text: Beer served in 7°C, Tulip Glass. Pours hazy yellow with classic hefeweizen head. Aroma of cloves, citron, bananas, wheat. Taste is sweet and smooth, mild wheat, slightly citrous with spices and herbal notes. Simple but delicious.
.33l bottle in Teteringen, hazy darkyellow/orange colour beer high carbonation and sweet and malty taste. Hints of banana and spice. Pretty nice beer.

Odd that I hadnt rated this before. Gorgeous hazy yellow gold color, not cloudy enough to hide that sparkle twirling up from the bottom of the glass. Fulsome, sticky, ice cream foam bulging over the rim of the glass. Bubble gum, ripe banana, orange creamsicle, and some green peppercorn phenolics. Soft and gently sweet but balanced by a light tangy acidity, low bitterness, sparkling carbonation on medium-full body. Simultaneously lively and creamy. That light acidity keeps it refreshing, barely. This was the sort of beer that helped convert me to variety 15-20 years ago. These days Im almost never in the mood for a Weißbier... too sweet, I want more bite. But its easy to appreciate the well-made ones.
The Classic! Plenty of body, flavour and balance. There is no on mistaking having this one.

Keg at Waterloo Tap, 20/06/17. The expected banana and cloves aroma. Its a thing of beauty: an opaque light gold. A thick creamy head. Ive had a stressful day so it makes me want to cry tears of joy and relief. Sweet and sour. Penny sweet foam bananas. When I get home I am going to eat a handful of cloves so I can see if thats what the bitterness is. Medium bodied. The soft carbonation comes to the fore. Long citrus finish. Awesome.

Door ruimschoots voldoende CO2 krijgt het biertje bij inschenken een mooie schuimkraag. Ruikt lichtjes naar bananen. Smaak is fris fruitig citroen banaan en koriander waardoor verrassend rond in de mond met een mooie subtiele  bittertje. Onmiskenbaar er zit in dit witbiertje meerdere dimensies door vooral die mooie ronde beetje zoetige bananen smaak. Zeker een weissbier wat je vaker wilt Hefe.

Good long lasting flavour with coriander undertones - not as overpowering as similar shop - bought bottles.
Long lasting white head, cloudy gold beer.
Very good and would buy again.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy yellow gold color. Thick, white mousse-like head. Yeasty, wheat malt nose hints at clove and banana. Clean, crisp refreshing wheat grain flavor. Light notes of lemon and clove on the palate are just exquisite. Very Refreshing and quite possibly the best Bavarian Weissbier in the world.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Greg & Janes Beer and Wine. Appearance is cloudy orange-light brown with trace sparkle, finger-width foamy white head with poor retention and trace lacing. Aroma is strong banana/fruity esters, with yeasty tart, mild bubblegum, clove. Taste is fruity ester/banana, clove, yeast, wheat. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with bubbly texture, average-to-lively carbonation and mix of sweet and tart, slightly dry finish. Overall, one of the true representatives of the style.

Appearance: Wheat beer. Pale yellow gold color with cloudy liquid and a rocky white head.
Taste: Very subtle light sweet touch with a medium bitter flavour.
Palate: Medium body with thick texture and average carbonation. Not too long bitter finish.
Overall: Good strong wheat beer. Less aroma than others but as much body and good taste.

Love the clover smell and hint of banana taste. This is my new favorite beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a seriously good beer-- very clean, refreshing, and has notes of banana, cloves, and spice in the middle of the taste. Do yourself a favor, and get this beer and give it a try.

Light hazy. The real thing. Imported. Big head, white and tall. Light hazy. The real thing. Imported. Big head, white and tall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bananowy song, no jak się nie lubi weizenów, tego też się nie polubi, bo to jest klasyczna definicja stylu. Szanuję, ale nie rozumiem.
This beer is so good. The grain, the clove, the banana. Ugh, I will drink this anytime anywhere Sam I am.
Little hazy yellow beer with white head. Aroma is good refreshing banana and malts, yeast. Taste is light bitter balanced with right sweetness. Long smooth finish. Really nice beer.

Pours hazy amber with a foamy white head. Light aroma of banana esters. Taste is similar with sweet malts and quite a creamy feel. Very refreshing on a summer's day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5l bottle. Malty taste, light banana notes. Hazy yellow color, white head. Malty taste, light banana notes, light sweet, light sour. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft to average carbonation and light sour malty finish. Very good.

Tried this for the first time when visiting Austria. Was impressed by the flavour and head which is very creamy, so I decided to search the Web for comments by others and gave it 5* on ratebeer.com A must try especially if you can find it on draught.
On tape, murky golden with one finger white foam, lemony aroma. Salty with notes of banana and lemon
Bottle at home. Cloudy golden straw colour, big creamy offwhite head. Banana, yeasty pepper, creamy, grainy and sweet malts. Good body, lively carbonation.

Bottle. Milky yellow/orange. Firm foamy head. Lovely lacing. Aroma is full on clove, a dash of lemons and some yeast. Taste is bananas, bread, wheat and lemons. Slightly spicy. Some bitterness in the aftertaste. Strong carbonation. Creamy and smooth. Very balanced. Refreshing. Great Hefeweizen.

Robe blonde aux reflets dorés, fine mousse. Nez typé qui allie des notes épicées, de céréales, de fruits compotés, de farine et de levures. Bouche tout en rondeur et en élégance, fruitée et raffraîchissante. Un délice par cette chaleur.

On tap at Weihenstephaner, Hackescher Markt, Berlin. Pours cloudy yellow with a foamy, lasting, white head. The aroma contains wheat, banana, fruits and citrus. It tastes light bitter and medium fruity sweet. Fizzy carbonation, creamy texture, long finish. Can compete with the Paulaner.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy straw golden. Huge and lasting, dense white head, good lacing. Pleasant peppery aroma, banana, cloves and citrus. Really smooth feel, lively carbonation that works great with the wheat smoothness. Taste follows the aroma. Crisp finish, really refreshing!

Botella de 50 cl, cata en Liquidos. Color amarillo, claro, espuma blanca media. Aromas a plátano muy intenso, clavo y malta. Sabor equilibrado, notable, a plátano, maltas. Muy fácil de beber y refrescante.
A nice Hefe Weissbier, I mostly only enjoy wheat beers in the summer on a hot day when its fantasticly refreshing.

Barwa jasnopomarańczowa, zamglona, pod światło słomkowa.

Piana obfita (po nalaniu połowy piwa nie mieści się już w szkle), drobnopęcherzykowa, koloru biało-kremowego. Powoli zapada się tworząc grubą czapę. Po kilku minutach formuje solidny kożuch, po następnych paru minutach tworzy obrączkę przy szkle i tak pozostaje do końca. Lacing średni.

Aromat mocno bananowy, lekko pszeniczno-drożdżowy, w tle bardzo lekkie nuty wędzone (jak w piwie grodziskim).

Smak bananowy w tle lekko gruszkowo-goździkowy, lekko słodkawy. Na finiszu lekka kwaskowatość.
Pisząc o smaku gruszkowym, mam na myśli smak gruszek w zalewie z goździkami.
Warka 28.09.2016
Un aroma muy bueno a plátano. Sabor agradable, deja muy buen sabor en boca

Proefglas van t vat op het Streekbierenfestival te Koekelare. U: Troebel stroblond met een witte schuimkraag. G: Tarwemout, gist en kruidig. S: Moutzoet met een lichte bitterheid en een licht zuurtje. Pilsvervanger. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.

0.5l bottle from hiebers. pours a cloudy pale golden with a huge steady head. aroma of banana and cloves. flavour of apples, banana, cloves. clean, easy drinking, not too sweet and not too spicy. not sure if this is really the worlds best weizen, but it is definitely a good one.

(From the keg) Pours a beautifully cloudy golden beer, with a creamy white head. A strong aroma of banana, clove, fresh malt and caramel. The taste is really sweet, and the blend of flavours is rich and beautiful. The mouthfeel is delectably creamy.

This is rated the worlds best Hefeweizen with every good reason. Truly amazing.

Van t vat. Troebel blond bier met witte schuimkraag. Geur: tarwemout, licht kruidig, vleugje banaan. Smaak: licht zurig, granen, terug ietwat banaan en licht kruidig. Licht mondgevoel. Medium koolzuurprikkel.
Orangefarben mit prächtiger Hefeblume im Glas. Fruchtig frischer Antrunk mit Nelke, vollmundiger Körper mit feiner Hefe und Banane. Alles vereint sehr harmonisch.

Tap at strange pub in San Marino. Pours light hazy yellow. Nose is fresh bananas, floral, bubblegum, more banana. Palate is nice banana and floral, perfect weizen notes. Finish is not that spicy. Very good weizen, very refreshing, very Drinkable, could just be a bit spicier.
Hazy yellow pour. Frothy head. Bready grainy yeasty aroma. Decent lacing. Round flavour the mouth, however still faily thin. Some light citris and bready cereal flavours. Easy drinking.

33 cl bought from supermarket. Pours hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma of bananas, citrus, bread, cereals. Taste of bananas, fruits, yeast an wheat. Medium carbonation and body, with sweet aftertaste. One of the best weizen I ever had.

Sporo estrowego banana, trochę ostrego goździka, bardzo dobrze ułożone, takie spójne. W smaku dość łagodne, średnio wysycone, kremowe wręcz, odczucie słodyczy podbite przez banana, ale podbudowa pszeniczna dość skromna, na finiszu bardziej przyprawowo-fenolowo.
Looks a treat in the glass. wonderful aroma of banana bread and ground cloves. some chive notes as well. strong taste of banana and nice amount of spice on the back end. great german beer.
LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Had ik meer van verwacht. Niet al te smaakvol: mout, bittertje, banaan, weinig carbonatie in de mond. Voor mij de top 50 rating niet waard.

Bought this to compare with some of the local Hefeweizens. Hazy, cloudy yellow, lots of carbonation, tall, thick, white head. Nice hefe aroma, banana & clove. Moderate to full mouth feel, tingly from the carbonation. Taste of banana and the wheat. Excellent, easy drinking hefe.

Aroma of banana, fruit, citrus and peach,bread . Flavor is dominated by banana notes with some fruity, slightly sweet and bready flavor and lingering citrus in the fairly dry finish. Low hop bitterness. Medium body and medium high carbonation. Very smooth and creamy sensation in the palate. Very good

Bouteille. Couleur jaune claire peu engageante mais belle mousse blanche. Arômes : céréales, herbes, citron, abricot, banane notamment. Bouche et saveurs : ronde, fraîche avec saveurs fruitées/épicées, petite amertume et finale sèche un peu "savonneuse". Une des meilleures allemandes que jai bu. Plus complexe que ce que je pensais au premier abord.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 A true classic. Easily one of the best lighter beers. Light does not mean flavourless. There?s plenty of body, flavour and balance for a gold 5,5% beer. Nice foam. Bread, wheat, citrus, banana.

Aromas a platano intenso
Buen aspecto, carbonatacion correcta, espuma persistente
En boca plena y equilibrada. Nunca defrauda

Huge creamy dense off white medium to long lasting head. Beer is dark golden murky. Aroma is dominated by ripe banana yeast and clove. Taste is low to average sweet with notes of banana, yeast and wheat. Finish is creamy, slightly bitter and medium to long lasting. Carbonation is soft medium refreshing. Although its a good Weissbier I personally prefer the bock version Vitus much more since its better in all ways.

Piana wysoka, trwała, zbita niczym śmietanka. W aromacie przyjemny i intensywny, mączny banan, goździka prawie brak. W smaku wytrawne, kwaskowe, wysoko wysycone. Bananowe, goździk pałęta się w posmaku, ale to leciutko. Klasyczna pszenica, raczej po bananowej stronie mocy.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with average sized foamy white head. Heavy banana and clove aroma. Light bodied with plenty of yeast notes. Easy to drink and very good.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle. 
Aroma is very fragrant with lots of banana and clove. Some faint bubblegum notes as well. Light wheat notes and no hop character. 
Pours a hazy, golden straw color with a large, creamy, white head that exhibits very nice retention as it very slowly recedes. Medium lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor is a bit sweet with some wheat notes and bread. Light bitterness. Fairly ester forward with a lot of banana and hints of bubblegum. Some lighter clove notes. No hop flavor. Esters linger well into the finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium high to high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice ester and phenolic forward wheat beer. Its solid, but its also not really my jam.

50 cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of ripe banana, grains, wheat, vanilla and hints of spices and malts.
Appearance: light golden color with huge and super creamy and perfectly white foam made of middle sized bubbles and some big ones. No Brussels lacing. Light to medium hazyness. Very good retention.
Taste: medium sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of wheat, sweet grains with hints of banana, vanilla, cereals, bread, citrus and some spices. At the sweet side with some acidic sparkling overtones.
Palate: medium body, oily-silky texture, medium carbonation, very long sweet finish with flavors of sweet grains, ripe banana, vanilla and some spicy notes.
Overall: excellent appearance, not very intense but good aromas of ripe banana, vanilla, sweet grains and spices. Very good flavor of sweet grains with banana, vanilla and spices overtones. Sweet, refreshing and very pleasant. Very good beer.

Sampled at the Bräustüberl Weihenstephan in Freising.
Lasting white head. Cloudy solid yellow color. Big banana aroma. Fresh wheat taste with small banana taste.

Cerveza de altísimo nivel. De las mejores de trigo que he probado.
Aroma intenso afrutado, apariencia amarillo pálido, turbio y con espesa corona de espuma blanca constante.
Sabor muy intenso afrutado, toques a cereal y pan y paladar al mismo nivel.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text:
From a beer hawk mystery case. Quite sweet, caramel , lightly hopped. Pleasant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not sure what all the hype is about on this one. Maybe mine was past its prime. Dont know how to read the code stamped on the back label. Very underwhelming.

Jest banan, za którym pojawiają się aromaty goździków. W tle czuć owoce cytrusowe w stylu mandarynki i pomarańcza. Dodatkowo dość wyraźnie czuje aromaty przypominające świeżą bułkę pszenną. Wszystko to jest bardzo ładnie ułożone i nie ma się wrażenia że któryś z motywów zdecydowanie dominuje. Otrzymujemy świeży, pozbawiony nieprzyjemnych elementów aromat.
W smaku piwo okazuje się gładkie z posmakiem drożdżowym charakterystycznym dla Hefeweizen. Drożdże delikatnie oblepiają nam usta w taki mączysty sposób. Tu również mamy motywy banana i goździka. Jednak tak jak w aromacie delikatnie przeważał banan tak teraz smak wydaje się bardziej zrównoważony. Pojawiają się również motywy mandarynkowe, cytrynowe. Piwo jest dosyć słodkie, jednak nie zaklejające. Goryczka niska, prawie nie wyczuwalna. Wysycenie dość wysokie czyli oczywiście zgodne ze stylem

Head creamy and clean, lasts well good lacing. The body is golden yellow with hints of orange. The nose is cloves and yeasty musky sweetness. The mouth full and spicy with string notes of banana. A classic!

Draught at Plutzer Bräu, Vienna.
Dark orange, cloudy body, with a beautiful, big, stable, dense, creamy, lacing, cream colored head.
Aroma of ripe banana, vanilla, marzipan, bread, flowers, spices, dried fruits, orange.
Wonderful taste, with similar aromas, incredibly smooth and creamy. 
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. 
Finishes smooth, medium spicy, moderate sweet, fruity, bready, floral, a bit yeasty. 

This is still the benchmark for the whole style, the smoothest and most balanced Weizenbier I know! Lovely creaminess throughout, with the sweet, spicy and fruity notes perfectly dosed and just the right levels of freshness and malt body. I could drink this all day, delicious stuff!

Keg, Berlin Charlottenburg. Ar: ziarniscie, pszenica, lekko kwasnawo, owoce tropikalne, mango, odrobina bananow, swiezo, soczyscie, stylowo. Wyg: zloto-pomaranczowawe, metne, piana roznoziarnista, dosc gruba, trwala. Sm: wysycenie dosc wysokie, troche kwasnawe, sa banany, odrobina lagerowej goryczki takiej lekko metalowej, ale nie ma zelaza na tescie skornym, ziarniste, lekko pszeniczne, bardzo srednie. Pos: kiepski, ziarnistosc, lekki kwasek, lagerowa metaliczna nieprzyjemna goryczka, koncernowa. Ov: pijalne, spoko ziarnistosc, ale nic specjalnego.
Bought from Systembolaget Östersund. Nice golden yellow pour with a perfect foamy head.
Hazy orange with white head. Cereal, banana and vanilla. Sweet, round and spicy finish. Great!

500 ml served in Weißbier glass. Vibrant orange golden colour, nice big white head. Bread, cereal, dough aroma. Very balanced taste. Yeasty, fruity and light bitter hint. Soft carbonated, medium body. Nice yeasty finish. One of the best.
50cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Bière très agréable avec des notes de banane.
banana, golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, full body, creamy, average carbonation,

Aroma: banaan, bubblegum, tarwe

Smaak: banaan, tarwe, fris en een bittertje.

Lekker

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Birra dal colore giallo paglierino opaco per i lieviti in sospensione. Schiuma compatta e persistente. All?olfatto sentori di frutta a polpa bianca, pesca bianca, crosta di pane e malto. Al palato mediamente corposa, corpo accentuato dalla presenza dei lieviti, le note che si ripropongono sono quelle già vissute all?olfatto. Una birra eccezionale, beverina e nutriente. Ottima
The classic hefeweizen , great banana and clove flavour. Clean tasting , very tasty .
Huge aroma of cloves and bananas, but unfortunately compromised by sulfuric notes. Very high carbonation (not my cup of tea), light body, easily drinkable. OK, but expected more.

500ml bottle. Pale cloudy gold with a sparkling, thin white head. Aromas of haylage, banana, light floral notes, and bread. Distinct flavours of separate bread and banana, with faint floral and wheat notes.
Den perfekte weizen. Flot mørkegylden farve. Ufiltreret med duft af banan, gær og citrus. Blød, frugtig og forfriskende smag.
12 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a thick cream head. aroma citrus and bananna. Taste is wheat with a meaty aftertaste

(12oz bottle) AROMA: yeast, sour dough, clove, anise,,banana, more fruity than Franziskaner (which is more tobacco and metal and malt) APPEARANCE: cludt golden yellow,mint of Amber/orange, fine foamed white head, creamy, not much head but it lingers. TASTE: tartness upfront, sour yeast and grain, malty but smooth, some herb and medicine, mostly yeast flavor. PALATE: soft and smooth, medium bodied, creamy, some closing bitterness. OVERALL: not bad. Probably not the best weisbier, but quite good. Strengths are a very nice nose and excellent on the palate. A bit one dimensional in flavor. A 100% weisbier experience with minimal lager or too much malt characteristics.

"The best is yet to come" sang Sinatra... well it's arrived! The Hazy amber liquid rolls down the long glass giving a two fingers white fine head gifting us with the fragrance bold wheat & yeast, peaking through is tantalising sweet banana. The feel is lusciously smooth like liquid velvet rolling around the tongue as it gently effervesces. Relish the creamy wheat elixir carefully in the mouth with its fulsome flavours that come in layers; a lightly sugared white bread and banana sandwich, a hint of a pleasing piquancy comes through and the culmination is the lightest bitterness and bubblegum. This is a Bavarian beauty you will be glad to serenade the into the twilight.

For the book. Aroma is wheat, clove, fruity, slight metallic, decent. Appearance is golden amber, off white head, hazy. Taste is wheat, metallic, clove, slight earthy hop, eh. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, wheat and earthy hop aftertaste. Overall, I expected this to be better based on the rating, but to me its just incredibly average.
Didnt enjoy this one very much. Maybe didnt have it with the right food or something but I found it bland.

Pours hazy golden colour with a beautiful head. Aroma of bananas, bubblegum and malts. Great and complex. Taste is quite sweet. Then, maltiness and bananas. Creamy mouthfeel, light bitterness. High body, such as hefeweizen. Medium carbonation. Its not as refreshing as others wheat beers. I totally understand why this beer is considered to be the best Hefeweizen. Fantastic.
Pours hazy golden with a thick cream head. Nose of bananas and bacon. Taste is quite creamy with lots of bacon and wheat. Really good hefe.

Aroma of banana, fruit, citrus and peach. Bready aroma in the background. No hop aroma detected. Appearance is hazy bright golden with fluffy and stable white head. Lacing on the glass. Flavor is dominated by banana notes with some fruity, slightly sweet and bready flavor and lingering citrus in the fairly dry finish. Low hop bitterness. Medium body and medium high carbonation. Very smooth and creamy sensation in the palate. Effervescent. 
A fantastic example of weissbeer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une bière presque parfaite, robe blonde pâle avec des reflets ambrés, et voilée par la levure en suspension et le froment. Bière assez épicée, clou de girofle, poivre. Atypique, longue, jolie alternance dépice et de fraicheur, magique.

W aromacie banan na pierwszym miejscu, jest tez gozdzik, bardzo przyjemny ale moglyby byc bardziej intensywny. Barwa zlota, opalizujace, jak na pszeniczne wyjatkowo klarowne, piana drobna i utrzymujaca sie, jednak nie za wielka. W smaku bardzo gladkie, lekkie, troche wodniste. Goryczki brak, ale zostawia chlebowy posmak oblepiajacy jame ustna, bardzo przyjemny, wysycenie dosyc wysokie, ale mniejsze niz typowy weizen, nie przeszkadza to. Kwaskowy finisz. Dobry klasyczny weizen.

Ar: Banana, peach, and sugar, all medium-low intensity; bright, lightly toasted bready malt; a bit of black pepper, clove, and bubblegum. Ap: Golden and very slightly hazy; huge white head, beautiful structure, which merengue-like consistency and phenomenal retention. T: Bright banana, peach, and dough up front; medium-light sweetness; banana lingers through palate, and finish is clove; bitterness is medium-low, very fresh and herbal; none of the flavors is overdone, all are pronounced but in harmony. P: Medium body with medium-high carbonation; creamy mouthfeel; finish is dry. O: Beautiful German hefeweizen; all the typical flavors (clove, banana, peach, pepper), coming together in great harmony, along with a soft, doughy malt profile and a great mouthfeel; a true classic!
On tap en Olut. Aroma afrutado, banana concretamente. Con cuerpo en boca. Refrescante
Świetna, bananowo-goździkowa pszenica. Fajnie kremowa, jedynie toche za słodka, ciężko byłoby mi wypić pół litra. No ale dobry klasyk i tak.

500 ml bottle.
Tastes very fresh with flavours of banana, herbs and sweetness from the malt. The mouthfeel is smooth and round, it feels rich and high in quality. One of the better weissbiers Ive had so far.
Bottle from systembolaget. A very decent wheat ale, surely one of the best.

Bottle from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours hazy pale gold with a thick white head. Aroma classic wheat beer of banana,fresh bread,clove with some spice & vanilla. Taste banana purée,clove,fresh bread,pepper & vanilla. Light bodied,super smooth the finish is sweet but with good balancing dryness & more banana,clove ,fresh bread & spice. A classic wheatbeer, so well made !

I dont like Wheat beers but this is one of the few a can drink.
great colour and taste great with refreshing banana flavour.
Great weizen beer, with golden golour and lovely white foam, rich aroma of fruit, banana, clove. Full body and great tate. Beer that easy can be paired fith food

Im not a beer connoisseur but after trying numerous relative types I can say this is absolutely gorgeous. A brilliant purchase from a supermarket, its a shame you cannot purchase a crate as opposed to single bottles but I like that they come 50cl bottles instead on 33cl bottles such as Goose Island IPA and Brooklyn Lager which are also fantastic beers available in most supermarkets.
Gyönyörű opálos sárga szín, hatalmas tartós habbal a tetején. Édes búzás, banásos íz. Nagyon itatja magát. Parádés búzasör.
Best hefeweizen ever. Yellow like a cornfield with a big white head.telhe taste is banana hobs and yeast. Perfect

Classic German wheat beer appearance in the glass - hazy, light golden colour with a good 4cm of creamy head. Quite a sweet banana/clove/bread taste with strong banana on the nose. Recommended if youre after a simple wheat beer but there are definitely better examples of the style out there.
Bionda torbida, schiuma cremosa abbondante, odore e sapore di cereali, molta banana, vaniglia. Buona weiss bier.
UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 draught. looks cool and foam doesnt go away quickly. taste is soft and sweet. very easy to drink and good refresher, but not a game changer.

Flasche bei Ambrosetti in Berlin gekauft
Farbe Gelb, trüb, eine Schicht Schaum
Aroma intensiv nach Banane, etwas säuerlich. Antrunk sprudelig, eher säuerlich im Antrunk, Banane im Hintergrund. Zunächst nicht besonders komplex aber lecker. Banane wird etwas stärker, etwas Grapefruit taucht auf. Langanhaltender voller Nachgeschmack - macht also im Nachgang noch einigen Boden gut, der anfangs fehlt.
Hazy golden yellow with rather large white head. Great Hefeweizen aroma of banana, yeast, and spice. Taste is full of banana, bread, and clove. High carbonation and medium body.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 Butelka 0,5l. Piękny, bananowy aromat, bardzo intensywny. W smaku to samo, świetny banan, do tego goździk.

12. 1. 2017, Gas Station, Ljubljana. Bottled. The measuring stick of Heffeweizen style as they call it. Proper in all aspects but IMHO lacks a punch and delivery to be extraordinary.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap in Damian. Small white head, hazy light yellow colour, aroma of lemon zest. Above average wheat beer, a bit watery, tastes is citrus fruits, banana. Rather good, not among best.
On tap at Damián. Great weissbier! Both aroma and appearance fit perfectly the style with yeast playing the key role. Sweet taste. Almost zero bitterness. Love it.

500 ml bottle. Hazy golden in the glass, thick white head. Aroma of esters, sweet banana, wheat grain, sweet bread. Taste is rather sweet, low bitterness. Flavors of sweetish esters, banana, a touch of clove, and some smooth wheat. Abrupt banana wheat finish. Medium to full, pretty smooth texture, high carbonation.

Rather sweet aroma of banana with notes of wheaty fullness. Cloudy golden in the glass with beautiful rocky head. Unpronounced taste of banana, some wheat maltiness and hints of bread. Highly drinkable and refreshing, but Ive expected more.

Orange opaque hazy body with 1 finger white head.
Banana banana banana everywhere some bread notes.
Taste is clove some caramelised bread, hint of sweetness still with the banana balanced with the sourness of the wheat 
Medium high body, lively carbonation 

That is pretty good and refreshing despite the body.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 Bottle. Cloudy golden beer, large creamy white head, slowly diminishing, decent lacing. Beautiful aroma of cloves, banana, citrus and some spices. Taste is light to medium sweet: banana, clove, a bit of bread and spices, with light citrus tartness in the finish. Light to medium body, lively carbonation. Rather thin, but also easily drinkable. Very refreshing, well balanced, with pleasant citrus notes (stronger than in average hefeweizen) - top of the style.

0,5 l bottle. Pours hazy golden yellow with big rocky lasting head. Aroma is banana, clove, some vanilla, malt, bread and yeast. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body with slick texture and rather lively carbonation. Beautifully balanced hefe weissbier.
On tap. This is the example of hefeweissbier perfection. no words to explain the balance, light banana and clove esters, nice and thirsty killer.

A wonderful aroma of lightly fruity, banana and citrus. The taste is similar to the smell. Good bitterness that fills the mouth a weak moment. Maybe a little watery at the end. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Light orange colour, white thick head. Aroma is sweet with cloves in the front and banana. Taste is lightly sweet with some nice tartness and grainy aftertaste. Bitterness is low but enugh to balance the taste. Very drinkable, almost ideal hefeweizen.

The real king of weissbiers which sets the standard for all other weissbiers. Lovley banana, bubblegum and clove aroma with a nice orange / yellow colour. Huge foamy white head and light carbonation. The taste is sublime, mixed bubblegum and banana flavours immediately hit you, along with subtle clove and butterscotch. Lovely aftertaste which makes this beer very more-ish. Highly recommended for anyone, especially those new to weissbiers.

Klasyczny wygląd porządnego Hefeweizena. Barwa na granicy słomkowej i jasnozłotej, piwo jest solidnie, ale ładnie zmętnione. Piana jest biała z delikatną jasnopomarańczową naleciałością, jest obfita, puszysta, zbudowana z drobnych oczek, długo pozostawiająca kożuch na powierzchni. W aromacie mamy to, co powinien mieć dobry Weizen - są przede wszystkim banany, ale i wyraźny, choć pozostający z tyłu, goździk. Bananowe estry sprawiają, że zapach jest słodki. W smaku balans jest przesunięty nieco bardziej na goździka (jest wyraźny, ale nie jest to jakaś dominacja), z kolei banany bardziej z tyłu. Piwo lekkie, ale nie wodniste. Wysycenie jest dość wysokie, intensywnie musujące w ustach, dodające odczucia pełni. Na finiszu pojawia się delikatna szlachetna goryczka, która nieco kontruje bananową słodycz. Bardzo dobre piwo! Numer jeden na świecie wśród Hefeweizenów nie zawiódł mnie. Bardzo lubię ten styl, mimo iż jego potencjał jest w pewnym sensie ograniczony. Natomiast jako reprezentant stylu - świetne piwo.
Hazy golden color with white rocky head. Aroma has wood, banana, and smoke. Taste is light sweet. Light body with thin texture. Average carbonation and long finish.

Pours light gold from the bottle and leaves a tall, foamy head. The aroma is quite yeasty with notes of banana and spice. The taste is bubblegum sweet and finishes with a light lemon tartness. Medium bodied. Overall a solid Weizen, but not my favorite offering from this excellent brewery.

Pours hazy golden with medium thick white head. Aroma is banana, fruits, sweetness, flour, sweet fruits, some citrus, mild cake. Taste is banana, wheat, flour, tropical fruits, some yeast, light citrus, souffle candies. Classical and good beer!
Aroma a banana y clavo muy limpio. En boca es viva dada su alta carbonatacion. El trigo da una sensación de cuerpo que hace especial cada trago.

Light bready aroma with subtle notes of banana
Lightly sweet and tart, very low biterness, very refreshing

Cloudy golden color with thick and strong white foam. Aromas of sweet of bananas, vanilla, honey and rather sweet and yeasty with notes of ice cream and foam bananas. Palate lighter body but with smooth thicker texture leaving long lasting sweet finish also with notacable carbonation. Taste sweet and milky of melted vanilla ice cream and bananas rather yeasty but fantastic. Overall, beutiful sweet beer, easy going and refreshing do recomend!
Robe jaune pale légèrement opaque avec mousse blanche abondante. Très fruitée avec une finale sur la banane

500 ml bottle. Pours yellow-orange with a white head. Fresh aroma of yeast, sweet fruits, banana and herbs. Light to medium body with soft carbonation with a light sweetness and a very light fruity acidity. The flavor is fruity (apples, citric fruits then banana), very well balanced and overall refreshing.
Arômes de pain et levure, corps jaune à peine trouble, mousse blanche abondante et stable. En bouche, désaltérant, banane, levure et pain.
Bottle from Biernavigatie. Hazy yellow, yeasty, banana, peach. Soft carbonation, Sweet, light bitter. Nice hefeweizen.

Data ważności: 30.08.2017 
 Kolor:  Złoty. Oczywiście piwo jest całkowicie i bezwzględnie mętne. 
 Piana:  Jak na najlepszego pszeniczniaka na świecie - piana nie jest wcale okazała.
Jest biała, drobnopęcherzykowa, średniowysoka, żeby nie powiedzieć niska jak na taki stylowy Weizen Glass. 
Bardzo niemrawo oplata ścinki szkła. Lacing co najwyżej na 3 z plusem.
Piana uleciała w dół w szybkim tempie i zatrzymała się na granicy kilku milimetrów. 
 Zapach:  100% pszenicy w pszenicy. Wyrazisty, intensywny aromat tego zboża. Stylowo aż do bólu. Mocna drożdżowość, lekko przypieczona skórka od chleba, guma balonowa, banany.
W tle leciutki cytrus, a za nim trochę pieprzowej pikantności.
Goździki wychodzą dopiero po ogrzaniu. Jest ich więcej po przelaniu piwa do szkła.
Jest klasycznie, dokładnie tak jak powinno być. 
 Smak:  Smak jest stylowy, aczkolwiek brakuje tutaj intensywności kilku elementów.
Wybija się ponad przeciętność drożdżowość piwa. Dopiero daleko za nią jest banan, trawa cytrynowa, cytryna i chleb pszenny.
Guma balonowa traci na intensywności. Goździki wypierany jest troszeczkę przez pieprz.
Ta pieprzowa pikatneria na finiszu fajnie komponuje się z drożdżowym charakterem tego Weizena.
Goryczka jest znikowa.
Półpełne ciało i bardzo wysoka pijalność.
Weizen jak najbardziej na propsie. 
 Wysycenie:  Żywe, wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Nie mam aż tak dużego doświadczenia z Hefeweizenami. Piłem ich zaledwie kilkanaście w swoim życiu.
Mówcie co chcecie, ale lubię Paulanera ;)
Weihenstephaner może nie jest najlepszym pszeniczniakiem jakiego piłem (w tej kategorii wygrywa wciąż Maisels Weisse) ale w dalszym ciągu jest bardzo dobrym przedstawicielem stylu.
Charakteryzują go unikalne cechy takie jak: wysoka drożdżowość, akcenty chleba pszennego, banan, goździk, lekkie cytrusy, guma balonowa czy przypieczona skórka od pieczywa.
Jest wysoka pijalność, jest orzeźwiający klimat - wszystko na swoim miesjcu.
Polecam pić jak najbardziej świeże.

Cena w Holandii - 1,35. Myślę, że w Niemczech można to piwo kupić w granicach 1.

50cl bottle at home pours a hazy golden colour with a big foamy white head. Aroma of yeast, bread, grain, citrus, caramel, light spices. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a slight dry finish. Notes of yeast, malt, citrus, banana, spices. Texture is oily, medi bodied with medium carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy golden amber color with a tall white foamy head. Aroma of doughy malt, grain and light cereal malt and citrus zest. Flavor is sweet fruit and yeasty spice with a bit of creamy malt and banana. Full bodied and creamy on the palate with a smooth, clean finish.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Glass at Brewdog Castlegate. Cloudy toffee. Medium/full body with smooth flavours. Standout banana and spice notes makeup a fine wheat beer.

22nd September 2016Craft and Draft. Keg. Hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light, semi dry and has reasonable carbonation. Light wheaty malts. Mild spice. Light esters - sweetish. Ripe citrus. Light semi dry finish brings out the banana esters. I respect this brewery but this pretty odinary.
Super Farbe und wunderbar stabiler Schaum. Frisch und süffig im Geschmack; im Abgang kommt stark die Hefe und Bananengeschmack durch - alles in allem ein super Bier

16/20 really smooth and tasty wheat beer. Drank bottle slowly over a couple of hours. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Finally got around to trying this, after discovering this style of beer. Lovely hazy orange with a big white head. Outstanding, so easy to drink. Lovely banana flavour from the yeast, with some spicy clove, coriander and soft vanilla caramel. One of the best beers iv ever had and possibly the best in this style.

Big bottle I calculate to be 6.5 months old into a pilsner.
A: Cloudy yellow pour with huge pillow of merengue. Great retention and prolific carbonation. Thick curtains of lace.
S: Yeasty vinous scent. Perfume and apple. Thank God no banana noticed.
T: Sour yeasty flavor. Like a saison imo. Not bad. 
M: Light and smooth mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Lightly coating finish.
O: Admittedly I do not like wheat beer and did not expect to like this. It is pretty good and I understand ti is a standard of the style. Still not my thing.

Dark golden, not too hazy, a bit of visible carbonation. Creamy head, big but not too big for the style, good retention and some lacing. Soft aroma of white bread/dough, cereal, light citrus/zest and a hint of banana. Taste is mostly sweet with good attenuation from the slight acidity which makes it quite refreshing: white bread/dough, cereal, banana, a herbal hint, maybe vanilla... Light body with soft crispness, clean and very easy mouthfeel. A very good hefe, maybe not super-impressive in terms of taste but very well made and refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 33 cl. bottle. Hazy golden colour with a foamy white head. Good lacing. Aroma is wheat, banana, honey, vanilla, clove, and hay with some grassy and even somewhat spicy notes. Has a pleasant savory taste with medium sweetness, light sourness and very light bitterness. It is fizzy and refreshing. Medium body with an oily to creamy texture. Quite long and a bit sour finish. One of the best commercial wheat beers. Great!

Piano gesta jak na pszeniczniaka przystalo Kolo jasna zlocisty.Mocno nasycone. Aromat bardzo slaby chlebowy I troszke w tle banana.  W smaku nie dzieje sie za duzo jesli nie.mieszax prze wlaniem do szklanki po wymieszaniu jest o wile lepiej czuc pszenice I troszke chleb oral drozdze ale przeszkadza zbyt duzo ilosc gazu. Po wygazowaniu piwo state sie smaczniejsze.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Orange color. Lots of carbonation. Aromas of baked bread, banana, clove. Quite sweet, but enough acidity and a touch of herbal hops makes it very refreshing. Lots of complexity for its strength, with yeast flavors of clove, spicy phenols, and a bit of banana. Probably the best hefeweissen out there.

From a bottle into a Ayinger glass. Pours white gold with head and lace. Aroma of amber malts, grains, bananas. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of amber malts, light grains, banana, minerals, mellow pepper zest. Overall flavorful, smooth, easy drinking.
Perfecta, es la referencia en su estilo. Un puntito más de complejidad que otras clásicas alemanas con mejor distribución en España

Yellow hazy with rich white creamy head. Mild slightly sweet malty aroma with spicy notes. Slightly sweet, medium fruity sour taste followed by mild bitterness with coriander notes.mild sweet sour aftertaste.

- leuchtend trüb-gelbe Farbe mit sehr guter und lang anhaltender Schaum
 bildung
- leichte Aromen nach etwas Banane und Hefe
- die Carbonisierung ist mir eine Spur zu hoch geraten
- der erste Antrunk ist zitronig-sauer und relativ stark moussierend
- danach kommt eine würzige Note, welche einen leicht metallischen Bei-
 geschmack hat
- im Abgang verstärkt sich diese würzige Note dann nochmals unangenehm
Fazit: Dieses Weizenbier ist so gar nicht mein Ding. Keine Ahnung
woher diese Bewertungen bei Ratebeer kommen.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2016 Pours cloudy deep gold with a huge white head anr decent lacing. Nose of citrus, banana, spice, baguette, wheat, yeast, a little zest and smoke. Well balanced light taste, a bit of phenolic bitterness on finish. Smooth creamy texture, high carbonation, very refreshing and drinkable.
Hazy orange pour with white head. Aroma is yeast and banana. Add a little clove and you have the taste.
12-05-16 // on tap at Zeitungsente Mainz. Perfect Hefeweizen. Strong banana and clove in the nose and mouth. Crisp. Yeasty notes.
Great Beer...my favourite hefe Weiss bier floral notes with banana and cloves  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Pours ultra-cloudy orange, basically opaque. Large head, but low lacing; very tasty-looking beer. Aroma is big on banana and yeast; also clove, honey, bubblegum - very nice. Taste mirrors the nose, loads of banana, sweet malts, light honey and brown sugar, bubblegum, clove; faintly tannic finish. Wonderfully full-bodied and smooth. Its rather sweet, but unquestionably a great beer.
Bottle 50cl. Huge white foam. Hazy color, fizzy. Aroma is wheat, grass, pine, moss. Taste is sweet banana.
Overall a nice light beer with a solid golden coloring. Flavour doesnt last but is smooth going down.
Great fruity and cloudy Weisbeir. Easy to drink and very enjoyable after a hard days work.
Pours golden slightly hazy with white head. Taste is really good with a lots of banana and fresh herbs. Really Easy to drink.

hay, floral, grass, citrus, basement aromas, cooked vegetables, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, salty, medium body, creamy, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Pours is cloudy orange with big white head. Aroma of spices, orange, fruity, banana, wheat. Taste is light to moderate sweet, malty, fruity mouthfeel. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, light sweet and spicy finish.
Hazy yellow color, large white head. Wheat, yeast and hay aromas, slight spicy. Taste of wheat and yeast, balanced but one-dimensional - boring.

No detail information on the labels on the bottle, no drinktemperature and so on.
Cloudy amber beer with very nice rocky white head, smell is banana but the taste is very light banana, good balance, yeast is dominated but not too much, ideal for summer and hot days, Im normal not a friend from German Hefeweizen but for this I can do it,
(I have 0.5l bottle with best-before 03.08.17 19:19)
Приятно& пшеничн& освежаю& пиво, красиво& на вид с отлично& шапкой пены, хороший аромат, хороший вкус и слабое послевк& bottle 500ml

Pours hazy yellow with beautiful white head. Aromas of banana, caramel, some sweetish malt-like tone to it. Very mellow flavours, crisp and well balanced - refreshing as one would expect with a very clean texture. Surprisingly, an oily to creamy palate, combined with a nice, slightly sharp crisp start to it. Very decent weissbier.
The best German Hefeweizen you can have, from one of the oldest breweries in the world.
Nice perfect looking hazy pale with fluffy head. Aroma is banana clove, wheat, and biscuit. Taste is nice light sweetness and a crisp drinkable bite. Freamy and good.
Pours a hazy copper/orange with a foamy white head. Aroma is banana, clove, spice, and citrus. Flavor is citrus, clove, and banana. Nice feel. Great.
Pours a hazy golden color with a thick white head. Wheat, yeast, clove, banana bread, lemon and bread aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a banana, yeast and bread finish.

Oranje geel, volle witte foamy schuimkraag, troebel, langzame CO2 bubbels zichtbaar....dat beloofd veel goeds. 
Aroma: Tarwemouten, banaan/gist, bloemig, kruidnagel, koriander vanuit de hop.
Smaak: Volle tarwe, banaan / gist, citrus, koriander, licht spicy hops.
Body is vol, zacht mondgevoel en toch voldoende actief koolzuur met een lichte prikkelige bitter. Echt een top Hefeweizen!
Klassiek!

Hefeweiss de 5,4 % abv en format 50 cl, la pinte allemande 
Rappelons que cette brasserie parle dune antériorité à 1040 !!! il y a de la bière qui est passée
sous les ponts !!!
Composition en malts dorge et de froment.
Elle reçoit aussi le titre de "premium bavaricum" par son brasseur.
Mon exemplaire était valable tranquillement jusquen 2017.
Couleur doré moyen pâle, avec un petit voile de levure.
Bulles fines, en colonnes droites, vives.
Mousse blanche, crémeuse, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de blé, paille de blé, pain bis, pointe de trèfle.
1ère bouche souple à soyeuse, à la très belle entame maltée, souple avec un zeste dorange.
Arrière-bouche belle, mais un peu légère.
2ème au très bel équilibre malt/blé/houblon.
Arrière-bouche large, longue, plus complète que la 1ère.
3ème sur un ensemble malt/blé/citron vert/herbes.
Arrière-bouche très construite blé et fines herbes vertes.
Longueur à la belle texture, des fruits blancs, des feuilles de vigne vertes.
De petites infériorités par moments, mais lensemble est beau.
Jambes à flocons fins, adhérents aux parois.
Levure souple, herbeuse, très belle ligne.
Alcool qui tire le meilleur de lui-même pour développer la longueur.
Finale sans réelle envolée, mais très belle.
CONCLUSION : une vraie hefeweiss, avec une qualité de réalisation énorme.
Seules certaines fins de bouche ou arrière-bouches sont un peu légères, et empêchent darriver
au sommet ...

500ML bottle. Pours beautiful cloudy orangey yellow with large creamy head. Excellent retention. Aroma is orange peel, lemon, coriander, pumpkin, butternut, nut and spice. Taste is exquisite; citrus and yeast partner perfectly with the palate, corroborating with the aroma. The mouthfeel is lovely. Its beautiful and thick and boasts a 5.4% alcohol content, but seems so much lighter. Very easy to drink as a session beer but the first pint should be drank slowly, savoured and admired. Brilliant brew from "the worlds oldest brewery".
Bouteille 50 cl - couleur blonde trouble, belle mousse blanche épaisse, odeur de citron, de fleur, gout sur les fleurs, les céréales, la banane, très rafraichissante

Frisch vom Hahn in Lichterfelde getrunken. Trübes Gelb mit schön ausgeprägter Schaumkrone. Positiv fällt auf, dass die übliche Hefigkeit fehlt und die Fruchtigkeit es zu einem idealer Sommerbier macht.

Light yellow coloured hazy beer with a large foamy white head that lasts a long time. Aroma is sweet, bananas and some spice. Yeast is also present. Taste is a nice mix of bitterness and sweetness. Notes of bananas, lemon zest and coriander with just perfect amount of carbonation. The mouthfeel is full and creamy. Leaves a lighy bitter taste in the mouth. Overall just an amazing hefeweizen.

Wait, I havent rated this yet?

Golden pour, larger white puffy head, full bodied. Clove, coriander, wheat, orange peels, banana and yeast in the aroma. Spicey up front, clove and light pepper gives way to banana, orange, caramel sweetness, wheat, yeast. Lighter carbonation. A standard bearer.

Pale orange and cloudy. Aroma and flavour both share a full fruity and spicy character. Moderately sweet taste with low bitterness. Full-bodied with a nice soft texture. Overall, the best weissbier I have had, and currently the only one I would like to revisit. I am not a fan of the style, but this is just richer than the others, and very refreshing.
Boca o.5L..odlično pivo, odlična aroma, odličan okus, odlična boja...

Zapach średnio intensywny, goździki, banany, kwiaty, drożdże, chleb, kurz. Kolor pomarańczowy, mętne. Piana obfita, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, niska pełnia, banany, przyprawy, cytrusy, drożdże. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

0,5L bottle, served in tumbler. Poured a very nice looking cloudy golden with a big fluffy 4 finger slightly off white head. Lively carbonation in glass. Aromas of cloves, coriander, caramel, banana, vanilla, orange peel. Taste: Oooh that is so refreshingly delicious! There is coriander, caramel, vanilla, banana, citrus, grass, hoppy bitterness, pepper, pine, cloves, orange, herbs, floral, hay. Medium body with a spicy, fruity, bittersweet finish. Absolutely delicious and a refreshing beer for the warm summer days. Top class!
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 11.2oz bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with a large white head. Aroma of yeast and bananas. Tastes of the same. Light carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Outstanding hefeweizen.
Cerveza de trigo buenísima. Cuerpo medio, medio gas. Tiene mucho sabor y se mantiene.
From bottle. Pours light golden, hazy, with big white head. Banana, citrus, sweet, floral, refreshing. Medium carbonation, sour note, easy drinking.
Flaske 0.5L på Fjellstua Ålesund. Farge gul uklar med hvitt skum. Lukt fruktig, banan. Smak banan, syrlige frukter, hvetemalt. En frisk og balansert hefe
It's Hefe weizen beer than I very love. I think it's the best of hefe weizen in the world. Very good taste very good head or bubble. Smooth and good body. easy to drink but not watery beer.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Healthy head. Lightly carbonated with a nice bitter tinge. More straw then banana. Decent Weiss beer with a good level of complexity. 7,4,7,2,14 = 3.4 (7th July 2016)

Retried it on tap. Wow that texture. Much better on tap!

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Kolor ?ó?to z?oty, z pomara?czowymi refleksami, m?tny . Piana bia?a, ogromna, puszysta, w konsystencji kremowa. Bardzo trwa?a, zdobienia na szklance nieznaczne.Aromat: banany, go?dziki, wilgotne siano i "zakurzona betonowa posadzka".Smak: banany, go?dziki i cytryna. Dalej zakurzona posadzka, wilgotne, stare zborze. Piwo jest delikatnie s?odkie, miodowe, jest pe?ne, g?ste, mi?kkie a? "t?uste".Goryczka niska (IBU 14), w zupe?no?ci satysfakcjonuj?c?. Wysycenie wysokie w kierunku do ?redniego, idealne.
the aroma is fruity and spicy with hints of banana, yeast and some spices... the taste is bright, fruity and malty with notes of banana, yeast, apple and sweet citrus... sweet and dry aftertaste...
Bottle (500ml): Golden with big white head. Cloudy.Bananas. This is perhaps my favorite hefeweizen. Need to get one for Beth

Farbe und schaum passt.
Nase: grasig klee keller witer banane
Geschmack: erst recht frisch und leicht. Erst im Abgang und Nachgeschmack kommt breite Hefe, Banane und Weizen. Wow sehr gut und süffig.
500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy golden. Really good looking wheatbeer. Banana, cloves, caramel. Smooth mouthfeel. Interesting and very drinkable beer. Highly recommended.

F: white, big, frothy, good retention.
C: dark gold, hazy, non-transparent.
A: wheat, malt, spicy, banana, coriander, hay, yeast, cloves, honey.
T: wheat, malt, banana, coriander, cloves, peppery, orange peels, light to medium body, good carbonation, on tap @ Open restaurant near Como in Italy, very good enjoy it.
Ej tu ****! <3.! Aroma un garsa identiska un izcila= banaans iemerkts liepziedos. banana maz, vairak viige svaiga un daudz pluuskoks. vnk taads pavasaris. obligati jaklonee

Tap @ Felni, Budapest, taster size. Cloudy yellow color. Uneven white head. Aromas: banana, light clove, with wheat, malt and fruit retronasal. Flavor is light sweet, light wheaty-sour, yeasty. Light bodied. Its a classic in the style, and rightfully so.
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Nice refreshing weizenbeer. A good drink for those hot summer days. Solid beer!

I dont like it as much as their Vitus, but thats not saying it isnt excellent. Back when I first began brewing this is exactly what I was trying to achieve. Pours hazy golden with thin, lasting white top and some clinging. Aroma is as stated - mild clove, banana, a zesty spice and some bubblegum. Flavor is quite similar. Classic for the style. Very drinkable all day long.

Sometimes I just dont understand ratebeer. To me this seems pretty similar to any other wheat beer Ive tried. Not a negative thing to say, its actually quite nice. But just... slightly better than average.

Hazy pale golden colour, with an enormous head that holds all the while and leaves a great lace. Aroma of banana, coriander, cloves, peaches and citrus. Medium body, great carbonation. Taste is similar to aroma: bananas, clove, citrus... Great.

Light yellow coloured hazy beer with a large foamy white head that lasts a long time. Aroma is sweet, bananas and some spice. Yeast is also present. Taste is a nice mix of bitterness and sweetness. Notes of bananas, lemon zest and coriander with just perfect amount of carbonation. The mouthfeel is full and creamy. Leaves a lighy bitter taste in the mouth. Overall just an amazing hefeweizen, didnt even remember that this was so perfect.

Bottle. Yellow color, almost clear but hazy liquid, white foamy head. Smell of banana and eggs. Aroma of banana, yeast, wheat. Light sour, not very bitter, radler like. Despite it is light beer, I didnt find it easily drinkable, nor have taste for another. Average.

20160605 Home; 50 cl bottle (BB 20170329): A yellow (slightly orange) coloured beer with a huge white foam layer. Smell of somewhat perfume, wheat, bananas, vanilla and clove. Taste is slightly sweet with small sourness and a little bitterness in the aftertaste. The body is medium, the texture is creamy, because of the nice, lively carbonation. A really nice beer for all year round.
This is my favorite heffeweizen to date. The look, smell, taste, and finish are really a benchmark of the style.

Cloudy orange-gold in the glass with a gorgeous fluffy white cap. Its been a long, hot pre-summer day of urban adventures & bbq & drinks with neighbours & this beer comes on like a dream as the day slips into evening. Nice balanced hefeweizen: banana bread, clove, shivers of bubblegum, fresh squeezed lemon.  Very refreshing, sparkling mouthfeel, clean crisp finish. None of the messy sugary aftertaste that lesser brews are handcuffed to. Fantastic. Going down sooooo quickly. World class.

Enjoyed from a bottle at the Pour house in Exton PA. Pours with a beautiful murky honey appearance with a large three finger head that leaves plenty of lacing as it goes down. It smells delicious, with banana, wheat, yeast and clove with some lemon coming through. The taste follows the nose with a nice blend of bitterness and sweetness and a lingering banana finish. The mouth feel is smooth and creamy with medium carbonation. I can see why this is considered this is one of the finest Hefeweizens brewed in the world.

Poured from bottle into glass at home. Aroma is floral, bready, toast, and pleasant. Color is nice golden with a udbjf1t head. Taste is amazing! So delicious on my first sip that I held back from draining the entire glass. This is simply great beer. Well balanced and not too sweet or too bitter. I love this beer.
Pours a hazy golden color with a thick white head. Wheat, yeast, clove, banana bread, lemon and bread aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a banana, yeast and bread finish.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Almost clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is a little musty hops with not much else. Taste is a little bitterness and also watery. Mouthfeel is also watery and a little soapy. Overall reminds me of kristallweizen. Did i get a bad bottle or is my taste very skewed? Overall i didnt like it so much.
Update: Had another one about a month later and dont want to change my rating.
Uma das minhas favoritas no estilo. Encorpada, mas desce suave e não é muito amarga.
Orange gelb im Glas, trüb, feiner weißer Schaum, frisch hefig in der Nase, erfrischend im antrunk, runder Körper, leichte Frucht im Abgang, erfrischend

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 Aroma: slightly sweet   Appearance : large white head and yellow gold   Taste : Great bitterness Great Sweet perfect Malty Banana   Wheat Palate : excellent fresh medium body proper bitternessin Sevilla Maquila
外观是金黄色
0.5l bottle. Large white head and plenty of lacing. Bright hazy orange. Yeasty and sweet taste.

Bottle, o.5l. Hazy golden colour with big, creamy white head. Average carbonation. Aroma of yeast and banana. Taste follows the aroma, sweet with hints of spices and bitterness at the end. Overall excellent refreshing beer. A true example of the style.
Bottle at home. Big white head, clear golden colour. Lively carbonation. Strong aroma of bananas, bread and yeast. Notes of fruits. Medium sweetness, light bitterness.

(50 cl bottle in rocks-glas.) Light, clean wheat aroma with that sweet fruity vanilla bouquet reminiscent of a Weiss. The taste is great. Full with a fint of smoke curled up with banana and sweet orange.

This beer is highly available , true to its tradition, quite quaffable , very tasty, pairs well with many foods, and is sorts bananas .......i would call it the best beer that isnt specially "crafted" i call it..
Like infused beers and ales or stouts with coffee added..
either way...its great and most women like it also!
The appearance of this beer is supreme!
pillowy layers of whip cream type foamy head topples it if poured accurately.
The nose is of bananas ,bubblegum , cloves , and wheat malt or bread.
The taste is similar ,emphasizing on that clove-spice and carbonation that doesnt lack.
Mouthfeel on this is complexly versatile with brunch food or smoked meats and cheeses being its perfect palatable match-up.
Prost~!

bread, dough, toast, banana, clove, pepper. quite gentle but pleasant and well balanced. 
pale, cloudy, white foam, frothy, lacy. 
light sweetness, lightly bitter, bread, dough, banana, clove, pepper. Nicely balanced and not overbearing. 
light body, slick feel, creamy, lively, long smooth finish. 
Had this one on tap and in bottle several times and I keep returning to it.
Bottle. Cloudy, nice lasting small head. Aroma is yeasty banana, cloves and coriander. Taste is the same, but includes more spices and some hoppy notes. This is the best weissbier.
Very nice white beer. Enough creamy head and not very clear apparence. Some hops and malts and long lasting aroma on palate. A good one to drink.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2016 Nice, drinkable beer with very powerfull taste. Head is very creamy. It is refreshing and its aroma is good.

"My new favourite Weizen. Nose has baked banana/apple and clove ester notes that you would expect, and also a funky whiff of prawn cocktail crisps (Skips) that you wouldnt. Dont know how much of that is due to this bottle being six months past its best before date. Very creamy mouthfeel  fuller than Frankiskaner Hefe (sampled simultaneously)  almost bringing to mind vanilla/custard. Slight bitter (aniseed/fennel) vibes floating over a longish finish. "

En effet, une hefe weizen typique mais aussi puissante et racée, à mille lieux dune Paulaner beaucoup plus fade.

Nagy, tartós hab, narancsba hajló, szalmasárga szín. Illata a szokásos, banános, citrusos, búzás. Kissé édeskés, malátás, banános, narancsos ízvilág, közepes szénsavtartalommal. Testes, mégis könnyed, kiváló összhanggal rendelkező, frissítő, nagyon finom sör.

Hazy golden beer with a whtie head and bready, banana-y smell. Sharp on the tongue both due to the carbonation a bit of a zingy citrus hit. Banana, yeast and hops in there too. Perect for a warm day, this is a really good hefeweizen. The taste of banana lingers in the aftertaste.

Cloudy golden color with some powerful activity. Thick foamy white sparkly 3 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Sweet grains and citrus smell, a little faint. Flavors of fresh grains, lemon, orange with hints of clove and coriander. Well balanced with a pleasant rich sweet bread taste and a slightly sharp and crispy citrus and herbal feel.

Slick full body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified and short clean finish, ending with pleasant floral spices and fruity sugary banana and honey feel lingering on the tongue.

Overall an exquisite craft offering complex and delicious flavors, great freshness, extremely well balanced, accessible, and a true joy to drink!

UPDATED: APR 22, 2016 Nagazowanie wysokie  odpowiednie. Barwa jasno-żółta, całkowicie mętne. Piana bardzo wysoka, biała, wolno opadająca, z wysepką, długo utrzymująca się, wysoki w kierunku średniego lacing. Aromat: intensywny z początku, następnie umiarkowany, na zmianę fenolowe goździki i estrowe banany - dobrze zbalansowane ze sobą. Generalnie na początku czuć bardziej goździki, następnie banany. Smak: goździkowo-bananowy na zmianę (jak w aromacie), oznacza to bardzo dobre zbalansowanie. Pszenica słabo zarysowana, przejawia się jako nuty chlebowe, występujące gdzieś z tyłu. Mogłoby być ich nieco więcej. Piwo jest raczej słodkie, a także odpowiednio kwaśne. Aromaty chmielowe praktycznie nie występują, a finisz jest fenolowy, raczej krótki, lekko ostry i chlebowy, ogólnie przyjemny. Średnia pełnia i brak wodnistości. Piwo jest ułożone - można wracać wielokrotnie.

My new favourite Weizen. Nose has baked banana/apple and clove ester notes that you would expect, and also a funky whiff of prawn cocktail crisps (Skips) that you wouldnt. Dont know how much of that is due to this bottle being six months past its best before date. Very creamy mouthfeel  fuller than Frankiskaner Hefe (sampled simultaneously)  almost bringing to mind vanilla/custard. Slight bitter (aniseed/fennel) vibes floating over a longish finish.
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white head. Aromas of banana, yeast, wheat. Taste is sweet with a bit of bitterness.

On tap, hazy bright peach color with white head. Nice yeast esters on the aroma with the classic banana and cloves. Taste starts slightly sweet with banana and wheat, not very spiced, really fresh and easy to drink. Full bodied with a good amount of carbonation. Really good hefeweizen, fresh and easy to drink. I can see why its considered the original classic.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 This is what a hefe is all about. Cloudy with a lingering white head. Nose is yeast and bananas but not overwhelming - doesnt shout its a hefe. Taste is wheat and yeast balanced with light banana. Hops are undetectable but there is a very light bitterness. Half Liter bottle Bring on the cans! 

This is a state brewery. This must be the best thing any government did apart from protecting citizens, justice, and insuring the playing field is level, which very few do well.
Nice cloudy appearance, thick white head. Can smell and taste the yeast. One of the better Hefeweiss beers i had. Smooth and a bit sweetish. overall good to have in the fridge to enjoy anytime.
UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Cerveja de coloração dourada e bastante turbidez. Espuma persistente. Aroma e sabor que remetem à cravo e banana, típico das weissbiers. Excelente cerveja.

Where: The Big Stick, Navy Yard DC. 
How: 20 ounce draft pour.
Appearance: Cloudy golden orange/yellow with three fingers of fluffy white head that retains for a while. 
Aroma: Banana bread, yeast, clove/spices.
Taste: Just like aroma, great bready quality.
Palate: Strong carbonation, yet this beer goes down very easily.
Overall: Good beer, not one for a solid drinking session, but perfect for one beer after work, or relaxing on the weekend, in spring time weather.

Historic rating, bottle from a local supermarket. Poured a hazy yellow gold colour with a small white lasting head. Aroma of light hop, wheat, banana, lemon and clove. Light sweetness, medium bitterness, light sourness. Medium body, light sourness. Decent brew.
Boa breja de trigo. Faz bastante espuma. Bem leve sem comprometer muito sabor. Senti falta apenas de um pouquinho mais de corpo.
Tåkete ferskenfarget med lavt, tett skum. Tykk bananduft sammen med nellik og koriander. Følger godt i smaken sammen med en lang og fyldig avslutning.

Aroma of wheat, banana, corn, bubblegum, bread and cereal. Pours hazy dark golden liquid with a big soapy white head. Sweet taste, initial flavour of wheat, banana, lime and sweet fruit with some malt and yeast notes in the background. Full body with an oily texture and decently high carbonation, dry yeasty finish. Overall this is a prime example of a Hefeweizen, very vivid and fresh wheat flavour and rather yeasty compared to most other Hefeweizens.
Hazy golden liquid with white frothy head. Aroma of banana and coriander. Tastes same, medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Light body, creamy feel, average carbonisation.

Pours hazy pale golden. Huge ivory head, almost no lacing. Aroma is canonical: how a hefeweizen should smell, that is, a well balanced mixture of banana, smoke, bread, citrus, white pepper, and wild cinnamon. Taste is full, round, slightly sweet and no bitter at all. Nice low carb, very long finish. Subtle, refreshing, nutritious and complete.

Ar- slight banana and clove with hints of bready malts

AP- could light gold with a big white head

Flavor- sweet bready malt up front with subtle banana, clove, vanilla. Slight hop flavor

Mouthfeel, medium bodied, well carbonated, no alcohol, 

Ov- light, refreshing, great summer patio beer, would like a bit more of something, or everything. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

#100 on Ratebeer.

Price: 2.09 .
Standi didelė, balta puta. Malonus kvapas, labai geras skonis. Gaila, kad didoka kaina.

It is Spring time and Im hitting the Hefe Weissbier. This one even out performs Tucher. Light, crisp, and refreshing. Best of all it appeals to many palets not accustomed to real beer. My favorite all around beer.
Straw color light banana aroma. White head nice lacing. Hop sharpness over a malty wheat backbone. Easy to drink more than one.

The best German weissbier. Cloudy golden body with very big white head.
Wonderful aromas of fruit and citrus. Flavours: Smooth malt background, notes of fruit and banana. Very refreshing beer. Drank 500ml bottle.

Not my favorite style, and it tastes like bananas... but not too much. Yeasty, bready aroma, cloudy pale orange look. Mild tasting and very clean, easy drinking and refreshing, needs a slice of orange or a little umbrella to make it more cute. But on a sunny, hot summers day (a rarity in Deutschland) this would be a wonderful pick-me-up. A very nice example of this style. Actually, I just cut a slice of orange and hung it on my tall tulip glass, squeezing a bit into the hefeweizen... a sin I know, but its not bad. Better to have orange flavor than banana.
One of the best white beers I had, very well balanced with a whipped cream kind of freshness to it.

Bottle at home. Pours a bright cloudy golden/orange with a small lasting white head. Aroma is bread, citrus, creamy banana. Taste is citrus, bread, creamy, nice tarte finish. Not my preferred style but I can appreciate this is a solid effort.

On tap at De Paas in The Hague. Bright orange pour with a tall white head with good retention. Smells like yeast, warm bread, bananas and spices. The taste is crisp and refreshing, with the same notes.

Color amarillo,turbio,espuma color blanca, cremosa y con buena retencion; aroma frutal,especias, levadura.
Sabor afrutado, banana, especias, clavo,pimienta,dulce,amargor bajo,maltosa.
Cuerpo medio, carbonatacion media.

Gentle, lovely, light banana and subtle coriander aroma with a slight sweetness. Mine actually poured rather clear, golden with a fine, bright white white head. Texture is soft with medium medium high carbonation lending decent mouthfeel but no harshness. Flavour is soft apricoty with a light spice, almost soap-like. Good level of bitterness. There is one odd flavour which is somewhat bath-product but overall very, very tasty.

I am not the biggest fan of the Bavarian purity law. What initially apealled superior quality control in a first moment, later sounded more like a restrain on creativity and, specially, difference. To my humble perception most of the german beers all tastes the same. I wrote this to be assured that the reader would not waste time reading a review of an unbiased person. Having said that, this is a good beer. Not special by any means, but a good beer. As a weiss beer it is exactly what I expected: beautiful, refreshing and very drinkable. It really smells a little like banana, and it is very light. You can feel some bready like after taste. But dont look for much more than that. At least it is the best aromatic german beer I ever smelled, because they all smell pretty much the same to me. Cheers

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 On tap. Colore giallo torbido/ocra. Testa bianca, cremosa e granulosa di ottima persistenza. Straordinario olfatto di banana e vaniglia, malto e spezie. Carbonazione mediamente frizzante, mossa. Aroma solido, estremamente intenso e gratificante, di frutta matura (fra cui banana), panna cotta, lievito, qualche spezia più in sottofondo (chiodi di garofano). Gusto mediamente dolce, maltato. Finale corto e pulito. Corpo un po sottile, trama leggermente troppo watery. Una hefe weissbier che non ha bisogno di presentazioni, di aroma inconfondibile, succosa, caratteristicamente intensa e soddisfacente, sempre e comunque ai vertici della sua categoria.

pale golden color, cloudy and opaque, white foam, creamy and leaves a good mark on the glass, the aroma nuances include banana, malt, cereal and yeast. Has banana flavor is slightly acidic, fresh, light body, low / medium carbonation and final slightly sweet and sour.

On tap at The Gingerman. Pours a hazy orange with gold with medium frothy white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong yeast, clove, banana. Medium mouth, similar flavors to nose, crushable, very nice.
Bue avec Milinf. Mousse qui tient. Blonde légèrement trouble. Je ne lui ai rien trouvé dextraordinaire. Une bière qui ferait une bonne bière dété rafraîchissante.
Tap at Brewdog Clerkenwell. Hints of raisin, tasted malts, banana and some spice. Medium body. Highly enjoyable.
Top-End der deutschen Weizenbiere! Wunderbar vielschichtiges, fruchtiges Aroma, ohne zu süßlich zu sein. L

Bottle. Cloudy golden pour with a dense white head. Aroma is banana, citrus zest, slightly bready, rich. Taste is banana and sweet citrus, pretty rich for the style and ABV, hints of spice and breadiness, nicely balanced and flavourful.

Aroma: spices,yeast, fruity, light banana.
Appearance:Yellow ,cloudy/hazy, white foam, 
Taste: lightly bitter, light sweetness, spices, a bit of hops.
Palate: medium body, slick/creamy feel, average carbonation,
500ml bottle. Very cloudy, very refreshing wheat beer. One of the better weissbier I have tried.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
If there was ever a perfect beer this is it. There is no other review you need to read. I dont say that lightly or facetiously.
Hazy orange yellow color with white foam head. Aroma of wheat malt, yeast and coriander. Taste is smooth, creamy, banana and lightly seasoned.

Bottle - Cloudy yellow colour, huge foamy white head with excellent retention and fine lacing. Spicy aromas of yeast, lot of banana, some cloves and crushed wheat, bread, hints of tropical fruits. Taste is very smooth, bread, banana, mango, pineapple, tangerine, dough. Medium body, average carbonation, thick and silky texture, yeasty and fruity finish, no sourish aftertaste. Excellent hefeweizen near to perfection.

Color rubio pajizo. No está filtrada.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2017 butelka, warka do 01-09-16. metnawe, slomkowe, z niezla ale szybko mydlanie opadajaca piana. aromat... no tegez, weizena ;) bardzo bananowy, malo gozdzika, pszeniczno-zbozowe klimaty. w ustach stosunkowo lekkie, choc cialo jest, spore wysycenie poszczypujace w jezyk, praktycznie brak goryczki, pojawia sie tez slodycz... plus oczywiscie powtorka z aromatow. bardzo pasuje mi ta rownowaga bez udziwnien, klasyk faktycznie klasa. choc przyznaje sie - ze weihenstephanerowy dunkel jeszcze lepiej wspominam :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking a Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier by Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan at BrewDog Warszawa

Slodki (choc mniej niz pamietam), bananowy (na maxa), gozdzikowy (nie tak mocno), wcale nie taki pelny jak w glowie byl
UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 Pinta 50cl, en cervecería Kraken, cerveza de trigo con muy buen sabor, olor y apariencia, muy recomendable

Vom Fass. Gelbes Weizenbier mit tollem weissem cremigem Schaum. Selten so cremiger Weizenbierschaum gesehen! Es duftet nach Hefe und Banane. Fruchtiger Antrunk. Pfirsich und Banane. Hefe im Abgang mit Zitronenschale.

Hefe weissbier.
