Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is banana, spicy yeasts. Taste is more subdued and light. Not too shabby.

Aromat: średnio intensywny - banan i goździk.
Wygląd: piana bardzo obfita, o białym kolorze, mocno zbita, barwa piwa to mętne złoto.
Smak: wytrawne, wyraźny banan, w tle goździk, goryczka niska.
Tekstura: pełnia umiarkowania, wysycenie wysokie.
Ogólne wrażenie: bardzo smaczny i stylowy weizen, pięknie wygląda, świetna tekstura, w smaku mocno bananowe piwo, jednak aromat mógłby być intensywniejszy.Wysoko pijalne.

Bottle
Aroma-clove, banana, 
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

Bottle. Nose of cloves, banana, some citrus zest, yeast, light dough. Cloudy pale gold, thick initial head. Wheat, light spice, banana stretches out though mid and final accompanied by a gentle satisfying citrus note. Medium body, very creamy, good carbonation. Great nose. A bit thicker than most weissbiers -- the beer equivalent of comfort food.

strong banana smell, taste thick, smooth.

no bitter just pure smooth Weissbier.
Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma: wheat, yeast, ripe banana, some cardemom. Taste is sweet and sour, malty, yesty, banana. Medium body. Nice weisse.
Flasche - Top-End der deutschen Weizenbiere! Wunderbar vielschichtiges, fruchtiges Aroma, ohne zu süßlich zu sein. Langanhaltender Abgang.

Aroma - nice wheat and bubblegum like yeast. Classically Hefe!
Appearance - the body is a cloudy golden maize color, with amazing nucleation. The head is great about 3" and holds on for days. White as snow.
Taste - great wheat and banana like yeast ~ and its done wonderfully.
Palate - medium body, soft texture, soft carbonation, and subtle finish.
Cloudy pour with white head and lacing. Hippy arouma with a scent of banana and fruity. Taste very smooth with fruity back ground.
Pours yellow, lovely frothy head. Aroma of grainy bananas, taste is faint banana, grains. Smooth, tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 Aroma is typical hefe bubblegum and banana. Appearance has slightly deeper gold color than most hefes imo. Taste is very creamy and balanced between wheat, bananas and a hint of spice on the backend. Palate retains that spicy note with a trace of carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Flasche 0,5l: Goldgelb, leicht orange, milchig trüb, fester feinporiger Schaum; leichte Süße in der Nase, Hefearomen, malzig, leichte Hopfennoten, leichte Bitterkeit; im Körper leichte Würze, helle Malzigkeit, cremig, sehr kräftige Kohlensäure, etwas Apfel, grüne Bananen, Hopfennoten; trockener Nachgang
Metne o bursztynowym odcieniu z obfita biala piana. W zapachu dominuje banan i cytrusy oraz slaba won drozdzy. W smaku raczej slodkawe z owocowo bananowa nuta. Orzezwiajace.
En af verdens bedste hvedeøl. Ravgylden og ufiltreret med den typiske duft og smag af bananer. Den er bare så lækker.
Bottiglia da 0, 5 l. Color oro schiuma abbondante bianca fi grandiddima tenuta. Al naso banana ma anche un po di latta e malto., gusti che si ripetono al palato. Finale dolcino.
Boa Weiss, bom equilibrio apesar de achar um pouco fraca, mas bem refrecante. Boa Weiss, nad especial
Bottle from Albert Heyn. A classic hefe weizen. Very balanced, maybe a bit too much. Backlog from 2015/03/11.
A wonderful drop. cloudy appearance with clove and a slight banana lacing. creamy medium feel. From the top drawer.

Been on my list to review for awhile and finally getting around to this venerable stalwart. Its one of the first beers which really opened my eyes to better beer. So Im happy to review it with a more discerning palate. 

A: Cloudy dulled gold with a thin but sturdy white head. Just a dab of lacing.

N: Huge clove, followed by cracker and banana. Wheat, white peppercorn, yeast and esters, a squeeze of lemon juice, Coriander and even more breadiness.

T: Quite sweet and very little bitter. A touch spicy. 

M: Very creamy carbonation, light but filling mouthfeel, no alcohol. 

O: An amazingly flavorful hefeweizen that deserves every one of its kudos. It is easy to drink but truly excellent in all facets.
Nice golden, cloudy look to it. The slight banana aroma hit me first then I tasted cloves with a banana after taste. Really is an outstanding wheat beer
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2016 cereal, pale, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, thin feel, medium body. Over average wheat beer.
Weizen profumata e nebulosa, che incarna perfettamente lo stile. Aroma e gusto sono quelli giusti, finale amarognolo e secco, concisa, non appiccicosa, dissetante.

Cannot believe i havent rated this classic before.
500ml bottle purchased from Fred Meyer in Wilsonville OR.
$3.19
Classic looks...cloudy darker yellow..with a large thick and creamy white head.
Aromas of dough, cloves, banana and cereal. Very nice.
Taste same as the aroma..with maybe a bit of pepper and wheat.
Mouth feel is medium with medium to high carbonation. Leaves a nice after taste..and a dry finish.
A classic..understated but elegant.

Draft pour, golden, just slightly cloudy, moderately rich head and subtle aroma that matches the clean, crisp flavor of a classic wheat beer. This hefeweizen has just enough orange and coriander to enhance the flavor without overpowering a very nice Bavarian beer flavor. This is a great summer beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Station House, Forest Hills, Queens. Pours hazy yellow, thin white head. Aroma is clove, lemon and wheat heavy. Flavor is wheat, clove, slight banana, pretty standard wheat beer but a good example of the style, its good quality.

Złote, mętne, piękna gęsta piana. Wzorcowy lacing. W aromacie bardzo wyraźne banany, lekkie goździki gdzieś z tyłu. Smak to idealnie 50:50 banany i goździki. Ogólnie bardzo solidne piwo ale czy rzeczywiście najlepsze? Na pewno wzorcowe.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Dorata chiara, opalescente, schiuma bianca fine e di ottima persistenza.
Aroma di coriandolo, citrica, chiodi di garofano e frumento.
Al palato stesse componenti, coriandolo meno evidente, corpo medio-pieno, ben carbonata, un po' acquosa.
Eccellente nel suo stile.

Aroma: Simply a deScriptor of the style, although could be much more intensive: bananas on first plan, then clove and wheat, citrus. Appearance: High dense head, enourmous lacing, nice hazy yellow color. Taste: Bananas, wheat, many citrus notes, nice phenols - rather delicate but well composed, very crisp, low watery feeling, some weizen sourness. Palate: FInish is semi-sweet, carbonation is optimal - high to medium, body is low to medium. Very refreshing, smooth and delicate weizen, everything well balanced. Definately one of the top beers in its style.

12oz bottle. Hazy orange color with a white head. Strong citrus orange aroma. Medium body with a lot if carbonation. Orange citrus spice flavor. Very clean.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On Tap Pours a cloudy gold color with a thick firm frothy beige head. Aroma is of Bananas, cloves and lots of vanilla and spice. Taste is smooth heavy and clean. Palate is thick and creamy. One of the best examples of style in the world.
Pours a hazy amber from the tap. Nose of banana-y yeast, but not as heavy as most hefeweizens in that. All in all a good balanced hefeweizen. Good beer.
home bottled. very fine head. citric aroma, freshing taste. better at low temperature.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 3rd June 2016 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a cloudy golden straw yellow colour with a fluffy and puffy three finger white head that dissipated slowly leaving some nice lacing. Aromas are lightly bready and wheaty with lots of sweet banana, banana bread and clove. Taste is sweet ripe banana with hints of bubblegum, clove and citrus lemon. Medium bodied with mid to high carbonation. Overall, a very balanced Hefeweizen that tastes great. But still cant find this in Hong Kong and always have to carry it back in a suitcase.
UPDATED: NOV 5, 2015 On Tap. @Deutschland, Oviedo. 02/11/2015. Color amarillo, aroma trigo, levadura, frutal, ligera.

Bottiglia. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è discreta. Il cappello di schiuma persistente è voluminoso e abbondante con un finale di merletti. La carbonazione è esagerata. Al piano inferiore la frizzantezza è di bollicine fini dalla carbonazione esagerata, frizzante e vivace. La consistenza del liquido è opalescente, dal colore giallo dorato. Il corpo è pieno, dalla struttura cremosa. Alla lingua laroma rimane in equilibrio tra il dolce medio e lamaro medio. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono lunghe, come pure il finale. Il retrogusto è persistente, dai sentori di pane, fieno, agrumi e cortile.

50 cl bottle from City Center One, served in a snifter. Light amber, unfiltered, with huge white head that dissipates over time. Aroma is light banana, yeast, grains, very light spicy. Medium body, low carbonation. Taste is medium sweet, with low bitterness, sweet finish. Texture is oily to creamy.
Beautiful white foam, orange color, a fruity flavor. Consume preferably summer, pleasure beer.

0,5l from bottle. Yellow cloudy color, medium big white head. Smells spices, tobacco, yeasty, fruity. Medium body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes spices, some yeast, fruity, peach, light hop notes, a bit herbal, a bit peppery. Finishes with fruity notes and spices. Quite decent

Goden color, cloudy liquid and high white head.
Aroma is fruity with some yeast notes.
Taste is a bit sweet and balanced.
Great Weissbier... love it

500 ml bottle. Bought in "Mise en Biere" in Lausanne. Best banana Hefeweissbier smell youll ever smell, very sweet and complex, some pepper in the back and also a lot of cinammon. Very good looking deep golden color with a large white head. Taste is very good, maybe it lack a little bit more power for being perfect, but is really good. Sensation in your mouth is great and the beer stays in your mouth for a long time. Ill give this a 3.8 rating very well deserved. And hope ill still be alive in 2040 for celebrate the 1.000 years of this great company :)

500ml bottle. Hazy orange colour with a large foamy white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, fruits and spices. Wheaty malt flavour with notes of the aforementioned fruits and spices. Pleasant finish and aftertaste. Another excellent hefeweizen.
30th April 2015
Huge frothy white head with very good retention. Hazy yellow pale amber colour. Aroma is banana and wheat beer. Taste is wheat, banana with clove hints.
Beautiful golden colour in the special glas. I am not very into white bear but I was pleasant suprised about this one. Fresh taste, bananas, citrus and very drinkable.Also the typical wheat taste.

Alaranjado palha, turva, espuma branca uniforme, de boa formação e persistência, praticamente o padrão de uma boa weiss. Aroma de cereais, laranja, coentro, adocicada, muito redonda. Paladar segue as primeiras impressões do aroma, trazendo um cítrico alaranjado bem equilibrado e dulçor de mel, baunilha, cravo. Corpo e carbonatação médios, sensação aveludada. Aftertaste adocicado, cravo, dispersão da impressão inicial alaranjada. Definitivamente uma das melhores weiss de grande produção.

50 cl bottle at Merkur, Vienna.
Hazy dark yellow colour with huge head.
Spices and bubblegum and musty aroma. 
A taste explosion !! Spices mainly .
Creamy texture with medium body and good carbonation.Cant describe the aftertaste. A good way to celebrate the 500th rating.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 New rating, June 2017: 8/4/8/4/14. With an evolved palate Aroma of clove, banana, light citrus, a little peppery, wheat, dough. Great balance, easily drinkable. Should definitely not be much bolder in aroma and taste.

Old rating, October 2015: 6/3/6/3/13. Aroma is kind of fruity (the infamous bananas are there for sure), but not very dominant. Pours hazy gold with a frothy head, taste is moderately sweet with light bitterness and a dash of salt. Medium body with average carbonation. Nice, but it could have been a bit bolder in aroma and taste.
Bottle. Bananas, cloves, wheat, spices and yeast. Moderate sweetness and mild bitterness.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2017 Updated.   Cloudy yellow pour. Taste is perfectly smooth that is clovy with a distinct banana finish. Clean aftertaste perfect for any occasion.
W aromacie banany. Piwo zielonkawe, trochę żólte. Średnie nasycenie, piana odpowiednia. W smaku pszeniczne z mocnymi nutami bananowymi. Jedno z lepszych w swoim gatunku :)

From bottle in Weizen. Pours golden with significant head and aroma of banana and cloves that carries through to the palate. Glad to have a German hefe from the old school as Ive had a few imitators that werent too great. This one is a beaut.

500ml bottle into weizen glass. Classic Hefe aroma, like a sweet spice cake. Cloudy pale yellow beer with enormous white head. A few tiny bubbles arise. Flat light body with slight zingy banana finish. A touch of cloves and a little metal/sourness right at the end. Certainly easy drinking but a bit insipid.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 Yellow-green golden appearance with lots of foamy head. Complex tastes banana, vanilla, citrus, leaves and bubblegum. Very good mouth feel, with perfect carbonation and a lasting aftertaste
Butelka. Przyjemny zapach, odpowiednia barwa, w smaku banan. Konpletne piwo pszeniczne.

Pours cloudy golden orange with a large white head with sufficient retention. Very nice aroma of wheat, yeast, banana and clove with a little bubblegum sweetnes. Full, round taste of wheat, yeast, vanilla, banana, clove, honey and cinnamon topped off by more herbs difficult for me to distinquish. Pleasant, long, sweetish finish with the malt also kicking in. Great hefeweizen to be enoyed slowly. A little heavier than many of them, but here it is all for the better if you seek more than a quick swill.

500ml bottle. Cloudy golden orange with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are chewy wheat, bread crust, honey, dough, cream, banana, bubblegum, sweet orange pulp and cloves with floral notes. Really sweet, fruity and bready with a subtle spiciness. Medium body, good carbonation, creamy texture.
0.5l bottle. Cloudy orange color with nice white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, citrus and bubblegum. Taste is sweet, little bitter and pleasantly sour.
Hazy light golden color, white head. Fruity esters nose, banana, light malty, wheat. Sweet taste, banana, wheat, light bitterness, bread. Medium body, average carbonation.

Super solid Hefe. Aroma of banana and clove, similar taste with a bit of vanilla. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Brewdog Manchester. A cloudy golden orange colour with a thick white head. Big aroma of wheat, banana, clove, vanilla, some bread, subtle bubblegum and caramel. Taste is similar of wheat, vanilla, banana, clove, some bubblegum, slight bread, caramel and subtle spicy, herbal hops. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A sweetish, bready, vanilla finish. A big aroma of vanilla and banana followed up by a bready, traditional wheat beer taste. Tough decision between this and Schneider Weisse.

Poured from a 500 ML bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- A fantastic aroma of cloves and bananas.
Appearance- The beer pours a murky yellow/orange color with a thick white head.
Taste- Outstanding flavor of cloves, fruit and wheat. Great balance
Overall- A world class beer, even if you arent a hefeweizen fan you should give it a try to see what a masterpiece of this variety tastes like.
Bottle. Pours cloudy with white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, yeast and citrus. Taste is slightly sweet and yeasty.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden orange color with off white head. Aroma is fruity, malty and yeasty, citrusy fruity and banana, spicy, bready. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

-very sweet malt flavours like honey or caramel
-heavy on clove
-nice floral and citrus notes
-banana is more subdued compared to other Hefeweizen
-probably the best carbonated beer ive had,the head stayed for a good 30mins it seemed
-very sweet,creamy finish

Really great one,though most itt know that already.
though i have to say that i slightly prefer banana-heavy weizens above this like Franziskaner,Maisels Weisse or Schneider weisse

Frukt, jäst, vete dominerar denna fräscha öl, grym att dricka kyld en varm dag. Tycker den är riktigt bra även om det inte är en ny favorit i kategorin.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy golden with medium head. Banana, sweet sticky smell. Nothing refteshing about this beer.

How : tap Appearance slightly hazy golden, large white head. Aroma : banana, peppercorn, orange peel, some herbs and light syrup in the back. Palate : medium to light body, average to low carbonation.
Gold and hazy with a thick, meringue head and a spicy, peppery, ripe banana nose. Easy intro with light carbonation, a mild palate and a banana, lemon bar, soft finish.
Pours hazy yellow, huge head. Intense banana clove aroma. Taste rich banana, white fruit and spice. Palate is creamy with bits of yeast.
Golden with a short lasting big white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, caramel, clove and lemon. Taste is sweet and mild bitter.

Bottle thnx to Matt. Pours clear blonde, good white head. Smell is banana yeast. Taste is mildly bitter, full-fruity banana, not as overripe as the belgian variants tend to taste like. Indeed refreshing. Nice carbo and very easely drinkable. I have trouble to believe it, but I actually like this one, a lot !

Keg at the Holborn Whippet. Light gold, impenetrable. A slight white head encircles the glass. The tang of lemon gatecrashes the traditional banana and sweet spice Hefe aroma. Sweet, almost saccharin, taste with a bit of a sour note to balance and help wash it down. Pretty good but no world-beater.

Złote, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która sukcesywnie opada, niestety aż do zera. Aromat silnie owocowy, głównie banany i lekkie pomarańcze, a w tle goździk. W smaku lekko kwaskowe i mocno owocowe (ponownie głównie banan). Goryczka niska, zgodna ze stylem. Ogólnie bardzo dobra pszenica, bardzo intensywny smak i aromat, wszystko na miejscu i zgodne ze stylem.
On tap. Pours a hazy yellow body with a white head. Light tasting with strong nodes of banana.
50 cl bottle 5.4% abv. Golden hazy colour with large head. balanced spicy taste with a hint of sweetness. not too sour as many other hefeweisens. also no weird after tastes. excellent.

Bottle at Michaels Tavern (Barcelona, Spain). Appearance: Golden color. Hazy body. High carbonation. Large, rocky, light, intense white and lingering head. Aroma: Wheat malts. Bread, cereals, spices and fruits. Taste: Medium sweetness. Palate: Light and thin body. Wheaty, sweet and refreshing aftertaste.
Belle mousse blanche, une couleur jaune orangé, légèrement troublée, une saveur fruitée (citron léger, banane?) et épicée. 50 Cl V&B St Brieuc

Bottle. Hazy weissen-colour with a white head.
Notes of banana and flowers in aroma and taste.
A Classic from den Weissbierspezialisten!
Ao estilo de Erdinger!! Aroma suave, agradável aos apreciadores de cervejas especiais. Recomendamos..

Bottle shared by Markku, thanks! 
Hazy light yellow with a small white head.
Aroma is light malty, yeasty and fresh. 
Taste is pretty much like the aroma but with some citrus and herbal bitterness.
Light body, high carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Dry herbal aftertaste.
Dont care much for Weissbier and their likes, this was no exception.

Bottle: Poured light gold in color, unfiltered cloudy appearance in a very good way. Thin but dense head with great retention. Citrus notes, brings to mind a dry wheat field in the late summer months, many people say they smell bananas but I didnt get that impression at all. Slightly dry mouthfeel, with fairly strong carbonation on the tongue. Overall a very pleasant unfiltered wheat beer.
Draught at weihenstephaner berlin. Aroma orange, wheat, banana, cloves. Taste is crisp and refreshing. Smells good, looks good, tastes good.

Bottle:
Pours hazy, pale yellow with a tall white head.
Orange, banana, clove, wheat aroma.
Taste is bright and zesty...banana, spices, orange malt, wheat malt....Pretty much the benchmark for the style.....
Excellent.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Cloudy yellow color with big white head. Aroma is yeast, banana and spices. Taste is a mixture of bananas and spices with little vanilla aftertaste Everything is just so well balanced, true hefeweizen!

Cloudy golden, tall creamy head. Excellent retention. The nose is yeasty combining a dozen of spice plus proper amount of banana. Medium body. Oily. The flavour gives you what you expect but this is extremely smooth & well balanced. A perfect play of malt, yeast and hops. Mild bitterness through the ending & aftertaste. This is really delicious.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bardzo obfita piana drobno pęcherzykowa z większymi bąblami gdzieniegdzie. Barwa złota, mętna. Aromat bardzo czysty, klasycznie bananowo-goździkowy z dodatkiem drożdży i skórki od chleba pszennego. W smaku na początku kwaskowość o charakterze zakwasu chlebowego szybko przechodzi w cytrusową słodycz, jest rześko, odświeżająco, średnie, lekko szczypiące nagazowanie i niewielka przyprawowo-kwiatowa goryczka na finiszu wnoszą pijalność tego piwa na wyżyny!

Bottle.
Intense yellow, white head,
Aroma of banana, spices.
Nice taste of banana marshmallows, some sweetened, fizzy some hints of bitterness.
Great aroma - some wheat but a nice slightly ripened banana...Taste not as standout - just not that much flavor. not really impressive for this highly rated of a beer. easy to drink
16oz draft pour. Thin white head and golden yellow color. Smell was a typical wit with apricot and citrus. Taste was crisp and wheaty with smooth finish and no real bitters.

Hazy golden yellow, with a thin dense head. Slightly sour and critrusy, grassy, light bitterness, with a lightly sweet, malty and loaded of banana finish. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Good and well balanced.

On tap at Old Nicks pub, Eugene Oregon. Amazing beer thats very simple, yet hits the spot in a way few others can. Ive also had this out of the bottle, too. Price to value ratio is very good. This is a high quality beer at a fair price. Taste is excellent. Banana bread and hints of licorice were detected, coupled with sweet grains. Im just gonna sum it up by saying this beer is great.

Towering fine & dense white head, very stable over very hazy, pale orange beer; Banana, not much else. Hint at basmati rice, and raffia. Sweet-sourish banana; lactic/wheat acidity, citric even. Spritzy carbonation, refreshing, wheatslickness, medium bodied. Not bad, but Im surprised that this brewing institute cant do better than some of its big company competitors.

Liter @ pilsner hause in a stein with a Hazy yellow beer. Medium white long lasting head. Aroma of bananas and a bit of cloves in the flavor. But also a malty taste with hints of hops to finish. This is a nice weissbier.
Yellow cloud color, medium foam. Aroma of banana and wheat. Sweet taste and nice lasting aftertaste. Best weissebier I have tried.

Pours a hazy yellow with a medium sized white head and a few spots of lace. Aroma is bubblegum, vanilla, light banana, clove, and light bready wheat. Flavour is vanilla, clove, bubblegum, banana, mild noble hop presence with a mild bitterness and a chewy/bready wheat characteristic. Very good example of a traditional German hefe!

Wunderbares Weizen.
Gilt nicht umsonst als eines der besten deutschen Hefeweizen. Eingeschenkt im Glas sieht es perfekt aus, auch im Aroma schön hefig und malzig. Banane kommt gut durch.
Im Geschmack erfrischend, spritzig und fruchtig. Leichte Säure und dazu süße Banane. Das Malz bildet eine sehr gute Grundlage.
Toll!

Draught. Colour dull yellow. Good stable froth. The aroma of apple, citrus, malt and bread. Thick taste of wheat malt, hops, green apple, bread. Mighty Wise, but in my opinion, not the best copy. Ill check in bottled form. Rated 4 out of 5.
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 Lekker Weissbier, dat zich vooral van andere Weissbieren onderscheidt door de fruitige geur en frisse afdronk. Perfect bier voor in de zomer.

Weihenstephaner is the pioneers of wheat beers, because it is from the worlds oldest brewery that still exist, and their beer is cherished by beer connoisseurs worldwide. Beautiful foamy beer with a discreet but delicate aroma of banana and wheat. Other wheat beer smells more towards like freshly baked bread, but Weihenstephaner is therefore more green with fresh immature wheat grain. The taste is rich of ripe banana, but without the sweetness of taking too much. It is a little spicy of coriander and a little clove, again in a manner which seasoning does not take over either banana sweetness or its fresh thirst-quenching wheat malt embossed twist. Everything is in perfect balance, actually so perfect that it is almost scary perfect. All hefeweissbier I will taste in the future will be in deep contrast to this masterpiece. I am very excited.

Bottle. Hazy yellow orange with a large white head. Lots of banana in the nose, raspberry, strawberry. Same goes for flavour with some grain, hay, pineapple, oranges, cloves. Medium body, lively carbonation, some sweetness, little bitterness. Easy going.
Najlepsze niemieckie piwo pszeniczne jakie pi?em. Intensywny smak, ?wie?y zapach. Polecam!

The classic Weissbier. A beautiful frothy head with a delicious wheat and malt taste and a clean finish. Best when drank from tap. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

When poured into the glass it produces a dense creme coloured cloudy, quite longlasting head. The colour of the beer itself is hazy apricot. Aromas of ripe banana, honey, wheat, yeast, some vanilla, and clove come to mind. Hopy, then flavours of popcorn, malt, sweet banana, butter, clove and sth between slight cinnamon and honey. Smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Incredible solid beer.

On tap, 500ml. Pours yellow with a brownish tint and heavy cloudiness. Head is medium-tall, white, thick and creamy; and is long lasting. In nose, aromas of strong clove, slightly phenolic, wheat, some spice, light banana, very slight vanilla and some malt, sweet and pleasant. Mouth feel is creamy and quite full, with medium carbonation and nice texture. Tastes slightly sweet with very mild hop bitterness and very subtle sourness. Flavors of clove, with very slight phenol, light banana, strong wheat with some yeast and light malt, hop flavor is not very noticeable. Good, not heavy, yet complex enough and very drinkable.
tek kelimeyle harika, hafif şekerli, içimi kolay,kafası güzel, türkiyede bulunması zor.

After spending an entire summer in Germany, where I was introduced to wheat beer, I was excited to come home and see what America had to offer. Sadly, I struggled to find anything that came close to my experiences in Germany and eventually gave up. One day, bored and equipped with Google, I set out to learn more about beer. Along the way I stumbled upon RateBeer and BeerAdvocate, both of which hold this beer in the highest regard. I tracked it down, poured it up, and drank my first sip. Absolutely beautiful.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Hefetrübes goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Banane, reichlich Hefe, sehr süffig, spritzig.

Pours a beautiful, hazy, sunny, peach pulp color, with a dense, stable head.

Smells of ripe banana, red apple skin, together with grassy hops and white pepper. Banana shines through beautifully, while balanced by the hops and a coppery whiff, remaining the beers enjoyable balance.

Drinks incredibly smooth, carried by soft yeast, feels utmost silk on the palate, while providing enough carbonation to create an refreshing impression. 

Begins with cakey malts, clove, honey and a fantastic yeast smoothness, establishing the beers world-class mouthfeel. While the spices are prominent, they do get tamed by earth, a glimpse of oak and the grassy, slightly herbal hops. Finishes with young banana, more clove and honey, while the hops provide a pleasant, refreshing herb presence.

The interplay between noteable carbonation and euro hops turns out great, as the beer dont need no bitter hop punch to balance the sweeter spices, but uses the metallic qualities from the carbonation to create a short, refreshing burn, taming the sweeter ingredients of the brew. As easy as this drinks, as convincing is the beers receipt, showcasing a truly well made Weissbier, which leaves a refreshing, perfectly balanced impression on the palate.
Perfect appearance. Aroma of banana, cloves and notes of yeast like wheat dough in bakery. Crisp taste with lemon fresh finish. Perfect.
Out of bottle. Always to be a bit hazy. Nice yeast and banana note. In the mouth a bit more crisp than expected but nice fine carbonation. Finished with a suggestion of citrus, almost sour orange?
Rated based on notes taken 10 Jun 2012 -- This is an amazing Hef. Tops that I think Ive ever tried.

Pours cloudy yellow with a creamy white head. Takes a while to pour because the head is so big. Aroma is fruity malt with citrus and bananna, spicy yeast profile with some cloves. Creamy mouthfeel. Light malty start with fruity notes. Some citrus flavors. Finishes with a spicy yeast and light clove . I am not at all a fan if this style but I could drink this one all summer .

From a bottle. Pours an orange-yellow and makes a thin white head. Aroma is of wheat and yeast. Tastes of citrus, light malt and wheat. A very good example of the Bavarian white genre. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of bananas and yeast, typical cloudy yellow color with a creamy white long lasting head, not too sweet and while the banana notes are clearly present I found the citrus to be more noticeable. Fades to a lightly better taste with a very nice after taste. Im a Weissbier fan and this is one of my favorites.

Bottle. One the best in its style. Yellow-orange colored, hazy almost opaque with a full frothy white head it starts of as a delight for the eye. Rich aromas of banana and yeast play on the nose. However, the real distinction is the really balanced and harmonic composition once the Weisse touches the tongue. The taste light sweet. The rich flavors of fruit, yeast and wheat are embodied in a medium body with medium carbonation, witch keeps it refreshing and crisp. The mouth feel is very smooth and turns into a very just slightly bitter finish, which is followed by a great and really pleasant aftertaste. Strongly recommended.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, wheat, Weizen yeast, banana and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, wheat, Weizen yeast and banana; ends slightly dry with citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Nobody should care about that though, since this beer is still amazing and so refreshing.
aroma of banana with hints of citrus and yeast. The same notes goes for the taste. Not too sweet and solid Hefe stuff!
A good beer. Not my style, but you must recognize that fantastic qualities. Sed to remove or re hidratrar you, wonderful!

Bottle to stange glass
Banana, yeast, wheat, and hay. Hazy yellowish amber with a bright 1 cm, very creamy white head. Theres good retention and very little lacing.
Taste is banana, lemon, yeast, and a touch of pepper.
rich banana aroma not to much foam full bodied medium carboxinated some banana little clove very good weizen indeed

my favorite wheat beer there is nothing else to drink better at hot summerdays with not to much alc.

perfect aroma and taste
Apariencia limpia espuma densa, olfato levaduras y notas acidas. Sabor equilibrio perfecto del trigo con el resto de las maltas con acidez bien puesta y un toque ahumado.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 The classic hefeweiss. Pours a rich gold with a stunning huge fluffy head. Smells of wheat, spice, tastes superbly balanced, yeast and fruity esters, light spice. One of the smoothest, easiest drinking beers there is, light bodied and easy dryness, like sipping clouds.

HAY I AM BACK GUYS TO REVIEW MORE CRAFT BEERS FOR MY FANS AND EDUCATON. SO WHENISTEPHEANAR IS A CLASSIC SESSHION FOR THOSE WHO DONT NOW AMD ITS INSPIRE BELGIUM. THEYRE PUT LEMON AND IT RELLY MAKES THE LEMON FLAYVER. ONE DAY IF IM IN GERMONEY ID WILL DRINK WORLD CLASS CRAFT BEERS AND LERN HISTORIC THINGS. BUT REMEMBER EVERY BODY THAT PLINY IS THE BEST BEERS AND CHANGE THE WAY ITHER COUNTRYS TASTE BEER.
A hazy, bronze-ish golden colour with a boisterous head. Taste is clove, wheat, a bit of banana bread. Solid traditional brew.

Líquido turvo,formação de espuma característica do estilo,alta,volumosa e duradoura;aroma e sabor igualmente característico,aparecendo cravo,banana,malte tostado,tutti fruti,aveia,porem com um maior "corpo" e um agradável amargor ao fundo,média carbonação,refrescante,equilibrada. Boa weiss,gostei,recomendo.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 10A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 07:51. AROMA: phenol aromatics with notes of clove, some vanilla and a pinch of bubblegum. background of faint wheat. no hop aroma. APPEARANCE: gold color and hazy. large moussy head with style average retention. TASTE: a combination of clove and some banana flavours, with a nice wheat background. hints of vanilla. low bitterness with a semi-sweet and wheaty finish. PALATE: medium-light body with high carbonation. OVERALL: a nice and traditional wheat ale.
Cloudy orange with huge white head. Fruity cooked banana aroma with hints of citrus and yeast. Sweet cooked banana in taste along with hints of yeast. Wellbalanced
delightful , prickly carb, creamy, orange, touch sweet, touch of ice cream. Paired extremely well with the crab and shrimp appetizer that featured an orange glaze.
Troebel oranjegeel bier met schuim. Smaak is krachtig, licht zoet, fruitig, banaan, citrus en carmel. Eén van de beste Weissbieren die er zijn. Etiket is iets aangepast inmiddels.

Nice golden yellow color, slightly murky, dense lasting head. A: fresh grains, soap notes, hint of banana and lemon, hint of metal. Pretty typical Weizen. T: refreshing, perfect mouthfeel, medium bodied. Starts with fresh grains, little doughy (just right). Moves towards a fruity, mildly bitter taste with banana notes. Aftertaste is relatively neutral with some fresh grains, some banana. Nice.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2015 Very high end wheat beer. Light carbonation...... Pours a cloudy orangey yellow. Nose is banana, chewing gum and sherbet and sacharin. Taste : Banana, sugar, sherbet and dough. Creamy mouth-feel for sure. Great wheat beer I am just not sure I could drink too many in succession. Overall though, perhaps the best wheat beer I have had in a long time.....comparable to Koenig.

500ml bottle, pours an English mustard yellow with a big, thick, creamy white head. Smell is bananas, bread dough and some spice. Taste is gentle warm spice and fruit, bit of banana, hint of citrus and some dried fruit. Very creamy mouth feel, non aggressive carbonation and a short, fruity finish. Brilliantly crafted beer, smooth, gentle, flavourful and refreshing.

Extraordinaria espuma blanca, densa y suave de 4-5 dedos. Muy burbujeante y de color típico pajizo claro y ligeramente turbia. Aroma a malta de trigo y limón. Sabor también con algo de limón y especias abundantes destacando clavo. A diferencia de otras del estilo el sabor es muy seco, preparando un final todavía más especiado. Excelente
Cloudy deep yellow pour, thick 3 finger white head. Nose is banana. Bittersweet. Middle is soft creamy wheat malt, subtle but steady soft fruit. Finish is sweet bread. Delicious.
Bread, toast, dough, banana, woody, roasty. Excellent Heffeweissbier! Best Ive tasted so far. Very refreshing and smooth. You know youre drinking a quality wheat as soon as you taste it!

Bottle. Peach color with nice steady head. Aroma of banana, cloves, yeast. Taste is rich and complex: some sweet, some bitter, some tart. Very nice. Low carbonation, full-bodied beer. Oily texture. Excellent hefeweizen.
bread, hay, toast, citrus, herbs, banana, alcohol, dough, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, creamy, full body, soft carbonation,

De botella. Con un color dorado turbio. Espuma blanca, abundante y persistente. Aromas claramente a plátano. En boca es una cerveza fabulosa, de las que llena la boca. Una verdadera delicia. Un postgusto ligeramente amargo. Muy equilibrada y sensacional para mi gusto.
HAzy Golden, nice white head, aromas of banana, lemon and some cloves, taste of wheat, banana and yeast,

Oh, yes! Cloudy amber, big white top. Sweet bitterness, very complex and simple at the same time. Master art! No aggression at all, but full taste and aroma. Nice carbonation also, one of the best German hefeweizen.
50cl bottle. Pours golden color with big fine white head. Aroma of wheat and cloves. Strong spicy taste with light bitterness. Long bitterish aftertaste. Not bad, but there are better heffeweizens.

Spisane z Notatek kiedy Ratebeer był w zeszycie i główne poszukiwania nowych piw i smaków, odkrywanie świata to były głównie piwa zagraniczne w dużej mierze niemieckie, 
Piwo wypite: maj 2008, 
Z notatek wynika że smakowało jak na tamten czas :)

Smells like a wheat beer, but with some harshness.

Pours a cloudy light gold colour.

Taste is similar to Erdinger, but with a harshness in the aftertaste. i cant place it.

Lots of carbonation,

Overall I was not disappointed. Although I do prefer Erdinger over this one, even though this one had less of a fruity taste, which I prefer.

MB

Finally rating this. 500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy bright orange color with a large white head. A big clove, banana, citrus wheat nose. Rich almost sour wheat, tangy, banana, sweet malty base. Light spices, clove and lemongrass. Very smooth palate. Yes, this is lovely. Hard to imagine many more drinkable beers.

Liter crushed at the brewery paired with some weisswurst just to make it official. Cloudy golden pour with a huge white head and excellent lacing. Fruity esters, bananas, cloves. Definitely the best hefe Ive ever had. Could drink about a thousand of these.

500 mL bottle poured into a hefeweizen glass. The aroma is a mellow, creamy banana and vanilla with a complimentary clove and some subtle undertones of peaches. The beer is a cloudy pale with a hint of gold to it, and is topped by a creamy and frothy white head that retains well and leaves a light lace. The taste is a mellow and mild medium sweet with medium low bitterness. A creamy texture and carbonation go down smooth and easy with a medium body containing notes of fresh baked bread, banana, orange, vanilla, and a light woody clove spice that finishes clean with a lightly bitter clove and citrus zip and crispness that mellows quickly and turns over to a light oranges and nila wafers combination which stick in the aftertaste with a touch of lemon, and a lactose hint. Quite delightful.

0,5 liter, 5.4%. bleek helder met geel/witte kraag. aroma van banaan, citrus, stro, gist en mout. Smaken van banaan, citrus, koriander, gist, mout, matig zoet, iets aan de dunne kant. te zoet en ik had er iets meer van verwacht... wat beperkt... flets...

On tap at Søernes Ølbar, Copenhagen. Cloudy bright yellow with a small white head. Nice aroma with wheat, yeast, fruity (banana) with notes of spices (coriander maybe?). Strong bitterness, with a hint of acidity. Round palate turning slightly sweet in the aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2015 Splendida weiss, giallo paglierino torbido con una persistente schiuma bianca. Profumo dolce di banana, al palato perfettamente bilanciata, nel complesso dolce ma senza esagerare. Carbonazione vivace, molto beverina.
Bottle. Big white head. Cloudy golden. Yeasty, fresh, foamy, grass, honey melon, banana and grainy. Excellent!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Aroma: Vanilla, wheat, banana, hops
Appearance: Yellow (dark,) some haze
Taste: Wheat, banana, vanilla, similar to the aroma, sweet with a touch of bitterness
Palate: Silky smooth, so drinkable

Id drink this daily if I wasnt so lazy and if I wanted something not super alcoholic.

Also, they are right, it does go with Weisswurst, thank you local German pork store.
Very sharp sourness with strong aroma and very strong palate with great smell but appearance is not bright

0,50 bottle purchased at the Beerville store in Belgrade-Serbia. Ciao Vlada. Pours completely cloudy orange skin color, very intense with a medium white cap. Nose: pretty much an yeasty orientation covered by peers and banana. Some flowers too. Mouth: perfect carbonation balanced and frizzy just in the aftertaste. Banana, melon, fruit salad with a balanced sweet accent. A very tasty German Weiss. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Probably the best Weizen. Great appearance. Fresh, refreshing and very intensive taste and aroma of banana.

Draft at cerveteca bar in Lisbon. It pours a cloudy yellow colour with a very thick and large white head that lasts very well. Aroma is of strong banana, wheat, lots of cloves and sweet candy feel. Taste is banana, some tartness, overall sweet and spicy, wheat and some yeast. It has a medium body, medium carbonation and a crisp and refreshing feel. Definitely the best hefeweizen Ive tasted in my life. I will for certain drink more of this in the upcoming summer.
An amber, cloudy Hefe Weissbier with high white head. Aroma is fresh fruity, banana, yeasty, light malty. Taste is sweet and light bitter.
On tap. Pours cloudy yellow. Banana aroma, sweet. Crisp taste, mostly banana again, nicely tart and dry. Extremely refreshing.

Yellow to orange colored, nice and thick lasting white head. Aroma is sweet banana, wheat and strong cloves. Taste medium sweet wheat and again more cloves than banana, yeast. Medium bodied yet thick with medium carbonation. Nice, lightly sweet banana aftertaste.

Hazy gold color with a very fruity aroma as well as a little floral and grassiness. Flavor was a nice blend of sweetness, bitterness, and spiciness. Its also super crisp and smooth. I thought I didnt like wheat beers for a while. I may have just been converted!

Tap. Hazy gold. Long lasting thick foam. Lively carbonation. Aroma: Banana, clove, yenka chewing gum, slight citrus. Taste: full body, lively carb, wheat tartness, banana, refresching, slightly bitter finish, leaves you wanting more.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy yellow colour. Huge fluffy whie head. Aroma of wheat, banana and spices. Flavour is similar with lighter banana notes. Sweet medium finish. Medium body, high carbo. A really good hefe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice palate. Rich flavours make the taste smooth yet complex. Not so cloudy for a hefe but the appearance is delightful
On tap at Irreale. Hefe aroma, but soft and elegant. Light body, sweet, mineral, fresh, soft banana hints. Great.

Trying this draft in Istanbul so rather unorthodox. Really quite lovely. Strong wheaty aroma with a corresponding taste. Lovely cloudy appearance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle & Keg at the same time. Keg is more fresh and slightly more aromatic due to its unpasteurised nature. 

It is definitely a classic. Pours a huge head almost 3 fingers, which lasts for a long time. Flavours of banana, clove, yeast, bread, and citrus hit the nose. Taste is mainly based on banana and bready maltiness of wheat, no hop bitterness, but citrus notes. 

Must try this German classic.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Uitgeschonken in 0,5 liter Weihenstephaner bierglas. Goudgeel troebel bier, met volle witte stabiele schuimkraag, die boven het glas uitsteekt, en zeer lang in het glas blijft. Geur van mout, brood, gist en specerijen als kruidnagel en vanille zelfs kaasachtige aromas. Zachte en typische verfrissende smaak van Weissbier. Tonen van vers brood, bananen, honing en specerijen, vooral kruidnagel haal je er duidelijk uit. Weinig bitterheid van hop, meer citroenachtige droge en kruidige afdronk. Uitstekend en mooi gebalanceerd Weissbier van de oudste brouwerij ter wereld, echt een Duitse klassieker, behoort tot de beste Hefe Weissbieren die er zijn.
SB Oskarshamn, flaska. Allt rätt. Färsk flaska -16. Som dom skall vara. Rätt glas och underlägg.
If only I had discovered this beer earlier in life. Other raters have described this well enough, it is the pinnacle of the style.

Pours hazy light golden like a wheat beer should. A very good head in a wheat beer glass!
Smells yeast and spices.
Mouthfeel is light with low carbonation. Tastes light yeasts, spices with little citrusy flavor. Very good wheat beer. My best wheat till date!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy yellow, retentive creamy medium white head. Nose is a nice and mellow blend of banana, fruity bubble gum and wheat, some mild citrus. Flavor is fairly wheaty and banana-y, some bubblegum in there, finishes with wheat and spice. Flavorful, yet mild and smooth, and balanced, nice.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2015 Compra: XXXII

Opinión: De lo mejor en su genero, aunque como todas las de trigo demasiado floja para mi gusto.
Een redelijk lekkere weiss bier. Vol van smaak, mooi troebelachtig en redelijk wat schuim. Toch heb ik betere op in deze soort.
Barnyard, cheese, cheese, cheese, cheese, leather, citrus, barnyard, citrus, citrus, roasty, grass
One pint, 0.9 oz bottle. Poured a cloudy golden color with a white head. Taste of banana, clove, spice, and yeasty. Average carbonation, light-medium body. Refreshing indeed.

0,5 l bottle. Pours a nice, beer with an aroma that reminds a lilttle of vanilla. The ingredients, which include spices and banana, mix really well together to give full flavour, yet mild mouth feeling. It is mild in taste and easy to drink. If you would like to try wheat beer, you should look no further.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma -Vanilla, banana, lemon. Taste - Banana, orange.
Draught. Pours cloudy orange with a mostly lasting foamy white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, honey, bread. Taste is much the same with a little bit of spice on the finish. Smooth light mouthfeel.

Kuflowe w Browarze we Freising.Barwa złotawa,mętne.Aromat to klasyka piw pszenicznych, to piwo ma wszystko;banany, cytrusy, zioła i owoce.Zapach drożdży bardzo dobrze zbilansowany, absolutnie nie przeszkadza. Lekka kwaskowośc, raczej wytrawne, cała gama smaków. Piwo super.

The cloudy orange color. The cream is white and has good height and dense body, firm and very persistent texture that leaves a perennial layer along the tasting.
The aroma is sweet banana, with a marked presence of yeast, clove and subtly honey.
The taste comes first shown is the average sweetness of wheat, yeast, bread and more smoothly banana. The final shows the typical bitterness of Weizen, however this particular beer is noticed a little more pronounced.
The aftertaste is long slightly sweet banana, but has a predominant flavor of yeast and yeast.
Medium body, medium carbonation.
It really is a very full-bodied beer with creamy, robust and refreshing texture, well set with alcohol.
The ingredients are well harmonized making has a great drinkability.
Good example of the German Weiss Munich representative of hefe-weissbier style with striking features and a lot of personality.
Overall a great beer. I thoroughly enjoyed it and will be having it again. Bottle, poured into a mug.
Draft. Hazy golden color poured with minimal head. Aroma of bananas. And spices. Flavor is banana. Little bitterness.

En Botella. Un clásico perfecto de su estilo. Esm vaso dorado turbio de buen brillo, y buena corona blanca. Aroma hierba, trigo, plátano, algo de especies. Muy rica y agradable y no falla, pero si te gusta ésta, debes probar. La Vitus que es aún mejor.

Cor amarelo palha e turva; espuma branca de alta formação e baixa/média persistência; pouco lacing.
Aroma de banana e cravo.
Sabor maltado seguindo o aroma com leve picardia e acidez no final e amargor muito discreto; retrogosto de leve álcool e leve adstringência.
Corpo leve/médio e Média carbonatação.
Cest une bière très agréable. Elle a vraiment une belle robe, jaune clair, trouble. Elle est légère et je note une bonne note de froment et un léger goût de banane. Ce nest que du bonheur.
As good as a hef gets. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Clove and banana in the aroma with some spice. Nice yeasty flavor with malt and just enough hops to balance. Extremely refreshing.

500ml bottle. Golden straw with tall dense whitw head. Aroma of cloves, grass, citrus and bananas. Taste is dominated by bananas and cloves but also has a light citrus touch towards the finish. Mouthfeel is smooth and sweet and the carbonation is low, theres a slight bitterness to the aftertaste but otherwise very clean finish.

Bardzo fajna pszenica, co jest standardem w niemieckich produktach z 
"weiss" w nazwie. Przyjemnie nagazowane, odrobinę słodkawe w smaku, jednocześnie pełne. Można brać w ciemno.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Dark golden, almost light brown, haze color with compact creamy white head. Aroma is malty, with fruity esters of bananas, plums. Flavor is malty swreet, with fruity esters of bananas. Nice malty aftertaste which is very well balanced with low hop bitterness. Texture: body is soft, smooth, carbonation is moderate low. Overall: Very good beer, representative example of this style.
pours a cloudy straw yellow with a lively thick head. Aroma is hay-grass. Creamy mouth feel. Nice semi sweet slightly citrus taste. Clean slightly sweet finish. Pleasant palate. Great Weiss!

Uma cerveja interessante...a primeira cerveja industrializada do mundo, sec IX.
Corpo medio, doçura e amargor equilibrados!!

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 Bottle from Masuyos Liquors. Pours a cloudy golden deep yellow with a big thick creamy head. Banana, cloves, lemon zest, and wheat on the nose. Medium body with a rich and creamy taste on the palate. Slightly bready malt taste is present as well. Great smooth finish. A true classic. / Bottle shared a tasting (Thanks Jesse!). Banana cream pie on the nose with some banana pudding and clove aromas. Rich and creamy mouthfeel with very soft carbonation. Smooth drinking and very enjoyable. Not as wowed as I was the first time, but still world class.

Bottle @ home.
Clody dark orange, 2-3 finger thick off white head. 
Fruity, spicy, doughy aroma with oranges, clove, ham, dough, some apples, vanilla? Hmm...
Taste packs refreshing oranges, some banana, prominent clove and firm bready wheat. It's fairly dry, which I like. Medium bodied with a nice round and crisp carbonation, soft texture.
A very nice hefe for me who's not so fond of the style.

Moderate to weak cloudy, yellow to orange colored, nice and thick lasting white head. Aroma is sweet banana, wheat and strong cloves. Taste medium sweet wheat and again more cloves than banana, yeast. Medium bodied yet thick with medium carbonation. Nice, lightly sweet banana bread aftertaste. Marvelous! Personal favorite among Hefes!

Hazy yellow, stark white foamy head, runny lacing. 
Banana notes are more on nose than palate. 
Banana, banana bread, plastic, spice, fruity, complex. 
$3.29/500ml bottle at Total Wine and More Boca Raton Florida
12.8.2014. Aroma of spicy banana, cloves, wheat. Tastes malts, banana, spices, wheat.
Definately one of the Best Hefeweizen on the Planet! Great smooth Mild taste. A great choice for any occasion if available.
Steady consistent vanilla, lemon aroma, cloudy, pale yellow amber colour with thick creamy head. Very nice on tongue - smooth. Very refreshing - excellent beer.

Pours a cloudy light amber. World Class head volume, lacing and retention.

Classic wheat nose of light clove and banana, a touch of lemon, yeast and biscuit. As it warms, a subtle spicy character emerges.

Medium bodied with a very smooth texture that approaches creamy. Well carbonated with a rich effervescence from the middle on.

This beer is the standard for Hefe Weissbiers and is world class. The flavor profile is intense, complex and well balanced. It begins with a mild tartness that separates into lemon and banana. As these fade in the middle, clove comes forward over a biscuit background with a hint of spice and dryness. The finish is crisp, with a mild biscuit fading and leaving clove.
50cl bottle. dark orange colour, slightly hazy. decent lacing from rich whitehead. aroma of bananas and bread. nice taste, refreshing. high carbonation, average bitterness

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 Great hazy yellow pour with a white head. Fruity aroma. Sweet banana bread and citrus notes through out the flavor profile. Very clean and refreshing beer start to finish. This is my favorite wheat beer.

Served cold. Small head, translucent hazy yellow. Malt, wheat, citrus, vanilla aroma. Mid bodied, bubbly, and creamy. Malted wheat, vanilla, citrus, with a smooth yet mildly hoppy finish. Creamy and smooth throughout. Wonderful hefe.

In my top 3 of Hefeweizens . Could easily be no. 1. Very full bodied, fruity, refreshing, with Champagne like carbonation. I always notice that when days are getting longer and spring and summer closer, I start to enjoy more and more these, "Poor mans Champagnes", as they say in Bayern :)

Nez sur la vanille , robe blanc cassé, du corps , ce qui n?est pas le cas de toutes les blanches, Elle est effectivement longue en bouche comme le souligne mon voisin du dessous. Superbe blanche , n?étant personnellement pas un immense fan de ces dernières.

Pours a nice frothy straw color. Aroma has spicy banana, clove, freshly baked wheat bread and a slightly herbal fruitiness. Flavor is great with sweet banana bread, maltyness and a slightly dry herbal finish. Nice and refreshing with loads of carbonation. This is a classic. Has everything a weisse should have.

Orange citrus, banana and bubblegum yeastiness. Mmmm. Creamy head. Drinks supremely

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 Robe blonde et trouble. La mousse se forme et tient bien.
Arômes puissants de bananes et de clou de girofle. Légères notes de vanille.
Carbonatation très fine.
Très longue en bouche.

Très bonne bière de blé.
Representa exatamente o que deve ser uma German Weizen. Encorpada, aromática, espumosa e saborosa.

Great example of german hefeweizen! Perfect presentation. One of the stablest heads I ever seen by hefeweizen. Bananas, cloves, fruitiness and some flower aromas make this beer special. Nice high carbonation and some fruity bitterness.

Greet beer, and a nice quantity. It comes with a beautiful glass. It is mild in taste, a greet start for a evening of beer. It has a thick layer of foam witch remains on the beer for quite some time. Beautiful german workmanship.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2015 Bottle 0.5.
Golden color. Medium sweetness in taste. Well balanced. Refreshing. Best hefeweizen I tried by now.
Drank it draft. As good as hefeweissbier can get. Good banana notes. Yeasty. Refreshing. I love it

Blonde assez pâle, voilée. Grosse mousse blanche assez persistante.
Arômatique fruitée banane et blé. Très grosse présence de phénols épicés clou de girofle. Bonne présence de levures.
En bouche pareil, avec une toute petite acidité qui donne une impression citron. Fin de bouche légèrement sucrée. 
Très bonne, balancée.
Une Hefenweizen "parfaite"
Wow another good beer from them, taste sweet with not alot of hops looks great goes down smooth even with a burnt mouth
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Wauv. Endnu en skøn German Hefeweizen. Jeg vil til at drikke flere øl at denne type.
A perfect Hefeweizen! Gorgeous aroma and taste of banana and cloves. A classic
Excelente cerveja. A melhor Weizen já degustada! Aromática e espuma cremosa. Equilibrada.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, mętne. Piana drobna, obfita, długa.
AROMAT: Wyraźny słodki aromat bananowy, goździki fest, w tle guma balonowa, brzoskwinia, akcenty chlebowe, bawarskie drożdże i troche przypraw.
SMAK: Wyraźne goździki, zbożowość, delikatna słodycz owocowa (banan, brzoskwinia, morela), przyjemna kwasowość. Wysycenie wysokie, goryczka niska.
OGÓLNIE: W aromacie jest to co być powinno: wyraźny banan-goździk i dodatki. W smaku orzeźwiające przez wysokie wysycenie, pełne w smaku, wyraźnie zaakcentowane różne smaki - piwo kompletne w swoim stylu.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2015 Bottle, 500mL. Home. Merci @Jaghana ! A brown orange earthy opaque beer ; very bubbly ; big white head with a good retention. Fruity aroma (lemon, banana+), herbs, clove. Intense aroma from the nose. Light to medium dry bitter, light sweet, acid note in the background. Medium body, dry smooth texture, good carbonation, bittersweet finish with cloves. Overall, really good weissbier : intense aroma (fruit, spice), drier than other weissbier I tasted for now.

Poured a hazy yellow orange colour with an inch of white head that left thin lacing. Aroma is of a sweet clove and yeast. Flavor is banana, clove, citrus, and wheat grains. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. Beautiful example of the style. I could drink this all day.
Good. Certainly one of the best representatives of style. Rich and slightly bitter
500ml Flasche. Bernsteinfarben und naturtrüb. Grosse, weisse Schaumkrone. Bananenaroma. Mittelsüss.

Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass on 12.18.14.

A: Banana and cloves. The cloves are sweet, not spicy. Wheat is there too.

A: 3 finger head. An orange yeast cloud extends 1 finger from the bottom of the glass.

T: Banana dominates. Orange, sweet cloves and wheat are subtle.

P: Creamy smooth. It floats on the tongue.

O: The banana flavor is like ripe banana. Thats first, then orange. On the back end, the cloves take over. There is such great balance here. Its a world class hef.
Over all delicious brew. A bit of clovy phenol flavors give a slight banana nut bread undertone.

Dourada com turbidez. Espuma branca, densa, persistente de boa formação. Aromas típicos do estilos: banana, cravo. Boa carbonatação. No paladar reflete os aromas mas com um picante no final. Refrescante.

Aromat słodkiego musu z brzoskwiń, bananów i jabłek, poza tym delikatne akcenty białego wina. Barwa złota, mętne. Piana wysoka, długa, średnio pęcherzykowa, bardzo ładnie zdobi szkło. W smaku świeżość pszenicy, cierpkość i słodycz czerwonej porzeczki, banany. Bardzo fajna goryczka. Niższe i przyjemniejsze nagazowanie, od większości weizenów. Bardzo pijalne.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours yellow to orange colour with a nice and stable head. Hazy, as weissbier should be. Aroma is classical cloves and ripe banana bouquet, pleasant and strong - One day after I tried the beer I could still sense the aroma from the empty bottle. So light and velvet in the taste, notes of banana and cloves, a bit sweet, a bit sour, fizzy. This one is top class weizen by all means.
Bottle, For me, the best Hefeweisen, love the banana smell, deep and soft flavor.

On tap at World of Beer. 
Very tasty Hefeweizen. I pick up more clove than banana with this particular Hefeweizen. Very good!

The aroma is full of wheat and yeast. The color is beautifully golden. The liquid is cloudy. The taste is full of wheat, yeast and little bit of banana. Nice slightly bitter taste. I like that a lot. Big fan of Weissbier!
It has STRONG aroma of banana, bubblegum, yeast, dough. Huge head that lingers. Creamy feel, very smooth, just fantastic.
A classic remains a classic. Looks very nice in the glass, with a clouded yellow color and nice rich head. Taste is sweet, with notes of bananas, orange and, of course, yeast. One of my favourites!
True Bavarian classic helles weizenbier. Clouded yellow colour and good foamlayer. Full mouth with malt and hints of vanilla, banana and yeast

This beer has hints of banana, and has a yeasty taste. Its taste is complex enough, although very smooth. Carbonation is good for this beer type. Very close to Paulaner hefe-weizen (could not decide which one I prefer).
Swirled and poured out yeast.

Would recommend this to all people who like wheat beer.

Keg at brewdog bar, Sheffield. Hazy orange with glossy white head. Aroma of orange, banana and spices. Taste is dry and sweet with a slight dry bitterness. Quite prickly and on the thin side. Not amazing but good.
Bottle from Booths in Ripon. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. The taste is wheaty with citrus notes. Quite a bit of spice too. Light, refreshing and very tasty. A great wheat beer.
Bottle. Pours offish yellow. Very high head, very carbonated. Smells of wheat and yeast. Taste is much the same with a hint of fruit. Paired with a gourmet sandwich on wheat bread, Nice

Pours offish yellow. Very high head, very carbonated. Smells of wheat and yeast. Taste is much the same with a hint of fruit. Nothing strong or offensive at all. A good beer to have and just relax with.
Had on tap and in bottles.
Banane, Nelke, Würzigkeit. Am Gaumen angenehm süßlich, bananig, würzig, leicht herb. Fein und süffig.

Bottle sample. Slightly hazy light golden with big off-white head. Aroma of wheat, grainy fruity (mostly banana, pear), yeasty, hay, somewhat floral. Sweet flavor, banana, floral, grainy, light sourness, sweetish finish. Light carbonation, medium-bodied.
THIS. This is what a Weiss beer should taste like. Favorite beer from the worlds oldest brewery.
UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 Excellente. Rien de plus à ajouter que les autres commentaires, tout y est dans cette weissbier.
My favourite hefeweizen. Hard to imagine one getting much better than this. The banana and clove notes are very subtle - perfect. wonderfully refreshing summer beer.

500 ml bottle @ En Aithria, Athens Greece. Color is light orange, hazy, with big white head. Aromas of banana, clove and yeast. Taste is sweet with yeast, banana and some clove and flower notes. Light body with medium to high carbonation.

Bottle pour. Cloudy golden with a large white creamy head. Ripe banana, dough, and yeast aroma. Creamy medium body. Ripe banana and wheat taste. Not bad, but not as good as many of the ratings suggest.
Klasyka gatunku weizenow. Smak od osadu dro?d?owego daje ciekawe doznania. Obfita, drobnop?cherzykowa piana. Barwa m?tna, jasna. Na pierwszym planie go?dziki, dalej banany. Idealne piwo na upa?y.

Tap at Weihenstephaner pub in Tbilisi (40 cl / 5.50 GEL). Opaque orange, kind of like home-made apple juice, head fluffy, white, very persistent. Nose is sour, wheaty and yeasty, faintly doughy, later on I also get some spicier notes. Could be my imagination fed by the German theme, but there also seems to be a bit of sauerkraut in here. Tastes mildly sour (as in light apple juice), wheaty... Begins with the sour notes, then settles at a grainier tone, finishing with a wheaty dryness. Id also say its somewhat watery on the palate. It is light on the tongue, but overall it has a certain thickness. No bitterness. Palate very smooth and soft, carbonation present, but not too much, body relatively light. Overall decent. (Or rather: a boring classic.)

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 Very typical appearance for a wheat beer. Some bananas in the smell and much more in the taste. A monkey would definitely drink this beer and the image you have in mind is comparable to the beer. That?s how good this is. (Iff you like the thought of a monkey drinking this beer)

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 0,5 ltr bottle. Pours a orange yellow coloured beer. Taste wise it?s fruity banana / orangy with a light beer taste. Real nice drink. It?s fresh it?s exciting! Definitely the friend you want while sitting on a terrace on a hot day. Yee-yaw!

Bottle. Amber loveliness mit a thick head. Tres smooth and crisp. Feels like silk. (Well, actually no it doesnt - it feels like beer. That was just a simile). Taste is understated but a nice subtle balance of tangy citrus and sweet malt. Superb, palate-cleansing example of the style. Jon likes this.
Bardzo dobry weizen. Co prawda aromat nie porywa, a piana nikła, ale nadrabia w smaku. Polecam!
es una rubia, pero rubia nublada con un aroma como de madera, y luego el sabor algo frutal
On tap at Loreley. Poured gold orange with thick white head. Aroma banana peel funk. Light carb med bod. Taste is mellow sweet banana creme.

lightly-clouded slightly dark yellow, one inch of eggshell-colored fuzzy foam that fades moderate-to-fast to a ring. Aroma of semi-sweet scone, some banana, banana bread, hay and brush, and a bit of raw sugar and cookie dough. Body is light, soft, watery, and frothy. No burn, but substantial carbonation. Flavor is a lemony, wheat tart bread with less sweetness and banana than the aroma would suggest. Light, grassy hops, no noticeable bitterness. Hay as it warms. A very nice hefe with an outstanding aroma.

Drink cold: 10-12°C
Eye: pours a dull golden to amber, honey-ish color with a big rather quickly dissipating head with lively carbonation.
Nose: ripe banana, floral/frutiy notes, fir, yeast, honey
Mouth: honey, wheat, bread, honey/honeydew
Palate: red clover/honeydew, fir, wheat, sour bread/dough, barley, hops
Overall: very nice and also complex Weizen. Not too sweet, not too malty or bitter, round. Smell/Nose almost blew me away. So sweet (only in the nose) but complex at the same time. taste/mouth unfortunately cant keep up though. High drinkability with a persistent tendency to one more ;-) i can only recommend this one
The head is good, the body blond cloudy. It smells aromatic-yeasty, fruity, melon-creamy,. Taste is refreshing, fruity, fresh fruity melon, bit peach, bit sweet, -hoppy, wheatmalty. Good.

Woaah, banana, clove, apricot, thyme and sex beer anybody? Well step right up ale and brew perverts. Its got the haze, the smell, the glorious mouth full of childhood sweets and tastes like something out of all known planetary systems. Its also got the ridiculously unpronounceable german name which I think is this: vee-hin-ess-sta-fan. If youve got a beer with 13 bloody letters in it, you better brew a good one. Its just lovely, lovely, lovely. Creamy with no bitterness, hop hunters chill out you crazy bean lickers, have a lovely breakfast beer and rip up a boiled liver sausage to go with it. Gggrrrrr, tonight Im German.
of all the German "HefeWeisse" beers i ever tasted, this one is closest to perfection. An absolute top scorer.

Aroma dat nauwelijks overtuigd. Prachtig goud/geel/troebel om te zien, met een nog mooiere schuimkraag. Smaak heerlijk zacht, drinkt zich soepel weg. Mooie geheel tussen carbonatie en algemene smaak. Heerlijke weizen!

Aroma: cloves, wheat, banana.
Appearance: hazy straw color, nice white head.
Taste: low bitterness, intensive cloves notes with herbs, banana, dry and slightly watery, refreshing.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, zesty finish.
Overall: Classical weizenbier, technically perfect, but Ive tried much better stuff.

Thick, cloudy pineapple yellow color with a full two fingers of creamy white head. 

Aroma is musty, horsey yeast. There is a hint of banana, but it is overwhelmed by a tartness, like a sugary lemon. The aroma absolutely requires agitation to get the full nose. It dances in the nasal cavity. The banana is more like a banana creme pie.

The flavor is musty, horsey malts; slightly sour yeast funk; tart citrus like lemon, blood orange and tangerine. There is a lemongrass finish, with an end of dried leaves. A touch of pink bubblegum.

The feel is very dry, and a little prickly. The remnants of the beer lingers for a while, leaving a tartness in the aftertaste. Every time I think that Im over hefeweizens, I try a great one. I will try to remember never to question Weihenstephaner again.
Pour from bottle. Banana clove. Pretty standard. I guess it is the standard.

Platz 1 bei ratebeer? Ganz ehrlich, für mich das schlechteste Weißbier das ich je getrunken habe - Geschmack, Farbe, Kohlensäure, Hopfen...Alles nix 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2015 Dal colore giallo carico, leggermente velato, e con una buona pulizia nel bicchiere, questa weizen mostra un bel cappello di schiuma molto fine e bianchissima, anche se leggermente troppo evanescente. Al naso è un tripudio di sentori fruttati (banana e pesca bianca, uva spina) e floreali (camomilla), su una base maltata non troppo in evidenza. Il corpo è nella media, con unottima carbonazione per una perfetta scorrevolezza. Al palato ritroviamo le note fruttate su una buona base maltata, con una lievissima acidità di fondo. Amaro erbaceo quasi impercettibile, persistenza buona e leggera sapidità finale, completano questa birra molto equilibrata.

In pieno stile Weiss, giallo ocra con una buona schiuma fine e croccante. Spezie, banane ed albicocche al naso, in bocca macedonia di banane, mele e albicocche, con un po di pepe e coriandolo. Buona carbonatazione e corpo medio. Al palato è liscia, beverina, come acqua. Buona birra , ma non è il mio stile.
Really well balanced with clove and banana notes and an elegant malty note. The best of these wheat beers that I have tried.

Poured from bottle, hazy pale gold with thick creamy head. Aroma mild with notes of banana, grass and herbs. Taste is refreshing, lots of CO2 carry notes of light toast, banana, grass and herbs. Dry-sweet finish.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 Ugjennomsiktig gul med medium skum. Aroma av banan og gjær. Stort sett samme i smaken. Noe tørr.
This weissbier is really refreshing Where some other wheat bear have a less nice aftertaste, I have no problem with this one. Drinks easily.

Light refreshing great fruity tasting wheat beer and easy to get hold of in supermarkets rather than having to online order

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from ASDA, Manchester. Slightly hazy pale orange coloured beer, with not much of a head. Has a light wheat aroma and taste, but feels understated in this and its yeast. Palatable, but a lesser morsel in its style.

Nice cloudy orange color with large fluffy white head. Bananas, fresh, yeasty, a bit tart. Great fruity-refreshing taste of bananas and more fruits I can?t quite tell. Smooth mouthfeel, super easy to drink. A very balanced and good Hefeweizen - I personally prefer Schneider, but Schneider is a bit less balanced and more distinct.

Pours hazy orange with a large thick foamy head that lasts long. Fruity aroma of citrus, banana, wheat, malts, yeasts, bit of vanilla. Lovely. Taste is pretty much in line with the aroma. Clear note of the banana, a nice lingering spicy bite as well. Sweet all along the line, but there is a nice mild bitterness that lies a bit underneath the sweetness. Nice mild aftertaste with that same mix between the malty/bready sweetness and the mild bitterness in the background with a nice yeasty kick. Absolutely lovely. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, and midlly carbonated. Nice, beautifully balanced and tasty Weizen, which I would love to drink everyday. True quality and absolutely a gem.
Hazy orange body with a thick white head. Aroma is fruity, banana, sweet citrus, wheat. Taste is sweet with a light bitter aftertaste. Slightly dry finish. Really refreshing.
Deep yellow color. That banana sourness on the nose, and a little thru the sip. Pretty thick stuff.

50 cl. Also on tap, @Speedy Pub in Monza. Pours a very large white creamy head, deep orange, cloudy and opaque colour. Smells smells fenolic/clove, fruity, grainy and vanilla. Tastes very fruity, esters, sweet spices, banana hints, wheat; nice and right amount of sweetness. Fizzy high carbonation, medium bodied, creamy texture. Extremly smooth, probably the most balanced and weiss out there, and maybe also the most drinkable too, aromonious, delicate, but still perceptible flavours. Seamless and very refined, but not the tastiest. Not sure at all to consider this the "best" weisse /hefewizen (see Ayinger and Schneider...)
Draft at trios. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head. The aroma has plenty of banana, medium clove. The taste has a ton of banana bread and a slight spiciness. Well done.

This highly rated beer got my hopes up far too high. Poured a murky straw with a massive off white frothy head, which is very appealing. Aroma was of wheat, citrus, herbs, and too much bubble gum. Tasted of bubble gum to the max, with wheat and herbs in the background. Had a refreshing bubble gum aftertaste that was tolerable. Also a big chewy mouth feel, but remained clean feeling too.

Couleur jaune trouble, petite mousse blanche. Bon nez de bananes, pailles. Gout malté, bananes, notes de levures, petite amertume en fin de bouche. Ca va, le minimum quon peux attendre dune hefeweizen.

Bottle poured into weizen glass. Hazy gold color with large, stable head. Looks great. Aroma of bananas, wheat, cloves, yeasts and hint of a bubblegum. Very pleasant. Taste has the same notes with bananas upfront yeasty finish. Mouthfeel is velvety, smooth. Great, classic weizen but I believe there are better ones.

I am led to believe this is a fine example of its style category but it didnt wow me. It is pretty, very much so, having a fine mouthfeel as well. Hazy orange straw with a huge foaming mountainous head, this is a chompable, chewy, medium carbonated palate pleaser. The scent is of wheat, yeast, bubblegum and is very candy sweet. What killed me was the taste...just pure bubblegum sweetness with a little wheat. I get the fact that Belgian yeast strains produce certain bubblegum/banana/fruity esters but when all you taste is liquid Hubba-Bubba, you need to draw the line.

A very good Weissbier from a brewery that has been producing this great beer long enough to have it right. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour hazy lemon gold with thick white head. Nose spicy clove, ester, light banana. Smells crisp. Taste big banana milkshake, clove, and hint of gum. Only faint grainy malt late palate. Much thicker mouth feel than expected.
Strong fruity yeast aroma. Bright yellow pour. Heavy head and carbonation. Subtle lemon zest with perfect sugar level. Finishes with a pleasant freshness

Reviewed On: (6/28/14): 


*Glassware: Weizen


*Serving: 11.2 oz (Make it 12 oz, Weihenstephaner!)


*Aroma: banana, clove, wheat, yeast


*Appearance: A very hazy pale gold with a fist of frothy off-white head. The head very slowly receded to two fingers. Light lace was left on the glass after the beer was finished. 


*Taste: Banana upfront, clove in the middle, and yeasty taste in the end.


*Palate: Light body, creamy mouthfeel, highly carbonated on the tongue. Finishes semi-dry and is quite refreshing.


*Overall: A fantastic hefeweizen from a brewery w/ a rich history and experience of brewing excellent quality beers.

Drunk in brewdog dundee. me and ma da had one each. i saw it there and got it cuz roda banged on about how it was her fav beer in the world and id never tried it before. pours a hazy golden wheat colour with a small head. aroma is typical bready banana sweetness. taste is similar. light and crisp. slightly sour. i was hoping for a big bubblegum and banana punch with the taste and i didnt get it. felt a little thin and watery. not bad but it wasnt all id hoped

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle served into its own Weizen glass.
A: Pours a hazy and pale yellow color forming a thick, creamy and huge white head. Excellent retention and some lacing formed and left in the glass
S: Traditional Weissbier in the nose: The mix of banana esters and clove. Strong notes of bread, pale malts, wheat and bready yeasts
T: Slightly sweet and very bread upfront. Notes of banana, clove, white bread, pale malts and wheat. Extremely smooth and balanced
M: Smooth and creamy body: Extremely balance. Medium carbonation. Bready aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Perfect German Weissbier
[ BA Review @ 12/23/2009 ]
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours hazy yellow, nose is banana and wheat, taste is banana, dry, yeasty.

0,5 l, flaske, 5,4 % ABV, købt i Netto på Roskildevej i Valby, 9. oktober 2014.
Ufiltreret gylden/honningfarvet hvedeøl med stor flot hvid tætboblende skumtop på 7-8 cm tykkelse (skænket i hvedeølglas). 
Aromaen er let syrlig af gær og citrus. Hø fornemmes også. 
Meget fin og mild, men karakteristisk smag. Øllet har let bitterhed, meget let sødme og Inter surt. Ikke svært at forstå, hvorfor denne øl er så populær bl.a. på Ørsted Ølbar. 
Som sædvane er denne hvedeøl vel karboneret på et medium eller lidt over niveau. Konsistensen er glat og øllet har en fin blød, men også perlende mundfølelse. Kroppen er let. Eftersmagen er fin og let bitter. 
En ganske fin hvedeøl, som man egentlig ikke kan finde noget manglende ved.
Well balanced. Great and foamy white head with a beautiful golden look. Not overly spiced. Easy drinking--a definite do again.

The smell is decent with an obvious banana and clove up front with a lemony zest and mild wheat finish. The taste is decent with a nice blend of orange/banana/lemon/clove and a hint of corriander on the back end. The mouthfeel is great as the beer is well carbonated and leaves a lingering mld bitterness around.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 Classic hefeweizen that does exactly what it should. Really lovely in both the aroma and the flavor.
16.9 FL OZ ($2.99) pretty good german beer. I liked this one, very refreshing and has a very smooth finish. check it out if you can find it.
Bottle at home, 4th October 14. Poured a huge yeasty head, aroma is yeast and banana, some spice. Taste is banana, yeast, pretty clean and drinkable
Bottle 0.5l from Spar supermarket Zadar Croatia.Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head.On the nose banana.Taste and aroma of citrus, yeast, banana.Perfect balanced and carbonated Weizen.
Uklar gyllen med et stort hvit skum. Aroma av hvete, frukt,krydder og banan. Smaker som aroma, men her kommer også sitrus inn i bildet
A very pleasant smell, yeasty and fresh. Pours with a lot of head. No use for words, Ill just go drink it. An excellent beer!
Jaune brumeux avec un grand tête blanc. Larôme des bananes, blé, clous de girofle. Beaucoup de corps avec du carbonisation haut. Très bon!

Bottle from drinkstore. Cloudy, bright yellow gold, huge fluffy laying brilliant white head. Looks great. Banana, spice and some mustiness in the aroma. Those aromas carry over to the flavour, banana, candi sugar and a dry, spicy note. Really clean, crisp flavour. Light, quite fizzy, really, really drinkable this.Clean, slightly sweet finish. Excellent.

Belo dourado opaco. Bela espuma cremosa, sem persistência, infelizmente, porque estava deliciosa.
Aroma abananado (existe isso?). Muito doce. Bastante adequado.
Doce, carbonatada, boa densidade. Cítrica na medida. Um "que" de amargo no retrogosto.

.5l bottle from Alko Seppälä 
Pours hazy yellow with high foamy head. Aroma is banana, yeast, malts, wheat and dried fruit notes. Flavor is mostly same. Well balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 This is one of those beers that few Germans really know, but which seem to be immensely popular abroad.
Bubblegum, plums and of course banana on the nose. The taste is rather weak for a Hefeweizen, some banana, some yeast, but not much.
Good, but overrated.
Cloudy and pale in color with a fluffy head. Smells like yeast and banana with a hint of clove. Very smooth and refreshing on the palate.

Murky yellow beer, short-livede white head, very lively carbonation. Lots of yeasty banana notes in the aroma but also plenty of herbs, cloves and bubblegum. The taste is dominated by yeasty banana and cloves, herbs, citrus and some malty sweetness. Long aftertaste. Lovely.
