Clear notes of banana and clove in aroma, the smell is sweet and a bit sour at the same time. Taste is the same as above however lacks a little punch, no real taste coming off the tounge.

Classic Hefeweizen from the worlds oldest operational brewery. This one has a fluffy head and deep orangey blonde colour, a soft and gentle character with the typical presence of banana and cloves aromas but in a subtle way, a soft and mellow mouthfeel and a somewhat dryish finish. Excellent example of the style.
Pours a cloudy gold with a big white fluffy head that has excellent retention. Nice lacing on the glass. Aoma of banana and yeast. Excellent weissbeer.

Bottle from supermarket. Golden, apricot colour with thick white cream head of good stability. Aroma of sweet oranges, maybe blackcurrant, some spice, some solvent ester character. Relatively low carbonation for the style supports good mouthfeel. Taste starts fruity (oranges again) and ends with spice and moderate bitterness. Enjoyed this.

On tap, pint at Smith Street Taps, Singapore. Lemon grass aroma. Medium sized head and a light amber colour. Light carbonation. Flavours of bananas, clove and a little citrus. Smooth to drink with a nice sweet finish. Pretty consistent wheat beer.

(50 cl bottle from local supermarket poured into Brøckhouse footed pilsner glass; BBD: February 27th 2015) This is not my style really but I recognise good quality when I see it. Pours a hazy golden with plenty of creamy white head and excessively lively carbonation. Good retention and lace. Aroma is banana, cloves, nutmeg, esters and buble gum in a rather well balanced composition. Oily texture, medium to light body and a short and sweet finish. Flavour has aroma notes and a mild sweetness. Okay but would probably prefer it to be served rather cold as Im not a big fan of the flavour.

This beer is a hazy goldent with a large white head, and the aroma blends wheat, yeast, banana and citrus. The taste is a nice mellow and mild sweetness blended with a slight sourness, and the finish, although not extremely long, is filled with wheat and banana flavor. The mouthfeel makes this beeer purely indulgent witht the thick body, average carbonation, and medium body.
Bottle pour, big white head, cloudy yellow body. Aroma bread, spice, banana, raisin. Flavor is fresh apple, peach, faint ginger, banana, do I taste smoke? Palate is light, carbonation lively.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy light amber with moderate head. Aromas of wheat, cloves, banana, and earth. Flavors are similar with more emphasis on fruit, smooth and subtle. Refreshing and easy to drink
Beautiful wheat beer. Sweet, fruity aroma and taste. Great mouth feeling with a lot of bubbles. Best beer on a beautiful day.

50cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow-amber with a Big, short lasting White head. Aroma contains both the Classic wheat flavors as well as some other grainy, caramel malty stuff. Banana and Tiny bit of hops. Taste is not overwhelmingly sweet nor sweet as these sometimes are. Still got that banana and grainy wheat flavor. Breadish finish. Medium-low Body and High carbonation. I kinda miss the smoothness, although it tastes decent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught 50 cl.
Deep hazy golden, with foamy white head. Fruity wheat aroma, hints of yeast. Malty wheat, banana and a hint of citrus. Smooth mouthfeel, with a good finish.
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, trigo, banana, ligeramente a levadura.

Bottled at Kaufland Knieliegen Karlsruhe. Excellent weizen. Cloves, banana, fruity sour on the nose. Beautifully cloudy hazy golden yellow with a bright white creamy head that lasts. Taste is sweet but excellently balanced with just enough bitterness. Maybe a little soft on the carbonation (it feels a little flat towards the latter half of a glass). Wonderful weizen surprisingly hard to find in Karlsruhe. :(

Aroma is clove, banana, sweet grains, yeast and light carbonation. Taste is quite sweet with a pale tartiness that matches exceptionally. Very well balanced and pleasant to drink. Appearance is a gold/orange cloudy body with a medium fluffy pearl head that retains very well.

Just the perfect example of a Hefeweizen. It really doesnt get much better than this. The appearance is spot on, hazy and pale yellow. Its got a perfect amount of yeasty banana and clove aroma and taste. Great carbonation that bites a little but doesnt go overboard.
Cloudy orange yellow beer with a thick White head. Full mouth feel with an even non-bitter flavor. Quick finish; no lingering taste on the palate. Yeasty pungent aroma. Extremely satisfying!
500ml bottle from Sainsburys. Pours a cloudy yellow with a frothy head. Aromas of banana, and yeast. Taste is very sweet bananas, and that nice grainy wheat.

The gold standard for a hefeweizen. Pours a pleasant yellow. Inviting wheaty aroma. Beautiful white head. Tastes of banana bread, yeast and a hint of citrus. Best of all, no detectable hop flavour. Almost a thousand years of tradition - cant get better.
Hazy yellow-golden colour. Creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, lemon peel. Slightly metallic. Light bitter aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Good beer.

Gold, clear yellow, white long lasting head, thick and tasty. Smells like rum from barrels, vanilla at first and wheat and fruits later. Sweetness of grains, bitterness of yeast. 
I really enjoyed in this one.

Oh my god, I loved this beer. Sometimes it's good to taste a hefeweizen the way it is supposed to be.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours an average frothy white head that mostly lasts. Body is hazy, sparkling yellow orange.
Aroma contains light malts (light bread, hay), light hops (orange, lime), light yeasts (dough, horse blanket) and banana, grape, apple, pineapple, vanilla, cola and spices.
flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet and finish is light acidic, light sweet and light bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
this is one of the best Hefeweizens. fruity, fresh, comlex and subtle. Just lovely.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, pale yellow-gold, big fluffy white head, excellent retention and lacing, good carbonation. Nose is banana, cloves, bubblegum and wheaty malt. Mouth is light-medium bodied, creamy wheat, understated banana, cloves, bread dough, bubblegum, hay, lemongrass. Classic example of the style.

what shall I say to one of the best beers in the world? Absolute perfection! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a slightly hazy medium amber with thick head and moderate lacing; smell is of umami, bananas, cloves, fruity pebbles; taste is alternatively umami, like soy sauce and fruity, with bananas and cloves coming through. There is a bready, wheaty backbone that ties the flavors together. Very smooth and low in bitterness, this beer is definitely on the sweet side. Mouthfeel is thick and chewy. Overall, the archetypal hefeweizen; this is the standard all other wheat beers are to be judged by.

Appearance: Pours a pale yellow with just over a finger of white head which fades gradually.
Aroma: Banana, yeast, bit of malt and hint of hops.
Flavours: Banana, hops, yeast, baking flower, cloves and a hint of citrus.
Mouthfeel: This beer has an incredibly smooth and creamy mouthfeel.
Overall: A nice Hefeweizen although I didnt go quite as crazy for it as everyone else. The banana and yeast notes are the most pronounced components with the aroma and flavour and I really liked this aspect.

Pours a murky yellow/golden colour with great carbonation and head.
Aroma is fresh citrus fruits with bitter and sour notes.
Strong citrus flavour, beautifully balanced bitter, sour and sweet notes. 
Goes down great.

500ml bottle, Tulip glass. Citrous and yeastyl aroma, Golden with cloudy appearance, Sweet fruit notes with mild malt, Medium body, Medium carbonation, White head, Nice balance between sweet and bitterness. Slight dray aftertaste

Oh, gracious this is tasty. Banana and yeast aroma, perfect sour sweetness... The platonic ideal of a Weiss beer. Cloudy amber pour and a light head. Softly carbonated and a malt-y, yeastiness that makes me sigh.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 A perfect example of a hefe weissbier. Wonderful aroma, outstanding head, cloudy. Just a touch of tartness and otherwise sweet and crisp. Perfect on a hot day. One of the best.
Draft. The standard for all other Hefes. Pours cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Nose is typical banana and grain. Taste is banana, clove and butter. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Great!
Light yellow color with good amount of white head, poured on tap. I taste a hint of banana and nice mellow taste.
Poured from the tap. Cloudy pale yellow with white head. A little wheat, light banana aroma, but strong banana taste.
Tap at Lazy Dog. Pours a hazy golden with some off white head. Aroma and taste of malts, a bit of spice, and some yeast.
Gulbrun tåkete med høyt kremete offwhite skum. Hvete, koreander og litt gjærlukt. Mild hvete, syrlig sitron og noe bitterhet i avslutningen.
Aroma is muted but predominantly yeasty. Pours a light, hazy golden yellow with decent white head. Taste is light with yeast and notes of banana and cloves. Very enjoyable and refreshing.

Notes from Family Hefe Tasting. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. One of the few with any lace. Aroma is spicey and fruity. Taste is spicey, tangy yeasty with fruit. 12.6 This was 2nd in the tasting, surprisingly being beaten by Paulaner.

From bottle. Pours an almost clear golden with a big white head. LIttle lacing. Aroma of wheat and bananas and other light fruits. Taste is the same, moderately sweet, delicious. Perfect carbonation. Medium mouthfeel. Excellent.

Aroma is wheaty. Lemony. Estery . 
Looks nice. White head. Slight hazy lemon color. 
Taste is smooth. Wheaty. Lemony. A really solid beer. 
Palate is smooth and goes down easier than other wheat beers. 

An amazing beer that anyone should like unless they crazy.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Light citrine, billowing and lasting white head, initialy clear, almost no lace, fine and steady bubbles. Assertive nose to start with, quickly dissipates. Very light body, moderately flavored, short palate. Low bitterness which makes it taste sweetish, what it is not. Refreshing, despite its low acidity. Fruity, mild banana flavor, cereal, assertive yeast. Rather weak in every sense, but pleasant enough, if you are thirsty. Goes very well with salty cheeses, such as ricotta salata or pecorino romano but also with a rich aged Gouda.
Bottle at some bar in Slovenia. Pours a cloudy yellow with a frothy white medium head. Aromas of banana, yeast, bread. Taste is very sweet bananas, corn-like earth-taste to it, smooth cream.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2015 Cloudy yellow with a massive velvety head. Smells like banana, bread, apricot, cloves. Taste is a little sweet, fruit, fresh bread, citrus. A little fizzy. Great beer.

Bought from the local bottle shop in Unterhaching. 500ml Bottle.

Pours a brilliant head, with a darker than standard weissbier coloured liquid. Smells of bananas and bread, but the taste is a little less full compared to its other Bavarian compatriots. Slightly metallic. Okay, but had better.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 12/26/2016 8/4/8/4/16 0,5l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, Bratislava, BBD: 24.10.2017 Pours deep cloudy golden liquid, big frothy white head, Aroma: loads of ripe banana, citrus, malty, slightly caramel, Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, light to medium sour, ripe banana, malty, slightly caramel, candy, clove, walnuts, slightly lemon peel, Palate: meidum body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, long bitter aftertaste, Overall: excellent hefeweizen, enjoyed, got all should be there (citrus, banana, clove, walnut). Complexe, tasty, easy drinking.  7/20/2014 8/4/7/4/16 From 0,5l bottle. BBD: 14.01.15 Pours deep cloudy straw to amber liquid, big frothy white head. Aroma: intensive banana, citrus, clove. Taste: ight to medium sweet, light bitter, light sour, banana, yeast, citrus, clove, Palate: medium body, creamy texture, average to lively carbonation, long bitter sweet finish. Overall: excellent Bavarian wheat, plenty of bananas, very drinkable and refreshing.
07.2014 (Butelka 0,5 litra) ZAKUP - Warszawa - Szklanka typu pinta - schlodzone

Aroma: wheat, yeast, light caramel, some bread malts. Appearance: hazy gold, big frothy white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets remain subtle, slightly expanding, malts, wheat again, relatively short finish, remains mild, slightly carbonated, medium body. Overall: great Hefeweizen, subtle yet complex in all aspects. Bottle from Waitrose, Canary Wharf.

Poured at tasting a hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is banana heavy with wheat and some light yeast. Body is light. Taste was banana, wheat, light malt, some hay, with a light fruit. Very refreshing.
Taste is mild, full of wheat, some light fruitiness (apricot?) slightly yeasty, not bitter with only muted hops. Very pleasant and tasty. Pairs well with white cheese, salmon or nuts.

Pours a hazy yellow gold with a thick foamy white head. Aroma is banana, spice, wheat, grain, hay, sweet. Taste is wheat and hay, banana, spice, butter, yeast. Such a fantastically drinkable beer, extremely light yet flavorful, perfect wheat beer for the summer.

This is hands down my favorite beer of all time! The aroma and taste tops off the charts. Whenever this beer is available at bars, I always ask for one. A+ 5 star.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly hazy yellow. Foamy anf persistent white head. Classic, but moderate, weissbier aroma, with bananas and tropical fruits. Similar taste. High drinkability, and refreshing for being a weissbier.

Tap. Cloudy, yellow with a small white head. Aroma has banana, yeast and grain. 

Tate has banana, butter and some hay. A really light wheat beer with a strong banana overtone. Mouthfeel is smooth with a nice aftertaste. An exemplary wheat beer.

Cloudy color. Smell has hay ad yeast. Taste has some herbs and yeast, not much of banana. Good but not outstanding

Bottle at Fado. Not normally my style - but beats all the other Hefeweiss beers I have had. Hazy blonde gold pour with some delicate white foam. Big wheat - only very light toasted notes, but still reads as fuller than one would expect. Green banana. Orange pips. Marshmallows. Has the full flavor of plumped up wheat berries. Tastes like the real thing. Nicely balanced and refreshing.

Bottle, cant remember where from. Quite a light yellowish colour, thick white head. This is a well balanced quaffable wheat beer. A little sweet, fruity, appe, banana, clove spice, modest bitter finish. All sounds like any other weizen which is I guess true and this doesnt challenge the tastebuds with extremity. However, it is perfectly balanced and is I think just nice. I normally prefer my weizens a bit more malty as the lighter ones can feel overly thin and not refreshing, but this does the job extremely well.

I cant believe I havent rated this one yet... starts with the traditional aroma of wheat, with banana and clove. Pours a hazy light straw with a huge white head. Light wheat, paired with more banana notes. Light bodied, nice and crisp. A great beer to have on a hot summer day.
Nose is pleasingly yeasty with slight clove and coriander. Taste is yeast, bread, slight banana, a little peach in the finish. The finish is short, its a wll balanced drink.

Hófehér, összefüggő, puha habpaplan telepszik rá félig átlátszó, sápadt testére, miközben mikroszkopikus méretű buborékok selymesítik tökéletes állagát. Illata rendkívül gazdag, kóstolás előtt percekig elidőzhetünk az aromák kavalkádjában, melyet gyümölcsös, selyemcukros, édeskés élesztős összetevők adnak. Íze nemkülönben összetett, üdítő és kiadós, fantasztikusan kiforrott és élettel teli, egyszerre gabonás és gyümölcsös, mindemellett selymesen krémes. Igazi csemege, az egyik legjobb búzasör, amit valaha kóstoltam.
Bottle @ home 20140703. Pale and cloudy, huge head with excellent head retention. Aroma is clove, citrus, banana, dough. Taste is similar. Very refreshing. You get a lot for the money.
@ Röhällavägen. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget (20:-). Wheaty and a bit fruity with yeasty and acidic notes, banana, medium body. The finish is dry with some bitterness and wheaty notes.
Orange colored beer with a good white head. Taste is Fruity, cirtrus. A good weizen.

0.5L bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a big, frothy white head. Aroma is classic weiss with banana and clove. Initial flavor is pleasantly skunky, quickly giving way to a nice malt sweetness followed by banana and citrus. A relatively long, skunky / sour linger that is typical of this style. Active carbonation with a cream mouthfeel and medium-full body. This is a prototypical Bavarian weissbier, and definitely one of my favorites.

50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is golden pale and very cloudy, with a generous, creamy and consistent head. Medium to high carbonation, medium body. Complex aromas for a weissbier, beyond the traditional aroma of banana and clove, there is slightly citrus peel kind tangerine, wheat bread and yeast. Fresh taste, not too sweet and almost no bitterness. A really well balanced beer. I dare say that up to now has been the best weissbier I ever drank!

Bottle from Waitrose. Poured a perfect cloudy deep orange, with a large, thick white head. Excellent aroma, with all the best hef smells at the fore; banana, cloves, orange peal, peaches and yeast esters. Slight citrus bite in the flavour, lots of fruits with some wheat. Finish is bready malt, coriander and straw. Probably my favourite hef.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 12 oz bottle. Pours hazy gold with a very thick white bubbly head. Delicate citrus aroma, bananas, apricots, lemon. Yeasty, sweet bread, bananas.  Mild, yet uncannily spicy. Excellent carbonation.
@Nedre Mölla 25/6-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Yeast, banana. Taste: Dito + some wheat and sweetness. Body is medium, the finish has some sweet notes and taste of banana.

The body is cloudy and has an old gold or dark golden color with a tall white head on top. The head is thick and foamy, long lasting and makes spotty lacing on the glass. The nose is sweet and full of fruity yeast with notes of banana, bubble gum and wheat malt. There are bready and yeast flavors up front with banana notes and a touch of clove coming through. The finish has pleasant tangy wheat and very mild hop bitterness which give it some dryness. The palate has a refreshing, easy drinking medium body with nice active carbonation and a lively crisp texture.
500 ml bottle from a local shop in Guilin Lu, Changchun. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a good head head. Les harsh than most weiss Ive had. Yeasty with a little sweetness and spice. Great stuff.
Bottle. Pours a hazy slightly orange beer. Aromas of cloves, wheat, yeast and citrus. Taste is fresh, citrus and spicy. A really good balanced beer.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a huge white head. Nose is bread and yeast with spice and banana supporting. Mild sweet with a modest level of spice supporting with cloves dominant. Medium creamy mouth feel with average carbonation. Excellent.

P: Very cloudy, orange/dim yellow with a huge thick white head. S: Spices, hint of herbs, bananas, wheat, and some vanilla cream. T: Some spices, wheat and bananas. M: Soft and highly carbonated. O: Pretty awsome and easy to drink.

Tap at Brewdog, Nottingham. Turned to this by way of a "freshener", after a big day on the ale! From what I can read of my notes, its cloudy with a thin white head. Spicy. Nutmeg. Clove and banana. Taste is spicy dry. Lively palate. Vague...

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy blond beer with white reflection, small carbonation and big light white foam. Smell: bread and wheat, cereals with some grassy notes. Taste: amazing malty wheat taste. Good balance !! Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: nice balance some watery taste.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2014 I had the distinct pleasure of enjoying several pints of this on draft from various beachside bars in Tel Aviv. Just relaxing in the Mediterranean sun while sipping on this smooth and flavorful hefeweizen was a sublime experience. Pours a solid hazy golden orange with ridiculously intense lacing, aroma is sweet and complex with orange and banana notes. Flavor is perfect for the style, yeasty banana and citrusy flavors with a wheaty/malty base. Flavor intensity was refreshing, not overpowering, and allowed a range of spices and other accent flavors to show through. Medium-bodied and fresh tasting. Without a doubt the best authentic hefeweizen I have ever encountered. I'm not a huge fan of the style but I can tell objectively this is a superior example.
This is an outstanding hefeweizen. Classic banana notes, great smooth yeast flavour, decent head, sweet, mild and classic german complexity. I could drink loads of this on a hot evening. Brilliant.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Bready, fruity aroma of wheat and yeast, bit of banana in there. Taste is wheat, yeast, fruity, bit of banana. Nice.
Best Weiss bier I ever tasted!! Worths every cent! Cant find something negative here..

Flaska från SB. 
Dimmig lätt gyllene vätska ett stort vitt skum som håller sig länge. 
Kryddnejlika, jäst och banandofter. 
Inte så stor i smaken, men dofterna återkommer på tungan. En fin sötma och mycket lätt beska dröjer sig kvar. 
Nice weiss!
Bottle. Strong clove aroma, but low aroma of banana. Cloudy, pale color. Head is short-lasting. Refreshing and low bitterness. Moderately good.

Tap.Great banana aroma,clove in the flavor. 
light sweetness,lightbitterness in the end.Very refreshing.On the top of its genre

Bottle. Pale colour, cloudy, rocky head that does not last long and shows poor lacing. Aroma dominated by banana, with a little bit of clove and wheat. Light bitterness, but higher than average for a hefeweizen. Lively carbonation, thin feel. Good beer, but I wish it had more body and more banana.
Dit is een goed witbier. Geen uitgesproken smaak, duidelijk tarwe. Lichte schuimkraag en troebel. Top bij heet weer.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought near Bamberg. Very refreshing wheat beer full of flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Cloudy, golden, frothy, white foam, medium body, average carbonation, medium bitterness, light sweetness, & bitter finish.

Pours with an abundant 3 finger head, hazy pale golden, and brisk carbonation. Plenty of sweet smells such as that ripe banana in aroma. Clove in the flavour - some of the most marked Ive tried. Very luxurious on the palate. A touch of acidity to make it mouthwatering.

Brown/orange hazy beer with a silky and beautiful foamy white head. Lots of fresh citrus with some yeast on the nose. Sweet, lots of citrus, crispy carbonation, thin to medium body, very good drinkability. Wow this is so good. An excellent beer for a hot sunny day. Kills your thirst and satisfies your taste buds.

500 ml bottle. Pours a deep golden colour with a huge, frothy, long lasting white head. Sweet aroma of banana, wheat, yeast and some spice. Sweet flavour of banana, spice, fruity yeast and a dry wheat finish. Very smooth. Medium body with oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent and refreshing. My favorite hefe.

Bottle. Pours in a hazy straw yellow, big foamy, white head. Aromas are a bit banana and yeast. Taste is light, sweet. Carbonation is average, texture very watery, not much after taste, a bit malt. 

I expected a bit more from this beer, it´s a typically bavarian Weißbier, but not the best one.

Pours a beautiful straw color and smells wonderfully of cloves and bananas. The taste is light and ever so slightly sweet but perfectly balanced with the spiciness of the yeast. Paired with a grilled white sausage outside on a wonderful MI summer evening! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy straw colour with big frothy white head. Light, watery body with slightly creamy feel in the mouth. Not much aroma and subtle tastes of banana, honey, clove and other spices. I though Id like this more - think Ive got too used to the stronger wheat beers which pack more of the flavour -but still very drinkable.

50cl shared bottle @ home from Mitra. Clear to hazy pale color, medium white head which quite quickly disappears. Aroma light citrus, apple, fruits and floral in the nose, flavor is the same and light cereal, limonade, green tea. Taste medium sweetness, hint of bitterness, slightly acidic. Light body, creamy texture, average carbonation, refreshing light sweet finish. Delicious light beer, rather a soda than a beer. I miss the bitterness so much, so its not my style. Might be good with a meal.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 BB 14.12.16. Poured a cloudy pale golden colour with a two- to three-finger bright white frothy head that retained very well before diminishing slowly to a cap that laced OK. Aroma of sweet banana with a hint of cloves. Tastes nicely of sweet banana followed by strong cloves; spice and wheat comes through as it warms. Light body. Crisp and smooth with a nice not too sweet and not too spicy finish.
As others have said, cloves and banana feature heavily in the aroma. Taste wise it is equally sweet and yeasty bitter. A really nice beer!
Thick white head, straw-hay-sunny colour. Mild banannish aromas and taste. Mild body. A bit spicy. Great beer. A bit sweeter than I remember. Still perfect balance.

Típica cervesa de blat, aromes a pa i a plàtan, un pel àcida.
Típica cerveza de trigo, aromas a pan y a plátano, un poco ácida.

Bouteille de 500 ml dégustée au Pub Italia à Ottawa le 22 mars 2010 au coût de $7.75. Bière dorée foncée trouble. Mousse assez, col épais, crémeux et très persistant. Très peu effervescente, bulles moyennes. Odeur de banane (blé) marquée, dépices (clou de girofle) et de levure. Très douce, peu sucrée, peu amère. Goût de blé bien présent mais pas marqué. Manque un peu de corps, un peu fade malgré saveur blé/épices.

Bottle, 500 ml. Pours cloudy light-ish amber with around a finger of creamy white head. Good head retention and a lot of lacing going on. Biscuit malt base on the nose is joined by notes of orange, honey, banana and some sort of cream. Bread and biscuity (think Jacobs cream crackers or some sort of pretzel) dominate the taste. Definitely not one for when refreshment is the priority. Not really getting much else other than maybe a little bit of honey or banana. Carbonation is fairly potent and mouth feel is quite dry. Curiously enough there seems to be virtually no taste on the back end (i.e. back of the tounge and the throat) and certainly not any major bitterness to speak of. This is a style Im largely unfamiliar with so I dont know if its a trademark of the style or not, but its odd to me nonetheless. Goes great with strong cheese (as do aforementioned cream crackers).

Bière légère aux arômes typiques de banane et levure. Léger manque de corps et une finale peu soutenue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy golden yellow color with a persistent white head. Strong banana and yeast aroma, and a very thick layer of foam, and persistent. In the mouth we find banana and yeast. Very balanced and sweet aftertaste.

Draft @ BrewDog Edinburgh.
Aroma of wheat, banana. Haze yellow, greenish? Virtually no head lasting. 
Taste of wheat sweetness, light bitterness if any. 
Finish is sweet. Watery texture. Average carbonation.
Pours a hazy apricot with 2 fingers of white head. Smells like sugar cookies and banana. Taste is banana and bubble gum with some wheat and tang. Very smooth mouth feel. Impressive!
On draft. Murky orange color with one finger head. Aroma of banana and cloves. Banana and bubblegum taste. Really smooth. A slight tangy finish. Really like this beer on a warm day.

This certainly looks proper - hazy orange body with a huge head that lasts almost as long as the beer does. Banana gum yeast byproducts on the nose. Lovely wheat tang on the tongue along with more intense banana that fades to a spicy clove aftertaste. Soft and smooth mouthfeel. Basically the benchmark for hefeweizens.
Cloudy gold/honey coloured body with tall white head. Slight bitterness and banana or raisin taste. Strong wheat, herbal scent and a soft finish.

Tap at The Oak. Pours a very cloudy yellow-orange color with a small foamy head that fades normally and leaves long lacing. Aromas are banana muffins, light bubblegum, and clove. Taste like creamy bananas and clove. Yeasty bubblegum in the finish. Medium to thick body with an ultra smooth creamy mouthfeel. I dont drink hefes very often but this is one Id go back to for sure.

Finally trying to get through some of the classics. Nice white head on a pale yellow hazy pour. Wheat and slightly yeasty nose. Refreshing taste, lots of yeast and just a hint of a phenolic of some sort in the background.

Bottle. Pours a really pretty glowing, hazy gold/straw with a thick and solid white head. Aroma is prototypical bubblegum, clove, banana and wheat. Taste dominated by bubblegum, clove and toasted wheat with a hint of burnt sugar in the finish. Nice pillowy mouthfeel with strong carb. Pretty perfect demonstration of the style.

Hazy yellow with medium sized white head. Common aromas of wheat, yeast, banana, cloves and Coriander but so nicely in balance. Very inviting. Wow, great and full taste with all formentioned ingredients. Again lovely balance! Medium to full bodied with average carbo. Like it, love it, want some more of it! Tastes even better than it smells if thats even possible!

With it's thick white head and poured into the twisted weizenglass this looks beautiful. The smell has a hint of banana and vanilla. The taste is soft and creamy, but o so fresh. Perfect for a hot, sunny day. This is my absolute favorite hefeweizen!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 There is a reason thus is 1. Solid banannas Cloce cloudy good mouth feel really lingering after taste the first sip makes you want to see the bottom of the mug
Dunkel lys gyllen farve med mye lyst skum som sitter. Lukt av lys malt, banan, gjær og kydder. Smak av lys malt, banan, gjær og krydder. Godt og leskende. Vinmonopolet.
Duft av hvete, sitron og høy. Dunkel lys gulbrun farge. Tynt dekkende hvitt skum, heng langs kant. Smak av hvete og en anesle sitron.

Bottle from Maltitude. This beer was recommended to me and Im very glad I took their advice! Pours hazy orange body with a fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, and sour dough. Tastes of wheat and yeast, with a dryness at the end. Very good wheat beer.
Pours a nice cloudy orange with white head. Citrus, raw wheat, and some coriander spice like notes on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a cracked wheat note.

Pours an evenly hazy orange body with a huge, fluffy and well-lasting white head. A cascade of foam rises on the surface and feeds the head. Nose has loads of cloves. banana, yeast and sour dough. Taste has nice balance between sweetness and a mild tart sourness, finishing in a crisp dryness. Carbonation is heavy and the mouthfeel is nicely rich, avoiding the watery palate that often follow this style. This is a superbly balanced wheat with all good aspects of the style present.
Hazy, yeasty smell. Nutty taste and some hints of spice. Good head and lacing. Smooth mouthfeel.
2014.05 - Gentse Biervereniging - proefavond bieren met tarwe - goudkleurig bier, mooi wit schuim - neus : gist, tarwe, beetje het putje - smaak : tarwe en gist

Wonderful aroma of banana and cloves. Nice cloudy appearance. The taste is very "fresh" with a nice fruitiness. Low bitterness and a short aftertaste. The carbonation is just right.

Ive yet to come across a better weissbier.

0,5 l bottle. Pale yellow and unclear in the glass. Fine white head. Dry ripe banana on the nose. Starts more with wheat, caramell and yeast, light herb chewing gum in the background. Decent sweetness, nearby watery. Not bad but maybe a little bit overrated.
Yellow towards orange, nice white head. Strong banana and a hint of dusty toffee. Sweet malt, toffee banana with really mild metallic bitterness in the aftertaste. High in carbon watery.

On draught in Frankfurt. Has been one of my favorite Weizen for a long time. Very good example of the style. More subtle and complex than many others, not simply a wheat and banana monster. Yeasty nose. Creamy wheat taste, a bit of citrus. Great mouthfeel.

My favorite for this style based on carbonation not excessive as some others 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy yellow in colour with a typical large perfectly white head. Clean aroma with subtle clove and yeast aromas. Great mouthfeel, tastes clean and smooth very slight spice and a little more clove. Fantastic.
Weissbierin güzel örneklerinden biri daha.Sakın çok soğuk içmeyin,gaz oranı çok fazla oluyor.

Nice; solid. Strong banana notes, which I like in this style. Strong ABV, which again is good. Drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Weihenstephaner from a bottle
Very good head over a hazy golden body.
Banana and clove in the aroma as expected, but subdued and less strong than the bready malts. Also some lemon.
Mildly tart.

Banana and dough in the aroma. Hazy yellow. Pretty sweet taste and one can actually taste the wheat there is some citrus present as well. Medium body, lively carbonation, frothy texture. Overall a pretty nice hefeweizen but Id like more complexity
Excels in subtleties. No big bold surprising flavors. A perfect hefe weisse. A nice bready wheat and yeast flavor with hints of banana and citrus. Soft prickly carbonation.
Bottle. Wheat, bread, banana, clove on the nose. Golden hazy color with a firm white head. Slightly sweet with a lot of carbonation. A true thirst quentcher & a great weissbier.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed while watching that Fargo spinoff show which is pretty great. Appearance is a cloudy gold with a moderate white head. Aroma of light clove and banana. Taste goes down decently. Just decent.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a nice, thick, frothy white head. Aroma is peanuts, banana, dough, baking spices. Taste is delicious, sweet ripe bananas, bready malts, sugar cookie, a hint of spice throughout. Delicious beer. This has to be the best Hefe Weissbier that Ive had to date.

A weizen like a weizen should be. The king of the wweizenbeer (if you ask me). Beatifull hazy golden color with a incredible firm bright white head that lasts forever. Yeast, wheat, banana, citrus and a slight spicy taste. Beautiful. Best beer to drink on a thirsty day. Not spectaculair, but exactly as it should be, this beer feels perfectly balanced.
Ótima cerveja, 5,4% vol., muito equilibrada, espuma densa, cor dourada, cerveja com aroma suave, medianamente lupulada, encorpada, agrada a maioria dos paladares, altamente recomendável.
Cloudy. Banana and a light sourness. The definition of Hefeweizen. Enough said.
Light Golden body with a nice white longlasting head. Aroma of wheat, banana and citrus. Good sweet/sour taste with a note of citrus, spice and fruit. Long lingering aftertaste. A good weissbeer.
Hazy yellow appearance with medium head. Balanced banana and bread aromas, some sweetness and fruity on the mouth. Well rounded. Pretty much the best Hefeweizen around.
Tap at Library Alehouse in Santa Monica. Yellow pour, no head. No lacing either. Smelled like bananas and citrus. Taste is sweet, citrus. Overall good stuff.
Korngul tåkete med tykt hvitt skum som ligger lenge. . Lukter banan, hvete og gjær. Sprudlende munnfølelse, smaker syrlig og godt, kanskje noe pepper i ettersmaken.

Lys brungul farge med høyt hvitt skum som blir liggende. Lukter hvete og tydelig banan. Smaker syrlig og søtt og noe krydder. Ganske livlig i munnfølelse. God bittersøt i ettersmak. Absolutt en god hveteøl.
Bottle, pours kind a straw yellow with a white head, sweet flavor of bananas, yeast, and caramel, very slight bitter, very good and easy to drink.
Very balanced hefeweizen, a masterpiece in its genre. The classic banana flavor. Magnificent session beer.
Cloudy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, & bananas; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, clove, and some citrus, Very nicely balanced; Excellent classic hefeweizen.

0,5l bottle. Hazy golden color with white head and nice lacing on glass. Aroma is banana, wheat and cloves. Taste is a little bit sweet, with banana, spices and wheat. Medium body. Overall its really great beer, very tasty and balanced.
From bottle. Cloudy yellow in glass. Good wit head. Inviting noise. Yeasty. Some pepper. Taste is bubblegum. Soft what. Some citrus zest. Effervescent mouth field. To of class.
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 Bottle 0.5 l. Medium body, light carbonation and big creamy head. Aroma of banana and hay. Liquid is dirty pale golden and cloudy. Nice one.
Bottle into an ale glass. Pour is a haze yellow orange with a thick head. Taste is pure summer wheat grass with a slight bitterness. Aroma is light grass and sweet citrus. Finish is crisp.

500 ml bottle, compared back to back with 3 other top rated hefes. Pours cloudy orange with large creamy and very long lasting white head.
Aroma is cloves and light banana, sweet, a bit acidic.
Taste hits you immediately, its much like the aroma with a lightly bitter finish, very well balanced. Light to medium body, with softer carbonation.
Une superbe bière allemande ! Belle couleur pâle et un peu trouble. A la pression ou en bouteille, une valeur sûre de la bière blanche (type allemande).

The best Hefeweisen from the worlds oldest brewery. With a golden orange appearance, this unfiltered beer changed my opinion on wheat beers. With a light banana aroma/taste with even a hint of mango, it doesnt get any better than this brew for a summer beverage.
Orange color with huge off white head. Aroma is huge. Cloves and bananas. Taste is same as aroma. Cloves, bananas. Perfectly balanced. Medium creamy body! Classic example of style! Perfect beer!

Gyllene gul, grumlig, kraftigt vitt skum. Banan, jäst, malt, sötma. En bra veteöl.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy yellow with white head. Malts, banana, yeast. Sweet, with slight sour. Easy drink, lovely weizen.

On tap. Pours a cloudy yellow color with big white head. Fresh fruity aroma. Taste of malt, bread, yeast, spices and lots of lighter fruits. Medium body and carbonation. Sweet with a slightly dry aftertaste. Crisp and drinkable.

Cloudy yellow color, big white head. Sweet, banana nose. Fizzy carbonation and medium body. Aroma is banana. Long sweet finish. A little bit more watery and less aroma than Weihenstephaner Vitus, but still very good. (Vrutak 0,5l bottle)
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 Cloudy golden color, big white creamy head. Medium to full body, average carbonation. Aroma is wheat, banana, yeast. Medium sweet taste. Good German Hefe.

Not that much of a head, even though there is a strong feel on the tongue from the carbonation. Pretty distinct smell and especially taste of spice - cinnamon or clove. Not much of the banana flavors of some hefeweizen. Overall a quite good beer. Good with mild foods as the flavor is mild and a bit subtle (especially to us lovers of American craft beers).

Taste from bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with white head. Nice yeasty aroma, banana, wheat and spices. Taste is fairly sweet with minimal bitterness. Tastes of grains, yeast, banana. Medium bodied. Very good smooth tasting Hefe. Would love to try this beer fresh at the brewery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In a take-away from the Beer Growler in Savannah. Man does Ontario need places like this, stupid LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden-amber with white fully head. Smells of yeast, grain. Tastes of banana, a little bubblegum, and wheat. Some odd of flavours on the finish though, wonder how common that is for this beer.

Très bonne bière , mérite dêtre bue . 
Pour moi , la meilleure hefe weissbier , rappelle vraiment lAllemagne une fois en bouche .
Mérite sa renommée , a conseiller a tout amateur de heffe weissbier .

Bottle. Bright gold with a fluffy white head. Aromas of banana, clove spice, and yeast. The taste follows and adds honey and a hint of apple juice. Light mouthfeel for the style. I really enjoyed this one, probably the best of this style I've had to date. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Goudkleur, troebel, met dikke laag schuim. Aroma van banaan en hop. Smaakt prima, beetje zoet en fris. Lekker.
CLoudy light gold pour with a fluffy white head. Spicy, bananas, yeasty aroma. Tastes spicy, slightly sweet, a little sour, yeasty.

On tap at the wharf. Hazy golden with a thick drippy off white head. Aroma of Bananas, spice and yeast. Amazing! Flavour is very mild and wheat spicy. And totally underwhelming. I caught a hint of fish on the first sip. Body is firmly medium. Finish is banana bread and a little thick.

Really lovely interpretation of the style. Normal aromas for a hefeweissbier, banana, cloves, bubblegum, but its the appearance that makes this beer something special. Cloudy, almost bright as if its being lit from behind, gorgeous, really mouthwatering. Palate is nice and full, doesnt strip the palate like some other hefe. Nice

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 Had great expectations about this one.
Pours a quite hazy straw coloerd glass. There is about two fingers of weak white head that quickly settles to only a lacing.
The aroma is grainy (wheat), but quite mild. Also slighty yeast and alcohol aroma.
The taste starts with sweet grains, the body is bitter and it has a slightly stale feel. There is a bitter finish.
Its a nice beer, but... not really what I expected.

Muy buena cerveza de trigo. Buena espuma. Aroma típico a plátano y clavo. En boca notas de gominola. Intenso sabor con final seco. Muy agradable

Filip
Equilibrado no aroma e sabor. Aroma mais fraco, mas típico, banana, cravo, acho q pq tava bem gelada. Sabor tipico e sem realçar um dos sabores, muito equilibrada. A melhor do estilo que ja tomei.

Cloudy yellow beer with little-to-none head, which is quite strange for a weissbeer. Aroma has bananas, citrus, wheat and yeast. Taste is surprisingly mild, with wheat and yeast. Some citrus flavors are there in the background. Pretty light body and high carbonation. Interestingly this wasnt that good as I thought. Still enjoyable weizen.
Awesome hefe, probably my favorite of this style. $3.29 a 500mL bottle. Cloudy and yeasty for all that German brewed goodness
golden with white head. Aroma is sweet, banana, esters, wheaty, yeasty and cloves. Flavor sweet and estery. Some banana . Sweet and light acidic finish. Nice wefe
Poured from a bottle - Cloudy light yellow with a big white head. Banana aroma. A little bit of hay. Its a little more sour than I expected it to be. I wish I had a Weisswurst for this to wash down.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours cloudy yellowy, turns a bit darker when the yeast comes in. Thick head. Smell of very very light banana and some clove, sticky wheat.. Taste semi dry with a bit of wet hay and banana clove, some doughyness. Light mouthfeel, extremely small bubbles.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Color amarillo naranja, forma mucha espuma blanca que perdura, aromas muy frutales, plátano, manzana y limón, en boca es refrescante con sabor a cítricos ,cuerpo y carbónico medios con equilibrado amargor y pos gusto muy agradable y largo.
Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, minimale Würzigkeit.
Smells like sweet-tarts. Flavour is yeast, banana, grains. Slight bitter overtone. Crisp, dry mouthfeel. Avoids most of the cloying aftertaste that characterizes a typical hefe.
Cloudy pour. Medium body, decent carbonation, sticky texture yet smooth. Yeast, citrus, banana, clove, pine, hop, malt. A lot going on. Excellent.

16.9 oz. bottle thanks to Emily. Appearance: Three fingers of white head, dissipates at a relatively quick rate, straw color, cloudy, poor lacing. Aroma: very light roast, citrusy on the palate, three fngers white head, wheat, belgian yeast, caramel, floral, leather. Palate: light body, oilly texture, average carbonation, brief finish. Taste: sweet with a little bit of tart. Overall, very nice, easy to drink, refreshing

Best hefe I've had - not my style but a still loved it- would recommend to anyone

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Woah. This might be the new champion of wheat beers. There is so much banana creaminess it threatens to over power but then the grain and the hops cut through with amazing subtlety. Smells fresh and rich, pours a very cloudy light gold with a solid head. Woah.

Cloudy golden light straw colored liquid with a huge white head that stays for a long time. Fruity aromas of bananas, caramel, bread and cloves. Taste is medium heavy sweet and medium to low in bitterness. Lively carbonation and medium bodied.
Fruity with classic wheat-aromas, some orange, apricot and banana. Slightly cloudy.
Cloudy gold beer with a nice weizen head. Lots of weizen notes in the aroma: banana, clove, vanilla. Very fruity taste with medium body. Refreshing and very nice.
Pra mim uma das melhores representantes do estilo. Cerveja clássica alemã, coloração amarelo ouro, turva, notas de cravo e banana, amargor equilibrado.
Realy freash taste and fruty. wery tastefull especially in hot summer days, goes perfectly with a wiener snittzel

Bottle  Cloudy pale orangey gold. Malty; wheat malts. Spicy; cloves, nutmeg, vanilla and ?cinnamon?. Yeasty. Fruity; bananas, oranges. Lively carbonation. Creamy wheaty malts, spices, mildly sour fruits and gentle hops. Refreshing and smooth. Bittersweet, fairly dry. Very drinkable! Very good! Lovely Hefeweizen!
Huge white head. Cloudy orange colour. Wonderful yeasty aroma with vanilla notes. Fruity yeast taste and a lasting, sparkly wheat palate. The perfect beer!

light honey/golden cloudy colour. Aroma is strong and classic, banana, cloves, yeasty esters and a hint of something apple like. It is a fairly tight beer with a decent amount of carbonation. Classic, medium bodied.
This is the best wheat beer out there! Everything a wheat beer should be! Amazingly fruity aroma, perfect levels of carbonation and sweet after taste.
Fine, rich foam. Fruity nose and very well balanced taste. German wheat beer at its best.

What might be regarded as a prime example of a classic Bavarian weissbier, it certainly possesses all of the hallmarks of one. Big and robust in body, with an enormous head of billowing foam and a tart, refreshing palate of fruit, spice, and drying wheat. This IS the wheat beer all others should be judged by. Just the smell alone separates the winner from the fakers.

500 ml bottle @ home.February 06, 2014
Beer bought @ "Vinmonopolet Oslo City"
Beer enjoyed from a weizen glass.
Cloudy dark golden color and medium carbonation
A nice creamy lasting head.
Aroma is  a bit sweet,yeast,citrus,some spices and a touch of banana.
Fruity taste with flavors of yeast and citrus. 
A nice refreshing weizen.Probably better in summertime and served with clams or a nice seafood salad.

Bottle 0,50L. Hazy, dark yellow colour with huge, frothy white head and lively visible carbonation. Aroma of banana, butter, biscuit and white bread. Taste starts light sweet, goes thrue the phase of light acidic and finish sour. Medium to full body, oily texture and lively carbonation. Very good hefe.
Absolutely stunning Hefeweiss, one to revisit often. Enjoyable, refreshing and full of flavour. Highly reccomended - ranks amongst the greatest!
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 Draft. Pours a cloudy yellow/gold. Smells slightly sweet of cloves and bananas. Sweet taste of bananas and wheat. Light bodied and very easy to drink.

Strong wheat aroma with honey notes. Thick head with lively carbonation. Dark gold color. Sweat malty taste, strong wheat,very light bitterness, slightly astringent, citrus notes. Short aftertaste. Light body and very smooth .

Repülőtéren vettem. Egyőtt volt csomagolva egy barna buzával és egy pohárral. Az egyik legjobb búza sör amit ittam. Jó az iz hatás.
One of the best wheat beer I drank. Good taste effect.
1 Feb 2014, tap. light gold and faintly hazy. nose is sweet here yeast and slightly soapy. thin body and faintly fizzy. sweet popcorn malt and faint coriander. ok.

TWF; Pours hazy golden with a lasting frothy, leaving lacings white head. Aroma is wheat malt, banana and yeast. Taste adds sweet and spice. Medium body, light to oily texture. Soft carbonation. Mild fruity, sweet finish.
Cloudy straw to gold. Spennende hveteøl med sterk bananlukt......................
Gyllen farge med flott hvit skum. Hvete og banan smak. Men har en hveteølsmak som jeg ikke liker. Drikkes på smakskveld
Ótima weiss, com uma espuma com muita permanência e cor amarelo escura. Banana e cravo em grande evidência.
Ljusgul grumlig med stort ljust skum! Skumbananer och det som hör till en weissbier! Helt ok!

Pours a very hazy/opaque golden. A huge, frothy head that dissipates quick. Nose has some malt, a lot of clove, banana, caramel and a fruity citrus. Taste is a lot of banana, clove, wheat, sweet caramel and bread. Delicious. This is the best hefeweizen out there.

500ml bottle, pours cloudy orange golden brown with a large white head. Aroma is of banana and spice yeast esters over a delicious honey and caramel malt backbone. Body is light and the finish is bitter and crisp and short, with a herbal aftertaste. So easy to drink. A great weissbeer.
On tap at Stelle Italian restaurant, Berlin. Pours hazy orange with nice head. Citrus fruity aroma. Fruity, banana, wheaty flavor. Great hefeweizen, best one Ive tried so far.
Uklar strågul. Let skum. Klassisk hvedearoma. Smag: banan, appelsin, lidt krydret måske. Dejlig rund.
Tap. Hazy yellow pour with a big creamy white head. Banana, citrus, orange peel. Light body with banana juice like creamy body. Not bad
Great weizen. Floral aroma and a little bit spicy and banana taste at the end. Light body and great drinkability. You just want to drink more and more.
Bottle. Pours cloudy straw colour. Large foamy head that persists with good lacing. Simply awesome weissbier. Has all the characteristics you expect and balances them beautifully.
Shared 50 cl bottle. Nice yellow hazy pour with a huge head. Lots of yeast and ripe fruit in the nose. Flavours is Bananas, cloves and yeast. Quite nice!

De memoire
Blonde pale, grosse carbo et collet genereux.
Aromes de banane, girofle
Corps rond et cremeux
A re-deguster
Bottle, aroma is spicy clove and banana. Taste is very crisp and bubbly with a great spice finish

floral, citrus, banana, bubblegum, amber, cloudy, 
bottle, beer with everything you can expect from a weissbier
Drank from 0,5 liter bottle. This one is simple, its the best weissbeer of the world! Or at least in my oppinion. Not bitter aftertaste which is often the case with other weizen.
Shoot. Our flight to Geneva is delayed, but fortunately they have a selection of beers at Rotterdam/thehague airport
This is the most ideal and most delicious example of the style I've ever tried. Simply delicious.

Bottle.
Pours a nice cloudy light golden colour.

Aroma. aroma of wheat, and a combination of banana and sweet milk chocolate.

Taste. Strong taste of clove, followed by banana, bubblegum and also a milk chocolate like sweetness.

Overall. Refreshing, easy drinking and full of flavour, everything i want in a beer, this beer would be especially good a hot summers day.

Aroma of apples, straw, wheat, hint of clove. Hazy golden with 2 finger head. Taste of clove, banana, wheat malts, a bit of bread. Opens up a nice hop bitterness and finishes with a dry hefe yeast. Good carbonation and mouth feel, well rounded.
Pours a cloudy nectar with a massive white head. Lovely wheaty smell with a hint of banana. Strong yeasty taste with a small hint of bubblegum.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2014 Bottle. Very nice aroma, pretty spicy with a lot of the characteristic wheat and yeast tones coming through as well. Refreshing but still with lots of taste. The balance is truly great and with just the right amount of carbonation the mouthfeel is great. I guess that if you want to make beer for almost a thousand years, you got to keep your quality at a high level. Probably my favorite weissbeer.

What a great beer this is. Everything you can ask for when it comes to weissbeer. One of my favorites

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy gold body under a large frothy bright white head that slowly faded. The nose is wonderfully fruity and full of banana and bubble gum esters. Lots of yeastiness and wheat, this really does define the style pretty damn well. The flavor is a bit of a let down from what I want from the style though. It comes across as a bit too thin and watery with not quite enough depth from the yeast. The esters just arent there in the flavor. It just tastes a bit flat and boring. Some light fruitiness and a touch of lemon on the finish. Lighter bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Meh, still pretty decent, and better than the majority of US craft Hefe offerings, but not the gold standard for the style anymore.

Pours a beautiful hazy straw colour with a very thick head. smells of banana, cloves and spices. a wonderful beer to drink, goes down smooth as any and to me is the best representation of a german hefe!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 
Look: Pours with a massive white head, slow retention to a foamy ring, leaves a sticky excellent lacing. Cloudy yellow wheat with light orange hue. Lots of carbonation. Cant get sexier that this. 


Smell: Clove. Wheat, bread sweetness. Spicy. Earthy yeast. Light banana and a hint of lemon. Basically what defines this style, did expect a bit more banana, but doesnt matter really. 


Taste: Smell pretty much translates into taste + light hop bitterness. Clove start is the most obvious, also some spice light banana, apple. Then goes in to crackers medium sweet wheat middle. Ends with earthy yeast with light bitterness and some banana esters. Cant really think of a more perfect blend of tastes, no wonder this one defines the style.


Mouthfeel: Light-medium body, crisp dry - you need and want to take another sip soon. Constantly. Till all gone. 


Overall: German perfection.

Cerveza rubia túrbia. Con espuma blanca, abundante y densa. Aroma afrurado a plátano. Sabor ligeramente ácido, plátano, y el fondo característico del trigo. Una cerveza muy refrescante, saciadora de la sed, perfecta para empezar y para los días de calor. Una de mis cervezas de trigo favorita. Y si es de barril, mejor.

Pours an inviting hazy gold with a thick foamy white head. Aroma is yeasty and hints of ripe banana. Taste is sweet with a zing of citrus. Very refreshing and easy to drink.

Cloudy honey gold color with thick frothy head. Typical banana clove aroma. Taste is fruity, wheaty and a little spicy. Silky smooth texture. Easy drinking. Best Hef I've had. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy golden color with a large head. Nice aroma with some banana and clove. Soft and very well balanced, light sour. Lemon and banana in taste. My favourite weiss!
Very good well balanced and flavorful beer lots of bananas and spice with a little zing . If you like wheat beers this is a must.

Pours cloudy golden, light thin head that dissipates quickly. Yeasty bread nose with a hint of spices. Bananas apple a big dollop of spices with some medicinal notes as well.

Bottle at the brewery. Strong banana and bubble gum in the nose. Slight hop bitterness, with some carbonic bite from high CO2. Soft malt character but kind of flat. Some soapiness as it warms too, but may be the hops? Balanced strongly toward the esters, very little clove. Thin mouthfeel with a dry finish.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle.

A- Oranges, bananas, lemons, spices.

A- Copper color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Subtle flavors. Nice fruity tones, wheat tones. Balanced well.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- One of the top Hefeweizen around. This beer does almost everything right and its one of the originals. Hard to go wrong with this beer.

A fresh, banana feast of a wheat beer. Drink this on a hot summer afternoon & you'll feel as cool as a polar bear. Lovely silky mouthfeel.

Rated by BrewTom
Aroma of yeasty and cloves. Cloudy caramel colour. Taste of yeast and cloves with a slightly astringent, slightly metallic finish.

Hazy in appearance and yeasty in taste, this beer has all the touchstones of an authentic German Hefeweizen. This stuff is ridiculously easy to drink in large quantities, especially on a hot day. Its just a bit earthy and a little sweet. Everything about this wheat beer is just right.
Pours a cloudy golden color with a large, long-lasting white head. Spicy sweet orange nose. Moderately wet, heavy moutfheel with some light fizziness. Tastes nearly identical to fransiskaner.
Alla spina. Splendido colore torbido, note di miele, grande rotondità e persistenza. Una weiss fatta in maniera assolutamente impeccabile
No es mi estilo preferido. Me gustó el amargor a pesar de sentir el dulce del trigo. Repetiré en otra oportunidad.
Poured from a bottle. Hazy/ cloudy orange color. Had large amount of head. Some lacing. Has sweet fruity taste.

Perfect golden cloudy hefe colour and hefe smell (slightly citrusy), classic hefe taste, best hefe.

Had on tap at Prader biergarten, Berlin, Germany.

A= beautiful light California Poppy orange with three fingers of billowed head that only falls as more of it stays attached to my lips because I can´t seem to let this one too far from my mouth. Cobweb lacing.

S= Banana, clove, yeast, grain, wheat tartar. This can be smelled from the table just sitting here, potent and awesome. There´s a certain dry sweetness to the smell I struggle to really put my finger on, but it´s there, and I like it.

T= Nice, spicy wheat nips at the palate as the sweet and earthz yeast comes through and plays a strong part. Finish is a bit sour, but otherwise perfect.

M= Creamy, lively carbonation. Finish feel is long lasting and salivating. Nice.

O= I´ve been waiting to review this beer because it´s not particularly easy to get in my area. Just so happens it was the first beer I had in Germany, and the right one to have at that. This beer deserves to be as high as it is on the Fame list.

Serving type: on-tap

06-15-2011
Bread, bread, bread, woody, vanilla, basement aromas, banana, cereal, floral, resin, coffee

Aroma bem marcante da banana e do cravo, levemente alaranjada e turva. No sabor, presença da banana, do cravo, leve traço do álcool e oxidação, paladar mais lupulado que as outras weizenbiers. Recomendo.

Shared a 500ml bottle from Marhun (Darmstadt). Pours a hazy yellow colour with a nice white head. Aroma has yeast, lightly banana and bubble gum. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste light bitter, light sweet with some spice notes and a dry finish. Overall, a very good Weiss that I certainly will drink again.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 Espuma persistente. Um bom aroma. O sabor, apesar de lembrar pao, nao eh marcante. Seca, nao borbulhante.

Its the only alternative from the tap to the bland Forst Kronen in my favorite bar, and its a great one. One of the best hefe weiss available, with all the things done right (the banana aroma, very refreshing, etc.) but I drink too much of this to write anything serious about it.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 Vaalea, samea väri. Erittäin hyvin vaahtoava olut, jossa vaahto pysyy myös pitkään. Tuoksussa aavistus sitruunaa. Maku raikas, tasapaksuinen, aavistuksen kirpeä. Erittäin maukas, pehmeä, miellyttävä saksalainen vehnäolut.

Such a good wheat beer. This is my benchmark for the style. Great banana, cinnamon & nutmeg flavours and so creamy tasting.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours cloudy gold with foamy white head. Taste sweet, banana, refreshing. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 Half liter bottle poured into weiss glass. Appearance is cloudy orange, with a towering three finger head that has some stickiness. Aroma is textbook, banana and clove spiciness plus wheat and malted sweetness. Flavor is malty and yeasty with sweetness and spice. Lemon, banana bread, clove, alcohol, and just a fuzz of hop bitterness. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft but abundant carbonation, drying finish. Perfect for the style and excellent overall.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2014 Classic aroma of German Hefeweizen (banana, spices etc.), maybe a little bit sweeter than average. Appearence: hazy golden, with big white head. The head stays for a long time and small head never dissapears. Taste is sweet, almost like honey, wheat, fruits. Finish is rather sour and a little watery, but also has hints of bitterness. Lively carbonation, its also creamy. Overall: just a classic example of German Hefeweizen, if you like Hefeweizen, you will love this one.

Visual: This is one of three bottles in a gift pack (for myself) that includes their own branded beer glass, which is 99% the reason why I bought it. Pours cloudy luminescent orange with a decent-sized foamy heady, sporadic lacing, lots and lots of activity.

Nose: Bright banana-citrus-pineapple. (8)-aromatic strength.

Attack: sharp, crisp, bubbly

Mid-palate: (4)-cereal sweetness, (MAIN) banana, wheat malts, tangerine,

Finish: cuts wheat dry, crisp bite, clean sweet fruity lemon citrus finish.

Summary: Good range of flavours, depth, and fabulous texture. This is now my go-to beer to accompany my meals (as of 2013-December) (Note: numbers above are on a 10-point weak-strong scale)

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2013 Bottle from local supermarket. Pours a hazy golden yellow. Aroma is typical hefe-weiss with bananas, cloves and all spice. Flavor is nice and light with a very crisp finish. A good weissbier, but one that doesn?t really stand out amonst other staples like köing-ludwig or franziskaner.
floral, citrus, earthy, banana, golden, hazy, frothy, light sweetness, medium body, creamy. Beautiful like a boozy liquid banana. I wish I had saved this for breakfast.

Big Bottle. Orlando. Poured a cloudy golden color. 1 1/2 finger high head. Aromas of lemon, orange, wheat, banana, spicy yeast. Average carbonation. Light sweetness. Sort of creamy texture. Ends sort of dry. This is a very good hefeweizen.

Hazy golden, nice white head that disappears fast. Yeasty, some citrus, bready, cloves, other spices, medium sweet with bitter touch and tart finish. Mouth is medium full, creamy, medium carbonation. Very nice beer.
I dont feel I have to explain to you guys what Hefeweizen beer tastes like. All you need to know is that this is the ultimate example of one.

De color entre ambarino y cobrizo, posee un aroma floral y herbáceo, acompañado a un toque especiado y cítricos que me decantaría a optar por el limón.

Se trata de una cerveza turbia por su característica de no estar filtrada, aunque los restos de la levadura no suelen quedar depositados en el fondo de la botella como si ocurre en otras espumosas del mismo género. 

Posee una espuma abundante, muy densa, firme y cremosa que debidamente servida, corona de forma espectacular su vaso característico de servicio.
Tiene una alta concentración de Co2, lo que la conserva perfectamente y no pierde fuerza incluso un gran rato después de su servicio.

Su sabor es mas que delicioso, desde el primer trago nos impacta en el paladar con todo su sabor a trigo malteado, donde si se mantiene el mismo en boca unos segundos se notan trazos florales y algo especiados con un regusto dulzón al final del trago pasando de puntillas.
Fuente: http://www.encopasabemejor.com/2012/12/weihensteph

500ml bottle from an Italian pizzeria on the outskirts of Berlin. Always nice to have a good weissbier in Germany, and although refreshing with a good hazy weiss taste, its not quite as good as this style can be. Served with a slice of lemon and, dare I say it, this really complemented the beer well.

Bière allemande assez typique. Légère, avec des goûts citronés, qui rappellent certaines blanches.
Une bonne bière pour se désaltérer. Moins pour la dégustation.
Excellent heffe wizen! Just love it, one of my favorite beers! Enjoy it and cheers...

un grand classique de la bière allemande, qui na rien de très original, cest léger, entre une blonde et une blanche, facile à boire, rafraichissante, légèrement citronnée, sur les céréales et les levures. Mais ça manque de corps, de complexité et de fruit : bref une allemande classique qui remplit bien son rôle.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 500 ml bottle, abv 5.4%, from Vinmonopolet Tromsø.
Full scents, apples, yeast, wheat malts, herby-spicy notes, clove, coriander, pears.
Tall deutschhhh pearl-white foam. Light golden hazy body. Not very much lacing.
Rich taste of wheat malts, hops, smoked wheat malts, apricot flowers, clove, yellow apple, dough.
Clean spicy feel to palate. Good body.
Finally sweet wheat malts, banana with honey, new dough, and overall a beer of high quality.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Beautiful textbook example of a hefeweizen. Aroma is puncutated by banana, yeast, clove and some bubblegum. Entirely satisfying, creamy medium body with decent carbonation. Bursting with yeast and banana and some spicy clove. A little doughy. Fantastically refreshing and a fine Hefeweizen.
Lovely cloudy yellow, nice white head that dissipated fairly quick. Aroma of cloves, yeast and citrus. medium body with nice banana and clove flavor. Not my favorite style of beer but was quite nice.

Cloudy yellow-golden, frothy white head, rim of 2/3 mm remains, nice lacing; wheaty buttery nose, aroma: yeasty, bread, banana, coriander, vanilla, cloves, citrus, herbal; fruity mild sweetness, wheaty malts with grass, honey and clove; medium body, buttery texture; dry wheaty finish with banana and light acidity

A: Hazy Golden Straw/Orangish Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Some Lacing

S: Oranges, Banana

T: Wheat, Oranges, Banana

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Lightly Sweet

Overall, one of the top hefeweizens that are very true to style. So drinkable.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2013 Bottle-taster at BBB Fest in Nashville. The prototypical German hefeweizen, with wheat and yeast shouldering the cloves and banana. If you are a fan of the style, I can see why this would be a benchmark. I am not such a fan.
Deceivingly crisp going by its cloudy appearance , highly effervescent ,nice golden colour,falls away in the end
