Cloudy gold with a foamy white head. Nose is characteristically wheaty and clove-y, and overall sorta smells like an airport. The flavor is really nice and mellow and balanced with nice tones of wheat and pale malt, a touch of clove, and a touch of grass, with just a kiss of banana ester tones. Finishes with a dry ish wheaty banana tone.
500ml bottle. pours a cloudy light orange/yellow. aroma is very wheaty and some dough and citrus. nice smooth taste. wheat at first and then citrus and the dough/yeast.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 On draft. Thick white head with small bubbles. Beautiful yellow-orange color. Smells of yeast, fruit, and alcohol. Medium bodied mouthfeel. Tastes of yeasty bread, banana, and cloves. Perfect balance. One of the best hefeweizens ever.

ivorywhite head that disappears quickly with some lacing. blonde-yellow turbid. aroma of vegetables, spices, clove, wheat. taste like aroma with slight sour finish. medium body and carbonation. this one isnt for me .. or at least this bottle wasnt. bottle 50 cl
Hazy yellow color. Aroma of banana and yeast. Very nice rich taste. Full body with long finish

Meh... Quite pale, little aroma other than that normally expected of a weissbier but a little thin and rather lacking in flavour. Massively over-carbonated - at the very least I guess it would make a good fire extinguisher!

Im not typically a big hefe guy but this beer is very tasty and refreshing. Definitely the best hefe Ive ever had. Taste is full of banana to be expected but there is also a fair amount of spices. Very good.

Just tried this last night in a German restaurant and was blown away by all aspects of this beer. Was drinking Erdinger Hefe Weiss but will have to get some of this in my beer refrig now. There are a few American wheat beers that are coming along very nicely but this beer is what they should use as a standard. In my opinion.

Fresh dough aroma and taste to match. Small hints of floral scent. Even lighter notes of floral in taste. Numbingly playful and enjoyable on the tongue. Well carbonated. Pours slightly murky yellow. Overall decent, just not my favorite style.
Odeur de pain et de foin mais surtout de banane. Couleur paille trouble. Mousse dense qui sestompe relativement vite mais pas completement. Une tres bonne biere...delicieux

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2015 Pours a hazy orange with a big white head. Very attractive look. Aroma of spices, banana, wheat, bread. Very refreshing, and one of the best Hefeweizen Ive had. Will definitely revisit next summer.
Perfect beer for summertimes, fresh and light flavour, little aftertaste and great aroma of banana and flowers.

I keep passing up this legendary brewerys beers at my store, but I probably shouldnt. Finally got a bottle of this today - their dunkelweizen is next on my list as I have yet to try the style. Anyway, this one: Nice head with good splotches of lacing. Banana, clove, peppercorn, spicy, and yeasty aroma that can help unblock your sinuses. Smooth taste follows. A little mellower than I like, but its exceptionally well-balanced. Doesnt overdo the spice element at all, for instance. Not surprised this is the standard for hefes. Not a huge fan of hefes and related styles, but this is a nice break from my typical Belgian Strongs, pale ales, and pilseners every once in awhile.

Bottle poured into a tulip glass. Hazy gold with a gargantuan white head, which really sticks around both on top of the beer and on the side of the glass. Aromas are somewhere between banana and orange. Taste is medium to sweet. Short finish, very drinkable.

Delicate in all respects, great weissbier.
50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy orange with big soon-fading head. Aroma is banana and grass. Taste is slightly sweet with a mild bitter aftertaste. Well craftet beer.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Bottle: golden orange-amber and yellow; yeasty haze throughout, topped off with a fluffy and chunky white head that looks like a cloud. It lasts forever and leaves fat, chunky lacing behind. Beautiful aroma of fresh hefe yeast, bready malts, and light spice. Clove, banana esters, coriander, some light orange zest, fresh baked bread, light bubblegum, and a soft blanket of wheat. So elegant - simple, yet refined and masterful. Taste is similarly great; light fruity esters; banana, faint lemon peel & orange zest, clove, mild kitchen spices, sweet bready malt, faint bubblegum, and a finishing mouthful of more sweet & fruity esters, almost finishing like banana taffy. Chunky and pretty thick mouth feel, just how a hefe should be. This is the best hefeweizen out there. If I find one better, Ill change that statement, but I doubt I ever will.

Pours a hazy amber-yellow with a frothy white head with exellent head retention. Aroma is of wheat, yeast, banana, cloves, bubble gum, black pepper, and some spicy hops. Taste is wheat bread, banana, cloves, light bubble gum, pepper, and some spicy hops. Has a medium body with a slightly creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, slightly bitter, medium, crisp, refreshing finish. Overall, a excellent beer that definitely deserves the tile of the best hefeweizen in the world.

0.5l bottle from Bavarian holiday. Hazy orange colour. Persistent head with sweet fruity aroma: banana, a I would say. Taste is dominantly sweet, but in harmonic way: honey, fruits (mostly banana, maybe mandarin). Malt and hops are hiding but they are ultimately there to moderate the sweetness a bit. Very good stuff, although a bit on the sweet side for me.
Hands down the best hefe I have had to date. Usually not my favorite style but this one jumps way out. "Banana, clove, and bubblegum". An all around great treat.

Cloudy and pale with a decently frothy, white head that fades a bit quicker than Id expect (but hey, this is a bottle from Germany, what can you expect?). Aroma is delicate, mainly clove and pilsner malt with very light banana. Taste is yeasty and crisp. Notes of bread, melanoidins, and a spicy off-dry finish. Would make an excellent breakfast beer. As is the case for most great beers, this ones got the balance just right.
opaque&deep gold in colour, white fluffy foam, light&floral taste with mid-high carbonation.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Pours with a big, foamy white head. Clear, fresh banana, balanced wheat, yeast and hobs without any being too dominant. Fresh citrus, common, cinnamon in complexrich aroma. Taste is lively by fine-tuned carbonation, banana, spiceness, wheat and malty sweetness, with little bitterness at final note. One of my old time favorite.

One of the best examples of a true Heffe Weissbier. Pours a lovely hazy wheat amber, with a billowing tower of pure white head. Strong aroma of banana, clove, cardamom and the slightest hint of tart lemon. Great body, perfect carbonation, although in the mouth there are creamier wheats around. Lashings of yeasty wheat flavour combined with an abundance of banana and mixed spice. Brilliant moreish, slightly dry finish, that doesnt leave your mouth excessively sweet.
Green banana, bread aroma. Banana cake flavor, wheat, pepper, creamy finish. A classic German white, pretty traditional and efficient.

Aroma: clove, banana, and a dash of cinnamon. Appearance: murky light gold. Beautiful carb bubbles on par with the best champagnes. Creamy, two-finger white head (looks like a layer of vanilla ice cream.) Taste: Sweet banana turns to spice turns to bitter turns to light sourness. Medium body, creamy texture, fizzy carb and a bitter but clean finish.

This was my favorite beer years ago, but I felt I grew out of wheat beers and so moved on and havent had it since about 2008. I could see myself drinking more of this beer again...

UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 A beautiful thick head. Mushy and soft palate with well-balanced flavors of yeast, clove, and underlying hops. Rich yet quaffable. Nice Brussels lace adds even more appeal to this very fine Weissbeer. Excellent.  What is Utopia?  Drinking this beer in multiples while snacking on homemade spicy beef jerky.

Aroma: The smell is complex and rich, spices (cardamom, coriander, clove), citrus fruits (orange, lemon), sour notes.Appearance: A clouded light orange/yellow beer, a very big white head leaving good lacing.Taste: The taste is equally complex, spicy and citric. Lime with gingerbread.Palate: Light carbonation, a fresh feeling, a good body, a slightly dry finish.Overall: A beer for a warm summers day.Note: On-tap at beer sampling at De Klomp Reviewed 2011-07-02.

Pours appropriately cloudy, huge banana/bubblegum nose. Flavor matches aroma closely with the perfect balance of clove/banana/bubblegum. Creamy texture with ample carbo. The perfect hef...difficult to imagine a better one.
Draft. Pours cloudy golden with a large lacy white head. Aroma is banana, yeast, fruits, bread and cereal. Medium sweet. Sessionable, nice for the style. Medium body with average carbonation.
September 2010. From bottle. Golden yellow with a white head. Banana, spice, wheat, yeast and grassy aromas. Flavors of light fruit, clove, yeast and lemon.
Tap. Unfiltered hazy orange. Little head. Typical funky yeast and citrus aroma. Orange, sweet, spice, and yeast finish with good bite. Good execution of a classic style.
Для меня это пиво  эталон вайцена, но оценки слишком не завышу, берегу их для ещё лучшего пива.

Une belle robe blanche et trouble une richesse au palais avec un arrière goût de banane, cependant elle manque un peu de nez et elle perd beaucoup de ses qualités lorsquelle se réchauffe ce qui est souvent problématique quand tu as 50cl dans ton verre.
A spicy/peppery, wheaty, only lightly sweet brew. Good wheaty aroma. A perfect example of an unfiltered Kristallweizen. Nice carb.

Appearance: Slightly hazy golden amber with a large billowing tight white head.
Aroma: Subtle bubblegum, banana, fruity and peppery, with biscuit and bread notes.
Taste: Medium sweetness, with low bitterness and sourness. Banana and peppery notes on the tongue.
Palate: Thin smooth texture, light/medium body with average/prickly carbonation. Quite astringent with a lingering fruity, banana and pepper finish.
Comments: Very tasty and refreshing. Left a glass lace.

AR bread, nuts, citrus, herbs, raisin
AP pale, cloudy, white foam, 
TA medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
PA medium body, thin feel, fizzy, long finish

Overall a top notch beer. I enjoy it almost every week. Simply love it!

Bottle at The Jones B-Side in Gainesville. Pours a deep murky yellow with a one finger white head. Smells of banana, clove, yeast. Flavor is banana, pears, apples, clove, yeast with a nice crisp bitter hint and plenty of prickly carbonation. Easy drinking and light with plenty of flavor. Yum.

Bottle 33cl, bought in supermarket. Very nice Hefe Wessbier, probably the beste one arround nowadays. Im very glad that this beer from the oldest brewery is available in the local market. Its a very fresh weissbier that lacks bitternes compared to other beers. In my opinion a good thing!

Very nice hefe, looks grat poured into a hefe glass with a big fluffy, somewhat persistent head and an earthy aroma. Mild and balanced, not overpowering in bread, bubblegum, or citrus, just a very nice drinker with character.
Really great. This was on tap at 28 springs. Smooth and refreshing. I could drink this all day.
Bottle cloudy light amber color nice Aroma of fruits yeast and also some sourness taste is sour fruits with some malt aftertaste is malts and some hops nice weisse but i had better ones

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2013 Bottle. Pours a very cloudy yellow. Big white head. Aroma is banana, wheat, cloves, citrus. Taste is big time sweet. Nice creamy texture, medium body, good carbonation. Definitely my favorite hefeweizen.

Sweet nose with notes of honey and vanilla- nice, effervescent texture. Well balanced, not too heavy. A perfect Weis beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dit is toch wel een van de lekkerste weizen bieren die ik ken. Mooie kruidig in aroma en smaak, met een volle body.

Cloudy orange w/ a lingering whipped froth white head. Aroma is orange cream and yeast. Sips full and body is full throughout. Flavors of yeast, citrus, dough/bread, vanilla and butterscotch. Top notch very authentic hefeweizen...prob great w/ some sausage & kraut.
500ml bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden color with a fluffy white head. The aroma has nice banana, yeast, wheat, grains, cloves, some sweetness. Light and refreshing with a creamy mouth feel.

If you like a full bodied hefweisen it doesn't get much better than this. These geniuses have perfected this style of beer. I guess after almost 1000 years you would have it down to a science. I am sold.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cant say I really believed that I would find a better hefeweisen than Hacker Pschorr, but I think I just did it. Guess it makes sense that the worlds oldest brewery would be able to unseat the champ.

Pretty much everything you want from a hefeweizen. Color is a beautiful golden cloud with a fluffy head. Smells very earthy and natural. Tastes extraordinarily rich and flavorful - all the depth of a traditional hefeweizen with an incredibly subtle but lovely banana/honey tinge. Refreshing, rich, drinkable - so much going for this wonderful beer.

Pours hazy straw. Lots of medium frothy, white head. Banana, yeast, malt nose. Sweet. Grainy mouth feel, low to medium carbonation. Malt, banana, some bubblegum aroma. Not my style, but a refreshing weissbier.
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 Bottle at Léhűtő Beer Pub. Hazy golden colour, thick white head. Banana, spices and yeast in aroma. Sweet taste with banana, citrus, spices. An awesome weissbier.

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a pillowy and persistent white head and finely beaded carbonation. Aromas of banana, lemon, clove, vanilla and pepper. Taste starts out with fresh apple, before more yeast-driven flavours of banana, coriander and clove come through. Fantastic creamy mouth feel. Quite a clean finish with lemon and a touch of vanilla. Great stuff.
#113 - bottle fro supermarket. Opaque amber, gorgeous. Aroma of orange and wheat. Sweet to taste, oranges, banana and alcohol. Slight gas
This beer is a good hefeweizen. Notes of banana and other fruity aroma. Really good.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2013 Foggy orange with a huge white head. Aroma of yeast, ripe fruits, banana, clove. Taste is fruits, bananas, yeast. Balanced, medium bodied and carbonated. Good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Spina @ rose & crown. Chiara torbida con schiuma eterna. Ottima hefe! Poco carbonata, buon corpo e banana dominante. Leggermente astringente nel finale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Pours hazy gold with big white head, smells of bread with nuts, flavors of yeast, grain and an open meadow... A very fine wheat beer. Enjoyed after my workout ( don't tell Tony Horton!)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Maybe slightly overrated, but still a very good beer. Expected a little bit more for the price.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruity, wheat, and sweet yeast, hints of banana and clove with many floral and herbal nuances. Refreshing.

Pint bottle poured into a Franziskaner weiss glass. Beautiful cloudy golden color with a thick, fluffy white long lasting head. Wiffs of clove, banana, spice and yeast on the nose. Lots of carbonation on the tongue with flavors of yeast,clove, banana, malty biscuit that is mildly bitter but so darn smooth and easy drinking. Similar to Franziskaner but not as banana forward. Doften är hö, gräs, malt och citrus. Smaken är stall, syrlig, frisk, vissa beska, äpple likt en halvtorr cider.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating rerated 18.08.2013, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is fresh fruity, citrus, yeast, wheat, fresh apples, peach, hints of flowers and banana. Taste is slightly dry, wheat, yeast, hay, flowers, dough, herbs, citrus. Nice mild bitterness. Nice one.
GCB: Delicious and accessible hefe. One of my favorite beers for summer. A must try.

Bottle. Hazy orange with an average, frothy, mostly lasting white head. Aroma is lemon, banana, cloves, yeast, wheat. Flavor is moderate sweet and mild bitter, spicy, lemony, peppery. Well balanced. Finish in dry and quite sweet. A top Hefe.
Excellente bière blanche avec son trouble naturel elle tire sur la blonde.lété bien fraîche ya rien de mieux!
A very nice weissbeer which is very drinkable. Little interesting aftertaste however to set it aside.
Why do I have to write a long comment when I am clearly using a mobile device and drinking beer? Typing is hard work!

Perfect beer. Golden hazy color with hazy head. Aroma of yeast , wheat and species. Taste is grainy , bananas amd yeast. Great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer drinks smooth and full and is completely rife with an amalgamation of flavors that is best described as banana nut bread. Up front you get the sweet ripe banana notes which then meld in to more of a yeasty bread character and is then finally smoothed out in to a crisp cashew finish. Absolutely delicious.
nice good cloudy golden look with a fresh herby aroma.but to me sorry tastes a bit shitty like hoegatden the 2nd worst drink in the world

Bottle poured a clear light golden color with a one finger white head. Aroma has wheat, light yeast, and some sweetness. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation medium low though it does coat alright. Flavor brings the yeast to the front, banana, grass, wheat, and some sweetness on the finish. Not bad on the drinkable scale.

Bottle 0.5l. Classic german Hefe Weißbier with a much more distinguished taste than the rest of its competitors. Banana, citrus and perfect balance between sweet and bitter. Perfect carbonation. A true classic.

After a mediocre hefe at Genesee, had to grab a classic German one. This one is not my fave, but it is pretty good. Cloves dominate the nose and taste with bananas there but in the background. There is also a bit of pepper in the palate. Pale and cloudy and foamy true to form. Nicely done.
Overall just too bland for me. Decent color, nice head, but the flavor first persist enough.

butelka. wyborne piwko z browaru reklamującego się jako najstarszy na świecie. intensywnie bursztynowy kolor, który wydawać by się mogło zwiastuje cięzki smak tymczasem piwo jest delikatne leciutkie wchodzi jak płynne zloto, odświeża jak trzeba. pieniste, dużo gazu , ktory w ogóle nie przeszkadza szybko uchodzi. Pyszne. Kupić skrzynkę jak się da.:)

Pours a cloudy golden with a huge, fluffy eggshell head that settles slowly and leaves a fair lacing behind. Nose involves fresh yeasty notes of clove and banana with some lemony citrus notes. Fairly sweet, somewhat tart, with a light bitterness. Light bodied, fluffy, a touch grainy, with a crisp lemony tart finish. Refreshing and enjoyable, an ideal summer beer.
No beer is perfect but this is pretty close. Taste is wheat grain yeast lemon peel spices coriander. Amazingly refreshing especially on an evening like this
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 Bottle from studio b Fayetteville WV. Aroma of bubble gum and banana. Very yeasty with notes of banana, bubblegum, and a hint of citrus in the background.

Nice aroma of banana, bubble gum, spices and fruit. Beautiful cloudy orange with a thick white head that lasts ages. I like my hefes sweet...this does not disappoint. Sweet wheat and bubble gum flavors that magically get covered with spicy fruit and the perfect bitterness from the hops at the end. Medium carbonation light body and smooth finish. One of the best.
0.5 l bottle from Alko. Big head, cloudy. Taste has more of banana than the competitors of the same style. Excellent, very refreshing. Enough of the words, you should try it too.

Pours with a thick and foamy white head. Very slow to fade in a tall glass. Cloudy yellow in color. Aroma is sweet yeast and citrus spice. Taste is banana bread, yeast and lemony. A classic hefe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(bottle 02/08-2013) Large white head, unclear orange color, yeast and wheat aroma, slightly banana wheat taste. BB date 04.04.2014.
A true all-time classic and deservingly so. You can taste the hundreds of years of experience that this brewery has. Great weizener.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy orange/yellow with a big white head. Aroma is yeast, citrus, and spice. Taste is the same as the aroma. This beer goes down very easy and is very tasty. Great beer, will definitely have again.
This beer is very good. Balanced, wheat, banana, flavor, minor citrus as well. This beer is perfectly balanced, easy to drink yet fulfilling at the same time.

Bottled sample at Charcut. Golden colour. Long lasting head. Hint of cloves. Great tasting beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 11.2 FL.OZ Bottled. Pours a light golden color with a nice white head. I smell banana, citrus, spice and wheat. I taste all of the same, just a wonderful and refreshing ale! This is one of the best! !!

Bottle 500ml - The largest forthy head of any beer Ive ever had. A colouring that is not unlike straw or wheat. Its nice but I cannot its exceptional. It does what it says on the tin. Wheat beer is just not for me.
The best hefe I have ever tasted........I judge a bar basted on whether the sell it.

(Bottle): Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of yeast, banana and some citrus fruit elements. Wheat, bananas, yeast and citrus dominates the flavour with a nice bitter-sweet balance. Well carbonated. Very nice.

The classic example of the style. Strong lemongrass aroma. Wheaty as well. Clear golden color with a strong white head. Nice carbonation and clean finish. This actually had somewhat of a full creamy feel. Good basic flavors. Wheat, citrus, pale malt with a mild hop finish. They should know what theyre doing considering how long theyve been around.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 Pours foggy golden with big head. Nose is wheat, bread, fruits, banana, lemon. Super smooth, I kept swallowing it before I could taste it. Taste is banana, wheat, lemon, lingers a bit. Really drinkable. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
banana and wheat aromas. unclear with a fine white head. light bitter, and sweet. fizzy, but with a good mouthfeeling

Veldig god og frisk øl. Både til mat og som kosedrikke. Deilig og forfriskende. God sommerøl!

--- For norwegian readers...

Pours an extremely bright golden with a full, fluffy, very long lasting white head. The aroma consists of banana, orange, spice, and wheat. It has the nose of what I expect from this style. Taste is very strong in banana. It is balanced well with orange and lemon. Wheat flavors are underneath. There is some slight tart in here. Aftertaste is banana and lemon, and while isnt very potent, does linger for awhile. Light to medium in body, with a sort of sudsy texture, with lively carbonation. This is very refreshing to drink. Great for anytime of the year, but probably best for warmer weather. This one is great. This is how a German Hefeweizen is supposed to be. This should be a regular go to.
Bottled. Smell malt, citrus. Pours hazy yellow with a nice head. Taste wheat, citrus and malt. This is a nice beer and it drinks pretty well.
I have had this beer many-many times, it is very good with nice cloudy orange colour. I like wheat beers so if you are not a wheat fan it will not be your favourite. It is quite refreshing as well
Nice hazy yellow color, great head. Cloves, underripe banana, lemon zest, bread. One of the better hefes out there...
Hazy orange colour. Big white head. Aroma of lemon, orange, hay, yeast. Little bit of sweetness, no bitterness. Refreshing. Its a good beer but wheat isnt my kind of beer really.
Sweet banana and clove flavors. Awesome beer thats good year round. This is one of my favorite beers and I would recommend it to anybody.

Cloudy gold colour with a big foamy white head. Aroma is fruity, banana, wheat, sweet malt -goood I suppose, but wheat beers really arent my thing. Taste was sweet. Oily texture, medium carbonation. Good, but Im still too be won over by wheat beers.

one of the world standards for this style. yeast in suspension gives a pleasant haze to the straw yellow color. rocky white head. pleasant clove yeast esters. clean, smooth and almost creamy flavor and texture.

Very nice Weiss. Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a light white head. Smells like lemon. Taste is very bready and lemon, with a peppery finish. Not bad! Had on tap at Mill Valley Beerworks.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle from Munich Airport. Pours hazy golden to orange, with a large, lasting white head. Fruity, wheaty and yeasty aroma with moderate banana and notes of clove and citrus. Moderate sweet with pleasant banana flavour and a slightly dry finish with some acidity and bitterness. Medium body with fairly average carbonation. Smooth, tasty and refreshing. Delicious!
0,5 l bottle. Cloudy, yellow colour, short-life white head, ester aroma, good fizziness, medium body, sweet taste, floury palate, no bitterness. Well-balanced decent hefeweizen, but nothing else.

Color ámbar tupido con espuma densa y generosa. Aromas frescos, trigo (como no) y un dulzor con punto floral y ácido. En boca es suave, melosa y equilibrada, con un dulzor ácido muy bien integrado. Sin duda, la mejor del estilo que he probado.

Bottle to tulip, shared by my wife who loves hefs. Pours hazy yellow with a large white head. Nose is yeast, banana, malt. Flavor follows, with some clove. Its true what they say: this is a classic hefeweizen. Nice summer brew.

On tap at the Von Rothenburg Bier Stube in Germantown. Ive had this beer countless times that I cannot believe I didnt have a rating until now. The beer is a lightly cloudy golden straw body with a white head. Aroma of clove, wheat, banana, yeast, and vanilla. The flavor is much the same. Palate is very clean for a hefe, and leaves you wanting more. This one is definitely world class, and a lot of times what I order at the Stube.

22oz bottle. I recently discovered this brewery and I have love all of the ones that I have tried, This was deliciously sweet and wonderfully flavorful with a nice floral finish. Will definitely be a regular purchace

i have probably bought this weissbier at least 600 times.if i had to be stuck on a desert island with just one bier...this would be it!
i love this bier!

It's hard to think of a better example of a true Bavarian style hefe I love wheat beers in general and I would stock this by the case if I could afford it. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
Not only the oldest brewery in the world, but also one of the best ones. Thats what a Wheatbeer has to taste like!
Pours trouble darker gold with a white head. taste of banana, sweet wheats and some malts. Good weizen!

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2013 I cannot recall any other experience with a (German) Weizen as good as this one. Spectacular, perfect Hefeweizen, with a creamy head that one wishes beer from a tap would produce. I love the buttery feel, the banana Juicy Fruits gum, the vanilla ice cream creaminess, that typical grassy touch that add to the mix of a perfect Weizen aroma and taste. This was a very fortunate pick for a lovely and hot midwinter day, but I could drink this beer in any season..

Great German heffewiezen. Good head. Great aroma. Will definitely get again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 Bottle 33 cl. Pours a giant, white, creamy head. In combination with the pale, hazy appearance its a very good looking beer. Typical hefeweizen aroma, yeast, malts and wheat. Taste is basically the same, yeast, malts and wheat, but the yeast is better noticeable. Tasty summerbeer.
Can a beer get an automatic 4 just on pedigree and the awesomeness of its website alone? This one does. Then bump it up to a 4.9 on taste and aroma and you have one of the greatest German beers made.

BOTTLE. Head: off-white, giant, creamy, good retention. Colour: golden-orange, cloudy.

Aroma: quite strong, banana, clove. 

Taste: wheat sourness, fruity, clove. Quite fizzy. Slight bitterness in the finish.

Bottle to Pint Glass.Pours a golden yellow with a nice soapy head. The main aroma seems to be of floral kinds. The taste is smooth with a hint of clove and banana. Not a big fan of weissbier but not bad

Pours a hazy straw with a fluffy white head. Nose is dry spices, yeast, banana esters. Mouth is fluffy, pleasant sweet grains, soft ground spices, nothing aggressive. Yeast and banana esters. Nice beer, I dig the style and Id happily drink these in the hot weather.
From bottle. Cloudy golden color, plenty of fizz. Banana bread aroma. Wonderful flavor of banana, clove, and spice. Refreshing and a favorite.
Has a wonderful banana and yeast taste to it. Poors a strong yellow color with no head or lacing,
Ligger inte i klass med Schneider, det gör den bara inte. Men en riktigt trevlig weis. Drömmer fortfarande om att komma över en flarra från första batchen.

Tasted at Frankfurt from tap. Cloudy yellow colour. Very big head, delicious wiesse taste, malty aromas, beautifull taste, delicant aromas. The best wiezen probably i drinked so far. Also it is nice with a porks shoulder.
Bottle at home, done from memory, rating is just for my own. I will edit if I drink it again, great weizen, but its not super special.

Billed as the oldest brewery in the world, the beer smelled like the oldest beer in the world. Very rank smell....not at all appetizing. The hazy golden colour reminded me of a good wheat beer after I got past the smell. The flavour was a little tart for a wheat beer. Not a lot of the spiciness present in other wheat beers.

Bottle from LCBO and thanks to czar, thanks a lot sir! Pours a cloudy straw colored with a sufficient creamy head. Aroma is a little subdued with mostly wheat shining through. Taste is spicy, sweet with almost none of this hop thing. Flavors are what you expect from an hefeweissbier: cloves, bananas, sweet malt. Mouthfeel is nice and slick. A really nice one, one by which Ill judge other hefes by from now on.

Draft to taster. Looks good for the style; a hazy orange with foamy white head that dissipates into sticky lacing. Smells of banana, clove, and yeast. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant mouthfeel. A good example of the style.

The classic hefeweizen.
Cloudy orange with a good white head. One finger retention.
Yeasty aroma notes with some banana, caramel and toffee.
More or less the same in mouth, with a medium bitternes in the end.
Soft carbonation.
Bottle 50 CL. Pours murky yellow with big fluffy head and a fruity scent. Notes of orange, citrus, fruits. Slightly too fruity for my taste but not too bad.
Very nice hefe weissbier, nice aroma. Slightly golden colour. Nicely carbonated.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 Opaque yellow to orange beer with a huge head that disappears soon but leaves lacing on the glass. Aroma has sweet banana, spicy yeast and citric fruityness. Flavor is more on the dry side with fresh fruityness and spicy yeastiness. Thin and highly carbonated palate. Initial bite of bitterness and a long spicy-yeasty finish. Good.

Very smooth malt background, 
rich yeast flavors, sofy spicy, with fruity banana tones,
reminiscent of clove, very balanced wheat beer. 
Washes down easy and lasting tasting notes.
Nice carbonation and good colour and a medium bodied beer.

Tasted from a bottle and tap, both are just as good. personally prefer the bottle cos you can control the pour / head and more importantly the goodness thats left at the bottom.

500ml bottle at BBQ restaurant in Pahrump 
Appearance: Cloudy yellow with a big fluffy white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Banana, coriander and wheat 
Taste: Banana esters, spices, wheat, honey and lemon 
Nice

Cracking example of the style. Pours a lovely hazy gold with big white head. Aromas of banana, clove and yeasty bread. A slight sour sweetness builds as it goes down, and has a great finish leaving you wanting more.

Colour: Bright golden yellow.
Nose: Wheat, citrus, orange, coriander, cereal.
Flavours: Fruits (banana, orange peel), herbs, toast, yeast. Smooth with just a hint of bitterness (very subtle). This adds to the complexity of the palate.
Finish: Long, mellow, fruity and fresh. Thirst-quenching.
Verdict: The Hefeweizen against which all others should be measured. Truly amazing.

Cerveja de cor dourada e opaca. Espuma branca e aroma adocicado. Sabor leve e tradicional de cerveja de trigo. Desce bem sem amargor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle. Almost archetypal hefeweiss. Cloudy pencil yellow, banana wheat aroma, bananas, wheat and a touch of coriander. Good body. Overall, exactly what youd expect.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 Mooie oranje kleur met een volle kraag.  Frisse fruit, mout, geur. Smaakt lekker bitter, zoet. Iets hop, fruitig.
Pours a beautiful golden hazy beer with a good big white head. Smells a bit like bananas and also taste like it. A bit weak carbo but after all a good weisse
hazy amber with a tall foamy head. subtle aroma of dough, banana, citrus and some cereal. well-balanced taste. not bad, but there are much better hefeweizen.
Pours a translucent straw colour with white head that thins. Smells of fruit, citrus, and bananas. Crisp. Tastes crisp. Hints of fruit. A nice wheat beer!

0.5l bottle. Hazy orange body, long lasting white head. Aroma of banana, lemon zest, a hint of toast, bread and pepper. Taste of banana, caramel, bread and pepper with some floral hoppyness in the finish. Very good beer thats for sure.

Large head, coriander, wheat and banana on the nose. Taste is at times a bit alcoholic. 
Very good mouthfeel.

Nothing refreshes you more than this naturally cloudy wheat beer with its wonderful yeasty fragrance and taste. Goes well with dishes that do not have too intensive a flavour, especially that Bavarian speciality Weisswurst or white sausage.

Wife ordered this on draft, good choice.  I snagged a few sips.  Hazy straw yellow color with white head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, yeast and some clove.  Taste seemed thicker then expected, a heavier take on the aroma.  Medium body, average carbonation, smooth, creamy with a lingering nice finish.  Very good hefe.

Bottle. Blonde hefe with tall eggwhite head. Yeasty fruity aroma. Sour, liquorice, salty, white pepper taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2013 Color between yellow and golden. Beautiful huge fluffy head lasting to the last sip. Aroma of banana and wheat, not bad one, but the taste is perfect for weizen. Lots of banana, wheat, some pear esters and clove background. Perfect carbonation. Defintely the best hefeweizen Ive ever drank! A must to drink!
Bottle, 50cl, Mitra Nijmegen. Had this with friends at a vegan dinner party. Refreshing beer with the taste of fresh bread and lots of banana. Works good as an apéritif.

Telling from my heart...this is a very special beer. When i pour this beer in special glass it make large plump foam area. it settles down and has a few dimples in it - it remind be of special girl Vera I knew in Brasil. she had such a beautaful glorious butt-cheek portion but had cute dimples that i love with all my heart portion. I remember her well - her beautiful cheeks would glisten in hot sun and i wish to take bite out of her cheek knowing that this would be delicious, this beer is almost as delicious.....huhhhhhhhhh - i think I have gone made with the delicious Weihenstephaner as i reminis about her swaying her cheek portion to the smooth sounds of Louis Prima - i arouse and have many fine beer with her and then dance the love while i worship said cheeks. I love this beer very much, almost as much as dear beut Vera

Bottle, 1 pint, 0.9 fl oz. Pours with a 1" creamy marshmallow-white head. SO ALIVE...effervescence like a good champagne. body completely opaque almost mustard yellow-white. Everything a good hefe should be. Refreshing, flavors of wheat, citrus, fresh-baked bread, yeasty but not off-putting at all...lemonade, no alcohol-shiver, toasty-roasty but not like the darker cousins. The wizard at the local Total Wine said it was the best one in the store, and dammit, hes probably right...but CHALLENGE ACCEPTED...I will try them all. You should own some of this if this is your style. I am a non-hoppy man, so...there ya go!
Very Nice Beer after sauna. Perfectly yeasty and So, So wonderfully foamy. Good friend to finnish HK Sininen sausage (falukorven in sweden).

50cl, BB 04/2014, local REWE. - Finally getting round to reasserting/rating some benchmark classics of my pre-RB regime...  Pours a fluffy white-yellow with generous lively, soapy head. Enticing, spring floral aroma heavy on pepper, clove and smoke giving way to a spectacularly delicate taste juggling clove, floral yeasts, apple, bubblegum, dried orange peel and faint smoke with impressive balance and low amounts of banana shake. Light mouthfeel, high carb, very refreshing and light enough on the stomache for sessioning in summer.
Aroma: Malty, slight banana, bit of sour, hint of smoke, cheese Appearance: Hazy, yellow, orange, fine foam and lace Taste: Bit of smoke, citrus, grass, hint of banana
Troebel donkergeel, vaste kraag.  Ruikt zoetgistig.  Smaakt fris,  wat kruidnagel, beetje banaan, gist.  Wel  ok voor een weissbier, sowieso niet zo mijn bier.

This was for a long long time my favourite beer, and on quite a few days per year it still is. 

I prefer to serve it really cold at ~6 degrees and let i quelsch my thirst after a long day of work or fun.

Low acidity compared to some other witbiers but it manages to balance the fruitiness almost perfectly to it.
Sweet tangerines and yeast oh yeast define this beer.  Theres hardly any sign of crisp hop and yet it finishes clean without the cloying finish you expect from the over ripe citrus aroma.

500 mL bottle. This is a classic wheat beer, superbly crafted and very refreshing. Pours an opaque straw with a nice long lasting head.  Lots of yeasty aroma. Well balanced on the tongue and a nice long finish.  Highly recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Heerlijk biertje. Veruit mijn favoriete weizen tot nu toe. Erg fijn mondgevoel. Mooie kleur.
On tap at Ale&hop. Hazy golden colour with white head. Wheat, cereal, fruity (banana) aroma. Sweet, fruity taste, also with wheat. Light body.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 On-tap poured into Weizen Glass.  Cloudy golden with a huge head. Good lacing. Pleasant weissbier aroma, with banana, clove and other fruity notes. Taste matches the smell, with very balanced mixture of banana, clove and wheat yeast. Pleasant wheat aftertaste. Very refreshing with medium carbonation. 
Excellent  Hefeweizen.

Banana and clove nose. Great mouth feel for a hefeweisen. Overall, excellent hefeweisen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy yellow, white head. Excellent nose of yeast, sweet banana. Sweet wheat, malts. Good

500ml bottle - Typical Hefeweizen appearance, milky yellow, fluffy white head. Nose is a spicy clove-cum-banana, lots of cereal and dough there too.  Refreshing taste, light sweetness, medium body, yeasty herb finish. A very good beer. Theyve had long enough to practice mind you. Prost!
Everything that youd expect in a Hefeweizen. Good Appearance, Banana Clove almost buttery taste, thick on the palate. Best Hefeweizen Ive ever had.
Nice cloudy appearance as you would expect from a wheat beer. Hints of floral aroma. Its smooth and has a slight bit of citrus at first. The after taste is not as good. Overall, an average beer.
Slightly cloudy with small head. Good floral accents with a tasty caramel undertones resulting in a very drinkable beer

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 Cloudy, light straw with frothy head when poured from bottle into the glass. Banana, bubble gum and baking bread aromas. A touch of banana and bubblegum sweetness  leads into a yeasty and only gently bitter mid and back palate. Perfectly carbonated. All of this leads to an incredibly refreshing  beer. The best of its kind, especially with German style sausages.

Was shocked to realize that I had never rated this classic.  Several years ago, I stated that the stringent German beer laws resulted in uniformly boring beers.  I cringe thinking about this idiotic statementt.  This beer pours a hazy yellow with a massive head.  Smells of spice.  The vibrancy of the mouthfeel might trick a drinker into thinking this beer was spiced.  Flavors of bananas and citrus.  A great beer.  A perfect go to when you feel like grabbing the devil you know.  Bottle - Intown Market - Atlanta, GA

Bottle at home. Pours a cloudy gold with lively white head. Aroma is banana, yeasty, bready goodness. Taste is highly carbed, somewhat spicy, slightly sweet. Full, creamy mouthfeel. An always delicious classic.

500ml bottle. Quite hollow in flavor. Expected more than just herbal/spice notes.

 / Rated on the go
heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, bread, hazy, golden, light body, thin feel,

500 ml bottle. Golden, a little foggy, with a minimal head. Aroma with banana, close to pinapple. No yeast taste. Somewhat sweet. Body rather thin. Refreshing and almost enjoyable, since I normally dont like Weissbier.

A - Bright white 3 finger head that retains very well. Thick splotches of lacing.

S - Savory banana, clove, wheat.

T - Follows the nose except the spice is muted. Banana with plenty of dry peppery wheat. Bubblegum and melon come in to play. Finishes with a creamy spice flavor.

M - Full body. Prickly carbonation.

Very solid for the style. One of the best for sure.

Serving type: bottle

04-06-2011

Hefe weissen when it is at its best. 
Multitude of flavours. Fruits, bananas and vitamins . Refreshing even in this wintery swedish spring. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The best and most complex Hefe, loads of Banana, dough, bread, very yeasty really creamy, silky mouthfeel caramel notes in there too really crisp and clean for an unfiltered beer. World class
just top notch hefe beer! eminently drinkable stuff.. soft, full and moreish
Cloudy yellow with nice fluffy white head. Aroma is classic hefe with yeast esters, banana, wheat. Taste is slightly bitter with a nice fruity and estery note. Very drinkable and refreshing. Classic.
Not sure there is a more basically perfect, full flavored Hef in the world. All other hefs are imitations that dont quite live up. Hef and only hef, perfectly done. French bread in a glass.

fles 50cl
kleur: goudgeel, niet helder, flinke witte schuimkraag
geur: fris, tarwe
smaak: tarwe, graan, fris en licht bitter
lekker fris bier, voor warm weer.

Bottle at Sybarite Pig. Tulip. Beautiful hazy golden yellow with fluffy thick white head. Little lacing. Fresh aroma of floral notes and biscuit. Taste is floral, yeast, wheat grains and finishes extremely smooth. Light carbonation with floral aftertaste. I dont usually drink hefes but this is very good.

50cl bottle. Orange cloudy with medium white head. Nose : yeast, tart, bread, banana and hay. Quite complex aromas. Sip : low to medium density, creamy texture with good carbonation. Sweet soapy and grainy flavour, strong yeast taste. Getting dry and spicy. Very refreshing. Best example of this style. One of my favourites.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a giant head that dissipates into a cap and leaves great lacing.  Strong aroma of banana bread.  Had a lot of yeastiness and sweetness on the tongue.  Medium bodied beer, feels thick and creamy.  This is my favorite Hefe Ive had to date.

I get hazy white-yellow beer with a huge head.
Aroma has banana but also something full and sweet - malts?
Palate is fullbodied and velvety and taste is in really good balance.
Like a carbonated banana-milkshake with spicy yeast.
This is just a classic hefe all around. Nice hazy pour with a white head. Aromas of malt, yeast, banana, and hints of clove. Wonderful wheat flavor and very refreshing. Great brew.

Pours a cloudy amber with huge, fluffy head. Classic aromas of banana, clove and soft, fruity esters. Great yeasty, bready flavor. Nice, light mouthfeel. Carbonation makes this a very refreshing drinkable brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Originally rated 9.9.2011 at Janoinen Lohi, Helsinki. Draught, colour is hazy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Banana, wheat and malts. Better than average weissbier.

Basically the essential Hefe (along with Paulaner), and I cant really put my finger on anything even remotely wrong with this brew. So withinin the style of hefeweissen, this is perfection. Really beautiful orange color and an astonishing head to match. Smell of lemon and banana, citrus peel and clove. Spicy and fresh with a medium body and very slick texture. Aftertaste is complex and inviting. Get this on draught at your local german bierstube.
First Weihenstaphaner and Im not disappointed. Clove, banana, and spice aroma. Flavor follows with some yeast and a touch of pepper on the finish. really  light and refreshing.

totally smashed by preconceptions of wheat beer, absolutely delicious. that wheat flavour wasnt unpleasant this time, surrounded by banana and spices. very light and unfortunately seemed a bit foamy in the mouth, but a fantastic beer.
Poured a murky brown with a small white head. Aroma of sweet malt and spices. Medium body, flavour of sweet wheat and cloves.
Might be the perfect weissbier. On draft at Schnitzel Platz in Glendale Heights, Illinois.  Hints of banana and easy drinking.  Goes great with good German kraut and schnitzel.

A hazy gold brew that has the smell of wheat and some hints at spice.  Taste is very refreshing with a good mix of wheat flavors and some hints at maybe a clove or coriander.  Not sure if either was used in this brew but it does seem to taste as if it has some.
Got this as a sampler bottle but plan to pick up allot more when I am doing up some braughts this summer.

Bottle @ home. profumo di banana e lieviti a tonnellate. odora di pane fresco. Il colore è giallo intenso con alcuni riflessi ambrati, opaca come tutte le weiss ed è visibile una carbonatazione marcata. La schiuma è densissima, sembra panna, perlage fine ma non durevole. Il gusto rispecchia il profumo con molta banana, un che di citrico e sapore di lieviti. 
Una delle migliori weizen che si possano bere.

Flaske fra polet: første gang jeg drakk dette var fra fat på flyplassen i Berlin, og det var en åpenbaring. Lys oranjse, uklar, og med en herlig aroma av banan, nellik og litt karamellaktig sødme. Midtveis i glasset ønsket jeg at avgangen ville bli kraftig forsinket. Flaskeversjonen er også en benchmark - dette er en klassiker innen stilen, og verdt hver eneste krone.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours straw yellow eith high white head, diminishing. Some lacing. Aroma is of wheat, bananas, yeast. Taste is of wheat, bananas, yeast, hints of acidity. Palate: ligth-medium body. Overall: Very nice yeast features. Refreshing.

Bottle (500 ml). Thanks to czar and hoppypocket! Hazy yellow/orange with a frothy white head and some lacing. Aroma is yeasty with a lot of banana esters and wheat/acidic notes. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with banana, yeast, wheat, slight acidity, malt and a touch of spices. Medium body. Slightly dry. Drinkable, refreshing and well-balanced. One of the best Hefeweizen!
Drought. Hazy pale yellow apperance withnsmall whitish foamy head, citrus aroma, low carbonation, sweetish taste with a tang of bitter orange, lomg finish leaving citrus aroma on your tongue.

Impressive head, doesnt last long though. Orange/brown, cloudy. Spicy yeasty banana aroma. Sweet-ish wheaty flavour, theres also some alcohol-bitterness in the back of the mouth. A good example of the style.
Pours cloudy with big white head and excellent lacing. Great carbonation with medium body. Wonderful balance of citrus, banana and spice. Easily one of the best Hefs Ive ever had.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pours a hazy and light golden colour, heavily carbonated and with an enormous white foamy head. Some yeast is visible in the glass towards the end of the pour. Aroma is yeast, wheat and banana. Mouthfeel is medium. Superbly balanced flavour, with the slightly sweet wheat and hints of banana and spices and a dry finish. A refreshing and thoroughly enjoyable beer, the best hefeweizen Ive tasted.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a nice head and marvellous lacing. Aroma has banana, cloves, lemon, wheat. Taste has the same bananas, cloves, citrus, crisp wheat. Dry finish. Medium body with full carbonation.  A solid hefe, one of the best for sure. Something i could drink gallons during a nice summer day.
Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Wheat,yeast,malt,fruit and spices aroma ; Hazy orange color with huge head ; Sweeter taste ; Refreshing ; Soft carbon ; Superb Hefe.

hazy golden colour with a  bit less foam than the average of wheatbeers; aroma of bread, yeast, honey and banana; taste is a bit sweer and less sourish than expected in case of a wheatbeer; a bit strange, but great
Drinking this beer was a pleasure, I am a fan of hefeweizen anyway. This one is definitely a step above the rest. It is a little sweeter than the average, incredibly smooth, top notch!

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2013 Ive had this beer so many times because 1) its awesome and 2) its widely available.  I have found that sometimes I get the odd dodgy bottle that tastes like a lager, but by and large its reliable.   The banana and spice flavours are perfect in the aftertaste - subtly sweet and very moreish.  This wheat beer sets the standard.  At its best its a 4.3 for me, but Ive had some that would rate a lot lower.  4 is a fair average.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Very refreshing beer. Similar to the Kristall version but with a little more depth. Banana, clove. Sweet, sour and lightly spicy. One of the best wheat beers.

12 oz bottle pour in a glass and what golden color with a nice looking white head like a crown and nice sweet aroma of clove and bananas. Tastes so rich and refreshing and very palatable. Its one of my favorite German Weiss Beers. Would recommend specially to those who like Weiss or even to those whove never tried Weiss beers.

Its been a long time coming for this one. At one time German Hefeweizen was my absolute favourite style and I was dying to be to try this. It was not available in my area until recently. Im not going to bore you or myself with the obvious. For instance it possess all the natural characteristics of quality German Hefe. Its got the banana and corriander bouquet. Noticeable lack of "orange" or citrus though. Its got the cloudy opaque hue. What I do find surprising comes with both the taste and palate. Everything is on point right up until the very end where both taste and mouth feel just drop right off.
500 ml bottle. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Taste is sweet and malty, lots of wheat. Good weiss without any special characteristics, but not in a bad way.

Great tasting beer! Great tasting beer! Great tasting beer! Great tasting beer! Great tasting beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

As good as a wheat beer gets!  Cloudy yellow with white head.  Nose of wheat, grass, orange, and banana.  Full mouthfeel with significant carbonation, moderate body and finish.  Very tasty, super sessionable.
Gyllengul, dimmig öl med ett kraftigt, typiskt weissbierskum. Doft av jäst, banan och lätt kryddighet. Detta återkommer i smaken på denna öl som är en av de bättre weissbieren.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a very cloudy gold color with an huge white frothy head. Strong aroma of bananas and some clove. Medium body with heavy carbonation. Sweet flavor with yeast. Sweet finish, no noticable hop flavor. An excellent hefe, quite possibly the best?
Really strong bubblegum and banana scent. Pours a dense, foamy gold. Light carbonation, tart taste with a touch of sweetness.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 Cloudy body with large head of foam.  Very smooth & drinkable with banana flavors and no bitterness.

Delicious.  A fine example of the hefe weissen, this has a nice full flavor one would expect in finer wheats.  Pours a nice cloudy straw with a fine clutch of head, this is a great beer for a cool summer - where you need something a little richer to carry the day

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dim light golden orange appearance,  a big cream colored head -    lighter appearance that other German Hefeweizen. Fairly spicy yeasty, appetizing banana and clove, wheat malty aroma. Sweet wheat malty, delicious banana, moderate clove, fairly spicy yeasty flavor with a bit dry, spicy finish. Everything in this beer is in perfect balance, delicious sweetness (banana, wheat malt), great spiciness (yeast, clove). Overall: a classic specimen, highly recommended.

Bottle, hazy yellow/ orange color with a medium white head. Aroma is strong banana and some clove. Flavor is yeast, bready with some clove and a banana finish. Palate is light/ medium, refreshing and tasty. Solid Hefe.
THE ORIGINAL! All other Weissbiers grandmother.. No comments needed, The best.... Word...

Bottle at 16 Tons Taphouse. Cracked one of these for the first time in a while the other day, still doesnt fail to impress. Slightly cloudy golden straw color, slight white head. Aroma is citrusy, warm and inviting. Body is lively, refreshing and clean. Little bit of malt, finish is brief and just a bit sharp. What a hefe should be, could drink it all day.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2013 appearance: Hazy gold color with a firm and full white top. Looks very tasteful. 

smell: Banana, wheat and yeast. Bit of bubblegum. 

taste: Banana sweetness, with a bit of a bubblegum taste. Yeasty and wheaty. Broken up by a tiny bit of citrus and a copper like bitterness. 

mouthfeel: Medium bodied, creamy with a dry finish. Medium carbonation. Goes down well. 

overall:A very nice, refreshing and tasteful white beer.

50cl bottle. Glass: Weizen. Pours a yellow-orangish colour with a perfect white head, very nice appearance. Wheat and banana on the nose, typically Hefeweizen-like. Taste is pretty much the same, but surprisingly depurated...sweet but not too much, creamy mouthfeel, good body and carbonation, etc. All the ingredients are very well balanced, Its impossible to dislike this one.

Det tar en evighet innan det vita skummet lägger sig tillräckligt för att kunna ta den första smaken. Då framträder banan, citron, vitpeppar och örter. Banan, rättare sagt skumbanan, och apelsinskal är de dominerande dofterna, men där finns dessutom en stickighet som jag härrör till örter och kryddor.

Schiuma persistente, bianca, pannosa. Al naso sentori di grano, cereali, note fruttate. Corpo medio, il gusto è dolce ma mai eccessivo, cereali, lieviti, note fruttate. Bel retrogusto fruttato ed una leggera nota luppolata che pulisce bene il palato. Molto beverina, rinfrescante, equilibratissima.

Draft. Pour is hazy lemon with a frothy white head and great lacing. Big banana, clove, sweet fruits, biscuity, bread, straw, orange peel, somewhat tangy aroma. Taste is crisp and spicy, clove, coriander, banana, straw, grass, tangy, and fruity with a dry, crisp finish and a touch of clove in the backend. Medium body with high carbonation. Super refreshing - I could chug this stuff. Could be the best Hefe I have ever had.

50 cl bottle. Golden colour, clear liquid and white nice head, minimal after some time. Nice aroma, with hints of citrus, herbs banana and wheat. Quite fruity.The taste and the palate are the best parts. Taste just perfect, perfectly achieved sweet/bitter balance, with salty and yeasty notes. Medium to full body, thick/creamy texture and perfect average carbonation. The finish is long and delicious, beginning sweet and finishing a little bitter. Overall the best Hefe Weissbier I have tasted so far, one or two steps above Paulaner or Franziskaner. To enjoy as much as possible, as well as her sister Weihenstephaner Vitus.
Bottle. Aroma banana, light citrusy. Colour lightly hazy yellow. Taste orange peel, grain, light yeasty.

No complaints. Has the nice german hefe taste. Flavors blend almost perfectly. Start to finish is clean. Had with spaetzel and snitzle. All goes together well. Big fan of the german ales. Sweet on the taste. Going to try sierra nevada next.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2013 The perfect hefeweizen: pours hazy orange-gold with large white head. Just the hint of sweetness mixed well with malt, wheat, and a clove spiciness that finishes it off and rounds out the aftertaste. Can taste the wood it was finished in with a complex background. Gentle but present bitter finish. Moderate carbination. Excellent.
I find hefeweizens too sweet. Particularly the German ones. Do they need to be distinguished from the hefeweizens that come from other countries? Where are their categories?

Hazy gold with a mountainous white head. Spicy German Weissbier nose, grainy, some phenolics and a bit of bubble gum. Flavor is balanced between malt, wheat and mild clove spiciness. Good carbonation, but not excessive - overall a great weissbier!

In a weizen glass, a soft half centimeter white head appears and lasts for about a half minute before slowly dieing into the body. Typical cloudy body is seen. The smell is the banana up front with some yeastiness and graininess. The taste is sweet with previously mentioned flavors combined decently. The palate is light to medium with a decent creaminess all around. Overall, this is a good hefeweizen and good for me.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2013 Appearance: thick white head, very cloudy darker gold color, specks of brown yeast floating in the beer Aroma: banana, hint of lemon, wheat, yeast, very aromatic Taste: yeast, banana, lemon, bread Palate: full on the tongue, goes down so smooth, no aftertaste, lots of c02, frothy Overall: an amazing beer, very refreshing, just feels great in the mouth, delicious  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a huge head and lots of lacing.  Aroma is fruity with a banana smell and wheat, bread, and clove.  Taste is bready and malty with banana and cloves.  Very good hefeweizen.

Ar: caramel, bread, cereal, toast, citrus, floral, dough, bubblegum, clove, ginger, 
Ap: orange, amber, hazy, cloudy, frothy, white foam, 
T: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
P: medium body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long finish, 
O: Lovely stuff. Better from the tap than bottle, but still very tasty.

A bottle of 330 ml. Poured into a weizen glass with a capacity of 300 ml. This one pours great, gave me a huge white head, 4 fingers in height with great retention. When it finally came down, a thin strip of foam remained on the beers surface. Pale golden colour, slighty hazy.
Sweet aroma of bananas and clove, less strong once the foam goes down of course, but still there during the whole drinking time, and quite pleasant.
Taste is also just a bit sweet and fruity, with some spices and yeast traces.
Rich body and as mach carbonation as needed. Leaves your palate dry.
A great beer, maybe I will seek it again after I finish my three other bottles.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Haparanda. Hazy orangeish yellow beer with a huge white, foamy head. Very yeasty and bananic aroma. Taste is quite sweet, banana and fruits present. Mouthfeel is fizzy and sticky, not bad at all.
Nice beer, special flavor, maybe its not the beer that you can drink all day long but its very special and aromatic

Appearance:  Hazy golden orange, thick pillowy white head endures.
Aroma:  Bubblegum, bananas, oranges.
Flavour:  Lemons and oranges, spicy notes in background.
Mouthfeel:  Very smooth, moderate carbonation, low bitterness, but some definitely in the medium length drying finish.
Overall:  Outstanding!

Hazy orange, big white head. Aroma: wheat, banana, orange peel, spice. Taste: all of the above, with a touch of vanilla and apple.  Dry, bitter finish. Zippy carbonation and a slightly oily mouthfeel. An excellent hefe - exceptionally balanced, easy to drink and full of flavour.

Bottle from Tescos. Colour is hazy amber, very big foaming white head. Nose is banana, clove, nutmeg, spices, lemon, yeasty, wheat grain. Taste is banana, clove, nutmeg, caramel. Body is fairly light although bit oily.

Bottle. Hazy hay yellow liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of banana, clove, earthy wheat, light vanilla and bread. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of cloves, banana and bread. Medium bodied with high carbonation. A classic.
Nice cloudy golden color with a thick head.  Good yeasty aroma.  Sublte taste of banana and clove.  Was expecting a stronger flavor.  Still a good hefe.

2013/01/23 - Pours a cloudy straw color with a massive, pillowy, white head that lingers. Aroma is cloves, spices, yeast, bananas and faint citrus/coconut? Taste is sweet malts, yeast, banana and spices. Well carbonated, light to medium mouthfeel. One of my favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bomber into pint glass...Pours hazy orange,  thick white head...  bought this cuz f the high ratinng, and i like a good hefe...  glad i got it,   crisp citrus fruit aroma,  and very smooth easy drinking, orange spice malts,  love it

Oh hey, reminds me of a much better Stella, citrus head, smooth finish. Great alcohol percentage for the taste. Yummy 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Cloudy golden yellow colour, fluffy white head and aroma of banana & cloves. Spicy malt & wheat flavour with notes of citrus, banana & cloves and a light tangy bitterness, through to a clean finish. Smooth soapy mouth feel, moderate carbonation. Very drinkable.

16.9 oz bottle.  Pours orange and cloudy with a dense white head that clings to the glass.  Smell is sweet malts, wheat, lemons, spices and yeast.  Light to medium body with lively carbonation.  The flavor is wheat, lemons, yeast, light spices, crackers and bananas.  Minimal hop bitterness with a clean finish.  This is the best wheat beer Ive tried.  Smooth and easy to drink.
Tap at all in hua hin, hua hin, thailand. Hazy deep yellow color, medium white head. Wheaty and yeasty aroma, citrus. Nice wheaty taste, sweetness, yeast, fresh, citrus.
Een heerlijk weissbier. Heeft een prettige zachte smaak en is licht van kleur. Een aanrader.

Hazy galden with a tall fluffy white head. Aroma bursting with wheat, banana and clove, some earthiness. Creamy, smooth, medium body, soft carbonation.  Luxurious wheat with the banana/clove/yeast seamlessly filling out the rest. Clean, refreshing and delicious.
murky orange color.  nice, long lasting white head.  Smells of wheat.  Very smooth, refreshing taste.  Slight wheat, citrus, orange flavor.  DElicious.
Discretamente mediocre, un po citrica ma poco aromatica. Giusto se non cè altro una sera si può bere.

Pours a murky honey yellow with plenty of haze and a cloud like head of foam.  In the glass its got style and beauty.  The nose is bracing and not run away with fruity sweetness.  Banana, wheat , earthy yeast, fruits, clove and as it warms a little - some pepper.  The palate is immaculate with tall wheat, sweet biscuit and citric hops. Its clean and civilized.  Leaves with a small taste of alcohol and  drier and drier as it drinks.  A resounding hefe that dares to growl a little in the glass.

This was the first truly craft beer that I had ever tried, and I remember it fondly even though I might not have been able to fully appreciate its aesthetics and complexity at the time. Bought a bomber bottle from Wegmans for about $3. My first impressions likened this beer to fresh banana bread with some clove, and it was very smooth and easy to drink.  Had a good combination of bitterness and sweetness that were both subtle and pleasant in character. A definite treat and the best wheat beer Ive tried to this date.
One of the best white beers there is. Always makes me think of bananas.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Large white head that lasts forever. Straw colored cloudy body. Aroma is quite modest, but the taste is full bodied with hints of pine, citrus, banana, exotic fruits and saaz hops. I imagine that this one is great in company with seafood.
My friend Erik from Canada introduced me with this beer. Probably the best bottles hefe-weissbier I have ever drunk

50cl bottle from Drink Shop Tallinn.  Yeast and wheat are perfectly balanced. A faint sense of summer fruit. Pale yellow, actually more clear then cloudy, even if poured perfectly. Thick, slightly brownish head. Perfect amount of yeast makes it really enjoyable. Medium bitter, fruity beer with faint honey endnotes. Perfect fizz, medium body and slightly rugged texture. Slightly dry. This beer should be served in the right glass and at the right temperature, otherwise you will spoil it. Suits well fish and light pork meals. Possibly my favorite German Hefeweisen.

Bottle. Pours clear perfect straw with airy white head. Clear aroma of hops and grain with a subtle boozy note in the (very) long nose. Subtle, sweetish grainy flavour that reveals itself in its perfection after a few seconds in the mouth. A fantastic hefeweizen. Recommended to everyone.

Tap pours cloudy medium yellow with a tall white head. The aroma is musty sweet grains with some spice and light banana. The taste is super smooth wheat, just a touch of the earthy spice with the banana and clove from the yeast. Filling with the unfiltered wheat and healthy carbonation. Very refreshing and clean on the finish. An amazing what beer, the standard.

Draft at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur.  Poured a cloudy medium amber with a thin white head and some broken lace. The aroma is of bananas strangely enough and its rather strong too. The flavour starts out as bitter and a little alcoholic but then the yeasty mellow, slightly citrus side takes over. One of the best Weissbiers, but I have a few that I like.

banana, bubblegum, citrus, golden, hazy, rocky head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, salty, light body, slick feel, average carbonation, astringent, bitter
Pours cloudy dark golden with rocky white head.  Big aromas of banana and bubble gum erupt with a citrus (grape fruit) backdrop.  Watery thin in the sip, but carbonation on the tongue immediate making it feel larger bodied.  Slickness remains on the mouthfeel.  Banana like sweetness with a more foreward bitterness than previous experiences with Hefeweizen.  Bitterness lightens up, but persists with a slight clove spiced astringency in the aftertaste.  It is a refreshing beer!

Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of banana esters, bubble gum and slightly bitter hops. Some citrus in the mix as well. Taste is bitter up front but then balancing with the banana esters and slight sweetness. Smooth and very easy to drink. A solid hefe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2015 A great weiss.
Deep golden colour and a huge head. Aroma of yeast and fruit, banana. Very fresh with lovely taste. A great weiss.
Excellent weizen, probably for me the best till now.

Tasted from bottle in Widmer Hefe glass. Buttery golden color with a stiff white head. 

Classic Bavarian wheat aroma with clove and spice. 

Some saltiness but very subtle. 

Lingers with a little sourness and alcohol burn. 

Seems like a classic representation of the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
50cl bottle from ça sent la biere, mail order, portugal. Golden cloudy appearance with nice medium white head. Medium to high carbonation. Low sweetness. Nice citric wheat aroma.
Flaveurs de bananes, de mangue et un peu de gomme balloune. Belle pétillance, couleur laiton patiné. Opaque, un peu épaisse. Très agréable blanche allemande, totalement fidèle au style.
Crisp and fresh. Very tasty. Colour is a little cloudy, but overall a very nice beer.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Always a tricky pour this virtualoly pours itself such is the heady intensity. Deep hazy yellow in colour which is quite fizzy and rather spicy opn the tongue. Taste dilutes as it hits the middle and develops beautifully a mealy lemon like quality. Very nice timeless classic. Beautiful

Dun jaune flou et brillant, malgré le paradoxe, cette Weihenstephaner explose avec un nez banane-girofle qui invite à une lampée franche et précipitée. En bouche, on nous sert exactement ce que le nez nous avait laissé croire et plus dune texture qui a de quoi saturer les papilles. Je nai plus de doute; cette bière mérite sa réputation et son statut exemplaire.
Bottle.  Taste is banana, wheat, clove and sunshine.  Everything you would want in a hefe.  Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Pours deep yellow, almost light orange, less than a finger white head very murky, nice lacing that dissipates quickly.  Smells wheat and cracker, then sweet fruit, pears mostly, then a bit nutty, yeasty.  Taste spicy up front, a bit of cloves, mellows to wheat, pears, crackers, slight alcohol, not much though, peppery spice, cloves and pear linger in the finish.  Medium body, fantastic carbonation, no alcohol heat detected. Overall excellent for the style, not my favorite style, but this one will be purchased again, very easy drinking, very complex.

Bottle and draught, always as excellent. Yellow hazy. Very distinctive yeast aroma/profile. Lots of cloves and fruity tones (banana esters, some citrus etc), with wheat mixed in. Nice body. This is what I compare all other weizes to. The closer they get, the better they are.-- bb/h

Bottle. Everything about this beer is professional - from the looks (impressive head), through the aroma (citrus and clove, then banana, vanilla and pear, then some yeasty smokiness and biscuity malt) to the taste (malty-fruity flavour, yeasty, velvety palate; light tart, pretending to be sweetish). No fault to be detected, though it also does not strike me as particularly outstanding. Just a very good hefeweizen.

Type: 500ml bottle
Glass: Pilsner glass 
From: Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, Calif., on Jan. 5, 2013
Price: $3.49 
Misc.: Part of the bottle reads Brewed under the purity law, of 1516.

Poured a golden orange, slightly hazy color with at least four fingers of soft rocky white head. Lots of head. Minimal lacing with great retention.

Smelled cloves, banana and honey up front, followed by some slightly corn and skunky malts with a whiff of vomit. Could smell the carbonation.

Tasted much better than the smell. Got cloves, spices and banana with a sweet aftertaste. Light lemon grass as well. Just fantastic.

Light body. Oily texture. Lively (above average) carbonation. Long finish.

Just a fantastic hefeweizen and another damn good beer by Weihenstephaner. Im not too into hefes, but Id be willing to reconsider after having this.
Excellent beer!!! Cloudy hazy golden pour, taste of wheat, cereal, citrus, thick creamy feel, light body, lively.
Cloudy straw color with a thin head that disapated quickly.. Minimal lacing. Strong citrus nose and taste. Good over all flavor.

Perfect texture. Well mixed flavours, with a hint of banana and raisin. One of the more "tasteful" weissbiers. This is really something else than Erdinger Weissbier. A great taste-experience, and, when poured properly, the foam "lid" makes it look outstanding aswell.
Wonderful yeast notes. Cloudy, hazy golden color. A classic example of the style.

Legendaarinen vehnäolut kaatuu vehnälasiin vaalean kultaisena, sameana ja hienolla kestävällä vaahdolla, jonka toivoo joka kerta laskevan nopeammin. Haju on hyvin banaanimainen, ehkä hieman sitrusta taustalla, joka tuntuu kirpeytenä. Yrttistä mausteisuutta, ruohoisuutta ja lievää leipäisyyttä on myös havaittavissa. Maku on tasaisen banaaninen, greippinen, hieman mainen ja marjapensainen. Leipäinen mallas tuntuu etenkin alussa ja lievää ruohoista humalan katkeruutta tulee loppua kohti suuhun. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen ja jää pyörimään kitalakeen. Kaiken kaikkiaan legendaarinen vehnäolut ja hyvin maistuva kesäjuoma, joka maistuu myös tämän pariskunnan kauniimmalle osapuolelle.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2015 Cloudy straw color with a big foamy white head.  Nice yeasty aroma with wheat, banana and clove.  Taste is a ripe banana with accompanying sweetness, clove, bready yeast and a tanginess from the wheat.  Soft medium body with plenty of carbonation.

Gold hazy color with nice two finger head.  Decent lacing.  Smells yeasty with wheat and banana.  Taste same with wheat upfront and hints of banana. Light, pleasing mouthfeel.  Easy to drink and good example of the style.  One of my favorite hefeweissbiers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500mL bottle (BB 29.10.13). Pours a wonderfully cloudy golden hue with a lasting white frothy head. A very nice clove/citrus aroma which follows through to the flavour with a nice sweetness to boot. Im not normally a fan of hefe but this is a very nice beer.

Pours a slightly hazy light golden color with a huge bubbly white head that transforms into meringue on top. A steady stream of carbonation bubbly rise from the bottom causing a seemingly endless head. Smells of banana, bubble gum and a hint of pepper, nutmeg and allspice. A lightly sugary sweet malt provides a backdrop for the showcase of yeasty aromas. the flavor is lightly sweet malt with a bready yeasty taste. Medium to thin body with a spirited level of carbonation and a sweet spicy mouthfeel. This is a really nice beer! I guess if youve been doing this that long you are bound to get it right.
Bouteille de 500ml,robe blonde opaque, arôme de banane et de levure. En bouche, même chose que les arômes! Typiquement allemand!

No bottling information.
Appearance: A huge creamy white head slowly dissipates into the hazy orange and straw colored body while leaving foamy lacing behind.
Aroma: The aroma is complex with hints of bubblegum, cloves, and light cloves spice through it with just a light tart citrus on the finish. Excellent.
Taste: This is really nicely balanced, not as pungent as the aroma, but the flavors are all here. Crisp wheat provides a clean light citrus while the yeast gives very light banana on the intro and throughout with a very light spice on the finish. This is a great summer beer, very refreshing.
Palate: Light creamy body, with moderate carbonation.
Overall: Excellent value beer and a standard for the style. This is a necessary buy for anyone who comes across it.

Ottima weizen, che inizia già a stupire con il suo aroma pieno, fruttato (banane) con una nota che ricorda i pop corn. Ingresso in bocca dolce abbastanza carbonata e corposa. Beverina e intensa. Uno splendido esempio di weizen in tutto e per tutto.

Cloves, bananas, bubblegum, and flowers on the nose.  A hazy orange-amber hue with a fluffy, sudsy white head of great retention.  Off-dry with a light bitterness.  Medium-full bodied, full and flzzy carbonation, and a short finish with some fruity and floral notes lingering afterwards.  Outstandingly refreshing.

Deep cloudy, almost muddy yellow to orange (If it wouldnt be muddy, then golden) with medium bit lasting white head. Nice thou fast disappearing laces.
Aroma.. its all about yeast and wheat with notes of honey, citrus, banana.
Sweet with bit spicy light bitter finish.
Quite interesting beer for a change. Definitely great refreshing quality brew.

One of my favourite weissbiers. It doesnt get much better than this.cereal, toast, roasty, herbs, golden, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish,

0,5 liter bottle. Bought at V-Markt in Munich. Golden cloudy color. Citrus notes. Great flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2013 Cloudy yellow golden color with big white head which stays for a long time. Aroma of wheat, yeast, some banana and orange. Taste is dry sweet, has wheat, malt, orange, some bready and spicy notes. Aftertaste is short and lightly bitter. Medium carbonation. Very nice refreshing wheat beer.

16.9oz Bottle A - Pours a golden hazy color, two finger frothy off white head, excellent retention, lots of bubbles S - Banana, yeast, dough. T - Banana bread, malted wheat, mild spice. M - Light/medium bodied, good carbonation, smooth clean finish. O - The standard for Hefeweizen!
Really good weissbier. Pours a cloudy gold with a strong persistent head. Aroma of citrus with a flavor to match. Some cereal also present. Light bodied and creamy.

Appearance was cloudy light gold with creamy white lasting 1 finger head, rings of lacing. Aromas fruity berry, banana, bubblegum, dough,  hints of wheat and sweet 2-row malts. Taste sweet malty backbone with the fruity yeasts coming out to play like banana, berry, bubblelicous gum, slight orange peel. Palate smooth crispy CO2 with light-medium body, then lasting fruity slightly dryish glorious finish. My top 5 hefes.

0,5 l bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a medium white head. Yeast aroma with a fruity bitter taste. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Peckhams Union Square, Aberdeen. It pours golden yellow with a thick white head. The nose is wheat, banana bread, spice and dough. The taste orange peel, wheat, spice, banana, light tartness and dough with a dry finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. A very drinkable and well balanced weissbier.
On tap at WVRST in Toronto. Aroma citrus, bubblegum. golden, cloudy. frothy, white foam. lively carbonation.
500 ml bottle. Bought at Interspar, Austria, 0,89 EUR. Pours cloudy yellowish orange with a thick white head. Banana-like yeasty, fruity aroma with some citrus and wheat. A very good hefe, I mean it!
muito boa, mas parece ter menos gosto de trigo que outras, como a Baden Baden. vale a pena experimentar!

Bottle shared with McTapps. Simple and average Weizen. Nice cloudy in colour but as fruity as the others in the aroma. I miss that sourness coming from the belgian wits. Quality weizen but in no way my favourite one.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Light milky yellow-golden in colour with big and steady head. Taste of rich yeast, light malt and sweet dough ends in s gentle banana tone. Easy to drink but not the best German Weizen ever.

Pours murky golden colour with thick creamy white head and good lacing. Aroma of sweet yeast, bread and banana. Medium bodied and creamy. Pleasantly sweet on the tongue with a touch of spice. No noticeable bitterness. Nice creamy finish. Well balanced. A classic Hefeweizen.
Pours a cloudy amber. Pleasant aroma and palate.  A very good, drinkable hefe.
Pours a classic cloudy orange with an impressive white head. -aroma is wheat, candy foam banana, doughish. Taste is slightly sour, banana, citrus, palate a foamy and carbonated.

#253
Die älteste Brauerei der Welt und dann so ein peinliches Etikett! Schade, schade, aber der Inhalt zählt. Und da gibt es durchweg gute Noten, auch wenn ich die Würzigkeit eines <echten> Hefe-Weissbieres vermisse. Irgendwie ist mir das zu sehr Mainstream, da fehlt die Kernigkeit. Ein <normales> Augustiner Weissbier hat da mehr zu bieten!
	
Test vom 16.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,12,12,12,6,12 - 11,70

15/12/2012 on tap @ GEIB. Dorata, torbida, opalescente, schiuma bianca morbida, abbondante e discretamente persistente. Al naso aroma molto pulito e "fresco" di frumento, limone, banana. In bocca è piuttosto armoniosa, fruttata e speziata, beverina, leggermente acidula, molto piacevole. Corpo medio-basso, carbonazione corretta. Non male, anche se non è certo lo stile che preferisco.

Pours a hazy straw with two and a half fingers of rocky white head. Pretty good retention and a little lacing. Aromas of banana, grass/hay, floral, bread/dough. Flavor is bread, bold wheat, hay, with a mild, sweet aftertaste. Moderate carbonation and a light body, very smooth mouthfeel. Very tasty and refreshing. Dangerously drinkable. An awesome beer.
