Bottle. Cloudy Orange colour residual head. Aroma of boiled sweets. Taste is Orange peel and cloves, quite warm on the tongue. A nice beer but I wouldnt say it is the best German hefe. Enjoyable though.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Pours a golden color with pleanty of fluffy white head.  Crisp and clean taste with no fruit finish like many American 's.  A classic beer that truly lives up to its reputation. The way a hefe was meant to be.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle from tescos. decent hefe nothing standout. head lasting longer then frank. think the paulner could be the nicest and more complex hefe around. yet to try others . this is not a bad hefeweizen.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a fairly small white head. Nose is light and citrusy. Tastes like summer, with a nice bit of citrus in there. Not sour or sweet.

Havent had a Hefe in a while. I needed a break from all the IPAs, Imperial Stouts and shit. Purchased from a local grocery store for exactly $2.99. Pours an amber, tangy orange with an eruptive off-white head which had wonderful legs. Smells of European hop pellets, wheat, pickled pears, Flintstones vitamins, German yeast and some lime. Tastes of rosemary, wheat bread, pollinated flowers, noble hops and and light fruit. Good.

Dark hazy golden colour with orange hues and shades .  Pops a big foamy head of average longevity . Light and thin aroma balancing between wheat and banana and fruits . Yeasty and fruity taste with a subtle banana feeling  matching the aroma while adding a bit of citric mouthfeel in the end , typical character for a weiss but a unique balance in this bottle . Overall a brilliant hefeweiss.

Botella. Sin duda alguna la mejor cerveza de trigo que he probado hasta la fecha. Apariencia limpia espuma densa, olfato levaduras y notas acidas. Sabor equilibrio perfecto del trigo con el resto de las maltas con acidez bien puesta y un toque ahumado
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 watch out, a huge head on this beer! middle of the road beer in my opinion. But I can see why people rate it highly, just not my style.

On tap  11/23, Pours a cloudy golden color with a thick white head that leaves great lacing.  Smells of bananas, wheat, and yeast. Tastes of wheat, bananas, coriander, lemon, and citrus. Mouthfeel was smooth and chewy, with great carbonation. A lot of great flavors going on here. This is the best hefeweizen out there I?ve had. Glad to have experienced it on tap.
500ml bottle. Hazy amber color. Nice thick white head, stays. Massive banana, malty, sweet aroma. Banana, sweetish, some plastic, grainy flavor. Very rich taste and very drinkable.

Trigo de manual, probado en barril. Color paja turbio con tonos mates y una corona blanca más persistente de lo habitual en su estilo. Aroma balanceado entre plátano y clavo. En boca es muy fresca y floral volviendo el plátano con toques de pimienta en el retrogusto. Ligeramente baja de gas para ser un trigo alemán aunque no pierde por ello nada de sus propiedades. Muy buena.

12 oz bottle. Has a nice hint of fruit. Nice average wheat beer that is light and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2013 On tap at Wvrst Toronto.  Poured bright, cloudy gold with a foamy white head.  Aroma of banana and toast.  Sweet citrusy taste with light carbonation and a long toasty finish.  Probably my all time favourite beer.

Pours a cloudy, golden orange, as youd expect with the style, it has a smooth white head that lasts, as you would expect again from a wheat beer. Smells of cloves and some banana. Taste is again of bananas, cloves, some spice notes and the malt background, very well balanced and easy to drink. Well carbonated, decent body and mouthfeel, leaves a nice, slightly dry finish. Very drinkable, would be an excellent session beer.
161112. Tap at Konttori, Tampere. Pours hazy golden with a nice head. Aroma banana, wheat, yeast. Smooth overall wheaty taste. Nice balance. Not Bad.
golden, cloudy, frothy, floral, light sweetness, lively, creamy, light body,

Bottle served in a Hacker Pschorr Weiss glass. 

A: Pours a hazy straw color with some amber hues in the body. I heavy white head forms on the pour and recedes very slowly leaving behind sheets of lace.

S: Big orange peel with some cracked wheat and spicy yeast. Coriander and banana with a slight sweetness.

T: Much more wheat flavors in the taste. Coriander, orange flesh, and sweet yeast. 

M: Medium bodied with a little bit of chew to it. Medium-low carbonation. Sweet finish.

O: Very solid hefe. The taste was spot on, but it didnt quite live up to the complexity of the nose. Would enjoy again.

Serving type: bottle

Poured from 330 ml bottle. 

Hazy, sparkling, golden straw color with huge, fluffy off-white head that lingers for a while and good lacing. 

Aroma of yeast, wheat, banana, light cloves, lemon and bread. 

Taste of sweet wheat, cloves, banana, bread and citrus. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonation with a luscious mouthfeel. 

About as perfect an example of a hefeweizen as you can imagine.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Game changer. This is a big, fruity bad boy with a fluffy feel to it. Im not a fruity person (I mean I like fruit in its purest form but fruity stuff normally leaves me cold).  Im also never entirely comfortable with the use of brackets, I use them with abandon though, I just dont care. Test me on that Gove.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 33cl bottle, golden yellow colour, medium white head, sweet citrus bannana, sour, high carbonation
Pours orangey yellow with a huge soft white head. Sweet smell with some yeast and banana. Taste of wheat, yeast, fruits and some spices. Pleasant creamy mouthfeel. Perfectly balanced hefeweizen.
Perfection! Towering creamy head, and taste that captures the essence of a weizen. Doesnt get much better than this.....

Tap at nobles. Been a while since Ive had this, I used to enjoy it a lot. Hazy orange with big white head. Aroma is mostly banana, foam banana sweets, little earthiness and light spicy. Taste has lots of banana again with a little more clove spice coming through. Quite well balanced and nice on the palate with a clean finish, not as heavy as I remember. Decent

I live in Germany and have tried many Weizen beer. I can say that this is the best I have tried. I still need to try Ayinger and Schneider, but I still think Weihenstephan will rank with them. This is my favorite beer to drink when I want more than one beer and fortunately I can buy a case anytime I want. Tomorrow I am driving to Westvleteran, Belgium to get my 2 cases of #12; it only took three weeks of calling to get a reservation.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090727.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of spices, yeast, ripe fruits, banana and some wheat. Flavor of wheat, banana, grass, spices and some yeast. Very balanced.
Botella. Una de las mejores cervezas de trigo que he probado. Aroma acido y a malta. Sabor con un toque ahumado, la hacen muy especial, bastante cuerpo. deliciosa

Hazy deep yellow colour with a big white head. Wheat and some banana in the nose. Normal german hefe weisen flavour with banana, fruity, yeast, sweet wheat, light citric. Nice full body.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2013 Licht lychee, wat vers kruid en ander fruit in zowel aroma als smaak, inderdaad erg verfrissend. Goeie kraag op troebel goudgeel. #2 prima omschrijving, nu in de zomer gedronken bij bbq. Heerlijk, past goed bij eten.

16.9 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy, golden orange with a tall, creamy, white head that dissipates slowly.  Aromas of wheat, oranges, and yeast, with just a touch of grass.  Taste is lightly sweet with a hint of orange or some other sweet citrus.  Has a light body with thin, slick, texture.  Has soft carbonation and a medium finish with little aftertaste.

This is, without a doubt, the best Hefeweizen Ive ever had.  My only nitpick would be that I would prefer the texture to be a little more on the creamy side and less on the slick side.  But I aint complaining!!  ... Barkeep!  Bring me another!!

500ml bottle @ Zinnkeller, Helsinki. Pours cloudy yellowish orange with a thick white head. Banana-like yeasty, fruity aroma with some citrus and wheat. The flavour is dominated by banana-like esters from the yeast and light wheat malt. Soft towards medium carbonation. Slightly, but not altogether too sweet finish.

Bottle. Pours an orange body, with a rich white head that diminishes quickly, leaving a good lacing. Aroma dominated by yeast, couldnt find anything else. Some yeasty and fruity taste, light to medium sweet. Oily texture, medium body, average carbonation. Hefe beers arent really my style, but this is a solid hefe that I enjoyed.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow amber with a large white foamy head that dissipates quickly with decent lacing. Aroma is wheat, citrus, banana, yeast. Flavor is about the same with a strong banana finish. Lightly sweet, lightly citric tart, medium body, well carbonated but not fizzy.

The color is nice and the head is beautiful, I think the appearance is the best thing in this beer. Aroma is not so sweet as you would expect in a hefe weissbier. more like a bread.  The taste is quite complex you feel the hops but the carbonation is a bit too much for me. Palate is better then the taste for me - bitter and nice.  Its a really good beer that I would recommend for sure.
Nice wheat beer.  Appearance is what you would expect.  Taste is fine.  Overall, a good beer to start with.
Bottle. Golden hazy color with great white head. Flavor is very good with hints of banana. An excelent beer, especially in the summer
A very nice hefe. Yeast and clove but well balanced and tasty. A good start for the tasting.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2012 Almost forbidden good weiss bier. Rich flavor, banana flavor, with a great body and copious amounts of foam.

500mL bottle poured into a craft beer glass. Opaque pale straw yellow hue. Sparse Particulate matter is noted. Subtle carbonation, pleasant and not overpowering. Light frothy marshmallowy head. Lacy consistency, pure white. Nice palate. Mild and understated. Delicate aroma of grass or wheat. Sour, lemony, bready flavours are detected in the taste. Minimal aftertaste and nice finish. Makes me proud to have a Bavarian background.
Lives up to its reputation as the standard all hefes are judged against. Cant decide if I prefer it over Hoegaarden.

pours a cloudy orangish with a large white foamy head, and good lacing.

smell is of wheat, banana, and some spice.

taste is of spice, wheat, some citrus, and banana.  ends a little tangy.

La mia weizen preferita. La bevo regolarmente allEataly di Torino e di Pinerolo. Frizzante al punto giusto, molto corposa, sembra più densa delle altre birre. Una volta in bocca gli aromi pervadono il palato e la lingua. Il 19 anzichè 20 va per lodore che potrebbe essere più deciso in proporzione al sapore eccelso.
Ive had this bottled and on tap.Pours yellowish golden with a giant frothy head.Smooth with flavors of clove,spice,citrus fruit and dough...

Aroma: Clean aroma. Hoppy and peppery.

Appearance: Dull amber body with a massive, off-white head that holds well. Very lively carbonation. Thick lacing marks. 

Taste: Classic banana and clove flavour. Quite peppery, with a nice, bitter orange rind tang. 

Palate: Medium body with a smooth, slightly oily mouthfeel. Soft carbonation fizz. 

Overall: An excellent hefeweizen. Great balance of flavours and very easy drinking.
My second fav Deutsche Heffe. Full flavor cloudy wheat yet light and bubbly. Good for an afternoon by the pool.
HOnestly the standard of the Hefe. So great. Hard to find much bad about it. love it. really fantastic. Smooth. Full bodied. Tons of flavor.
One of the best, if not thee best. Hefes                 im not a big hefe drinker but I appreciate them, I taste and rate them as my wife drinks them, and this one kicks ass.

Pint at rattle n hum. Cloudy orange with great, inviting, white cap. Nice lacing. Huge yeasty aroma, with a pleasant citrus backing. Taste is yeasty citrus. Good carbonation. Won't make me fart a lot later. Bonus.
Golden colour, aroma of clove, banana, bubblegum. Taste is more of the same, with citrus and wheat. Really crisp and very delicious.

A- light orange and cloudy. Billowy, meringue head that stays throughout the beer leaving a great lacing which looks like rorschach tests on my glass while I drink . . . I see a sheep, and a happy guy drinking a great beer!

S- All the usual suspects for a good hefe, bananas, cloves, bubblegum, wheat. But this beer, the bouquet is fantastic! And let me set this straight, "bouquet" is not a word I use normally but this beer has brought me to a place where "bouquet" was the word I needed to use to get my point across.

T- Yeasty Wheat bread, a slight banana and clove hit in the middle and a little bitter slightly metal taste at he end.

M&D - Well carbonated as it should be, but not so much that it foams up in my mouth. Easy drinking with a very clean and pleasant aftertaste. Great beer any time but on a nice summer day it is perfect!

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy golden straw colour with plenty of fluffy white head. Smell is definite wheat beer, with lots of banana, some grain, and some cloves. Palate is medium bodied with average fine carbonation and a bit of a sticky smooth mouthfeel. Taste is pretty good but kind of one-dimensional its sweet at first, then gets less sweet, and has a sweeter aftertaste. Good overall.

This beer pours as a cloudy, light Amber liquid. It is effervescent with a rush of bubbles and has a thick, fluffy and persistent head that sticks nicely to the vessel. The aroma is strongly of wheat with caramel. The taste is also of wheat with a nice amount of sourness and a soft wheat aftertaste. This is a medium to full bodied beer. It has a creamy, thick texture that is slightly creamy and there is also some bold carbonation. Overall this is as a wheat beer should be, with a thick creaminess and strong wheat flavors. I enjoyed this as a light wheat beer

Pours a hazy golden yellow with 3 finger head that persists leaving moderate lacing.  Tastes of bubble gum, subtly of bananas. Subtle herbal hop. Tart, but not sweet. slightly bitter. Thin to medium body with effervescent carbonation. Sticky palate. Short to medium, but prominent finish.  Good beer. .
Poured from a 33cl bottle intho a weissbier glass. Cloudy with a huge frothy head. Aroma of grass and coriander. Creamy mouth feel. Pleasant and refreshing on this hot day in August.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 Pours hazy golden with a big and well lasting white head. Aroma displays fruitiness with plenty of banana, wheaty maltiness and yeasty notes. Taste is light sweet, fruity and yeasty, very tasty and balanced. Sweetness is kept in check by the light sour wheatiness. The palate is medium bodied and very smooth.  A classic hefeweizen if ever there is one.

Tap @ FG w e. Hazy, yellow-orange pour with top-heavy shading. Aroma of musky fruit (banana, apple), tame palate of banana and other light tropical fruit. Well-rounded with a good, clean finish. Expertly balanced and drinkable but stiill not amazing.

No idea what the freshness is like, 5491 printed on the label. 16.9 oz bottle into a tall pilsner glass. When I opened it it gushed over and the bottle had a large layer of sediment on the bottom.

A - Lightly hazed golden amber body. Massive fluffy bone white head. Amazing retention and lacing.

S - Huge bannana presence. A touch of clove, spicy yeast, wheat, and some biscuity crackers.

T - Underipened bananas, clove, yeast, spices, and bready malts. Very tasty and refreshing. Well balanced and light, but full of flavor. Mouth feel is lightly syrupy yet crisp and well carbonated.

O - Certainly the best hefe I have tried. This is a style that is hit or miss for me as I lean more towards the banana flavors than the clove flavors. This one is very banana heavy with just a touch of that spicy clove. This is an excellent beer.

500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with lots of rising bubbles, a big white head, and some lacing.  Smells of bananas, yeast, and spices.  Aroma is pretty much the same, with lots of cloves.  Mouthfeel is lively,due to the carbonation and cloves.  Taste is on the bitter side, with a medium body.  This is as good as any German Hefeweizen I can remember, and as great as the other brews Ive tried from this justifiably celebrated brewery.
Tasting along side other German Weiss biers there is none better. They have been doing it for 972 years and have the recipe perfected.

this is a quality beer perhaps a little to over hyped based on name

pours a beautiful hazy gold with a huge frothy long lasting white head.

aroma screams German hefe.  banana is abundant, Clove lightly present and quite yeasty.  I think with so many American hefe now out there, people are overwhelmed by so much banana and clove, but its nice with this beer

flavor is sweet but a little to much banana.  carbonation makes it refreshing

It very much tastes like banana and clove, though the taste across your palate tastes like you have been punched in the mouth and are swallowing your own blood. Just because a brewery is old does not mean that it produces a quality product.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden in color with a thick, white head. A less sweeter hefe but very refreshing and crisp. It left me wanting a little more in flavor, but I found it very enjoyable to drink on a warm day.

Bottle at home. Has a hazy straw-yellow colour with a medium off-white head. Fruity aromas of banana, herbs, spices and citrus. Much of the same stuff going on in the mouth as well but more grass and hay in the after taste. Soft and sparkly mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A fantastic and well-balanced hefeweizen. A perfect summer beer.

AROMA: bread, citrus, orange, cake, dough, 
APPEARANCE: pale, hazy, rocky head, white foam, 
TASTE: heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
PALATE: medium body, sticky, lively, abrupt
OVERALL: too sweet and sticky, not refreshing.
Very smooth and flavorful. Worthy of the praise. Nice aroma and color. Like silk in the mouth!

Bottle from LCBO.  Pours pale yellow and hazy with a giant frothy white head.  Aroma of delicious spices and subtle citrus fruits.  Taste is banana, clove, vanilla, with a clean finish.  Smooth, good body and carbonation.  This is the best Hefeweizen Ive had, and am likely to ever have.

On tap at the Braustuberl Weihenstephaner, Freising (Nov 11).
Poured into the appropriate 0.3l glass with a couple of fingers head.

Cloudy dark yellow in colour (there wasnt much lighting in the cellar room we were in, so difficult to be precise on this one!).

Full of flavour namely a hint of banana with cloves and other spices, a truly well balanced beer of this style.

The smells largely matched the taste to save repetition.

The mouthfeel did it for me, silky smooth and my palate begged for more, lacing remained throughout my drinking experience.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: SEP 17, 2012 33cl bottle. Wow what a nice beer. Nice refreshting taste. Very sweet citrus smell.
Delicious and refreshing.Better on tap, and a little carbed, but thats getting picky.

APPEARANCE: The yeast produces a beautiful cloudy golden pour.  A voluminous white head and minimal lacing cap the show. AROMA: Bananas, dough, and a hint of herbs fill the nose. TASTE: The taste is bananas, cloves and bread dough. MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light to medium, very smooth and mellow. OVERALL: This a very enjoyable Hefe Weizen and one I will buy again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Top notch. The aroma is bananas, bread dough, and kind of an herbal bubblegum. The beer is bright golden with a very large pillowy head. The taste is bananas, dough, bubblegum, and some clove notes. Smooth with a nice crisp refreshing quality. No wonder this is the oldest brewery, they make a great product.
Pours a light orange color with a thick flavorful white head. Aroma is of wheat and citrus. Taste is a perfect balance of citrus and spice.

Pours a banana color. A little cloudy but refreshing aroma. Hard to find distinctive tastes I can pick out. Head gives beer a creamy taste but I detect a borderline sour taste. Light and a tad fruity and citrusy.

330ml bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a hazy dark yellow with a billowy white head. Decent head retention but somewhat lacking in lacing.

Wonderful aroma of bubblegum, clove, banana, and oranges. This is really what a Hefe should smell like.

The flavor has Lots of banana/bubblegum yeasty esters along with some clove. Everything is fairly well restrained with no single characteristic becoming overpowering. The soft wheat mouthfeel along with fairly high carbonation makes this one refreshing beer.

Overall, one of my favorite Hefes. Really a benchmark for the style and a beer everyone should try.
Poured hazy orange, with white head.  Smelled citrus and yeast. Tasted sweet and fruity. Slightly below average carbonation and felt a little sticky. Light body.  Sweet aftertaste.
Draught @ Monks Sveavägen. Hazy golden yellow colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of bread and spices. Flavour of malt and spice with some banana.
Bottle - Nice white strong head, golden hazy (depending on the yeast), nice aroma, some banana, very refreshing in summer. Very nice wheat beer, one of my favourites.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden colour with average, macropore to frothy, minimally lacing, white head. Slightly sweet wheat malty, slightly fruity aroma with a grassy and herbal touch, ripe banana, apple. Soft palate, soft carbonation. Taste is moderately sweet wheat malty, slightly suppressed by yeasty and tart notes, later undefinable more fruity, lasting finish with some dry notes of hop and apple parings. Good but not outstanding.

A long time favorite of mine, its finally time to review this great beer.

A: Cloudy, hazy yellow with a huge, white head. The head has very long-lasting retention and leaves a copious amount of lace all over the glass. Very nice.

S: Banana, clove, spices, apples, wheat malt.

T: Refreshing, delicious, amazing...I could go on. Certainly one of the best hefeweizens in the world. It is anything and everything a great German wheat beer can be. Awesome flavor, with a large banana, clove, wheat, and spice presence. All of these aspects are woven together and balanced perfectly. Happy, happy, joy, joy!

M: Refreshing and clean, with a pleasant aftertaste of spices, bananas, and wheat.

D: Chuggable. A great choice for the summer and/or when grilling, there is never a wrong time to indulge in this masterpiece of brewing.

As a home brewer, I hold this beer to be the perfect example of a heffe weisen. It has a slight banana and bready flavor with the slightest after taste of hops on the back of the tongue.  There are crazier wheat beers to try, but this is a gold standard of the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 Re-rated on 14.07.2013:
Bottle from Alko. Thick yellow color, medium white head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, wheat, banana, yeast and a bit of earthy notes. Velvet smooth body with lots of citrus. Bittersweet finish with citrus and banana. Very easily enjoyable hefeweizen, although still a bit too light overall compared to the other highly rated hefeweizens.

This beer was presented to us as "one of the best in the world" and "a wheat beer at its best." Maybe this sounded like pretentious bragging that turned us off right from the start, but we werent overly impressed. In fact, when we tried it, our response was, "Nah."

Bottled, 0.5l. Hazy deep golden color with huge creamy white head and average visible carbonation. Aroma of grains, yeast and vanilla. Taste starts with refreshing sweet & sour grainy malt and is followed by light fruitiness. Aftertaste is warm and lightly bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and lively carbonation. Very good, but tried better weizens, too...
golden, cloudy and unfiltered. banana and clove aroma. sweet, citrusy and somewhat bready. crisp and refreshing. probably the best hefeweizen ive ever tried.

Pouts hazy golden wheat color with a nice 2 finger head. Head laces well on the glass. Carbonation bubbles nice. Aroma reminds me of root beer. Full bodied. Almost creamy. Mild flavor. Not too strong of anything. Taste some wheat. No bitterness. Finishes smooth

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a glass goblet. Pillowy head with a lively aroma of bananas, candi sugar and cloves. Slightly cloudy with a golden oak color. Malty sweetness dominates the taste, with only the slightest inkling of hops for balance. Full mouthfeel lingers just long enough to bring you back for more.

500 mL bottle. Part of the Weihenstephan taster.  Pours a cloudy light amber.  Good spice on the nose, banana, cotton candy, bubble gum.  Nice medium full body with a creamy mouthfeel.  Sweet, but with enough bitter and sour  to offset it. Good stuff.
0,5l bottle. A great German Hefeweizen with a great history. Weihenstephaner has justly the fame of one of the best weizen beers of the world.

Poured from 500ml bottle to weizen glass:

Pours a burnt straw gold, very lively body to it. A swelling white head leaves good lacing.

Sweet malted wheat, honey, semi-stale hops, faint yeast, something floral.

Cereal malts, banana, sweet wheat, clove... an immortal beer.

Exceedingly drinkable. Dangerously so.

This beer is beyond tried and certainly true.

Bottle. Pours unclear orange, with a full head that dissolves rather quickly. Aroma is very fruity, with banana and cloves, as well as notes of hay and grass. Full creamy body, with moderate to soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with a very nice fruitiness, as well as apples, hay, caramel and grass. A nice yeasty, acidic finish.

Reading the comments of some others who have rated Weihenstephaner hefe weissbier make me think of the wise old comment that bottled beer has the same relationship to draft beer that canned green beans have to the fresh picked. It may just be a matter of taste--which of course can differ--but if you havent tasted a liter from a newly tapped keg of hefe weiss, you owe it to yourself to seek it out. Of course, if your local bar or restaurant cant sell enough hefe weiss to keep it fresh, then the bottle my be your only chance. But then another fresh draft like Algash Whitbier might provide a better experience.
Hazy yellow, white head. Aroma citrus fruits, some banana, some dough. Ok body and carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2012 12oz bottle poured into a Bruery tulip glass. Pours a cloudy golden color  with a one finger head that doesn?t leave any lacing. Aroma is straight banana and cloves. Almost like a milkshake. Taste is the same. Has a creamy mouthfeel at the start but, surprisingly, finishes up on the dry side and leaves you ready for the next drink. Low ABV makes these perfect for a warm summer day.

Grande formação de espuma. Aromática. Refrescante. Leve, desce muito bem. Boa opção de trigo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
May be a bad bottle, but this beer tastes like glue (mucilage-type). I had to work to finish one bottle. Will also be trying their Crystal weissbier as well...

Hazy cloudy pour.  Very pale.  Head faded really quick.  Banana and wheat aroma.  Leaves a weird film in your mouth.  Taste is ok, but a little too much of that banana "hefe" flavor for me.  Mouth hurts a little.
One of the best German Weizen at all. Best taste. Best aroma. There are not so many beers in Germany that can offer a better Weizen-experience.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow colour with a huge frothy white head. Aroma is quite heavy on the banana and cloves, with a few extra spice notes. Taste is moderately sweet throughout with little to no bitterness. Light body, decent carbonation and a thin mouth feel. An exceptionally good hefeweizen.
Poured a cloudy, light yellow with a quickly dissapating head. Citrus and spice aromas. The taste is a fairly sharp spice bite and a smooth finish. Excellent, well-made summer thirst quencher.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy yellow with good white head. 
Aroma is yeast, cirtus, banana. 
Taste is banana, bitter, citrus, little sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin, creamy. 
Great weissenbier.
Citrus, wattery taste. Smell is great. Not able to see through. Foam is soapy-dense. Probably only good in really warm weather.
500ml bottle. Golden hazy with large white foamy head. Aroma of fruity yeast and wheat. Flavor has lots of banana and notes of metal. Aftertaste is slighty sweet with citrus notes. Great weissbier!
On tap in Mauthen. Aroma is a lot of wheat, quite sweet, some citrus. Taste is a lot of malt, wheat, very sweet. Quite refreshing.

On bottle from bolaget Strømstad.
Golden unclear color, good foam.
Good Intensity, fruity banana.
Medium body & complexity 
Enjoyable
Tremenda cerveza de trigo! Muy suave. Mejor que la archiconocida Paulaner.

Bottle 50 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Hazy golden blonde, nice pale ivory foam and active crackling. Fresh aromas of wheat, banana, spiced yeast and bread. The mouth is very soft, velvety, with fruity hints of banana, gooseberry and mango. Slight but with some depth. Long final, perfumed, always on sweetness.

Bottle 500ml,
Aroma: Hoppy, floral, citrus and herbs. Light notes of banana and peaches.
Appearance: A nice white/yellow hazy/cloudy with a white frothy head that lasts.
Taste: a very nice balance of sweet and sour. Imagine hops and oranges.
Palate: Medium body, with average carbonation still making lively, with a nice astringent long and sweet finish.
I enjoyed this beer on a very warm day, love it.

500ml bottle - pours cloudy orange with creamy white head.  Nose is wheat, banana, and clove.  Flavor adds yeast and a little metal in the aftertaste (bummer).  Sweet and medium to high carbonation that tickles the tongue.  Quite tasty but the aftertaste takes away from the initial sip.  .

Greg and I compared a series of three respected, true-to-style German Hefeweizens: Paulaner, Erdinger and Weihenstephan. The Weihenstephaner had the largest head, initially, but it quickly dissipated. Swirling would kick-up new foam each time. Exquisite aromas of banana and bubblegum, and unlike the other two, this one smelled of clove and faint noble hops. Mild malt and wheat, light breadiness, with more complex grain flavors than the others.. Not buttery like the Paulaner. A bit fuller-bodied with a very nice subtle, grainy, mineral water hardness. Some light herbal tea tannins. Crisp, refreshing, delicious. A perfect hefeweizen.
Complex.  Banana.  No head.  Cloudy.  Slight cloves.  Delicious.  Thanks Seymour.
Love this beer. Wonderful aroma of banana and clove. Tart, yet somewnat sweet. Wonderfully complex

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2012 Bottle (0,33l & 0,5l) nice white strong head, golden hazy (depending on the yeast), nice aroma, some banana, very refreshing in summer. Very nice wheat beer, one of my favorites.
one of the beat wheat beers I have tried, hazey golden, and less sweat then most other German wheat beer. Lots of complex flaviours and refreshing finnish. Top Beer.
Its that classic banana and cloves that I love.  Its bright, refreshing and hits the spot on a warm day.
Pours a cloudy straw yellow with thick white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, clove, and some slight citrus.  Flavor matches well and is suprisingly full bodied.  Very solid hefe.

Unclear pale gold, big creamy foam head slowly settles and lasts, leaving no lacing. Marvelous aroma of fruity citrus, clove, coriander,and banana. Initial taste is yeasty and wheaty, followed by banana,clove and a citrus fruitiness. Lively carbonation, light bodied, low hopped. Lightly spiced finish. A classic. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

Pours a dense gold with a two-finger head. Heavy lacing. Brilliant buttery aroma, with caramel and bubblegum. Beautiful spicy taste, maybe a little cilantro and apple. Hearty yet effervescent mouthfeel and light finish.

In the glass, this beer is a cloudy golden color with a gigantic head like a scoop of vanilla ice-cream.  The aroma is slightly tart and hoppy, and the taste is complex.  Its very fizzy and sweet, there are hints of banana and citrus and big hops, and the flavor hangs around pleasantly in the nose after each sip.  This isnt the kind of thing I typically go for, but I did enjoy it.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2012 Aroma is fresh and zesty. Banana flavor is balanced with crisp spiciness: some pepper, coriander, nutmeg. Makes me want to taste.  Coulr is hazy honey yellow. Head is abundant, creamy, stays long. Palate is light, fresh, bit sweet but spices balance nicely. Light carbonation. Easy to drink. Taste reminds aroma. Spices even more. Overall this band plays nicely together, melodies and rhytm lead you outdoors into sunshine.

500ml bottle into a weizen glass. Pours a cloudy light golden color with lots of rising bubbles. HEAPS of head, and almost overflowed when I opened it. The head is dense and velvety, and fades very slowly. The nose is of banana, yeast and a slight  amount of clove. Very complex palate. Begins with a bit of banana and some sweetness. Progresses to some slightly malty flavours in the mid palate with roasted wheat coming through. The finish has a slight spiciness to it, mild herbacious hop flavour, a bit of an acid kick and a spritz of carbonation that leaves your mouth tingling. Finish is good and long, leaving a nice coating in your mouth and tending towards those roasty flavours again as the finish tapers off.
Mouth feel is fizzy and slightly creamy, with a little bit of a buzz as it slides down your throat. Wonderful balance of flavours, and really easy to drink and enjoy. This is really an amazing beer, and it deserves its high status.

Pours hazy golden straw color with nice medium head which retains well. Smells of banana, wheat, citrus, and clove persist. Taste follows with same, but better balanced than other hefes. Smooth mouthfeel, high carbonation with a nice silky finish. Very refreshing. 

--- Cheers
Not really an expert but judging from my modest experience in unfiltered brews I would give this a 4 on a scale of 5, right after Hoegarden
Hoppy, flavoursome, slightly gassy beer. Best drunk slowly. Definitely tastes well with a meal or on a quiet night.
Pours a cloudy golden color. Smell is of banana and clove. Taste is the same, only a little milder than the aroma. Overall a good quality beer.
It poured a hazy orange/gold color with a white head. The aroma was yeasty and of some banana. The taste was banana peel, spices, some citrus zestiness and a little yeasty.  A decent Hefeweizen.
Great taste and availability on tap. Unfortunately not easy to find the bottled version in my country.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden color with big white head.  Banana, wheaty, yeasty, spicy aromas.  Yeasty, spicy, and banana flavors.  This was my 53rd rating on RateBeer, and I had yet to have rated a true German Hefeweizen.  What the hell was my problem??  But I corrected my error, by having this Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier.  Truly one of the best beers in the world.  I love Weihenstephaner, I love this beer

The worlds oldest brewery and they can still make a fantastic drinking beer. the aroma is heavy on the breat with a lots of sweet banana. the palate is medium heavy and offers a full bodies taste with a soft palate. a pleasure to drink all the way.

Hazy darker gold with big, foamy, white head / Sweet nose of banana, citrus, clove, and wheat / Medium to full body, sweet and fat, with minimal hopping / Big, sweet flavors of banana, orange peel, lemon, clove, and bread / I struggle with these sweet, cloying, hefes.  Committing the heresy of heresies, I added a lemon.  Tried on the same day as their kristal weiss, which had much better balance.
Not too much to say that other havent. Perhaps one of the best beers I have had.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2013 Bottle. This is one of my favorite German beers. Pours a golden orange with a full white head. Earthy aroma. Smooth and light taste. Great summer beer.

Pours a clean gold with fizzy white head. Nose and taste are of grass, a touch of wheat. Nice summer beer, nothing special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 great heffe aroma. golden and hazy in appearance with huge long lasting head. good flavor, slightly yeasty and citrusy. notes of banana and clove. smooth clean finish. quite refreshing
Pours a hazy yellow-copper with a big foamy white head.  Aroma is of wheat and yeast, some mild fruit.  Great light, refreshing taste, dominated by wheat flavor.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2013 This is one of my all time favourites which I frequently get on bottle and, luckily, on tap. Pours a lovely distinctive golden orange body with a thick and full white head, lovely bready aroma which carries over into the soft taste. A warm, soft and full bodied beer! An absolute classic, with such an impressive history and experience to it... one of the Bucket List Beers if you haven?t tried it!

16.9oz bottle poured into weizen
Aroma: Belgian yeast, coriander, spices, banana esters, lemon
Appearance: very clear pour, pale golden yellow color with tons of bubbles rising, 3 finger mound of stark white head.  Tightly packed bubbles.  laces glass incredibly well.  
Taste: medium sweet, mild sour, mild bitter
Palate: finish is mild bitter.  very crisp and refreshing.  Body is light and texture is creamy.  Carbonation is lively.  
Overall: This is a solid beer.  Lots of flavor even though its light.  Would be extremely refreshing on a hot day.  Price is right.  Would buy this again.

Rating #45 for 2012

12oz bottle cold from a shaker glass. Aroma wet wheat and mild fruit sweetness. Foaming white head atop hazy honey brown liquid minimal lacing. Very mild taste of wheat some bitterness to the finish. Medium bodied beer with medium carbonation slightly dry finish. Will drink again and re-rate.
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2013 Just had my first one. real good, good taste good aftertaste. Will be buying this one again.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2013 from bottle. hazy orange colour, frothy white head. perfectly balanced aroma of fruits, yeast and some floral notes. fruits are mainly banana, pear and citrus. again, very balanced taste on this one. light sweetness with a slight bitter aftertaste. lively carbonation and medium body, quite creamy texture. flavours of banana, pear and other summer fruits. i really recommend this one, one of the best weizens on the planet!
500ml Bottle. Pale in colour with a lovely cloudy appearance. A very enjoyable and refreshing beer.

Cloudy golden color with massive head.  The banana aroma dominates and maybe a little spice jmups out here and there.  Taste is sweet, but well balanced.  Resembles banana and creme, almost like the carbonated version of doughnut filling.  This brew has a very creamy in mouthfeel and I recommend taking a gulp of that beautiful foam as long as it lasts.  Overall, an extraordinarily refreshing brew.  Although it is available year-round, I recommend saving it for an outdoor gathering on a warm to hot summer day.  Drinks perfectly fine on its own.

Pour from a 16.9 oz bottle. Cloudy yellow brew with large white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Taste is a sour wheat, yeast, and light citrus and spice. Nicely flavorful and complex. Great on a hot day.

Pours a murky golden color on tap with small white head and good lacing. Smell is typical german yeast with slight citrus notes. Taste is typical hefe weiss, but smooth and well balanced. One of the best germans.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 One of the best hefeweissbiers. Enough taste, enough aroma. Very nice in some summer terrace.

Sameankeltainen olut jättää kivasti pitsiä. Tuoksu hiivainen, banaaninen ja aavistuksen sitruksinen. Maku hiivainen, banaaninen, sitruksinen ja viljainen. Raikas ja täyteläinen vehnäolut, jälkimaku lyhyt.
Not a bad beverage on a hot summers day.  Poor was hazy yellow with a pesistant white head.  Wheat and yeasty.
The original hefe from the oldest brewery in the world (yr 1040!). Does it job on a hot summer day in an excellent way. Very cloudy, yeasty, banana fruity with a slight bitter touch. Prost!

Bottle.  Banana, yeast, clove and slight bubblegum aroma. Cloudy yellow with a large white head. Banana, light wheat malt, clove, citrus flavor. There was the slightest hint of bitterness, probably not a fresh bottle, or I would have rated the flavor a little higher. Even at that, its still a great tasting hef.  Medium body and carbonation.
Det bästa på veteölsmarknaden. En släckare i sommarvarmen. Fruktig och syrlig med lagom sötma.

12 fl. oz. bottle marked 8461.  The pour is a cloudy pale yellow with an overabundance of foamy creamy head.  It takes some time to settle back. The aroma is bursting with banana, clove, pale malts, and yeast. It is very enticing. The body is light and pleasant. There is a slight citrus zing on the taste, which is also of wheat and spices.  The finish is clean and refreshing. This one is one of the best Hefe-Weissbiers out there.
Good flavor for a hefe. Does not appeal to the hop heads but if you appreciate a sharp bite to your malt thus hefe is the best one around

12 ounce bottle purchased over a year ago at Total Wine in Las Vegas ($1.99).  Pours a cloudy golden-straw color with great big puffy white head.  Aroma of slightly under ripe banana, wheat bread, a bit of citrus, and spice (clove?).  Flavor of banana, vanilla, bready malts, some caramel, honey, and spice.  Nice creamy mouthfeel.  Not particularly exciting but exceedingly drinkable.  (1964, 703)

Quite a yeasty aroma, a little too much. Cloudy appearance made me wonder if it had gone bad. The taste was also a little odd, not the best after taste, though I was able to endure it. Not my kind of beer, at all. You may love it, seemed to be of high quality, just not for me.

From the bottle so I cannot comment on the appearance.  Aroma is clean banana and slight clove over a crisp and dry malt backbone.  Taste is thirst quenching and highly drinkable with the banana/clove up front and a clean malt backbone that include some slightly sweet/caramel flavors.  I dont think this bottle is even that fresh and this beer is drinking mighty fine.  Excellent beer.
Fresh scent of yeast with floral hops. Very fruity taste with flavors of yeast, wheat, spices, citrus and some banana. A very good Hefeweizen, but unfortunately a bit short in the taste.

Wonderfully refreshing weiss. Pours hazy golden, with a fairly tall and thick white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, some bread, spices and fruit. Taste is sweetish (banana still clearly present), with a subtle and nuanced bitterness. Body is creamy and medium full, with a decent bit of carbonation. Not overly long finish.
light copper color with big three finger head. lots of banana, but also clove and other spiciness. this is a fantastic hefe.

Draught at Ørsted Ølbar. Ive struggled with wheat beers in the past but I couldnt pass up the opportunity to try this on tap. Looks nice in the traditional glass with its famous hazy orange shade. Banana and clove are always mentioned, and yeah, I guess thats not far off at all. Pretty nice aroma then. Has a real orange marmalade tang to it, and the mouthfeel is quite heavy. Normally Id prefer a thicker mouthfeel but this is quite a struggle. Still digging that minty bubblegum aroma though. It has, at least partly, restored my faith in wheat beers.

From the bottle. Classic aroma of Banana, Clove, Yeast and other spice.
Very drinkable, good carbonation and mouth feel. Estery on the palate with more yeast. Refreshing and sessionable.

pours slightly cloudy yellow.aroma is heavy on the banana side with bubblegum and malt.flavor profile perfectly matches the aroma.medium body with heavy carbonation and a fizzy mouthfeel.has a crisp sweet finish.definitely ranks up there with the best hefewiezens that ive had.bought a five pack assortment of weihenstephaner and im glad i did.all five were very good.
Pours cloudy gold with one finger of white head. Smells of banana, wheat bread and yeast. Taste is the same very nice

May 10, 2012 6.4% abv; 500mL bottle, refrigerated; tumbler
Aroma is clearly banana with some spice, clove, and background wheat. Delicious but not overly complex.  Pours a light wheat colour. Hazy with thick white and fluffy head. Beer laces extremely well.  Tastes as it smells, albeit more complex.  Babada still dominates but clove, coriander, and wheat are evident.  Slightly herbal hops, but extremely clean.  Refreshing and light. Great active carbonation. Finish is very clean.  As a refreshing yet flavourful beer, this is one of the top.

My 500ml bottle was best before 22nd May 2008, I drank it on a wet and cold November night in 2007.

Poured into one of my Franziskaner Weissbier glasses (wetted before the pour).

Looks great, orangey coloured cloudy body, huge head, bubbles arising, just like a good hefeweiss should.

The aroma is also huge, vanilla, bananas and toffee apples, very impressive.

The taste is full of different flavours all trying to get out, with the same three as the smell winning the battle. Vanilla ice cream and Banoffi pie but without the sweetness the idea suggests.

The mouthfeel is full and lingers, this is a well crafted beer.

 A truely good beer.

Huge, soft white head, hazy amber-straw beer. Smells remarkably of banana bread - banana, butter, cinnamon and wheat. The taste is sweet and also reminiscent of banana and spices. There is a lingering, mild, refreshing bitterness in the finish. This is an exceptional beer.

Smell is wheaty, a bit of yeast and crisp.  Huge, foamy, pillowy head with hazy golden color -- awesome appearance.  Refreshing summery wheat taste with just a bit of sweetness, some bread as it goes down.  A good one, one of the best wheat-based bear Ive had.
Pours hazy orange gold with a pillowy white head. Aroma is yeast and banana. Taste is banana peel, some spice, some citrus zest, and a little yeasty. Nice carbonation.

They claim to be the "älteste brauerei der Welt" (or the oldest brewery in the world). When some business is able to satisfy its clients for sooo many years... It must have a reason. And this Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is THE only reason... Banana and clove aroma with a hint of vanilla perhaps, cloudy appearance, thick white creamy long-lasting head, golden colour... Just for its appearance and aroma it deserves the best position of all! Then.. Once you drink the first sip you start understanding why the brewery has been running for so long... Incredibly refreshing, medium sweetness, very balanced, medium body with perfect average carbonation, creamy texture, long and again sweet finish... Just amazing. Drunk from tap and bottle, it doesnt matter its impressive in every way. PROST!

500ml bottle. Another white from Germany. Usual haze orange colour with huge white head, good retention and lacing. Aroma consists of yeast, raisins, banana, wheat, a lot of pepper spiciness.
Balanced taste, with bananas, little pepper, wheat, decent amount of hops. Well carbonated. Good weiss.

Cloudy orange with a spotty white lace.  Some banana, light lemongrass, cereal, clove, spice.  Flavor is similar, a little on the sweet side with some
Banana, citrus zest, clove.  Okay, but I
Prefer my hefes drier.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2012 Pours a pale and hazy golden colour. Refreshing taste, with aroma of grass, koriander and leaves as I could notice. Finish is some bitterness and some hay and grass. One of the beers I allways buy when the weather is nice and I have a beer on the porch. Best weissbier Ive tried!

UPDATED: APR 30, 2012 Bottle. Lets see, what the worlds oldest brewery has to offer in terms of GHW. Washy golden colour, fairly more transparent than the average GHW beers. White, medium head. Beautiful complex sweet aroma of flowers and fruits. Loads of banana, some hefe. Sweet malty banana taste. Mid-carbonated, medium bitter. Very balanced, very refreshing. A mass produced hefe should be something like this one. Excellent.
One of he best weissbier available, great aroma floral and sweet scents, long lasting head, excellent palate and fruity essencens with caramel, banana and gum
Easily one of the best hefeweizens that can be found in the u.s.  Yeasty light banana.
Easily one of my favorite beers. I love the slightly fruity flavor (almost a hint of banana).

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 On tap. Light copper, hazy. Nice white head, persistent, poor lacework. Banana, clove and bread aromas. Light body, tastes malty and fruity. Short finih. Quite refreshing, a really nice heffe weissbier.
A cloudy golden yellow color with thick snow white foam head. Good Weiß taste, bit fruit, lots of yeast. Thirst quencing (Velp 201204)

Originally reviewed 4/28/09. Pours a cloudy yellowish gold with a bubbly, frothy white head spilling over the top of my weizen glass. Gorgeous. Smells of spices, bananas, citrus - smells awesome. 

Mouthfeel was a low point for me. Not crisp at all. Very watered down and slick. I was disappointed with this characteristic, though it created an easy quaffing environment. Flavor full of spicy citrus goodness, but nothing that was heavy or harsh. Just perfectly tame. Wonderful Hefe that I will come back to again and again this summer.
One of the better supermarket available beers, I prefer the smoothness of hoegaarden and the smell of Schneider weisse but this is a good quality drink to the end.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2015 Pours foggy yellow with high head
Aromas of sour fruits some corn syrup
Nice sour and sweet taste which keeps going. Not the abrupt ending that sometimes os the fact for these kinds of beers. Good beer
16.9 oz bottle pours golden with a white head.  Aroma of sweet citrus, yeast , spice and bananas.  Taste is sweet bananas, spice and bread.

citrus, grass, hay, banana, amber, cloudy, sparkling, white foam, frothy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively, 
one of my favorites

(bottle) Poured an unattractive murky straw colour with a little head. However appearances were deceptive... A nice aroma made up of  grass, esters, spice and floral hints. Very pleasant palate: medium bodied with mouth-filling fine carbonation. Flavour had an interesting mix of spice, yeast and banana. Overall, a respectable, but unexceptional hefe weisssbier.
hay, citrus, grass, lightly bitter, medium sourness, light sweetness, golden,
Hazy yellow colour. Classic hefe weizen with banana and clove flavour. Very refreshing beer

Was very surprised to find out I never rated this classic beer, even though Im certain Ive had it many years ago.  Look folks, I dont think this beer is that special--despite its reputation and respectable rating.  Its certainly smooth--and quite clear for a wheat--but Im not picking up much; not much that I like and not much that I dislike.  I enjoyed their "Vitus" slightly more.

In bottle at home for the Mass Online Tasting. Pours a light golden colour with a pillowy white head. Aroma of bananas, blueberries and cloves. A similar clove flavour upfront with a little black pepper and a really nice banana smoothie finish. This is drier than I remember with moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Lovely!
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Colour is hazy golden with huge white head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Flavour is yeast, banana, malt. Really great hefe.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2012 Misty light orange pour with well-carbonated head.  A classy Hefe with banana peel nose & taste. Surprisingly thick body. Smooth, pleasant, but short aftertaste.
Golden cloudy pour with big lasting head.  Aroma of spice and banana.  Banana citrus flavor with peppery spice.  Sweet easy finish.
Hazy orange with thick lasting foam. Yeast and peppery spices to the nose. Also some banana. Probably the best in this category.

Pours a thick white long lasting head color is hazy orange aroma is mostly wheat,cloves and yeast taste is wheat malt, banana, yeast, cloves and slightly peppery going down  body is mild carbonation is average aftertaste is sweet
Aroma is a spicy citrus. Taste is strongly spice with some wheat and citrus. Overall very good.

A: Pours an impressive cloudy golden along side a fluffy three finger head of good retention and lacing.

S: Typical aroma of banana and cloves, but also featuring a solid noble aspect to it, as well.

T: Its hard to put my finger on it, but this just works. This is so refreshing, and so well balanced. Opens with subtle banana and cloves, and finishes with an incredibly crisp maltiness. No one note overpowers the other, everything works in perfect harmony.

M: Lighter body, but with near perfect smoothness and carbonation, and a nicely dry finish.

O: Oh how I wish this was readily available in my area. Id still have no trouble going to Virginia just to buy cases (yes, cases) of this. This is THE benchmark of hefeweizens for a reason, people.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 500ml bottle.  A fresh slightly banana aroma with a great appearance. Taste is citrus, banana and hay. A great Weissbier.

Appearance of this beer is just what it should be for a wheat beer. Its perfectly cloudy. Less of a yeasty taste than its German counterparts, but its still a great tasting beer. Id say its even a bit sweet at times. Nevertheless, great beer.

Bottle- Pours a hazy light golden color with a big head that fades slowly to ample lacing. Aroma of spice, banana and vanilla with some malt sweetness in the background. Taste of banana, spices and malt sweetness. No real bitterness and a clean finish. Fairly medium body, smooth and refreshing. A very enjoyable beer and an easy drinker. Probably my favorite "Hefe".
Very nice color, banana/chocolate-ish - aroma, dry after taste though, tastes like angels peeing on your tongue, very mild flavour

pours a beautiful hazy gold unleashing thick banana/yeasty aromas. taste is brilliant with a nice wheat malt backbone supporting some of the best yeast flavours ive ever tasted,making all other weissbier yeast look like retarded cousins. very carbonated so pour carefully and enjoy what i judge all other hefes by.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 Banana yeast aroma. Foamy two finger head. Cloudy soft amber. Soft banana lemon with some bitterness. Zesty carbonation. Has a medium mouth feel but yet refreshing. Outstanding! Sets the bar for this style.
On draft at the brewery.  Classic gazy yellow with a thick white head.  This beer sets the standard for the style.  Nice banana esters.  Great hef.

From one of those metric 12oz bottles into a weizen glass.  Pours the typical hefe cloudy yellow.  TONS of fluffy white head and fluffy white lacing.  Yeasty, bananaey, gummey aroma.  Mouthfeel is perfect.  Light but not crisp; good body and smooth.  Taste is bubblegum, yeast, more bubblegum, some soy sauce and grass.  I could drink this stuff like water.  A very good weissbier.  Not as fresh as Id like, but very, very good.

bottle   hazy gold with full white lingering lacing head . aroma is yeasty , wheaty , spicy coriander & clove  . taste is sweet citrus, yeast , cloves , banana . light refreshing body , lively carbonation .taste lingers in the mouth for a long time . pretty good hefe weiss

Poured at the Tratorria in Sac. Aroma is nearly non-existent, although the flavor is full of rich maltiness. There are elements of dark fruit and toasted caramel...almost a meal in itself. Excellent beer paired with Bavarian goulash. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 Ködös közepes sárga, élénken pezseg, naná mert búza. Illata édes, erjedt és csak kicsit szúrós. 
Íze laza, frissítően szénsavas, enyhén savanykás minimális komlóval operál. Szerintem nem annyira nagy szám, jobbra számítottam.
Clàssica German Hefeweizen. Bon color, bona carbonatació i bona retenció descuma. Per a lestiu, refrescant i de trago llarg. Bona textura. Però no és dels meus estils preferits. Bona cervesa.

Hazy light brown with a long lasting white head. Smell is spicy, mildly fruity, with a great yeastiness. Taste is sweet wheaty malt and banana. Very yeasty. Mouthfeel is creamy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent Hefe. Pours golden and hazy with a frothy white head. Nice sweet, banana, yeasty aroma. Light refreshing taste - matches the aroma with a faint grassy aftertaste. Medium bodied, fizzy palate.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 Im pretty sure this is about as good as youre going to get when it comes to Hefeweizens.  Three fluffy fingers of white head leaves fantastic lacing down the Weizen glass.  Hazy gold with lively carbonation.  Smells of clove and coriander with interesting citrus esters rounding it out.  There is a great banana, yeast, and clove flavor.  This is the hefe by which I measure all others.  Even though I dont drink a ton of wheat beer these days, this is still one of my top beers of all time.
I hate to be the one to ask what all the fuss is about. This is a pretty good hefe. Reasonably complex aroma and really smooth taste. I really didnt detect anything outstanding.
A golden coloured, cloudy beer with a big,white head. Aroma: yeast, banana, clove. The taste is sweet and spicy. Live carbonation, medium body.
Wheaty aroma with a hint of banana.  Relatively light yellow color, nice and cloudy.  Taste is full as an authentic hefe should be with a light lemony finish.  Pretty good.

16.9oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a cloudy golden orange with about 3 fingers of bright white head. Aroma of banana, clove and wheat. Taste is lightly sweet and mirrors the aroma. Medium bodied with a thin yet sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, Im liking this beer. Then again, Ive yet to find a Weihenstephaner beer that I dont like.

Bottle. Rating #1905. Hazy golden yellow pour with a bright white head. Big banana aroma, hint of clove and a little bit of citrus. Sweet, ripe banana and some lemon coming together very nicely. (2233)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Hazy light brown with a long lasting white head. Smell is spicy, mildly fruity, with a great yeastiness. Taste is sweet wheaty malt. It blends well with some spicy clove and lemony tartness. Very yeasty. Mouthfeel is creamy.
golden, cloudy, white foam, floral, herbs, full body, creamy, lively, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Pours a cloudy orange brew with a 3 finger white head with excelente retention, aroma has notes of clove, malt, orange, medium bodied, very refreshing, the flavor is medium sweet, medium to low bitter and low sour, it has notes of clove, citrus fruits, malt; excelent balance, starst sweet and ends bittersweet.

Cloudy honey like pour with white foamy head. It bursts with a plethora of aromas such as floral, citrus, spice, pine, hops and wheat. Its a full bodied weissbier with a slightly complex flavour profile. Very refreshing with all the above distinctly present in a balanced manner. Very nice indeed.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shes a beaut.  The Hefeweissbier by which all others are measured, in my opinion, hard to get better.  Big head pour,  fresh wheat smell.  Manages to be sweet and not really bitter at all.  Filling, like a weissbier should be.
On tap at WVRST, pours a hazy yellow with a big creamy head.  Aroma, is banana, citrus, cloves, vanilla.  A sweet to sour taste on the palate.  A perfect beer for summertime patios.

On tap at the Abbott in Toronto.  Hazy golden yellow with medium short-lived head.  Tangy, citrus, yeast aroma. Banana and mildly sweet taste.  Medium body and finish with mild carbonation.  Nice german style wheat beer.

Blonde body and fluffy head are picture perfect with lots of carbonation bubbles. Doughy sweetness, lemon, and grass make up much of the smell, with the taste more of the same, mixed with a very light bitterness. Its exceptionally soft on the palate, and the flavors are mixed well.

Wonderful beer to drink casually. Best when drank from the tap. The bottled version is a bit carbonated but does not at all hinder the complexity and craftsmanship of one of the oldest beers in europe.

From notes.  First reviewed 2/2/2011.  Poured from a 16.9 oz bottle into a tulip. Drinking from the worlds oldest brewery tonight.

This is an aggressively carbonated beer. A massive white, tightly carbonated and creamy head floats on top of an inviting hazy golden tangerine beer. Great retention, and a sheet of lace slides down the glass.

This is quite the balanced aroma for a Hefeweizen. Banana, clove, wheat, some white grape and green apple skin. It is very aromatic, with a flowerlike quality to it, although I get no specific floral aroma.

The start of the sip is bananas drizzled with honey. A dash of cloves, and some white grapes and tart green apple skin add some tartness. A touch of spicy hops is the finishing touch. The finish is dry and a touch bitter but otherwise cleans up well. 

Mouthfeel: Extremely bubbly, this is very intensely carbonated. The beer doesnt wander around my tongue, it dances. This gives it quite a light mouthfeel. It is light bodied and although the front has some quite dry as well.

This is the epitome of a Hefe, light and drinkable. Crisp and elegant, this is a great beer to relax with.

on tap poured into pint glass, served with a lemon which I put to the side

a: plae hazy straw yellow color. Lots of bubbling carbonation. Nice foamy head wirth excellent retention

s: sweet smell of wheat, also hint of banana ester from the yeast. 

t: Very good beer, light, sweet and the yeast esters provide nice caracter of banana, clove, bubble gum. I would say the banana was prominate early but as the beer warmed the close spicyness began to dominate the palate

m&d: very drinkable, excellent call in warm weather

Bottle.  Has a beast of a head that will last until the beer is gone.  Has that beautiful cloudy color that you can only find in a wonderfully made hefe-weisen.  Such a thick beer to drink, and yet you can sure make a session out of this beer.  I would highly recommend it to anybody from a beer tasting scholar to a bud light drinker.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2013 Re-rated.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours cloudy yellow with a large lasting head consisting of small bubbles. Aroma of yeast, banana, bread and cloves. 
MIld taste, a mild tangy sweetness to start with, followed by a more overpowering sweetness and finishes with a hint  of yeast.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
Smells kind of bad.  Theres clove and maybe banana, but the thing smells like hell.  It has a sour aftertaste and even some astringency.  On tap at Beer bistro
Bottle. Cloudy yellow haze. One finger foam. Basement notes. Sour bitterness. Medium finish. A classic hefe. Nice brew.

500ml bottle at Jerrys Old Town. Pours a cloudy, yellow color with a huge white head. Aroma is yeasty, banana, clove. Medium on the palate with soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, clove, wheat, banana, with a sweet clove finish. Excellent.

Very lively on pouring. Thick creamy head. Pale yellow and cloudy. Aromas yeasty and herbal with strong scents of cloves, coriander and lemon grass. Bitter and flowery in taste with a lasting clove aftertaste.

On tap at Jackie-Os, served in a pint glass for $5. Had an enormous head while the bar tender was pouring it, it took a while to do properly. When I got it, the super-foamy thick white head was still a half inch thick, with another half inch bulging out from the top of the glass. Color is a mostly hazy gold. Really, a nice-looking hefeweizen. Good, even sheets of lace. Really crisp carbonation, on the lighter side. Great texture, nice and dry, easy drinking. Great clove aroma. Banana, vanilla in there too, with the wheat. Taste is kinda neutral, but enjoyable. Slight tart-sweetness, and malty clove-spiciness, beyond that. Excellent hefe, it certainly met my expectations.
Bottle. A very good Hefeweizen. Lemon and clove with mild sweetness. Smooth with good carbonation. Dry finish. Tasty.
A very soothing beer with a rich aroma and a taste wich make your moth feel very alive. It has a smooth texture that makes it very enjoyable and every sip is like a band new experience.

Det kan kun blive en ren 5er. Det er måske ikke helt og alene øllens skyld, men efter at have været på TUM (Technische Universität München), så er denne øl bare vedhæftet med så mange gode minder. Øllen er i den gærede ende af Weissbier skalaen, skummet står flot til sidste slurk, hvis den bliver skænket rigtigt. Og så smager den bare af sommer, sol og frihed i Freising (München)
aroma is light but hints of banana, wheat and clove, appearance is light coper color, slight haze, flavor is wheat, banana, clove, very clean and crisp

Pours cloudy yellow with a BIG white head. Smells like citrus and wheat, very clean. Taste very creamy, with a good wheat back bone and fresh white fruit flavors. After taste is some what like cream soda. I very much like this style, and this example. It is nice and light, yet it had back bone. Good stuff!

pours cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. aroma of citrus and wheat. taste is smooth and creamy, banana, citrus, fruits. fragrant, well balanced and carbonated. not my favorite style, but its a great example.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and its not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!

Ins Glas gegossen, macht es eine prachtvolle Figur. Schöne gelb-orangene trübe Farbe, und eine wahre Prachtkrone!!! Es riecht herrlich hefig und bananig frisch. Der Antrunk ist ebenfalls spitzenklasse. Ausgeprägt hefig, fruchtig, orangig. Hier kommen alle Aromen eines guten Weizens zusammen und harmonieren einfach super miteinander. Zum Mittelteil und Finish hin bleibt das Weizen einfach super angenehm! Einziger Minuspunkt: Es könnte ein wenig mehr rezent sein. Ansonsten ein absolutes Spitzenweizen!!!

One of the best weissbiers I ever had.
Perfect weisse color, with an even better foam.
great earthy aromas.
taste of yeast, bananas.
really enjoyable and easy going.

leaves, spruce, citrus, cooked vegetables, licorice, cloudy, orange, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, full body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

This is properly one of the best beers I know. Together with some Weissbier from Brauerei Aying, this is one of the most spectacular beers. It has a taste a bit like iron... kinda hard to explain, but the taste is anyhow really good.

Nice pillow of head, huge drywall and hay aroma, with some apple as well. Flavour is a mix of barnyard and citrus with wood notes, gueuze-like almost. Semi-dry finish. I think this is the best hefeweizen Ive ever tried.
Fien creamy head, cloudy yellow. light fine banana and raspberry rubbery nose, elegant. Medium body and s0me soft length. Elegant almost creamy, banana, raspberries and only a light hint of yeast.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow/orange with a thick white head. Aroma of banana/clove hef yeast, lemon, wheat bread and some hay. Flavor is very well balanced with smooth wheat malt, slightly tart yeast and light hop bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation and a clean, refreshing finish. This is an outstanding Hef, no, an outstanding beer period.

Pours cloudy pale yellow with silky creamy white head with lacing. Aromas, bananas, citrus, some yeast, orange, fruits, some wheat grains.. Palate is orange, tart little acidic,  with medium full smooth carbonation. Texture is medium full, sticky but light. Aftertaste is  wheat malts, with dry watery medium short finish. Very balanced Weissbier and good amount of flavours. Maybe a bit too standard though.
Sample at 2012 Columbia World Beer Festival.  Cloudy with a wheaty, yeasty aroma.  One of the best wheat beers Ive had.  Not too fruity or bready like most.

Draught at the Dublin bar, Herzliya. Cloudy orange-yellow with a relatively small white head. Ripe banana and clove aroma. A bit sour, a bit bitter, a bit sweet, like it should be. Fizzy. light bodied and a little watery, long finish. Usually an awesome beer but in this case a little watery and not well poured.

A beer that Ive claimed over the past few years as one of my top ten favorites, tonights beer is the Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier.  Brewed in Bavaria, Germany, Weihenstephans label states that its the oldest brewery in the world. Records date back to the year 768 with documents mentioning a hop garden, but the brewery was officially licensed in 1040.

The 17oz bottle pours at a clear burnt-amber color, with a nice thick ivory white foam on top.  The foam lingers for several minutes, and leaves behind a mild lacing as it recedes. The aromas are bright and distinct, with plenty of lemon, orange peel, banana, and spices. I absolutely love the aromas on this little Hefeweiss!

On the palate, the Weihenstephaner is flavorful and complex, yet so incredible easy to drink! The citrus and banana is right up front in my mouth, but not far behind is the spice and just a touch of alcohol. This is an absolutely delicious brew that I highly recommend for anyone who ever considered those mediocre mass-produced imitations.
Very light golden color and not much of a head, has a similar scent and taste to the dunkel. I am not much of a fan of the style, prefer the dunkel a lot more.

50 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 15.05.2011
Aroma is slightly stale and tart with wheat, some banana and yeast. Flavour is slightly sour and tart with bubblegum, wheat, some banana and hints of yeast. Very typical but good hefe, that could have a bit more rich palate.
My personal favorite hefe. Bottle which pours a clouldy orange. Heavy aromas of wheat with a slightly malty finished. Well balanced.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 Bottle.Cloudy gold, like bee wax. Yeast creates a uniform layer in the glass.
Had straight from the bottle. A little more bitter than your average hefeweizen, but the flavor is tremendous. A fantastic beer.

Served on-tap at Als of Hampden into a dream weaver goblet.

A - Pours hazy, bright, orange with a nice creamy half finger tall head leaving spotty lacing down the glass.

S - Lots of bready wheat and yeast, oranges, lemon, and a bit of spicy clove. The crisp citrus fruits mix well with the strong wheat core to produce a very pleasant nose.

T - Lots of chewy wheat up front, lingering thru the finish, mix well with the spicy clove and bright citrus fruits. Finish is pretty bready with most of it lingering long after consumption. Perfect beer for a warm day like today. Very nice stuff.

M - Medium-light body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Chewy feel from all that wheat. Finish is a bit spicy with plenty of lingering chewiness.

D - Very good. I am not the biggest fan of hefes but this one really does set the bar for all others. One of, if not the, best I have had. Glad I finally got to try it.
I did not denote any distinct aroma but the color when poured was very rich and pleasing.  It has a nice smooth taste, not overpowering with a pleasant after taste.  Overall a very nice beer.

Not too bad, but compared to http://www.ratebeer.com/beer/schwarzbrau-weissbier which is of similar style, the Weihenstephan leaves a lightly stale impression. I miss the freshness and the lively aroma found in a classic Hefeweizen. Yeast flavour doesnt match the combination of the other savours. Water seems a little too calcareous, a little too hard for my taste. I wouldnt reject it if offered.

Pours a nice cloudy gold with 2 fingers of head that fades to one, banana and bubble gum aromas, slightly too much bubble gum in the taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Clear champagne gold body... moderate white head and good lacing

S: Clean banana, floral, clove, yeast notes... fresh feeling

T: Solid hefeweizen... the special thing about this beet is the clean flavor profile... its an effortless blend of subtle floral, spice and yeast flavors

M: light to medium body... crisp finish, semi dry

O: A very nice brew... plain as day to see why this beer has been brewed for ages
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden with a white head.  Aroma and flavor of banana, spices and some yeasty notes.
Great beer, drinking the bottle tonight.  Cant wait to try it from the tap at our local German diner.
50 cl. bottle @ home. As expected, it pours a hazy yellow with an enormouse white head. Furthermore its a classic weizen. German quality all the way
Nah... really sweet weissbier with a smooth palate. A little too thik for my taste but probably not bad if you really like the genre. I prefer my weissbeer a little fresher.

Bottle - Pours hazy golden amber with a thick white creamy, foamy head. Nose is bold, rich banana and juicy tropical fruit, a touch of clove, and a thick yeastiness. Taste emphasizes the sweet fruity notes, overripe banana, lots of yeasty bread, and a touch of plastic and clove. Smells great, but the taste really falls short. A little too carbonated also, but overall pretty smooth. Man, this would be fantastic if the taste matched the aroma.

Presents a delicious aroma: citrus, spice, slight banana and, of course, fermented wheat and its signature yeast. Looks like any other hefe, but character is more profound.Taste is spicy, sweet and bitter in roughly that order. This is no revolution; in fact it is one of the originals. Again, the high score is based on the degree to which these elements come together.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2012 On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Hazy pale color beer with white rocky head. Sweet fruity citrus aroma because of the yeast. Some wheat flavour also appears, but the yeast is the dominant. Interesting refreshing light bitter taste with malty sweetness. Medium body with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Wheat malty and yeasty, refreshing, fruity and citrus finish. The delicious yeast makes it different. One of the best hefeweizen, Ive ever tasted.

500 ml bottle.  Pours slightly hazy golden straw color with a huge 3 finger dense white head with incredible retention that reduces to a cap that stays for the remainder of the glass.  Thick lacing clings around the glass as well, incredible.  Aromas of big banana, clove, bubblegum, pepper, lemon, and spicy yeast.  Fantastic aromas here with great balance and strength.  Taste of big clove, pepper, banana, bubblegum, lemon, bread, and spicy yeast.  Light bitterness on the finish that lingers with citrus, pepper, banana, and spices for a bit.  Extremely smooth and slightly creamy medium sized body.  Fairly lively carbonation that dies down as I make my way through the glass.  Extremely well balanced with the flavor profile as well.  Overall this is an absolutely incredible wheat beer; and the definition of a hefeweizen in my opinion.  I will keep coming back to this one at only $3 for a half liter at the store.
Hazy orange color with good big white head. Banana and wheat aroma. Good citrus and wheat taste.

What the heck, I havent rated this, yet...? Ill be damn...
Man this is one of the better Hefe Weizen beers out there.
Ah I see it scores really high and it has almost 2000 ratings.
Guess it needs my points but a review might be the same as it will be said about 1500 times before.
Its a good beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: From a 500ml bottle on 25/12/2011. Pours a murky light golden with a big head which disappears quickly. Has a strong aroma of ripe banana, yeast and a touch of barbecue sauce. In the mouth, sweet banana is most prominent, along with some spice and bubblegum notes. Perfect carbonation for the style. An exceptionally well put together, nicely balanced hefe.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2012 Poured murky golden. Lots of head. Sweet honey wheaty smell. Great Weizen taste. So insanely drinkable, perfect carbonation. Worlds Oldest Brewery obviously knows what they are doing. 

Edit:

Revisited as part of a blind test against Ayinger. Pour was murky yellow, hazy. Very sweet gum and banana smell. The head was taller and fluffier than Ayinger. Sweet, good carbonation, smooth, clean, and crisp. Overall, still a delicious and prime example of a German Hefe.

I simply loved this beer.  It has a wonderful arome and taste.  Very clove like but in a good way.  My only complain was that the head was a bit much and i had to wait until it was down a bit to drink the beer.  Otherwise though this has to be one of the best beers ive ever had.

Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier has a very thick, white, pillowy head and a hazy, yellow-golden appearance, with lots of streaming bubbles, some lace, and little light-brown yeast chunks floating about. The aroma is faint, but one can just detect water and a little bread. Taste is of banana, white wheat bread, coriander or cloves (hard to say which), and water, plus, maybe cinnamon. The body is on the watery side, and Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier finishes easy-drinking and wet. Overall, this is a good beer, but, with its spicy aspects, I would not want to have it with a meal. RJT.
Jäst, muskotnöt präglar denna trevliga veteöl. Törstsläckande och välbalanserad. Given till kryddig mat. Slutsats: God och prisvärd.
Nose is sweet banana, some dry malty notes, whiff of hops, cloves, feel is quite broad, carb Is mediumheavy, taste is heavy banana, sweets, cloves, bread, sweet lemony notes
Tap - nice big foamy head, hazy medium straw color, clove spice aroma, taste of cloves and mild banana
En väldigt trevlig weissbier, och min personliga favorit i kategorin, med en behaglig smak av citrus och någon krydda som jag har svårt att precisera.

Its great nothing bad about it but it behind Franziskaner Hefe Weisse in my opinion.  It does have a great aroma like smelling coffee beans all day! Yeast and grass with some citrus going on. The finish taste after awhile seems to linger and almost gets kinda odd. Its not sweet but almost then a tiny tiny bit of bitter. Nice beer head nice kinda frothy. Overall I like it.

Poured in Erdinger wheat beer glass. Cloudy German typicall wheat beer look with a big lasting head. Typical German wheat beer smell. Medium body mabye a tyiny little watery. Had a diff wheat beer from German b4 this so hopeing to recall this one fully correct cus eather both were a little tad water or one wasnt but this had a bannana taste that seemed a little like honey(refreshing sweet bannana)with a dusting of cloves added 2 that. I enjoyed this one. cheers.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a light white head. Sweet banana aroma. More banana in the flavour with plenty citrus in there too. I think that this is a classic.

Ahhhh a classic Bavarian Hefe Weiss. Served at a great temperature with a huge, off white head, a little lace. Color is a very lightly hazy yellow amber with some bubble trails. Aroma is very fresh, bananas, malt, yeast, spice. Flavor is similar to nose. Body n carbonation are the epitome of hefe weiss and so perfect. Finish is like flavor, tapering to a slight tartness, refreshing, yet satisfying. Drink these forever.

Banana, spice, and a little bubblegum in the aroma.  Flavor brings out citrus and more spice.  Carbonation brings some balance to what is otherwise a pretty sweet beer.  Really tasty, easy-drinking beer.
