50cl bottle. Murky pale golden beer with a big and white head. Excellent lasting and better lacing. Aroma is malty, yeasty, clove, banana, with some citrus hints. Flavour is fresh, sweet at the beginning maintained in the final, yeasty. Body is high. Texture is oily. Carbonation is soft. From my point of view the best Hefeweizen Ive ever tasted.

A mia moglie garbano parecchio le weizen, dunque quando le trovo le compro per lei, perchè invece a me non fanno impazzire. Su questa però devo ricredermi davvero ottima,e sicuramente diversa dalla massa di weizen che ho assaggiato fino ad ora.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2014 Pours a hazy golden color with mountains of foamy white head. This is one awesome beer. Very complex. Yeasty aromas...some spice as well. First sip, I got bubble gum, and a hint of banana. Second taste..extreme cloves on the palate. Finishes smooth with a hint of spice. Phenomenal stuff.
buona birra che rappresenta molto bene il suo stile. schiuma persistente. E un sentore di banana lo si percepisce in maniera piacevole e invitante :)
5.4% cloudy pail yellow colour with a thin head, very good wheat beer aroma and taste.
Totally loved it... reminds me how Paulaner was couple years ago. No doubt - worth its price.
Cloudy gold color with medium white head. Barley aroma, and a great smokey-sweet with bread and barley flavor. Best Hefe Weissbier i ve ever tasted!!!!!

Bottle (50cl) from Vinmonopolet, Oslo. Huge offwhite head, foam creates nice shapes while it slowly recedes to a thick film. Hazy orange/amber colour. Aroma of yeast, esters (banana, yellow apple), also metal, grass and flowery notes. Medium/light body, average/soft carbonation. Taste has a ripe fruit sweetness, citrus acidity and herbal bitterness, excellently balanced. Dry finish.
Bottle. Nice yeasty aroma with a hint of banana. Well balanced and strong yeasty German Hefe taste. Lively carbonation.

On draft at the Brass Tap, poured an amazing hazy orange, with aromas of banana, wheat, citrus, and clove.  Flavors are exactly the same as the aroma.  Really great beer for the summer time in the Florida heat.

Appearance: Golden
Aroma: barley
Taste: nice taste
In general: Best beer for me.

Appearance: golden with light head, nice bubbles. 
Aroma: Aroma is of banana, and wheat.
Taste: Taste is medium sweetness, again bread and banana and clove n the finish. 
Palate:Medium body

A great Beer!

On tap at Ørsteds Ølbar, Copenhagen. Slightly hazy yellow colour, with a very durable white head. A very nice aroma with yeast and wheat, then a powerful banana and hints of citrus. The taste is fairly sweet with notes of honey and coriander. Super creamy palate, medium body with a long finish with lots of banana. My best hefeweizen so far.

Bottle.  Clear golden pour with large white head.  Typical aromas for the style...clove, banana and yeast.  These components are also present in the taste but not in an overpowering way.  Very clean on the palate, no bitter aftertaste.  Heavily carbonated with a creamy texture.  This is one you could drink all night without wrecking your taste buds.

Location/Date:Bottle on 11/13/2011.
Appearance: Pours a golden cloud with light head, some bubbles. 
Aroma: Aroma is of banana, clove and wheat.
Taste: Taste is medium sweetness, bready and banana with clove on the finish. Really nice.
Palate:Medium body, a little bit of fizz, no aftertaste.
Summary: A great example of the style and a great beer.

Bottle enjoyed at home from a weissbier glass
Orange hazy, super big white head. Smells of wheat, banana, citrus and yeast esters. Taste is quite malty, wheat dominant, with subtile sweetness that balances off perfectly with som citric acids. This beer suits perfectly for warm summer days. Nice on the palate, some bitter finish
On tap.  Comes pale cloudy gold with a large white head.  Aroma of bread, citrus, malt, bananas and spices.  Taste is similar.  Very complex.  Crisp and very drinkable.  Excellent !!

Es la mejor weissbier de Alemania,aromatica ,corposa,agradable. El olor es muy agradable a frutas y flores,al paladar es bien corposa pero suave al mismo tiempo,el after taste es muy bueno te deja el paladar con un sabor delicado. muy bien!!
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: 500ml bottle. Hazy gold with a long lasting fluffy white head. Great banana and wheat aroma, mild cloves and light orange zest. Smooth, nice carbonation, well balanced sweet and bitter, finish is nice and dry, more bitter then the start,  some spice and orange. A good Hefe.

26/10/2011 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 15/06/12  (2011-584)
Very cloudy dark beige to amber beer, huge creamy off-white head. Aroma: lots of ripe banana upon pouring, citrus and spices, fresh coriander leafs, banana bread. MF: good carbon, medium to full body. Taste: banana milkshake, breakfast cereals (smacks), honey, citrus fruits. Aftertaste: sweet raisins, more banana, little bot of alcohol, sweet whipped cream.
This is my first beer to rate and I must say Its fantastic! 16 Fl. Oz. Pale golden color, very foggy (translucent).  Small white head. Very prominent banana taste with a smooth creamy after bite.
This beer poured a light golden color with a little off white head. Nice and crisp with a great yeasty flavor.
My favourite session beer on the planet when fresh. Looks gorgeous, smells suberb, lovely banana, wheat and clove flavours, full body. Perfection.
50cl bottle at Salzburg airport: Probably mty favourite weisbeer of the trip. Fragrant, spicy, with the usual banana/bubblegum flavour. I was sorry when we had to board.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2011 One of the better weissbiers, but I dont care for it much..  Its a mild beer.  Notes of banana and clove.  Mild citrus and spice.  The clove notes ruin it for me.

500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a small white head and a little lacing.  Aroma is wheat grain, banana and some cloves and yeast.  Taste is yeasty with a mild malty sweetness with banana and some cloves.  Nicely balanced and very enjoyable.
cloudy golden color, lively foamy head, notes of banana, citrus and cloves
(bottle)  Pours a perfectly cloudy golden complexion.  Nice aroma of wheat and banana.  Refreshing and crisp flavors.  A classic Hefe Weiss.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 (Flasche) Das Weißbier ist mittel- bis dunkelgelb mit einer starken Hefetrübung und hat einer schneeweißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr leicht malzig mit einer sehr starken Hefenote und ein einer Spur grünem/fruchtigen Hopfen. Geschmacklich ist es eher schlank und leicht malzig mit einem starken Hefegeschmackund einer winzigen süße im Hintergrund. Der Nachgeschmack ist hefig und eher gering und die Bittere ist stieltypisch gering und die Karbonisierung stark. Zusammengefasst ist es ein süffiges, erfrischendes Weißbier.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 Great cloady golden colorand white foamy head. The aroma and flavor is intense of wheat. First thoughts is the flavor is also a bit dry. Within this style, I really enjoy this one.

500 ml bottle. Purs a hazy amber/orange with a nice, stable and frothy head. just as it should be. smell of much yeast, banana and a bit of citrus. heavy banana taste. malty and still a lot of yeast. a bit of clove. full body and lively carbonization. slightly bitterness at the end.

Disig gyllengul vätska med högt skum som bildar en tjusig skumkrona. Stiltypiska dofter av skumbanan, jäst, kryddnejlika och lite mineraler. Fyllig och stilsäker, liten jästbeska och väldigt lättdrucken. Börjar nog ändå tröttna på weiss som ölstil. För söt och för lite beska och syra för att vara bra som matdryck och för lite egen karaktär för att stå sig som sippardryck. Men jästkaraktären hos en bra hefe som den här är ändå fortfarande häftig.

500ml brown bottle. Pours out hazy golden yellow colour. Dense head with a rocky top. Clovey nose. Favour has soft wheat base, cloves, yeast. Finishes dry, lingering yeasty end. Body is quite soft with smooth gentle carbonation and a soft mouthfeel. Archetypal hefeweissbier. Good anytime.
Pours with a big white head.  Nice wheatbeer aroma and taste.  Low bitterness, lasting palate.

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is hazy, yellowish-orange color with tons of foamy, off-white head.  Aroma is very fragrant with flavors of fruit citrus, banana, a little spice standing out.  Taste is similar with fruity notes at the forefront like banana and citrus along side wheaty base, yeast, and a mild hop bitterness.  Palate is medium-bodied, smooth texture, foamy carbonation, semi-dry finish.  One of the best Hefeweizens around.

Bottle 50 cl. A cloudy golden colour with a high white head. An aroma of malt, wheat, banana and spice. The taste is medium sweet. A medium body, oily texture, average carbonation and a medium long, light sweet finish.
The paragon of hefeweizens. There is simply no other beer that can compare.

Slightly hazy, lustrous golden-amber with a big lacy white head on it. Gorgeous full wheat maltiness coupled with cloves aplenty (same as I got from the Kristalweizen. Big soft and creamy at first and then comes a cascade of bubbles that give full, on-going mouthfeel. A definite lemon citrus tang lingers and settles on the front of the tongue and a provocative bitterness sits on the sides. A quenching lofty breasted wench of a beer. I rather like lofty breasted wenches.
Keg at Brass Monkey. Pours hazy Orange with a frothy head. Banana, clove, yeast. An absolutely textbook Hefe.

Classic hefe looks - hazy orange with a big bubbly white head. Typical aroma with banana, yeat, white bread dough and hay but also some spices and a nuttyness. Very drinkable and refreshing because it has just a bit less sweetness than the other German brands. One of the classic ones, but also one of the best. (50cl bottle)
Pours golden pale with a ton of white head. Smell: Clove, banana, bread, coriander and apple. Taste: Banana, bread(yeast), clove coriander. Mouthfeel is light with a nice spice note.

Fresh 12 oz. Pours a frothy-foamed golden orange/yellowish.  Smell is huge, banana. clove, citrus, spices, phenols, yeast, etc.  Taste is exactly what you would expect from the nose, all of those same characters - super complex, excellently drinkable, spicy and crisp.  A fantastic beer and definitely one of the finest of the style.
Draft. Clean, crisp golden. Foamy white head. Honey, sweet bubblegum. Very balanced, rich sweet-weiss. really nice, straight up for style

Hazy golden pour with a beautiful thick ivory persistent head.  Aroma of banana and soft clove phenolics with a slight whiff of DMS towards the end of the glass.  Flavor of banana and cloves with a slight sweetness.  Wonderful high carbonation medium bodied mouthfeel.  No astringency.  What an excellent beer!  I guess theyve had some time to perfect it (est 1040!).

Stop the press!  I have just enjoyed the MOST amazing hefeweizen ever!!  Definitely one that would make me pack a bag and head overseas to Freising, Germany, just to enjoy this beer at its freshest!  It pours a tantalizing hazy golden colored brew with a hearty frothy head.  Some beers are meant to be savored at many levels and this is exactly one of those beers!  Sit back and let the scents of cloves and banana-nut bread along with subtle hints of citrus fill your sense of smell.  The savor this prime brew and enjoy that warm banana-nut bread flavor following by a nice slightly citrus-y aftertaste.  Words just cannot describe how amazing this one is  you just have to get some for yourself and enjoy!
classica hefeweizen di quelle che io considero piu bevibili e dissetanti e che mi piacciono di piu !color giallo chiaro non molto torbida!classico profumo agrumato leggero come nel gusto!
A white head with a cloudy golden color.  The aroma is doughy with some orange peel and a taste of yeast and dough with more citrus.  Not my favorite, but a solid hefeweizen.

A cloudy golden orange beer with a nice sized frothy white head.  The aroma is yeast, wheat, and spice, very nice.  The flavor is a bit spicy and earthy with a nice citrus taste.  A very tasty and easy to drink beer.

Smells of a cigarette ashtray with month old butts in it.  Also get some clove and yeast.  Damn these German beers.  Pours a cloudy pale ale color, very similar to a Blue Moon, but with a huge pillowy head that lasts.  Chunky.  Im getting hit hard with the clove on the taste.  Spicy.  A little funky.  this is a world class beer.  Know that.

On tap at Beermarket in Toronto.  Pours hazy orange with a huge white head.  Nose is of yeast, banana, bubble gum and cloves.  Medium, slightly crisp, creamy body. Yeast, banana, bubble gum and cloves combine on the palate in a wonderful complexity.  Long, balanced finish.  Im not a fan of hefe, but this one is outstanding brew.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2011 Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on September 17. Pours a hazy golden liquid with a huge white head. Smell is loaded with banana but theres also yeast and some lemon zest. Taste is fruity and spicy. There is banana, orange zest, cilantro, basil and yeast.

Poured from bottle.  Pours a slightly bubbly straw gold, with fluffy white head.  Nose of lemon, spice, and funk.  Sweet and somewhat tart, with some licorice qualities.  Very creamy and smooth with slight bready aftertaste.  Wasnt sure what to expect with this, but I definitely think Ill be back for more.

Trübe Honigfarbe und fruchtig-hefiger Geruch. Geschmack fruchtig-bananig und prickelnd. Leicht wässrige Eindrücke im Mittelteil. Nelkenartige Hintergrundaromen. 
Solides HW. Gut trinkbar.Test vom 17.5.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow.  Nice aroma of banana and clove.  Smooth taste.  Banana flavor really stands out.  A very pleasant hef.  My favorite of the style.
Cloudy yellow, with white head, Smell of yeast, citrus. Taste of banana, corn, malt and wheat. A sweet dry wheat aftertaste. Soft carbonation

16.9 oz bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a giant pillowy cream-white head with great retention. Aroma is clove, banana, bubblegum--all the hallmarks--along with some earth and a little funk. Its not as awesomely aromatic as some other examples. Taste is sweet and meaty, delicious. Highly carbonated and light-bodied. Tasty stuff.
500 ml bottle from BevMo online (Pleasanton). Nose of bananas, yeasty bread, and light caramel malt. Hazy yellow with a big pale yellow head. Flavor is bananas with hints of bubblegum and bitterness.

This beer just feels good and belongs in your mouth.This is a beer that still has a beer taste  but being a hefeweizen at the same time.
 Mostly yeast smell with spicyness,unripe clean fruit like just a memerably good smell.Not alot of yeast aroma has such a good one as this.Pretty masterfull beer all around.
 Cloudy pale yellow light  brownish gold with lots of carbonation,foamy sparkly white head that keeps a1/4 inch to the bottom of the glass while it contiues to bubble and stick to the glass.The aroma is refreshing just to take a big whiff like taking a deep breath in a surrounding you could just sit on a cloud of and just breathe.
 It enters your mouth with a smooth, lightly sweet taste of  a soft bread like and smooth soft mild citrus spice finishing with  a good kind of subdued light carmel toasted  fresh bread made from an age old recipe that doesnt  exist anywhere else.Then leaves you with a mild spice carmaly vanilla dry very mild citrus.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Weizen glass.

Appearance: Cloudy orange with magnificent, billowing white head that leaves some nice lacing behind.

Aroma: Strong sweet banana bread at first, but turns very dry and clove-like after a few minutes.

Taste: Fantastic wheat malts augmented by mostly banana at first and then cloves and noble hops carry through on the long finish. Never enjoyed the actual wheat taste from a beer so much.

Palate: High carbonation, light to medium body, very crisp and dry.

Overall: By far, the best Hefeweizen I have had. Very refreshing and crisp, yet complex and flavorful.

Bottle in weizen glass. Cloudy orange colour -  beautiful big white head and lacing. Lemon and vanilla aroma, though not as aromatic as some other hefeweizens. Taste has a nice balance of sweet and a touch of sour. A great hefeweizen. Very drinkable and refreshing.

From the tapper, the aroma on this one is potent. Full of yeast and wheat, it promises to be one soulful wheat beer. The head is stark white and thins quickly, leaving laces. The brew is an inviting hazy yellow. This one had a strong wheat flavor and is slightly sweet, with a faint hint of citrus. It is light on the palate despite the initial carbonation burn. A very nice, yeasty wheat brew.

It looks like a perfect hefeweizen: it pours a hazy, light yellow, sparkling body that is filled with tiny bubbles. A huge, dense, creamy white head builds up easily, reduces to half a centimetre in a couple of minutes, and stays at that size until the glass is empty. Excellent lacing. An unusually intense aroma with lots of banana, spices, yeast, fruits and sweet honey. The taste is medium sweet and light acidic with some additional bitterness in the finish. A very long, spicy aftertaste with sweet honey and caramel notes. Medium body, lively carbonation and a rather dry finish. By far the best hefe-weizen Ive tried so far, with intense aroma and flavours and a lovely mouthfeel!
[50 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Oslo City, Oslo]
Bottle from Systembolaget. An awsome wheat beer with a nice fruity banana aroma and nice balance of wheat yeast. Nice thirst quencher as well as a compliment with most kinds of everyday food.
Complete goodness out of a hefe! Ive been buying this beer where ever I have found it, and will continue doing to until I am dead.
Love the banana notes.  Big fan of the Hefes; this might be my fav.  Attractive color and great aroma.  Easy to pound and catch a nice buzz.  Heavily carbonated, tickles the tongue.

Looks nice and hazy with an orange body. Lots of carbonation and a good head on this one. This smells very sweet and yeasty with sweeter citrus notes. Flavors were full of hops, yeast and bread with a light spice - all very smooth with a nice bitter finish. Fun to drink aggressively or pair with a favorite German dish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2011: hazy orange with a creamy-looking white head, strong thick, creamy coriander taste, very thick wheat backbone, almost tart, plenty of yeast, nice but not really picking up banana in here, good but not as good as I expected this to be

Superb looking head, both fluffy and thick. Diminishes after a while though, but remain as a white lid on top. Body is slightly hazy yellow going in orange. The aroma is dominated by sweet banana, citrus, fruty bubble gum and wheat. Truly a great hefe!
Bottle. Hazy gold with quarter inch white head. Aroma is wheat. Flavor is sweet, spicy, wheat.. Very smooth and delicious. Excellent hefe.

Fuzzy reddish golden orange. Pillowy white lasting head.
Huge sweet citrusy aroma. Absolutely wonderful.
Soft bitterness initially,  bright lemon zest. Clean light hop finish.
Full in your mouth. Lasting and makes you want more.
Cloudy golden orange with a nice big white head. Aroma of spices, yeast, wheat. Taste is the same. A model Hefe. Medium bodied, smooth and refreshing.

Im disappointed in myself for awarding near an overall 5 but this one deserves it. This is the prototype for a Hefeweizen. The appearance is a golden, cloudy, murky, dulled orange. It smells spicy and has the yeast youd expect. This hits on all points. It tastes like a hefe should. It has the sweetness and yeast to represent the style like it should. For other beers I would describe all around aspects but for this, I remarkably, have nothing to say. It is the perfect Hefe. I almost cant believe it. Its very drinkable and you must try this. This is THE Hefe.

Drank this at Fizz beach-bar in Koh Tao, Thailand-- the place where beer-lovers become teetotalers. Poured (into a dimpled mug) a nice copper-golden color. Hazy with a heavy banana aroma. Some vanilla on the background-- amazing combo. Flavor seems more intense than usual-- perhaps the result of drinking $h!t beer all the time. Great mouthfeel from the carbonation. A great representation of a heffe and a godsend in Koh Tao-- where Tiger is macro-king.
Fruity and citrusy aromas, darker than I would except (or maybe its just the photo I have :)). Amazingly drinkable. Looking forward to getting it again when I get the chance.
Hefeweizen is one of my absolute favourites and, as yet, Weihenstephaner stands unbeaten.

Poured out into glass, showing a nice copper glow over a golden colour. Hazy as hell and releasing a heavy banana aroma. Some vanilla on the background. Flavour is heavy, giving a typical hefe weizen character with a bit bitter finish to it. Nice and hoppy, I might say. When it warms up at the end of the drink, it becomes a bit more tastier, so I think this one should be poured just a bit above the regular hefe weizen temperature. Great hefe weizen, great beer.

Keg @ The Castle Tavern, Inverness...........Yellow, very hazy, large rocky head, heavy carbonation....aroma of yeast, wheat, clove-banana, spices, more pungent that from bottle......taste of sweet malt, yeast, clove-banana (strong), aromatic spices..lingering finish of cereal, wheat, cloves.
Overall - very good hefeweisen.. As I recall, it was a bit better out of the bottle.
Very strong Hefeweizen taste with most notably the banana and lemon taste. Nice refresher although its fruity aroma is very dominant. Pours very nice and overall a good beer.

Pours a hazy, nearly-opaque golden orange with a massive white head possessing high retention. On the nose is citrus candy, orange peel, lemon, banana bread, honey, cloves, cinnamon, pepper, cream soda, bubble gum, wheat, and yeast. Mouth feel is slightly oily and perfectly carbonated. Taste is fresh citrus, lemon, honey, cloves, pepper, orange soda, grapefruit, banana, bubble gum, wheat, toast, and yeast. Finish is semi-dry and slightly bitter leaving lingering orange peel, banana and yeast. A delicious, fruity and refreshing beer with an intoxicating nose.

Poured a dense cloudy amber hue with large flambouyant creamy head that lasts well. Moderate aroma of white bread and banana skin. Yum, actually tastes like liquid wheat followed by that banana skin mixed with a moderate lenth bread dough finish. Lively carbonation on palate (touch to much?), full and thick body. Am not usually a light-colour beer fan. But this is delicious, and could happily drink this all evening.
great white frothy lacy white head a top a golden cloudy yellow beer. smells like banana pudding. taste is sweet with cloves vanilla bananas and a bit of sweet citrus.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy pale straw yellow, with a large white head .
Has a light honey clove aroma, with hints of bananas, and an undertone of grass. Tasty and refreshing, slightly sweet with mild malt, ending with a gentle grain taste. Hints of banana, honeycomb, and straw, this ends so pleasant and easy.

.
Vypito na Beerkétě - Jedno z nejlepích peničných piv, co jsem kdy pil, opravdu vynikající chuť .

Beer pours cloudy light orange with a generous lacing white head. aroma of wheat malt, fruit (banana), spice and light yeasty notes.
Flavour is semi-dry and reflects the aroma. Very smooth and wonderfully balanced. Lingering dry finish with a trace of bitterness. This is a wonderful Hefeweizen.

Yellow with alot of head. Artificiell smell and very strong with tones of caramel, citrus, wheat, toffe. Tastes of bread and quite soft but strong aftertaste. Quite the balanced beer, and then there is the soft banana.

Great drinkability :)
Bottle from Alko. Originally rated on 28.5.2009. Tasty, but quite generic hefeweizen.

Hazy yellow color as almost always with this type of beer. Creamy white head. Smell sweet, grains and a hint of fruit. Taste is just a plain weizen and thats all this beer is: just another hefe weissbier.

Pours hazy, golden yellow with thick, white head.  Banana and clove on the nose.  Taste is soft, bready, and sweet with banana and a touch of clove in the background.  Medium-bodied with medium/high carbonation.  One of the best examples of its style.

Pours cloudy yellow with a large compact white foam. Round and smooth aromas of wheat, lemon zest and bananas. Medium bodied with a great soft mouth feel. Very balanced in its taste with a light bready touch. Bananas and yeast in the after taste. Very refreshing and mouthwatering.

I dont know why every one is always so conservative when rating beers. If a beer is really good, rate it really good. If its the best, rate it the best. In my opinion, Weihenstephaner  defines the best of everything in its class. I love it and when I find it in beer serving establishment on tap, Im a happy beer drinker. Looking forward to  my next one.
No doubt this is a giant of this style. Aromas of cereal, some light fruit, and a bit of a bitter finish. Good carbonated mouthfeel. This and creamy. Awesome beer, especially in the warmer weather.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 A truely great beer my fav you need to try this beer if u havent already I now. Drink it all the time get this beer in your life!
Tasty! Very rich with spices but has a very pleasant aftertaste. Seems like a heavier beer, but I like it. Will drink again.
12 oz bottle pours a hazy golden color.  Aromas of wheat, banana.  Very smooth and light bodied, just a great summer beer
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow/golden colour with creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, sweet. Flavour of banana and fruit.  Just another hefe weissbier..
Top three weiss ever and my personal favorite. Nothing more to say that hasnt been said already in other reviews. If you havent tried this hurry up and do so!

~Biog banana aroma with big presence of clove. Light bready grain, light lemony citrus.
~Pours a hazy golden color with huge lasting frothy white head.
~Sweet banana flavor, with mild clove spiciness, bready wheaty grain.
~Med bod, med high CO2, sweet finish.
~I had an old bottle as the beer was stale with cardboard flavors and glass bottle. I tried to overlook those flaws, as this is a great beer. I wish I could have had a fresher bottle. Bevmo needs to learn how to store their product. I just got gypped.

Poured from a 500ml bottle. Hazy golden wheat in colour. Huge foamy head! Lots of aroma, I get Banana, citrus, wheat and cloves. In the taste, I get banana and cloves straight away. Light on the tongue and a crisp finish. Quite posibly my favourite German beer of this style

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2015 Sharp, crisp banana and cloves in the aroma. Typical Hefeweizen notes, of course, but calibrated to the perfect point. Theres also bread and biscuit providing a solid backbone o the sweeter yeast notes. The taste is initially banana sweet but then turns into a citrusier tart and culminates with very mild, dry bitterness. Sleek and velvety body with spritzy carbonation, making for a very satisfying mouthfeel. Ive had batches that have presented slightly smoky phenols, but those are exceptions. This is an outstanding beer, probably my go-to.
mild and pleasant taste is a result of a longer period of storage and maturation. a very good wheat beer one of the best i have tasted

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy golden with a white head, loads of fine bubbles. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, bubblegum, light lemon notes. Taste is wheat, banana, light lemon,light spices. Light body, lively carbonation. Nice refreshing Hefeweizen, the light sourness keeps it very fresh and drinkable. 130611

500ml bottle. Light golden pour (slight haze) with billowy white head that recedes slowly leaving almost no lace. Big banana and bubblegum nose, a hint of spice. Relatively light on the palate (a little weight) with a fruity/spicy with a little sweetness through the middle. Finishes long and quiet.
Draft at De Paas.  Pours hazy golden with good white head.  Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast.  Flavor same as aroma.  Pretty normal for the style.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma has a distinct banana-bubblegum presence from the wheat malt. Flavor is very much the same, banana and bubblegum flavors in the forefront with backnotes of vanilla; moderately sweet, but not overpoweringly so. Silky smooth going down too. Very good hefe.
Very good beer from Germany. I had this out of the bottle that I found in a local liquor store.  It is not sweet and can easily be an all night beer.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2015 0.5L bottle, hazy gold body, massive thick white head to dip your nose in, then reducing to an almost permanent lacing,  wow! Tasting the foam is grains, wheat and a pinch of metallic, citrus and acidic. Quiet nose, no skunk at all. After the foam, typical weizen: wheat, yeast, banana, a pinch of clove and lots of citrus. Balanced smooth\crisp, maybe too gassy (shaking the glass will reduce it, anyway). Quite sweet, dry, long sourish finish. A perfect Weizen. Delicious, Id dare to say this is THE Weizen, and for a good reason.

Das Bier ist recht mild. Im Antrunk ist noch ein leichtes hefiges Aroma zu erkennen, im Mittelteil wird es dann allerdings säuerlich, das ist schade, da im Vordergrund ein eigentlich harmonisches malziges und hefiges Aroma präsent ist. Im Nachgeschmack ist mir der saure Teil deutlich zu stark, sehr schade. Mittelmäßig. 	 
Test vom 18.9.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,10,9,7,10,9 - 9,30

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2011 On tap.  Pours a light golden color with some haze in it.  It has a nice crisp malty/yeasty flavor, though it has a slight sourness to it as most hefeweizens do.  Finishes very smooth.  Im not a huge hefeweizen fan, but this is definitely a good example of the style.

12oz bottle courtesy of weihenweizen, pours a hazy golden with a nice white head and lacing, aroma is full of banana, clove and coriander, the flavor is full of spices mixed in with the banana and a slight fruity finish, all around delicious.

Slightly hazy gold body with a foamy, clinging white head.  The aroma is light until youre about to take a drink.  At that point the banana and clove jump out.  Wow!  Bright, crisp mouthfeel leads to a delicious and easy-drinking beer.  Smooth wheat and citrus is capped off with a nice clove spice.  Fantastic.
Pours hazy yellow with notes of citrus and bubblegum.  This drives more of a clove and yeast flavor that ends with a nice refreshing long finish.
Pours a lightly hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is yeasty, clove, bubblegum, and light bananas.  Flavor is spicy wheat, yeasty, clove and bubblegum.

Sets the standard for Hefeweizens.  Even with a transcontinental voyage on its shoulders, Weihenstephaner Hefeweizen still amazes with its deep, wheat-filled yeasty goodness, as solid a wheat beer youll find.  Hazy gold and with an everlasting head, the brew sends almost visible waves of banana and clove into the air;  yeah, its nothing new within the style, but this beer kinda originated things, so you have to show respect.  Tastes classic hefeweizen, simple yet elegant, brisk and perky yet complex.  Bananas and cloves meet a lemon-zest yeast finish, as dead-on as a hefe can get.  Very bubbly, almost too much so, but tasty and worth learning about, just for the beer history.   (5/11/09)
Poured into Weihenstephaner glass at pub. Nice Wheaty and yeasty aroma. Nice, deep yellow colour with hints of orange. Bold wheat beer flavour, clean but with slight aftertaste of close and bananas

pours a cloudy orange with a giant head - going from bottle to glass easily took 5 minutes with the massive head this beer produces.  Suffice to say, great carbonation and a 4-inch pillowy head promotes a prominent aroma profile.  What you get is a smell sweet malt with overtones of the required clove and hints of bubble gum.  The taste doesnt disappoint - a good wheat base with more of the same - light, spicy hops to balance the malt with clove and a tiny bubble gum lining. Its refreshingly light on the palate with a lasting thirst-quench to it..  Slightly sticky mouthfeel afterwards.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2011  Appearance: creamy, cloudy gold, nice head.  Aroma: banana, pine (clove?) and wheat.  Taste: wheat and pine, understated banana and light citrus.  Finish: lingering balanced sweet cereal and spice.   Notes:  Reviewed from beer tasting spreadsheet entry about 1.5 years old.  Notes field read only Very good HW. Updated entry on 07-07-11   Had on tap at the Old Brogue Irish Pub in Great Falls, VA.  This is a premium hefeweizen, which until now Id only had in the bottle.  On tap its even better.  This is a GREAT beer.  Fruity, light, sweet, spicy, utterly satisfying.
Pours golden with a large white head. Aroma is malt, heavy banana and clove. Flavour follows the nose.
Pours cloudy orange/gold with a foamy white head. Strong banana aroma with a little citrus. Surprisingly creamy feel and damn tasty.

Cloudy, golden pour with an enormous head that stuck around and provided some thick lacing. Very nice looking beer. Nose is banana and clove. Taste is similar to nose with a bit of hops. Good carbonation with a medium to light body. Very drinkable.

(bottle). Cloudy gold color. Medium to large white head with good retention. Light clove and banana aroma. Flavor of the same with moderate bread. Avg duration. Dry finish. Creamy/slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Good lacing.

Bottle (500ml) - An exceptionally good combination of banana & oranges blended with a mix of lemon, clove and wheat. A truly excellent smelling beer that gets better each time.

A beautiful golden orange with a massive foamy white head that fills the top of the glass & lasts remarkably well. As you would expect the beer is a cloudy one. Its incredible looking & I cant wait to taste it.

A great tasting banana flavour upfront that is combined with cloves and oranges and a hint of citrus in the background. Fantastic and a beer I could drink all night long.

Smooth and incredibly refreshing, the beer goes down so well and feels great. It is light to medium bodied with perfect carbonation.

Absolutely fantastic all round & definitely one the best beers I have ever tried. Exactly what a hefeweizen should taste like & one that everyone should try. - - -

Bottle from Mane Liquor. There is no need to explain this one since most people should have had this by now. A perfect example of the hefe style. Probably the best going around and at a fantastic price

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into the curved weisse glass from the gift pack. Attempted to do it traditional style, pretty much failed on that. (Will not be holding my poor pour against the score!)

Appearance- After it settled down, excellent amount of head with lacing throughout. Hazy golden color, like a hefeweizen should have.

Smell- Exactly what you should expect from the style. Lots of cloves and bananas. Pleasant, but not overpowering in any way.

Taste- Again, bananas and cloves, a very full taste, but still very easy drinking.

Mouthfeel- Exceptional! Despite the full taste, this in no way taxed my palate. As light on the tongue as a BMC lager, but with a taste that rivals any beer.

Overall- Had to go the full monte on this one. In addition to the combination of drinkability and full flavor, you can taste history while drinking this beer. This is the hefeweizens all others are measured against, and for a good reason.
Hazy golden with large white head - aroma of wheat malts and yeast - taste is wheat, some yeast and small hints of banana in the backgtound and lingers into the finish - very good and refreshing

Bottle. Blooming eggshell head on a darker, hazy orange hue.  Lots of nice tart citrus, orange, slight banana, grass, and clove in the aroma.  Same goes for the taste, but with lots of nice grassy and yeasty sourness on top of citrus and banana.  Lighter to medium body, with softer carbonation.  Always nice.

Pour light hazy golden orange white head terrific lace. Aroma banana, clove, bubble gum, pepper, spicy yeast. Taste pepper, spicy yeast, clove, banana, bitter, bubble gum. MF medium to full body medium carb. Good stuff solid wheat.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange body with a mostly white head.  Bubblegum, and banana sweetness.  A hint of citrus with a spicy tone.  Light cloves and orange peel.  Very soft and thin body with a mild sweetness.  Great offering, but not my favorite weissbier.

Pours a hazy orange with ample white head.  Aroma is distinctly banana, clove, and yeast.  Taste is bready with a lingering clove note.  On the palate it is light bodied but the high carbonation lends it a creamy mouthfeel.  As far as wheats go, this is supposedly one of the best.  Very refreshing but I am still gaining an appreciation for wheat.  Great beer if you gets down wif wheat.
i don;t think this beer can be beat.  unless you go back to less than 1000 AD.  ........i think these guys got it down by now.  youre not gonna beat this.  close to perfect, what more can you want?

Prost! I have waited to try this beer and have high expectations. Read my review in the context of the style.

It poured beautifully into my weizen with a 4 finger thick frothy / foamy white head. Head retention was impressive and lots of lacing hugged the glass.

The aroma epitomizes the style - I get some faint banance, cloves, wheat, yeast, and bready notes. Typing it cant describe the "x factor" present. I have had other beers with these players but they dont come together like in this gem.

The taste mimcs the aroma and again has banance, cloves, wheat, and yeast notes. The taste has a slightly sweet element and is very refreshing. The finish is dry and leaves you wanting more. Top notch.

The mouthfeel is smooth and medium bodied. It was quite effervescent with moderate carbonation.

If you have access - there is truly no reason to wait to try this. It should be purchased and consumed regularly throughout all warmer months.

Draft.  Pours unclear orange with a lacing cloud-like fluffy white head. Aroma is  wheaty with a medium yeasty note with a vanilla fruity sweetness . Flavour is wheaty yeasty sweetyness with a little clove.  Not to sound like a broken record, but there is a reason why this is as highly rated as it is.  Just a magnificent beer in a style that I only venture into during warm months and European adventures.

Bottle. Tapping The Vine. Woah. Ive neglected this beer for far too long. Nose is heavy yeast and bread with slight fruit and honey sweetness saturating the nostrils. Poured light orange-amber color with huge white head from a vigorous pour. Nice lacing. Taste was insane! Yeasty and nutty with wheat bread and spices. Somewhat sweet but not too much so. Just right. Also, traces of fruits could be detected as well. Perfectly balanced. Great with a meal or alone.

Bottle 50 cl. Slightly hazy relatively light yellow pour, with a very durable white head. A lovely scent of yeast and wheat affects almost before the capsule has come off. Then banana and hints of citrus. the taste is fairly sweet, and notes of honey and korianter sensed.
excellent example of what a hefe should be. even though i think its a little overrated its still a great beer. yeasty and wheaty.. exactly what i expected.

Draft at The Bridge. Pours a cloudy gold color with a centimeter-thick bone white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, bready malt, straw, cereal, and grass. Flavor is very similar- banana, clove, sugar, sweet and bready malts, wheat, and cereal. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a dry, sweet, grainy mouthfeel and dry finish. Lingering sweetness. Hard to find a more classic German hefeweizen than this one, even if the one I tried seemed a bit old for some reason.

Appearance - Extremely tall, foamy, long-lasting head. Clear golden body. Bottle foamed over as soon as I opened the bottle, and was very difficult to pour even though I did not shake it.

Smell - Light and refreshing floral banana smell.

Taste - Very light and springy with refreshing subdued fruit complexity. Balanced spice, and subtle alcohol.

Mouthfeel - Spritey spice feel, goes down very smooth.

Drinkability - Could drink this all night. Not heavy, and complex enough to keep me coming back for more.

Serving type: bottle
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Cloudy golden color with nice thick white head. banana, lemon, spices, ghints of honey in aroma. taste, banana, coriander, cloves, hints of oranges. Nice sweet finish. Nice.

On draft at British Beer Company. Poured into a Weihenstephaner glass (long tall wheat beer glass), cloudy orange-yellow with a white head. Fruity citrus and banana with very subtle spiciness. This is a benchmark beer that you can always go back to for a great example of the style.

Some cinnamon in the aftertaste, The finish has a slight acidic touch.
Pours out a cloudy orange/gold with a thick white head. Has an amazing banana scent, which carries through to the taste.  Such a great taste, palate, and appearance. I highly recommend this to anyone who likes Hefeweizen.

Bottled, 50 cl. Pours hazy orange with an irregular mellow white head. Aroma: Candyfloss, banana, yeast, citrus. Taste: Moderate sweetness. Banana, citrus flavours. Wheat. Palate: Soft bodied, creamy texture, almost average carbonation. Pleasant mild dry finish.

If youve had all the time to refine your beer that these guys have, your beer had better be damn pretty in the glass.  And this is, it glows a cloudy yellow hue and smells exactly like you would hope, loads of clove and other yeast spiciness. Really a style-defining beer in the way few others can aspire; the only thing that immediately comes to mind is Alpha King, and even that is so far from the realm of standard APAs that it almost breaks type.  Truly a benchmark beer, in a style Im not even particularly fond of.
Cloudy yellow pour with small head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and coriander. Taste is of wheat and yeast with a slight citrus tinge in the background. Good beer.

Bottle 500ml at Patricks. Pours cloudy, straw yellow with foamy white head. Aroma is banana, clove, citrus, yeast. Taste is medium sweet, very light sour. Light to medium body, creamy, soft carbonation. Really good weiss this one, up there with Paulaner. 07042011

Poured from the bottle, the color is a warm, creamy-looking yellow-orange, with a big, fluffy, foamy white head. The aroma has the prototypical German yeast characteristics of banana and clove to go along with a wheaty earthiness. The flavor is primarily an airy, lightly-sweet, and mildly fruity combination of unripe banana, milled wheat, and yeast. Medium bodied, but the the fine carbonation makes it seem fluffy and smooth.

50cl bottle. Pours beautifully, cloudy with a big head, if not careful, a very big head! The nose is of toffee and bananas and there are also distinctive notes of ginger and praline. The taste has more of the banoffee pie thing going on. The palate is fairly big in structure, a very creamy texture and a refreshing (if still a little sweet) finish. Lovely beer, but I like most Weiss beers so I find it hard to be discerning.

0.5l bottle. poured with heaps of tight frothy head, golden with hazy. aroma of hay and citrus. hardly carbonated at all. lots of long mouthfeel. slightly sweet with a little amount of bitterness. not bad.
Pours hazy golden straw with a tall thick head, decent lacing.  Aroma is fruity.  Good wheat flavor throughout with a spicy finish, there is also a little malt at the end.

Very easy to drink. Huge head, which settled away in 2 minutes. Perhaps my nose is different, but no banana, citrus, or cloves here. Something like wild forest strawberries if it were a fruit. Tastewise one the best hefeweisse.
amazing hefeweissbier. full robust flavor.. one of the best ive had.. bought it at 99 bottles in federalway

(bottle) Finally got around to reviewing this one.  Lets see:  Hazy yellow orange colour, creamy, frothy Weizen-style head.  Aroma of wheat and mouldy orange.  No banana, but plenty of clove and ever so slightly peppery.
Mouthfeel is much creamier than some other German Weizens, which become dusty and gritty towards the end of the glass.   This is a very well produced beer, but I will look elsewhere for my next Hefeweizen.  Not as bland as Erdinger, but not as good as Paulaner IMO.

Pours an opaque golden with an incredible white head.  Huge, billowing head and a thick lace coats the glass.

Intense spicy wheat aroma.  Pepper and cloves with a citrus edge.

Very creamy with a crisp taste.  Light and sweet.  Not as spicy as the aroma indicates but still a nice pepper kick to offset the wheat sweetness.  Lemon/orange tang.  Needs saying again, this is very creamy with a light carbonation tang.  Evaporates in the mouth, as if the beer converts to head as you drink.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden yellow. A handsome and full, white head that dissipates pretty quickly. Aroma is bananas and yeast. Flavor is fruity with a whole load of bananas. A little bit of yeast in the background. Palate is perfect. Not watery at all, but not too full to get in the way of drinkability. Lot of carbonation.

500 mL bottle into a pint glass.  Lovely gold/orange colour with a well formed head.  Smells wheaty and a little smoked.  Very easy on the tastes buds, wheaty, mild, a touch spicy.  This would be a pleasant session beer but doesnt have enough flavour to suit me.  A good beer, but not top percentile.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy yellow/golden with a sticky white head, excellent retention. The nose is the most interesting part here, marzipan cake, tangy c-fruits, some warm spices I cant define. Then greatly mouthfilling and creamy but the aftertaste is somewhat corny, reminds me of sweet breakfast cereal. Palate is rather silky for a wheat beer. Taste is mildy sweet with that typical sourness. Overall good, but not that magical.
Poured from bottle. Cloudy appearance , sparkling, nice frothy head that stays, bready, wheaty smell. Awesome tasting wheat beer, can keep coming back to this one.
Pour is a light golden color with a small white head. Nose is of citrus and some other hop characters. Taste is mostly the same. Though not the most complex, still a decent beer.

Tap. Pours quite transparent golden yellow with a full white head, stays nicely all the way down to protect the beer underneath. Heavy aroma of citrus, some malts and hops obviously. Nice taste of the same citrus, very refreshing. Very good hefe weissen.

Ive had this one a few times but never got around to rating it. This serving was off the Tap, light frothy head. Sweet banana aroma, very yeasty. This is probably the best example of a Hefeweizen that is out there, plus, it is extremely easy to find. Great example that is perfect for hot, summer days.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2014 Pours a hazy yellow with off white head. Aroma is tropical with banana, mangoo, fruity yeast and wheat. Taste add a little bit of hops and some spice.

Pours cloudy yellow with a really fuzzy big white head. Aroma is sweet, with cents of fruit, spices and bananas. Flavor is of banana, sweetness,  pale malt and yeast. Little bitterness.  Palate is soft carbonation, medium bodied, thin texture and general smoothness.  Overall an excellent Weissbier, really enjoyable.

I cant find the banana in this as some have but I did find the lemon. A very tasty and refreshing beer. It would be a great beer for a warm summer night. I normally do not drink wheat beers but Ill have another of this one...maybe two.

The classic hefeweizen.  Pours extremely hazy/cloudy gold, with big fluffy white head, took a few pours to get it out.  Aroma hits right away with a big bubblegum, banana, and clove base, some nice apple, pear and other ripe fruit, and some other spices.  Taste is even better, creamy mouthfeel from the yeast.  Taste is sweet banana, bubblegum, ripe fruit, banana, nice clove, cardamom, grains of paradaise almost with a spicy dry and clean finish.  How all hefeweizens should be measured.

Was hard to pour this one, as the head was big and didnt want to drop. But Im not complaining, that much. Pours cloudy as expected, big white head.
Bits of banana, bubble-gum, and cloves right up front.
Sweet banana, with some clove. A little of the bubble-gum on the back-end. Bit wheaty, with a typical remnant of yeast coming through.
Very smooth. Creamy. A little sweetness stays with you along with a slight yeast aftertaste. The carbonation helps keep everything balanced.
Very drinkable. Not much for a session beer for me, as the typical hefe flavors get to be too much over a long drinking session. But very good on a warm day.
citrus, hay, dough, vanilla, golden, hazy, rocky head, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter,
Cloudy yellow orange in color... Aroma is crisp, wheaty, notes of cloves and spices... Flavor is wheat malts, notes of banana and cloves... Pretty good hef

Pours a cloudy gold with a tall frothy white head with great lacing. Aroma of yeast, banana and citrus. Taste is quite malty with wheat and fruit, particularly of banana and cloves with some spice. Dry finish. Quite a full complex flavour but also refreshing. Awesome
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2011 VLight clean extremely refreshing hefeweizen, palate is very citrusy, light citrus complexing keeps you going back for more, highly recommended
bottle in a hefe glass.  Hazy golden pour with huge frothy head.  Strong spicy aroma of coriander and citrus.  Rich, well developed flavor.  Easy to drink, but has enough flavor to enjoy all day.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2011 Fantastic example of the form. Aroma had citrus notes. Pours from tap with an inch head. Unfiltered so it has a nice cloudiness. Nice floral notes on the finish. Just a beautifully balanced beer.
Beautiful cloudy golden color of unfiltered weissbeir. Wheat malty aroma, mildly spicy on the tongue with a clean finish. Very nice.

On tap at the Paas, the Hague.
Cloudy blond colour. Very refreshing Weiss beer.
Clear golden with a huge lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, banana, wheaty, yeasty and cloves. Flavor is rather sweet. Soft and smooth. Sweet and light acidic finish. Very refreshing. 040310
Bottle. Hazy golden with a fluffy head. Lovely fruity flavour and taste. Easy on the palate

12oz bottle served in a tulip.  Pour is hazy, deep gold with 3 fluffy fingers off quickly dissipating white head.  Nose is Belgian yeast, old vegetables, light summer fruits, and a bit of spice.  Taste is bubble gum, light hops, light toasted malt, and a bit of corn.  This fades just a bit, and is met with a variety of spices to comprise the finish.  I must admit surprise with this one.  From the nose, I didnt expect much.  However, this really shines as a wonderfully refreshing beer that would easily flex its muscles during the warmer months.
Light cloudy orange with huge fluffy white head. Nice banana and spice aroma. Light hop flavor with good maltiness.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2011 Pours a murky orange-gold with a large foamy white head smelling strongly of clove and banana. The lacing sparkles and slowly crawls down the sides of the glass.

Everything comes together in this hefe. Im not the biggest fan of hefes but this one does it right. The banana, the clove, the lemon, the malt, the hops all blend together magically. This one also comes with the perfect blast of carbonation. MMM. Deliziös.

This is about the only hefe for me thats equally quaffable and sippable.

Classic Hefe, not as cloudy as expected, nice fluffy head, lovely wheat aroma, really easy to drink as a hefe should be, good hop/malt balance, even with the low bitterness (supposed to be) doesnt get too sweet, highly carbonated as it should be, the perfect summer beer, though Id drink it anytime.

Pours a hazy yellow color with aroma of sweet fruit.  Taste of possibly pomegranate or some type of sour citrus fruit.  Palate is left with notes of fruit and yeast.  Overall a good beer that was refreshing.

Cloudy golden color with a thick white head.  Fruity and spicy yeast aroma.  Some subtle hints of tropical and citrus fruit on the palate.  Mouthfeel is crisp but not thin, tending more towards the medium range.  Finishes on a cereal grain malty note.  Very nice.  Definitely one of those "bench mark" beers for the style.

Appearance: When poured into the glass the beer created huge amount of foam which separated whithin several seconds, unveiling a beautiful hazy golden beer with a big frothy head.
Smell: Cloves, and subdued banana, fruitiness. A bit of yeast, light sulphuric notes. Some citrus.
Mouthfeel: Medium body, quite surprising for the style. nice moderate carbonation, refreshing and clean finish.
Taste: Cloves, slight banana notes. Great balance of flavours, no "banana shake" feel, like with some other Weissbiers. A bit fruity, some breadiness, citrus, touch of spiciness/bitterness in the finish, which goes away in about a minute, giving some space for another glass )
Note: Classic example of the style. Refreshing glass of pure gold with added bonus of balanced flavours.

Weihenstephanerin hefe on likaisen oranssi ja erittäin samea olut. Valkoista ja paksuhkoa vaahtoa muodostuu paljon. Tuoksussa on hiivaa, vehnää, persikkaa ja banaania. Maku on sama, mutta ilman selkeää hiivaisuutta. Lisäksi pieni mausteisuus astuu tässä vaiheessa kuvaan. Raikas ja puhdas olut, joka toimii erinomaisesti maukkaana janonsammuttajana. Hiilihappojen runsaudesta huolimatta lasi tyhjenee melko nopeasti. Itselleni tämä on parhaita eteeni sattuneita vehnäoluita. Hinta-laatusuhteeltaan tämä on erinomainen.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 Aroma is bananas, wheat and clean.  The flavor is bananas, wheat, malts and a clean/smooth finish.  Very easy to drink, a classic.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2012 Cloudy hazy orange body with a big white head. Yeasty top weiss aroma with a nice cereal tone. Slick extremely drinkable texture. Great yeasty flavour, banana and vanilla. Excellent. (8/5/9/5/18)
Pale cloudy golden body with a big white head. Yeasty aroma with wheat, cereal, some caramel and vanilla. Perfectly carbonated refreshing palate. Excellent  flavour with wheat, vanilla, some banana and spices.
(bottle) slightly hazy gold with huge white head. Aroma of clove, some banana. Flavor is clove, banana, yeast, bread.

Best Hefeweizen I have had personally. It had that off white cloudy display  funneled inside the bold orange color of the full beer in the large Hefe glass as the head was settling. Pleasant disposition with a travelers finish that gives me a certain feel good since. As if I were on a picnic sitting under a tree as foxes scurry threw nearby bushes and butterflies flew back and forth across grassy hills. This beer had an earth tone to it. Would pair great with any grilled beef or pork. Flared  up my nose. Then I dipped it into the Hefe  while gulping. A little foam from the head ended up on the tip of my sniffer. From the worlds oldest brewery and there are just some thing you cant quite mimic.

Draft.  Pours a slightly hazy bright yellow with a medium white, dense head.  Aroma of earth, yeast, citrus, some banana.  Flavor is full, earthy, some banana and lemon.  Mouthfeel is great -- creamy and smooth.  Delicious, complex, subtle.

500ml bottle sample purchased at the LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden colour, with a fluffy white head that recedes to a small ring very quickly. Some decent lacing as well. Aroma is very distinctly of hops but not strong. Taste is bitter and slightly tart.

What a beautiful head! Huge, foamy, white and lasting. underneath a a cloudy golden beer with tones of yeast, wheat and ripe banana-sweetness. Lively carbonation and the clove-like spicyness makes this a very refreshing beer and balances the sweetness perfectly

pours pale yellow, slight haze, with a 3-finger white head. bread, wheat, oranges, spices, bubble gum. light to medium body, lively carbonation (a bit too much). a solid hefeweisse brew, the best ive had yet, although not my cup of tea.
500mL bottle, pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma and flavour of bananas, citrus and clove. Solid hefe.
Fruktig lukt, nästan lite kardemumma. Fruktig och lite besk. Klingar av väldigt fint och minimal eftersmak men väldigt vattning. Inget jag blev allt för imponerad av.

On tap at the Brick Store Pub. The pour is pale yellow with a huge white head. The aroma is oranges, spices, wheat and bread. The taste is huge wheat malts and citrus hops. The palate is light to medium, good carbonation and a smooth finish. Overall a simple, flavorful and well balanced beer.

Poured a nice yellow with a solid white head. Smells of spice, a bit of citrus, wheat and yeast. Flavors are of banana, clove, faint citrus and some other spice. Banana taste is very tasty and the clove is not overdone. Palate is rushed with awesome texture of smooth flow along with perfect carbonation, resulting in a beautifully balanced and bodied beer.

Poured into a weizen glass.

4.0 A: Hazy golden yellow color. Two fingers of dense head with excellent retention and moderate lacing.

4.5 S: Tons of banana esters and peppery spice. Perhaps there is some clove in there, but Im not picking much up. Something along the lines of lemon as well.

3.5 T: Really crisp and refreshing, but I find it rather bland. I dont know where everyone is getting bursts of flavor from. The flavors of the nose are back again, but really subdued. This, not a bad brew.

5.0 M: Insanely smooth. Frothy and something like creamy, though not actually creamy. Simply wonderful feel.

4.5 D: Mouthfeel is awesome, smell is awesome, appearance is good enough. Only thing holding back this brew is the lack of stronger flavors.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-11-2009 04:16:03

Mildly hazy golden yellow with 3 finger white head. Smells mellow sweet fruits, oranges and apricots, a bit of wheat and some funky yeast notes. Taste of mellow citrus and orchard fruits, wheat, yeast, a bit of bitter hops.
Medium body and carbonation with some alcohol warmth and nice dry finish. yeasts and fruit hang around a bit. Excellent brew, beautifully balanced. Alcohol well hidden but lends a nice warmth. Top of the list Hefe for sure!

Great nose with prominent citrus and bread, pours golden with a white fronthy head.  Starts light and heady on the tongue, with medium mouthfeel,  advancing into strong musty wheat, a balanced grist; banana esters and Tang to finish.  Best Weiss Ive had.

Has a dry, bready, crisp aroma. Beautiful golden color that is perfectly clear topped by a generous white head. Taste is a great balance of sweet at the beginning and middle with a bitter finish at the middle and tapers off at the back end. Between the full body, the creamy texture, and the fizzy carbonation, the mouth-feel is an excellent sensation. Hands down one of the best beers Ive had, even as someone who isnt huge on wheat beers.

Magnificent beer. A perfectly-balanced, clean-finishing beer that achieves sophistication and complexity without sacrificing accessibility. Heavily-carbonated but more "creamy" than "fizzy"-tasting, with a subdued, elegant spice-and-citrus aroma. Beautiful, translucent orange-gold color with a short, fluffy head that quickly turns to lace. It is hard to describe what this beer is without talking about what its not-- it is crisp and defined without being acid or bitter, rich and satisfying without being yeasty, complex and floral without being weird. Great mouth-feel without being sticky or meaty. Balanced is the name of the game, here-- there is nothing to dislike. Belongs on any list of the worlds most perfect beers.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow, with one finger foamy head after decanting. Smell is outstanding perfect representation of banana and clove. Those two carry over to taste, alongside bubblegum, yeast, wheat, and coriander. Just a tiny bit of bitterness helps balance this nicely. Lively carbonation and light body; easy, wholly enjoyable drinking here.

Pours a beautiful hazy golden with orange around the sides. Huge frothy bone white head, but only lasts for a minute or two, then fades to nothing. Aroma is of yeast with a hint of banana. Light bodied with high carbonation. Very nicely balanced, a touch of acidity followed by sweet wheat, finish is medium with some spiciness developing, primarily cinnamon and some typical medicinal notes. Very crisp and refreshing, I will be returning to this beer come the summer.

bottled. pours a pale gold. this thing has a huge pillowy white head. aromas of floral hops, pine, and citrus. moderately sour and lightly bitter. flavor on the tongue are well balanced with the above aromas. the finish is well balance and long for a medium bodied beer. overall, this is pretty good, ill buy this again when looking for a well balanced weiss.

On tap. Golden cloudy looks, Massive head. Hoppy floral and grass aroma, banana there also. Medium sweetness, some spices around the flavor. Very refreshing, great taste. soft carbonation on the palate. Nice after taste.

540ml bottle poured into weizen glass. Beautiful orange/yellow cloudy appearance. Giant growing white head which quickly fizzled out. Aroma dominated by citrus and yeast. Taste of lemon, orange, some spices and cinnamon. Extremely lively and bubbly mouthfeel. Delicious beer and always a treat. 

As a side note, I used to have this beer out of a vending machine at the Technical University in Munich during night shifts manning a physics experiment. I dont know whether it was fresher or it was just the novelty of drinking in a physics lab, but those were some damn good drinks!

Highly carbonated, nice pour, cloudy golden yellow hazy color, smells of yeast and citrus.

Taste is bitter, lemon citrus, can taste the bread and yeast, smooth and crisp, bitter on the back end, clean tasting hefe.

Definitely nice for a hot day, not overpowering at all, all around solid beer.
Golden pour with white head. Nose of banana and yeasty wheat. Flavor is crisp with notes of the aforementioned. Enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 Draught @ Apotekergaarden, Grimstad
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and clove. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long wheat, banana and clove finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Draught @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of banan and wheat malt. Taste is light sweet. Texture is watery with soft carbonation.
Impressive heffe, big taste, similar to Hoegaarden, but with less citrus.  Totally cleansing.  Memorable.

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity wall adhesive white foam collar which was fine and even of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. The beer has a thick blond color and a sweet taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a banana touch . This beer smells fruity.
Really good weizenbier. Smooth but still rich taste. Enjoyable light mouthfeel.

Pours a cloudy pale orange. Nose is weak, hints of lemon peel and wheat, taste a a bit too bitter, a little sharp, fair amount of body, moderate sweetness. A little let down, as I love their other beers.
Yeasty, fruity taste. Strong banana and spice aroma.  Bright golden color with a huge head and lots of carbonation. A great hefe!

I am not a big beer drinker but after having this... I had this from the bottle at Red Coat Tavern in MI. What a find! Instantly became one of my favorite beers. Good head, nice color, fruit and grass flavors came through without this being too heavy. As many others have said, this is a VERY refreshing beer. Light, smooth, and not overly carbonated. Picture sitting on the porch on a warm spring evening (your choice of location, mine is somewhere in the Canadian Rockies before all of the snow has melted) drinking multiples of these. Excellent beer if you want to try something other than the usual big name brands but dont know where to start.

0.5l bottle. Pours a unclear orange/yellow pale body with a gigantous beautiful white hefe foam. Noticed some sediments at the bottom of the glass. The aroma is really strong and nice with sweet yeast, bananas and wheat. Not heavily carbonated. This is fantastic refreshing and a great weissbier!

Poured from a 1 pt .9oz bottle.  

Appearance: Great hazy orange color with a thick, pillowy three finger head.  

Aroma: Bready, doughy, banana, floral

Taste: cloves, spicy, sweet

Mouthfeel: medium body, tons of carbonation.  Carbonation really bites into the tongue.

Overall it was very good.  The first German hefeweizen Ive had so I cant compare it to the style, but I look forward to trying more.

everything this style should be. strong and sweet banana aroma, big bubblegum and banana flavors. great carbonation. this is a richly flavorful beer, so if youre looking for light and refreshing the Premium is a better choice

Rating #468, bottle from Lagersalget @ Grønjordskollegiet  

Very nice apperance. An orangey beer in the middle, but it has more white-yellow edges / hue, and almost looks like a darkened witbier or something like that. Head is huge at first, but then it falls, though it remains to exist as a small, dense, white head. Aroma is banana and hay; all the usual stuff, but seems a bit more malty. Nice. Flavor is banana at first which is very pleasant; then comes some hay and rubber together with a certain bitterness from the hops that appears more distinct than in many other hefeweizens which is also pleasant, and at last we have the alcohol that is also more distinct than in other hefes. Surprisingly thin and watery. I had expected a creamier beer and prefer the palate of ex. Franziskaner over this beers palate. Refreshing as hell. A nice hefen, but lacks palate.

16oz bottle poured into a pint glass.

A-Pours a hazy saffron with an incredible head of bright white foam thats three fingers high. As the head melts its amazing retention fades slowly leaving large chasms in its top and laying down amazing sheets of lace leaving the glass look just like spent bubble wrap. stellar simply stellar.

S-Smells of delicious banana nut bread almost.... with hints of bubblegum and wheat. No alcohol apparent at all.

T-The taste is stellar. All banana and wheat sweetness that tastes delicious. There is an extremely clean finish with no bitterness at all.

M-The mouthfeel is silky smooth with just enough carbonation to keep things exciting. 

D-This beer is amazingly drinkable. I have yet in my life to find a better hefe than Weihenstephaner. I have compared all others to this so far. If I was rating on a scale of 5 to the style this would easily be across the board. The smells erupt from the glass the taste is not only dead on for the style but also downright explosive for a wheat beer. The drinkability is both flawless and dangerous as you will require to buy more of this before you are ready if your not careful. A sixteen oz bottle can last no more than 5 minutes if youre not paying attention.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 A: Slightly-hazed orange with a pretty nice head and good lacing.

S: Sweet grains and some spiciness paired with beautiful hefe yeast.

T: Some spiciness to balance out the sweet malt background. The spiciness seems to come from a bit of clove, and then there is some definite banana with hints of vanilla. 

M: Medium body with a good amount of carbonation.

D: This is the definition of the perfect summer sessionable beer. Great thing to always have around during the warmer months.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-01-2009

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2012 0.5 L bottle @ home into a Paulaner Weissbier glass. Cloudy, light golden orange appearance with a big cream colored head- a touch lighter appearance that other German Hefeweizen. Fairly spicy yeasty, appetizing banana and clove, wheat malty aroma. Perfect aroma. Soft mouth feel. Fairly sweet wheat malty, delicious banana, moderate clove, fairly spicy yeasty flavor with a bit dry, spicy finish. Everything in this beer is in perfect balance. Absolutely delicious sweetness (banana, wheat malt), great spiciness (yeast, clove). My favorite German Hefeweizen and quite possibly my favorite beer. This one is the perfect session beer unlike some of my other (stronger) favorite beers. Really, quite possibly my favorite beer.
UPDATED: JAN 15, 2011 An unclear yellow orange beer.Banana,yeast,flowers,wheat,light bitter,clove,orange,tangerine.Good ballance.Very drinkable beer.

50 cl bottle. Pours a cloudy, opaque yellow body with a creamy white head. Nice lacing.Smells of wheat, yeast and citrus (mainly lemon). A bit of spice in the nose too.Nice yeast and lemon flavors too. Clean and smooth palate.
golden, cloudy, frothy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thin feel, average carbonation,

A legjobb búzasör, amit valaha ittam. Gyönyörű arany színe van, mintha csak egy reklámot látnánk, olyan szép. Banános-élesztős illata bódító,  hatalmas fehér habot ereszt, ami igazán tetszetős. Az íze is mesés, valahogy olyan kerek a történet, édeskés banános íz, háttérben a citrusok, kenyérízt is éreztem, de egyik irányba sem megy el túlzottan, a szolid kesernyés lecsengés azért megvan. Közepes testű, tehát még itatja is magát, és nem sok szituáció merülhet fel, amikor nem kívánnám. Fantasztikus!

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from the Leesburg Wegmans. 
Aroma: The nose is full of banana, clove, yeast, and wheat.  Classic German Hefe. 
Appearance: It pours a cloudy, dark gold with a meringue like white head.  Great head retention. 
Taste: The flavor is light and clean with notes of banana, clove, and a bready wheat note.  Very traditional and very well done. 
Palate: Light in body with an abundance of soft carbonation leading to a short, clean finish. 
Overall: An excellent, classic example of a German Hefeweizen.  Highly recommended if you are a wheat beer fan.

On tap at Brauerei Weihenstephan. Pours golden bronze in colour with a white and fluffy head. Aroma is banana, spicy and citrus. Flavour is banana with some yeast and fruitiness. Easy to drink and smooth. Excellent full aftertaste as well that is crisp and refreshing.
Amazing beer. The pour is cloudy orange with a huge head. Aromas of wheat with fragrant yeast and spices. Delicious yeasty hefe with slight spices upfront and banana and fruits also present.

The Moment: Simple evening--crosswords and Baseball Tonight... Glassware: Koenig pilsner... Appearance: cloudy, slightly opaque golden body with a soft, thick snow-white head; nice tracings as the glass empties... Aroma: citric notes tickle with an undepining of hops to spice up the experience.... Palate: smooth, creamy texture--as pleasant and inviting a hefe as I have encountered... Taste: Clear, crisp profile, as expected from something with a recipe this old; a bit tart, but softly invigorating... Overall: Can anyone argue with the year 1046? A classic that refreshes easily, evenly, and with a slight twerk that provides character in a genre where the less character, usually the better...

Notes from Saturday, July 31, 2010
12 oz. bottle from HyVee Marion

Ar: Smells just like a good hefe should.  Clove, banana, and hefe yeast dominate.
Ap: Pours a somewhat opaque gold with a huge weizen head.  The head dissipates disappointingly quickly.
F: Again, emblematic of the style.  Clove, banana, hefe yeast overwhelm the palate in a good way.
P: Nice lively carbonation, medium chewy body.
O: Absolute classic.

0.5 L bottle. Golden and cloudy with white foam. Aroma is hay, banana and leaves. Taste medium sweetness, lightly sour and sour-bitter finish. Lively carbonation, light to medium body and a quite thin feel. The beer worked great to my spaghetti carbonara and was real easy non-complex session beer. Very high drinkability!

50cl bottle from Sainsburys. Poured the expected hazy straw colour with a large billowing white head; yeasty aroma with some light coriander; soft and lightly bodied, with a refreshing wheaty taste; and a light dry wheaty finish. This is very subtle and understated compared to the majority of Hefeweizens. Very pleasant and easy to drink.

I normally enjoy heavier beers, but THIS is the exception!! A beautiful large white foamy head with scents of clove, banana, and some citrus. A creamy texture that lasts quite a bit frames the Juicy Fruit flavor. In a class of its own!!
Hazy blond beer. Nose of oranges, banana and wheat. Oranges and banana in the taste as well. Also some spices and bubblegum. I think this the best Hefe I have drunk so far.

Bottle. Brought this one back from Montana, a week before it became available here in Alberta. Fantastic. So glad I paid the extra duty on it. Pours the classic hazy/murky orange/yellow you rather expect from a Hefe. Nose is soft banana and orange, some spice and wheat here too, plus light malty notes as well as a very light spiciness. Bubblegum too. Flavours of gum, spice, fruit, lemon, wheat yeast. Pleasant, not my favorite Hefe, but very nice.

On tap at rattle n hum.

Golden yellow in appearance with a thin white head. Aroma is of spices, bananas, flowers, and wheat. Flavor is much of the same and full of carbonation with a strong yeast and bitter sugar aftertaste. Good hefeweizen.
Den har det mesta som är så härligt med en fin tysk veteöl. Fräsch och balanserad, mycket skumbanan, lagom syrlig. Riktigt bra!

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy yellow/golden colour with big fluffy white head.
Yeast, wheat, hops, fruits and spices in aroma.
Flavour is wheat, yeast, caramel, banana, spices and mild hops.
Quite fizzy. Balanced Weißbier.

Pours a hazy yellow with the tallest head Ive seen for a while - a big billowing cloud of a head.  The nose is of lemon, perfumed fruits, light malt and bready yeast.  There is a fine mix of spices too.  Its light in the mouth, with the yeast and spices being the major character.  About half of the way down a little tartness creeps in but is balanced well by a soft malt presence.  The mouth feel is very thin, highly carbonated and refreshing.  It finishes on the yeast and perhaps a touch of honey.  Nicely done, undoubtedly a classic - but how exciting can a weissbier really be?

500ml bottle poured from one of their World Cup Gift boxes poured into the strange looking Weihenstephaner World Cup Glass. Golden yellow in color, with just a little cloudiness. Vigorous pour leaves more foam into glass than beer that settles with some nice lacing. Banana and cloves in the aroma with some bready wheat notes. More cloves and bananas in the taste, but not overwhelming. Citrusy yeast component adds just a little bitterness in the finish. Soft creamy mouthfeel with lots of carbonation.
This is my favorite hefeweizen, perfect on a hot summer day, but also very good when you want something relatively light and refreshing. Makes a great session type beer or starter beer when you want to move on to something more heavy.

Bottle thanks to Gunnfryd.Pours cloudy yellow with a nice big fluffy white head.Aroma of cloves and banana with some yeast,caramel , wheat and bubblegum.Flavor is wheat malt ,sugar and spice with a little bitterness.Medium body, average carbonation, sweet spicy finish.
A very nice hefeweizen.
hazy brown yellow colour with a fluffy long lasting head. Big ripe banana nose with hints of cloves. The flavour is also full of banana and yeasty. Really fresh and citrus. Very refreshing
On tap at Blind Tiger. Pours an amber orange color with a white foam head.  Has an aroma of orange and fresh bouquet.  Has a lemon zest taste with notes of banana and clove.  Very tasty.
bottle pours hazy orange with a tall white head.  Aroma is strong clove and banana with a mild alcohol.  Flavor is strong wheat and a sour lemon note ending with peppery yeast and light citrus.

Pours yellow-brown. Aroma is lots of banana, and cream. Flavor is also lots of banana and citrus. Very smooth.
On tap at The Farmhouse in Burlington

Minden dicséretet megérdemel ez a kis serecske. Nagyon szép kis opálos testére gyönyörű hosszantartó, mégse kemény habkorona ül. Könnyen átfolyik rajta az éltető nedű. Élénkítő. Még a végén megszeretteti velem a búzasöröket.

50cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Best before 2011-05-05. It poured a pale golden colour with a huge white foamy head that settled down slowly. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is massive wheat with heavy notes of yeast. Some dough, dust and bananas as well. Flavour is smooth, but a tad watery and thin. Carbonated. Wheat, dough and yeast are the most prominant features, but theres also notes of spices, and some fruityness such as apples and citrus.

Bottle. Poured a murky yellow with a large rocky white head that was fully lasting and had excellent lacing. The aroma was loaded with a doughy yeast , bread malts, light citrus hops with notes of banana and cloves. It tasted mildly bitter-sweet to start and developed into a light, sweet yeasty flavor with notes of citrus, banana and some spices with the flavor lasting for quite a while, thus enhancing the experience. Mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a soft carbonation.. Overall an outstanding Hefe-weizen.

Off white large full lasting head. Cloudy deep golden colour. Aroma is moderately malty with fruity (apple, pear, citrus), orange peel and hoppy notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (baked apples), excessively carbonated, ending in a moderately fruity and slightly spicy finish. Light to medium bodied.
UPDATED: APR 2, 2011 RR Bottle: Nice light golden hazy color with a medium white head. Smells of banana, yeast. Taste of lemon, banana, with a good bitterness to finish it off.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: Pours a cloudy golden color with a huge, frothy 4-5 finger white head. Excellent head retention. Nice lacing.

Smell: Banana, clove and yeast with a hint of lemon. What a hefeweizen should smell like.

Taste: Typical wheat up front followed by banana and clove in the middle and ending with a mix of spices, phenols and a hint of lemon. Aftertaste is dry and earthy with a very slight hoppy bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a high amount of carbonation. A little prickly, in a good way.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. This is the perfect summer beer.

Overall: Excellent beer overall. I dont think wheat beers get any better than this. I guess thats what you can expect from the worlds oldest brewery.

Bottle at Freakin Frog. The barkeep executed a perfect pour from the bottle. Its dark golden with a fluffy white head and a fresh wheat aroma. There is a tasty slightly sour wheat flavor with a carbonated yeast sensation and a dry slightly bitter finish. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2010 Pours a light golden color with a full thick pillowy white head.  Looks terrific in the glass.  Excellent aroma with smells of spices like clove and coriander, but it is also light and fruity giving aromas of bananas, apples, yeast, and fresh hay.  Just a very nice complex aroma.  The taste is light and spicey.  Nice fruity flavors, tastey spices, and fresh bread are all very prevalent on the palate.  The finish is about medium and a touch dry.  Very nice hefeweizen.
