Bottle. Cloudy yellow colour. Big carbonation. Smells of lemon and wheat fields.  Crisp, well ballanced beer. Mellow.  Slight, short lived, mellow hoppy finish. Very pleasant; very drinkable. I meant it doesnt blow you away but perfectly pleasant.

Featured at my Oktoberfest party this pours a dirty colored orange.  Nice frothy white head that lasts.  smells of great citrus.  taste of orange peel and banana.  some hops a light bitters.  very crisp and refreshing.

Light, flavorful, refreshing and smooth.  This Heffe has become my everyday beer.  Great balance of hops that starts off crisp and finishes fruity.  Their slogan is "The worlds oldest brewery" and many wise men have said "if it aint broke, dont fix it".

Pours murky golden with a small white head and good lacing. Nose is strong and a mix of wheat bread, banana, and hops. Frontside of the flavor is well hopped with a little skunk; backside turns much sweeter and features banana notes along with a starchy malt. Finish is quick and a little sticky. Not my favorite style but pretty good stuff.
On keg. Amazing beer!!! Lovely creamy head, slightly hazy. Citrus notes - orange peels - and cloves. Very complex and good structure.

Shared bottle at Cardinal 18.8.2010. (Tried again as tap 29.9.2010 at the same place. added two points on the overall)
White head on cloudy light golden body.
Banana, clove and wood on the nose.
Sweet, alcoholic, spicy, light bitter flavors. 
Light to medium body, gentle carbonation.

Pours a hazy orange color. Some sediment on pour but great fluffy head. Aroma is fantastic, wonderful clove and citrus smell. Also hints of banana on the nose. Taste is crisp, with banana and cloves. Aftertaste of caramel and maybe some hay. Fantastic beer, one of the top wheat bears to be had!
Tap. Aroma of yeast, wheatmalt, citrus and fruit. Golden amber colour with soft white head. Yast, apples and wheat in flavour. A bit ciderlike. Very tasty.
Taste super clean. One of the best hefeweizens ive had. No gummyness or starchy flavor, just good, clean, refreshing, beer flavor

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 12.4.2010.
Golden colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of wheat, banana and citrus. Flavour of the same elements with caramel malts and grass. Medium bodied with a oily mouthfeel. Lingering fruity finish. Tasty Hefeweizen.
very nice lemon / yeast aroma.  Cloudy gold with white head.  Carbonation feels strong, medium body.  Pleasant Hefe, but not the best.

Smells light and airy, sweet and just a hint of floral tones. Exaclty hefeweiss. Looks great too, nice head and lacing, hazy golden with a lot of red hues. Very soft flavour, the yeast comes on after the bubbles and then slowly the sweetness and the esters come out, it seems almost thick and will take a while to get used to the flavours. Youd almost choke on the bubbles if you werent expecting them, its quite foamy. This is quite nice, not as sharp of flavour as other hefes and much more yeasty and foamy.
Bottle. Pours hazy dark yellow with a large white head. Taste is medium sweet with bit of acidity. Palate has a medium body, thick mouthfeel. Aroma has citrus, banana, bread and spices.

Nice luscious pour.  Totally foamy goodness bursting with banana and cloved spice aromas.  Light cinnamon and touches of green apple sparkle are noted on the palate as well as a quenching light watery berry finish.  Easy to quaff and nice for a hot day.  Very exemplary of the style.

Good beer, very interesting history of the brewery. Overall I was some what disappointed. I was not a big fan of the after taste. it almost taste like plastic or something similar. The aroma was strong and light all at the same time. Definitely have to try this at least once.
500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy light amber with a large head.  Aroma is nutty, yeast, some lemon and clove.  Lemon to start.  Yeast and nuts follow.  Lemon on the finish and aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2011 Pours a beautiful, almost hazy yellow. Bursting with carbonation in the glass. Beautiful creamy head that stays awhile. Smell of bananas and even bubblegum. Very smooth going down with no heavy lingering tastes. Great begginner craft beer. Lots of clove on the flavor, maybe a bit too much for my tastes. My first wheat beer and I like it quite a lot.

Bottle. Poured int my Edinger World Cup glass and started with a glass of foam. Long, long lasting head on cloudy dark orange-amber. Strong spicy yeast aroma. Smells earthy and peppery and of straw. Flavour like an orange-banana Orange Julius with some herbal bitterness in the finish.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2015 Surely world class.  Very pure tasting. Excellent Hefe-weissbier. Serving: bottle

Getting a bottle of  this was sort of a funny story. Im in my local Total Wine and I run into a friend who was buying a 12 pack of assorted beers and hes ahead of me in the checkout line. Right after he buys his beer he turns to me and asked if Ive tried this one. I said no, so he gave me a bottle to try. It was a great decision on his part.  This one is pretty damn good. The foamy, creamy head is the sexiest part about this beer. It just lingers around for what seems like forever. The aroma is sweet and citrusy, as is the taste. Its a good fine beer to say the least.

Bottle pour gives hazy yellow color with medium white head.  Aroma of spice,bread,   Taste coriander, banana, clove, citrus, floral.  Clean finish.  Palate carbonated.  Minimal alcohol.

Nice beer.
my first favorite style beer was hefeweizens.  this is the reason why.  i love the freshness, the fruitiness, the cleanliness..lemons, fresh banana, cloves, slight honey, happy little beer.
This is my favorite Hefeweissbeirs that I can purchase outside of Germany.  It has excellent flavor and it tastes just like what you would get from a restaurant in Germany.

Served in a weizen glass

A: Haze golden color with a white frothy head that last a bit leaving some of the foam attach to the glass, some visible carbonation.

S: Bread, banana, very fruity, sweet and a little bit bitter at the same time.

T: banana, lasting bitter flavor, gassy feel in mouth, anisette, for a 5.4 ABV you can taste a little bit of the alcohol, watery.

Overall its a very refreshing and inviting beer that you can knock a couple in no time, its one of the best weissbier that I have tried.

An exceptional hefeweizen. The beer looks great. Its glowing, dusky, cloudy gold with a fine, soapy, craggy head. Lacing is in abundance. The smell is clean wheat spice, lots of fruity esters and sweet malt. The flavor is like drinking a bit of summer.  Theres a ton of wheat spice and everything comes through crisply and cleanly but never bitingly. It is refreshing and cooling but also lush and full. The feel is velvety with lots of gentle suds.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow. Aroma of yeast and citrus. Taste is more citrus and some spices. Weissbier is not my thing.
(bottle) cloudy yellow - light brown with small white head; aroma of cloves, balanced flavour - solid

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2014 another of the top heffes out there, just a touch behind Schneider in smoothness and flavor as the best out there.  aroma of banana and cloves.  the flavor the same with noticeable wheat as well.  well done, and at a nice price.

1 pint bottle.  Pours a cloudy light orange.  Thick bubbly white head with great lacing that lasted the whole beer.  A hint of banana as it slides into my belly.  Very nice.  Will definitely have again.

500mL Bottle from the LCBO. 5.4%. Slightly cloudy yellow sunset pour with a bubbly white head, medium retention. Aroma is yeast, citrus, coriander, and a floral lilac undertone. Initial mouthfeel is crisp, low-medium carbonation. Taste is near-perfect balance of a yeast texture with wheat and a particular spiciness that lingers on the palate into a delectable finish. Fantastic hefe.

Bottle. There is some extra spiciness in the taste, otherwise it has all the characteristics of a top class hefeweizen. However, its way more expensive than, say, Franziskaner (which is even better) around here.

On tap. Golden cloudy looks, Massive head. Hoppy floral and grass aroma, banana there also. Medium sweetness, some spices around the flavor. Very refreshing, great taste. soft carbonation on the palate. Nice after taste. Puts all American hefes to same! Had a great day with drinking beers with liveFreeorRye

A: pours an opaque orangish-yellow, with a massive white head. Outstanding retention level with ridiculous lacing.

S: sharp notes of citrus, mostly lemon and unripe oranges. Some slight metallic tones, but faint. There are also aromas of coriander and maybe a hint of clove.

T: huge notes of honey and bananas. Some light citrus flavors, light lemon. Mild coriander notes with a huge yeasty flavor.

M: solid mouthfeel. Very refreshing and slightly creamy. Exceptional carbonation, perhaps perfect.
Very good weiss bier looks great, nice citrus/banana taste, would definately try this again

Looks great, hazy orange with a thick head. Aroma of corriander, banana, and oranges, vanilla, with strong yeast notes as well. Carbonation is perfact. Flavour is great. All the aromas are represented in the palate plus a strong and spicy clove bite. Perfectly balanced. This is a fantastic hefe weiss.

Bottle: Pours a Cloudy golden hue, with a huge white head and great retention. Smells like the hefeweizen probably should; Light citrus, yeast, clove, and flavors are the same with a touch of spices. Light sweetness, bitterness, carbonation - can someone please send me another case of Weihenstephan? Danke!

Bottle - my favorite Hefe... nice golden color, slightly hazy. Scents of banana, citrus, yeast. It has the perfect combination of carbonation and related mouthfeel. Refreshing, yet has character and levels of flavor. Not too sweet and makes for a great summer brew.

Bottle served in a stem glass. Pours cloudy bright light orange-yellow with large fluffy white head. Good retention and minimal lacing. Aromatic sweet wheat and light citrus on the nose. A hint of dough and some funk that exudes belgian blond. Nice. Mildly sweet flavor. Light body, fizzy carbonation, sticky texture, and a dry, crisp finish.
Sublime.  What a beer.  Brilliant mix of aromas - spices, grains, fruits, yeasts - perfect dryness, beautiful mouthfeel with perfect carbonation.
Pale hazy golgen and moderate pure white head. Great aromatics of yeast, spices, and some banana. Very flavorful and easy drinking. Good spice flavor and cloves. My first one, very nice.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2011 On tap. Golden cloudy looks, two fingers of white foam head. Hopy floral and grass aroma, some dough and banana there also. Medium sweetness, some spices around the flavor. Very refreshing, great taste. Medium body, soft carbonation on the palate. Nice after taste.

On tap into a frosted pint glass with an orange wedge squeezed into the beer and set aside. Aroma was spicy cloves with a hint of citrus. Appearance was a hazy orangy gold. Taste was heavy on cloves but had a subtle banana flavor. With the orange added there was a nice citrus layer added to the palate on top of the original clove and bananas.
Great pretty Hefe, nice misty gold colour & fluffy white head. Fragrant banana, wheat, and a little clove of course. Pleased with this one.
Bottle pours a deep dark gold with huge white head. Scent of  wheat and fruit. Taste is light sweet fruit and wheat. Very crisp and great on a hot day.

One of my all time favorites. Had this up in Northern Italy in Cles, more than likeley youd say ambiance made me love this beer, but had many here in the states and still one of my favorites. Full of banana/ clove flavors, love the cloudy chunky pour. I could drink these all day here in NorCal or all day at Flamingo Pizza in Cles/ Italy.
Yellow, really thick head.  Aroma of banana and clove - very strong, very nice.  Taste of banana with a bit of spice.  Extremely refreshing and nice wheat beer.

Perhaps this is even better from tap, but hey bottle version is not bad at all. The beer is light, easy to drink and has a hint of lemon flavor, which could also be interpreted as flower taste. I could found also some yeast flavor as well and it suited well on over all taste. What a delightful tongue tickling beer.
Dressels Pub, STL. May 2010.  Good beer with a bit of a fruity taste.  Recommended.
Light golden in color. Very hazy.  Tastes like banana cream pie. Very refreshing. One of my favorite beers.

Pale, hazy golden color with a large white head. Aroma is spice, cloves, and yeast. Flavor is mostly yeast with a hint of spice. Cloves present in the finish. Excellent beer for grilling out in the summer. Pretty much top of the class for hefeweizens.

Enjoyed from a 12oz bottle in a Guinness glass.  The beer pours a straw-colored to medium golden color, with a large and fairly dense white head.  The nose gives assertive notes of banana, along with a much more muted note of residual malt sweetness.  The other classic flavor/scent of the style, clove, makes its appearance on the palate, showing throughout, along with a more restrained banana.  The finish is estery, without being unappetising, and leaves the drinker quickly reaching for another sip.  Overall, it is easy to see why this is seen as the archetype of the style.  Pleasant in the extreme.

Clove, tart, banana, spicy aroma.... alot going on. Light orange hazy color. Full white head. Taste is clove, citrus, vanilla, barnyard, some light banana in there. Could be confused with a Saison IMO. Medium palate yet crisp, bubbles are present and refreshing. Overall a very nice German Hefe. Not my favorite style... but one of the best I have tasted.

Poured hazy golden yellow color with a massive white foam that firmly coats the beer. Clove, banana, vanilla, honey, some hints of apple and white grapes in the aroma. Sweet taste, medium dense at best. Well matching carbonation, overall easy on the palate. Very enjoyable, great for a warm summer day.

Bottle 50cl. A cloudy yellow-golden beer with huge white head and good lacing. Smell is on wheat and banana. Aroma is in wizen beer with banana notes, wheat astringency and yeast. But this one is very creamy with a small caramel-chocolate finish. Nice beer.

Pours a hazy light orange body with a nice, foamy white head that sticks around for a while, proper hefe-style. Smell is pretty intense, with banana and clove all over the place along with some caramel-ish hints in the background. Delicious. The palate is very refreshing, without ever becoming too light. Wow. This IS a good weizen: theres banana, clove, bread and hints of toffee, with the slight balancing bitterness of citric peels. Hints of almonds in the aftertaste. Very well balanced, soo drinkable despite its complexity. Truly a delicious weissbier by any definition and a flagship of the style. Get it if you can.
This is _the_ hefe weissbier to me. Cloudy yellow-orange look and big head - Check. Dough, banana, cloves, citrus - Check. Refreshing light acidity - Check. Goes well with a lot of food - Check.

On tap at beerbistro.  Pours a cloudy slightly brownish orange with good sized white head.  Nice aroma of yeast, banana and clove.  Flavour is quite fruity with bubblegum, banana and yeast, clove seems less pronounced than in the aroma although still quite apparent.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Finish is fairly dry.  Quite well crafted.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2011 Hands down the best wheat beer and one of the best beers on the planet. Has a whole other dimension of richness in flavor that isnt present in most others.

Ködös narancsszínben mutatja magát kitöltés után ez a búza, melynek fehér habkoronája hozza az elvárhatót, és miután összeesik, tejszínhab módjára megmarad a főzet tetején.
Kellő levegőztetés után bontakozik ki fűszeres, banános/citrusos illata.
A pezsgő szénsavasságnak hála, csípősen, frissítően indul, íze egy igen jófajta banános, gyümölcsös, teste nekem picit vizes, de belefér, főleg ilyenkor nyáron.
Aromája élesztős, gabonás és szegfűszeges, befejezése fűszeres és száraz, melyek határozott együttese kellő kedvet adnak a következő korty(ok)ra, így a nedű igen könnyen itatja magát.
Ez egy igen kellemes, jófajta és frissítő búzasör volt.

50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy weak orange, with a big creamy white head. Aroma is yeasts, citrus, fruits and some nice malts.Taste is citrus and a good touch of banana and spices, fresh and smooth mouthfeel.Very refreshing beer, the best hefeweissen i have tried.

Bottle. Ooh, this is a good beer. Its got a nice, thick, and delicious head, a fantastic looking, slightly murky reddish golden color, and an amazing hint of cloves in its taste. Will definitely seek this one out in the future.

Bottle. Semi-cloudy yellow/gold pour with a big white head. Nose of bananas, sweet malt and clove. Sweet banana flavor with clove and a sweet malty finish. I can respect it for what it is, but really not my thing.

Hazy golden beer with large fluffy white head. 
Aroma spicy a little banana with wheat and malt.
Flavor very smooth and refreshing. The banana and clove are subdued with bready malt coming through. 
Dry finish.
Medium body.
Draft. Pours hazy orange with a big white head. Flavor is banana, coriander, clove. This beer is just fantastic, I drank a liter of it and went back for another!

Pours out lightly orange, a bit unclear. Looks like a mix with witbier. Nice big white head, holsd ok. Good wheat-spiced smell. A bit weird, but not bad. A bit watery taste, wheat, not to much different tastes. A bit cookie-bready and spiced. Ok-beer...

(500 ml bottle frrom Bootleggers) Pours semi-cloudy light golden, much cloudier at end of the bottle. Very tall off-white head in my weizen. Aroma of citrus, banana, wheat malt and yeast. Mouthfeel nice and wheaty smooth although perhaps a touch light-bodied. Flavor of peppery citrus and banana, with notes of wheat malt and yeast. Light phenols initially. Tasty and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange/yellow color with a big frothy white head. Aroma is of banana, yeast, spice like clove and wheat. Flavor is filled with banana and clove, with doughy yeast and some frutiness. I also get some citrus, pepper and some cinnamon in the after taste. The body is medium and velvety smooth with alot of carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel. Overall a really good Hefeweizen!

500ml bottle.  Hazy golden in color with a thick, white head.  A less sweeter hefe but very refreshing and crisp.  It left me wanting a little more in flavor, but I found it very enjoyable to drink on a warm day.

12oz bottle, marked 0100, I believe bottled on April 10, 2010.  Pours hazy orange with a large white head.  Leaves a ring and some spots of lacing and holds a light foamy head.  Aroma is strong on fruit, banana particularly, some light citrus, clove, yeast.  Flavor is fruity, starts somewhat sweet, a lot of banana, orange, some clove, finishes dry and a little chalky.  Medium carbonation.  Never been a fan of wheat beers and this does nothing to sway that opinion.  I can see the attraction though, and how this would be a good example of the style.
500 ml bottle a hazy orange yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts yeast fruits banana taste citrus banana spices malts and hop

Bottle via Spirits Red Bank. Poured much darker then I was expecting an orange/amber body with a large full creamy white head. Aroma was nice with strong notes of cloves, banana, wheat, grass. The body was far thinner then I was expecting with strong carbonation. The flavor was rather astringent with notes of wet old wheat and some over ripe banana peels. Ah I have to say I was expecting a little more from this one.

Best before 04/03/2009 and poured in my Erdinger Weizen glass (originally rated December 2008). Says "The worlds oldest brewery" on the front label. This hefe has a cloudy, golden-beige-orange colour with a big white creamy head, long retention, and patches of lacing. Smooth oat aroma with some nice spices, German wheat yeast and banana. Well-balanced mouthfeel, between refreshing, but not watery, having a little stickiness, but again, not too much. Tastes like a hefe, but a little different from others Ive had before. Starts off a little on the bitter side, and then, kind of falls flat, with the mild yeast in the finish. Not your typical bubblegum sweet flavour. Well brewed (does not look like a mass-produced beer) but not to crazy, making this one a good session beer. Just wish it had a little bit more taste in the finish and aftertaste.

I just had the Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier. I have to say it was better than Weihenstephaner. Thats not to say this isnt good. Its very good. It is lighter in all aspects except alcohol. Very very smooth and delicate. A bit lighter than I like. Ill tell what....... this beer doesnt make you want to slow down and enjoy it.

Poured a hazy orange with a huge foamy white head.  Aroma of oranges, bananas, yeast, and wheat.  Some coriander as well.  Taste of citrus and wheat upfront transitioning to banana and coriander.  Smooth and creamy finish.  Palate is exceptional, and it goes down smooth.  One of the best of the style.

Tasted 6/20/10.  500ml bottle.  Hazy with a golden straw hue.  Huge three fingers of thick white head.  Heady aromas of citrus and graham crackers with nuances of floral yeast and cloves.  Medium bodied with a thick body.  Yeasty with big citrus notes.  Lightly toasted malts and golden wheat flavors.  Slightly peppery behind the banana and clove note.  Lingering finish.  This is an execptional example of this style.  It really sets the bar.  These guys really know how to do it!

Came in a 3-pack from Kenny Road Market, complete with World Cup Edition glassware, all for less than a 10-spot. Good beer and new glassware always make me happy. Poured into the glass it came with. Nice golden color with a foamy white head that stuck (be sure you drink it at the right temperature). Aromas were, of course, of wheat, banana, and clove. The flavor carries these same qualities, but with a little citrus and more spice. Lively palate and goes down easy. Very enjoyable.

Beautiful color, would have given it a perfect score for appearance it the perfectly white head would not have disappeared so quickly.  Basic hefeweizen aroma, spicy but not too overpowering.  Upon first taste, it is very clove heavy, needs the slice of lemon to cut it, my tongue is getting tingly about half into it.  The taste is very refreshing, perfect for the 85 degree afternoon we are having.  Overall, very satisfying so far but I do believe I am going to need a couple more to make sure it measures up ;)

Happy drinking!
Light aroma, very light flavor, buddy said a hint of cloves, but I dont buy it. Very good.

Sneaking a sip turned into sneaking multiple gulps - what an awesomely drinkable tasty beer! This cannot be chalked up to a right beer right time senario. Cloudy weak metamusil colour with a thick off white cap with no retention issues. Smell and taste are both complex and subtle. Very very floral. Fresh lemonyness with a very mild yet obvious banana aroma that has cocoa qualities to it. Cloves. This is a very interesting spice. Soft yeasty notes join in - everything is blended so well smellwise. My mouth is greeted to a succulent treat indeed. Quick flash of banana lasted a micro second only to pop up again mid to mid-late. Medium spices and cloves, bit of lemony funk as an undertone. Wow - doing a forceful mouth swish between the teeth brings forward even more flavour including a solid spice power, light orange that fades in and out, hints of hops keep showing up, lightly acidic. Great mouth feel - smooth, has a great carbonation to it, soft, goes mild through to the finish with soft spices, yeast and light fruit. An excellent beer - now I feel like drinking heavily. Thanks again beer, you bastard.
UPDATED: OCT 11, 2010 Hands down,the best heffeweiss beer Ive ever tasted.Wonderfull taste,perfectly strong,quite sweet, and with such a smooth aroma.Yet weiss beers are not my type...

Partly cloudy gold with slightly off-white head. Aroma is of bread and malt. Taste is a little citrus with a whole lot of that wheat beer flavor. mild carbonation is enough to give it texture and a light finish. I think I have found a very refreshing summer drinker.

Bottle. Ive been to the brewery but the first time I rate this beer is in Malaysia! Dark gold and hazy with stable head. Spritzy, floral aroma is less estery than many and not clouded by too much yeast intensity. I like that. Has a suitably fruity bouquet that has light banana esters and some white plum. Quaffable palate with medium carbonation. Excellent acidity level balances the lingering sugars. There is not a lot of grain character. Is balanced, between the citrus and the banana. I like it.

Cloudy dark golden pour creamy white head .... aroma of banana and clove (yeast) ... taste was very clovey and spicy with banana and lemon zest that follows ..... a light spice finish that doesnt linger .... a really good quality hefe

Aroma: Different than I was expecting. I have just finished the Krystal and I remember it having a very robust nose full of yeast and herbs. this beer is more subtle. Im getting a faint citrus with very mild herbal notes.Theres more of a bready malt character to this beer too. 
Appearance: Fantastic! I really do love to see a big frothy head on top of a glass of hefe! This beer is murky with yeast and the color of a golden retriever; blond in parts amber in others. 
Taste/Palate: Very pleasant but again surprisingly subtle. After having the Krystal Im blown away by the relaxed nature of this beer. I was figuring an even more robust ale with bursting flavors and Im getting a subtle yet complex, well balanced, relaxed smooth drinking hefe. There are spice characteristics like nutmeg and clove, and a sharp hop character right down the center of my palate. The acidity is great and it compliments the carbonation and body to make a truly refreshing delight. I really am just blown away with how dry this beer is in comparison to its companion the Krystal.
Overall: I was surprised by this beer. I found this beer to be full of finesse and subtlety. A great learning experience and wonderful drinking.
Hazy amber, thick creamy white head, foamy lacing.  Traditional notes of banana, wheat, and spice.  Taste reflects aroma.  Creamy mouthfeel.
Yet another beer I drank months ago and cant remember the taste of. But I do remember that it was very good. Ill be back soon for a full review.

Bevuta alla spina alla Lepre e in bottiglia al 2 di Picche, entrambi a Genova. E una tipica weizen lievitosa dal colore giallo oro opaco, schiuma bianca persistente, aroma di banana e chiodi di garofano. Una delle migliori nel suo stile.

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy gold, with a large, fairly quickly dissipating head. Banana and cinnamon notes dominate the aroma, with a yeasty hint in the background. There is a moderately bitter flavour, strong for a weissbier, but  it does not last. The main flavour notes are banana, cinnamon and sweet spice. A good weizen, but fairly simple in style.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2012 Draught @ Haus der 100 bier Berlin & Stockbridge Tap, bottle from a friend. Spicy grain & banana aroma. Cloudy yellow brown colour, big head. Banana & clove flavour. Smooth with sweet aftertaste.  Decent wheat beer.

500 ml bottle; straw gold and mostly clear with eggy white head fading quickly; lemons, grassy hops, wheat and starch; creamy mouthfeel with creamed wheat, lemons and fresh grains; mildly sweet in the finish and a really nice brew; easy drinking and smooth fresh wheat; cant imagine this beer fresh at the source

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a deep, cloudy, golden colour with a magnificent, fluffy, offwhite head and great lacing. Aroma is stunning, lots of yeast and wheat as well as some citrus. Taste is acid of course, a little underwhelming but still great. Smooth, creamy body. Not much flavour or bitterness but very drinkable. Probably the best weissbier there is.

Bottle. (rating number 600)

One of my favorite wheat beers, great aroma and taste of banana, yeast, orange and wheat. Also some pepper in the taste. Fresh with a nice balance. Very drinkable.

Gorgeous hefeweizen. Pours into wiezen glass golden yellow with apricot hues and a massive foamy cap. Aroma is sourdough, ripe bananas, spicy hops, hints of lemon zest and fresh grain. Flavor is smooth banana bread, peppery spice finishing with that wonderful German yeast and cloves. Body is fairly light with strong effervescence. This is a very fine hefeweizen.

From 12 oz bottle. Aroma bready malt, banana, and some slight stank. Appears barely hazy straw with a small, white head. Tastes of banana; slightly sour and slightly metallic. Medium-light body, barely sticky.

A- Pours a nice cloudy amber orange with a large white head of 3 fingers which settles down a bit. Lacing stays throughout. 

S- Smells really nice, exactly what you would expect of this style. Wheat, yeast, and the banana and light spiciness. I also detected a smoky burnt wood aroma. Aromas combine together very well in a balanced mix. 

T- Tastes similar to how it smells, but definitely not as bold in flavor as I would have expected. Very nice balance again overall. 

D- Goes down easy with a light body, yet with plenty of flavor. Carbonation is light.

Overall, I would definitely drink another of these.

500ml bottle in a Weizen glass.  Pours opaque golden with a big, fluffy white head.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, and some notes of banana and spices.  Flavor very yeasty, with banana being a big part of the aftertaste.  Very light, but its good for this style of beer.  Its the oldest brewery in the world, so Im pretty sure they wouldnt still be around if they werent doing something right.  A great hefeweizen.

Finally decided to try this in the form of a 500mL bottle.

Pours a nice straw yellow with some orange hints to it. Large white head-at least 2 fingers-and then settles down a bit. Lacing stays throughout glass as it goes down.

Smells really nice, textbook for what you would expect of this style. Wheat, yeast, and the banana and light spiciness (cardamom almost?) all combine together very well in a balanced mix.

Tastes similar to how it smells, but definitely not as bold in flavor as I would have expected. Very nice balance again overall.

Goes down easy with a light body, yet with plenty of flavor. Little carbonation and bubbles which is nice too.

Overall, I would definitely drink another of these if I had it, but I only had one. I was expecting something a bit bolder for some reason, but this came across quite nice and Im glad that I gave this classic a try.

Hazy golden pour with a big, pillowy, 3-finger white head.  Sweet fragrant aroma with loads of yeasty banana and clove.  Some subtle citrus, pepper and straw add a nice contrast.  The flavor is lightly sweet with mellow citrus notes and grains wrapped around fresh banana and clove and a finishing with peppery yeast.  Creamy, smooth, medium full body with lots of carbonation and a crisp finish.
Pours darkish hazy yellow with a high head. Aroma is mostly wheat with a hint of banana. Flavor is quite full, with wheat, yeast and again subtly some banana. Very nice hefeweizen.

I had this tall draft in the proper glass at Smiths Billiards in downtown Springfield.  This was the best hefe that I have had.  Maybe I have had too many crappy American attempts at the style.  The pour looked amazing on an 80 degree spring day.  The flavors were banana, hay, and fresh bread.  This draft was great, I cant wait to try the bottled version.  It is also neat that the brewery started in 1040 AD.

Part of a Mix a Six pack.  Bottle.  poured a merky yellow orange with a thick white head that diminishes quickly.  Aroma is refreshing banana, orange, and clove.  Taste is the same that is easy on the palate.  Very nice Hefe
Amazingly mild yet still has a wonderful hefe yeast flavor.  Very clean aftertaste. An amazing recipe that lets the yeast flavors dominate and be delicious.

Pours golden yellow with champagne like bubbles streaming up to a snow white, foamy head that collapses quickly. The aroma is predictable with banana, clove, bubblegum and yeast. The flavor is the same, and a little watery. A good hefe, but Ill take Ayinger or Hacker Pschorr over this one.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber, with a large fluffy off-white head.  A picture perfect wheat beer.  Aromas of clove, yeast, lemon, dough, and something buttery.  Taste has heavier yeast notes than most wheat beers.  Citrus, banana, light spice, and dough.  Goddammit I love wheat beer!

draft @ redlight redlight.  This is one of those beers thats slipped through the cracks, Ive had many times but never rated it I guess?  Floral citrus on the nose with banana and some clove with hints of cinnamon.  Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a solid white head.  Citrusy with some nutmeg and cinnamon with banana notes.  Also bready wheat notes run throughout.  Great Hefeweizen, world class.
Pours a lovely cloudy golden color in the glass. Nose is flowers and spice. Taste is wheat, some citrus. Rated 3/3/2000

Draft at redlight redlight.  pours bright cloudy gold with a big white head and good lace.  very floral aroma.  definite hints of tropical fruit.  quite an excellent nose.  the flavor is very mild, a little sweet but still dry. not as enticing as the nose but good, crisp and refreshing.  a very good summer beer.

12oz/500ml bottles and on tap.  On tap in Fredericksburg, TX is by far my preferred way to quaff this great one.  Pours a hazy, golden body topped with a fluffy, ivory-colored head that recedes eventually.  Aroma is yeasty, spices (clove and some pepper), bananas, bubble gum and some light citrus.  Flavor is equally complex with plenty of yeast, clove and banana in equally intermingling parts.  Light, creamy finish that leaves you wanting another sip.  Absolutely fantastic on warm spring/summer nights.
Orange and unclear. Has a huge, white head, lasting. Spicy aroma, coriander, citrus, lemon, yeasty. Sweet flavor, acidic notes too. Faint bitterness. Fruity. Creamy, sparkling texture.

Bottle. Pours opaque amber, not as orange as Erdinger Urweisse. Thick, white small-bubbled head. Smells and tastes of lemon, not sweet but a full smooth substantial taste, like it was filling. Nice, barely dry finish. Very drinkable. Close to Urweisse, maybe just not quite as good.
bread, grass, amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, salty, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation.

Cloudy amber body with a large off-white frothy head that recedes pretty quickly. Wheat sweetness with a fair share of banana, a bit of clove and maybe a little pear. Earthy yeast character and loads of banana on the tastebuds. The mouthfeel of this beer is absolutely perfect. Super smooth and creamy with a clean finish. This is one that Ill be sure to come back to again and again.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2012 My favorite types of beers are those that dont taste like typical beer. I prefer an authentic, niche, well-crafted style even if its not the easiest beer to drink. Of course, not all beers that fall into that category are automatically masterworks, such as Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier. This is a beer whose reputation precedes it, and for the most part it lives up to the hype.POUR, COLOR AND AROMAWheat beers tend to flow very smoothly out of the bottle, as this one did. However, trying to pour the beer itself is quite a challenge. Whether poured down the side or the center of the glass, this brew forms a huge layer of fluffy, bright white, marshmallow-like head. The head lingers throughout the life of the beer and leaves plenty of lacing on the glass.The complexion is a dark orange/amber hue which is, not surprisingly, extremely hazy with some miniscule sediment noticeable. The aroma is potent with clove and banana and overall very sweet-smelling.TASTEWeihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier has a very sweet palate which isnt quite as spicy as I would have liked. It has a strong taste of banana and clove noticeable from the first sip to the last swig. The liquid itself has a slightly grainy texture, making it drink more like a hearty beer than a gimmicky, novelty beverage. The only caveat is clove might be a bit too strong for me, as I probably wouldve preferred a more intense, juice-like taste, but the overall palate here is definitely clean.FINISHThe great thing about wheat beers like this is how much softer in the mouth they tend to be than typical lagers and ales. There is definitely no hop bite here, so this beer goes down extremely smooth. Combined with the sweet taste, Hefe Weissbier would make a great introductory hefeweizen.BODYIf the cloudy body is off-putting to the lightweight drinker, they should consider how easy the beer is to drink and the fact its a very light beer. At 5.4% ABV, Hefe Weissbier is only a little stronger than your mass-market brew, and is likely equal or even lower in calories and carbs (sorry, I couldnt find those stats). FINAL THOUGHTSA beer like Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is probably the best example of what a truly authentic German wheat beer should be.NOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zD4ZAg20d5I

500 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a Weizen glass. Pours hazy amber with a tall white frothy head. Head fades slowly, leaving some lace. Starts off with a powerful aroma of yeast and clove along with banana, grass and a touch of citrus. Flavour is moderately sweet throughout, with a touch of bitterness towards the end. Finish is moderate in length and fairly malty. On the palate, light-medium in body with a smooth, milky texture. Highly carbonated, but with tiny bubbles that do not detract from the smooth texture. Overall, a fine hefeweizen. I would have liked a little more lace, but the aroma is very inviting. Smooth and drinkable. Not a complex, introspective beer but a reasonable choice for a summer evening on a patio. 2010-04-28

12 oz.  Pours a clear gold clouded by the sedimentation of the beer with a strong head and great lacing.  Aroma is of light malts? with plenty of banana, clove maybe a little citrus fruit as well as other wonderfulness.   Sweetish taste disguised by light bitterness.  Palate is excellent light body with  a thin texture with lively carbonation that propels the clove finish of this excellent German beer.  First time trying a real German hefeweizen and I must say it was quite the perfect style for a warm day.

One of the variety pack.  Pours a typical golden cloudy color with a long lasting white head and good lacing. Malty with a hint of banana esters and wheat. Clean flavor, very nice, some residue at the end of bottle.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a pale hazy golden color with a thick very long lasting white head.  It has a pleasant yeast aroma and also smells of banana, clove and wheat.  It has a wonderful understated taste of banana, clove and wheat with a cereal like aftertaste. This is a wonderful beer. I will definitely try to drink more beer from this brewery in the future.

Bottle courtesy Nate.  Pours clearish golden with a thick, white head, dissipating to 1/8 of an inch.  Slightly skunky fruit nose with mild spiciness, clove and coriander.  Yeasty flavor, slight banana with some clove, a full, but watery mouthfeel with OK carb.  The standard Hefe.  Solid and tasty, even after this bottle sat for a year plus.

Appearance: Hazy, orange-tinted golden color with massive, protein-full, viscous white head with solid quality.

Aroma: Smooth vanilla sweetness spiced with a bit of clove and a faint citrusy tartness.

Flavor: Smooth honey-dipped cereals gently dissolves into a mild bitterness and peaked in a nice citrusy-tart, mildy acidic, smoothly sweet yeasty goodness. What a balance!

Mouthfeel/Palate: Smooth yeasty envorioment, gentle carbonation, fruity, citrusy palate with mild clove spiciness.

Overall: Memorable Hefe indeed!

A- Translucent bright yellow body that even a gentle pour produces a unmeasurable overzealous fluffy white head. Head slowly fades to 1 finger with perfect retention. Cloudiness is thick and barely lets light pass through it. Beautiful unfiltered Hefe Weizen.

S- Good, Light, and typical for a hefe. Great balance of sweet bready yeast, clove, and banana. Hints of citrus also emerge.

T-Very similar to the smell. Perfect balance of sweet bready yeast, clove, and banana. Hints of floral hop and citrus emerge for the finish-but are very faint. Sweet bready yeast and some clove linger long after the sip. Taste is very light.

P- Wonderful light, smooth, and creamy body based on yeast. Light carbonation accompanies this.

O- This is a classic example of a hefe. It has everything that should be found in one and keeps it all in balance without anything extra added. Has the high drinkability and enjoyability that one should have. It was a bit on the expensive side for the bottle. I can see myself having more affordable great German hefes like Hacker-Pschorr and Franziskaner more often but I will treat myself to this one again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-06-2007 17:17:45

Pours hazy yellow with rich white head leaves nice lacing on the glass. Yest, malts, fruits, bananas aroma. Fresh citric and malty flavor with typical weisen character. Round and fruity on the palate with fresh malty and slightly hoppy aftertaste.

Pours a one-finger white head that fades quickly leaving no lace.  Light cloudy amber color.  Light bodied and good carbonation.   Nose is light lemon.  Flavor has some sweetness, lemony/yeasty.  Good summer hefe. $3.25 for a 500ml bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, MA.

12 oz. bottle to weizen glass, and this beer is precisely why I went to the trouble to get a weizen.  Pours cloudy gold with huge white head.  Aromas of bread and cloves.  Taste is a complex--cloves, banana, citrus with a bread yeast.  Not too sweet, balanced right.  Finish is also complex, but very pleasant and says "more please."  This beer even has a lingering aftertaste that is good.  Palate is slightly creamy, but nothing chewy about it.  Good brew!

Pours a heady orange haze. Nose is spice, wheat, banana and clove yeast. Flavor is soft spicy malt with lots of banana. Finish is bready wheat and a smooth banana that moves into bubblegum. Absolutely delicious. There is a  flavor to this beer that defines weihenstephaner beers and when you find it, it is bliss.

A classic Bavarian Hefeweizen. Colour is a little hazy with a MASSIVE head. Poured into Erdinger glass. Consumed at home. Bottle bought from Sainsburrys. 

You have to drink this fresh as posssible. Ideally in Germany. From this beer I am receiving citrus notes; a slight oaky textrure in the gulp, floral hops and a smooth slightly dry finish. Drinkability is high. Easy to procure and a fantastic beer which should be available more than it is. All serious beer drinkers should try this classic from this great old brewery.

Out of bottle..let me start off by saying this was a perfect example of a Hefeweizen. color and aroma are on point. I feel the Aroma is very complex but I feel the taste was the most complex cuz I felt it touchs on multiple taste bud notes....from slighty sweet to a nuty peachy type of flavor that i cant put my taste buds on but its mos def a flavor transition that is appealing. Not taking anything from the beer gods but its sumthing about that flavor! and be warned the head of this beer can be dangerous after a few of these! Head is med/high. ENJOY THIS HEFE BABY!

Bought two bottles of this beer, and Im glad I did, because the first one tasted horribly watery. The second was much better. Pours a hazy orange beer with a huge white head. Because of its refreshing taste, this must be a good summer beer.

banana aroma and slight banana taste, nice fairly pale but rich appearance. taste is sweet wheat and really refreshing. I wouldnt say this is thick but its satisfying in palate. When Im not craving hops I want a beer like this.

50cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with lots of yeast/wheat floating around. Aroma is clove with a slight hint of banana. Taste is wheaty (??) and very nice. Over all, this is an excellent import. Although better at the source I cant complain about this bottle of beer.
Tasted 2010-04-?? (forgotten backlog). Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of freshly baked wheat bread. Flavours include wheat, banana and cloves. Very good wheat beer.

Pours a hazy orange with large white head.  Very lively carbonation with loads of bubbles rising to the surface of the beer.  Bready and citrus aroma with a hint of clove and honey.  Strong clove flavor with slight banana that peeks in momentarily.  Finishes nice and spicy.  This is a very nice beer to enjoy while sitting outside on a warm and sunny spring day.

Pours a light yellow-cider color; head was very thick and fluffy; white in color.  Aroma was very distinct.  A mix of banana, bread, and cloves.  Taste mimicked the aroma.  It  tasted like banana bread with a little bit of malty-ness to it as it went down.  Good amount of body and carbonation.  Definitely my favorite Hefeweizen yet.

Pours a misty honey yellow with thick, whipped-cream-like head.  Fresh pizza dough aroma at first - very yeasty.  Mellows out to spiced orange - mulled wine?  Even some ginger and rosewater.
Light flavour, clean palate, a little watery.  Refreshing, relatively low sweetness for a wheat beer.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 [3/10] Hazy gold with a modest for the style thick white head. Generous, beautifully integrated aroma of wheat, yeast, citrus and cloves. A little banana, but not too much. A little sweetness, a little chewiness and some sourness. Lightened by the carbonation. Brief clean finish. An outstanding example of the style. [3.8][3/14] Hefes seem very vulnerable to bottling issues - whats startling on tap can be pretty crappy in the bottle. But not this one. You can get it everywhere, its reasonably priced, tasty and involving. A ridiculously great mass market beer.

500mL bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a fluffy but diminishing head.  Estery, yeasty aroma.  Slightly bitter, slightly sweet and yeasty flavour.  Light bodied, lively carbonation with a short powdery finish.

Bouteille de 500ml, achetée à la LCBO, bière dorée claire trouble, opaque presque, nez dester de la levure classique des bières dus sud de lAllemagne, épices, clou de girofle, banane, en bouche la bière est onctueuse, longue, agréable, épicée, bon malt, et le blé est présent et bon, du grand savoir faire.

pours a deep golden yellow with a fairly nice white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, some apple, and definitely banana present. Medium body. Banana and spices taste with a nice citrus and fruit ending. Easy to drink. Refreshing. Love it.

Bottle. Pours a yellow-orange colour with a white head. Aroma is some  yeasty, citrus, wheat and some herbs. Flavor is well-balanced and very mild with some sweetness. Lots of wheat, some yeast, citrus and banana and a hint of malts. Very good indeed and a perfect beer to go with lighter foods, salads or fish.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2010 Bottle. Pours an unclear deep golden colour with a nice foamy white head. Aroma is quite subdued with some notes of wheat, yeast, spice and a little bit of grass. Wheat, yeast and slight citrus flavours. A dry and bitter wheat flavour linger in the finish. Medium body with good carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2010 500ml bottle thanks to Julien
Aroma : wheat, coriander with some other spices. Nice wheat profile with some fruit and candy hints. Small hints of liquorice.

Taste : Wheat, coriander and other spices. Nice wheat profile again.

Overall : Quite tasty and refreshing. Nice wheat profile. One of the best Hefeweizen Ive had ! Nice summer drink.


On tap at Brewbaker Berlin.
Appearance : Hazy pale yellow with a small creamy and fluffy head.

Aroma : Some yeast, lots of wheat and grain. Lots of bananas. Some sweet grain. Light spices.

Taste : Lots of wheat with some spices. Fruity and yeasty. Lots of banana. Light sweet notes on the finish that reminds me of maple syrup (good but weird...). Slightly mineral. Great carbonatino. Just fizzy enough.

Overall : Different than the bottled version. Very nice but I think Ive had better ones later during the trip. Pal 3 to 4. Overall 17 to 16.

Bottle.  Pours cloudy, golden amber, with a thick persistent head. Aromas of wheat, lemon zest, yeast with a hint of orange.  Taste is dry with the citrus playing very well off the wheat base, a very mild bitter finish.  Excellent hefe, probably my favourite to date.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Bottle.


A - Cloudy/hazy golden orange. Medium sized, white head with average retention.

S - Malted wheat giving a bread/cracker smell. A little apple and citrus smell, with loads of banana smell. Some spiced, mostly clove and a little pepper, scent too.

T - Really nice flavors in this beer. The base is a creamy malted wheat that gives it a cracker/bread type of flavor. Loads of banana and bubblegum mixed in with that, also some spice (clove, pepper). A little hint of citrus lemon flavor at the end.

M - Incredibly smooth and creamy. Medium body and somewhat crisp. Medium carbonation.

D - Incredibly drinkable. Creamy smooth body allows it to go down easy and the flavors a very tasty but dont overload your palate.

Notes: Amazing beer that has fairly simple flavors that are mixed and balanced wonderfully. Great for a summer day of relaxing.
A very pleasant wheat beer - round with esters without going overboard into banana-land; full mouthfeel and long-lasting head. A classic example of the style.

Bottle pour, cloudy yellow, dark.  Nice, smooth dense head. Smell of wheat, yeast, sweet bread. Fairly dry taste, move around your mouth and it varies even to sweet.  Complex, fruit. Very nice Hefe Wiessen, dont know how I missed this one until now.
Aroma of fruits, wheat and hops. The taste was almost the same but I would also add a yeast and banana character. Good Hefeweizen... what I would expect from the style.
Dark yellow pour with a frothy white head.  Aroma of citrus, especially lemon-lime.  The flavor is a mixture of banana and lemon-lime, and somewhat makes me think of bubble gum.  Unique taste.
Aroma is wheat, freshness and a bit aloe vera maybe? Taste is rich, long lasting and very much cellar dust.

Provdatum: 2005-09-02, flaska, Göteborg
Vete, jäst,  härligt frisk - en perfekt sommar weiss

I have never been a fan of hefeweizens. Lately though, I have been sampling quite a few, esp. German examples, to see if I couldnt learn a little more about them and maybe figure out for sure what it was I didnt like. As it turns out, most hefeweizen just arent very good. They are clumsy, dull representatives of the style. W/ Weihenstephaner, this is not the case at all. This hefeweizen is a big, vibrant and flavorful beer. It is only slightly hazed and pours a lovely golden w/ a big white head. A fresh, almost exaggerated banana presence is the centerpiece of the nose w/ coriander-like citrus notes in the background. Soft sweetness is tempered by vigorous but gentle carbonation. Comes off pleasantly thick w/ a slight, oily slickness. Cloves and some floral hoppy notes make themselves known as you dig deeper. Wonderful beer. this is making me rethink my position on hefeweizen.
Great beer. Smells of wheat and hops. Taste is very smooth and sweet. For a hefe, this is one of the best I have tasted. Would recommend this one to a new hefe drinker.
17 ounce bottle A cloudy gold pour big white head . fruity clove aroma taste of dough, banana, clove. a smooth refreshing finish

Draft at the fly Rod Tap Room - Poured a cloudy straw yellow in color with a pretty big foamy white head.  Some minor lacing on the glass.  Aroma is strong of doughy yeasts with some citrus and plenty of clove/banana.  Flavor was much stronger than I expected... again, lots of bready yeast, some citrus/orange and a nice amount of the clove/banana.  The wheat and the yeast combine to produce a tart finish with the fruitiness lingering.  An excellent weissbier.

On draft at South Park Tavern, Dayton, OH.  Wow.  Never had this style before but it really sat well with me.  Nice spice aroma and taste to it.  Poured a cloudy gold color.  Great spice and citrus aromas.  Tremendous beer.  Can see me buying bottles of this in the summer to kick back and drink on a hot summer day.

Bottle in West Lafaette.  Very classic aroma for type, sweet , hay, and spicy peppery notes, slightly cloudy golden honey color, nice head but collapse quickly, no lacing. Good sweet sharp taste and some salt. Light body just slightly oily
bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  murky gold with a white head.  cloves, spices, lemon, and wheat.  nice on the palate, light spices, yeast and a well balanced spicy finish.

(12oz bottle) Pours murky yellow-orange with nice creamy head and good lacing. Nose of heavy spices, oranges and banana. Taste has well integrated banana, clove, great sweet balance, cinnamon and lemon. Great creamy carbonation with a near perfect palate finish. Not the absolute best hefe Ive had, but very very close.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Cloudy yellow-gold colour with thick white head. Sweet banana and clove aroma with hints of other fruity aromas as well. A kiss of citrus and toast. Lightly smokey phenols with a nice wheaty full mouthfeel. Fresh and very tasty.
Bottle, pours cloudy gold with medium white head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat, and some citrus.  Taste of citrus and wheat and high carbonation.  A refreshing beer that everyone likes, even the girls.
ample frothy head, thin body, non-carbonated with malty overtones.  sweat toasted, critus taste

Big white creamy head, lacing, golden/orange hazy colour. 
Aroma is spicy, yeast, coriander, lemon, citrus, lime, soft malts and a soft ending bitterness.
Flavour has the same notes and is just wonderful! 
Mouthfeel is smooth yet refreshing.
Havent to date had a weissbier that can measure up to this one!
This is a good beer. Has kind of a  cloves and grassy earthy banana taste. It is cloudy and full of flavor. Nothing to remember but definitely good.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Blonde and cloudy with good white head. Citrusy and yeasty wheat nose. This has a spicy flavor, with a bitter citrus tang, a hint of banana, and a good balance of wheat. Simple yet very refreshing.

A: The pour is a hazy pale golden color with a fluffy white head that sits atop. There isnt much lacing, but some nice carbonation.

S: The smell is primarily clove and banana. There are also some nice bread/doughy notes.

T: The taste follows the nose. An excellent spice and fruit characteristic which I love about Bavarian Hefeweizens. There is also a nice yeasty component.

M: The carbonation is quite pleasant and tingles a bit. The body is medium.

D: This is what I think of when I hear Hefeweizen, not the stuff American breweries market as a Hefeweizen. A delicious and easy drinking beer.

Pours a lacing cream color head with a hazy, deep straw colored body.  Aroma is yeast, some banana, little clove, earthy, grassy, and some zest.  Flavor is yeast, banana, grass, lemon, hint of clove.  Nice creamy body.  Bran like flavor long after the swallow.

Pours a cloudy golden with a big white head... big aroma of clove, banana, bubblegum, yeast... Flavor follows suit, big flavors, complex... medium carbonation, medium bodied... touch dry in the finish... easily one of the top hefes...

0,5 l bottle, bought at Sörspecialista.hu
Poured hazy golden-amber with a superb foamy, stable and delicious, lacing white head that diminishes slowly, disappeares never...Alluring one, i am thursty right now! Phenolic, grainy based aroma with banana, fruity citruses, honey and the typical hefe spicies: clove, cinnamon and vanilla in the nose. Smooth mouthfeel with a rich flavor with fine grainy taste, fruity character of citruses and phenolic banana. Hop and spicies in the finish numbling my palate. Spicy and citrussy aftertaste.
Cloudy light yellow colour. Minimal white head. Aroma has hints of banana and wheat. Suprisingly light flavour, definite traces of banana. Very nice.

Közepesen sötét aranysárga színe van.Misztikusan opálos és ködösen gomolyog a mélyén az élesztő.Tetején a típusra jellemző krémes és hatalmas hab van,ami elég hamar eloszlik.Illata fűszeres,malátás és élesztős,szinte harapni lehet.Íze mint az érett banáné,édeskés és egyben fanyar.Nagyon jól érezni benne a szegfűszeg aromáját.Nagyon összetett íze van,van benne minden ami elvárható ettől a típustól de egyik sem domináns,nagyon kiegyensúlyozott.Közepes teste van és igen élénk,pezsgős.Utóíze kissé komlósan száraz és enyhén fanyar.Fantasztikus egy búzasör,egy igazi etalon!
On tap. Cloudy and yellow. Relatively spicy for a German wheat beer. Very well built and almost flawless, if not as flavorful as Denisons.

16.9oz. Very hazy golden/light amber, small head with good retention, minor lacing. Strong banana and wheat aroma. Light banana flavor, light-medium sourness, bit bold overall. Medium body, very slick texture, high carbonation.

Bottle 500ml. Great heffeweizen. Aroma has apple, grain, and earth. Taste is sweet, with a hint of sourness, and a mildly bitter finish. Palate is silky, with a thin-to-medium body. Cloudy yellow in the glass, with a frothy white head.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2010 In bottle; pours a nice golden color. Aroma of citrus and spice. Very good tast; notes of citurs/orange and spice, very creamy tongue feel. A very good weissbier, maybe my favorite

this pours a cloudy golden orange color with a fluffy white head, the aroma is of bread and malt, plus earthy aromas i cant really pick out... the taste is alittle malty, and other flavors that again i cant put my finger on, but overall for a hefe weissen that im not a big fan of, its pretty good

Pours out cloudy and pale orange yellow with a pretty decent head. Light fluffy foam. Tastes of banana chips, lemon grass, a little black pepper but just a hint, bready, and yeasty. Pretty good stuff. Probably the best Hefe Ive ever had. Really a very good, exceptional beer for a style that usually isnt my favorite.

Draft @ De Paas in the Hague.
Hazy dark yellowish brown, medium head.
Hoppy, lemony aroma, creamy and full.
Full flavour of lemon, hops, grass, hints of fruit.
Very nice, kind of an all year round Belgian White (Witbier).

Bottle.  Pours a really cloudy golden color with a big white head, naturally.  Aroma of spice, banana, clove, and dough.  Taste is very good.  More banana and spice with some bubblegum.  Light body with nice texture.  Very refreshing.  Excellent hefeweizen.

pours pale yellow with large white head. aroma is sweet just like juicy fruit bubble gum with just a little spice edge. drinks smooth and sweet with banana, clove, wild flowers, and again just like juicy fruit. fantastic brew.

Pours a yellow straw color with a white head. The aroma is classic hefeweizen, bananas and cloves. The flavor is more of the same with banana being stronger than the clove, but both are present and work well together. Medium carbonation and a thin-medium mouthfeel.

Hazy golden yellow color, large white head; aroma of wheat and yeasty banana, slightly citrus and some spices; medium body, thick enough mouthfeel, highly carbonated; flavor of slightly sour wheat and citrus, banana, spices. Greatly balanced, good all-around hefe, but I´ve had more interesting ones.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2010 Bottle. Dark golden in appearance with fluffy white head. Aroma is banana, lemons and spicy yeast. Taste begins with cloves, bananas and bubblegum followed by grassy wheat and honey.  Finish is crisp and dry with a spicy clove aftertaste. Outstanding example of the German Hefeweizen style.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a huge head. Aroma is yeast bread, citrus, fruit, landfill. Light bodied with hints of banana, vanilla, citrus. Long lasting finish with a sweet spicy note. As far a a hefe goes, it is as good as it gets. It is more like a beer cooler,(as in wine cooler). A girly beer. It has a pretty good kick. Seems to drink more than the 5.4%. If I get the urge for another Hefe, this will be the one. I recommend it.

nearly opaque gold with a thick foamy white head. smells of bread yeast and a bit of lemon. bright, sweet and sour, lemon, gently toasted wheat a fairly "fresh" tasting weisse. bready body, great and distinctive

Bottle @ HomePours a lively amber with a fluffy white head. Aroma and flavour is fruity with a strong banana hint. It has a full, smooth body with a satisfying finish. A wonderfully refreshing beer. Recommended.
Golden with good head. Aroma from light banana and yeast. Taste is fruit and yeast. Body is medium. Texture is thin. Lively carb. Good finish. Overall a good beer

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2010 Hazy orange with a big dense white head. Aroma is yeasty banana, the usual suspects but in a mild wheaty and thick way. Flavor is dense wheaty, slightly fruity with notes of banana, light fresh spices and lemon. Body is rather full with a smooth and refreshing mouthfeel. Great food and summer beer.

Wonderfully refreshing, especially on a hot day. Aroma is sweet with a hint of banana. Taste is light with a blend of banana and clove. Its lightly sweet with yummy, malty goodness. Highly recommend if you want a beer with a lot of flavor . but not a lot of heaviness on a hot day.

One of the best hefeweissbiers. Aroma is malty and yeasty at first , but later u can feel fruits (orange, apple, banana) and some spicies. Taste is the same with fruits and yeast at the same time to be at first. Nice finale sweet, yeasty and fruity with some sourness at the very very end.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2010 Aroma is floral with citrus and something that my nose reacts to as chemical.  Citrus and mild hop dominate the nose while banana constitutes the body.  finishes light, sweet and fruity.  This is the quintessential Hefeweizen and a true classic!

Another good weissbier from the swap.  Poured from bottle to pint glass.  Large head and excellent lacing.  Cloudy body and a medium yellow / orange color.  Average maltiness with hay flavors.  Light hops with citrus notes.  Kind of a soap yeasty finish.  Light to medium body and an oily texture.  Soft carbonation.
Pours a hazy blonde color with a decent white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum and wheat. Flavor starts off sweet and thick and also has a sweet finish. Very well balanced.

(12 ounce bottle - pint glass)  Pours a hazy yellow color with a pillowy white cream head.  There is little aroma due to the thick head but the aroma that is there is of yeast bannanas and cloves.  Taste is a bread and hay malt, it also has tastes of yeast, bannana and cloves.  There is also light notes of lemon.  Has a great fizzy lively carbonation.  It has a short abrubt finish.  Pairs great with sushi.

A: Pours a cloudy murky yellow brown color with a booming head. The head dies down to a manageable level but is continually fed by stream after stream of bubbles.

S: Tons of aromas in this one. Banana, Clove, Lemon, and Bubble Gum. The aroma lets you know this is a wheat beer and a good one at that.

T: Big bold flavors for a wheat brew. It has all that you would expect in there just more of it. Lemon, over ripe banana, and clove dominate. The yeastiness is there giving it an almost sour dough bread type quality.

M: Light and sparkling like a good wheat beer should be.
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2010 Such a refreshing German hefe. Bannana, clove, and yeasty flavors are followed by a malty finish. Its not too spicy or citrusy which makes for a lighter flavor. One of the best

12fl oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Cloudy orange with a ton of creamy white head.  Aroma is yeast, banana, citrus.  Flavor is citrus, bread, clove, slight banana, very yum.  Light-bodied, light to medium carbonation, very smooth.  Short finish is very mellow yeast, ever so slight hops.  Extremely drinkable.  Excellent brew - a fine example of a hefeweizen.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2011 hzy-straw, lasting-foamy-wh-hd.

aroma: ^wheat banana clovey-spice.

taste: ^wheat banana clovey-spice §tart clean, vinyl T3, no bubblegum.

the vinyl, the lack of rich clove and bubblegum ester complexity, and the dry rather than creamy texture, leave me somewhat unsatisfied.

------ 

Aroma is bursting with green banana and toffee, with some minerality and notes of oak and pear in the background.
Appearance is slightly hazy light gold.
Taste is tart grainy wheat, yeast-bite, sweet pale malt, minerality, oak, and a hint of green banana.
Body is creamy and full.
Theres a lot of sweetness in the middle, but it finishes fairly dry with a minerally tartness.

500ml bottle poured into a weizen glass. Poured a cloudy golden color with orange highlights. The thick 1.5" head quickly reduced to a thin white cap. Not much lacing either. Aroma of bananas, yeast, bubblegum, spices and a faint fruity sourness. I just love this aroma. Taste is similar to the aroma but not as strong. Sweet malts up front followed by some citrus and spice finished with a light hop bitterness. Smooth & creamy with tangy carbonation. Very drinkable. Another one of my favorite Hefeweizens.

16 oz. bottle- Pours a beautiful cloudy golden with a perfect head and lacing, the aroma is citrus and wheat. The flavor is full bodied, not watered down at all and is probably the best hefe ive had, including Spaten Franziskaner, it has a very nice wheaty flavor, no fruit needed. The most thirst quenching beer Ive had in a long time.
Bottle from the Fort Worth Gingerman.  Orange, kinda hazy pour.  Lemon, wheat, and a little banana aroma.  Taste is malt, citrus, banana, and spice.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2011 Pours a hazy deep golden with a nice thick bright white head.  Aroma is clove, substantial lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and creamy texture.  In particular it has excellent estery malt (mostly clove, some banana, and a hint of bubblegum) that lingers.  On draft this is slightly better than in bottle.  This not only my favorite hefeweizen this is my favorite most refreshing and flavorful summer time beer. Prost!

This is a very good Hefeweizen.  I recently did an 8 beer taste test and this one came in 2nd.  see video here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzgDNw-QJL0
 It tied for 1st in our judges scoring.  Fantastic beer!  I love it!

Ill come right out and say I love this beer. Lots of yeast, bananas, clove and sweet hay in the nose with some vanilla. I could just smell this beer and be happy. The palate is creamy and smooth. Much of the smell is translated directly into the taste. This is definitely one Hefe youll want to roll in order to get all the yeast into your glass. Super long finish that is pleasant till the very end.

Bottle pours cloudy gold with a large, soft, white head which leaves nice lacing. Aroma smells of banana bread with additional notes of lemon and bubblegum.  Flavor is bananas, wheat dough and lemon curd.  Overall the body is light to moderate, with a creamy texture and a short finish.  Definately a classic Hefe.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2009 Pours hazy golden with generous creamy foam. Aroma is bready with a heavy banana sweetness. Flavor is also strong in banana and fruity sweetness with a doughy yeast flavor balanced with just enough carbonation.

Banana-yellow color with thick, frothy white head, reminiscent of roasted marshmellows; cloudy and effervescent. Medium Aromas of topical fruit-banana and papaya-as well as yeast and wheat. Palate is creamy, malty and very sweet with long, arid, "wheaty" finish.
500ml bottle.Cloudy golden, white head. Medium body, high carbonation. Finishes long. Very refreshing and drinkable.

Quintessential German Hefeweizen. Had some on tap at Rattle n Hum. Poured a cloudy orange with a light, white head. Nose of yeast, coriander and citrus. Nice bready flavor with notes of orange, corn-on-the-cob, and yeast. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation, this beer has just enough crispness to remain smooth and refreshing. Great stuff.

500ml bottle from the LCBO
Pours a hazy golden yellow with a big white frothy head
The aroma is yeasty malty banana
The taste is smoothe refreshing yeast banana 
Nice Wheat Beer

" His family owns the oldest brewery in Barvaria" " It was the greatest beer in all the world" one of these quotes from Beerfest is true and its the oldest brewery. I will say though of the German wheat beers out there this one is my favorite. Great for the style and a bit more disernable on all flavors than others. Thumbs up from me.

Cloudy golden-yellow, large lingering white head, good lacing.
Aroma is very yeasty, lots of bananas, oranges, wheat, perfume.
Flavour is of perfume, floral hops, tons of yeast, lots of bananas.
Yeasty mouthfeel, medium body, high carbonation.
Finishes long, yeasty, dry. 
Incredable amounts if yeast and must in this one. Very refreshing, highly drinkable. 
500ml bottle purchased from the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario.
Opened on February 26, 2009.
Best before March 4, 2009.

Poured into a weizenglass. Has a cloudy orange color with a white head that initially fills basically the whole glass. After A while the head dissipates a little and has an appealing rocky structure. Some lacings.

Lots of malted wheat and barley with notes of spices and banana in the nose. Hints of lemon and light phenols.

A rather soft but prominent malt presence of barley and wheat dominates the flavor. Lots of white bread and crackers. Well balanced flavors of banana and spices (cloves) take over in the middle. Notes of yeast with an earthy twang. The finish is gentle and a bit short with lots of mild spicy notes, some phenols and a light fruitiness. A minimal taste of alcohol in the finish as well. No real bitterness.

Medium body, not very crisp due to the gentle carbonation.

This is a hard beer for me to review since I generally have a problem with hefeweizens - I dont really like the style. Im often underwhelmed by their flavors, short finish and mouthfeel. That being said, I think this one is quite good and I can see why its conceived of as a real classic. It has a well balanced character, and both spices and fruit esters are pleasant and kept at bay (in some hezeweizens they are too prominent in my opinion). Easy to drink and refreshing, but its not very interesting or exciting.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

A: Poured with a nice large, white frothy head that hung around for quite awhile and left excellent lacing behind. Body was cloudy, almost murky, and a dark orange color.

S: Great aroma of lemon, orange, light yeast, wheat, and pepper. Lots going on here.

T: Nice flavor of wheat, citrus, and spices... the pepper in particular is quite prevalent (say that three times fast). Short duration, which is normal for a hefeweizen.

M: Medium-bodied and quite creamy, with average carbonation.

D: Hell yeah its drinkable. You could put these back all night and never get sick of them. An excellent hefeweizen, and a damned good session beer.

To me this beer defines a Hefeweizen.  All other brews of this style should be compared to this one, and in my honest opinion Ive yet to have one live up to Weihenstephaner.  There are many out there that come close, but this beer is the only true liquid of the gods!

Pours hazy straw color with billowy white head. Aromas of clove, bananas and wheat. Similar flavors with some yeast, citrus and a touch of sweetness. Light to medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and average carbonation.
Hazy golden with a lingering white head. Nice banana clove aromas with tart pale wheat. medium body.  Nice estery clove, sweet banana flavors with grainy wheat bread.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle. Cludy straw colour with huge slightly off white head. Slightly sweet aromas with plenty of cloves and citrus. Lots of yeast also. Flavours are much the same with plenty of meatiness. Great example of the style.

bottle - I was sligthly disappointed by the aroma as I expected a sharper nose on this brew, it was quite faint. Otherwise, a great blend of banana and citrus flavor with cinnamon biscuit undertones. Balanced taste. Great Weizen!
Bottle. Aroma of banana and cloves. Hazy golden pour with a good fluffy white head. Tastes of banana, citrus fruit and spice. Very well balanced German wheat beer, refreshing too.
Pours with a cloudy yellow body topped by a thick head with some lacing left on the glass.  Its slightly sweet with notes of clove, light banana and lemon.  Light bodied, crisp and smooth.

De couleur dorée-orangée et très trouble, elle dégage des arômes de bananes et des notes dhoublon. En bouche, elle est plutôt tranchante, épicée et pétillante et en finale, les notes plus douces de bananes font surface. Le houblon apparait quelque peu en arrière goût. Bonne bière.
Poured slightly hazy golden yellow, citrus, grainy malt, citrus peel, little spice, little bananna.

Cloudy golden color with a thick white creamy head. Smell is wonderfully strong of clove, banana, and citrus. A ton of body to this one. Taste is the same as the smell but theres a thickness about it that says this is a great beer. Also get notes of bread and a mild butter taste. I think this is one of the better weizens out there.
The way a wheat beer should taste, lots of yeast and a fruity taste, banana and citrus comes to mind. A favourite.
Bottle. Great classical hefeweizen. Cloudy yellow with huge white head. Aroma bananas, cloves, coriander,tropical fruits. Taste nice, sweet malty, wheat.
Very good german weissbier. And you can feel history running down the throut drinking it :)
A bit bubbly. Bigger bubble on the white head. Aroma has wheat, citrus and banana. Light and easy to drink. Not too complex and slightly thinner than the Franz. Pretty good overall.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2015 Appearance: hazy yellow orange
Aroma: Spicy, coriander, 
Flavor: Caramel, slightly peppery, coriander
Palate: Velvety smooth, creamy full mouth feel, accomplished without sweetness or heaviness. Outstanding.
Comment: On draft. Beautiful balance. Very well-made. Better than most of the Japanese ones that Ive had.

Bottle from Oasis 11/21/15.
B: Wheat, green banana, coriander like spice.
Flavor:  Wheat, light caramel sweetness, partially ripe banana, grain, and a roasted caramel finish.  Score 3.8.

Draught in Osaka.
Thick, cloudy gold color with a fine, thick, head. Grainy cereal aroma with restrained banana and clove. Slightly cardboardy, with banana, clove, creamy wheat malt. Too far from the source to match the real thing, but still good.

Bottled. Murky cider like color with a big white fluffy eggwhite head that thins to medium. Aroma is floral, fruity specifically bananas, and overly citrusy. Smells clean. Flavor is sweet and crisp and wheaty. Dry long finish that lingers. Subtle notes of alcohol for a wheat beer. a complex wheat brew.

Hazy golden pour with just a touch of orangy gold.  Thin but firm head.  Very warming citrus and spicy scent.  Wow.  Not that is a Wheat Beer!  This is by far the best wheat I have ever had and thats saying a lot as its one of my favorite styles.  This is amazing.  One of the best beers I have had in a long time.
A bottle 0.5L from Alko shop. Spicy and bananey nose. Pale large head. Hazy pale golden slightly orange colour. Soft bananey and wheaty taste. Slightly sour. Some bitterness at end.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 1pt, .9oz bottle into a weizen glass. There is no freshness date but there is a bottle number of 6069 printed on the back.

Appearance: The body is cloudy and has an old gold or dark golden color with a tall white head on top. The head is thick and foamy, long lasting and makes spotty lacing on the glass.

Smell: The nose is sweet and full of fruity yeast with notes of banana, bubble gum and wheat malt.

Taste/Mouth: There are bready and yeast flavors up front with banana notes and a touch of clove coming through. The finish has pleasant tangy wheat and very mild hop bitterness which give it some dryness. The palate has a refreshing, easy drinking medium body with nice active carbonation and a lively crisp texture.

Notes: This is a world class beer from the oldest brewery in the world.

Bottle 500mltotal beauty when it comes to heffeweizen. Nice foggy- yellow colour that really gives you the impression that this one is made of honey. And the taste is no different cause is like you feel the honey in it. It also has the classic bitterness at the end but its taste really gives this one a place among the best weissbiers.

Opaque warm peach pour, dense, abundant clouds of ivory bubbles. Sun-warmed dessert apples in the nose, vanilla, clove, just a faint little lactic noteicing on the cake. Spritzy, tinglely-tangly wheat, restrained honey sweetness. Teaming with microscopic points of fruit and spice, such complexity that no sip registers quite the same: now orange blossoms, now cloves, now lemon, now coriander seed. Hops restrained but when sought for, definitely show: a firm resiny presence lending some nice shape. Soft and full on the palate. Delicious and completely endearing.

Cloudy nectar pour with one finger tight white head that lingers fleetingly. Aroma is loaded with banana and clove, as well as a distinct and pleasant yeast biscuit dough. Lemon and coriander are a bit more subtle, but make their way in there as well. Flavor is quite bready with a magnanimous yeast profile and a citrus profile that nicely complements the yeast dry wheat malt. Less sweet than many of its style, this one pulls it off deliciously. Palate is smooth, not overly carbonated, and bone dry in the finish. Great for the style- a standout for sure.

Pours a murky dark peach color with a nice but quick to dissipate white head. Aroma holds lots of doughy yeast, citrus, banana, spice, lemon, and wheat malt. Flavor is heavy with bread, yeast, dough, and wheat, along with clove. The finish is really nice, with an impressive bitterness to it; this isnt nearly as sweet as some more mediocre hefeweizens. Palate is very refreshing, but not too light; great beer for the style.
bottle. Poured cloudy straw coloured with a large white dense head. Strong yeasty citrus aroma. High carbonation.  Taste is sour, yeasty with a light peppery bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2011 Have had this from the bottle and on tap. This is one of my favorite German hefes and a great example of the style.

Hazy orange pour with a huge, fluffy, white head. Sweet banana and cream aroma with soft wheat and yeast. Sweet banana flavor with cream, caramel, yeast, and more. Havent had this in awhile. Damn, this is good!
Bottle. Apperance; Light yello, cloudy, with a big white head. Aroma; Wheat and a small amount of citrus. Wheat and light bitter ending.

(Bottle) Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. The aroma is fantastic and typical for the style with spicy clove-like phenols and light banana and mango esters. Some pear and peach as well. The doughy yeast and wheat makes the nose round and soft. Undertones of vanilla ice cream and mild white pepper. A tiny touch a lemon and flowers are also notable. The flavour is light sweet and light bitter with a nice wheat backbone. Starts with fruity esters and light toasted malt and ends with clove and light band-aid phenols. Undertones of vanilla, lemon, bubblegum and flowers. The mouthfeel is round and soft with a lively carbonation. Very clean and easy to drink yet quite fat. There are some hoppy notes in the aftertaste. Medium bodied. Ester and phenols are the new malt and hops.
