UPDATED: JAN 12, 2010 A hazy orange pour with an incredible head. A straightforward weizen aroma - heavily doughy, bready and a fresh lemon/orange-like acidity. The flavour is of bready and honeyish malts with a sticky yeastiness, bananas and a slight acidity again. Medium to light mouthfeel and pretty strong carbonation, Id say proper to the style though. This was one of the first beers I bought to enhance my beer-knowledge and I still like it, probably my favourite hefeweizen - please note, I dont like them overall.

A cloudy golden beer with a nice 3 finger foamy head. This beer looks really good as you pour it. Aroma of banana, some spice. Taste was some banana & had a nice mouthfeel. This beer does not look lazy & it dances in the glass with the carbonation. This is the most refreshing beer I have ever had & is such a thirst quencher especially if you have been outside in the heat.

My friend warned me by saying: "Watch out, this stuff just goes down." Thats exactly what this is. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head that fades but never dissapears completely. Smells of wheat wheat wheat with a few subtle notes of spice/corriander. Starts out thin in the mouth but leaves a rich aftertaste and is incredibly refreshing.

Wow, such a joy for the mouth.  Cloudy yellow in appearance.  Yeast and citrus to your nose.  The taste, OH the taste.  Lots of layers, theres yeast, then comes the citrus.  The bitterness then nips your palate and leaves your tongue tingling  while it mulls it all over and yearns for another sip.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2009 500ml bottle. Huge head with big bubbles. Really strong wheaty and spicy aromas, lots of yeast. Slightly cloudy golden colour. Great flavour! Gloriously refreshing. Layers of flavours make way for a very flat tasting finish, which isnt perfectly in line with my tastes, but the layers of flavour are wonderful. Complex but not intimidating, very good.

On tap at Trykbar. 
Cloudy golden colour with a big long lasting head. 
It has a wheaty and spicy aroma with banana and citrus notes. 
The flavour is nicely balanced with notes of wheat, banana, citrus and spices. 
Very nice hefeweizen.
Straw color and taste; light lemony/chalky taste with mild malt/wheat after taste
white: delicious, wheaty, smooth and sweet.  I could drink a dozen of these and want more.  Basically the epitome of the Bavarian wheat beer style.

650 mL bottle. Beautiful hazy gold with a nice foamy head. Hoppy citrus, banana, and a sharp fruitiness in the aroma. Taste of sweet banana and wheat with a slight tanginess. Perhaps a bit thin at the start. Very smooth finish, with a touch of hops and a pleasant return of the original flavours. Glory!
On draft. Hazy yellow pour with good bright white head.  Nose of banana and clove.  Flavor is much the same. A fantastic hefe.  One of the best germans for sure

It smells like a wheat field and is a pure wheat straw color, just slightly cloudy. It has a pure delicious wheat beer flavor in the tradition of the German purity laws. There is a smooth, lingering, pleasant aftertaste as well.

500 mL Bottle. Murky straw body with a thin white foamy head. Aroma of plum sauce and bananas with faint notes of cloves, pears, melon, and wildflowers. Full flavor of malt / wheat with notes of tangerine peel, cloves, bananas, and an innuendo of pineapple with a finish that is like cantaloupe. Hey Hefe lovers, check this one out. Actually, I enjoyed it with my chicken dinner.
BOTTLE: gold pour, somewhat hazy. Wheat, orange/citrus, and banana on the nose and taste, some spice in the taste as well. Great beer.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in Plano, TX. Pours a very nice looking cloudy yellow/orange with thick creamy white head. Aroma is terrific, wheaty malt, banana, a little orange. Flavor is malty, banana, fruit, very balanced. Mouth feel is medium body, soft, medium-high carbonation. Overall, a very tasty hef...

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2009 Bottle. Light hazy yellow, massive white head, good amount of lacing. Aroma is sweet, fruity, estery, banana, cloves, citrus, coriander and yeast. Flavour is full and mouthfeel is thick and smooth.Crisp, dry finish. The best hefeweissen Ive had. Lovely.
Oldest brewery seems like a bold claim but I believe such a statement after trying do depict the magnificence of this brew.

Bottle from the LCBO. While a great weissbier, it lags behind Denisons, which I hold as the ideal to achieve. Good amount of lacing with a golden pour. Touch of sugar hidden beneath the primary flavours of banana, cloves and coriander. Clean finish, and a very enjoyable beer. Weissbiers are one of the few lighter beers I enjoy drinking, and this is definitely one of the top I have had the chance to drink.

One of the best wheats ive tasted. great balance of clove and banana, nice fresh citrus flavour with a crisp tartish finish, Tasted alongside Schofferhofer, Erdinger, and Paulaner, was the best by far.
From a bottle poured a hazy golden color with a fair amount head.  Nice malt citrus flavor with a quick finish.
Color is golden.  Aroma is full of malts, yeast, and spices.  Taste is full of malts and yeast.  Has a nice and smooth finish.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co. Short pour to a Czech-Pils glass. The color was a hazy gold with a white, foamy head and spotty lacing. The nose was soft wheat, banana, and spice... notably clove. The flavor added to these a hint of light fruit sweetness and a very appealing dryness to the finish, which sets it apart and above many other hefes for me.
Cloudy deep yellow color with a big thick white head. The aroma is big on spice, banana and wheat. Taste is solid, smooth, and rich. Finish is dry. Excellent.

Source:500 mL bottle from Midtown. 
Glass:Aventinus glass. 
Appearance:Cloudy gold pour with a two finger white head.  
Aroma:Banana and cloves. 
Flavor:Banana was feint, with fruity esters and a yeasty finish. 
Palate:Medium body with solid carbonation.
Overall:Excellent hefe.  Must have more.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden yellow, a large, rocky white head sits atop. Banana, citrus, spices and wheat aromas. Sweet, fruity, yeasty flavours with a citrus tang and an ample herbal hoppy finish. Medium carbonation, light in body. Lovely, crisp and refreshing with nice balance.
bottle. good beer that was very pleasing - golden hefeweisen great flavor and spices.  nice beer

Bottle pours out a cloudy gold topped with a tall white head. Aroma wow what I nice Hef aroma lots of spice, clove, banana, belg yeast and a nice malt. Tast much as the aroma lots of banana very nice. A perfect example of a German Hef.
Cloudy dark yellow pour with lacy white head. Great crisp beer with a sweet finish on the palate.

Poured cloudy golden, with about half a centimetre of foamy white head, that dissipated to a ring around the glass. Lovely aroma of mostly smooth vanilla, with some wheat and a tinge of clove, not overbearing or sickly like some lesser hefes are. Flavour is mostly vanilla and a good helping of banana, with a wonderful smooth mouth feel. A very smooth swallow, with a sweet aftertaste that turns dry. I thought Schofferhofer was great, but I think this tops it. Not a big hefeweizen drinker, but if I feel like one this will be the number one choicefor me. Superb.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow with a nice controlled white head.  Aroma is yeast wheat, and lemon.  Heavy wheat bittterness followed by a nice underpinning of malt, citrus fruits, sourdough yeast and a touch of spice.  Nice light mouthfeel, perfect for a warm summer day.  Outstanding hefeweizen, try it.
Tap @ Isaac Newtons, always is. great summer beer, will have next time i go to that bar. Is a nice change from double ipas, RIS, and belgian quads and tripels. Great beer.

12 oz bottle courtesy of Tim.  Pours a cloudy golden orange honey with a medium frosty white head.  Aroma of cloves, bananas, bubble gum and wheat.  Taste of cloves, bananas, wheat  yeast and light bubble gum.

Bottle-hazy gold/straw coloring with the typical large white head.  The brew had plenty of carbonation.  Aroma was of overripe bananas with clove and wheat.  The taste was kind of the same.  I have to say that most Hefeweizen taste the same to me.  I like them, I just cant tell too much difference.  Produce Place 2.79

Pours out a cloudy orange/gold with a thick white head.  Has an amazing banana scent, which carries through to the taste.  Beautiful fruity sweetness complimented by the banana hints, goes down very smooth as well.  This is the best beer Ive ever had, its easy to see why this brewery has been around for nearly 1000 years.

Poured from Bottle into Weizen glass.

Pours a cloudy yellow with some hints of orange and a fizzy but dense white head that quickly dissolves into a good layer atop the glass. The aroma is banana, clove, fruity esters and yeast, slightly bubble-gummy. The taste is sweet upfront and accompanied by some earthy notes and ends a touch tart with a nice semi-dry finish. Its light bodied with very nice effervescence. Very tasty stuff, I know now why people bring this beer up when talking about a "classic" German Hefe. We done, tasty and thirst quenching.

Bottled from AH in Mestreech. Color is hazy orange with lively carbonation and enormous white head which leaves thick layered lacing. Looks very nice. Nose is citrus, and sweet banana. Aroma is the same with yeast. The sweet sour composition remains. Very well balanced between sweetness and sour. Very nice!

Clear pale straw color with a think creamy head. Heady yeasty smell with the spice of cloves and a lots of esters on the back of the pallet, bannana, bubblegum. Taste is a light sweetness followed with a dry bitter. Soft feel with the tingle of champagne carbonation.
500ml bottle. Cloudy and fruity (banana). Some spicy hoppiness. But not my favouritte hefeweizen.
500ml bottle from the LCBO.  Not my favorite style, but this one is very nice.  Doesnt clobber you over the head with clove and banana.  Very balanced.

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors. Smoothest Hefeweizen I have ever tried but the flavor left me wanting more. Banana aroma traditional to Hefeweizens wasnt very strong and the same could be said for the flavor. Just not what I was expecting from it. On the positive side it pours a beautiful white head and goes down very smoothly. Still a great Hefeweizen but just not my favorite.
Tap @ Loreley. Quintessential hefewizen with light fluffy white head and lemony sweet spice nose. Very enjoyable on a mild day.

Bottle @ the now out of business La Bodega. Light cloudy yellow, with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat and clove. Flavor is clove, light banana, wheat, a little hop but barely there. A great weizen.

Bottled.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of banana and cloves. Flavor is wheat, yeast and spices.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2009 On tap at Rattle N Hum (Midtown, NYC): the aroma gives off a strong banana and spicy clove feel, but the balance is perfect. Tastes similar to the aroma. Smooth finish, banana notes from beginning to end. Some cinnamon... But overall a chewy feel- definitely not like a crisp pils. Totally opposite and thats what I love about it. #055 on 08072009, DG.

Clasic hefe appearance, big fluffy head that takes forever to dissipate. Smells classic wheat and light underlying fruit. taste is heavy wheat and just a hint of the classic banana flavor in the background. Light spicy finish with a touch of hop character. Overall - just a great, balanced  Hefe.
50 cl bottle. Cloudy orange body with medium size white head. Flavour and aroma is yeast, wheat and banana.

16oz bottle. Awesome yeasty banana aroma with hints of spicy clove. Poured the traditional way (half glass, swirl then pour the rest) it yields a cloudy gold brew with a thin fizzy white head. Carbonation drives forward big yeasty wheat notes with dashes of caramel, clove and cinnamon and tons of banana and bubblegum, slight grass hops on the backend. Complex and layered. I dont think there are even many german hefes that are better than this.

Bottle.  Poured a dirty gold with a big creamy head.  Aroma of wheat, clove and banana.  Aroma was nice, bot would have liked more.  Flavor was again not as good as expected, but perhaps I had too high of expectations.  That being said, it was quite good for the style and nice on a warm day for sure.  Wheat, some banana (not enough) with a dash of clove/spice.

12 ounce bottle - $1.79 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours out a hazy, dark-hued, golden body with a tall, airy, whitish head.

Smell: Vibrant, aromatic scent of wheat malt, ruthlessly mashed bananas liberally seasoned with vanilla sugar and clove, and even lemon peel.

Taste: Sweet, tangy taste of wholesome wheat malt. What follows is rich, full flavors of ripe bananas, vanilla cream, and fresh cracked cloves. Small, meager spritz of lemon juice. A few added shreds of Big League Chew. One slice from a Red Delicious apple. Very light Noble hop character and bitterness. Just the perfect amount of overall spiciness to the taste. Finishes dry, crisp, with one final taste of malted wheat.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Moderate carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel, yet it remains nicely effervescent.

Drinkability: Terrifically drinkable, really! I cleared through my twelve ounces with record speed as this makes for delightful early-summer refreshment.
Bottle: A beer among my favorites. The flavor is nice and the appearance is just beautiful.
Cloudy orange, fluffy white head that falls quickly.  Flavor is spicy wheat.  Very drinkable and refreshing, a classic hefe.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2009 Poured into snifter, shared with 502flavors.  Initially a 2 finger white fluffy head that quickly diminished leaving a small ring with a light yellow/water color.  Aroma is straight overripe bananas and heady cloves, flavor to match.  Carbonation makes for a dry finish in the beginning but towards the end it was a mild not dry finish.

bottle. Pours a slightly hazy light orange with a frothy barely off-white head that fades to a ring and a thin foamy film. LIttle to no lace.  Banana and clove and wheat dominate the aroma - spicy. Flavor is the same with a tiny hop presence to balance it out.  Yeasty finish.  Medium to light body with effervescent carbonation, a bit too much for my taste but on cue with the style. Overall: not my style, but very refreshing.  A great summer session beer.

Bottle. Hazy amber with a big whitish head. Oarange/banana/malt aroma with some yeast and spice. Wheat/malt flavor with good frutiiness (orange/slight darker fruit) and yeast. Medium-light body. Easy drinking and refreshing. Orange and wheat/malt lingers with some yeastiness.
bottle. Cloudy yellow, mid-sized white head. Fruity-malty nose. Medium-bodied, malty with a nice wheat character and a rather shy fruityness. Yeasty background. Good.
Bottle, AH. Cloudy golden colour, small off-white head. Aroma of wheat, cloves, banana. Taste of wheat, citrus, banana. Creamy. Smooth finish. Easy drinkable.

On tap at Stone.  Cloudy amber in the glass with a resilient white head.  Sweet citrus and honey nose.  Banana.  Nice thickness in the mouth.  Complex and subtle flavors.  Not my favorite style, but this one I enjoyed.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2009 500 ml. bottle. Pours a huge fluffy white head of good duration, with some lacing, over a cloudy yellowish (SRM 5-7) body.....nose of apple, pineapple, lemon, bit of bubblegum/banana, and the usual clove......taste initially is tart apple and pineapple, ending with clove, dry thoughout.....mouth feel is light, carbonation high. Hits the style exactly.
really tasty light beer. slightly sweet, slightly creamy, really refreshing.

foamy and murky with a nice muddy palate thats not too thin. Lot of flavor: banana, citrus. 

Got this in a 500cl bottle

Bottle.  Pours a huge, pillowy, pitted, meringuey, white head.  Patchy, sticky lacing.  Hazy, golden body with light yeast clouds.  Aroma is dominated by clove with a vanilla accompaniment and some light banana and bubble gum esthers.  A little dough presence from the yeast with some underlying wheat malt and grain.  Creamy, medium bodied palate with prickly carbonation.  Very smooth with a lightly bitter finish.  Some faint tartness, too, as well as a touch of citrus.  Overall a fantastic Hefeweizen, which for me is close (but not quite) to ideal for the style.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2009 Bottle from Tesco.  Murky orange/gold colour with lasting foamy white head.  Aroma is mostly citrus and yeast with a touch of spice.  Cloves and  bubblegum/banana are the immediate flavours with an underlying lemon/orange taste and a strange, but very pleasant, touch of overripe apple.  Long, dry finish and very light on the tongue.  Excellent.
Best Weizen I ever had. Smooth and great banana flavor. Top of its class and a great beer over all.

Bottle, Tesco, Carlisle. Exceptionally cloudy, with a foaming white head, accompanied by a fresh, fruity aroma. Peaches and cream the prominent flavour, with subtle citrus and a big dose of herbs. Nice tangy bitterness on the tongue and, as with the majority of German Hefes, really refreshing.

Aroma perfeito, cor adequada ao estilo, suficiente levedo para se sentir no último gole, mas não tanto que sobre para fazer pão, na quantidade exata, paladar com um "citrus" no fundo  , dando o toque certo de uma perfeita Heffeweiben.
Colore giallo opaco con una spessa schiuma spumosa.Aroma di pane e lievito con sentori speziati e di banana.Sapore molto fruttato,di banana e leggermente speziato.Ottima weizen.E dissentante anche.

Bottle. Slightly hazy yellow with a thick foamy head. Good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is mostly bready and yeasty with cloves, spices and banana esters. Flavor is more fruity than expected with bread, banana esters and some spices.  Medium body. A good heffeweizen.

Brown bottle, 500 ml, best before 11.08.09, purchased at a BC Liquor Stores on April 29 2009, savoured on June 8 2009; eye: golden with a straw hue, hazy, voluminous white head that turns into a creamy sheet, slight lacing; nose: wheat, fruity, banana, yeast, lightl spices, bread; mouth: a bit thin, refreshing, wheat, fruity, banana, yeast, clove, bread, finale in wheat with a good presence of banana, rather carbonated, slightly bitter, mildly sweet, light body, light acidity; overall: nice surprise

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, meilleure avant 11.08.09, au BC Liquor Stores le 29 avril 2009, savourée le 7 juin 2009; il : dorée avec une teinte paille, voilée, mousse blanche abondante qui se transforme en une couverture crémeuse, très légère dentelle; nez : froment, fruitée, banane, levure, léger épices, pain; bouche : un peu mince, rafraîchissante, froment, fruitée, banane, levure, clou de girofle, pain, finale en froment avec une bonne présence de banane, plutôt carbonatée, très légèrement amère, moyennement sucrée, corps léger, légère acidité; en résumé : belle surprise

Wow was this thing amazing. So incredibly crisp and bright, like citrus in hoppy beers without the hop acidity. Lots of banana and cloves everywhere, some corriander and lots of yeast, but not bready. Great and clean and crisp and vibrant. Not a hefe fan but this one was great.

500 mL bottle.  Pour is hazed golden tending toward amber with a large white head.  Strong clove aroma with banana and bubble gum.  Flavors of wheat, cloves, mild bubble gum, spices, and a slight touch of apple.  These flavors are balanced perfectly to create a unique and very tasty profile overall.  Great hefe.
Bottle, poured out in a new, unsused glass. Maybe thats why theres not too much head. Cloudy look. Fresh aroma, a sparkling taste, good beer

Bottle into a weizen glass. Pours a cloudy yellow with a very impressive head. Took me a few min to pour all of it into the glass. Mellow bready aroma with very slight notes of clove and spice. Taste is very mild and bready. A nice hefe.

Tasted at Emmetts Tavern in West Dundee at their quarterly beer tasting.  Pours a hazy golden color with a very thick white head.  Aroma is light clove, slight ester profile is present, lots of yeast and wheat.  Flavor is very well balance with the esters being light in the background with a slightly heavier clove but not overdone.  There is a slight sweet wheat profile throughout the drink and the yeast really add a great flavor as well as help to carry the density of the brew.  Overall a great hefe and one that I can image being even greater fresh or from the tap.

Draft at a party.  Poured a hazy light orange with a thick white head.  Aroma is sweet wheat with notes of banana, citrus, and yeast.  On the palate, it is cabonated and refreshing.  The flavor brings out a bit of clove and a few other spices.  I am normally not a huge fan of a Hefeveizen, but this was exceptional.  Thanks Gregg.
Pours a hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma is bananna cloves esthers ans malt as well as yeasts. Flavor is clove bananna esthers wheat , malt spices. Well balanced hefe.
Yeasty, slightly fruity, light hazy yellow color.  Flavor is crisp, light overall.  Refreshing.  Doesnt seem very complex, but good overall.

Pours from the bottle with a huge white rocky head and a hazey yellow-amber colour. Well balanced wheat bear flavours cloves and banana/bubble gum. A lively carbonation gices the beer a nice crisp mouthfeel. Nice.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2009 on tap at fiddlers hearth. pleasantly surprised with this one.   pours a hazy orange.  lemon, citrusy fruits.  spices, wheat, and yeast.  Smooth, easy drinking, and refresing.  



rerate:  This is beer is awesome.  A baseline for what a german hefeweizen should be. Tons of flavor and aroma for a relatively low abv beer too.  Really nice!

On tap at Binnys South Loop. Pour golden with a big, fluffy white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is of fruits, citrus, spice, grass. and malt. Aroma smells very refreshing and inviting. Taste starts off with lots of assorted fruit flavors up front. Delicious spiciness with lots of citrus in the body. Each sip finishes with a load of wheat and yeast. Lingering citrus taste. Very light body that drinks very easy. Well-balanced, and very refreshing. I liked it.

Aroma is spicy banana city.  Creamy carbonation. Unfiltered apricot color. A bubbly very smooth beer with a hoppy slightly bitter finish, and that seltzer-y mouth tingle. very refreshing, fruity and light.

Probably the best Hefeweizen I have tried. Found this gem at Leos in South Point, OH and I only had to wait for one of those summer scorchers to crack it open. The special yeast is the most noticeable part of this brew, with a heavy banana and clove presence that goes down like water and doesnt coat the mouth. Almost like a Kolsch with a beautiful yeast strain.  Two thumbs up.

16.9 oz bottle.  Poured a nice bright orange color with a gigantic, lasting head.  Delicious flavor, a bit spicy with a wonderful fruit aftertaste.  Great light beer; I could easily drink a couple in one sitting.

A hazy orange gold weizen with a beautiful thick and frothy head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, cinnamon and light lemony notes. In mouth, a nice refreshing weizen with nice sweetness, fruity esters,  more berries than bananas. Medium bodied. Bottle from LCBO. BB 04-03-2009.

Bottle. Pours a very nice looking hazy golden color with a giant frothy white head. Aroma of clove, banana, and a hint of citrus. Flavor is nice: spicy banana. The flavor does end rather abruptly though with a slight citrusy bitterness. Very nice beer. Refreshing and easy to drink.

Bottle  Pours a hazy straw color with a generous white head.  The head lasts well.  Has a good aroma of wheat and sweet fruits.   Has good carbonation.  The flavor is not as sweet as I thought it would be, it is muted nicely by light bitterness and nice hints of spices.  This is well balanced.  Has a dry texture.  I would give it a light body.  Has a good finish with a nice aftertaste.  This is a easy drinking good beer.
Color arancio sbiadito, una weiss con un aroma molto elaborato. sul palato dolcezza sopra la "norma"

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2011 Bottle pour into shaker (all they had).  Hazy orange with moderate head.  Citrus and wheat notes on the nose.  A very good, well-balanced beer.  Mild bitter finish and a very good hefeweizen - Cheers!

Re-rated Thanksgiving Day.  Hard to top this Hefe.  I say this is my very favorite of this style, and the rating goes up accordingly.  It is the best of all the other Hefes I have had, all rolled into one.  Perfection of this style IMO  Update:  simply cannot rate it higher than Schneider, so adjusting it a bit.

Pours a cloudy orange with a glorious, soapy white head that lasts for ever. Aroma is yeasty, clove,  banana, and a faint hint of spice. Flavor is same with slightly more spice. Moutfeel is light and crisp, and finishes clean. This is the best hefe Ive had. Slightly better than the Hacker imo. A new favorite.

Hazy orange with a huge head. Aroma of pineapple, banana, wheat and bubble gum. The flavours are a bit more salty than the typical weiss and the fruit esters are bit more in the background. Nice, though.

Bottle 50cl. Pours an unclear golden ale with a big firm, offwhite head. The aroma is wheat, fruits and citrus. The flavor is wheat, malts and slight notes of bubblegum. The palate leaves some sweetness. Overall this is a good wheatbeer.
You cant really improve on the commercial description. A tasty and refreshing beer with fruity undertones that goes well with a nice wurst.
Hazy yellow-orange pour with a nice white head. Aroma of sweet malts and citrus. Flavor is smooth of malts and a great orange flavor. Light to medium body with a really smooth texture.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 Rich hazy orange/straw pour with the expected towering head.
Aroma is mostly wheaty bread, then pleasant banana and spicy cloves with a final hint of citrus.
Wheat also dominates the flavours, with some of the banana showing through too.
Great mouthfeel, perhaps a bit too watery, but spot on carbonation.
Bloody refreshing stuff.
Pours a beautiful cloudy orange. The smell promises spiciness, which the taste delivers on: cloves, bananas, maybe allspice? Delicious and refreshing on a hot Alabama night!
Bottle. Golden yellow with tall white head. Aroma of clove, yeast, bread. Flavor of clove, banana, yeasty bread. One of the best next to New Glarus Imperial Weizen.

Draft, 22-APR-2009.
Absolutely the best weiss I have had. It is so much better draft than on bottle.
Cloudy with white head.
Very spicy with lots of cinnamon.
Super-weisse.

after Paulaner, this is probably my favorite hefe. pours a darker yellow, almost brown with a much cloudier appearance. aroma is predicably yeasty and citrusy. it has more bite than Paulaner and it stays on the palette longer. quite good.

Too bad U.S. craft brewers cannot emulate this fine Weissbier. Nothing compares.

hazy straw color with rocky white head.

nose is a delightful mix of estery, bananna, clove, and bread. Very appetizing.

palate is a glorious mix of malt/wheat with plenty of fruit and that nice estery banana taste.

Finish is very appetizing as well. Have to have another.
Straw color/hazy with thin white head.  Big banana/estery aroma.  Spicy flavor with banana and clove notes.  Top notch wheat beer.   Doesnt get much better than this.  On tap at Peculier Pub, NYC.

Appearance: initial head is average and creamy, white and with good lacing; mostly diminishing. Cloudy and thick body, dark yellow hue. Aroma: banana, dough, little vanilla and clove, moderate yeast. Initial flavor: moderate sweet and light acidic. Final flavor: light sweet and acidic; short duration. Palate: light-medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation and slightly chalky finish. It tastes like a cake made of banana, vanilla and cinnamon.

16.9oz bottle. Pours clear golden orange with a large fluffy white head. Aroma and flavor of bananas, cloves, and yeast. Not too sweet. Crisp, refreshing, and highly drinkable. A fine example of a style I do not usually prefer.

Hazy yellow gold pour with a thick frothy white head that retains very well. Excellent wheat and yeast spice aroma. Taste is amazingly crisp wheat. Less sweet than most wheat beers and that is why its one of the best.

On tap @ Jakes Bar and Bistro, this one is on quite regularly at Jakes and I love it, from the oldest brewery, great spiced bread and old banana flavors, call me crazy but a brewery thats been there for almost 1000 years has got it down!
Pretty clear for a hefeweizen, white head does not last. Taste is some bannanas and cloves plus bread and yeast. Good beer - its drinkable and refreshing though not particularly memorable.

Bottle poured into a pint glass.  Color was a hazy light gold color, with frothy white 1-inch head.  Aroma of cloves, wheat, orange, coriander, and flowers.  Taste was of citrus and spice.  Awesome mouthfeel, very crisp and quenching.  Great beer.
Very smooth Hef with great aftertaste that rests on the back of the tongue. One of the best Hefs I have had hands down. This would be great on a warm summer day with some beer brats.

Pours a crystal gold with a fluffy head. Some light fruit on the nose, and the taste is This is such a refreshing beer; it begs to be sipped on a patio in the summer. One of my favorites. A little on the simple side when it comes to flavor, but always satisfying when youre looking for something light. Pairs great with candied walnuts.
Bottle from Farm Fresh on April 3, 2009.  As far as hefeweizens go they dont get much better than this.  Thankfully this is easy to find because it is one of the best in its category.

Huge fluffy head that sticks around for awhile. Nice looking translucent orange haze color. A very awesome looking beer. Huge yeast citrus aroma. This has a ridiculous aroma to it. A nice yeast hefeweizen smell. Jeez this aroma is pungent. Nice banana clove smell. Big on the yeast and banana flavor. A very good taste, but it is missing the spices. I think there could be more clove. Not as thick as I would like it. One of the best, if not the best german hefeweizen I have ever had. Overall, great beer.

Big, hazy, golden and unmistakably German.

Loads of banana in the aroma which makes it quite a palpably thick smell. Citrus and coriander top-notes. Some lightly roasted caramel and cereal hidden back there too.

Very sweet and fruity. A tiny dry tingle deep in the throat brings some biscuity powderiness. Orange peel and juicy mango with very obvious yeast. 

Lovely thick, whipped cream texture. An absolute pleasure to drink.
Poured a copper orange with a small white head. Smells of lemons, tastes of lemons and bananas. Lots of fragrance, lots of taste. A very drinkable session beer.

Bottle.  Aroma of crisp wheat, banana, clove and a hint of cinnamon.  Mouthfeel is full, yet crisp.  Flavors dance across the palate, infusing a well-balanced flavors that are also present in the aroma.  Nice yeast component as well.  Finishes dry-yet-juicy, not bitter nor sweet.  Simple, but well composed.
Bottle from BevMo!  Pours a cloudy yellow/gold color. Aroma is very yeasty with banana, clove, and a hint of bubble gum. Taste is the same, with a metallic and flat finish.
A great Hefe.  Have not had one of these since I went to Germany.  And I do miss it.  Cloudy gold and smells of delicious yeast.  Tastes of banana and fruit.  Decent finish.

Bottle.  Poured a hazy yellow, golden color with a frothy white head with nice lacing.  The aroma was of clove and bananas and the flavor was the same, but not as good.  The beer has a medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, and an abrupt finish.  Overally, this is a good beer.  I wish the flavor was as good as the aroma.  I would definately drink this beer again.
500ml bottles from Utobeer & Nelson Wines. Cloudy yellow amber with a lovely nose of clove and herbs. Fresh taste and a delicate palate. Overall, a great example of the style.

12 ounce bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy lemon yellow color with a large frothy head. Good retention and lacing. Aroma of banana, clove and bread. Taste is caramel, bread, banana, pineapple. Medium bodied.
hazy, golden, white foam, medium bitter, typical weizen, fizzy, medium body. From bottle average flavour but on the tap in skiareals is the best
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Aroma of citrus and banana with some added spice. Fluffy head with a mildly translucent pour. Definitely full of spicy banana flavor and a slightly grassy, but clean finish. I will have to buy this one again in July, very refreshing and well done.

On tap at Zenos Pub - State College, PA. Aroma is a cold glance of orange peel, a bit of lemon-flavored sugar and some soft bread. Pours a darker yellow, hazed with a thin, lacy white rim. Flavor is relatively and bland. A generic Mauritian white sugar melds with a bit of banana skin and some almond oil. Balanced, with a real juicy finished in line with chamomile and apricots. Its okay and maybe a standard, but not all that exciting and expressive for the style.

Good German Hefeweizen.  Pours a nice cloudy straw yellow with a nice but short lived white head.  Plenty of bannana and yeast in the nose.  Flavor has abundant bannana, yeast and clove.  A very nice refreshing brew.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2009 16.9 oz Bottle-Cloudy golden yellow w/a pure white head & great lacing. Spiced, fruity aroma. Flavors of wheat, banana, spice, citrus, & cane sugar. Very smooth & easy to drink w/a great mouthfeel & good carbonation. Id say this is the best Hefe Ive ever had, very good brew.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2009 The undisputed king of the fruity banana aroma Hefeweizen (with Schneider Weisse being the leader for bready Hefes). Pours a light orange color with huge white head. Heavy-duty banana aroma with some clove. The aromas are so damn seductive they immediately pull you back to the glass just after you have put it down. Taste is bananas galore and citrus, slightly sweet. Perfect mouthfeel and carbonation, refreshing and smooth. Drinkability is only limited by how many bottles you have left or how soon you pass out. Damn this is good! In this case, "the worlds oldest brewery" is not just some gimmicky slogan, it means quality.

Bottle.  Powerful aroma of yeast and wheat.  Cloudy light orange body, large fluffy white head.  Flavor is strong wheat, banana, lemon, mildly sweet.  Finish also has some sweetness.  Pretty much the perfect Hefe.

Really good hefe.  I hear people talk about this like its the definitive example of the style.  It definitely is good, but Im not sure its head and shoulders above the rest.  Still, tasted so good to miy palate.
Bottle. Apperance; Light yello, cloudy, with a big white head. Aroma; Wheat and a small amount of citrus. Wheat and light bitter ending.
Bottle. Poured a cloudy gold color with a white head. Aroma of fruits, wheat and yeast. Has a spicey wheat flavor. I love wheat beer, this is the best I have had so far.
Bottle - Nice hazy pour . aroma and taste of bananas and wheat. Refreshing and enjoyable

Bottle at Heidis Bierbar Århus. Cloudy yellow colour with a big white and lasting head. Aroma and taste of fruit (banana, pineapple, grape) and yeast. Heavy weizen and so much more taste, than Erdinger and Franziskaner. One of the best, if not THE best. Thumbs up Kenni.
Cloudy pour. Aroma has notes of fruit and yeast. Taste reflects the aroma. This is a very good Hefe!

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Best Hefewizen ive sampled by a distance.And my first offical rating of the style  on ratebeer : Very soulful. Banana esters are on drugs in this beer...jumping outta the glass .Vibrant wheatines . Lovely beer.re8awesome Wheatbeer.Damn ..damn..damn .addictive banana and spice flavours.Bombastic ...fantastic
En uppfriskande, vederkvickande, veteöl som får en att glömma bort den grå vardagen. Översköljer alla sinnen och dränker eventuella sorger. Fruktig, graciös och elegant.
Good hefe.  Better than the kristal version they produce.  Pours cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Fruity and yeasty aroma.  Tastes of wheat and banana.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Good stuff.
FInally a change of pace for me from my usual imperial stouts and IPAs.  Smells and tastes of banana, very pleasant, perfect looking pour.  Excellent stuff.

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy gold body with lots of continuous rising carbonation. Small, but very creamy white head that lasts throughout the entire session, however, leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is bready wheat and bananas. Distinct floral yeast aroma with mellow wheats and a light pepper spice. Flavor is much of the same. Wheat, yeast, ripe banana, and a hint of a light lingering spice. Palate is medium bodied and smooth throughout. Overall, this is probably my favorite hefe and its made damn well. Not the most exciting of styles, but very refreshing and enjoyable.

of all the hefes this is top dog. They are only the oldest brewery in the world so there doing something right. the body has a nice golden color with a cloudy haze to it, and a fluffy white head. (this is what i imagine, when i think of a perfect beer should look like) its got a sweet banana aroma. the taste has a perfect blend of banana and clove. (i find a lot of hefes have two much of one and not enough of the other) and it goes down so smooth, like grapejuice. if your looking for a nice light beer, or a great beer to enjoy in the summer while sitting around a pool reading a book, or new to craft beer drinking and need a place to start. you just cant beat this beer. if you like your beers richer or higher in alcohol, you might find this on the weak side. but without a doubt  this beer always delivers.
I like wheat beers and this is my fav.... Nce poor with decent head nice lacing...color a little darker than other hefes.  Bread, lemon and slight bubblegum deliciousness....

A tart citrus aroma accompanied the pour of the cloudy golden beer.  A nice white head lingered with good lacing.  The taste was sweet, with an active carbonation that bit the tongue quickly followed by a hoppy, clove spiciness.

On tap.  Poured a cloudy yellow with a nice white head.  Very typical aroma, wheaty, citrusy.  Good round body.  Wheat and banana flavors.  Was more pedestrian than I was hoping but a good hefe nonetheless.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2009 Color: slightly cloudy golden with a trace of orange.  Thick head that slowly dissipates to about ¼.  Nose: spice and fruit rind.  Taste: Malted wheat, touch of clove, hint of grapefruit and lemon.  A very clean, smooth, refreshing brew with almost no bitterness.  Solid carbonation, slightly dry finish.  Nothing is overpowering here.  Very pleasant and very good.

Murky dark apricot with frothy thick white top, opaque. Smells of ginger, oranges, lychees, and strawberries. Tastes of berries, ginger, and vanilla. Mild and bitterless. Might be better in cold temperature.

Pours an unfiltered apricot color with a minimal off white head and is active.
Lots of banana malt smell with a beerish aroma.
The taste is wheaty with hints of banana and vanilla.
This light bodied beer has soft carbonation.
Very drinkable.
Bottle. Hazy dark yellow colour with a huge white head. Banana, yeast and wheat in aroma. The flavour is sweet, banana, yeast and wheat. Well-balanced and very tasty hefeweizen.

Pours fairly ugly peach color with quickly dissipating head.  Aroma of pear, apple, peach, lemon, and a good amount of wheat.  Flavor is not too sweet, with notes of peach, pear, a nice dose of lemon, cinnamon, coriander, and wheat.  Palate is fairly full with a semi-dry finish.  Not bad.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2009 The classic weissbier, never disappoints. Cloudy golden color with a nice white head.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, and clove.  Typical light wheaty flavor, yeasty, refreshing, fruity, with clove and banana. Very refreshing. Always a good call (unlike Miller, which claims this, but is a terrible beer).

Mini growler from Half-Time.  Pours a hazy light amber with a good sized white head.  Nose is citrus and wheat, almost a little clove spice, and a good amount of banana and yeast. Carbonation is subtle, mouthfeel is medium but light.  Slight sweetness leads into a light crisp yeasty finish.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 Appearance:  Textbook, enormous, white head; darker orange color; moderate haze

Aroma:  Like banana bread with cloves; very typical, nothing out-of-the-ordinary

Flavor:  Better than Ayinger; better balance; good banana and clove flavor with a stronger wheat, some vanilla, and subtle citrus;  Complex

Palate:  Nothing to complain about; Long, enjoyable finish; wheaty creaminess

(I had a Double IPA before this, so my taste buds are a little shot.)

Pours to a pale, cloudy amber with light, quickly dissipating white head that laces the glass with a medium grip.  The nose is pure spice and banana, a sign of good things to come.  This moderately carbonated hefe is a very spicy beer from start to finish, and as refreshing as any wheat brew should be.    Most certainly worth visiting every few months.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2009 This is my all time favorite Hefeweizen.  Any time I get a chance this is my selection.  Such a great taste, palate, and appearance.  I highly recommend this to anyone who likes Hefeweizen.
Bottle. Dark golden with huge creamy head. Intense wheat, banana, bubblegum and yeast aroma and flavour. Great carbonation. Smooth and bitter finish. Great beer.

This beer looks amazing. Such an enormous fluffy meringue like head, a nice cloudy light orange color. Plenty of good lace. The smell is intensely yeasty and dry with some good fruit scents. Some spiciness, some copper, and some bread dough. Flavor is just so quintessential for the style. but the notes are so well amplified. This is a fantastic tasting beer. There is a immediate yeasty and bubblegum flavor some apple and citrus along with the classic banana clove combination. This is sweeter than many hefes so I take it one bottle at a time, but it is such a delight.

Aroma is bubblegum and must.  Nose is all clove. Pours a crystal clear golden. Flavor is sweet, cloveish and slightly back biting bitter. Definitely a true Hef!  Bready notes strike in between the clove and bubblegum notes.

16.9 oz $3.20. Nice cloudy yellow, superb head. Typical smells of cloves. Flavor is bubblegum, clove, blackjack nice. This was definitely a good hefe and I am fairly ignorant when it comes to German beers. Ill be picking up some more Weihenstephaner beers in the future.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-05-2009 02:43:50

Wow, I cant believe iI havent rated this! Beautiful hazy golden body, white head, lots of visible carbonation. Aroma: wheat, stewed lemons, hops. Flavour: wheat and citrus, hoppy-yeast finish. Clean and crisp. Awesome.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma was fantastic! The scent of bananas fills the nose, along with some really strong yeast scents. The flavor is similar, but has a nice malty base. Great carbonation, feels real lively in your mouth and is very, very drinkable. Easily the best hefeweizen I have tasted.

Hands down, the best authentic hefeweizen Ive ever had. The aroma is insane. Its yeasty, and bready, and amazing. The flavor is also really malty, with hints of banana. Thanks to my pops for splitting this fantastic brew. Cheers!

Bottle. A sweet smell, only light yeast and citrus. The white creamy head is rather small with a normal duration. The body is light cloudy and orange. The taste is light bitter with a normal duration, not so pleasant. The beer is light with much carbonation and a light astringent finish.

Another $2.69 bottle from BevMo this poured a nice cloudy yellow with a good white head and great lacing.  Nose of of banana and citrus. Really nice clean mouthfeel. Flavors mirror the nose. This is an outstanding hefe.
This is one of my favorite beers, it has a great flavor with a slightly dark cloudy yellow color. Very easy to drink and always good. Bottle

Murky golden pour with a thick white head that evaporates very slowly. Bubblegum aroma with some nice banana scent as well. Flavor similar but a little bit more banana than bubblegum maybe with a nice carbonated kick to it. Probably the best hefe I have ever drank.

Hazy gold body over tall white head. Nice smell of sausage and light yeast, you can tell its not an overly sweet version of the style. Taste is citrus and breads, some clove. Light on the palate, fizzy with medium finish of bread dough. I prefer something sweeter, but this will do nicely.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2011 Bottle. Bright orange, great head. Nice citrus orange aroma. Little lemon and banana it there as well. Taste has a nice spicyness to it for a hefe. Classic banana earthy taste. Bread like, maybe even a touch of some hops in the back-ground. Texture is light but not watery. Little carbonation bubbles while in your mouth. Overall great beer...I wouldnt expect anything else from the worlds oldest brewery. This must be a 5 from the tap or at the brewery??

bottle bought in Systembolaget - Stockholm.
Appearance: cloudy yellow color. Great head, compact, lasting, a little rocky and with good adherence at glass.
Aroma: fresh wheaty and yeasty smells. Clear banana reminiscences, also to cookies, cake, vanilla, gun, toffee and slight citrus notes.
Flavor: sweet wheaty start that persist right to the end. Slightly citrus note. Fresh yeasty progress with hints of toffee, banana, vanilla, custard and lemon cookies. I can to remember the dessert of banana with palm-trees honey and the natural orange-banana juice.
Palate: medium body and semi-creamy texture. Medium carbonation.
Remark: refreshing with very nice yeasty and banana notes, but slightly sweety unbalance. Drinkable.

bottle 500ml 3,01 from Alko EXP 11.03.09
hazy golden yellow bit white head pleasant scent taste tasty mixture of grain and wheat banana and spicy hops. Pleasant phenols in aftertaste.

A: Wonderful cloudy gold. Huge puffy head, hangs around a long time.

S: Cloves, bready, citrus.

T: Big spice, cloves, banannas, orange. A bit of a hop spice near the back. 

M: Super clean, and smooth. Spicyness stays until the next sip, but, while drinking this, it is normally not too long between sips!

D: Fantastic. Just as good during a clold winter night, as it is during a hot summer day.

This is the world’s standard, for Hefe’s. Hands down.

Bouteille 500ml, courtoisie de Blankboy. De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, citron), moyen dépices (clou de girofle et coriandre) et de blé, léger de gomme balloune et de pain avec des notes de sucre bonbon et de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches). Mince-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen mais croustillant ainsi qu une texture moyennement crémeuse et aux petites notes aqueuses. Goût de levures fruitées (bananes, citron) accompagné dun moyen goût épicé (clou de girofle, notes de coriandre) ainsi qu un léger goût de gomme balloune lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de blé aux notes asséchantes avec un léger goût de pain et des petites notes de sucre bonbon et de miel puis en finale l’on retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) et de levures épicées (léger regain de clou de girofle). Post-goût moyen et aux notes sèches composé de levures fruitées (peau de banane, léger zest d’agrumes) avec de faibles notes de houblon herbeux.
This is one of my favorite beers, it has a great flavor with a slightly dark cloudy yellow color.  Very easy to drink and always good. Bottle

Bottle, poured a nice head... swirled to get the yeast and added to the glass. Dynamic baked bread aroma. Spicy too with honey and cloves. Very yeasty and malty. Smooth on the palate. Great flavor. One of the best Hefe Weissbiers I have tried. Perfect in every way.
Hazy amber with medium off whtie head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with banana notes. Flavour likewsie adn it finished sweet.

Tap last night at my local.   A pleasant yeasty spicyness.  Light to medium body. Citrus and clove dominate the nose with whisps of light malts.  Malts appear in second half of mouthfeel.  Great on a cold night.

500ml bottle: Pours hazy, slight golden with an elegant white head. Clove aroma, mineral and malt. Clove dominates flavor, slight banana, prickly carbonation. Light-bodied. Gets more wheaty as it warms.

Pours hazy pale amber with pale gold highlights, and a tall foamy white head, that has good retention and lacing. Aroma is full of banana, some yeasty bread rolls, bubble gum, strawberry starburst, bubble gum, and lemon. Flavor is good, really good. Orange glazed dinner rolls, banana, clove, bubble gum, fruity yeast. Finish is very clean wheat, spicy yeast, and a some watery orange. Body is a little thin...I think, its difficult to gauge since every sip seems like a million flavorful little ants are fighting in my mouth - very over carbonated, but seems to settle down by the end of the bottle. Still, best Hefe I have had.
This Hefeweizen is crisp and heavily carbonated. Strong banana and lemon flavors are present. Citrusy sweetness lingers at the end of a sip

Bottle from Systembolaget.
It looks like a unfilterd apple juice with a white head. The aroma contains wheat and yeast. A bit to high on carbonation. Will buy it again in the summer!
Stormy yellow with a cumulus head.  Flowery aroma, banana peel flavor with bubble gum and taffy.  Fair hops throughout.  A top notch hefeweizen.
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2010 Bottle. Hazy golden. Thick head. Smells orange and yeast. Tastes vanilla, orange. Refreshing!

Worlds oldest brewery...so says the label.
Cloudy pale gold with a two inch white head a good amount of lacings. Aroma is spicey.
Taste is bready, spicey, some bitter earthy hops.
Mouthfeel is very good and highly sessionable. 
Very nice Hefe. Decent value at $2.99 US for a little over one pint. Well recommended.

500 mL bottle. Pours a murky dark yellow with a decent two-finger white head. Fairly high carbonation. Nose of yeast, bananas, orange peel, lemon zest- standard wheat beer. Taste brings out some cloves and citrus tartness. Fairly light bodied but excellent. Nice dry finish. Best hefeweizen I have had.

From bottle.
Pours to a light yellow-ish orange with a sizable, 2 finger head. Good amount of carbonation. Lots of yeast and some citrus and banana on the nose. 
The aroma gives a strong hint to the flavor, with a good deal of citrus coming through right after a yeasty first taste.  A bit of clove, as other reviewers have suggested. Coriander as well. 
Smooth finish, very clean. A strong example of the style.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2009 Foi com essa cerveja que descobri as verdadeiras cervejas de trigo. Aroma frutado, lembrando banana e caramelo. Espuma densa e persistente, cremosa. Sabor com toques de fermento.
Bottle. Poured with a wonderfully thick creamy head. Cloudy and hazy amber colour- great taste with a fruity aroma.

Bottle.  Poured a hazy yellow color with a thick, rocky white head that diminished slowly to a thick layer.  Aroma of lemons, banana, wheat, clove, and some light yeastiness.  Tart, crisp entry with some lemon and wheat transitions into a soft banana and clove spiciness, followed by soft apricot paired with some doughy yeast.  Crisp finish.  Low carbonation, but the wheat provides a nice bite to complement the flavor.  Very nice, refreshing beer.

Cloudy orange body with three pretty fingers of puffy lumpy white head that falls at the edges leaving a nice dome of lasting foam.  Strong yeasty clove spice aroma and bananas.  Taste is smooth and sweet bubblegum, wheaty body, pear and bananas.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy/dirty amber, nice lasting head. Sweet bubblegum, light fruity aroma. My favorite (so far) hefeweizen!

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2008 500ml bottle into eponymous branded weizen glass. Cloudy golden colour with an ample foamy white head. Classic spicy yeast banana aromas. Tingling fruity chewy palate with classic bubblegum and clove notes with a clean neutral refreshing finish. A top class Bavarian wheat beer.

Great Hefe.  As usual bubble gum and banana mixed with some mild clove.  A yeasty doughy texture.  Huge creamy head that was extremely long lasting.  Hazy murky clarity with average density.  Color medium yellow.  Light to medium body with creamy texture.

Bottle.  Pours the usual hefe cloudy yellow with a really nice 2 finger rocky white foamy head and perfect lacing.  Nose is banana bubble gum and sweet wheat.  Taste is coriander, clove, banana and yeast and a nice clean finish.  Light mouth feel.  Not a hefe fan, but this is the best one Ive had by far. Mostly because of the way it finishes  it doesnt have that overly sweet aftertaste.
Pours cloudy golden with nice white head. reat citrus and spice flavor and aroma. Light feel to it. By far the best hefe I’ve tried.

Pours hazy gold with nice bright white head. The aroma first hits with a big bubble gum note. Upon deeper investigation the bubble gum was still there but just beneath were notes of wheat, mild banana, yeasty spices and some fruity esters in the background. Wow, tasty hefe. It starts with bubble gum, banana and wheat. Soon those notes are joined by mild tart acidity, floral and spice hop bitterness. As the finish approaches the classic bubble gum and banana overwhelm the other notes.

Bottle poured into a Weihenstephaner Weiss glass, produced a proper two fingers worth of white head that lasts. The body of this wonderful brew was a hazy and golden orange in color

The aromas of bananas, wheat and spices filled my head. The nose on this is exactly what I expect in a Hefe. The banana smell wasn’t overpowering as in some others 

The flavors mimic the nose, but it is very refreshing in the way it plays in your mouth. Good carbonation and light as well, great flavors this is a world class Hefe. This starts of sweet and fruity and had a light dry finish.

Highly drinkable, it would be my go to session brew if it weren’t so expensive.

Interesting how even not my favorite types of beers are worth drinking when they are one of the best in their category.  A lot of flavor in this lighter tasting beer.  Flowers and green fruit, spice and a crisp kind of malt and a slight dry finish.  Not something I would choose again, but something I am better for having tried.
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy golden color with a light white head.  Aromas and flavors of clove and malt.  Light bodied, finishes spicy on the lateral parts of the mid-tongue.  Very nice beer.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head.  Taste of fruit and yeast.

Really a nice hefe.
Pours cloudy golden with a nice white head.  Has the lovely yeasty, banana, clove aromas.  Goes down very very smoothly, just a perfect example of a great German weissbier.

Cloudy and Golden with a durable and lively white head.

Aromas of Bannana and yeast with a hint of lemon. 

Sweet on the first sip developing to sour then bitter at the end of the taste.

Smooth mouthfeel, almost coating the mouth and going down with little carbonation. Highly drinkable for lovers of beer or not this is a top notch beer and highly reccomended.
Draught. Pours with typical hefe golden cloudiness, with durable head. Citrus and yeast on the nose, and decent mouthfeel.
Tasty hefe, not too sweet, not too strong.  A bit heady when poured, smooth going down. Fairly mellow overall and damn enjoyable. Not too expensive either for an import.

Bottled. Huge, floffy and creamy head is white. Pours hazy yellow to orange. Warm aroma of wheaty banana and sourish yeast. Spicy sharpness is also detectable. Flavor is sweetish malty with increasing sourness and dryness towards the finish. There´s also mild bitteration in the finish. Palate is creamy smooth and moderately carbonated. Medium bodied.

Bottle: Deep golden, hazy with a firm almost creamy white head; very solid sweet-fruity (oranges, lemons) nose with some phenolic, yeasty and wheaty undertones; medium bodied; robust sweet-sourish flavour with a tinge of bitterness; moderate sweet-fruity-wheaty finish, balanced by bitterness and tartness in the aftertaste. First-class Weizen.........

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2008 Rating is better of two ratings
rerate: (7-4-7-3-14=3.5)
Caramel aroma. Toffee taste, banana. As one would hope from a hefe.
rerate of: (6-4-7-3-12=3.2)
500ml bottle (Gallows Bird, Espoo, Oktoberfest 2008)
This is one of my favourite hefe-weizens. However, I was pretty boozed up by the time I decided to knock this one back, and it wasnt refreshing enough for me. The aroma was the usual toffee and banana, but the palate was sticky, and the taste was so packed full of caramel it was simply not crisp enough. Ill have no problem rerating this in the future though.

Very tasty brew.  Cloudy golden yellow color.  Decently spicy (clove and yeast) with a very lemony flavor.  Hint of banana as well.  Smooth and well balanced.  Has a tingling tartness. Yeast/spice flavors in the after taste; fairly dry finish.  Mmmmm.
This is a very good food beer. Well balanced spices that will not over-power. A pleasant aroma of banana and cloves. One of the best hefe weizen I’ve had,

How have I not tried this yet?  maybe because it’s a boring wheat beer.  Well, I can admit when I’m wrong, because this is delicious!  Poured a cloudy apricot color with a nice white dissipating head.  Aroma was cloves, lemon, banana and some spice.  Taste was much the same, with banana bread and a terrific semi dry finish.  This beer excells in it’s balance and has no noticable flaws.  Best Hefe I have ever had!

Pours a cloudy pale golden color with a nice sized foamy head that doesn’t last. Aroma of bread, spice and banana.  Flavor starts off with the sweet banana and then you get the malts and spice.
Nice carbonation from middle to end. Very smooth.  Nice hefe.
Ceebs 25 gives a pretty good description of this one.
06.02.2004, 0,5l Bottle. The colour is hazy yellow. The beer smells nice and has a nice aroma. The head is small and there is little carbonation. Aftertaste is a little weak.

500ml bottle. BB 21.1.09. Poured into official weizen glass with reasonably big fluffy white head atop a slightly cloudy golden body.
Plenty of banana on the nose, quite citrusy with a good deal of clove, vanilla and bread coming through. 
Carbonation is fairly lively, creamy texture, smooth full body with a hint of refreshing citric tartness.
Unripe banana and lemon peel seems to be the best way to describe what I taste on the body straightup. A bready maltiness takes over bringing pepper and clove, with some sharpness and dryness lingering on the finish. 
Not as good as remember...but what beers are! Excellent hefeweizen regardless, not overdone and I think that may just be the key.

11.2 oz bottle. Very aromatic and pleasant smelling beer, lots of yeast and wheat bread dough, bananas, light peach, and a hint of bubblegum.  Good frothy starch white head, sadly it mostly dissipates, very cloudy, mostly opaque, dark butter yellow in color.  Flavor is rather similar to the aroma (besides the bubblegum part) with the start being a jumble of several different flavors and a bunch of yeast, but then theres an almost tangy bitter earth citrus hop starting in the middle into the finish, which lingers pretty nicely, a good feel overall with a  tingling bite.  Really, this hefe is quite hard to beat.
Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a fluffy white head. The aroma is fruity, with banana and lemon, also clove and other spices. The flavor is very well balanced, with clove and ripe banana. Very nice.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2008 draught @ cafe t moortgat, arnhem. i always like a good wheatbeer. this hefeweizen really pleased me. the beer has an cloudy body with an ok head. the aroma is very strong and typically for a wheatbeer. the taste was very full with an good aftertaste. great mouthfeel. enjoyed this one a lot.

The pour was mostly golden in color and not that cloudy.  The head was white and compact with virtually no lacing.  The aroma was yeasty, malty and citrusy.  The flavor was bright citrus, yeast and thin malt.  I liked the yeasty notes, made it taste not so standard.  The mouthfeel was above average for the style, the finish was average.  Enjoyable.

I have tried most of the German Hefe-Weizens out there that I can find and this definitely in the top two, if not the best one in the world. The aroma is great, the appearance perfect and the taste is nice smooth wheat flavour with a hint of banana/fruit. Definitely my favourity beer so far!

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2013 On tap at the brewpub. You have not had one of these beers until you have had fresh on tap at the brewpub. When this is poured I dont see a beer but a blond women in a golden dress. Probably one of the best German Hefe-Weizen there is. Nice banana aroma.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 (bottle) pours a cloudy golden colour with a dense white head. aroma of peanuts and wheat, quite medicinal, with hints of apricot, peaches, light notes of yeast and herbs. flavour is mostly on the fruity side of things, with some dominant notes of banana and peaches, followed by a mellow wheaty caramel finish. medium-bodied with refreshingly lively carbonation.

Aroma is banana/citrus and easters. Pours cloudy orange with rocky white head. Flavor is crisp citrus and banana with an undertone of spice. Finish is nice and dry. Medium body with okay head retention. Sweet and refreshing, almost like a Witbeer with more banana and spice.  Well done. Probably the best Hef out there.  If you like WIdmer Bros, you have to try the original!

From bottle.  Part of Dayton Beer Tasting July Event.  Paired with chevre on crostini.  Poured cloudy light amber as remembered.  Typical banana wheat aroma with cloves and citrus.  Light citrus taste mixed with wheat with a long lasting finish.  Great hefe.
Fantastic German Weissbier. Lovely Hoppy aroma, complemented by a scent of clove and friuty overtones! Great out of a bottle, great from draught! Best German Weissbier I have ever had.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2009 7 oz draught sample.  Cloudy yellow pour with a thin white head.  Aroma of bread and yeast.  Taste of the same with some subtle hints of citrus.  Slightly watered down finish.

From bottle. Wonderful sweet banana wheat aroma, with clove and mild citrus notes, yeast funkyness and light gaseousness. Great nose on this one - this exemplifies what I think of when I think German Hefeweizen smell. Cloudy medium amber body with foamy off-white creamy-foamy lacing head. Medium bodied, with medium carbonation that’s almost effervescent. Starts with terrific fresh sweet wheat malt, light banana, and some chalky bitterness. Light amount of citrus character and yeasty taste. Even a bit of clove and vanilla in there, too. Light and refreshing and one of the best I’ve had in a long time.

500 ml bottle. Hazy orange body with a foamy off-white head. Aroma is fruity, yeast, ester and a bit spicy. Flavor is refreshing fruity, citrus, banana and yeast. Medium body as preferred with this type of beer, very nice and close to perfect.

Pours pale yellow, slightly cloudy, big, dense head.  Lacing that clings thickly to the side of the glass. Strong aroma of lemon and banana.  Thin but rich body, a little dry.  Well balanced taste, slightly sweet, very subtle, some banana and wheat, but other flavors are hard to pick out.  A very mild hop aftertaste.
From tap, Great orange-honey color, stronge aroma of apple & banana, nice flavour of banana & clove, well balanced, liked it very much.

(bottle): Pours a cloudy yellow body.  Huge foamy white head,.creamy & lasting. Some fruity esters, some spice like clove. Some heaviness in the aroma. Fruity banana-like taste. Somewhat watery, but definately not weak.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2010 50 cl bottle. Hopheads´ tasting 22. august. Hazy yellowish color, fine white head. Aroma is banana, wheat, spices and yeast. Flavor is the same. Nice weissbier, but not as fantastic as the score indicates.

Re-rate: Well, in fact it is fantastic...

Poured from a 500ml bottle and served in a weizen glass.  This beer poured a cloudy golden orange hue with a thick head of slowly fading white fizz.  A small amount of slippery lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma of the beer was made up of flaked wheat, ripe bananas, and a stong note of spicy clove.  The flavor consisted of mild banana and some lightly spicy yeast.  Everything that the nose displayed seemed muted or toned down a notch.  The mouthfeel was crisp and light-bodied with moderate carbonation.  Refreshing and highly drinkable, but as far as hefes go, this was pretty average.

Draft beer.

Wheat, with light banana.

Beautiful cloudy yellow color with a good head.

Great taste, but I don’t have a good way of describing it.  One of the best hefes I’ve had!

bottle, biergarten, tivoli,cph.
very nice aroma, sawdust, a little citrus.
cloudy yellow with nice large white head, flavor is strong as in powerful, and built of several things i had a hard time figuring. but it tastes wonderful.

(Draught at Hilpeä Hauki on 2008-08-21) Orange colour with hints of brown. Cloudy. Medium-sized head that disappeared quickly. Banana and salty liquorice in nose. Full-bodied palate with lot of carbonation. Banana, salty liquorice, sweetness and light bitterness in taste. Nice.

$2.99 500 ml bottle. Yet another tasty hefe. Lots of banana in aroma, nice cloudy appearance. Really easy drinker, the bottle was gone quick. Tastes just like you would want a hefe to taste like. Right up there with Dancing Man, but for the price and ABV, DM has this beat for sure.

500mL bottle purchased from LCBO in Toronto.  Pours a perfect wheat beer pour - light cloudy gold with a nice head.  Nice aroma - more on the yeasty side than the banana side.  The taste follow suit.  A bit light, more focus on the yeast and wheat, less on the banana and clove.  Some light spiciness associated with the yeast.  Overall, slightly on the light side - or have my tastebuds been fried by too many weizenbocks?

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2009 Wehenstephaner claims to be the oldest brewery in the world!  This beer has a good-sized, but quickly sinking cap.  There is a nice aroma of floral hops and a little citrus and wheat.  Rich hefe flavor - full wheat and yeast - holds up well without lemon.  Tingly carbonation.  One mouthful told me that this is a first-rate hefeweizen, and subsequent swallows did not disappoint.  I can see that the rest of the ratebeer crowd feels the same way, since this is in the top 1% for the style.

Golden with a huge thick head. Lots of carbonation seen rising from the bottom.
Smells like malted wheat and a little spice. Also a little lemon.Taste is heavy of malted wheat, barley, and lemon.Not bitter and just the right touch of alcohol.Carbonation is great. Good aftertaste.This is an immediate favorite.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a slightly cloudy golden blonde, with a thick head, most of which dissipates quickly.  Aroma is a spicy, Belgian-like yeast.  The flavor starts out with a strong yeastiness, with notes of citrus and spice.  Slight aftertaste of wheat.  Very nice mouthfeel.  Not really my style of beer, but excellent for what it is.

[1504-20080701] 500mL bottle. Sweet grainy banana malt aroma has a hint of cotton candy. Hazy, orange brown body with a long-lasting foamy white head. Sweet grainy banana continues in the flavour with a nice base of toasted French bread. Medium body is smooth. A touch under-carbonated but lovely still, despite its lacking fizz factor.

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a fluffy white head and nice white lacing. Nose was spicey & banannas. Flavor was a refreshing mix of  spicey cloves and wheaty grains. Also, the usual bananna flavor. I have not had a lot of hefes, but I thought this one was awesome.
Enjoyed this.  Large head, course bubble size.  Very sweet aroma and flavour.  Typical cloudy look.  Supposed to be the ’standard’ for this style - can’t argue!

bottle.  A relatively gentle pour into a hefe glass still yields a huge, 3+ inch fluffy white head.  Aromas of banana, some yeast grain, and hints of clove spice.  Flavor shows great balance- mild spicy bitterness, banana sweetness, some mixed spices with cloves in the front, and a smooth bready sweetness.  Palate is crisp and clean, plenty of flavor, with a clean and clear finish.  Overall- a downright superb hefeweizen.

The best example of a German Weizen. Hazy pale yellow, big white fluffy head. Thick aroma of banana, yeast, wheat and some spice. Subtle flavour of wheat, banana, little hint of citrus. Very refreshing, prickly and creamy mouthfeel.
Looks good in the glass, has a nice fluffy head,  new it was a wheat just looking at it, definitely smell and taste yeast, finishes with a nice taste.
hazy gold blond coloured body with a white head a herby fruity aroma a fruity herby taste with a fruity bitter finish

Pours a bright, slightly hazy yellow with a big puffy white head that lingers throughout the session leaving bits of lacing.  There is also a constant stream of bubbles coming to the top.  Smell is wonderful with cloves, banana and sweet wheat.  Hint of citrus in the nose as well, mainly lemons.  Taste is absolutely perfect for a hefe with an initial citrus burst followed by a massive sweet wheat taste full of bananas and spices.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied and unbelievably creamy for a hefe with tons of carbonation.  The drinkability couldn’t be higher on this and it is the definitive example of a hefeweizen as far as I’m concerned.  There is no better summer beer on earth.
Hazy yellow coloured beer with some light carbonation and a small white head. Herby and fruity, wheat aroma. Full spicy palate. Finish is bitter fruity, with some herby touches. Nice weissen.
500 ml bottle. yellow golden colour. medium white head. I don’t understand whats so great about whitebeer... it’s not my style I guess...

Bottle from the LCBO. Strange that I haven’t rating this yet, I’ve gone through a few bottles while it’s been available here this summer. Pours a hazy dark golden with a big pillowy white head. Aroma of a solidly textbook hefe - OK, a bit heavier on the cloves than some, but still right on style. Same goes for the flavour - fresh and yeasty and wheaty, with notes of cloves, banana and a bit of bubblegum. Nice soft mouthfeel as well. I love this style, and I love this beer.
Hazy blond coloured beer with small white head and no visible carbonation. Yeasty aroma. Full palate. Finish is yeasty and fruity.

Poured a 2 finger head into my pint glass (I know I should’ve used my weizen glass, but I have to hand wash that)...
Head dissipated in about 1 minute. Color is straw, slightly cloudy, I even dumped all the yeast into the glass.
Smell: cloves , what else can I say. Kind of like standing in a field of cloves.
Taste: very clovey, some dryness in the back of the mouth. A tad of sweetness trying to get out but the carbonation keeps it back.
Mouthfeel: Another 5. creamy very nice.
Drinkability : that’s what these beers are made for.
This is a very nice beer which showcases Weihenstephan’s amazing hefe yeast. Perfectly done.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2008 Pours a cloudy straw color with a white head that lasts the duration of drinking. Nice, well balanced smell of wheat, yeast, clove and banana. I was drinking out of a tall hefeweizen glass and it laced the entire length of it. great beer!

Bouteille 500 ml, acheté au LCBO de Summerhill (Toronto), le 14/7/08. Arome de blé malté légèrement épicé, des notes de fruits exotiques. Goût de blé malté doux et savoureux, un petit note d’alcool mais ça passe. J’avais vu le verre de cette bière quant j’ai bu la Denisons Weissbier à Tornoto et j’ai vu la bouteille quelque jour après, j’étais curieux!

Had this a while back. Pours light hazy orange with head made up of many small bubbles. Aroma is banana and bread. Flavor is yeast and banana. Not really my style, however as far a the style goes this is pretty good.

Pours a hazy orange, somewhat muddy body; large, white head, mostly lasting with a fair lacing; small bubbles of average density. The beer has a heavy banana aroma, together with moderate hops notes and moderate-to-heavy yeasty notes, like fresh dough. Flavour is moderately sweet and acidic with a light bitter note that comes up in the long finish. Medium body with an oily texture; lively carbonation; light-to-moderate astringency.  Tasty beer, easily sessionable.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: 50cl bottle from Supermarket.  One of the more favoured hefe-weissbier.  A fresh, fruity wheat beer which is very refreshing.

(Bottle) Bours golden cloudy with a big head. Aroma is yeasty with some citrus notes. Flavour is wheaty with yeast esters. A very refreshing and drinkable hefeweizen, really nice (I think this was a rather fresh bottle)

On tap at Newport Pizza and Ale house. Aroma is yeasty with esters of banana and coriander. Color is a hazy orange yellow with very good carbonation and a big thick head. Taste is light and fruity. Starting with medium body it goes down with a crisp feel. Finish comes on with a fruity yeast flavor and a mellow citrus taste then ends with a faint banana and coriander flavor and a gentle bitterness. After taste is clean with the citrus taste riding out the longest. This is one of the best Hefeweizens I nave ever had.

50 cl bottle. Dim amber/orange with plenty of white lathing head. Citrus and banana in aroma, some bread as well behind that typical wheat beer aroma. Sweet taste with banana and bread. A suitable acidity and a thick mouthfeel.

Taste 7/8 Bottle 3078. Tasted in a weihenstephaner glass (ohhlala). Looks: Cloudy wheat in a golden body. Thick white head. Aroma: Wheat, yeasty and sweet. Taste: Smooth, light bodied.  Effercescent and very drinkable. A nice  mild hops bite in the finish.
a good example of a hefe weissbier.  bannana like smell, nice big head,  a  nice smooth finish to this beer. A great beer for a hot summer day!  The perfect bier too fill ones stein!

12 oz bottle. I would prefer to get the half liter bottles of this, if I could. Cloudy, blond with billowy, ample head. Lots of carbonation, lots of flavor- sour banana. tart, refreshing. Complex, forward yeast flavor. Must compare this to some local wheat beers.

Wheat beers are my favorite, and this is by far the best sample I’ve gotten. I have zero clue why it took me so long to try.

Absolutely brilliant golden-yellow with a great, large, airy. white head that lasts for quite some time. Superb head retention that slowly reduces to a full silky canopy and lace. Very Vibrant bouquet with major hints of banana, citrus, and a hint of cloves and vanilla. Citrus favors dominate along with major compliments of banana and clove. I’m now on a major mission to find this on tap, but the bottles are other worldly already.
Poured from a tap a light cloudy orange.   Sweet and refreshing combination of notes and yeast with a touch of fruit,
cloudy orange with a big white head. aroma is rich with cloves, banana and hoppy notes. Taste has all the same with a great balance.

Bottle. Pours a perfect cloudy orange/gold with a big white head. Aroma is banana, clove, yeast, and floral touches. perfect. Flavor is slightly sweet, with all of the elements of the aroma in perfect form. Finishes a bit dry, with a slightly lingering yeast flavor. Have had this multiple times in hefe tastings, and it always stands out as the clear winner.

A little dark on the pour.  This is an amber in color with a huge, two inch of pillowy head.  Looks great!  Smell is all wheat, some lemon and some other spice being noticed as well.    More wheat and you can taste the yeast in there as well.  This is a Hefe in the purest sense of the word.  Clean and non-cloying.  Refreshing, perfect warm weather beer.  Here comes the stateside part of my review: I think it would improve with some vigorous hopping, lol.
Draft. Really tasty old German-style hefe. A touch of bananas, but mostly just lovely yeast and refreshing citrus. Just what a German hefe should be.
very pleasent scent of spices and fruit.  taste is of spice and some yeast and fruit.  finish is very smooth with a fruity spiciness that lasts.  I would purchase this again.  Very nice.

Pour is cloudy golden with a very fluffy white head.  Aroma is quite potent with wheat, floral aromas, light orange, and spice.  Flavors are full with floral and a medium but very smooth sweet orange peel.  I got a lot of yeast in the flavor as well finishing with a wheat finish.  Good brew.  Would buy again. Very refreshing
Bottle: pours a cloudy orange with a big frothy white head, aroma of banana and yeast, taste is just a touch sour with banana and some spices, nice refreshing hefe.

A long while ago I drank this bier in a Bavarian bar.  Today it is still as great of a drink as I remembered it to be.  When poured correctly it has one of the most perfectly proportionate heads as any bier i have seen.  The bier it’s self has a slight banana undertone with a subtle citrus after taste.  Light and milky, this bier is poster child for all Bavarian Weiss biers.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2009 Bottle thanks to Woodsman52.  An awesome German Hefeweizen.  Strong aroma of bread and yeast. Magnificent tangy citrus flavor of wheat, light hops, and yeast....with bit a of tart and extremely clean crisp finish.  Refreshing and light.  This is what I imagine a perfect German Hefeweizen to be.

Bottle thanks to Woodsman52.  Hazy golden with a nice head depending on the way you pour this.  Could be excessive or small depending on your expertise.  Large bread yeast aroma.  Slightly sweet with some short lived bitterness.  Fizzy on the palate but smooth.  Nice beer.

Bottle and on tap but I just finished a bottle so this review is based on a bottled sample.  Consistently hazy glowing sunflower supporting a towering white head.  Lots of lacing.  Aroma of fresh bananas, yeast and newly cut grass.  Mildly spicy but crisp banana flavor with cloves and a kiss of yeast.  Rich texture and a full flavored brisk finish.  Refreshing and versatile.  Clearly worthy of its place as a world and style standard.
POured as cloudy yellow color with a nice whte head. Aroma is very wheaty. Flavor is much the same, not too much fruity tone mixed in.

Bottle, 50 cl. Huge rocky white head with excellent lacing. Cloudy dark yellow body. Malt aroma of grain and hay, light hop aroma, aroma of banana and bubble gum. Medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation. Moderate sweet and light bitter.

500mL bottle.  Pours a nice cloudy golden colour with a nice frothy head.  Nose is quite fruity, can pick up on strawberries, banana as well as a bit of a floral touch.  Flavour is a bit sweet, but very clean.  A bit of the banana again.  Finish is quite nice, with a very slight bitter spiciness.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a big foamy white head. Fantastic aroma of banana, clove, spices, candy store and wheat. Flavour is banana, more banana, clove, sweet spices and a long pleasant bitter aftertaste. What a wonder of hefes!

Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is a cloudy, sparkling, hay-colored beer with a firm, dense off-white head.  It has a spicy aroma of banana and clove.  It is medium bodied, smooth and creamy with a clean finish.  The flavor is clean, bold and smooth with a lot of spice.  Its very clovey and peppery.  An excellent Hefe!

I am a huge fan of Hefe Wiessen beers and this was an excellent choice for me. I can honestly say that I enjoyed it very much. It had the traditional banana/clove taste but was sweeter with a little more spice to it. I thought it had a very nice nose and a clean crisp finish.
