500 ml bottle from LCBO, served at cellar temperature in a Weizen glass. JN 27/08.[br/][br/]

App.:  Hazy orange-golden with a fair white meringue.
  
Aroma:  Cereal and wheat, slightly tangy, light banana esters, a bit grassy, lightly smokey (really??), slightly spicey.
  
Palate:  Medium body, medium-full effervescence, somewhat astringent.
  
Flav.:  A bit more banana that on the nose, some cereal and what, a bit of clove dry with a very slight spicey grain aftertaste.[br/][br/]

I worked on the Freising campus of TUM, where this brewery is located.  Oddly enough, their products were not well-liked by the locals due to rumours of headaches.  This product was not well-liked by me because it was boring.  Thankfully, no headache to report.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2008 Has the aroma and flavour of a typical Hefeweizen. Citrus, yeast, banana, cloves, and bubblegum. A bit sweeter than other hefeweizens I have had (a good thing). I have been wanting to try this one for quite some time now. I was happy to see it here finally. Although I think it is just seasonal beer here in Ontario. This reminds me why I love Hefeweizens.

On tap at Happy Pizza Kitchen in Munich.  I am rating my very first encounter with this beer, and subsequent run-ins have been stateside bottles and do not live up to the first few pints of this I had.  Unbelievable smoothness and almost a fruity yeast taste.  Very effervescent texture, notes of mellow banana and appley-clove.  Just outstanding when I had it first.
bottle, cloudy pour with large foamy head, banana fruit flavors are well controlled not overpowering, finish is smooth and balanced
Bottle: Pours golden and hazy with a huge white head. Wonderfull nose of vanilla and banana. Grainy flavour with wheat and citrus. Very drinkable.

Appearance: Pale yellow, cloudy. Lots of head, not longlasting.
Aroma: Not that wheaty. Hint of fruit, honey.
Taste: Pretty wheaty, hopsy. Fizzy.
Info: 500ml bottle, 24/1-2006, 65/300, 41/500

Fizzy golden w/ huge pale head. Strongly wheaty nose, raw banana, clove, yeast. Flavor is quite spritzy, wheat, peppery spices, a hint of alcohol. This bottle was  surprisingly low on fruitiness.  Medium bodied, slick palate. Its a good weisse, but Ill go with Ayinger.
Alot sweeter than most hefes, but this leaves nothing to be desired.  Its a very deep taste that changes as it sits in your mouth.  Less sweet finish.  Not too lemony, which is very refreshing.
Pours a cloudly yellow/gold color.  Aroma is very yeasty with banana, clove, and a hint of bubble gum.  Taste is the same, with a metallic and flat finish.

Not my favourite style, but very nice indeed.

Aroma is yeasty with just a hint of banana and clove.  taste is strong for the style and the aftertaste lingers pleasantly.

"The Worlds Oldest Brewery" seems to have perfected this style.

Bottle. Lovely cloudy light golden pour with a nice bubbly and lasting head.  Bananas, yeast, clove on the nose.  A little citrus.  Very bright and flavorful.  This is such a standard Hefe its almost hard to describe... its exactly what a Hefeweizen should be.  A classic.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2010 500ml bottle from LCBO in Ontario. Pale cloudy yellow with big foamy white head. Yeasty banana aroma. Very buttery smooth, carbonated, mild yeast, wheat, banana taste.

typical hefe pour. nice cloudy yellow pour, with a great big white head. Lovely aromas of banana, and bubble gum. Some nice yeasty esters. Flavour is nice and yeasty, with some great clove, and banana. A nice slightly tangy finish. a great hefe. Spot on for the style, and excellent example.

500 ml bottle from the LCBO. everything about this brew is pure hefe. no reason to go into real detail about anything because nothing really stands out from anything else. just a very good example of this style. great summer brew.

500 ml bottle. Hazy dark yellow, big foamy white head. Yeast and malts in the aroma, with some banana and notes of citrus. Medium-bodied mouthfeel. Spicy flavour of yeast and wheat, some banana as well. Im not a great fan of hefeweizens, but this one is very pleasant and refreshing.

Was served with lemon at Ashleys in Ann Arbor (although I didnt ask). Overall, quite good, and par for the course among higher-quality German hefeweiss beers. Banana and yeast for sure, but didnt pick up too much clove.

Pours a nice cloudy amber with a creamy white head.  Love German Hefes and this one rates pretty high in my book.  Refreshing, with slight banana and strong clove and yeast flavors.  I could drinks many, many of these in the summer on my patio.

Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with gigantic pillowy white head that. Aroma is yeast, hint of banana, wheat. Taste is wheat, bit of spice, banana and bubblegum. Finishes with a clean taste of wheat and spice. Masterful example of the style, one of my favorites.

Bottle pours hazy yellow with a head that rapidly diminishes.  The aroma is of yeast and light malt.  The taste is light, a bit of what and just a hint of spice.  There is almost an oily mouth feel to this one.

0.5l bottle. Aroma is typically hefeweizen. Yeast and wheat and banana. Pours a cloudy orange-brown with a moderate head. Palate is smooth. Flavour is nice and not overpowering. Notes of cloves, banana, wheat. Hmm. Perfect for this brutally hot day.

Pours a cloudy darky yellow with a BIG foamy head. The aroma is straight up wheat and yeast, with some light citrusy notes. The flavour is spicey, and fruity with a standard banana flavour finish. A damn refreshing beer, and the foamy mouthfeel is bang on. Goes damn good with some fresh beef jerky.

if you are in the mood for a nice wheat beer then this one fits the bill.  Pours murky orangish colour.  wheat and yeast on the nose.  Good mouthfeel and as good of a flavour as you will likely get for the style.  Nice on a hot day.  prefer it to original schniederweisse, hackerpschorr?

Murky blond beer; head creamy but dissipated quickly.  Fruity aroma and lemon wheat aldehydic flavor with mild sweetness. Smooth mouthfeel.  A little flat but could have been the tap.  Good but not great beer; will try again on a hot day.

500ml bottle 
5.4% ABV 
I tried this beer on May 31, 2008 after purchasing from the Queens Quay LCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazy orange colour with a generous bubbly head.  The aroma was mild wheat, some hops, and some spiciness with a malty feel.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied, slippery, with a lot of carbonation.  The flavour was sweet and spicy with wheaty, malty, and soime fruit tones in the mix.

Pours orange and is slightly cloudy, with a frothy head at first and then a thinner creamy looking head. Smells of yeast and wheat exactly what this style is known for. The flavor is very smooth, has a sort of citrus hint and a little banana along with yeast and wheat. This is a great Hefeweizen!

Poured a cloudy orange with a blooming white head. Strong and complex aroma; sour wheat and yeast, hints of banana. Tangy sour flavour, very refreshing bubblegum sweetness. Nice palate. Excellent beer, one of my favourites.
Wheat, sweet banana, spices and little of grass in aroma. Flavor is malts, banana, spices and yeast. Smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2009 Bottle, import, 3 weeks old. ;) Very nice solid blonde weizen color! Billowing head gives off yeasty banana and phenolic aromas. Taste darting hints of some tropical fruit, maybe guava? Slides back very lieblich and goes ex. well with the herb-poached arctic char. Even better with the brunch left-overs of same... hey you want to taste real Bavarian, try this in the AM with some extremely fresh Weisswurst and hot-from-the-oven Bretzeln. My Uncle considers Weizen a morning beer and this actually makes a little bit of sense....

500ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours the ideal looking Hefe, with a huge white head. Aroma: Yeasty to the max, what can I say, its a Hefe, think all the good characteristics of one. Flavour: See Aroma. Haha, well its a tad sweeter than some other Hefes Ive had, but in this case it helps balance the sour bite of the yeast. Malty, no hops whatsoever, plenty of citrus, nice spicy bite in the finish, a touch of clove. Not as much banana as I tend to like, but the key here for me is the moderate effervescence, because overly carbonated Hefes are just terrible (and almost killed me once). Ladys and gentlemen, for my 300th rating, I give you, Bavarian Wheat Beer. The first time a milestone rating has actually been anything decent for me. After a bad experience with too much Hefeweizen, I went through a period where it made me nauseous. This beer has changed that, and allowed me to enjoy the style again! Thank you Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan! (Ill expect a cheque in the mail for this promotion; I dont work for free you know).

I was a bit perplexed by this beer because although it is a German Hefe I thought it reminded me more a Belgium White beer because of the more complex taste and the hint of lemon in the aroma.  Regardless, this is an excellent beer that would satisfy me on most nights (except on a bitter winter evening).  Cheers.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2008 Bottled. import, 3 weeks old.
 Lovely clouded orange-gold with a massive meringue head, great retention, massive lacing.

Aroma: much like Schneider weissbier without the dried fruit tones ...this is the original hefeweiss yeast and we get juicy fruits, banana, clove,vanilla bean, a bit of bubblegum over some sweet doughy malts.
 
Dry character, moderate body,great peppery mouth feel,  a tad spritzy but not as pronounced as bottle conditioned wheats, great blend/balance of fruit-spice-dry toasty wheat....dry clean finish...wonderfully refreshing beer, very drinkable...cant wait to taste it unpasteurized on tap.

Better tasting  than Schneider, Paulaner, Hacker-P, Augustiner, Schöfferhofer,Andechser...and probably better than Ayinger when fresh...cummon you know it!

500 mL bottle.  (bb 04/03/09).  Cloudy yellow-brown with a decent white head.  Typical banana-clove aroma with a little citrus in there as well.  Lots of wheat and spice in the flavour, with some citrus up front, and a discernible but un-nameable (by me, anyhow) spiciness near the end that distinguishes it from othere hefes Ive tried.  Nicely carbonated, and a pleasant spicy, dry finish.  Great summer beer.

Hazy yellow-orange color. Quite big head is white and a bit soapy and cloudy. Aroma is wheaty malty, banana-like and yeasty. Flavor is well-balanced and quite mild: banana, yeast, . Light-bodied and slightly foamy carbonated palate.

Bottle. Hazy honey colour with a large white head. Bubblegum and yeast are at the forefront with citrus, spice, and very subtle hops lingering in the background. Well carbonated to the last sip, very light and airy feeling. A good, easy-drinking summer beer, but I was expecting more.

Århus2008. 50 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a lacing white head. Aroma is mild wheaty with a light yeasty note. Flavour is dry wheaty with a light phenol note and mild banana fruity yeast flavours. Ends mild fruity with a light dry wheat flavour lingering into the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2008 500 ml bottle - looks like thick, glowing creamed honey with a fluffy snow-white cap.  Aroma and flavours softly spicy and very full-bodied.  The perfect summer beer, and one Ill be buying lots of.  Other than Denisons Weiss, this is certainly the best Weiss Ive had, and surprisingly fresh too.  Absolutely fabulous.
On tap at Green Dragon in Portland, OR--Bright, hazy golden beer with a creamy thick white head.  Lots of yeasty esters.  This is the truth!  This beer put Bavaria on my map.
On tap at Brother Tuckers in Fl.  Wonderful beer.  Rich and yeasty with perfect balance and just a superb brew.  Chhers.
Good hefe with a nice aroma and a frothy head.  Has a hint of banana and lemon.
very nice weisbeer easy to drink smooth taste with a hint of yeast and lots of fruit
pours a hazy orange with a very long lasting head.  nose of sour orange.  fruity/vegital flavor.   not really that impressed, no complexity.  this isnt my favorite style so maybe thats the problem
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Fort Lauderdale, FL for $1.79 Very good.

This is one of the best German Hefes I have ever had. Pours a nice yellow color, lasting head. Wonderful aromas of banana and citrus. Flavors of banana, also vanilla. Recommend this to anyone looking for a refreshing beer.
user_location: Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey, USA

text: Bready, phenolic, slightly sour nose.  Beautiful slightly cloudy with big white head.  Wonderful straignt forward flavor dominated by CLOVE, clove and more CLOVE.  If you dont like clove, you wont like this bier... except that I dont like clove but love this bier... its that good.  Flavor lacks complexity, has a good wheat base.  Awesome mouthfeel, lively but not watery at all.  Overall an exceptional southern German wheat bier.  Excellent example of style.
Beautiful dusty colour. Soft round taste leaves a feeling of summer oin the cornfields. Best weissbier I ever tasted.
Dejlig hvedeøl, en af de føste jeg smagte for snart mange år siden. Købt i Bilka på 50cl flaske. Godt skum og god smag

16.9 oz bottle. Overall, this is a yeasty, wheaty and spicy (clove/coriander) hefe. I detected less banana and general sweetness than in others of the style. Love the creamy, low fizz texture. Nice, but maybe it would have been better if fresher, or an a hotter day.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2010 Pours a bright golden color with a huge, long-lasting, fluffy head. Aroma is light citrusy fruits, yeasty, with some malt. The beer looks good and also tastes good. The flavor is bananas, cloves, with some wheaty malts, perhaps a touch grassy, with some spices as well. Light and refreshing but a well-rounded hefe. If this isnt the best hefe Ive ever had its definitely close! Re-rate 4/16/09. Golden color, huge fluffy head, nice retention. Mostly same banana/clovey flavors, creamy and spices on the palate, light and refreshing. Not quite as good as initial review but damn good and one of the best hefes around.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2008 500 ml bottle. Poured into a weizen. Pours a cloudy straw color with a huge white head that dissipates quickly. Very nice looking in my weizen glass. A very light, refreshing treat that is heavy on the banana and clove character. Medium bodied. No bitterness present. Has a very clean finish. Best hefe that I have tried so far, but I like the weihenstephaner hefe dark a bit better. I have become a fan of this brewer. Update...Having another one of these and it[s even better than the last time. The ideal hefe.

500ml.  Pours hazy dark orange with a pillowy, lavish white head that never goes away.  The nose is possibly the only weak point of this beer, I get mostly straw and wet grass.  Body flavors include lemon rind, banana, grass, coconut.  Palate is easily the winner hear with a fine carbonation but palate coating viscosity that carries the finish on for quite some time.  A great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2009 On tap @ Bishops Arms, Karlstad, Sweden. First time I had it on tap, but it’s really good on bottle too. One my favourite Hefeweizens. Hazy pale amber color with a nice white head. Aroma is spicey with notes of citrus, banana, yeast and wheat. Flavour is pretty much the same. Lightly sweet, lightly acidic (in a good way). Banana, citrus, spices, yeast. Feels very refreshing in the mouth, quite much carbonation. Extremely drinkable!

Bella weizen di classe, tra quelle un po più facili da trovare al supermarket direi la migliore; unica nota di demerito sapore lievemente metallico però nel retrogusto sfuma decisamente. Ricca e gustosa ma allo stesso tempo molto godibile, dissetante e golosa. Bravo

Pours golden color with a thick, dense head. Aroma is very sweet, almost candy like. Taste is sweet, hoppy, citrucy, with some spices (?). Pretty good, just not really my thing. Probably wouldnt buy again.
Hazy yellow under fluffy white head, good lacing throughout.  Understated nose, and a full palate.  Peppery and sweet, with citrus following.  Really nice.
hazy golden appearance with strong white head.  flavor is of wheat malt with the classic bubble gum like flavor of a weizen.  a nice version but nothing exceptional

0.5 l bottle. Hazy golden color with thick creamy head. Strong clove aroma with apple, wheat and hint of banana. Grainy, wheaty, bready and strongly clovey flavor with some tart fruitiness and notes of apple. Oily palate. Not my favourite weizen, but fairly good.

Golden and hazy with a fine sized sustained head.  Wheaty, malty and yeast aroma. Initially sweet,spicey and yeasty, with a slight lemon flavour. Dry banana finish. Mediium to full body. A near perfect hefe.

A superb example of the style. Lovely deep hazy amber colour with a fantastic big rocky head thats lasting well down the glass,there is a good steady bead of bubbles. Aroma is the classic mix of fruit and spice, this is also found on the palate along with a touch of malty sweetness. The finish is long lasting and satisfying. A complex brew that delivers.

Pours a cloudy yellow-orange color with a moderate creamy white head.  A fair amount of lacing.  A moderate aroma of yeast, along with some banana sweetness and clove spice.  Flavor is sweet throughout with just a nice amount of spice.  Nice multidimensional flavor without being too complex.  Light and creamy mouthfeel.  Definitely one I would drink again.

Pours golden yellow only a little cloudy, you can still see through it. Large white head that lasts 4 minutes. aroma of wheat, yeast, and citrus. Flavor is medium wheat, yeast, and sweet water. Slightly fizzy mouthfeel. Clean finish. Pretty damn good, but a bit sweet, some wood tone, and empty fizz.
Gedronken bij buurman Jan Wemeijer. Lekker Witbiertje met een mooie schuimkraag.

A- Peachy orange in color with a massively fluffy, pillowy off white head.

S- Smells sweet and spicy with hints of banana, orange and citrusy fruits.

T- Very light on the palate but beautifully well balanced. A touch of sweet banana bread and other subdued fruit flavors. I like that the fruits are not overpowering in this beer, yet complement each other perfectly.

M- Mouth feel is very carbonated and light. I sometimes find certain hefeweizens leave a sticky undesirable coating in my mouth and are just too sweet which was not at all the case with this brew. Very refreshing.

D- One of the best wheat beers I have tried so far, intoxicatingly drinkable and very light.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden color with a large white head.  Aroma and flavor of spices (the spices are especially present when the beer is fresh...of the hefes that Ive had, it has the most spices).  Also your traditional hefe flavors of banana and some light fruits.  A good hefe, probably one of the best.

Pours a hazy orange with about two fingers of off-white rapidly dissipating head.  Heavy yeast tones in the odor, and I smell orange and pear.  Very watery mouthfeel, that goes into a general sweetness with a little taste of banana that drinks incredibly smooth.  Im not the biggest hefewizen guy, but this is probably the best Ive had.
A very delightful German Hefeweizen. A fruity aroma with some banana and yeast. Top of its class.
Could be a bit more crisp. Awesome though overall. Orange, Pear, Apple notes on the yeast. Poured a two finger foam glass. Picked up from my local supermarket. Great Heff!
I great Hefe. Smooth palate, a great flavor that sits so nicely in your mouth. Absolutely the best hefe Ive had.
Smagt 20/4 2008 hjemme. meget fin weissbeir,smagen er frisk af citrus og dejlig læskende.
A little too sweet for my liking, but an excellent Hefe - very creamy and thick, but still smooth.  There is definitely something of the banana about it, whatever that means.
A great Hefeweizen!  Nice banana flavor and aroma.  Pours a milky light bronze color.  Smooth finish and a treat on a hot summer day or evening!!

From the bottle, pours a hazy light orangish with a thick foamy white head.  Aroma is not overpowering, but has lightly distictive notes of banana and yeast, as would be expected.  Thicker than many heffies, smooth and malty without losing touch with the cloves, yeast, and light banana that the hefe is known for.  A fine beer.

Pours a hazy orange with a nice white head. Aroma of spices and banana. Taste is a crisp sweetness, which is refreshing and nice. Spicy taste in there more than in other German hefes. Light palate, but not watery like other beers in the type.

From a 0.5 L bottle purchased locally. Aroma is fruity, grainy and a little sweet. Color is pale golden, a little hazy, with a half inch white head. Flavors are grainy, and a little banana fruityness. Light, refreshing. Easy on the pallate, and just enough bitterness. Not as crisp as it should be. Probably starting to show a little age. Still a decent beer.

50cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Florida). Pours a slightly cloudy golden with a thin white head. Aroma: lemon, citrus, fruit with a hint of nuts. Flavor is wheaty, yeasty citrusy, with just a hint of hoppy bitterness on finish.

Bottle pours a very cloudy straw color with a decent clingy head.  The aroma is yeast, wheat, perhaps some clove/banana notes - not as much as I expected.  The flavor is clove, very slight banana, some lingering ale fruit characteristics, and spice like cardamom.  The palate is very refreshing and lively.  Overall, this rocks and it has been too long since Ive had a hefe!
Draft. Gorgeous honey with thick creamy white head. Spicy yeasty nose. Nice spicy fruit flavour. Damn nice.

What a massive head!  Honey colored and unfiltered.  Clove, wheat, and yeast are the nose.  Clove dominates the flavor but it is quite consistent with the aroma.  Some mild bitterness is a bit of a surprise and is also somewhat soapy.  Fruity esters show up mid glass (22 oz.)  I miss the banana and orange but this was a nice hefe and was also distinct.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2011 Lively golden/orange, glowing beer, with a foamy, well-sustained head - yeasty aroma, with notes of orange blossom honey, citrus, wildflowers, perfume/herbs, wheat, and a light nutty character - light yet creamy body - very subdued sweetness allows the herbal character and soft wheat notes to come through a lot more than in other hefes - yeasty, but not overly so, and the yeast combines with the grainy notes to give the beer a bready character, despite the fact that it remains light and refreshing throughout - very soft and subtle - phenolics come through just a bit, as do some light lemony notes, but herbs, flowers and wheat remain most prominent - this is an exceptional hefe, and one that I cant believe Ive taken so long to try.

Bottle. Pours a yellow-orange colour with a white head. Aroma is some perfumy yeasy, citrus, wheat and some herbs. Flavour is well-balanced and very mild wih some sweetness. Lots of wheat, some yeast, citrus and banana and a hint of malts. Very good indeed and presumably a perfect beer to go with lighter foods.
Dark yellow and hazy with a medium sized white head. Wheaty banana flavours.  Medium bodied, average carbonation. Quite a sweet finish. Pretty nice. - 500ml bottle.

this is one of THE classic hefe weissbiers out there (also try Schneiderweisse). Delicious fruity, citrus aroma. Substantial, yeasty head and dingy orange color. Hefty mouthfeel. crisp follow-up from the carbonation. later swallows leave it mellow but still complex due to the wheat. It balances a variety of foods. Especially simple Chinese dishes.

Santa cerveja. Cremosa e intensa. Sabor marcante, com toques de banana, cereais e frutas cítricas. Ainda bem que já chegou ao Brasil e está com preço bom. O problema de quem bebe uma Weihenstephaner é que nunca mais vai beber uma Skol.

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, one of the best hefeweizens Ive had.  Not being a fan of hefeweizens, this was interesting with flavors of vanilla and light citrus.

Pours a cloudy golden with a thick frothy white head, yeasty aroma has notes of coriander, vanilla, and banana. Tastes of wheat and banana with a bit of citrus and clove; crisp slightly seet finish. Great creamy mouthfeel. This is an excellent beer; Im sure Ill be stocking up on this for the summer.
Orangish in color with a big foamy white head.  Aromas of clove and a lot of bananas.  Taste is banana with wheat.  Very refreshing in the taste.

On Tap. Pours a deep cloudy amber with one the nicest heads Ive ever seen on a beer. The aroma slight citrus and banana with some subtle floral notes. The flavor is superb. Clean, dry citrus, banana, a sweet yet refreshing floral component, nice wheat/malt backbone to support it all. The palate is equally excellent, on the thick and creamy side for a hefe, but with just enough carbonation to keep the beer truly refreshing.  This is a really great beer. Go drink one now.
cloudy pour,big huge white head.the aroma is yeast ,banana taste is yeast,and major banana,with wheat backbone.this is a textbook german hefe.or beer geek lawn mowing beer

UPDATED: APR 29, 2008 Bottle pours a cloudy golden color with a foamy white head.  Aroma of yeast, banana, and spices.  Taste is floral, fruity,  with lots of wheat.  Decent carbonation from the yeast.

Crazy head. Aroma: Some citrus, a little bit of banana, and floral spice aspect. Yeast gives it a little kick. Taste: Starts pretty bland, then an earthy, floral taste comes in. Finish falls flat and dirty. Palate: This is surprisingly, very watery and thin.

Nice, fresh scent with a touch of banana and citrus. Has a great, bright yellow-orange hazy look, as I think a wheat beer should. White fully head, but doesnt result in any real lacing. Taste is classic hefe, with a crisp, citrusy taste. Slight bitter aftertaste, but clean. Good example of this style, but at the same time theres nothing substantially unique about it.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2008 ...bottle.Great overall, one of the best out there.  Flavor is there with the cloves and slight, not overpowering banana.  Citrus notes are there, nice pillowy white head with great lacing. Hints of candied sugar, sweet malt, and yeast leave you ready for another, one of my all-time favs.

Draught:  Aroma of spices, coriander, and banana.  Poured gold in color with a small white head that diminished quickly.  Very hazy; almost opaque.  Lightly sweet flavor.  Tastes of bubblegum, coriander, heavy spices, and mashed potatoes.  Medium body.  Thin texture.  Average carbonation.  Spiced finish.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2008 This is the standard by which all other wheat beers should be judged.  The aroma is a perfect blend of banana and clove.  The yeast sediment is perfect for the roll and pour.  No finer Wheat beer in the world.

Been looking to try this one for a while...pours a orangey-golden with an intense head typical of a Hefe. Aroma is very wheaty, citrusy (banana), with good levels of spice (mostly clove, some coriander).  Flavor is best described as clean...and this is a beautiful Hefe!  Very sweet with banana, a fairly healthy amount of bubble gum, a bit of tartness, lots of wheat, lemon, and definitely some good spice, mainly clove.  Slightly more oily on the palate than most Hefes Ive had in the past.  Could drink these all the time, summer or winter!  Theres a reason this is such a highly rated Hefe.  If this were renamed Weihenstephaner Barrel Aged Hefe Weissbier, this would be a top 50 brew!
Pours a light cloudy yellow with a fizzy head. Aroma is mostly funk. Tastes of citrus, sour tart, wheat. Finishes with a sharp lemon taste on the palate. Carbonation is solid.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with thick, bubbly head. Aroma is rising dough, graininess. Flavor is lightly sweet, fluffy bread, mild bubblegum, allspice, earthy notes. Very light bitterness in the finish. Palate is full, creamy, lively with carbonation.

Orange /yellow pour,large bubbly head,good carbonation,head settling down but will last well.Aroma rich wheat a toffee note or brown sugar,malted barley sweetness.Flavour very sweat wheat,sure it,s coriander in there,mellow orange a bubbly sensation on the tongue(on the palate).Finish has the sensation,bubbly sweet,dry.A different wheat drink from them in a way,very pleasant.

The only disappointment i had with this brew was it was too thin and light on the palate. Poured a nice hazy amber hue with a frothy white head which faded to a thin coating.  Aroma was very fruity banana notes some spice too it.Flavor was mostly sweet but had some nice bread like notes throughout.
Bottle. Fresh aroma of citrus and banana. Hazy light gold with huge head. Mild taste of banana and a lot of wheat. Too carbonated for me. Was hoping for more taste - I prefer the Kristal tbh
Pours a pale golden color with a huge white foamy head. Aroma of citrus,banana and yeast. Taste of banana and cloves. I guess it would be a nice summer brew.

Pours cloudy orange with a hige frothy head.  Aroma of banana, citrus, grass, and yeast. Smooth flavor with a pungent finish.  Honestly, not quite as much flavor as I was hoping for.   Ive had this before and have found it to be tastier.  I bought the bottle at a store thats not a "beer" store, so this might have been sitting on the shelf for a while.  Will re-rate with another bottle.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2008 Bottle: Poured a deep amber color weisse with a big foamy head with medium retention and no lacing. Aroma of banana and cloves is quite present. Taste is a mix between some banana and cloves ester and some sweet malt. Body is full with loads of lees and minimal filtration and some good carbonation. Not exactly what I was expecting and a bit darker then expected on the appearance side. It is too bad the bottles are not dated since I believe this may have been an older bottle. I will be adding this one to the need to re-rate list.

Rerate June 2008: A lot less sediment then last time with a more pronounced aroma of banana and cloves. Very well done.

Bottle. Huge creamy head. Light gold. Cloudy. Floral aroma with citrus, malt and a bit of musty cellar. Sweet taste; clove and orange prominent. Slight banana note and bubble gum in lingering aftertaste. Mouthfeel is full with zesty foaming. Delicious!

Bottle. Great example of a classic Hefe. 
Great summer beer. Nothing bad to say about this one.
Smelled like ketchup and tasted like onion rings. Very unusual brew, with a sour-sweet taste not unlike a saison. Not a particular fan, but props for uniqueness.

Bottle, split with after4ever. Pours cloudy gold with a lacy white head. Just a bit of banana and soft cloves in the aroma. Medium body and light carbonation. The taste picks up the same notes as the nose. Id like to try one of these badboys on tap.
Bottle. Not crazy about the way hefeweisse beer looks, love the way it smells and tastes. Cloudy, yellow color. Smells of cloves and slight fruit. Tastes of spice and fruit. Best hefeweisse their is.
Golden with a slight haze.  Aroma is wheaty and citrusy with slight clove. Nice raich wheat flavour with a nice cloy sweetness with crisp finish.

The king of german weissbiers, enjoyed along with a creamy soup, to which it was a perfect match! Extra soft and round plate and flavor, along with classic notes of banana and wheat, i think i still prefer the paulaner, but i have to match then some day.

Draft @ BSP.  Pours a lovely, respectably cloudy sunset orange with massive billowing head. Nose is peppery and clove-like, with a bready yeast bite, and minimal lemony tartness.  Very full on the palate, with wheaty malts in balance with slight citric tartness and a hay, barnyard hop character.  Finishes smooth and crisp, with hardly any bitterness.  An effortlessly drinkable hefeweissbier, pretty much the standard in my opinion.
Golden and cloudy with a good sized white head. Aroma is citrus and banana with spices. Flavor is clove and banana. Great example of a Weissbier.

pours a dark cloudy neon yellow with a huge four finger fluffy off white head. aroma is banana, clove, and lemon. has a medium body with good lacing and carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma but stronger. it is a touch over carbonated but creamy at the same time. very nice.

This is definitely one of the better Weissbiers that I have had.  You can tell that there is a long history behind this one.  Flavor includes hints of citrus and banana, color is golden orange; appearance is cloudy, head is frothy with white foam; medium bitterness, full body, taste is creamy, carbonation is fizzy, with a nice long finish.
A very good hefeweizen, though not as citrusy as the Franziskaner.  Very clean and srisp in body and wasily an all day drinker

Bottle: Yellow hasy colour, witth a nice creamy head. Aroma of banana,citrus, fruity,flowery and a nice spicy nose in the end. Flavor is almost the same here,thin to medium body, nice medium long dry finish

500 mL bottle at Flat Rock Saloon.  Drank this many a time...never rated apparently.  Poured hazy orange with thick white head.  Banana esters dominate the nose.  Flavor is sweet with bananas and coriander with a dry finish.  Very solid hefe.
Bottle-Munich.  My first Hefe love.  Poured a brilliant couldy orange and had the strong banana, clove nose.  Perfect sweetness and left me craving more.  This was the beer that got me into sampling!

Rated:18.12.2008
Bottle brown 500 ml
Very deep, intensive and lively colour as for a HefeWeizen denoting a good brew. Aroma is fully expressed and pronounced. Carbonation is strong and intensive, there is a great ammount of vivid bubbles forming dense rocky snowy white head. Flavour has all you expect from one of the best weizen. It is just typicall and proper, very grainy, wheaty and barley flavoured too. There is no extra strange flavour typical for some odd Hefeweizens. Only those recognized and some banana. Its not that yeasty as Paulaner, not clementine like as Erdinger but just proper and on a very high level.

poured from a 500mL bottle into a tall tulip weiss glass (consumed: 2/14/08)

A: Pours a gorgeous hazy, tawny, gold, with a huge rocky white head, which in turn seems to last forever & a day. I think I could take a nap on this beers head. Throughout the beer, it leaves behind huge chunks of lacing that remind me of the Archipelegos.

S: Yeast is right there in your face, lots of cloves, bubblegum and a slight tart lemony scent are all present too. Some nice fresh-baked bread brings it all together, this is an amazing smelling beer.

T/M: Sweetness hits the tip of the tongue immediately, but not cloyingly so. Followed by a very creamy, almost buttery body and some nice citric bite. Loads of bready malt & cereal grain flavors combine with the tanginess of the wheat and lead to a enjoyably astringent finish. A delicious beer that often winds up being gulped and not sipped.

D: One of the all-time greats, probably THE wheat beer that all others are measured against. One of the most drinkable beers around.

Im not a great fan of hefeweizen, but his beer truly surprised me!  Notes of banana and spice made this a delight for the palate.  Definitely not a one dimensional beer as has been my experience with so many other hefeweizens.

500. Pours a gorgeous cloudy medium buttery amber with a towering fluffy platinum blonde head. Intermittent starry lacing persists, along with a little dab of head. Mild banana nose. Medium body with soft carb. You can pick up cloves in there...mostly because you know theyre appropriate to the style. The flavor here is pretty battered from all its time in transit and the rigors of the journey.

A very bavarian and bananian taste indeed. However, one of the finest weissbiers that I have had a privilege to taste. Pours hazy and golden with a huge foamy head. Taste is malty, sweet, aromatic and citrusy. Hail to the Germans.
cloudy orange yellow pour flavors of bananas and yeast with a slight after taste of spices but over all very tasty nice beer

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2010 [2.14.08] Hello bananas! Huge banana aroma when you open the bottle.  Smells the most like actual bananas that Ive come across.  Lots of dusty yeast in the aroma too.  Not very hazy pour, kinda like a golden pilsner with a giant creamy froth white head.  Definite sour grassiness with fruity, dried banana, and yeast notes.  Find it really similar to the Paulaner hefe.  Sweet and sour banana  & spice aftertaste.  Filling body, despite the lively carbonation it feels a little flat and disconnected.  There are many smoother hefes out there.  Definitely not the end-all be-all of hefes.  8.3.7.3.13 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .[rerate 3.1.10] Meaty hefe yeast aroma, med sweet, nutty, lightly floral.  Flavor follows, a bit watery, med sweet, ripe banana, lots of nutty meaty yeast (bottle wasnt totally settled). 7.4.7.3.13.
coriander, cloves on nosing. thick head with good lacing, on 2nd pass bananna comes through. coriander/clove/ a little gum. very clean from start to finish with long clean wheat finish. damn good!!

Bottle:  Pours a pale orange/yellow with a pillow-like white head.  Aroma is amazing with some banana, orange peel, wheat, and nutmeg notes coming through.    Medium bodied mouth feel.  Spiced-up citrus wheat flavors pound the taste buds and not one time do they yield.  Ive definitely garnered a newfound appreciation for this style.  Very good.

Aroma is yeasty with esters of banana and coriander.  Color is a hazy orange yellow with very good carbonation and a big thick head.  Taste is light and fruity.  Starting with medium body it goes down with a crisp feel.  Finish comes on with a fruity yeast flavor and a mellow citrus taste then ends with a faint banana and coriander flavor and a gentle bitterness.  After taste is clean with the citrus taste riding out the longest.  This is one of the best Hefeweizens I nave ever had.

Bottle 0.5 l. Cloudy yellow, big white head. Nose is yeasty, a bit sour and wheaty. Flavor has wheat, yeast, some spiciness and sour acidity. Maybe a bit of citrus peel. Not much sweetness. Not as good as I wouldve hoped, too sour.
Poured to a golden beer with aromas of yeast and wheat. The palate was exceptionally smooth and had a good yeast and spicy flavor. Good beer.
Bottle: Pours yellow with a huge head.  Aromam of yeast and other spices.  One of the best hefeweizens that I have ever had.  Very good.
pours a cloudy light peach color with a creamy white head.  Has a sweet banana aroma with a yeasty presence.  light sweet malt and banana flavor with a hint of spice.  Very good overall.

This beer pours a cloudy yellow with a large white head.  WOW!  Take one whiff and the aromas just overtake you!  Bananas, cloves, all the things you expect from a true german hefe!  Then you take a sip and enjoy all those wonderful things that make the german hefe such a great beer!   The flavors of course emulate the aroma, bananas, cloves, etc...  this is one well crafted beer and is an exemplary testimony of what a german hefeweizen should be!  Cheers!

Pours a cloudy gold with a big white head.  Fantastic aroma of yeast and banana, with hints of clove and hops.  Slightly sweet and citrusy flavor, with the banana showing up again.  A nice medium palate rounds out this deicious hefe.

Served comfortably chilled from a 500ml bottle. Hazy, orange body with a thin, white head. Spicy aroma of cloves and some sweet fruits. Sweet, late banana flavour mixed with citrus fruits that help to counter some of the sweetness. Wheaty and spicy aftertones. Foamy mouthfeel. Well balanced weizen (Linköping, 26.01.2008).

Heres a beautiful golden looker, with a wonderfully suspended cloudiness throughout, just below its modest head.  The taste is a little too subtle to make it a favorite of mine, perhaps a little more citrus is what Im looking for.

The first beer to be poured into my brand new Franziskaner weizen glass. 3 fingers of head form instantaneously and I have to be cautious with the rest of the pour to maintain that amount of suds. The white foam lays atop a gorgeous, hazy organic unfiltered apple juice-colored body. OK lacing, good retention. 

The definitive weizen aroma: bananas and cloves. Very appetizing on this hot night. 

This beer is extremely mellow. Every flavor blends immaculately with the next. Soft banana and clove flavors meet honey, lemongrass, very subtle hops, a faint hint of pear skin, a bubblegummy note, cereal grains. Deeper than your average hefe. 

This beer has a nice crisp finish despite the cloudiness. Great balance, ample carbonation, mellow and sweet flavors, and low alcohol make for an insanely drinkable beer. Nice and refreshing. On a hot day I could easily imagine 3-4 of these disappearing.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2008 Bottle. Cloudy, hazy orange color with a fluffy white head. Aroma: Sweet and spicy with notes of cloves, mango, banana and yeast. Flavor: Sweet and spicy, banana, mango, cloves, yeast, and light lemon. Strong carbonation.

bottle.....pours a hazy golden orange with a moderate white to off-white head....bananas,wheat, and cloves make up most of the nose. a pervading sweetness all around.....a consistent flavor profile soon followed.  sweet and pretty well-carbonated with some spices thrown into the mix....im not a huge hefe fan but this one would be one i would drink again.  but overall, new glarus dancin man wheat is still my fave.

Thank you ilovedarkbeer for this. Very good for an exported Hefeweizen. Aroma is sweet wheat, banana, a little citrus, smoke, appricot and honey.  Pours with a huge creamy white head that lasts pretty well. Color is a hazy yellow with a little orange. Flavor is a bit weak and neautral, but not unpleasant.

Tried this after the dunkel hefe.  I prefer the dunkel, but this is more widely available and a close second in my opinion.  Very nice sweet aroma.  Lots of carbonation that stays with the beer very well.  Taste is a nice mixture of sweetness and spice.  Mouthfeel is great, it hugs my tounge.
Nice yeasty aroma, i smell wheat and banana notes. Unfiltered yellow with a white head. Well carbonated, well balanced beer. One of my favorite wheats.
Bottle. Pours rich yellow with a nice white, long lasting head. Aroma is noticeable bananna. Flavor is spicy and nice. A light refreshing beer.

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass. Had a cloudy amber appearance with a quarter inch head. Slightly trace of fruit in the aroma, with wheat creeping in. Has a subtlely complex taste, with plenty of spices to keep you interested. Fair amount of carbonation. This is an excellent example of a hefeweizen and very drinkable.

Pour is a golden with a decent head and a good amount of carbonation.  Aroma of cloves, spice, and bananas.  Taste is nice, more complex than most hefeweizens.  Mouthfeel is light, with plenty of carbonation.  Overall a nice German brew.

Sometimes Germans just know how to brew a great beer and this is one of them.    Banana yeast nose, rigid foamy head, and soft golden body make this a well done, session-able, thirst quenching German Hefe-licious beer.

It may be the oldest, and possibly the best from Bavaria, but the bottle I got stateside may have been old.  It seemed to lack the expected levels of banana and cloves that I am used to.  I would like to re-rate this when I have one on tap in Germany.

This is one of my favorites.  A truly classic representation of the style.  Extremely well balanced, and food friendly.  Wonderful acidity, loads of cereal grain flavors, with a bit of chalkiness, lemons, bananas and cloves.  Consistent from bottle to bottle.
Pours honey yellow with a thick, creamy head. Citrus aroma; flavor has grape, citrus and nutmeg notes. Very effervescent. Overall a good Hefe.

16.9 oz bottle-A hazy yellow with a somewhat small head for a hefe and an aroma of cloves,  banana, yeast and wheat. Taste of the same with some cloves. I feel this as being one of the lighter hefes but still very tasty.

Pours a hazy yellow-brown with a big white head.  Aroma is a nice spicy bannana and bubble gum.  Taste is nice as well, with the same flavors coming through as well as some clove all while being extremely smooth.  Very good.
Creamy banana and sugar without being overbearingly fruity.  Delicious, highly recommended.

02/01 0,5 l draught at Biergarten in Mariazell. Had murky golden body with bigger, creamy, long living head. Wonderful weizen aroma, fruity with banana, orange, some spices and bit of honey. Flavor was sweetish, fruity, but very empty bodied. Occasionally it also was ruined by minor unpleasant vegetable notes. Short and again watery finish, erasing nice aroma quickly. Not bad as it may sound, but missing so much character. I was specially surprised here when saw it is best European Hefeweizen. May rerate it from the bottle some time, although I doubt this was in bad condition.
Pours a hazy light golden color with a rather large head. Aroma of banana, bread, and a little clove. Seems a little dry, but still very good.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow/golden colour with creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, sweet. Flavour of banana and fruit.

A huge creamy, white head sticks to the sides of the glass on this one.  A bread and banana with lots of yeast dominate the aroma and flavor profile.  
Not a huge fan of wheat beers in general, but this is solid, if understated.

Pours out a hazy gold with a creamy white head that disipates quickly. Muted nose of lemon grass, honey dew, banana and clove.  The flavour is mostly standard banana and clove with biscuity, wheaty flavours and some lemon zest. Thin bodied, but slightly creamy, effervescent mouthfeel.

Pours a hazy golden with a big frothy white head that dies quick. Big melon, banana in the nose with a minor clove afterthought. Tastes all compliment eachother well. Everything in the nose dances on the palate. Medium and crisp in the mouth. So drinkable its not funny.
The bottle looks simple but good. The beer is too dry for a hefeweizen and too less fruity. I exspected more.

Wow.  Poured a yellow, cloudy color with a huge white head that lasted throughout the drinking.  Aroma was rather sweet.  It was a wonderfully clean and dry drink with a nice presence of cloves.  Definitely my favorite hefe to date.

Very pleasantly surprised by this. In my early beer geek days this is definitely the best wheat beer Ive had. Lots of flavour. The kind of drink Willy Wonka and Oompa Loompas make. Ive been turned off by some of the popular dish water Ive tried. Not shit loaded with fruit, which is a good thing unless you like to drink out of a tarts handbag. Oldest brewery in the world, since 1040 it says on the bottle. I opened it at 10.40, near the time and I waited just to be a geeky little twat. He he he. Ooh yeah, I like this. Won me respect for wheat beer. Until I try better this is like Pauli in Goodfellas, got to show respect but you know hell see you right in the end. Cheers.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2008 Bottled 50cl. It pours a hazy orange beer with a beautiful big white head. Vanilla and wheat in the nose. Bubblegum and strawberries showing up too. Vanilla, banana, lemon and spices in the taste. Some lemon sneaking in, giving a good balance. Wonderfully smooth and creamy. Surprisingly light bodied and rather sour. The finish is dry, smoky with hints of oranges. Refreshing, delicate and complex. A great beer. Additional comment: The taste: Extremely pleasant. Peppery, smoky components which are accompanied by a lot of banana. A hint of mint. Excellent
Excellent hefe-weizen and a very different taste on tap from the bottle. This beer is a highly recommended hefe!

Pours a cloudy golden yellow/ orange color with huge foamy white head.  Aroma of yeast, orange and lemon.  Very smooth drinkable beer with a nice citurs flavor.  Pretty highly carbonated with hints of lemon and orange peel.  Very crisp with a slight sour aftertaste.

This came to me in a huge 1 liter glass stein, which displayed its great cloudy yellow-cream color. It was lightly fragrant with the wheat, banana, and vanilla aromas coming forward. The fist taste was like the last with a refreshing medium to light bodied ale that tasted like the aromas.
This was a very good beer I could have anytime.
Pours a light gold with a fluffy white head. Nice hefeweizen aroma with light citus and wheat. Taste is very crisp and clean. Fiinsh a little dy.
A definite step up from the Original Bayrisch Mild.  A very good Hefe, as it should be since theyve been making it for ages.

Typical and average hefe all around. That really sums up my opinions on this beer.  
I know Im in the minority here.  
Maybe its just me, but almost all good hefes taste the exact same. Sure this one was slightly better than most, but still almost the exact same.

This Hefe Weizen tasted hoppy not sweet, which is what I like, because I usually drink Pilsners. A nice orange-yellow color with a big frothy head, which lasted. Highly carbonated. A great thirst quencher. I paid $7.99 for a 6 pack. So dollar for dollar, you cant beat this Wheat Ale. Highly recommended.

50cl bottle at De Baiard, Amsterdam, 12-2-07.   Cloudy gold-brown with a thick, sustained head.   Powerful banana/clove aroma of a good hefe.   The flavor is clean and dryer than others Ive had, and has the accompanying wheat phenols in a refreshing and crisp package.   The best weissbier Ive had yet.

My favorite beer.  So rich and complex. I always feel like there are new flavors hiding in every glass of it.  This is the template for a perfect wheat beer as it does not overpower you with the fruit or spices but rather balances them with a wheat taste going down and hops taste afterward.

Botle. Pours very hazy yellow. Medium white head, lasts a bit. Smells of bread, spice, the vaguest hint of banana.
Tastes of citrus, wheat, spice, with hops bitterness coming in at the end. Theyve been brewing for nearly 1000 years, seems they know what they are doing.

Draught at Freaking Frog, Las Vegas, 6% ABVCloudy deep blond color; creamy head. Nice aroma, balanced, with wheat, light spices, very light banana and cookies. Medium body, some sweetness, some spices, wheat; ending quite dry, and with a strong bitterness. Quite good.

bottle 50 cl. Pours a cloudy yellow/golden with a big but very fast-fading white head. The initial taste isnt even the best of this beer. There is citrus, grass and some banana. But then the long hoppy aftertaste comes in! Really, really good!

A hazed golden orange pour with a thick gooey lacing. Very nice spiced aroma. A fuity flavor with hints of clovve and a lot of bannana. Carbonation is ok but it was a bit fizzy. Palate was solid. A very good offering for the style has alot of the characteristics needed for the style.

Pours a hazy golden with a thick white head. Aroma is of sweet clove, wheat malt and light, fresh fruit. Taste is exquisitely pointed, refined and crisp. After drinking so many American incarnations of the style, its lovely to try the granddaddy from which they all have descended. Sweet banana taste balanced by clove. Has a distinctly German feel to it. Great beer.
Along with Denisons the best Hefe out there. Enjoyed first @ Gollem in Amsterdam & again @ Ellicottville Beer Festival. Creamy cloudy clovey. Delicious

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2008 Arguably a benchmark for Hefeweizen, this is incredible and perfectly exemplifies the traits of this style.  It is hazy gold with a huge, dense, thick white head that lasts forever.  The aroma is honey and pears.  The palate lively.  The taste is crisp, sweet before leaving a dryish but smooth finish, it tastes of wheat and biscuit with vague fruit and transforms to the paradigmatic bubble gum finish, being an almost minty, bitter, old-fashioned bubble-gum flavour like Dubble Bubble.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2011 Drunk from its intended glass just accentuates it so much more...so light and floral. a great hefe. Lots of banana and clove. Very light, but the body gives just enough to leave an impression. A true delight and one of the world classics.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2008 I bought four of the Weihenstephaner beers and saved this one for last because I am a Hefe Weiss lover. So here I go. Pores a typical Hefe cloudy amber with a huge frothy head that just wont yield. Typical sweet malt and citrus aroma. Excellent palate with just a little tartness on the finish. Well its no Franziskaner but all in all a refreshing wheat beer.

Its difficult for me to comment and or rate this beer becuase it is so good i cant really explain the intenseness that comes for siting and enjoying it. Um again the scores i rated here are as close as i can come to representing my opinion of this beer without giving it the medal of honor even tho im damn close. 
I wont get into all the fancy terms every1 else uses but if u havent drank this beer, do it if u come across one. Maybe i will come across a beer better someday but for now its pretty high on the list. Drink from a GLASS!!   :)
Great hefeweizen. Lovely color and taste. Much better experience than the one i had with Hacker-Pschorr. Very drinkable. I had mine with a batch of steamed crabs.
Bottle @ Le Coq au Vin. Good hefeweizen, enjoyed it with a cassoulet. Nice head, aromatic.

Purchased just a single bottle.  It poured a nice semi-cloudy yellow, with a nice sized head.  The aromas were good, strong banana, clove, and wheat.  The flavors are the same with a hint of vanilla.  I didnt like the fact that it was a little thin for my likings, so the mouthfeel was off just a bit.  Also, the nasty black yeast that dropped out of the bottom didnt help my rating at the end.

(nottle) Pours hazy golden with a large white head.  Aroma is quite nice with some banana, clove, and a nice dose of yeast.  Taste is where the beer falters a bit, with slight, very slight sweetness of banana, with the rest being clove, and a finish of yeast quite similar to that of mineral water.  Medium body, not too bad of a hefe.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2007 [Bottle, thanks Guerde] Pours hazy golden with a big off-white head that lasts forever.  Aroma is very nice with the typical hefe aromas of banana and cloves.  Taste is the same but a little disappointing in that it is quite subdued.  This is not helped by the medium-thin mouthfeel and average-at-best finish.  Still though, this is definitely drinkable.

Definitely the best hefeweissen I have had so far. It looks more like honey than beer, being a rich, almost opaque, slightly orange golden color. Aroma is strong and wheaty, with a strong citrus overtone - but the latter may have come from the obligatory lemon wedge. Flavor is rich, typical of a wheat beer but mouth-filling - no "thin" feeling whatsoever. I got a strong hint of citrus, but again this may have been due to the lemon wedge in the beer. Light, smooth and tingly, this beer is a winner. No wonder they have been in business for almost a millennium!
chiara buona schiuma aderente persistente mediamente fine aromi speziati lieve agrume piccola nota di banana leggermente acidula

Bottle, 500ml. A densely cloudy golden colour with a large frothy head. Aroma is peach, orange, banana, yeast/bread and spice (clove?). Taste is wheat, banana, spice (star anise, clove) and a touch of malt. Somewhat watery. High carbonation. Enjoyable, but Ive had better.

From bottle, and hefe glass.  Delicious aroma, banana spice flavors and aroma.  Ideally drink from a large 20 oz. hefe glass so that you can enjoy the aromatics as you drink this one down.  Earthy, musty, banana, fruit, sweet, bubbly.  Mouthfull after mouthfull of goodness.  Thoroughly enjoyable down to the very last swig.  You will head directly to the refrigerator to crack open another one, even though you know you shouldnt, not tonight, on a worknight.  But its so tasty you cant resist.
A fantastically drinkable and smooth German beer. I cant wait to have another one to give it a proper rating....hold tight

Im giving this a pretty high rating, but then Im a fan of a really good hefe, and there are so many that let me down.  This one does not let me down, and in fact it may be the best Ive had to date.  Very nice clove and banana flavors that come out strong.  Truly impressive.

Pours a golden colour hazy with a small white cap. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat and hints of spice. Initial taste is wheaty with an overlay of a spicy banana. Finishing light and crisp. Palate duration is decent, and slight lacing of the glass. Enjoyable hefe.

16 oz bottle.  Pours hazy orange with light carbonation and a big head.  Banana, clove and cinnamon are predominant but I swear I smell some pear in there.  Light flavor than the aroma would suggest.  Hints of banana and clove and again, vaguely of cinnamon.  Very light flavor with high carbonation level and light/medium body.  Fair.
Bottle.  Hazy dark yellow color with a disipating head.  Aroma is of wheat and citrus.  Flavor is wheaty and citrus with hint of banana.  Smooth and very drinkable... great summer brew.
Your typical German hefe. Nice and fruity. Banana. Cloves. This is what you want. This is what many American hefes dont do. Why?

Pours a lager like yellow beer. Produces a lively head. Notes of wheat  yeast, pine and banana. Body is light but soft. Taste is of wheat and yeast. Some sweetness with a crisp dry finish. A quality hefeweizen.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy strawlike colour, with huge white head. Aroma is banana / spice / wheat / citrusy. Taste is banana / cloves / wheat / lemon. This beer looks great and tastes even better

Bottle.
Cloudy hay colored brew.  The aroma is of banana and spices.  The sweetness along with that banana yeasty flavor impart something that is unlike any other type of beer.  Very refreshing and thus drinkable.  This brew is light but also liquid bread a the same time.  This is probably due to the carbonation which keeps this one from being too heavy.  One of my favorite Hefeweizen from Deutschland.
Bottle. Great color and aroma, scents of citrus. Lasting off white head. Strong citrus and lemon flavors. A tad harsh on the palate at first but a good finish. Worth trying.

For all of you who have never tried Weihenstephan, I encourage you to go out and have one. Like many other German Weizenbier, its very different from Belgian witbeer. It has a much fuller and smoother flavor. It has a wonderful cloudy appearance when poured into the typical tall half liter glasses and will charm you with its herbal and yeasty fragrance.

For availability in Amsterdam check <a href="http://www.dutchgrub.com/">www.

Pours a cloudy straw gold with a big white head. Nose is balanced yeast and citrus and the typical characteristic nose. Flavor is actually a bit lighter than I would have suspected. Still gives a nice full and even bodied hefe experience. Standard characteristics, but smooth and well done. Feel is smooth on the liquid and light on the bubble. Definitely drinkable. An easily sessionable brew, though me personally - I like mine with a bigger flavor.
Flaske. Virkelig flot hvedeøl. uklar rødlig gul farve med et kæmpe skum på. Klassiske banantoner og lilje toner. Dejlig øl, men kun en enkelt tak.

First impression before tasting... great looking beer after being poured into a Weizen... HUGE, textured, long-lasting white head with a yellowy-golden, cloudy body.  Big yeasty aroma and full herbal/yeast taste with a nice citrus overtone.

12 oz. bottle.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 Thick rich head poured into a weizen glass. Yeast flavored with pleasant floral and light breezy herbal tones. Chewy full texture. Great weissbeer with a salmon and salad. Very snappy and more refreshing than a Schneider Weiss for me. This is a great beer with a wide variety of foods and among the finest German Hefeweizens Ive sampled.

Bottle from Sainsburys, Heyford Hill, Oxford, 21-09-07   Really nice cloudy wheat beer with great aroma of banana, clove yeast. Tasted clovey, bananaey, wheaty, yeasty and some lovely citrus, in fact packed with flavour, just what I would expect in this type of beer if done well. Im not a fan of this style but I think I can appreciate a good one and this for me was very good.

One of the better wheat beers.  Good citrusy (lemony) taste along with the sweet taste. decent carbonation.  creamy yet dry.  A little more complex than other wheats.  had a little bit of off aftertaste- like rubber that took away from the initial great taste. 
****  9/1/07 Have had again and rubbery taste was gone.  mustve been bad batch.  great wheat.

500 ml bottle from Sams Wine and Spirits.  Poured in the traditional method, spinning the bottle and tossing in the last of the yeast.  Cloudy yellow banana clove yeast right off the nose.  Decent mouthfeel bananas, lemon, wheat.  .. although nothing that sets it apart from the many others not that different.  .. balanced tasty and refreshing.
Vastly underrated weiss - yeasty, cloudy, and just the right touch of that Bavarian clove style spice.  Very balanced, very clean hefty foam and everything you want in a Bavarian weiss.

Name: Hefeweiss
Date: 01/01/1994
Mode: Bottle
Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta

bubblegum aroma, slightlg fruity malt flavor, wheat character
-------- />
Name: Hefeweiss
Date: 06/12/2003

nice banana aroma and flavor
-------- />
Name: Hefeweiss
Date: 06/08/2005

nice big body, good rich flavor

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.1/5.0Score: **+/4
-------- />
The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Great Hefe. Pours a nice ornage golden color with a big white fluffy head. The head dissapates quickly into a soapy top. Smells sour and wheaty. Tastes like fresh bread with a bit of meat? Either way really good.

16.9 oz bottle.  Foggy olive orange with a white meringue head.  Wet lace.  Dough, candied lemon peel and green banana.  Tangy carb with a smooth, rounded mouthfeel.  Almost like they added some banana puree.  Taste echoes the nose with cloves.  Ends a little sour and wheaty.
Draft @ Marlow and Sons in Brooklyn.  Pours orange with a thin bright white head.  The nose is fresh and wheaty.  The taste is sweet and wheaty, its a nice hef.
Its good! cloudy wheat beer with lots of taste and fragrance. had it many time, would have it again and again. germans know how to make their beers.

Bottled. Consumed while watching Beerfest, thought it was appropriate. Pours a brilliant shade of orange, cloudy and full of life from the cabonation. Huge, over two finger thick white head sits atop the beer, and refuses to leave. Yeast, banana, oranges, sweet malts and hops combine to form a brilliant bouquet of aromas. Flavor is a bit of a letdown compared to the aroma, its a bit watery. This bottle has been in my fridge for going on 6 months now, and who knows how long it was on the shelf before that, so I wont knock it too much until I confirm with a fresh sample. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied. Finish is sweet malts, yeast and fruit, medium length and satisfying. Nice, but I prefer the Franziskaner version by a good bit.
Hazy golden with a high white head. Fruity banana tones. Some fruit and hops in the  taste. Medium body with aslightly sweet finish. High carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2007 First time I had had this it was out of the tap at little pub right smack dab on the Rhine River in Germany - and I thought I was drinking liquid gold.  Maybe the great memories have given me a bias, but this as become my very favorite Hefeweizen, and one of my favorite beers, period.  Everything about it, the color, the naturally sweet aroma and flavor, is perfect.   Adding a lemon wedge makes it even better.  Weihenstepher is the worlds oldest brewer, so theyve had plenty of time to get it right.  And they have.

slightly hazy orangish gold medium white head. has a lemon yeast aroma with banana and cloves in the background. smooth crisp medium body. tastes of acidic bread and cloves. the fruitiness is strong but stays in the back. very crisp and refreshing.
The best  Weisse beer I have tasted. Tastes better on tap then in the bottle but still great either way.

An enjoyable wheat. Poured cloudy dark yellow color with HUGE almost out of control head. Aroma is clovey. Flavor is very rich but not overdone clovey/banana flavor with a nice crisp bitter finish. This is up there amongst the many hefes Ive tried.

Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a weizen glass. Color is a golden yellow with notable cloudiness and visible yeast in the bottom of the bottle (poured into the glass, of course). Head is very big, slightly sticky, and white. No lemon added.

Smells of ground wheat with whisps of banana odor and a very slight ester.

Taste starts out with a strong wheat and fades to a more malty flavor, with evident elements of citrus, banana, and cloves.

Mouthfeel is medium weight with lots of carbonation as expected in this type, and a nice smoothness at the end. The initial "hit" of the carbonation and wheat is very refreshing, and the barley notes ensure a finish thats not too harsh.

Many say that this (and other hefeweizens) is a beer for the hot summer afternoon. I could drink it all day, all year round. Absolutely delicious; light but flavorful. By far the best of its breed.
12oz bottle. Hazy gold body, hints of banana.  i need to buy more of these. A+ brew

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 GBBF bottle tasting session ... VEry clowdy wheat yelllow ... banana and bubble gum nose ... very fruity lovely rich fruit ... soft banana ... very refreshing ... very good example ...4.1

hazy amber yellow ... small bubbly white head ... sweet soft toffee malts ... very light banananana nose ...way too fizzy ... soft juicy fruits ... bananananana and lemon ... little herbal spice ... soft toffeee ... its ok.  3.5
had at T.O. beerfest. Lots of head nose is banana and cloves, very yeasty flavor, smooth creamy refreshing, good beer

Orange-gold with large 2-inch white head. Strong nose of creamy wheat. Taste is same as nose with a full mouthfeel and a hint of orange and banana. Extremely drinkable; alcohol is well hidden. Medium carbonation and medium body. Very good.

Bottle. Hazy gold with bg white head. Nose of faint lemon, banana, yeast, pepper, and some sour wheat. Flavor is a nicely balanced combination of all of these, quite spicy on the tongue, and with a biting carbonation and clean finish. Very tasty.
Draught, a hazy gold with a large pillowy white head. A good yeasty wheat aroma with citrus and banana. Quite a good yeasty hefeweizen flavour - refreshing.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2011 12 oz bottle I believe. Aroma is very nice and yeasty. Taste is great. Smooth and refreshing and with great flavor. Second sample: liter with vi at the most fantasy German bar in NYC. Ours a deep amber body with thin off white lacing. Aroma is thick banana and clove. Mouthfeel is thick with notes of wheat, banana, clove, yeast, and spice.

Pint Bottle
$2.99 
Binnys Orland Park

Hefes arent my favorite style but Ive been in the mood for one today and what better way to go than Weihenstephaner? Pours a hazy yeast laden golden. The entire glass fills with big carbonation bubbles that speed to the creamy bright white head that forms on the pour. Leaves moderate lacing after each sip. A very nice looking hefe.

The smell is 100% hefe. The benchmark for others. Green bananas have a big spot in the aroma with clove coming in a close second, very spicy. Possibly some white pepper. Solid wheat twang backbone with a drop or two of lemon juice. Smells great. 

Flavor is spot on with the aroma. The banana is leaning more toward banana bread as opposed to green bananas. Clove with a twangy wheat backdrop and the lemon shows again.. 

Lighter bodied with a highly carbonated creamy mouthfeel. Very thirst quenching.

On a warm summer day like today this is about one of the easiest drinkers to find. Thirst quenching and enjoyable.

To me Weihenstephaner is the pinnacle all other hefes try and reach. Like I said not one of my favorite styles but when Im in the mood none are better than this.

7/16/07

The best German Hefe Ive had hands down. Aroma was a beautiful thick banana with a hint of lemon. Pour was a near perfect cloudy gold with an inviting 2 finger white head. But the taste...woah the taste. Sharp tartness and banana with heavy yeast tones and a delicious citrusy note. Very heavy carbonation...tongue biting carbonation I call it. Almost perfect!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Nice fruity aroma. Banana. A little citrus. Clove. Pours a nice hazy orange with a yellowish bubbly head. Flavor is wheat, yeast, fruity esters. Lemon and banana are extremely prevalent. It finishes with a nice lemon flavor and a spritzy carbonation. This is a nice hefe. Damn good.

Smells of yeast, fresh cut grass, mild wet pine, rust and ripe banana peel. Very cloudy, with a thick head and a lasting lace. Lots of carbonation. Tastes of yeast and hay with a nice grainy orange taste, all in appropriate harmony. Palate is a little shy, but that is the only setback.
bottle.  cloudy with nice full head.  citrus and grain grass scents.  great beer with yeasty taste.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow body with a creamy three finger creamy head.
Aroma of wheat and different dried fruits.
Flavor has large banana note.Some wheat and other fruits than banana little yeasty.
Palate is medium thick and smoth.

Bottle, Aikmans. Cloudy yellow colour with a huge white head. Surprisingly clean, with citrus and some grass. Some spices, little yeast. Mouth is not too thick, not too light, just about right. Palate is fruity and lasting. Rather surprisingly good.

Bottle from HEB. Nice couldy golden color and a large white head. Nice carbonation and smooth flavor. This is the epitome of hefeweizen IMHO. Nice yeasty undertones with a good spicyness. Very drinkable, very clean flavor. I dont drink a lot of hefeweizen, but this certainly reminds me of what hefeweizen was when I lived in Germany.

bottle, huge frothy head, cloudy and golden color.... citrus and fruit tones.... Hefeweizen is not one of my favorite styles of beer - but this one was enjoyable in its appearance, and citrus aromas.

Universal characteristics of a hefeweizen, but WOW what a bold flavor.  The mouthfeel is just about perfect for this sort of beer and the beer has just the right balance of spice and carbonation.  This is a fantastic example of a hefeweizen and a winner in every way.
This beer is another winner from Weihenstephaner.  Do they make anyting not worth drinking?  Well, except their alcohol free beer of course.

Cloudy pale golden color with a big white head.  Smooth, malty, banana flavored beer.  Aromas of must, funk, yeast.  Light bodied, refreshing flavors.  Mainly fruit with some bitter hoppiness towards the end.

Hazy golden orange colour with a huge rocky head that fades to leave a constant finger size covering. Gorgeous banana,clove, spice aroma that never looses any of its heady power. Taste is more spice, a wonerfull wonderfull beer.
Hazy golden with a large white head. yeast and clove aroma. Clove in the taste as well, but also a strong overtone of breakfast cereal. No bitterness. Quite fizzy. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2008 Cloudy honey colour with a fine white head which dies back to a lasting thin layer. Smooth, medium bodied, with low carbonation. Wheaty malt with cloves with a bit of banana.Slightly sweet finish.Quite enjpyable!

Straw-gold in the glass with a downright volatile, cloudy, light head.  Lots of spice aromas and the smell of banana bread.  Light, aromatic palate finishes soft and smooth, unlike lots of other hefes, this one finishes lemony, crisp and very very smooth.  Flavors are closely integrated and balanced between fruit and grains.  Classic and outstanding.
A very nice hefeweissen. Has the classic smooth taste of cloves and bananas.

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm) Golden orange, pale amber colour, hazy, with brief white head. Fruity, estery, slightly yeasty nose with notes of banan, green apples, Seville orange, clove and coriander. Fruity, slightly yeasty taste with banana, tropical fruit, hints of chocolate and spicy notes of clove and coriander. Some wheaty sweetness throughout but drier and more strained than many other of the same style. Solid and tasty hefeweissen.
On draft at the Beerfestival at Viersen Germany. A nice Hefeweizen. One of the better beers of that day

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Bottle. Poured a hazy orange-gold color with puffy white head. Medium carbonation, not too harsh to palate. Citrus and banana aroma. Flavor is very pleasant with hints of citrus, banana, and wheat. Smooth finish. Overall a beer that I enjoyed.

Bottle poured in to my Paulaner weizen glass.  Hazy yellow orange with a billowing snow white head.  Lots of carbonation raising through the glass.  Clove, citrus, and muted banana in the aroma.  Wheat, dough, banana and clove flavors.  Doughy palate with some spritz.  Finishes with a twang.
pours a cloudy gold with lot of head a carbination.  banana and citrus on the nose.  wheaty yeasty finish. nice stuff
Pours a cloudy dark yellow color with a tall soapy head that lingers.  Aroma of yeast and citrus.  Bananas, citrus, and yeast ptovide a well=balanced smooth, refreshing taste.  Great summer beer!

The color was a hazy golden.  The head was creamy and off-white.  The aroma was wheat, yeast, and some citirs.  The flavor was very strong, wheat, yeast, some citris, and some sourness.  The palate was thin/medium bodied.  The finish was yeast and wheat.
Lovely cloudy rich amber colour.  A lovely beer if a little too carbonated.  Brilliant for summer evenings - it is very easy to drink.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy pale body with nice head. Aroma is of bananas, cloves, spices, light citrus, yeast. Flavor was mild and smooth with the above aromas present.
This is an ok beer. Nice aroma that first reminded me of bananas and then later cloves. Light yeasty taste.

(Bottle) Pours a hazy yellow/light amber color with a silky white head and great amount of hefe. Aroma of yeast, wheat, and slight citrus. Taste includes some clove as well. Full mouthfeel, with lively carbonation. A classic example of an excellent hefeweizen.
absolutely my favorite Hefe.  Light and refreshing with a doughy and clover taste.  I could drink these all day in the summer.

From a 500mL Bottle.  A hazy tower of golden honey fills my weizen glass, transitioning nicely from a pale pear skin color at the bottom to a richer blood orange fog at the top.  Two fingers of soapy white foam rests calmly on top, attractively, but a taller, rockier head would make it even better.  Aroma of creamy banana yeast phenolics; very light and milky with an almost vanilla ice-cream like bread pudding character.  Not much in the way of spice aromatics, but it doesnt need it; simple, elegant, and clean.  A hint of lemon acidity adds a refreshing element to the bouquet.  Light bodied, spritzy carbonation that explodes on the palate in a burst of sizzling bubbles.  Theres a bit more yeasty spice in the flavor than found in the aroma; less banana and more white pepper and restrained clove.  The mild spiciness melds nicely with the spritzy carbonation, creating a flavorful level of refreshment.  Some semi-tart, dry wheat characters linger a moment after the flurry of bubbles clears, and then gives way to a finish of mild yeasty spice.  A well-deserved classic; nothing extravagent, but refined all the same.

Very appealing hefe that reminds me of Munich!  Great flavor and excellent appearance.  The lacing is dominant and the aroma has the nice wheat citrus flavor. Fanastic body with this beer that make it an excellent accompnayment to food and fun.  It is exceptional summer beer for a hot afternoon near a pool.

A classic german hefeweizen.  I became addicted to this traditional brew in Munich and have been hooked ever since.  The beer pours with a solid head.   Body is cloudy.  Taste is smooth, spicy and consistent throughout with hints of banana/fruits.  Very smooth finish.
this is without a doubt one of the best beers ive had. on tap at the nurnburger bierhaus, cloudy yellow golden in appearance, medium head, not overly sweet, definately my fav hefe.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2011 Dark, hazy yellow. with rust colored hues from the yeast. Huge, white, frothy and lasting head. Big aroma of banana and clove, bread, nuts and wheat. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lighty to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter and lightly to moderately tart. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Tastesof clove and banana. Nice moderattion between sweetness in one sip and tartness in another. Ive had this beer dozens of times and it has never failed to impress me. Thirst-quenching, easy drinking with lots of flavor. World class hefe.
Aroma of spice, fruit and wheat. Yellow orange in colour with a thin white head. Typical spice flavour with herbs and a rich fruity texture. Tangy finish.

Pours nice slightly cloudy golden color out of the bottle.  Banana clove and is that peach?  Probably not, but it is good.  better than a lot of hefes.  Even though im in a big ipa phase I would revisit this baby.

Draft.  Cloudy golden color that arrived with big creamy head.  A little thinner mouthfeel than some other hefes that Ive had. Tastes of banana and citrus.  Excellent.  Wish I could find this on a regular basis.
Golden color with bubbly carbonation and a nice big, creamy head. Spicy aroma with wheat and banana flavors.  Its smooth, light and refreshing. It finishes dry and a bit tart.
Nice and bready, with a citrus/banana back - well balanced.  You cant see your hand through the glass!  Goes down nice and smooth.

Bottle. This beer bring me back to Germany! Very nice! The aroma is some Banana, good!  Big white head that disapear quicly. Appearance some dark golden, the flavor is bitter and the same to the palate.
Cerveja de Trigo, com notas de banana no aroma e sabor amargo, o mesmo para o paladar. Espuma densa e encorpada, porém desaparece rápido. Coloração amarelo turvo, padrão das cervejas de trigo conhecidas como a Erdinger e Paulaner.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2010 Moderate haze with heaped suds and plenty of spritz. Seductive estery snout  with bags of banana, clove and tropical fruit. Flavour drier and less ripe than expected, with banana, pepper, biscuit and a notably more bitter finish than a typical Hefe. Decent brew, and so it should be after 900 years.  (Re-rate) Ripe banana aroma with an almost mulled gust of peppery clove and nutmeg. Thats a 9. Thick and milky spiced teabag clove and pepper in the mouth, with biscuit and banana. Just a hint of dryness to finish. Lovely spicy weizen, up-rated from 3.7.

Golden, hazy with a nice head. The aroma is nice with notes of wheat and banana. The flavour is slightly sweet and spicy with notes of citrus. The citrus is stronger than in the average weiss, but its far from moving towards a wit. A nice weiss bier for sure.

I AM BEGINNING TO GIVE A LITTLE LESS CREDIT FOR THE RECURRING THEME OF BANANA AND CLOVE OR CORIANDER FOUND IN GERMAN BEERS THAT APPARENTLY HAVE ALL GOTTEN THE SAME IDEA. THIS IS A NICE BREW IN THAT TRADITION. YEASTY BODY THAT IS GOOD. A TAD THINNISH TO SHOW A REFRESHING CHARACTERISTIC. MORE BREADY THAN BUNNY. A BIT TANGY. A HAPPY BREW. QUALITY SUGAR -LIKE HONEY- THAT IS MELLOW. IM THINKING CREAM OF WHEAT YEEESS WITH THE PAT OF BUTTER.

Very nice hefe, good balance of banana and clove, with a smooth heavy palate texture. When I try to get people to try new beers this would be what I start with.
