Most people around here drink a lot of american wheat beers, this kinda shows them the light, lots of flavors in a "easy to drink for any palate" kind of brew.
I did not like this one. It was very bitter and carbonated. Yeasty and thin, but not watery.
very refreshing, very tasty. I especially appreciated the perfect carbonation coupled with the not overpowering wheat beer flavors. Excellent.

Bottle.  Hazy golden color, foamy head.  Aroma of citrus, honey and spices.  FLavor is citrus, honey, spices, and banana.  The beverage itself was quite refreshing, and I have to say that I really enjoyed it a very pleasant finish that makes me want to go out and get some more to be perfectly honest.  A perfect refresher on a hot day - even though I could drink it all year long.

Dark hazed gold, foamy white head.  Nose held notes of of soft clove and banana, with just a touch of pear.   As it warmed, hints of lemony yeast and vanilla honey emerge.  Flavor was full on spiced frutiness that merges into a light yeastiness.  Light bodied, spritzy carbonation, dry, refreshing finish.  A classic summer brew...
Dark cloudy yellow colour. Lightly sparking. Fresh citrus aroma. Fresh spicy taste with some pepper in there. Some lingering carbonation keps the flavour alive in the mouth after swallowing.

Bottle.  Pour is a darkish gold, light amber... a little cloudy.  Head is pretty substantial and it is taking multiple pours to get it all into the glass.  Aromas are lovely.  Sweet honey wheat aromas mix with a little bit of coriander and cloves spicing with some floral hops in the background.  Bread and yeast.  Flavor is about the same with some banana at the tail end that leaves a pleasant little aftertaste.  This is a really nice hefe.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours cloudy pale orange, tons of white froth.  Strong wheat aroma--yeast and light-bread-y--and citrus.  Robust flavor-tangy and bitter, and some banana.  Full-bodied for a hefe and clean creamy finish.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2007 500ml bottle. poured, rolled, then poured it out into a FFF english pint glass. sorry no weizen glass left. pours hazy golden with fluffy white head. nose has a nice touch of banana and wheat without being sickingly overbearing, other aroma notes are wheat and other grains. flavor is not undelicous, a refreshing mix of wheat and banana. creamy mouthfeel baby. man even though its not imperial its good stuff. jk. the best hefe ive had and maybe my 7th so thats saying a lot. drink up suckers.
Many hefes taste very similar to me-- but this one always just stands out a little.  Maybe its their yeast?  Excellent flavor and quite refreshing on a warm summer day.

Bottle. Cloudy orangey golden with the characteristic huge head. Banana aroma dominant, clove is also noticeable. Fruity flavours that are less in your face than suggested by the nose- nicely balanced banana flavours with yeast and spices for dry effect. Medium to full body, soft. A classic that does not disappoint.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 A beautiful, cloudy, golden-orange coloured, a head is medium and blond. The nose is fruitfill, not very sweet, lots of yeast, bananas and hint of grass. Taste is fruitfull and smooth, bananas, wheat, yeast, great and balanced sourness. Medium bodied, lots of carbonation, smooth to drink and almost oily. Balanced beer and very refreshning. The best hefe.

Im curious how good this beer would be when it hasnt had to travel halfway around the world. It pours a cloudy amber with a large, frothy, off-white and diminishing head. The aroma is of cloves, citrus, bananas and a solid yeastiness. Light and slick,  it finishes crisp and clean. The flavor is a sweet yeasty front with a light citrus and banana segue to a solid wheat finish. A very clean and refreshing drinker; I could drink these all day long.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2011 Its been a long time since Ive geeked out on Hefes, but on this hot day in Carolina I thought Id take a splash. And this one was just the ticket, with a big cloudy body, a lightly spiced palate, and a frothy mouthfeel. Really good and quaffable, on a par with Paulaner and Hacker-Pschorr.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Re-rate 8/16: Bottle at Meshek Barzilay in Tel Aviv. A very nice classic Weizen, but I like it a little less than I used to. 7/4/7/3/15=3.6

Re-rate 3/31/08: Draught. Cloudy yellow with a big lasting white head. Fruity aroma of wheat, banana and some clove notes. Sweetish and lightly tart flavor with wheat, banana and a bit of spiciness. Light to medium-bodied with crisp mouthfeel. Great. 7/5/7/4/15=3.8Draught. Cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, fruits (mostly banana, duh), and a bit of spices. Wheat, yeast and banana in the flavor. Pleasant medium body. A great weissbier! 7/4/8/4/15=3.8
sweet - slight and very pleasent taste on the palate - a bit watery - It is very palatable to drink

Poured a pretty pale hazy amber/golden. The head is thick, creamy, offwhite. The aroma is nice, banana, citrus, spice, sour. The flavor is sour, spicey, banana, and more citrus. The palate is smooth and crisp while remaining full. This is a delicious german hefeweizen and I am beginning to adore the style.

500ml bottle in Weinhestephan glass.  Pours cloudy pale yellow orange with lasting white head and nice lacing.  Aroma of banana clove bubblegum.  Perhaps the best hefe aroma.  Extremely refreshing flavors of sweet orange fruitiness.  Medium light body.  Perhaps a hint too much carbonation, but refreshing mouthfeel nonetheless.  Delicious, Ill have twelve.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2010 Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. Hazy golden with large but short fluffy white head. Standard weizen aromas of banana, clove and yeast. Medium bodied and smooth, still with a vivid carbonation. Very nicely balanced with a noticeable bitterness and a refreshing acidity. Very enjoyable.

Bottle. Aroma is dominated by the yeasts soapy/musty smell. The malt has a grain aroma and the hops of lemon. Pear, allspice and clove are also noticable. The head is fizzy, white with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is a clear yellow/amber. Flavor starts out acidic and finishes lightly bitter and salty. Palate is light and is between dry and watery, but is very crisp and semi-refreshing. Carbonation is fizzy and finishes slightly astringent. A good hefeweiss.
Bottle.  The aroma of this beer was citrus, pear, and apple.  There was a hint of bubblegum flavor.  Dry, light/med body, hazy yellow.  Good carbonation, but no lacing in the glass.  Classic hef.

Hints of lemon notes - I didnt get the banana aroma that I normally get with a good hefe.  Aroma was more like a witbier when I first poured it, but the lemon/citrus aroma became more pronounced as it warmed a bit.  Beautiful golden hazy appearance.  Insanely frothy head.  Citrus flavor was refreshing.  Great summer beer.  Very dry on the palate.

Aroma of yeast, supported by a bit of lemon and banana. Hazy orange gold color with many, many tiny bubbles. Ferocious white head that does not seem to plan on leaving. Starts with a mouthful of citrus, spice and pleasant fizz. Passes to a dry, barely bitter finish. This one is all in the middle, and its great.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 12 oz brown bottle from Vintage Estates, thanks to Nuts. Pop the lid and you get an interesting aroma like no other.  Spicy wheaty perhaps coriander, Im not sure. Whatever it is, the aroma is volatile!  Pour is that typical wheat color, orangish with those swirling precipitants in there, very nice show.  There is some gunk on the bottom of the bottle. Very good initial flavor, I like it. The carbonation is medium high, enjoyable for a brew like this. The taste of this is good and wheaty but there are plenty of spices in there, it is not your run of the mill hefe. Comes across almost like a wit bier. There is a building medium bitterness that gathers on the back of the throat as this drink is depleted. Better than Penn Weizen. Almost as good as other cleaner Deutch hefes that I have tasted such as erdinger or Michelob barvarian wheat.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with a rocky, long lasting white head. Great wheat beer aroma of cloves, bananas and yeast. More spice and bananas in the flavour with some bubble gum. Very smooth to drink. Along with Schneider Original, the definitive hefe weizen. Re-rate 27/7/08: A similar experience to before, but tried alongside Schneider Original, the aroma and flavour were very light and the bubble-gum a bit too pronounced - re-rate at 3.5.

16.9oz bottle served in a weizen glass. Pours cloudy gold with an easy two fingered head.  Aroma is a nice mix of clove and banana/fruitiness. There is also a yeasty component to the aroma. This is what a hefe should smell like. Taste is sharp wheat, cloves, pepper, spice, phenolics, and earthiness. It would seem there is a tartness to the beer, maybe from the phenolics? The carbonation helps the mouthfeel, but the beer itself seems thin. A nice drinking beer and I would be overjoyed to drink it fresh with a white sausage, but I think this beer probably has its best days behind it due to the long ride from Germany. I did not like this style until I started drinking fresh, homebrew versions of it, it truly is a better beer fresh.

Rated 1/3/06:  This is the second style from the Weihenstephaner family of beers that I have recently tried. A beautiful golden color and very cloudy in the glass with a fantastic head and great lacing. After enjoying its appearance I took a few drinks and was instantly guessing at all of the different flavors that can be found in this beer. This style is not on my top five list, but It is a well crafted beer. Im sure a bottle or two will find its way back into my fridge from time to time.

Bottle. 16.9 FL. OZ. Hazy gold color with big, white, foamy head. Aroma of apricot, spice, and yeast.  Medium bodied with a grainy texture.  Smooth and balanced.  Flavor is light sweet with a very satisfying sour finish.  Very nice.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a big not ,pstly diminishing white bubbly creamish head leaving some lacing. Aroma of wheat, yeast, fruit (mainly banana) and some clove. The flavour is fresh and wheaty with some yeast, malt hops and fruits. Slightly bitter wheaty finish.

Bottle. Pours with a hazy yellow color. 
Aromas of banana and mainly cloves. FLavors of bubbelgum, citrus, dough, banana and more cloves.Lively carbonation and very full body or a Hefe.  One of the best ones out there,
on tap at papago. nice and yeasty. well balanced with dried orange and cinnamon flavors. mmm...pork chops.
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 Bottle.  Pour is hazy, darker orange than most Weissbier.  Huge head that remained throughout.  Great taste, currently my favorite (German hefe) out there.
Lots of flavor for a lighter beer. Cloudy blond color. Aroma matches taste. Not enough hops for me, but I appreciate its quality.

Everything a hefeweizen should be - clean, crisp, refreshing, inviting, quaffable and so much more. It may just be the perfect standard for a weiss and one can never go wrong in picking one (or 20) up.

Pours out to an almost impenetrable shade of fiery yellow, with a perfect lasting head.  This would be a martyr for style integrity.  Aroma of banana and clove, with a bright but wheat dusted note of lemon.  Taste is brimming with yeast and wheat.  Musty wood, orange zest, mild spice highlights with a sort of sesame seed dry bite at the end.  Palate is rather thick and full but this works quite nicely, creating a sort of creamy sensation in place of the usual spritzy sharpness of weissbier.  Both intelligent and approachable, and fantastically refreshing.

bottle from dcharms:pours a hazy golden hue with a large foamy white head. aroma is of yeast, wheat, and hops. some sweet fruityness. flavour is wheat, yeast,  spice, and some sweetness with a touch of hops in the finish. great mouthfeel full and creamy.
.5L draft in Vienna.  Very tasty weissbier.  Nice full mouthfeel and a great looking beer.

Very hazy golden body and a large & thick head plus good lacing. Solid wheaty aroma with some hoppyness, citric and floral. The taste was bready & wheaty, plus very good citric/cloves spiciness. Also, vanilla & bubblegum & tart yeastiness & grass. Full and round mouthfeel with good carbonation, very smooth. Full-bodied, creamy, fruity & refreshing. Great stuff.
Tap Bonte Koe, Leiden, Netherlands: Yellow Cloude Hefeweizen from the oldest brewery of the world, the right thirst quenching beer for hot april month in the Netherlands.
Bottle.  Pours cloudy orange/gold with medium white head.  Banana, yeast, lemon, sweet, wheat.   Have to give this a good swirl to get some of the carbonation out.
Very nice German Hefe.  Had this the other night and was pleasantly surprised.

Had this beer Saturday after riding my bike 93 miles on the MS150, courtesy of Stefan and Norbert, the 2 newest members of our cycling team, Team Hanley. The guys are from Germany and brought this brew directly from The Fatherland. All I can say is - AWESOME IN ALL ASPECTS!

Bottle: Cloudy and pale body with a massive amount of head that doesnt stick around, but looks nice and rocky.  Aroma is very tart, lots of lemon, with the banana, sour yeastiness, and clove qualities present.  In the mouth, this is exactly what a hefe should taste like.  Crisp. banana and cloves abound, with a lingering tart finish with some mild spicy hops mixed in.  Sour-dough bread like yeastiness noted as well.

Bottle.  Pours hazy hazy gold, white head. Aroma is super spicy; coriander, nutmeg. I tsmell citrus, bubble gum, banana, and sausage. Flavor is bubble gum, banana, wheat, cotton candy, and citrus tanginess. Excellent hefeweizen.
Bottle from Munich, poured into Weihenstephan glass. This is the hefe which all others should be judged against. Good body, restrained fruity and yeasty notes, perfect carbonation and finish.

Citrus on the nose. It pours a cloudy gold, typical of the style. The flavor was strong and assaulted the senses in a pleasurable way. It tasted of orange, marshmallow, and bubble gum, with no noticeable hops. Lemon in the finish.

Bottle.  Cloudy yellow-orange with a bumpy white head.  Light lemony bread/cereal and slight yeast aroma.  Clean wheat flavor livened up by a gentle lemony tartness.  Some fresh grass notes underneath.  Smooth palate with fine carbonation. Pure tasting  and refreshing.
Dark golden color with decent head... very sweet aroma backed by a sweet wheat flavor.l... a very good German Hefe.
Pours a nice gold color, but not as  murky as other hefs, not good or bad. Has a nice head to it and tastes very good. I liked better than Paulaner, but not as well as Hacker Pschorr.
I was surprised at how good this beer was. I had not heard of it before I tried it, and I loved it.  I will buy it again!

Not the best hefe Ive ever had, but it was pretty good, no complaints.  I probably need to taste this is a different setting, and not after Ive already had a few.  Little to no head. Decent aroma and flavor. Pleasant aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden-yellow with a huge lasting fluffy white head. Aroma of yeast and wheat along with fruit and spices (mainly cloves). Flavour follows the aroma: Yeast and wheat up front followed by spices and fruit and a mild bitter finish -- perhaps a tad watery but goes down really easy. Medium bodied. Nothing outstanding but still a damn fine Hefe.

Bottle.  Very good, a stronger flavor than that of Franziskaner.  Has undertones of apple and pear and a silky mouthfeel.  The finish is short, perhaps a little too short, but its one of the few complaints one could level against a very good beer.
Draft.  one of my favorite weisses of all time. dark cloudy yellow w/ serious head.  Fantastic fruity aroma, not to acidic but enough to have some bite.  A perfectly balanced weiss beer.
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2008 Garrafa, em janeiro de 2008. Coloração âmbar média. Aroma fraco. Sabor idem. Banana, pão. Levemente adocicada. Carbonatação média.

Draught. Pleasant aroma of honey and wax, reminds me a bit of a beehive...
Cloudy orangey colour, small head, taste is quite spicy with medium sweetness, smooth and easy to drink, short finish.

12oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy, pale yellow color with a lot of carbonation and a ridiculous white head that leaves foamy lace.  Aroma is heavy vanilla, yeast, fruits, citrus, orange.  Amazing aroma.  Taste is smooth with a heavy dose of banana.  Very good.

pbottle . . pours cloudy gold with a white head . . aroma is strong citrus, wheat, grass, bubble gum,banana,  sweet . . taste is sweet and fruity, slightly grassy, light bitterness in the middle and STRONG sweet ripe banana finish . . awsome!

Coloração dourada turva. Creme bege consistente mas pouco persistente. O aroma é perfumado, presença forte de cravo, bastante floral. O paladar n]ão acompanha o aroma, sendo mais fraco. Carbonatação um pouco forte, encobrindo o gosto. Típica weiss bávara, com gosto de Munique...

Bottle. Weizen. Awesome head that is fluffy and indicative of the style. Brilliant cloudy yellow appearance that smells of sweet banana and coriander. A lovely creamy mouthfeel is accompanied by heavy wheat and banana flavors with slight citrusy spice, subtle yeast and sweet fruit. A great beer from the noble Weihenstephaner.
I really like this beer.  Poured with a great head.  Nicely carbonated.  The flavor was perfect for this type of beer.  A touch of sweetness and a hit of citrus.  Very nice.

Golden with a white head.  Smells citrusy with a  hint of wheat malt.  The flavor is amazing.  Banana, esters, and buttery goodness.  Medium body.  Excellent wheat beer.  The German style puts the American Style to shame.

Absolutly astounding! 1" white head, unfiltered golden color, spicy nose. The taste blows you away with spice and citrus not found in many beers available in the states. Light vanilla smooths out the spice and citrus and provides a clean finish. A truly amazing beer!
Great taste.  Will need to purchase and have on hand when friends visit.  Golden color, flavor had a very slight spice to it.  Head hung around for a while.
Really excellent tasting, looking and smelling weiss. Extremely smooth beer with a head that lasts until the very end of the glass. Very refreshing as well.

pint bottle, pours excellent generous white head, condensing into a creamy froth and remaining until the last sip.  Golden color is delightful.  Perhaps a bit too effervescent, but a couple swirls calms it down nicely.  At 5.4% abv, alcohol shouldnt be as noticeable as it is.  Overall, a great hefe with lots of banana and a bit of clove.  Still, Ill be sticking to franziskaner and paulaner.

This is the standard for a German Hefe-Weissbier. Beautiful color, wheat aroma, and a touch of sweetness to the taste. Went through many kegs at the last Oktoberfest. Im always trying new beers at my store, but there is always a 6 pack of this in the frig. - Das ist dein scheiBe !!
Pours golden clear.  Aroma is wheaty and sweet.  Flavor is clean, crisp and refreshing, everything a hefeweizen should be.  Arguably the best wheat beer Ive ever tasted.

Bottle.Large white fluffy head.Banana, orange,clove,spice aroma.Cloudy gold color.Spices plus light citrus flavor.Medium body.Refreshing,crisp.Its great after being outside on a warm day.Very good hefe.

16.9 oz. bottle. Classic hefeweizen scent: bubblegum, flowers, bananas, cloves, soap. The bubblegum scent in particular is extremely strong. Also a touch of new car smell. Pours a hazy, sparkling, relatively pale gold with a large amount of fluffy, uneven, off-white head. Produces loose but thick sporadic lacing. Sharp, lemony, yeasty flavor. Slight spice kick. Subdued flavors overall. Appetizing, but I wish the flavors were stronger. Little aftertaste. Medium body. Smooth in the palate. Moderate liveliness. Easy to drink. I decided to enjoy this prototypical summer refresher in celebration of a beautiful, sunny, 70 degrees late March Minnesota day. Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is very much worthy of its classic status.

Bottle.  Pours thick, hazy yellow (actually quite clear for a hefe). Head is white and nice creamy. Aroma is very sweet with quite a lot of banana. Very nice, full mouthfeel. Begins quite sweet and then turns a little bit bitter. Compared to other hefes its sweeter, but more well-rounded.

boTTle....pours thick, spumous white head and cloudy honey-colored body with moderate carbonation. Pleasant aroma of banana esters, yeast, and fresh biscuits. Great depth of flavor with a pronounced fresh wheaty character, and notes of blood orange, some mild nuttiness( kinda like me). Continental hops make an appearance and lend some light but detectable flavor and bitterness. Mostly dry except for a touch of honey-like sweetness. Medium fullness on the tongue with some crisp and lively effervescence. Do a few more of these on a hot summer day...yep

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2010 Draft and bottle several places. Good Bavarian hefeweizen, with clove-spice-yeast aroma and flavor. Cloudy pear-honey color with huge creamy head. Flavor is spicy yeasty wheat with some not very sweet fruit, and some slight tartness. Excellent choice that beats the heck out of typical American wheat beers.

Got a cool looking cloud in the orangey-copper beer as the yeast fell down against the bubbles of carbonation. Smell and taste are a familiar fruity wheat. Very slight orange taste with hints of other mild fruit. Mild clove and very mild pepper.
One of the best hefes out there.  Its no Edel-weisse by G. Schneider, but its eye-popping.  Very slightly fruity, nice and crisp.  Damn near perfect.

Im afraid to taste anything rated higher than this. It could possibly put me death. This is by far the best Hefe. Maybe its to common to recieve the highest rating. The yeast from this beer is the base for every good american Hefe Ive ever had.
Cloudy golden color with a thick white head.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Smooth, refreshing wheat body.  Not one of my favorite styles, but a very nice example of the style.

Poured from a pint bottle into a pint glass, cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma was strong with notes of yeast, cloves and citrus. The taste however, was a bit thin with hints of clove, citrus and spices and a bready nose. Good carbonation. Overall very crisp and clean. A good beer, but I prefer the Paulaner Hefe Weiss because it has a heavier clove and banana taste up front. But thats just my taste.
Slight hazy yellow and nice white head. Very fresh taste of lemon, orange, hay and slightly spiced. Good balance and nice acidity. One of the best Hefe Weissbier on bottle.

Bottle acquired in trade with shp555. Poured a medium and hazy golden color. Aromas of citrus, yeast, light bananas, wheat and a trace of cloves. Tastes of wheat, lemons, and light spices. I found this one to be quite boring.
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2010 Maybe it is everyone using Weihenstephans yeast but this although this is the benchmark all other hefes are judged it didnt do much for me.
An awesome looking orange colour and lasting head.  Beautiful balance and complexity.  One to be savoured and not rushed.
Pours golden with a very slight haze. Head is large and lasting. Strong banana aromas. Solid mouthfeel, round yet still refreshing. Smooth solid finish. Not bad.
Not my style I guess.  Very good head to begin with but lost head rather quickly.  Too spicy, fruity for my taste. After taste on palate same. Golden cloudy in appearance.

Cerveja de trigo alemã. Cheiro suave, levemente frutado. Coloração caramelo escuro, muito bonita. Espuma densa, branca escurecida. Gosto frutado e de cereais, amargor agradavelmente suave. Uma cerveja leve. Boa cerveja de trigo porém não chamou atenção a não ser no visual.
Excellent hefe! A true classic. Pours smooth with a nice head. No need for lemon in this hefe. Cloudy and light golden appearance. Very smooth drink and great aftertaste.
yellow colour and a big white head taste of wheat and citrus a bit thin i guess but till good.Refreshing beer.

I can see how this beer is best-in-class.  This is quite a good hefeweizen, but I think Id still rather have a Franziskaner I think.

Appearance of this beer was quite good in my pint glass:  hazy yellow with plentiful head (note to self:  buy better glasses for this type of beer).  Aroma is of wheat, clove, and is quite fruity and pleasant.  Flavor is rich and spicy and quite good.  Mouthfeel is a bit thin.  This beer is very drinkable.

A better-than-decent full-bodied Hefeweizen thats widely available.  You know the appearance: unfiltered, straw-colored, booming white head.  Bubblegum, bananas, cloves, coriander.  Very refreshing, especially on hot Florida summer days.
Definitely my everyday beer. Easily available in my area. A great hefe-Weizen!!!!

A very nice looking hefe.  Pour is a cloudy golden color with a large fluffy white head.  Aroma of banana, spice ,wheat, and orange.  Smooth mouthfeel with flavors of citrus, orange, wheat, spice, and banana.  Damn good hefeweizen.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2008 dark golden, cloudy apricot pour with large slightly beige white head.  Smooth familiar banana taste with orance emphasis.  This is an excellent Hefe in a bottle.  Way too easy to drink
bottle. yellow color. medium head. banana wheat aroma. banana taste grainy as well. soft in palete not sharp.
Bottle. Cloudy pale golden colour with a huge white head. Spicy aroma with some ripe bananas. Flavour is fruity, yeasty but a bit flat.

Bottle 50cl. Ohhhh my god i do love this Hefe-weissbier. Aroma: banana, raisin, hay, golden, cloudy, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish. Eat my shorts.

Cloudy apricot colour. Medium white thick head. Sweet fresh fruit and yest aroma. Pretty live carbonation - gives nice feeling to the mouth along with the somewhat thick texture . Tastes sour bread dough, soap and fruits. I had predujices for hefewiezens, but this was ok.

12oz bottle.  Aroma:  Classic banana and clove, wheat malt, yeast, light lemon and floral.  Appearance:  Dark golden in color and very cloudy.  Bright white head was huge and mousse-like with great retention.  Good lacing.  Flavor:  Bready wheat malt, yeast, banana, clove, light bubblegum.  Low bitterness.  Some lingering sweetness into the finish.  Palate:  Medium-light bodied.  Medium-high carbonation.  Overall:  A standard for the style.  Classic all the way around.  Nice beer.

[Bottle, February 2007] Rich golden/yellow pour with medium head. Aroma was quite weak and fleeting which betrayed the flavor. The first sip of this thing reveals how flavorful it truly is. Not being the biggest hefe fan, this blew me away. Orange, citrus, lemon, yeast in flavor. Mouthfeel is fantastic - fizzy and crisp. Altogether an extraordinarily drinkable beer.
Bottle: Poured a murky orange yellow with thick creamy white head. Sweet metallic and yeasty aroma. Bitter yeast malt flavor.
Bottle. Unclear orange colour with a huge white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, yeast, citrus, and banana

Bottle. Head was huge fizzy and white. Good lacing to be found. Body was cloudy with small particles and a yellow with an orange kind of glow. Aroma was citrus, clove, leather, banana, perfume, grain and spice. Medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Light sweet flavour, slightly bitterness to be found. Great Hefe!
Frothy head with a cloudy appearance. Lots of flavor. Citrus aroma with a crisp finish. Very yeasty, very refreshing. I drink it regularly.
Im not a huge fan of the style, but this is a great example of the style.  It has the whole yeasty cloudy wheaty thing down cold, but not too cold, because that hides the flavor.
Pours a Murky Dark Peach color with a Fluffy White Head.  Tastes of yeast and Citrus Fruits. Nice full body. Greatf Hefe.

Bottled. Nice thick creamy head on this puppy! Aroma of banana clove and honey. Flavor has a yeast start with a flower type finish. A nice Hefe, Id like to try this again as it came highly recommended by a beer guru friend.

Orange, rusty body. Cloudy, big head. In the nose - yeast, citrus fruits. Flavour has usual wheat beer flavours - yeast to the fore with candy sweetness, citrus fruit and corriander spice. I was a bit let down by this beer, considering the rep its got. Flavours were ok, but it seemed a bit thin & watery to me. I still think its alright, but I prefer Erdinger, which seemed to have more body. However Ive drunk that on draft, the Weihenstephaner was from a bottle.

Bottle. Orange colour with big frothy white head. Orange and some coriander in the aroma. Very creamy on the palate. Tastes like bottled sunshine (and fruity grains). Very refreshing and harmonious. Brilliant hefe.
Draft. Orange-gold color. Great aroma. Nice head and lacing. Good mouthfeel. This is another wonderful example of the style. One of my personal favorites.

Pours a hazed dark yellow weisse with a lovely and great head. Nice aroma remenbering vanilla and citric fruits. Smooth flavor of Wheat, lightly sweet, spicy and banana notes. Fruity and spicy aftertaste. Tasted at Belgian Dash, Goiânia, Brazil, with promotion price. Wow!!!!!!!!

0.5l bottle purchased in a Spar in GrazHazy orange colour, big white head that went away fast. Nice aroma. Lemon, cloves, honey, apple, banana... even some hops I reckon. Taste.. lovely mouthfeel..  Pleasantly sweetish. Lemon, cloves, yeast, banana, some apple, pleasant lacticity. Extremely weak traces of.. hops I guess near the end. Damn refreshing. And here I am rating the best hefe Ive had and I find myself not being capable of writing much.. Its lighter than some, sure, but in this light definitely doesnt mean tasteless.  A superb hefe.

Pours a hazy deep straw gold color, topped by an inch or so of white foam. The head receds quickly to just a cap, but this cap provides a fantastic coating of lace. Bready aroma, with wheat and bread yeast, clove and some other spice - maybe light ginger.

Dry wheat flavor that is actually very full, complimented by nice yeast, mild clove, and some other dry spice that definitely is not ginger. It reminds me of fresh borage - a little peppery, grassy and herbal, even a little flowery citrus tang. Probably its just the hops, I know no spices or adjuncts are added. 

Good medium body, full carbonation, lingering dry aftertaste with just a hint of dried banana.

I just dont like german beer is what it boils down to.  Granted, i drank this in the middle of winter.  Had it been during the summer, and the beer was served extremely cold, at least it would be refreshing.  The wheat was very prevalent.  Very crisp mouthfeel, but very muddled flavor

Had this on draft at the Brick Store Pub in Decatur, GA over the Christmas holidays and it blew me away.  Exceeded all expectations I had since most hefes have tasted the same to me in the past.  This has clearly become my favorite of the sytle in a hurry.  Perfect, unfiltered appearance and the most lovely marshmellow-like aftertase on the finish.

Botte.  Pours a cloudy orange with a big white head.  Smells of fruits, mainly bananas, and spice.  Very crisp and clean, but it really doesnt do a ton for me, maybe different if had just got done mowin the lawn, but yeah, its january.  But overall a pretty typical heffe.

Pours cloudy yellow with a thick white fluffy head. Smells of a typical hefe with bananas and spice dominating. Taste is very nice sweet bananas, cloves, nutmeg, and a bit of citrus in there with pleanty of yeasty wheat goodness to boot. Have to say this is my favorite hefe so far.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2011 Bottled. Yellow-orange wheat with a diminishing white head. Some banana in the flavor, else it is only malt and grains. Sweet flavor with hints of caramel, fruits and spices. Medium to full body with a weak finish. A real disappointment even thoug it is not a bad hefeweizen. Rating: 5-3-6-3-12-2.9. 061124Bottle. Looking back at my original rating of this beer, its clear I have to rerate it. It pours an orange-golden body and a big, dense, off-white head with medium longevity. It has a pretty pushing aroma, in a nice way, with lots of banana, some lemony hints and a nice spicy clove scent. Sugary caramel too. Its full-bodied and nicely effervescent on the palate, with banana, cloves and caramel in a pleasant flavor trinity. The banana and some cloves are really lasting. A touch of bitterness chimes in. A really classic and quenching weissbier, thats for sure. 110627
Bottled. Golden yellowish coloured with a rather large head. Malty and sweet with notes of banana, cloves, yeasts. Slightly spicy and citric. Way too high carbonated.
Lovely beer. Banana and cloves, malt sweetness, a tiny amount of hoppiness. All in balance, nothing dominating.
very dark as for a hefeweizen, carbonation rather strong, some bitterness, but it has it all; wheat, yeast and smooth texture I like it
Bottle. Orange/golden colour with a white head. Aroma is banana, wheat. Flavour is banana, wheat, orange, sweet, spices.
Heavy aroma of yeast & spice.  Very cloudy with a thick head and lots of carbonation.  Taste of yeast, citrus, bannan & cloves.  Great lingering mouthfeel.  My favorite hefe thus far.

Cellars Tasting.  Golden color with a sizeable head.  Nice aroma of wheat and banana.  The taste is a fantastic wallop of wheat, yeast, bread, banana, fruit and orange.  Im not usually a fan of wheats, but holy damn is this outstanding!

golden orange haze.  it looks like the color of a lemon.  initially - nice head, but disipates rather quickly, scents of bananas and orange peel, a hint of citrus.  taste - orange, orange peel, slight hint of lemon that follows to the finish.  mouthfeel is quite cozy.  its a great beer, but not the best.

Attractive golden color with a deep creamy head. Aroma of ripened fruits, citrus prominantly. Very complex taste with great character. Very smooth and refreshing. They have had awhile to get this right. Since 1040.

Poured a cloudy golden color with bountiful creamy head.  The aroma was wonderful; started off with bananas when slightly colder and then revealed cloves and spices when it warmed up.  The taste echoed the aroma.  Got a nice spicy feel to it and felt very smooth on the palate.  I could drink this all the time.  Best wheat beer Ive had to date.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2006 Bottle.  Nice hefe.  A spicey hefe, typical golden color with a decent head and some lacing.  Citrus, banana, and (apparently from others) cloves.  Ill have to remember the cloves as that brings more to mind than a very vague "citrus".
Re-rated day after first sampling, color/cloudiness is back to normal now.
mmm Hefe. cloudy yellow color. lots of spice, cloves citrus banana. Certainly one of the best ones around. doesnt have to be warm outside to enjoy this one.

poured from bottle.  Head thick and creamy (my wife said it looked like whipped cream).  The beer looks great in the glass, hazy, pale and golden.  The taste is quite good and the beer drinks very easily.  Try it.

Draught. Pours cloudy yellow orange with very small white head. The aroma is banana, clove, and zest (surprise). The flavor is a bit on the spicy side, with quite a bit of clove and some other more faint spices. The finish is quite citrus-y. All in all, rather refreshing.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2010 Full bodied,  very yeasty, some doughy sourness, some fruity sweeteness, banana and cloves, spicy, quite heavy mouthfill, not my style but well crafted.
Bottle. Large big head with good duration. Color is amber and a bit hazy. Aroma is malt and some fruit. Taste is sweet and fruity.
Had this with timtim....this was a treat, its been a while since a wheat made me happy , but this one did...Very tasty brew! a new favourite here, i am looking for a tap!

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2007 12 oz bottle via shigadeyo (thanks!). This pours a hazy golden color with a large white head. Nose is spicey with note of wheat, pears, pepper, banannas. Tastes just like it smells with some vanilla as well and of course a fizzy crisp wheat finish. Mostly pepper and banannas in the aftertaste.
Very good weissbier. The mix of bitterness and and a clear fruit taste was wellbalanced and it was also a nice thirst-killer.

Bottle 0,5l. Yellowish coloured. Hazy. A huge head - that settles to a normal level in a minute or two. Rich aroma of fruit and spice. Sweet flavour - but not too sweet: Lots of fruity notes here. Some bitterness in a long finish makes it one of the better wheat beers.

Attractive beer- light amber on the bottom transitioning upward to a cloudier, darker composition, topped with a large white head. Aroma is textbook: fresh bananas, fruity bubble gum, spices, and heavy yeast. The sweet, smooth flavor was accentuated by the beers creamy texture and clean finish. Both extremely drinkable and tasty, this is an excellent representation on the hefeweizen style.

dark orangy in apperance with a thick white head. 
bananananana in the nose and in the aftertaste also
i get it now.  before having tried this beer, i have been unimpressed by hefeweizens, but this is a truely great beer.  cloudy, wheaty, and lots of banana in the nose (as they say).

Bottle 0.5L.
Orange, muddy body; large, white head, mostly lasting with a fair lacing; small bubbles of average density.
Heavy banana aroma, together with moderate hops notes (orange) and moderate-to-heavy yeasty notes (dough).
Flavour is moderately sweet and acidic with a light bitter note that comes up in the long finish.
Medium body with an oily texture; lively carbonation; light-to-moderate astrincency in the finish.
Very pleasent beer, one of the best hefeweizen I tried.
Pours a cloudy light yellow with a white head.  The aroma is of wheat and banana.  There is a  light banana taste with wheat and an acidic touch.
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2006 A light hazy orange glow. Very nice aroma with a light wheat taste. no bitter after taste. Very pleasent.
Bottle poured into pint glass. Lots of head, nice aroma. A bit lighter than expected, but still tasty. Banana in aftertaste very present.

bottle. Hazy light orange with a huge off white head.  Aroma is of estery bananas and heavy spices.  Taste is light banana, spices, light tart citrus in the finish.  the body was medium on this beer, and the carbonation was pretty lively.
Bottle at home. This is a really nice Hefeweizen, goes down really well. Insane tall and creamy head. Very smooth taste with citrus, banana and orange flavors.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2007 Drank with stegosaurus. First off I loved the beer ! Pours a hazy golden color, large white full head. Banana, wheat and yeast aroma. Flavor was spice, wheat and a hop finish. Good medium body.

I liked this alot.
Cloudy orange with big initial frothy head.  Strong coriander orange aromas.  Smooth well balanced texture and taste with a nice little bitter aftertaste.  My new benchmark for wheat beers.
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2007 Cloudy orange. Good thickness to it that fills the mouth. Smooth and clean taste that makes for a good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2007 Cloudy orange with a thick foamy head.  Nice nose - Strong banana and yeast.  Bubble gum after taste.  My favorite Heffe, although its a bit too carbonated.  Still, an amazing flavor.

clear honey color - nice white frothy , long lasting head  nose of extreme candy banana , yeast , bubble gum , spice , and nutmeg   taste of apricots, nutmeg, yeast, bananas , honey , lemon , and spices -- medium body slightly oily  aftertaste sour red fruit, bananas , yeast

On tap @ Cafe Dwazezka, Amsterdam.
Nice big rocky head. Color is dark hazy orange. Yeasty aroma with malts and lemon.
Banana and citrus flavoured. Spicy. Medium-bodied with a smooth and weathy  mouthfeel. Highly refreshing.

500 ml bottle. Caramelly orange in colour. Consistently cloudy. Throws a tall thick and creamy white head that clings to the glass. Very nice to look at. The mandatory banana and clove aroma is there, but there is also a slight sweetness and a a little caramel. A light hop aroma can also be detected. Soft mouthfeel with only a slight prickling feeling from carbonation. Non-offending flavours. Some bread and a little caramel, and perhaps also a little banana, but not really any strong characterful flavours. Instead it is well-balanced and tasty. Little bitterness found throughout. Very gentle and very nice.
Very nice on the tongue, flavor of yeast,  some banana, slight clove, earthy, the best balanced hefe Ive had! enjoyed drinking it very much!

I love this beer.  Its so unbelievably smooth, its like drinking velvet.  Poors a foggy golden yellow with a thick white head.  Unfiltered, which always adds to the appearance.  Smells citrousy, tastes refreshing.
I had this on draft at the BrickStore.  golden and very hazy.  banana, clove, orange.  very balanced.  An amazing hefe.  Pefect example of this style!

Bottle.  Pours cloudy dark yellow with a fluffy white head.  Theres not a whole lot to say about the aroma and flavor except that this is very nearly a perfect German hefeweizen.  Theres wheat malt, banana, slight sweetness, moderate yeast, slight sourness, and everything is blended excellently.  Dry finish, *just* slightly overcarbonated.  I gather than this used to be more unique than it is now, with the proliferation of fairly similar beers, but its still an exceptional example of the style.  Great on a nice summer day (as it still is here in September, since this is Atlanta).

Weihenstephaner is my favorite imported German Weissbier. 

The color is a beautiful golden orange and the foggy yeast looks bright white instead of just dirty. It also holds a decent head for a while. 

Smells like half and half, plums. bananas and wheat. Im drooling already. I noticed a lot of variation even between bottles in a six pack with this beer, which is unfortunate. This one is right on. 

Flavors creamy and smooth. Good wheat flavor, but the sweetness blended with the citrus really steals the show. Almost wholesome to the point of my mouth not recognizing it as a beer. This is making me miss my military career in Germany. 

Mouth feel is a little too carbonated for the thickness of the beer. Thats about the only miss here. 

Weihenstephaner is my go to wietzen, but I must reiterate that I found a terrible inconsistency in the freshness of this beer. If youre not impressed with the bottle in front of you, try another. This is a sad state of affairs, but the pay off of a perfect Hefe is well worth it. Good luck!

Had on tap with a big slice of lemon. Poured to a nice hazy orange-red, with minimal head or lacing. Aroma was mostly wheat and bread, although some smell may have been overshadowed by the lemon. Taste was again, mostly wheat, bread and yeast, with a hint of clove spice. Finish was a little dry, though all and all, this was a good beer for a warm summer night.
Unclear, yellow. Tall white head. Yeasty aroma with banana esthers. Mild flavour. Yeast, wheat, bananas. Good carbonation. Slightly watery palate.
High head on an orange body. Hints of citrus fruitss and wheat. Well-balanced, good mouthfeel. Dry finish, very drinkable.
PERFECT HEFE WEIZEN BEER. THE FRUIT AROMA AND FLAVOR IS THE BEST IN THIS VERY WELL BREWED DRINK. NEVER DRINK IT TOO COLD, YOU´LL LOSE THE BEST IT CAN GIVE YOU.

Thanks to YBSober for sharing this beer!
This is by far the best Hefe Weizen Ive ever had.

Appearance: Pours a cloudy pale orange yellow color with a big bubbly head. (BTW dont shake this one up (to mix the sediment) or you may explode the beer all over a friends kitchen. (sorry Wayne ;)

Smell: Boy, from the time this beer exploded all over the wall =) it had a fantastic aroma of lemon and wheat with a hint of fresh baked sweet bread. 

Taste: The front of the palate is full of wheat, yeasty lemon citrus, and a nice mildly sweet breadiness. There is a nice gentle bitter that balances this beer perfectly.

Mouthfeel: Oh so smooth, a bit of a nice dry finish.

Drinkability: The most drinkable wheat I have had yet. It is truly German and I highly recommend!

Hope this is helpful.
Cheers!

poured from a 12oz bottle.  Citrus aroma, spicy, orange in color, cloudy like most good hefes, very frothy head, medium sweetness, lively, Ive never been wild about this style, but I must say this is the best hefe Ive ever drank.  An outstanding brew.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2006 Pours light orange / dark gold with a large, thick, white head. Smells fantastic - like sweet breads (as in sugar+bread, not the sweetbreads as in veal glands), with some fruit (apple, banana). The flavor delivers what the aroma promises: doughy, wheaty, sweet, delicate hop bitterness, strong flavors of yeast which include crazy flavors - most notably apple and banana. Prime example of the style.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2009 Bottle split with Tronraner in a blind hefeweizen taste. Well, this was the clear winner. The aroma was the most powerful of the four with deep spiced notes of cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, banana, and a bit of dry yeast. Very aromatic. The flavor is a notch down from the complex, rich aroma, but it still has admirable nuances. Good balance of cloves, bananas, tangy yeast, and wheat. The finish was the driest in our tasting and very lingering with rich spiced notes. Just a slight hint at earth was noticed. This is a fantastic rich, complex hefeweizen.
Pours a cloudy gold, large head. Bready, yeasty, with notes of banana and clove. Easy to drink, excellent flavor profile. Great beer.
Smooth, easy to drink wheat beer...taste reminded me of a banana filled with cloves.

On draft.  Hazy gold color with a medium-lasting off-white head.  Light citrusy aroma with some subdued yeasty notes.  The flavor was lightly bready with a pleasant, tangy finish.  Very nice and refreshing.

Bottle. Deep gold color, pours a hazy. Large sized white foamy head. Aroma is fruit estery and wheaty. A medium bodied Hefe. Malts are wheaty and fruity with lots of banana and clove flavors. Slightly sweet tasting with some peppers and spices. Light and refreshing. Nice soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Smooth taste. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
Pours honey colored with rich, off-white head.  Fruity aroma with no hop bouquet.  Malty, spicy flavor.  Classic wheat finish.

Pous a nice cloudy orange with a big white head that disapated quickly.  Aroma is clove and banana.  Flavor is a nice balance between banana, bubblegum and clove.  Finish could use a hair more bitterness, but very well balanced overall.

12 oz bottle - pours a beautiful hazy orange/yellow with a diminishing white head - Nose is spicy with yeasty notes... Flavor is banana and cloves.. with a very bready finish..   pretty good .. but not to fond of the clove taste..

Very beery beer.  Has a good malty flavor, with nice bitterness from the hops.  Being the worlds oldest brewery adds a little cool factor into the beer also.  Nice cloudy amber body with a sweet hoppy aroma.
Cloudy with a thick, but short lasting, cream head. The flavor was yeasty but a bit too sweet for my palate, however the finish was oddly salty, like pickle.

Summer is wheat beer season. Well, all year really is, but summer is a good time to meditate on weizen qualities because its too damn hot to do anything else. But I digress. Weihenstephaner is the quintessential hefeweizen. Cloudy pour with fragrant nose of yeast, banana, and some clove spice. Palate is excellent with healthy carbonation and that ever-appealing appetizing characteristic. Flavor is a nice wheat interplay of yeast and malt that revolves constantly and maintains richness. Ideal, the ur-weizen for sure.
Bottle - Cloudy yellow. Banana, orange, wheat, a little sweetness. A typical german wheatbeer.

Bottle. This beer was not overly aromatic.  The appearance is great and the feeling on the palate is excellent but overall I felt it lacked flavor complexity.  Still, it was very good and refreshing.  Could use more flavor but it was aesthetically appealing nonetheless with a beautiful color, head, and carbonation.  Not bad at all.

aroma of banana pudding.  hazy yellow under a huge, lasting, creamy head.  spicy banana dominates the flavor.  bready finish.   light to medium bodied.  this is everything a german hefe should be.  i love this beer.

500 ml bottle.  Aromas of Banana right after popping the cap.  Wonderful  Hazy orange with a huge fluffy head that seemed to breath as it diminished ever so slowly.  More banan aromas after pouring.   Add in the clove to make this a very traditional smelling Hefe.    More clove and less banana in the flavor.  Classic wheat flavor too.  Hop bite.... Not... Just like it should be.  Very good Hefe.

Nothing like a hot summer day in Atlanta for a hefeweizen.  Had this on tap, but was served in shaker pint glass.  Kind of loses some of its appeal when its not served in a weizen glass.  Anyway, nice golden color with a great aroma: banana, fruity, lemony, and clove.  Good carbonation.  Could drink lots of these at a sitting.

This German Hefeweizen pours a hazy deep gold color from a 500ml bottle. Large sized white foamy head. Aroma is fruit estery and wheaty. A medium bodied Hefe. Malts are wheaty and fruity with lots of banana and clove flavors. Slightly sweet tasting with some peppers and spices. Light and refreshing. Nice soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Smooth taste. A nice beer for a hot summer night. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

23-Jul-06 (500 ml bottle, Bottling code of 7106 (97-Ot-06?): BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Part of the $15 Weihenstephaner gift pack (5 beers & 1 glass), Im serving this in the authentic Weihenstephan Weizen glass that is part of the set, and I must say, it makes a huge difference to serve it in this glass versus a clumsy, heavy American pint glass.  This is quite simply a gorgeous beer when served in the proper vessel.  Cloudy, golden body fills this foot-tall glass and is capped by a tall, white, stiff, meringue-like head that takes ages to settle down to where I can actually sip actual beer, not head.  Small carbonation bubbles creep slowly up the side of the glass until the glass flares out, and then the bubbles pick up some momentum.  Lots of patchy lacing is left on the glass.  Banana, clove and pepper form the spice triumverate in the nose, with wheat contributing a nice base.  Similar flavors, with spices and wheat being the obvious components here.  Some banana, but more clove and pepper.  Its lightly sweet and minimally bitter.  I think the beer gets a bit too bready as it warms up, which is an obvious problem with this glass -- too much surface area, so the beer warms up very quickly.  Medium-bodied and moderately carbonated, but could be cleaner if the beer didnt finish with that breadiness.  A good Hefeweizen, certainly above average for the style, but dont let it warm up.17-Dec-05 (500 ml bottle: $2.49 at BevMo in Oceanside, CA) Having just sampled the Ayinger Bräu Weisse, this one comes up a bit short in virtually all respects.  Light banana and moderate clove in the flavor along with mild wheat, but theres a distinct bitterness toward the finish that seems too prominent and distracting to me.  The nose is only mildly aromatic, with light banana and wheat being the only real aromas I pick up.  Medium-bodied with moderate to strong carbonation,  Pale golden in color and fairly cloudy, I can barely make out the few streams of carbonation bubbles rising through the beer.  On the initial pour, the off-white head rises to well over two inches, but that soon fades to a thin, filmy layer, and all subsequent pours, the head never exceeds half an inch.  And theres no lacing either.  Honestly, Im just not all that impressed with this beer.  Perhaps it sat on the BevMo shelf for too long, a possibility that is not too difficult to imagine.  Still, I dont know how the bitterness would be caused by excessive aging. (6, 3, 6, 3, 12 = 3.0)

Offwhite medium head over light hazy orange body with ongoing carbonation. Light, spicy milky wheat aroma with faint fruity notes. Light wheaty taste with some banana notes, aftertaste is light, spicy banana and wheat. A good weizen, but very light, and lacking in character. (0.5l bottle.)

I can see why this is one of the best hefes.  Pours hazy gold with a thick white head.  Lots of banana, clove, yeast, and wheat in the nose.  The taste really follows through with the same, adding a little more spice and a lemon/citus bitterness.  Thicker mouthfeel that is lightened slightly by the carbonation.  An excellent beer all around.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2007 (Bottle BB 21/02/08) Aroma of fruits (banana, lemon), wheat and yeast. Brown yellow colour, hazy and large, white head with fair lacing. Acidic, slightly soar (finish), banana, lemon and yeasty flavour. Medium to full-bodied, slightly sticky and lively carbonated palate. Very good beer and one of my favourite wheat beers. 02/07/07 (original rating was 6/4/7/4/14)
Top notch wheat brew; banana and citrus aroma; clean, slightly spicy finish; easy drinking
Poured a hazy yellow color with a medium white head.  Yeasty aroma with notes of banana, cloves, and dough.  The flavor was acidic and citrusy with notes of lemon and clove.  Light to medium bodied.

Bottle (12oz).  Classic - label says "contains malt liquor" - yee haw!  Pours very hazy yellow with a huge lasting off-white head.  Aroma of candy malt, tons of yeast, banana, lemon and more than a little slightly sour cream, with pungent spices drawing it all together - really interesting.  Taste of spices, banana, yeast, sugary malt, lemon juice and dry wood, almost like bubblegum in the finish, really well done - mouthfeel is fairly thick, a little acidic, almost sticky, with decent carbonation and a shifting, dancing yeastiness on the tongue - I see why this is so highly rated, complex, refreshing, not overly demanding but a great quaffer.

0.5 liter bottle.  Huge foamy yeasty head, hazy yellow/golden color.  Standard array of hefeweizen aromas... Complex mix of citrus, nutmeg, clove, banana, bubblegum flavors...refreshing, perfect example of a hefeweizen

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2006 Bottle. Poured yellow-gold with a white head. Strong wheat, banana, and clove smell. Taste is the same as the smell however personally I can taste clove more than anything. Tastes like a clove cigarette to me. Not my favorite style of beer but better than other hefeweizens I have tried in the past.
Pours a yellow color with a white head.heavy banana and clove aroma.Huge banana taste that lasted a long time.Great weiss!
Orange golden with fine white head.  Aroma  and taste of citrus fruits, sweet malts & wheat. Lively carbonation - medium body. fresh though short finish!
Looks, smells, and tastes just like a hefe should.  Aromas of banana, clove, and citrus.  Taste is quite yeasty and the carbonation is big and fine.  Great beer.

Nice creamy-colored head
hazy nice yellow-golden color
smells yeasty, some banana, citrus smell (rather distinctive), some clove,smells fresh
smooth carbonation
tasts yeasty,clove a bit of banana,citrus
yeasty aftertaste with clove and a nice, a bit hidden, bitterness
Large yeasty taste with strong hint of citrus. Aroma was fairly strong. Carbonation was a little more than I expected. Still a great beer...would much prefer the Ayinger Hefe beer though

Gold and hazy in colour with strong carbonation. Typical hefeweizen aromas of vanilla, clove, banana, and a bit of citrus. Nice tangy wheat flavor, with more vanilla and banana in the mouth. A bit of spicy hops on the finish too. Very nice full mouthfeel that still refreshes. Definitely more on the vanilla/clove end of the spectrum, with the fruity notes being held in check. Classy.

Bottle 41F Weizen Glass. Big and citrusy with good notes of warm yeast, Nice and fruity but slighty spicy aroma. The appearance is cloudy dark gold, with a white and fluffy head that lasts for some time.  Wonderful notes of orange citrus, and dry slightly bready notes similar to eating dry bisquits. Sweet, sour and almost no bitterness but a hint of copper, and maybe some celery.  Very nice and refreshing.  Nice sharp carbonation, with good moderate mouthfeel.  Yet finishes so clean, a definite thirst quencher.  A good be and maybe I like it better than Franziskaner hefe, Its definately good, and easily drinkable. Es ist gut bier.

yellowish orange pour with medium white head...aroma of banana, malts, stone, and yeast..flavor is quite similar, and is heavy in citrus...it finishes with some funky mineral/sediment aftertaste...nice palate

Cloudy orange with small white head. Typical Weizenaroma of banana and lots of german malts. Pretty sweet for a weizen, not too banana-ish. Fairly wellbodied. A classic and very suitable on warmer days, but not to be ignored n the cold ones as well..

Poured with a white head with very large bubbles. I could smell the bananas and clove aroma and also taste it, but wheats just must not be my favorite. This is suppose to be one of the best german wheats and i was not all that impressed.

Bottle - Pours a hazy medium golden/orange, huge creamy white head that mostly lasts, leaves good lacing. Aroma is dominated with banana and clove, with a hint of hops in the back.  Flavor was very crip and dominated by clove notes
Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. yellow colour. Powerfull hoppy and yeasty aroma.Very bitter taste. Average finish. Creamy palate. Nice but not fantastic hefe.
Bottle. White creamy high and beautiful head. Hazy yellow body. Banana and dry malt aroma. Sweeet and light flavor with thin acidic body.

Golden to orange, cloudy beer with a thick white head.Spicy cereal nose, lots of clove, cinnamon and malt. The taste is again cerealmalt and wheat, and the strong clove spice, til a smooth malty finish. (Draught).

Slight golden haze in color. More of a hazy color with a white foamy head. Strong banana nose with a decent amount of carbonation for a hefe-weisse. Wheat absorbs the majority of the beer. Spice is abundant with pleasant palate. Very light and is excellent for this time of year.
Draft - big banana nose.  A beautiful beer!  Cloudy gold with a brilliant white head of about 2 fingers.  Big wheat and banana flavor.  I think I prefer the Franziskaner, but this is a terrific beer!

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2006 16.9oz bottle, no date.  Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with a staying fluffy white head.  Aroma of banana nut bread, some yeast, pepper, and some tart wheat.  Also some leather.  Taste  is much the same with some dust, spices and pepper coming out more in the finish.  Very little bitterness.  Finishes fairly dry. medium to light bodied, fantastic lacing.  Excellent hefe.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: UPDATED: DEC 21, 2006 A very good wheat! Pours a cloudy golden in the glass. Sweet malty, spicy, bread, clovish nose. Aromas reflected in taste including strong banana notes. A great beer!!.

Great summer beer. Pours cloudy dark golden color with a giant head that takes a while to dissipate, lots of carbonation. Smells sweet and wheaty and banana-like, maybe some clove in there too. Super malty with some honey and bananas, bit of a spicy bite at the end with a weeee bit of bitterness to make it interesting. I could drink lots of these... well, like, two.

One of my favorites-solid in every way-Pours light cloudy amber with small head-aroma is heavy wheaty banana with clove and spice background, epitome of a hefe beer. Flavor backs up aroma but also has a more cereal wheat flavor and yeasty prescence; very fruity and wheaty with a nice carbonation twinge throughout. Palate is creamy with a wheat with ripe banana aftertaste. Solid.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 First ratingRating added 6/4/2006Bottle from Swedish "Systembolaget".Very shady light yellow color. Big lasting white head. Fruity banana scent. Typical wheat beer banana taste. Very low bitterness. Sweet aftertaste.7/3/7/3/13=3.3RerateDraught at Ölrepubliken on January 7, 2017.Had this so many times, surprised I havent rerated before.Shady yellow color, big fluffy white head. Banana and light clove scent. Sweet, banana, clove taste. Sort of fizzy mouthfeel, very low bitterness. Nice and refreshing.7/4/7/3/15=3.6

pours a hazy honey with a white head.  Aroma is fresh sweet wheat, bananas, lemons, honey.  Flavor is uber smooth and balanced...honey, malt, pepper, and bananas.  Mouthfeel is very smooth and a bit dry...extremely refreshing.

Another nice German wheat beer. It didnt beat out Franziskaner, but the quality was excellent. Nice carbonation to complete the standard cloudy yellow appearance of a nice Bavarian wheat. The flavor was strong but good with a sour touch to balance the sweetness.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2006 (04.21.06)  16 oz brown bottle from Beergeek.biz.  5.4% ABV. Batch 9165. Puured hazy orange  with large white head.  No discernable carbonation. Sweet malt, fruit and spicy clove in the nose. Medium boded beer that starts with light sweet malt and smoky/clove/banana ester flavors.  Finished dry with light malt fade. Light hop bitterness detected. Well-balanced and delicious, both this beer and the dark versions are probably the finest hefeweiss beers that Ive tried thus far.  (07.06.06) UPDATE. On tap at Firkins, Libertyville, IL. Spicy smokey aroma. Poured hazy orange with medium white head. Soft carbonation. Light-to-medium bodied beer that starts with light malt sweetness and smoky clovey flavor. Some banana esters noted.  Finished dry and clean. Refreshing.  This is an excellent hefe, as good as, if not better than the bottled version. One of my favorite hefe beers. Ratings stay the same.

Pours hazy / cloudy yellow with a large pillowy head.  Aroma has citrus and banana and a very clean smelling sweetness.  There is also a bit of bread to the aroma.  Light to medium bodied beer with lots of carbonation, but soft enough not to interfer with the flavors.  Taste has lots of banana and light bits of orange.  The finish has some prickliness from the carbonation as well as flavors from the intial taste mixed in with some cloves.  Very nice beer.

Orange colored, strongly hazy appearance. Medium sized vanishing white head. Fine aroma with spices, sweetness, banana and yeast, spices fit here well. Medium bodied. Flavor has also spices with banana and yeast, aftertaste is lasting with yeast, mild dryness and alcohol. Fine weisse!

Cloudy appereance, pale golden colour, huge and really persistent head. Spicy aroma with hints of banana. This wheat beer has the sweetest flavour Ive ever found in this kind of beers, really malty, with some good banana and pear traces. Spicy aftertaste, with few bitterness. Very drinkable and pleasant, simply one of the best wheat beers on the market.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2007 Bottle from Johns Grocery poured into 20oz tumbler - Pours hazy gold with a LONG lasting 3.5 finger white head that leaves some nice lace; A pleasant aroma of wheat (duh), malt, and some light banana to the nose; Lots of citrus and a little malt on the initial taste (orange mostly); Slightly sweet, but not too much (they read my mind); A very wheaty backtaste that isnt bitter or sour at all; This is a DAMN good beer! Possibly the best hefe Ive had thus far.

ReRate of sorts: Bought a couple of bottles while in Germany. Just as I remembered. Absolutely wonderful from start to finish. The best hefeweizen Ive had bar none.
Sampled on tap.  This is indeed a delicious beer.  Lots of wheaty flavor, baking spices and a dose of lemony acidity, with just a hint of banana.  Without a doubt, one of the top hefeweizens.

Absolutely PERFECT! Everything from the aroma to the flavour to the head was just what I;d want from a hefe-weizen! Beautiful cloudy haze witha  nice bright white head. The flavour ranges from typical wheat beer to a nice citrus finish! The aroma is sweet, yet strong enough to grab your interest. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

When Im in the mood for a hefeweiss, this baby pretty much tops em all!  Extremely refreshing session style.  Great summer beer!  I liked the Hacker Pschoor and this one might be a touch better.  Yum!

Bottle.  Cloudy orange/gold with a white head.  Aromas are yeast, citrus and banana with spices.  Flavours are soft sweet malts with wheat.  Also has bready yeast and banana with lemon.  Very refreshing with a moreish dry finish.  Very nice.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 bottle - Pours hazy gold with a big, enduring head.  It smells mainly of citrus and yeast.  The flavor is both sweet with malts and sour with considerable citrus notes that are more apparent than Ive usually found in the style.  The finish is crisp and mostly sweet with maybe a hint of spice.  Pretty good.
draft - Spice was more apparent.  Tasty citrus notes and an excellent body for this style bring it up another notch.
After the 1st taste, it took me back 30 years to when I was in Germany and had my 1st taste of German beer.  So smooth, so tasty, so good.  Definitely 2 thumbs up

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2006 Poured this one into my favorite stein & cranked up "Ein Prosit Der Gemutlichkeit" on the stereo!  Three bottles filled my stein and a 3 inch head crested the top! The aroma had a burnt clove or annis scent.  The brew was savory and had an appreciable aftertaste of spice and malt! Highly recommended.

Sampled at Sunset Grill & Tap in Allston, hazy yellow gold hue, with a frothy white head, bready dough nose, with a banana and citrus fruitiness accent, with a note of clove spiciness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, bready dough and nice wheat character, note of clove spiciness and maybe nutmeg or cinnamon, candied apples, banana fruitiness, with a caramelized malt, leading towards a yeasty, fruity finish.
Nize hazy colour, big frothy head and full of fruity wheat aromas. Very drinkable and refreshing, a bit on the thin side though, still, good for its style.
Glitters nice and oragne. Quite a big white top. Very fruity (mango and banana) and spicy, hadly any bitterness or sweetness. However, quite a full body.

This beer pours a nice cloudy, golden color with a LOT head.  Aroma of citrus and wheat.  Flavor starts with a big banana taste and ends with subtle hint of clove.  Good balance between these flavors for a wheat.  I happen to be a fan of wheat beers and this is the real deal!
UPDATED: AUG 29, 2006 Very nice deep golden cloudy pour, long lasting and creamy head. Spicy and fruity with hints of wheat malt, banana and a satifying smoothness. A very refreshing thirst quencher.
Nice pour with big billowy head. Cloudy Golden Color. Very sweet taste. Definitly the best wheat Ive ever had, but still not sold on the category.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2006 Bottle at Issac Newtons with Stegosaurus. Pours a cloudy yellow, with a white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, wheat. Flavor is of bananas, citrus, wheat, very smooth and refreshing.
drank in a snifter nice head very good heffe a banana taste fresh citrusa little floral. just a good full bodied beer you can enjoy.

better than average. pours out of the bottle a yellow-golden-hay hue w/ a thin but frothy white head that dissipates slowly but surely. a little bit watery but light and freshing on the palate. flavors overall a little simple and weak despite strong clove aroma and taste which is overdone. also bananas. yeasty aroma and flavors.  easy to drink. could def. have more than 1.
menial.  listed as the 3rd best hefe, i guess i had higher expectations.  though light body and character are the hallmarks of the hefe, i just need more flavor than this guy has to offer.

Pours a straw colour haze. White fully head. Nose is wheat and banance. Taste is well balanced with clove, honey, wheat, yeast and some bananers. Well put together, nothing offsetting. I could sip on these all day! Happy retirement Bergkamp. Us Gunners gonna miss you.

Blonde and cloudy with good rising head.  Citrusy and yeasty wheat nose.  This has a spicy flavor, with a bitter citrus tang, a hint of banana, and a good balance of wheat.  Simple yet very refreshing.
Bottle.  Cloudy amber pour...big fluffy white head.  Big yeasty, spicy nose...flavor follows suite.  Cloves, spice, light citrus...tasty.  Medium-bodied and smooth.  Pretty good hefe.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2009 Bottle courtesy of Philip. Hazy gold pour, lots of cloudiness, with a head that tops most, that is beige, and lasts for a while. Not what I was expecting in the aroma at all. I was expecting a banana whallop, but instead Im getting a yeasty punch with a smack of cloves and spices to folow it up. Very much a clove flavour, with spices, some fruit, and creamy oranges. Smooth finish, with lingering wheat finish. Thanks so much Phil, Im glad I got to try it finally.

50 cl bottle. Yeast at the bottom. Light amber cloudy colour with a great huge head. Great aroma of bread, yeast and hints of banana. Very fresh flavour og wheat with a great combination of the fine yeast, very little bitter. Very lively palete.
This  is a good hefeweizen, but I still rather stick with a fraziskaner.  Cloudy golden, slight aroma of fruit, taste is a bit wheaty, maybe a hint of banana.

Golden unclear, very fast disappearing white head leaving thick laces; A little citrus in a otherwise clove, yeast dominated nose; Little acidy in the body but great carbonation (not all that big in comparison with other weizen beers), very little power; Long, but watery finish with lots of clove and some late acidity.

0.5 L bottle, bbe Sep 06. Light veiled dark golden with a fine sparkle. The head is not huge yet stable and quite lacy. The aroma is yeasty, floral, orangey, also slightly sulfurish and acidic. Very round and full taste, slightly acidic. There is an elegant, fruit stone or nut-like bitterness in the aftertaste. Yeast notes appear when the beer warms up. Full body, lively palate, dry finish. Great balance.

12oz bottle ink jet on back label: 7425 -pours a big 4 finger, foamy to creamy white head that laces with hazy straw/yellow color.  Aroma is cinnamon, clove.  Taste is cinnamon, clove, spicing is a bit strong although the beer is smooth.  Mild carbonation.  More than an occasional beer.

Pour is hazy golden yellow with a nice fluffy white head...smell is banana and clove...wheat flavor is more apparent than most german hefes Ive had...some nice spicy notes throughout...nice subtle fruit finish...

Bottled, 500ml. Lemon gold cloudy, bubbly head. Initially thin and light on the pallate, making a search for flavours imperaive. Then comes cloves and banana, a boiled sweet note with pear drops. All very well, but it is a mish mash of flavours which never gives the impression of beer.

- I poured this from a 500 ml bottle into a pint glass.  So, shoot me.  I find that at 45 I need to update my beer glass collection.  I poured slowly and then dumped the last little bit of the bottle in.  I held it up to a light in time to see the yeast come down like an octopus through a very clear straw colored beer.  Then things got cloudy.  It had about a 1/2 inch head that died to soon.
It smelled of clove and banana and had the same taste.  I am disappointed.  Ive had this on tap before and there was a definite difference.  Ill have to go back to the pub and try another.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2016 Bottled.  Hazy dark yellow pour and an acceptably fluffy off-white head.  Massive aroma of wheat, yeast, and citrus.  Banana and bubblegum/cloves aromas are muted.  Smooth!  Tongue makes up for the banana the nose was missing.  Citrus is louder in the mouth, as well.  Spicy with a lasting, complex aftertaste.  Fresh, thirst-quenching, and unlike its neighbor, Paulaner, clean.  Have to agree, this is overrated, but that doesnt take away from the enjoyment - should be one of the top Weizen in the world, a toss-up with Maisels for my favorite. [2006.03.17: 4.0]
There are bottles that come in too clean, even bland, but thats part of the charm.  I generally have a pretty high banana threshold, and so this isnt really doing it for me there, and it certainly isnt overflowing with cloves.  I do love the yeast, though, which makes smooth all-rounders, and this old classic remains one of my go-to favorites, even though others may surpass it; theres something to be said for extreme consistency in such an inherently unstable product.  [2016.11.16: 4.0]

went to the wehenstephaner house in muenchen.  hazey golden pour with flecks of brown species floating.  large white sponge ridden head.  nose of spice and earthen bananas.  flavor spills onto a velvety palate that enhances the banana bread flavors.  good stuff.
Bottle: Cloudy golden colour, big white heavy head, aroma is fruity heavy with wheat and notes of banana and vanilla. Taste is very well balanced and refreshing, finishes a bit weak.

Pours a beautiful cloudy, honey color, with a nice lasting head. Taste is smooth and refreshing with very little bitter finish. Nice malty flavor with citrus accents but nothing too overpowering. A great brew.

Cloudy amber body with big white head. Aroma is banana, clove and apricots. The flavor is fruity, bananas and some citrus, light touch of spice, with a dry, slightly bitter finish. The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy.

Poures a cloudy golden color with a large pillowy head that lasts through the beer. Has an aroma of bananas and yeast. Flavor is citrus and bananas along with yeast and slight cloves. Has a crisp, thin mouth to it and finiches mildly bitter. A very nice hefeweizen.
Bottle. Aroma is enveloping and soft, with lots of banana and vanilla. Flavors of lemon, banana, wheat, and yeast. Light, sweet, balanced, and a touch of dryness - an outstanding weizen.
Light hefeweizen. Hazy yellow colour with a medium mostly lasting head. Weak taste of wheat and citrus. not the best hefeweizen around.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2006 50cl bottle. Poured murky yellow-tan (not a terribly appetizing color) into a footed pilsner glass with a huge foamy white head. Aroma is primarily yeast and DMS, with some banana apparent only immediately after the pour. Flavor is yeasty and grainy with definite DMS, though the latter is quite well-controlled. Definite clove note in some sips though not in others. Lightly bitter. Longish finish with bubblegum, then banana, then some sweetness coming through in layers. A little thin on the palate, but crisp, lively, and refreshing. Highly drinkable. Definitely the best of the three bottled hefeweizens I have tried recently (Franziskaner and Paulaner are the others) and the only one I would consider buying again.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2011 Bottle on 04/03/2011 from Once Upon a Vine - South. Hazy pale golden body with a small creamy white head. Sweet spicy and clove aroma with faint banana character and a wheat background. Dry wheat flavor with light clove and hints of banana. Medium light body with moderate carbonation. 7/3/7/3/13 - 3.3

02/27/2006 - Hazy amber color with a thin white head. Spicy aroma with hints of sweetness. Flavor of sugar with spice in the end. 7/3/8/3/12 - 3.3
6th Dutch Ratebeer Gathering. Very light brew, a bit sweet. Very nice finish. A bit fruity aroma. Nice!
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2008 This is a delicious beer. I enjoyed it very much. Not so common here now, but Im always on the lookout for it.
Wasnt a bad brew, but didnt have my expected Hefeweizen flavor. Not bad,not great.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2007 Pours out cloudy gold with a mammoth head.  Aroma of bananas and bubblegum.  Flavor is much of the same.  Palate is pretty smooth and not overly carbonated.  Would be a good beer for the golf course.  One of the best hefes Ive ever had.  Enjoyable to drink.  Significantly better than the Weihen Kristalweizen.  Damn, this beer is better than I thought.  I drank the half liter in like 15 minutes...its tasty.  (rerate)  God I love this beer.  Definitely the archetype of bavarian hefes.  I can never imagine a time when i would not want to drink this.  Thus the huge overall score. RERATE again.  just got a new case of this from a more reputable distributor.  i can tell this is a lot fresher.  just a really creamy texture and flavor.  Rerate.  Ive been through a few cases of this by now and i think that is quite a testament.  This beer can do it all.  if youre just thirsty from a long day in the heat it quenches you.  if you want a subtle yet sophisticated beer  its all there.  i fucking love this beer and im a hophead.  so easy to drink, low in calories, unfortunately its like $9 a six pack.

Pours a very hazy pale yellow topped with a two finger frothy head that slowly settles to a nice cap that stays throughout the entire beer and leaves behind lots of lacing.

Smell; really nice yeasty smell with a slightly over ripe bananas. Theres a bit of lemony citrus going on as well as some cloves.

Taste; wheat and yeast stand out along with the bananas, theres also some of that citric lemon and cloves. It has a bit of a spicy hoppiness in the finishand just a bit on the dry side. Mouthfeel is is medium bodied, with nice carbonation, and goes down so smooth.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: Bottle. Pours pale, cloudy, and a small white head. Banana, citrus, and hay in the nose. Flavos was kinda thin- but not bad. Same as in the nose.
this brew made me feel like i was on a boat, and that boat was red, and everyone knows that red boats arent allowed in the ocean.
Wow, this is one of the best hefes Ive ever had. Orange in it maybe, but certaily worth trying. I could actually drink more than one of these, rather than the usual struggle to get through a bottle.
In my opinion the best Waizen beer. Very clean and fruity taste, that reminds of banana.  Nice and aromatic smell

Poured a hazy, dark golden color with a huge white head that left nice lacing on the glass,  Aroma of banana and clove, wheat, lemongrass, and other sweet malts.  Taste of citrus, tart wheat, banana and lots of spices.  Creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2007 Everything a great weissbier should be. A beautiful bright yellow creamy butter hue w/ a full, creamy froth. Superb head retention that slowly reduces to a full silky canopy and lace. Aromas of banana cream, vanilla, and mellow citrus. Medium full nectar on the palate really infuses the complex flavors of vanilla, lemony citrus rind, honey, and spicey banana cream. Mildly medicinal w/ a fruity mild sweetness . Every great weissebier needs a little medicine in its portfolio. The finish has a slight acidic twitch to it clearing the palate for the next sip. Overall: a classic specimen. Creme de la creme! Thoroughly enjoyed and highly recommended.

The aroma has bananas, wheat, sugar, floral hops, spices, citrus, and mild sourness. The appearance is cloudy gold with a large foamy white head. The taste has cloves, bubblegum, wheat, bananas, citrus, and some bitterness. The aftertaste is malty and tangy. The thin palate is the only disappointing part of this otherwise very good beer.
Pours a nice cloudy gold with healthy head that recedes without lacing.  Lively with creamy wheat and yeast.  Abrupt bitter finish.
Cloudy gold with a big white head. Yeasty, wheat, fruit aroma. Nice tangy fruit taste that gives way to a banana flavor. Good beer.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2006 Draught at Tylers in Durham, NC. Hazy yellow-orange color with bubbly white head. Complex aroma including bananas, clove, yeast, and caramel. Tangy fruit up front, but not overly. Nice grainy aftertaste. Very good hefe.

This beer pours a fresh sqeezed orange juice color and leaves a thick white lace. The smell is aromatic orange, lemon zest, grass, hay, summertime in a bottle.
