The taste of this beer is so smooth it goes down so easy, lemon, grassy notes, with some subtle orange sweetness lingers on the palate in the finish. This is a simple hefe that just satisfies the tounge with fresh malty sweetness.
Poured a cloudy yellow with an enormous white head. Awonderful yeasty fragrance and taste. Best served with bratwurst.

"good beer, not my favorite hefe. Pour a cloudy yellow with a massive head. Aroma was of cloves and way to much banana. The flavor was over run by banana. Would put franz and paulaner are better though. "

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2006 pours a cloudy yellow, with a large foamy white head, lemony wheat aroma, flavor is of bananas and wheat smooth, reminded me of hacker pschorr weisse just a little thinner in body, flavor is great, this beer is smooth and crisp, worth a try.

The worlds oldest brewery comment on the label sold me on this beer.  I figured theyve had the longest to make a good product so why not try it.... and It didnt disappoint.
Pours a golden yellow with plentiful white head that lasts.  Aroma of wheat with a strong mild lemon scent.  Flavor is full wheat with some lemon and there is a bubblegum presence that appears after the immediate after-taste.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2009 Bottle from Slob Thanks! Pours a light yellow with nice lacing. Aroma of blunt lemon and wheat. Slight bubblegum hints in the background. Flavor is rounded banana and a full wheat flavor. A hint of lemon in the finish. A nice, light hefe. Repeat? Heck yeah.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
On tap at Old Munich Biergarten in Bradenton, Fl:

Pours a cloudy golden color with a big white frothy head. Aroma is yeasty with hints of wheat and banana. Flavor is yeasty and light on the hops with a smooth sweet finish. I would definitely try this again.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a thick white frothy head. Typical, but not aggressive,  aroma of banana esters and wheat malt. The banana clove and sweetness typical of this style was very tame in this example. Texture was a bit too fizzy. Finish has some faint bitterness, and is chalky and earthy. Maybe this was not a fresh sample, but I found this to be a rather generic  Hefeweizen.

Cloudy, fine carbonation and a big white head that falls after a few minutes to a more manageable size.  Distinct and expected tangy wheat aroma.  Typical wheat beer flavours with the wheat tangclearly there, with just enough hop to prevent sweetness.... personally I prefer my wheats a bit hoppier than this

a light orange straw color white laced head.  Light aroma some lemon rind & grains.  Avg palate that coated fairly well and was nicely cabonated.  Flavor is bananna & grain w/ some other light sweet notes.  Decent.

Bottle.  Poured out a cloudy light orange-brown color with a huge foamy ivory head that took quite a while to disipate, a great looking beer.  The aroma was full of yeast, banana and wheat.  The flavor contained banana, citrus and yeast on the outset with a smidge of bitter hops on the finish.  Very smooth palate, and quite delicious overall, quite possibly the best Hefeweizen Ive had.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2006 Smells very nice and it has got a aroma of a mixture of banana, yeast and citrus. It appears beautiful in chilled condition and the palate is just fantasticly smooth. Normally weissbier isnt my favourites, but this one is fantasticly nice!

Pours cloudy brass with a big dense foamy head that lasts well and sticks to the glass as it recedes.  I got aromas of straw, yeast, grape, banana, vanilla and herbs.  Flavor was bright and tart, highly carbonated, with notes of malt, wheat, yeast, citrus, herbs, and hops.  One of the better wheats Ive tasted and I generally dont care for them.  Slightly bitter, clean and dry finish.
Pours a hazy golden orange.  Aromas of bread/clove/ and some fruit.  Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice.

This was a good beer. The aroma was banana/bubble gum and the head was a creamy off-white that diminished about a quarter of the way down. The body was of a typical wheat but with no sediments and was a golden orange in color. The flavor was a sweet and a light bitter that hit the back of the throat but with a shorter finish than I would hope.

Aroma is spicy, ripe, chewy and yeasty, as a wheat beer should be. Unfortunately, this one comes up a little short on the flavor... its got nice banana, bubblegum, yeast and pepper, but its really unassertive and unfulfilling. The finish is nonexistant.

Bottle.  Thanks to my Secret Santa.  Lovely cloudy yellow-orange pour with a soft, billowy head.  Scents of banana and spice on the nose.  Creamy, viscous, citrus, spicy, banana flavors upon drinking.  Refreshing and delicious and and I love the style

Pours cloudy yellow with a tight, white head. Nose is complex, with yeast, banana, wheat and a bit of bubblegum. Flavor is wheat, yeast, sweet fruits. Spicy finish - a bit of clove. Really a nice Hefe!

A huge, rocky head lasts and is quaffable (as frothy lemon/spice) over a murky, golden-wheat, with the last dregs of yeasts sinking like wispy clouds. Aroma is at first banana, then immense clove takes over, thick & smoky. Notes of lactose and alcohol. Stable flavor with all of the above showing up at one point or another. Finish is spicy & softly tart. Mid-bodied with watery leanings. Just what I wanted... a very good Hefe!
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Bridgeview, IL 60455<font size=-1>

Pours hazy orange with a thick, creamy wonderful head. Citric, banana, clove nose with some hints of sweet bubblegum. Thick, fruity flavour. Wheaty and somewhat yeasty. Refreshing, with a little bitterness.
I did not care for this beer.  I guess I am not a big fan of Hefeweizens.  I will eventually get used to them, but I dont really like the strong after taste with them.
Nice rich hefeweizen.  A little to bitter for my  taste and I got a little to much of the hop oil to enjoy it.  Even the normal lemon didnt help.  A very pleasent beer, but left much to be desired.

.5 L bottle.  Pours a light gold with about a 1 inch head.  Aroma is very spicy, with banana and wheat floating around as well.  This tastes just like a good german hefe should.  Sweet banana flavor is in front, with the spice and yeast taking a back seat.  A great hefe!
Had during a beer tasting party.  Poured very hazy with smells of strawberry/banana with some clove.  Sweet but nice.
Bottle. Nice, wheaty and spicy aroma. Very big, semi-stable white head. Cloudy golden colour. Very spicy flavour balanced nicely by the mild wheat and OK bitter finish. Needs to be fresh, though.
Yeasty and finishes sour.  No bitterness to speak of.  I wanted to really like this beer but the sourness puts me off to it.

How could I have not entered a rating for this?  Well, its been described all too well by other more eloquent raters, so I will just describe this as my go-to weizen.  Light, tart, tangy, wheaty, with the right mix of banana and clove, always to my knowledge fresh-tasting and never had a bad bottle.  Bottoms up, I love weizens.
Slight citrus, creamy, with banana, marshmallow, and a slight bitter (orange peel) finish, huges head (stays very long) one of the best weissbier

Pours hazy orange-gold with a huge eggshell head. Classic hefeweizen aroma, with the cloves dominant over the banana. Very yeasty, too, and theres some wheat, of course. The flavor is quite yeasty, with the banana playing a larger part than it did in the aroma. The aftertaste is quick and fruity. Very good.

Lots of wheaty goodness in the nose and body.  Yeasty nose with a slight hint of bubblegum.  Definently that classic weiss flavor going on here, and it is done well. As with most beers, this one is better on tap. There seems to be an extra fullness and sweetness that is lacking in the bottled version.
Above-average German hefe, enjoyable as a session beer.  Not too much in complexity department.  I would have liked to tasted more cloves/esters.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2006 NIce Weizen, I have not tried one like this like in months, but other hefes good as well, but different. This was really spicy in flavor, and really Weizen.

Hazy yellow/orange colour. Big white long lasting head. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Bananas and cloves in the flavor aswell. But also a malty taste with hints of hops in the aftertaste. This is a lovely weissbier.
Tap: Very cloudy yellow body with a white head. Banana, citrus and wheat aroma and flavor. Low bitterness. Typical for the style with no flaws. Nice.

The beer poured a semi hazy straw color with a nice white head that had good lacing.  The aroma of this beer was of bananas and cloves.  The taste was dominated with bananas, a little vanilla, cloves, and esters.  This is a good hefe.
Not one of my favorite weisse beers, but still pretty good. Im used to Schneider Original so the body on W is a disappointing.
A very good hefe, properly served (draft, at the brewery tap). Hints of grapfruit, nice orange/brown colour.

500ml. bottle.  Hazy golden/orange color with a large white head. Aroma of cloves, wheat malt and banana. Flavor was similar to the aroma, except the cloves were more prominent, with a bit of citrus as well.
As Ive come to discover, Bavarian wheat beers dont seem to offer much variance from a standard mean; this is no exception.
In the bottle at the Huber Haus German Bier tasting. Hazy yellow-blonde color with a serious white fluffy head. Pronounced clove aroma. Full body with dry palate and a tart finish. Yummy.
A tad more flavorful than the original, yet not unique enough for me among the vast array of German beers.

Bottle 0,5Lt. Typical Hefeweizen hazy yellow color. Thick lasting head.  Malty and yeasty aromas. Rich flavors of banana, yeast and a touch of citrus. A very good hefeweizen ! Will defenetly buy again (many times :) )
A light beer with a good wheat flavor.  I wish this was a little less light affected. I bet this was a great beer when it was fresh.  It has a matly finish with a lite hop taste.  Good Beer.

Mmm! I enjoyed this at a typical pub/restaurant in east Berlin.
Smells of synthetic banana, yeast and wheat.
Tastes rich and seet, refreshingly mild in a way somewhere between hoppy, citric and spicy.
Cooling and enjoyable.
It has a childish and creamy flavour.
Tap, cloudy yellow, refreshing nose and mouthfeel, nicely spiced. Mouth of banana clove, wheat, and another flavor I couldnt pick out. Great finish, awesome hefe.
Half liter bottle. Hazy yellow with a large, persisitant white head. Nose of wheat, hops, and yeast. Flavor of spice and yeast with a dry, mildly hoppy finish. Refreshing.

Hazy pale gold with a big pillowy head. Initially esters dominate the aroma, but after a short time sweet spice, vanilla, yeast, and bubblegum take over. Great flavours of clove, banana, wheat and a little citrus oil.  Im not a heffe fan, but I loved this-- it actually got even better toward the finish. Ordinarily I find that there is a funny taste that accompanies many heffes that gets up into my nose and becomes annoying after one pint (Ive always thought that maybe this was related to histamines associated with the yeast and wheat interplay, but I cant be sure), but I didnt get that sense at all with this beer-- 100% fantastic!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Medium lasting head, cloudy. Fruity aroma, delicious taste - creamy,fruity (but not too much), high carbonation makes it good in this case. Drinks very well, excellent
This beer sampled at Brew Ha Ha 2005:  Pours a cloudy golden color with a good head that left pretty quick.  Aroma was slightly fruity with a wheat background.  Good taste with citrus and wheat.

Pour is your cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma is wheaty and vanilla.  Flavor is nice.  Lots of clove and yeast combine to make a nice banana flavor.  Very silky and smooth as it goes down.  I think the Franzikaner is better but this brew is very tasty.  The Germans know how to make the best hefes!

On tap at Tylers in Durham, NC. Beautiful cloudy yellow color with a thick white head. Aroma is spicey and slightly fruity. Wonderful banana flavor with some hops and a lot of spices. Nice citrusy finish with a lingering yeast taste. Great beer.

Bottled: Pours and looks just like a good little hefe should - cloudy pale gold with a big white head.Aroma wheaty with the expected clove and citrus notes. Flavour is the expected tart wheat with under tones of banana and citrus. Smooth mouthfeel. Pretty good all round just missing some verve.
Nice big head.  But I think that some of that carbonation turned me a bit off on the palate.  Good taste of wheat, citrus, and bannana.

500mL bottle.  A hazy straw pour with a thin, fizzy off-white head.  Lots of bananas, clove and yeast in the aroma.  Carbonation is VERY high, and unfortunately detracts from the taste quite a bit.  Still, quite yeasty and tangy.  Lemony and wheaty with just a touch of pepper in the finish.  Thin-bodied.  Very crisp and refreshing.

Hazy golden orange with lots of big bubbles producing a medium sized head that receded gradually to a thin film. A yeast burst was the first impression of the aroma, with the typical banana & cloves evident, but not prominent. On tasting was where it all fell apart. The flavour was a bit bland, and the mouthfeel was quite rubbery and metallic, with too much carbonation. After looking forward to this being a fan of the hefe, I was a bit disappointed unfortunately.
Very good Hefewizen.  In my opinion, its better than the Franzikaner version, but is not quite so widely available.

Bottle, at home.
Light amber with large white head, almost lasting, fine lacings. Aroma moderate malty, light hoppy and yeasty (citrus, fruit, refreshing). Flavor light sweet, moderate acidic. Light to medium body, watery, lively carbonated.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2008 Typical hefe aroma of banana, bubble gum, and cloves.  Taste is clean, bubbly, and slightly fruity. Mouthfeel is light and carbonation is high. The wheat comes through very clean in the finish, slightly less fruity tasting than Paulaner.  Still the standard.

Nice golden color, slightly hazy.  Full yeasty aroma, like a great hefeweizen, with a nice wheat beer taste.  Very drinkable, and a great summer beer.
Overall, about average (since I am very particular when it comes to wheat beers).
oh this is good, this is what beer should taste like...  a good clean refreshment, no bitterness, no fruit flavors just good clean beer.
(B0ttle 50 cl) Deep golden colour and a gigantic head. Aromas of yeast and fruit. Very fresh with lots of fruit esters and a very dry finish. 240800
A good example of hefe weissbier. The best Ive found in my home town so far.

Pours a muddy golden colour with a thin white head. Aromas of clove, banana, pepper. The flavour, although typical hefe, was quite well done, aforementioned aromas in the taste as well as crisp carbonation. Its quite possible this isnt as good when it warms up but my sample didnt last that long. A tasty hefe for sure.
UPDATED: AUG 15, 2005 I cant explain this one -- it reminds me of levitation and negative sorts of it.  And farting chairs.  Long live Chales the Fifth.  And Ingrid, cause shes fn cool.

The creamy banana and clove aroma is making me hungry.  Lively carbonation leads to medium body that is loaded with banana, vanilla and spice.  The finish isnt overly dry, leaving me wanting more.  Well done.
Not a typical wheat fan but enjoyed this draft. Bananna flavors with a nice fresh finish. Lemon juice maybe it a little less bitter.

Poured a cloudy golden from a bottle. Nice white, multi-sized head and lacing, especially for a weissbier. Aroma is sweet and wheaty. Taste is smooth, yeasty and citrusy. Wheat adds a nice flavor. Carbonation adds nicely to the feel of this beer and the wheat/yeast combination result in a dry palate. Im always amazed at weissbiers (like this one) that taste naturally citrus. Why is it customary to squeeze lemon juice?

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2007 From the bottle.
Pours a cloudy wheat with a great big head. 
The aroma is sweet lemon, yeast, spice, banana esters, and the essence of beer. The flavor is a classic and delightful wheat beer, and the palate is smooth and easy to drink. This one goes down beautifully on a summer day, but not at the expense of soul. A very fine beer.

this didnt live up to my expectations.  i have had homebrew hefes much better than this.  this was very basic-- lemon, banana, and wheat grains.  nothing too out there.  i liked lots of other wheat beers better.

Bottle poured cloudy orange yellow.
Aroma is lemon and citrus and yeast.
Flavor is yeasty with fruit and banana tones.
Yeasty lemon finish.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2007 Slightly hazy golden/yellow color, huge white head. Aroma has nice rotten banana, wheat yeastiness, pepper and clove. Huge rotten banana flavor, very chewy/yeasty pepper and clove in the finish. Aftertaste is all banana. Great mouthfeel, perfect carbonation. Very well done. Glad I checked back in on this.

Thanks for scoring this one lilkem. A lemon, hay, and bubblegum aroma. A golden apperance with a large head. The flavor was wheat, lemons, bubblegum, and hay. The mouthfeel is dry and doughy. I dont care for the style but I will give it some props for being right on par. Good summer beer.
Had aromas of vanilla and banana. Cloudy orange body with creamy white head. Flavor is of light citrus varity of lemon and banana. Smooth easy drinking hefe, good beer.
The aroma did not at first impress me, but the mild clove taste and light aftertaste sold me quickly.  Very smooth and not in the least bad tasting. I liked this hefeweizen very much..

Nice and dark cloudy gold with fluffy head but no lacing.Nice wheat,yeast and malt aroma. Full-bodied and creamy, this very flavorable.Nice, smooth and tasty.Probably the best wheat beer I have had so far.

A darker yellow-tan color than the average hefeweizen with a healthy pillowy head and aroma of cereals, cloves, and a bit of yeast.  Mouthfeel is full and creamy, rich.  Taste here is dominated by the wheat malt, with banana flavor muted relative to other hefes.  Light clove spice in the finish, but doesnt have much sharpness.  A unique hefeweizen indeed, more malty and rich than spicier, spritzier interpretations.

Bottle: Hazy yellow, very thick and somewhat dirty, large white frothy head, nice lacing, strong carbonation.   Clove on the nose, no real banana, slightly yeasty/bready.   Slight banana emergence on the tongue, cloves, and quite bready/doughy.   Wheaty mouthfeel, average body, but very clean and crisp.   Very slight citrus on the finish, bready, with lingering clove and spices.   An old standby when I want a German Hefe.

Bottle.  Got this one from Homebrewerguy and saved it for a hot ass summer day.  Here it is, and down it goes.  Not bad nose in this golden beauty, but not as spicy as I had expected.  Pours bubbly with a fine carbonation and a quickly disappearing head.  Nose of straw, clove, and slight malt.  Nice wheat beer flavor with a little banana, a little clove, and some other spices.  Great yeast used here as the carbonation is perfect for a weissbier.  Refreshing and easy quaff... not as good as Penn Weizen, but a fine brew.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2005 Aroma is banana big time, with clove and a little grassy. Taste is wheaty, clove and has a little sourness to it, which is a little different. One ill have again maybe after diner wasnt the best time to have it as it seemed a little bland.

Re-rating: Excellent hefeweizen, better than before and never a dull moment with it.

Poured with a deep white head that slowly diminished but some head lasted throughout. Little lacing. Strong smells of banana, with some mango and dough. Great lemon, hoppy flavor. Light body. Great for the warm afternoon.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2005 Nice hazy amber color with a thick head.  Aroma full of wheat and citrus.  Very flavorful.  Enjoyed this one a lot, need to go buy some more.
Medium yellow color with a  slight orange hue.  Think head and citrusy aroma.  Nice bubbly body, with flavors of lemon, cirtus, bananas and honey.  Pleasant tart finish.

[bottle from peckhams] pours a cloudy yellow/orange colour with a large fluffy head which lasts most of the way through the beer. the nose is fruity and musty with some banana, and a little citrus sharpness. body is light and spritzy with a good refreshing finish, an excellent hefeweizen.
[bottle from peckhams] pours a cloudy honey colour. smells of mango, sweet. light, spritzy body with a sour finish.
Poured a milky yellow-orange and 50% foam.  Sharp banana juice aroma; sweet and frothy .. mellow fruit, yeast (for sure) and a nice tingle on the tongue.  Beautiful.
a nice Hefe-Weizen in a rather modern style ... drier and less sweety than Paulaner or Schneider Weisse, medium bodied .... a perfect thirst quencher for the hot season ....

17oz - Sweet yeast and wheat flavor with hints of lemon and vanilla.  A bueatiful pour with a dark yellow body, champange bubbles, and a huge head that leaves no lacing.  Flavor matches aroma with a bread dough aftertaste that is slick and smooth.  A great hefe for anytime.
Dark yellow with a hint of orange.  Cloudy.  Aroma of citrus and some wheat.  Same with the flavor.  This drink is very refreshing.  Great overall.

Nice cloudy straw colour straight out of the bottle.  A nice white foamy head that gives off some of its great spicey citrusy aroma.  Banana is also present in the nose, a sweet wheat fresh bread smell.
The flavour is nice, a pretty little bite in the mouth with more of the initial spice and bread characteristics.
The finish is smooth, abundant carbonation gives it a little extra bite on the swallow.  There is some nice bitterness that leaves you wanting more.  Very nice.
A great refreshing beer. Would be amazing when your thirsty on a hot day. Crisp, sweet, bananas, and spice. A very good beer.
This has got to be the best Hefe i have ever had. Delicious banana and clove flavor.  Looks just amazingly appetizing.  This is the type of beer i could drink at breakfast time, its that tasty.
Excellent summer beer. Theres your usual banana-clove flavor, but this one doesnt hide the alcohol as others. Not overwhelming though.

Very cloudy and deep gold in color with a strong white head. A nice citrus and malty-yeasty flavor with a crisp finish, but you can detect a complex fange of flavors. The alcohol content is not completely hidden, but it is not strongly present either. A fantastic summer beer,

Pours a very pale hazy gold with a thick rocky ivory head. Lots of fine lace. Smell is spicy (cloves) and fruity (ripe banana). Lightly peppery

Smooth and creamy in the mouth. Lightly sour wheat malt. Ripe banana and spicy clove and underlying pepper. Some lemon flavor underneath, lemon rind. Crisp, dry finish. An easy drinker for the hot Georgia summer. If its not my new favorite hefeweisse, its in the top three.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 Bottle sainsbury ashfordPours and looks like a wheat beer with hazy golden body and white head.  Some yeast, banana, citrus on nose.  Not the best wheat beer in the world but perfectly acceptable. Re rate at the brewery Stuberl. On tap. Its beautiful .  So soft and approachable. Banana and mango. Soft in mouth. Almost banana syrup. Absolutely outstanding. The cereal the toffee the banana.  Really blew me away.

Poured a cloudy golden color with a small rather well-maintained creamy head.  Aroma was very yeasty with some wheat.  Flavor had some banana & spices.. along with some wheat & grass.  Light-to-medium bodied, and a smooth hoppy finish.
Fairly large fizzy white head that quickly diminished pretty quickly.  Cloudy yellow/orange body.  Nice spicy aroma.  Sweet bannany flavors.

poured a hazy golden color with sizable white head.  highly carbonated giving it a seltzer water flavor.  flavors included citrus and banana - almost a smoothish flavor as well as some clove like spice.  seemed to be lacking something.  decent.

Cloudy yellowish gold pour. Banana and clove aroma.  Clove immediately present in the mouth, banana flavor comes on in the aftertaste. good carbonation.  tough to judge this beer, as i am not too familiar with the style. decent beer.

Bottled at DBF 2005.
Unclear golden colored with a white head.
Sweet aroma of bananas with notes of spices and yeast.
Flavour of bananas, spices and yeast with acidic notes.

Who knew hot dog juice could taste so good? This is the one beer where my wife has to make apologies and not me. I dont get this beer and she swears by it. Taste funky to me. The ONLY thing that keeps the rating high is that NOTHING tastes like this. She just got a sixer of it so its freah and it tastes like it always does. Hot dog watery. Ill concede it still tastes "good" but then I like hot dogs. Just not something I could drink a lot of.
Good hefe. Glorious bubbling cloudy yellow with enormous rocky head. Clove/banana/blackcurrant? aroma. Medium body, minerally finish.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2008 Cloudy yellow-gold colour with thick white head.  Sweet banana and clove aroma with hints of other fruity aromas as well.  A kiss of citrus and toast.  Lightly smokey phenols with a nice wheaty full mouthfeel.  Fresh and very tasty.

Beautiful, big head atop a slightly dark golden body.  Very nice hefe flavor with lots of banana and spice, some citrus as well, but not the leading aroma/flavor, and hints of apple, as well.  Aroma along the same lines as the flavor.  Fine mouthfeel.

Bottle. Attractive hazy golden with billowing head. Didnt get much banana or clove aroma some citric fruit with a hint of exotic fruit and vanilla but nothing really dominant. Quite yeasty with mild acidity. A touch watery in the body but fortunately not too fizzy for me.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a big white head. Wheaty banana aroma and a dry banana taste. Medium body and a sweet finish.

(bottle) Hazy orange colour with a big but diminishing foamy white head. Clovy banana aroma with wheat. Nice banana fruity taste with almost creamy texture and a spicy yeasty finish. A good and refreshing Weizen !

Lightly cloudy golden color with a big white head that settles quickly but sticks around. Mild nose of yeast, banana, citrus, and spice. Palate is refreshing like a Hefe should have. Flavors of spice is most noticable, with mild banana and citrus flavors. A refreshing summer beer.
UPDATED: JUL 29, 2007 Excellent weissbier, but it is hard to make these as memorable as a good stout. At any rate, this is refreshing, full-bodied, citrussy thirst-quencher.

Buff colored and cloudy with a fat fluffy white head. Sharp and spicy in aroma with clove and banana, some wet blanket. Light bodied with a rock candy finish. Flavor is of  mild banana followed by a bit of a clove bite. A good Hefe but somewhat over rated. But hey, Ive never had it in Germany.

Wonderfully fragrant hefeweizen. Just a pity that the flavour doesnt quite match the promise. Intense gold colour with a lasting head. Terrific aroma, big and spicy, with unexpected fruit cake characters. Very inviting. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Bananas are the dominant flavour. A little tart on the tongue with some spice but just a little lacking in complexity. (Bottle)
hazy yellow, foamy head that disappears quickly.  fruity and light bodied.  typical hefe.
rich gold color, good head.  too fruity (lots of banana) smell and flavor for me. i didnt like this much.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2005 Extremely refreshing wheat, with a strong banana and clove aroma and rich wheaty mouthfeel that is just so creamy. Lemon, grapefruit, orange notes coexist with cut grass sourness. Very nicely done by these newcomers...

Poured a amber color very cloudy with a beautiful healthy head.  Aroma is mostly cloves with some banannas.  Very similar to the Hefewiessbier dunkel that I just finished.  Maybe a little lighter and a little more grass/wheat taste to this one.  Light in body and carbonated well to make it very refreshing.  Starts out sweet with a taste of bananna then to clove taste and finishes with just a little bitter sourness lemon maybe.  I think from the wheat.  Tasty beer and very nice.
Poured a cloudy color with a big nice head.  Taste of cloves and bananas.  Pretty good stuff.

A good hefeweizen even looks refreshing, and this one was certainly that.  Pouring a hazy dark yellow with a fluffy white head, this has a banana dominated aroma supported by cloves, some grassiness, and a drop of lemon juice.  Nicely carbonated and light in the mouth, this has a yeasty banana flavor along with some sweet maltiness and a touch of wheat tartness.  Clean refreshing finish.  After all this time, these guys are still doing things right.

(on bottle) There´s not much to say, but this is the standard other german wheats should live up to. Perfect balanced between sweetness and a slight hopping, exelent carbonation and a freash rush of malts to follow with a new sip. Thanx to the monks 1000 years ago, really; thanx!
lovely wheatbeer. dark yellow cloudy appearance, taste of banana, citrus and very spicy (cloves koriander) finish is fruity and a little sour. all-in-all very good brew!

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 18 Nov 2004 - Banana and clove aroma. Appearance is same as Kristall except cloudy.  Nice fruit complexity and spiritous floral hop aroma.  Thick mouthfeel and a lingering fruit finish.
an excellent brew, goes down very smooth with a great aftertaste. this is one of the best german beers that you can get. very smooth beer with a hint of wheat in the taste. very enjoyable

Beer #1 in German Bier Night. Cloudy yellow/gold color with a bubbly head that settles into a very thin sheen. Banana dominates the aroma with some yeastiness. Taste is more yeasty banana but not as much than whats in the nose. Medium body with a light carbonation in the mouthfeel. Although good, I doubt this stuff handles the journey very well. I guess Im off to Germany to try a fresher version.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2009 Bottled.  A cloudy orange coloured beer which pours with a tiny head.  The aroma has bananas, a little lemon and maybe some cream.  The taste has more of the same and is typically hefe although maybe the mouthfeel is a little fuller. I really struggle to say much about this style.  Most hefes Ive had are pleasantly drinkable but unexciting.Score 3.1Subsequent rating scored 3.2. Score unchanged

Excellent beer that suffers from $2.50 pint night pour. Very little head in a "regular" pint glass. A little work with a straw after a few sips brings the head to life and awakens the hidden aromas developed in this beer. Still not a great presentation for this wheat monster that defines the style for me. Slightly cloudy with dark straw/ amber color. Truly a great summertime beer. But, when its 65 degrees in February.. it just feels like summer. Malt/fruit flavor complimented by spice/citrus. One of a very few non-killer-hoppy beers that I could drink every day and that I actually keep in the beer frig. Choice is good.

Pours cloudy yellow with small white head that quickly diminishes.  Nose is Banana, allspice, and faint soap.  Banana and wheat flavors combat each other as well as some spicy notes.  Finishes with clean banana flavor.  Very good.

I hadnt really been a fan of wheat beers until the number of quality imports increased. They are still not in my top styles but for a hot Sydney summer day they work very well. Especially in the generous weizen style of glassware that encourages a billowy head over the plae cloudy beer. Great diacetyl nose character with banana and some light cloviness. Very enjoyable mouthfeel that is smooth rather than harsh. A bit of effervescence there as there is a bit of a belch factor. Oh well, beer was made to repeat like this, I mean beer was made to repeat like this.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: The beer pours cloudy with a nice thick head.  I have to admit I didnt like it at first. It had an aftertaste I couldnt put my finger on. After reading a few reviews, it was apparent that that is banana, and somehow that made me like it just a bit more.. (I guess it makes me feel better to go mmmm... banana, instead of hmmmm... what the hell is that?)

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2007 Pours a cloudy yellow color with huge frothy white head that grows and grows.  Aroma is of banana, clove, and the usual hefe chracter.  Taste is just like the aroma with a great balance of banana, clove and yeast.  Its creamingly smooth and probably one of the best hefes out there.
Tons of yeasty banana going on with this one. Not overwhelming though. Pleasant and thirst quenching. Very soft and just a very nice example of the style overall.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2005 From a bottle in a genuine Weihenstephan weissbier glass. I just love this stuff. It was my intro to the world of real beer when I stumbled upon it accidentally in Freising (fresh from the brewery) where beer is cheaper than soft drink (soda). Bottled version suffers a little from the long journey to Oz. Pours hazy goldish yellow with a HUGE head that retains well. Classic aroma of yeast/bread, bananas and clove which also comes through in the taste in very large measure. Full mouthfeel with medium carbonation and a yeasty/malty aftertaste that lasts for ages. Did I mention it was smooth and goes down without any resistance? Unable to stop at one.

Cant put my finger on the aroma but it smells good. Love the big frothy bubbly white head. Yeastier than I expected. A tad fruitier/sweeter would be nice but nevertheless this is a good one. For a hefe this one has a lot of flavor.
A nice reddish yellow. Slight head retention. Awesome aroma of spices and fruit. Flavor profile similar and complex. Very nice.
A gorgeous, smooth and quite fulfilling beer.  Absolutely delicious from start to finish!  Superb. Sweet, but not overly sweet.  Crisp and refreshing.  One of the best I ever had!

Bottled. Cloudy orange with huge white head. Fruity cooked banana aroma with hints of citrus and yeast. Sweet cooked banana in taste along with hints of yeast. Wellbalanced and not as sweet as Franziskaner Hefe Weissbier.

In no particular order:  the after taste gets sweeter the longer it lasts.  not much aroma, not much expected, a little yeast, a nice head, really big, cloudy and hazy, really good carbonation,  good taste, dry and sweet.

Murky tan/oxidized-(not greened)-copper.  I prefer this to most hefeweizens, as it does not punch you in the nose and mouth with its wheaty citrus glove.  It makes for a less defensive (thus more confident) brew.  Finish is malty and sweet--again, not going overboard on these features.  I hope to try this again--next time on tap (this time from bottle).

Pours a strawy colour and had a brilliant white head, the nose was spicy/yeasty. This was similar to other spiced wheat beers I have tasted, but with few surprises. There is quite a wheaty flavour and hints of clove, citrus and banana. Its not a world class beer, but is refreshing, clean and well worth the try.
An outstanding  example of the German hefe-weizen.  Beautiful rusty orange color, major clove & bubblegum, with banana underneath.  Lots of sparkle on the tongue.  Nice apple-like aftertaste.
pours golden orange, almost apricot, very white head. very cloudy. tastes quite fruity, very sweet.

A hazy, golden amber beer with a huge initial white head which despite dying rapidly leaves behind ample carbonation. Decidedly yeasty aroma with a slight nutty character. Sweetish with a slight fizz on the tongue. Yeasty flavours with some apple undertones. Overall an easy drinking beer but lacking any stand-out feature demanding attention or setting it apart from the rest.
Pours a hazy golden/orange color. Aroma is very yeasty and strong banana as well. Flavor is somewhat spicy. Kind of grainy with a hint of sweetness toward the end.

Almost opaque from the beige, yeast cloud that I formed from pouring every last drop of yeast and beer into my glass.  Nice foamy, white head, but not rocky.  Orange-amber around that cloud.  The phenolic aroma blows you away after a good pour--lots and lots of cloves with a burst of lemony bubblegum mingling with subtle banana undertones.  As for the flavour, it tastes a lot like it smells, except malt comes through in the flavour that was not apparent in the nose; lemony clove with bubblegum and banana at the very end.  Bitterness is pleasant and refreshing, underscored by the effervescence.  Light bodied with a clean finish.  I like this beer.
Hoppy spicy aroma. Cloudy yellow coliur with desent head. Sweet malt hop flavour. Smooth palate.

Pretty standard German Hefe appearance here. Aroma is as to be expected as well (banana/clove). Funny how these beers aromas translate into exactly the same flavors. In laymans terms, its not quite as good as Ayinger, but better than most I can get here in Nuevo Mexico. A perfect BBQ beer.

Hazy golden with a disappearing small white head.  Pleasant yeasty aroma.  Flavor is wheaty, citrus, and banana.  A little more hops show through than the average hefe.  Nice smooth flavor.  Overall a pleasant and drinkable hefe.

bottle. wow,it looks incredible poured in my Hacker-Pschorr glass! Gigantic white fluffy head is picturesque and lasts and lasts. aroma is predominately yeast, but also consists of banana, bubble-gum, clove spiciness. yeasty, malty, spicy, and sour. creamy mouthfeel. a very refreshing wheat. One of the best wheats that Ive had the pleasure of trying.

Pours hazy orange golden with a foamy white head. Dominating yeast notes in the aroma with wheaty hints. Bittersweet flavor with yeast, fruit and notes of clove. An all right wheat beer, but not outstanding.
Tap from andys. Poured a hazy golden yellow. Aroma of mostly yeast. Not my fav style but was refreshing and crisp. Slight taste of clove and banana? Sweet dry finish.
Has a hazy yello body and a white head. Aroma from banana and fruit. Sweet taste and yeasty.

Looks perfect on the pour. Nice foggy orange color. Has a thick head that stays.
Smells of bread dough, cloves and tropical fruit.
The best I can come up with is; it tastes like beer and banana bread. Its certainly sweet, too sweet. Candylike.
Feels very viscous. Oily.
Needless to say its not very palatable.
On tap. Hazy dark gold, smooth creamy texture, citrussy, very yeasty and a touch spicy with some banana, clove, bubblegum and smoke notes. Long sweetish finish. It is a little sour for my taste.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2005 Now zis ist vhat talkink abowt i am! A fine hefe it iz, brewt in der fadderlant. Ve hav better bier zhere but zis bier vill do you gut by trinkink.Earlier Rating: 12/31/2004 Total Score: 4Nice foamy head, well balanced flavor with less ester and more malt flavor than most wheat beers, rather high alcohol for a wheat beer but is acceptable, more carbonation than most wheat beers. Id like this as a draught beer even more. Outstanding beer!

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2005 A good example of an authentic hefe. Im surprised that it beats out franziskaner and some others on the rating scale though. Nice on the palate, initial flavors very citrusy, smooth and well-blended with the more sublte aspects. But I think it finishes weak. Its just missing a little something.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 (Villa Market Laguna 134 baht)
Cloudy but bright orange in the glass - quite striking. Fresh aromas of soft spice orange peel but all quite subtle. Palate is dry but still has traces of the spice and orange, and some dry aniseed to finish. Drank quite cold in this instance but seemed to work well.

Have been drinking this for about two years, but thought it was time I judged it. Poured from the bottle into a wheat beer glass, it quickly formed a big dense rocky white head. The body itself, an opaque golden straw. An initial slightly lactic nose, lead to hints of sweet malt, wheat grains and vanilla. On the palate it performed an orchestral piece, with a lot going on at once. Flavours of honey & lemons, bubblegum, citrus fruits and mild clove-like notes. Carbonation bites at the front of the tongue (minor demerit), but is balanced by the big body and foamy, long sweet and sour aftertaste. A beautiful Hefe Weiss.

Nice big frothy off-white head which stays thick throughout the drinking experience.  Maintains a good orangish/yellow cloudy appearance while fizz rises to the top.  Smells strongly of banannas, vanilla, grass and cloves - slightly spiced and citrusy.  Very clean taste, with cloves, wheat and warm baked bread being the most discernable characteristics.  Finish is light and lemony with hints of bananna.

Aroma of wheat and banana, cloudy yellow, good sized, off-white head. Flavours of wheat, yeast and some banana. Medium bodied, refreshing. Very good.

 Thanks jercraigs.

Bottle - 500ml. Nice hazy golden body topped with a lasting white foamy head. Wonderful yeasty/citrusy aroma with various hints of spices and flowers. Texture is mild and sort of oily. There is also some lively carbonation. Very well balanced taste with a nicely bitter/hoppy finish. Undoubtedly, a top-notch Hefeweizen.
not thin on mouthfeel. Nice aroma wheat with some vanilla. Smooth though not creamy. Nicely malted
Bottle. Cloudy golden with medium sized head. Banana, cloves, lightly tart. Medium bodied.
Enjoyed on draught at the Peculiar Pub in NYC.  Pours cloudy with a big head.  Strong hints of banana and coriander.  Enjoyed along side the scent of a lemon.  Very good beer on draught.

Hefes are a style that do not typically knock my socks off.  This one stepped up to the plate and impressed the hell out of me.  On draft at Half Time, Poughkeepsie, NY.  Pours slighty turbid straw color.  Aroma of huge hopcit, malt, wheat, and gigantic bubblegum and banana.  The individual flavors intermingled deliciously and naturally, as if they belonged together.  No harshness here, just a smooth finish.  Marvelous complexity, smoothness, and taste.  One of the best hefes Ive ever had, bar none.

on tap at isaac newtons. Pours yellowish white with good cloudiness.  great white head..aroma of coriander, taste is coriander..banana..and the freaking lemon they threw in there (ask first please..joe dont do lemons)..good hefeweizen.
Dark yellow and hazy in color with an ample frothy head. Aroma is yeast and bannana. Flavor is wheat, a little spice and bannana. Finish is smooth. An excellent wheat.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2005 Depending on the pour, cloudy or clear; pale yellow with an orange twinge; white, frothy head; nice lace, with interesting arches. Body is light; carbonation is mild; but it has an underlying richness. Gentle malt flavors -- bready and yeasty, with notes of buttery crackers. Hops are light, but have nice aromas; drying finish. Faint notes of sweet banana and dried clove. Mild bitterness in the aftertaste; light salt. Overall, it doesnt hit you over the head with flavor, but its balanced, nicely made, and pleasant to drink.
wow quite possibly the best hefe i have ever had.  pours a hazy deep yellow with a nice hoppy finish.  i was very impressed by the wat this hefe tasted. mmmmm was very good

This beer was flat out gross, tasted like piss, I really cant believe anybody would like this. I had about 6 people all sip it to see if there was something wrong with me, everyone agreed it was awful.

Bottle.  Cloudy yellow pour. Big frothy head. Classic yeasty citrusy aroma. Taste is a fantastic mix of spice, banana and just enough malt, with a slight crispness and hoppy bite finish.  There is nothing to blow you away here, nothing you havent tasted before, except it is all done at a very high level - a wonderful beer.  Thanks for sharing jercraigs.

Plenty of flavour I felt the cloudiness added to the taste.  Must be poured correctly otherwise the head gets too big.  The Weihenstephaner glasses are good because they self swirl the sediment as you pour.
Aromatic , plenty of banana , yeast notes . Large head . Drinkable , but a bit harsh for me .Maybe all that carbonation placed negative effect .

Poured a murky yellowish amber with a tall white head which left a lacing on the glass.  Fruity and spicy hefe aroma.  Taste is mostly hefe spiciness but not as heavy as olther hefes Ive had.  Very refreshing.
Clear color with one beautiful adherent foam. Not much dense one but in the complex very balanced.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2013 Crunchy wheat biscuits ebb and flow through elegant cloves... Minty leaves and citrus zest spice up the plump banana bread and angel cake... A generous, complex and nuanced Weizen which truly deserves all of its accolades...

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2008 2008-07-01. Bottle from LCB0. Hazy golden yellow body with a good sized white head. Yeasty lightly estery aroma, muted touch of alcohol is quite pleasant. (7+) Flavour is moderate, but complex. Sweet underlying pale malt, yeasty weiss esters, touches of banana and spice. Smooth medium bodied palate suits it wonderfully. Just really nice. 
7/5/8/4/16 - 4.0
<P>November 2004. Bottle. Hazy golden body, nice big fluffy white head. Touch of spicey clove in the aroma, small notes of banana esters. Pleasantly effervescent palate is rather nice. Flavour has some clove, though it is slightly muted from the aroma, and a pleasant wheaty tartness throughout.  Thanks M&J for bringing this back from NYC. I have now had the top 3 rated wheat bers as of right now, yay me! 7/4/7/4/17 - 3.9

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2005  This beer is excellent.  The aftertaste has a slight burning sensation which I liked.  A more bitter Hefeweizen then I have had in the past.  The best Hefeweizen I have had to date.
My favorite Hefeweizen. Has a much more pleasant mouthfeel than the others Ive tried, along with more wheat taste.

Draught.  Hazy stained wood.  Fairly subtle and fruity aroma with a touch of cloves and vanilla.  Flavor is very big for its size.  Notes of dried banana, cloves (lots), vanilla and nutmeg.  Very cloying.  I was looking for more of a hearty wheat taste which just simply wasnt present.

Huge cloves, bananas and wheat in the aroma. Orange-tan coloured body with generous off-white head that lasts nicely. Cloves and bananas and wheat figure prominently with yeasty citrus tartness. Bitterness in the finish balances nicely. Mouthfeel is engagingly prickly on the insides of the cheeks and is wonderfully refreshing. Bottle enjoyed with martinT and Rastacouere.

Although not a fan of light wheat beers, the Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier had a very cool refreshing taste.  What struck me most was the cloves in the aroma and right on the center of the tongue.  Also, a hint of banana like flavor.  A pleasant grain flavor is present in aftertaste.

On Tap at Flying Pie   Glas was a hazy golden with a thin but dense white head.  Spicey, yeasty aroma like a beigian.  Easy on the hops, yeasty, bread like flavors with spiciness of cloves, bananas and wheat.  Smooth but light feel, and was overpowered a bit by my Pizza.  Tasty though.
A very solid German Hefeweizen.  Citrusy, spicy,  easy drinking, and respectable.  Has that weird Weihenstephaner grain flavor going on as well.  Need to try this again.
bubbly head, creamy, banana flavor with hints of cloves, sweet, quickly dissipating flavor

Aroma: upon opening the bottle I got a massive whiff of banana that balances out to banana mixed with some cloves. Appearance: murky orange brown with a smallish bubbly head. Flavour: sweet wheat, creamy with noticeable banana. Palate: yeah this is thick and apart from the massive banana aftertaste some graininess shows through.

sloghtly cloudy, aggressive carbonation.  huge white top.  Esters dominate, phenols play back up.  plenty of wheat, smooth, creamy.  effervescence breaks the cloying, creamy mouthfeel to give a clean, drier finish.  this is a classic

Pours a coudy, bubbly, orangish yellow hue, crowned by an abundant white head.  Fruity, citrusy nose with a good bit of yeast.  Flavors are excellent, with a sweet wheaty flavor up front, followed by a nice banana note and giving way to a faint vanilla finish.  All that and a great, effervescent, sparkly mouthfeel.  My favorite weizen to date.
Pours a monsterous, white head. Has a cloudy, dark yellowcolor. Taste is incredibly smooth with wheat and fruit flavors throughout. Excellent beer.

Pours a cloudy, dusty yellow with a large eggshell white head.
Bannana aroma is dominant, with clove hidding underneath.
Flavor is wheaty, yeasty, fruity citrus. Finish is crisp.

An excellent German beer, probably one of the best I have ever had.  From beginning to end, it is truly an experience.  It really has unique flavoring.  Also its impressive I am drinking from the "worlds oldest brewery".  A great beer, try this yeasty gem.  I am just loving the aftertaste, I feel like I am enjoying the best wheat available!
Another fine Hefe.  Tastes very similar to the Franziskaner, in my opinion.  Very fruity and sweet.   Beautiful color and nice frothy white head. Very smooth.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2004 Clovy bananas spicey fermentation done with love. Big frothy head makes the mouth water to a true hefe man. Lovely cloudy gold in a glass. This is complexitys finest hour. Abundent in every aspect clove banana smoke heaven. What one would and should expect in a hefe. Mouth heavy hanging with a not to wet finish that makes you want more.(begging)
I love this S--- with a passion. This is what hefe is all about. Dont forget to swirl. ;^)
Very good.  Nice, thick weissbier.  A very ful, sweet flavor with a the right amount of spice.  This is a winner.

Bottle - Hazy yellow/golden hue and makes a thick white head.  Pleasant aroma, lots of banana and citrus in the nose, and fresh cut flowers.  The flavor is sweet and malty with accents of banana and has a very spicy crisp finish.  Palate is medium to full and carbonated perfectly. Very smooth finish.  An excellent hefe.

Highly efferevescent, cloudy yellow, big head that is gone in seconds, bubbles still dancing about though. Aroma is a touch sweet, long aftertaste, lightly bitter. Initial flavours fruity and sour. Very light mouthfeel, fizzy without any acid. Overall very nice.

Draft. After a week stashed in a growler, its still pretty good. Cloudy pale yellow has just a tinge of pink in the center of the glass. Very refreshing wheat taste, not only a lemony spritz, but a little Belgian candi sweetness, it seems.

Cloudy golden brown with a large white head. Malty wheat with some orange, banana and a cinnamon clove like aroma. Lightly tart wheat flavor with some fruity citrus flavors which lead into some estery banana notes. Light clove spice in the crisp finish. Very solid hefe, but I expected a little more, given its reputation.

Poured a clody golden color with hints of copper. Off-white head was 3/4" thick, very long lasting. Aroma and flavor are pleasantly fruity (banana) with a touch of clove and citrus. Pleasantly carbonated mouthfeel with a lingering aftertaste. Excellent hefeweizen.

Yellow cloudy body, with a small lasting head. Banana and citrus aromas. Fruity flavor dominated by banana on top plus some berries at the bottom. Crisp but creamy, carbonation highlights the flavors and keeps it very refreshing. An excellent hefeweizen overall.
The best of a flight of hefeweizens at the Flying Saucer in Memphis.  Tart, clove, banana:  just cant beat Schneider.

Pours a hazy golden orange color, a full bubbly head, some lace and a fair amount of carbonation. A fresh fruity smell of bananas, and slightly citrus. A sweet taste that is not too dry, is clear and clean, and finishes quite crisp. Great mouth feel with strong effervescence. An admirable balance of desirable characteristics in a Hefe Weizen.

Hazy gold/pale orange in appearance, pouring an enormous, bilious white head. Aroma is shockingly fresh, floral, citrus, lemon, orange, lively, and lovely. Light and playful upon the tongue, brief finish, light body, slight texture. No lemon required, unless youre a certified lily-gilder. Refreshing as a beer can be!
Light golden in color but cloudy.  Foamed up alot.  Sharp fruity taste, mostly bananas with a clove finish.  Pretty good, but not a beer I could drink a lot of.

Decent all-around hefe.  Yellow with a generous head, good rich carbonation yet an unagressive palate.  Well rounded spice, including clove in the aroma, and banana and citrus more prominent in the flavor.
Amber with a weak white head.  Aroma was of wheat with banana and a touch of smokiness.  Smooth and creamy.   Nice and somewhat refreshing but not appealing to me.
Cloudy upon pouring with no dominant taste.This brewery claims to be the oldest in the world. This means they must have wasted a lot of time producing this rather average beer.
The first thought that came to me was its banana and cinnamon taste.  It was dark brown in color.  Refreshing taste, I would get another.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2004 A decent white head tops the slightly hazy dark golden hue. Big yeasty aroma contains notes of cream, banana and lemon. Nice toasted-bready malt foreground. Wheat comes through nicely, refreshingly without being overbearing. Nice enough and mostly crisp, serving its purpose, but I just dont dig the style yet. Upon resampling, this one is far more character loaded than the erdinger I had on parallel. Direct cloves and banana aroma. Very clean yeast profile and great mouthfeel. I still dont enjoy the style, but this serves its purpose.

slightly toasty roasty aroma with hints of bananas.  Moderatley hazy starw/copper color with a nice white head.  Malty, sweet, roasty, malty banana/citrus finish.  Im must be missing something, cause I dont find this beer special.

Delicious.  Deep, hazy golden color.  Aromas are classic bananas in my Wheaties" thing, with nice spicy qualities, too.  Since it seems like almost everyone is using these guys yeast strain,  the nose almost seemed cliche.  But its just soooo good!  I could smell this stuff all day and not be bored.  Full of rich, soft wheat flavors, along with banana, clove, spicey hops (although they are pretty subdued in bitterness).  Tart finish.  THE STANDARD.
Nice looking beer, bananas and cloves, typical hefe.  An excellent beer with good body and typical flavors.  Surprisingly cheap here..

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2006 Bottle - Tried this in the states and wasnt overly impressed.  Bought a fresh bottle here in Germany.  Nice banana malt aroma with slight clove hint.  Cloudy amber head with good head.  Very nice balanced flavor - banana/peach flavor nice but not overwhelming - slight hint of malt - absolutely no bitterness.  Okay - this is possibly the best Hefeweizen there is.  Unfortunately, this beer does not age well so getting a fresh bottle is hit or miss - just tried some stateside and it was too old and I probably wouldnt have given it much over a 3.0.
Hmm my stash seems to be running out... must go get lots more. Not working without having a cold one waiting for me in the fridge.
yellow wheat body, huge foamy head. one of the best wheat beers i have had. the wheat seems to stick to the roof of your mouth. smooth consistancy though. very nice

I can see why this brewery has been around since the 11th century!  The best wheat beer I have ever had.  Appearance yellow and cloudy, with some white foamy head.  Nice spicy aroma.  The flavor is dominated by banana, cloves, and some other spice I cant put my finger on.  Never quite tasted a wheat like this one, as it has little to do with the typical citrus flavored ones.

Bottled.  Opaquely cloudy, looks like unfiltered apple cider, offwhite head, poor lacing.  Malty, banana, subdued clove, earthy; mild, but complex and pleasant aroma.  Medium bodied, foamy, bone dry finish.  Amazingly crisp, fresh, citrus, light clove, yeast like dough with a sour, banana clove finish.  Well balanced and totally refreshing German style hefe...had a number wrong. -_-

Nearly one of my overall favorites and certainly the best of its style.  Cloudy golden color and lace is as you would expect and outstanding aroma/flavor of citrus and yeast is what all German Hefeweizen should aspire to.

Originally had this off tap in Italy. The bartender took 15 minutes to pour, I was pretty angry by the time it finally came. Took me to the fourth beer to really get a good pour myself. Good hefe-weizen. Pale orange appearance with an enormous white head that shrunk kinda quickly. Decent yeasty, citrus aroma. Flavor is very good. Zesty, lemony. Pretty good mouthfeel, with some good fruits. Also very good served a little above room temp.

Nice cloudy golden color, thick, creamy white head. Good aroma of bananas and spices, maybe herbs too. Nice flavor of bananas, wheat and spices. Medium body. Very good, smooth and complex at the same time.

Bright white medium dense head, with stong lace and retention. Light gold in color. Aroma is yeast profile/ phenolic, but smoother and subdued when compared to Belgian and American efforts, this leads to a fine balance tha in my opinion lets you drink another one ore two for thirst.. The yeast profile does not over power and drive you away. Mouthfeel= initial is silky on roof of mouth followed by heavy carbonation finish. Sever in proper glass, and temps between 50 and 40 F results in a fine refreshing beer.. any warmer then the banana ester I am sure would be prevelant.
Cheers
Beautiful gold color with frothy head.  Smells of citrus, spice, and yeast.  Slightly bitter with citrus and clove.  Felt a little heavier than other hefe Ive tried. Very good overall.

Cloudy with slight yellow brown tinge, with fine head dissapating quickly. Soapy, banana, with spice and citrus on the nose. Slight citrus, creamy, with banana, marshmallow, and a slight bitter (orange peel) finish.  Well made though not my favorite.
Aroma is of spices, cloves, and fruit like a good hefe. Cloudy gold in color with a good white head, unfortunately the head was rather thin. Nice banana and spice taste. Very good Hefe here.

Maybe i am just losing my taste for this style. i found it nothing over par, but it wasnt horrible. it was just there in the bhuddist sense. Clean, nice hefe flavors. subtle finish. fizzy, full mouthfeel.

Notes from St. line Wheat beer tasting 7/30/04. 

  Hazy gold/white hued brew. white head. Fruity, malty nose with good hints of spices. Medium/light body, silky mouthfeel, lingering. Good bananna, spice flavors, lightly citrusy, good mallt backing. A true classic! Yummy.
This is my favorite of the style. Looks great, and has a wonderful wheat bread flavor with a nice bite at the end. Great after tennis beer.
Boy do I love head, and this beer offers plenty of it, Im not a big fan of this style but this one caught my attention, nice refreshing summer drink

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 [draft - Great European Beerfest 8 - Sharp Edge Tavern - East Liberty, PA] Poured a cloudy yellow color with a thin and fizzy head. Slight banana and sweet notes with a strong spicy aroma. Good spicy taste with a nice wheat and yeasty follow up. A very good hefeweizen.

A nice well made weissbier, but in a way I was expecting more out of this. Has the typical banana like flavors present but was a little low on the "spicy" side of the scale. Good toasty wheat flavors present as well. A pleasant drink.
Very yeasty and wheaty, spicy flavor. I miss the typical banana or glove notes. Beer is quite good, but i cant understand, why this beer should be the number two wheat in the world...

Pours hazy gold amber with a large and creamy white head. Some lacing. That wonderful banana nose and a touch of spice and malt just please the olfactory senses. Some citrus there as well. The flavor is similiar in the fact there is the banana and the clove. The citrus comes out a bit more and there is a nice bite of bitter hops. The palate is damn refreshing and smooth. Nice fruity finish of banana and citrus with just a touch of bitterness. Great.
On tap at Andys. Served in a tall weissbeer glass. Aroma of banana and clove. Good beer. Cloudy orange yellowish in color with a nice head. Flavors linger.

Tap. Tall Weihenstephaner glass @ Andys Corner Bar. Had side-by-side with a draft of Ayinger Brau-Weiss. Typical cloudy orange-yellow with a big rich white head. Banana nose. Thick sweet coating malt. Lingering flavors. No reason to turn one of these down, but the Ayinger beat this by a nose for overall flavor and impression.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text:
The Weihenstephaner Weissbier.. We all heard about the beer in a Danish sit-com, it was mentioned as the best beer ever, by a geeg in the sit-com serie.
Allthoug it was mentioned more for fun, then it still caught our interesst.. And we just had to find one... But it showed out to be a hard one. It was sold out in our normal beer-import, and we waited and waited, but it never arrived, and now its closed. But my friend (Dixen in here) took a trip to Germany and bought it. And we tasted it, it was VERY good, for this moment, it is my favourite right now... It is fresh and fruity, it was like a typical weissbier should be, and it has the traditions from the oldest brewer in the world. It is sweet and has a charming coulour. It is in many ways a women beer, but beers are not made to be enjoyed by women anyway.. :o)

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2004 It starts with a lofty head that lasts to the end. Wild aromas of sweet wheats and malty goodness cloaked in citrus, bananna and candy treats.  The flavor is amazingly balanced with light cloves, nutmeg, almonds, vanilla and esters. The color a is muddled yellow-orange that is of medium cloudiness and no unsightly "floaties" (i liken them to sea monkeys).  The sweetness is just noticable, as is apple and paw-paw. This is all tied together with a giddy carbonation that I havent experience in other wheats and that lends amazing spirit to the beer. There is no doubting that this is a champion beer. It is a shame that raters bias bigger beers because this is quality through and through.  I envision this beer tasting its best after a long day hiking the german country-side admiring the small, simple farms and  ancient vineyards.  Then stopping in a small villages square for a festive evening of dancing, feasting and drinking large litres of hefe-weizen.
looks like this could be my favorite hefeweizen.  cloudy gold color, largely citrus aroma but some hints of yeast and banana.  very tangy on the tongue,  with a sweet banana finish.  very refreshing.

mmmm simply wonderful.  i can see why this is rated #2 amongst the style.  lemony sweet aroma and flavor.  easy drinking.  yellow unfiltered looking pour.  a great german hefe, one of my new favorites.  best served very cold. mmmm

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2004 Bottle from The Wine Company, Slough. Im not huge fan of hefeweizens. This and Erdingers are my favourites though. Lacks the nasty clovey/spicy aftertaste that many other german hefes have. Good.

Weird... I thought I had rated this beer. Nose is grainy, yeasty and fruity (bananas). Hazy, yellow-orange coloured with a lasting head. taste is balanced; grainy, some yeast, fruit (bananas and citrus)and spices. Refreshing palate.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2006 Balanced clove and banana nose.  Doughy yeast also.  Lightly sweet flavor becomes a lightly sweet, lightly acidic finish.  Medium-light body, watery texture, soft carbonation.  The bottom line is: not full enough (body or flavor) for me to really enjoy it.

She pours majestically, with round bubbles and a nice muted golden hue.  The aroma and flavor are classic in the fruity "banana" style.  The spiciness leads to a full, round palate and long finish.  A classic.

Bottled from Happy Deli NYC.Clouldy Gold color,smells really bad but makes up for it in the taste Department, very Refeshing Although i didnt rate this as high as others it might be im not into this stlye as much as others.
(Bottle)  Pours a hazy golden color with a huge white rocky head.  Has the aroma of wet straw, banana, and light citrus.  Flavors of banana, and citrus with a creamy palate.

Nice. Very nice. And after all this time and all the weiss beers, getting to this one and liking it, but just lacking words in pulling it all together. Quenching? You bet. have what I like in a weiss? Thats for sure.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2005  A beautiful, large and white head on top of a golden and cloudy body. It has a fresh, but not that strong aroma. The taste of pure freshness fills your entire mouth and leaves a sweet burnout. It has a dry and fruity taste, and of course lots of wheat. A prime Hefe Weissbier - perfect for a warm sommer day! My favorit beer, but not the best beer (does it make sense? - YES!)

Apperance is as expected, cloudy medium golden at the bottom of the glass, dark golden at the top of the glass with a massive egg white head that is fully retained.  Aroma is also as expected with nice banana aroma and a wonderully complex spiciness.  Some pumkin pie smell there for shore.  Flavor let me down just a tad.  Light banana flavor with light spiciness bit of yeast and moderately dry finish.  Tasty.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2010 Bottle:  The aroma has lots of banana, bubblegum, citrus, and light clove.  It pours a cloudy golden orange with a large white head with good retention and lots of lacing.  The flavor starts with moderate banana and light bubblegum.  The finish has light-moderate citrus and wheat tanginess with light clove.  Light-medium bodied with moderate-lively carbonation that still manages to come across with a soft mouthfeel.  This is my "go to" beer and is virtually always in my fridge.
Classic cloudy yellowish colour. Fine nose and flavour with plenty of bananas and oranges. The wheat and yeast makes the beer very refreshing. All in all a great hefeweizen.
This is a good example of what a wheat beer should be.  Nice amber color, with wheaty-citrus smells and flavor, not overly thick.

Hazy golden amber colour with a mountain of head dissolving to a thin,lingering creamy slab atop the brew. Aroma is wheat, malt, bananas and citrus. Flavour is malty with spicy hops. Very smooth mouthfeel with a touch of bite at the end.
Remarkable wheat beer. Crisp, refreshing and good. Yeasty, citrus tang with bread like flavors. Some banana, spice finishes up this tasty wheat. One of the best hefes I have had.
Wonderful head and pleasant aftertaste. Has the citrus effect that a good wheat beer should have, maybe the best wheat beer I have sampled, although the Hacker is close!
Good sweet and citrus aroma. Taste is very citrusy, mainly orange and a little lime. Body is medium. Some hops evident in the finish. A little too carbonated for me, but other than that a good beer.

Cloudy golden color, with the most beautiful frothy hite head on top! Thats the way a hefeweizen should look! The aroma has banana, spices, yeast, some smoke and some biscuits. Spicy flavor, yeast, biscuit, banana and some dryness in the end and notes of hops. Its very full-bodied. Weihenstephaner... mmmmmm...
Good beer for this style, but I prefer Hacker-Pschorr or Paulaner instead.  This beer definately has the citrus and yeasty-wheat thing down, but lacks in depth compared to other of this style.
This is a very good wheat beer.Typical good wheat beer,massive head,cloudy heavy body,fruity flavour,citrucy,spicy,long fruity aftertaste.Overall very enjoyable!

50cL Bottle, 04.11.04.  pours a golden, hazy, hay color.  Completely clouded.  Mammoth, fluffy white head.  As the beer settles down a bit the appearance becomes less dramatic, more ordinary.  Beautiful aromas of floral and citrus hops and yeasts.  Flavors are somewhat vegetal up front; bell pepper, sweet, red; coriander, anise, clove.  Mouthfeel is coating and full, but decidely light with an assertive crisp carbonation tingle.  Refreshing and quaffable.  A classic.
excellent tall beigeish head. hazy golden color.  delightfully yeasty. best hefeweizen which is widely available.
I very much enjoyed this beer. Poured a very golden hazy color with a thick head. Had a nice fresh lemony taste to it that all weissbeers should have. A very  excellent brew.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2006 2003 bottle.  Pours a medium dark yellow, getting much more orange the more sediment is poured in.  Large white head.  Smells of light citrus, some faint clove and fresh wheat.  Had big expectations for this one and it definitely delivered.  Very delicate for the style.  Flavor is subtle, lightly citric, with only a small amount of banana.  The finish has a good crisp yet sweet (hard to imagine, but thats what its like) bubble gum flavor, with some light hops.  Body had a spritzy carbonation that I love.  Hacker-Pschorr pours on more flavor, but this one is more balanced and understated.
Wheat and citrus aroma. Orange/white color with average white head. Complex finish of wheat and fruit that last the whole drink. Very drinkable.
Great all around weizen. Yeasty and fruity with a huge head. Maybe even some cloves back there. Far to easy to drink. Coppery gold in pour, but it didn't last long enough to get a good look at it.

Beautiful beer, hazy orange-gold, shines in the glass.  Big head, poofy, white, and pillowy.  Nose very wheaty, a bit of banana, mildly grassy.  Flavor is sweet, full of banana and some clove, very punchy and juicy.  Full palate as well.  A very nice hefe.
Wow, a very very good beer! I was kind of surprised by this selection, great copper color, very lasting head. Capped off by a wonderful taste reminiscent of other great german weissbiers.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2004 The beer poured out of the bottle had a magnificently tall creamy beige head underlain by a translucent golden pale body. The whiff out of the bottle was wonderfully spicy. Out of the glass the beer smelled more musty, grassy, and yeasty. Tasted wonderfully crisp and spicy with a creamy wheat malt backbone supported by extremely flavorful hints of clove, banana, citrus, and peach. Dry, very refreshing and drinkable as a hefeweizen should be. One minute I had a full bottle, next minute it was gone.
A classic weissbier, hazy golden colour with big white head. aroma is sweet and fruity. Flavor is banana and bubble-gum. Palate is nice.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2004 Hazy straw color, high dense head that lasts.  Big classic aromas; banana, clove, vanilla...  This would seem a bit cliche, but it's the original.  Juicy, fruity flavors and a medium mouthfeel.  Very well done.
Very cloudy and a little orange. Large white head. Long lasting with some lacing. Orange peel and ginger in the flavor. A little metallic tinge in the earthy and grassy flavor.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2009  Bottled. Rerate. 
Hazy pumpkin yellow, cotton-like head. Big aroma from banana and clove. Notes of banana, ginger, clove and chewing-gum in the flavour. Spicy, fullbodied and refreshing beer this.

I love the sweet, wine-like aroma and golden color.  A nice head formed unlike any I've seen in a while.  This is my first Weissbier and, even though it's not my first choice of a kind of beer, it's not bad.  I appreciate this beer as being a good beer, but not one that I would drink often.  Not quite wheaty enough for me on the initial taste. The aftertaste, on the other hand is remarkably wheaty.  I like the alcohol kick, reminds me of Juebel Dunkel in that aspect.  On all other aspects, it is not very similar.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2004 The aroma was pleasant wafting thru my nostrils, the appearance is of quality - but the flavour and palate were mildly disappointing. With a rating like this has from fellow Ratebeerians, I definitely expected better. What's more, I much preferred the full-of-personality Weissbier from Oberdorfer to this one. Hey, this one just lacks something in flavour and palate - and those are the most important aspects, really, of enjoying a good beer - not packaging or appearance. The aroma is something to be considered, but not the determining factor in a beer's worthiness. 2nd rating: Upon further examination, this is a quite good Weissbier. I suppose Weissbier is somewhat of an acquired taste because when I had Hoegaarden and Franziskaner I hated the stuff. Perhaps I should re-try it and see. Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is very good, a beautiful golden yellow colour with a full, lingering head of whiteness with a graceful lace and good mouth filling flavour. I still do not think it quite worthy of its so-high rating though and think Ayinger's Weissbier to be superior. However, Weihenstephaner *is* the world's oldest brewery...and definitely worth a shot. = )
Ginger and lemon spices perfectly balanced to complete a great hefeweizen.  A great beer for a hot summer day.

Bottled.  Poured a golden color with a fluffy white head.  This beer was dominated by a VERY spicy flavor reminiscent of ginger and oranges.  Even though the flavors are potent, they're BALANCED.  My new favorite wheat beer.

Big white smooth moderately lasting head.  Fruity, banana aroma.  Dirty cloudy yellow body.  Light in mouth.  Sweetish, fruity and banana followed by a light tanginess that popped a bit on the tongue.

Tap. This beer with a cloudy mocha golden body, topped by a big thick white head, released all the expected hefe aromas quite nicely - banana, yeast, cloves all balanced nicely. Then a creamy mouthful refreshed the mouth and was a great accompaniment to a late night bite to eat. Slightly tangy citrus flavour lingered. Nice.

Big, rocky, white head. Cloudy gold appearance. Clovelike aroma. The taste has hints of banana and a tangy clove. When tasted side by side with four other wheat beeers, this was the best. No lemon needed.
Pale amber colour with a small, mostly lasting, creamy white head.. The aroma is citrus and banana. Good wheat and banana flavors. Good hefe

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2013 Probably my favorite hefeweizen. I have had this numerous times on draft and bottled and my rating for both is essentially the same. +++ Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle. Pretty label. The brew pours a slightly orange golden color. Very hazy. Has a large foaming head that is slow to diminish. There is a moderate sweet fruity aroma. Sweet front taste with a sour tangyness that lingers. A world classic in my book.

Sadly average. Nice color, but short-lived head. Nice aroma (yeast, citrus, banana). Slightly sweet malty and wheaty taste; dry yeasty finish. It feels like all the right flavours are there, but they are a bit too light and bland, especially when compared to my favorite hefeweizen, like Ayinger or Franziskaner.
Good stuff.  Pours a nice hazy yellow with a big white head.  Great yeast flavors aith sweet lemon and banana thrown in there.  Wheat predominant on the finish.  One of the best hefes

Bottled - drinked from Weizen class
Huge foamy head. Classic hazy weizen colour with orange shades. Florish sweet aroma with some yeast! Soft palate. Banana flavor. Sweety taste with carbonation holds till the end.
Cloudy and dark yellow. Big fast diddapearing white pillowy head. Spicy banana and wheat aroma. Flavour of banana and spices. Crispy and yeasty finish.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2006 Pours a deep cloudy yellow/orange with a fluffy white head. Nice wheat aroma and flavor. Very nice. 

Rerate Mar 2006: this may set the standard for a German Hefe. nicely flavored with yeast. Great aroma of banana and clove. A very good beer.

Has a hazy orangish color with a thick white head and quite a bit of carbonation.  Smell is a combonation of wheat/yeast/banana/clove.  Taste is a bit light of banana/clove and has a crisp, almost a little to fizzy, finish.  Overall a pretty good wheat, but a little to light to be great.

Hazy deep gold w/a lasting frothy white head.  Typical clove and banana esters w/a  wheat malt lagging behind as it warms.  Also lightly papery.  Wheat malt and cloves predominate flavor, but also has light banana esters and lightly oxidized(papery).  Otherwise not much else going on.  Well balanced with a dry finish.  Highly effervescent, lighter body, and a light acidic bite.  Unfortunately, this bottles a little old and past it's prime.  I've had bottles that were more fresh and will rate this accordingly.  Normally a pretty thirst quenching beer and quite enjoyable under most circumstances.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2005 First rating was 5-3-6-4-10, or 2.8 overall.  Second rating: from a 16.9 oz. bottle, beer pours (in Weihenstephaner glass) a light to medium golden colored cloudy liquid (not as cloudy as Franziskaner) with a small amount of white head.  Aroma is of wheat, lemon (no lemon put into it), sour.  Flavor is a lemon wheatish grassiness, and slightly sour.  Sampled alongside Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier, and the Franziskaner is easily better.  Sampled nicely chilled.

Um Wow!  This stuff is the end all be all.  I suppose the best way to describe it is to go thru the drinking sequence.  nice head, some citrus notes, great color for a hefe.  goes down smoothly with a light citrus aftertaste.  some accents of banana.  This is the real deal, good on any occasion.  If you haven't tried it, do so!

Bottle. Relatively recent purchase for me--from my trip to Houston in Oct/Nov 2003.  It's afresh as I'm normally ever going to see it, but alas, this bottle just doesn't do fresh Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier justice.

The beer pours golden and sports a massive creamy white head, just as it should, but even though I swirled the bottle fairly aggressively, there's no hefe--it's glued to the bottom of the bottle.

The aroma is very yeasty, with the telltale aroma of wheat, and hints of grass and a subtle matiness.
Taste is clean, yeast-malty with a nice citrus character, but there's a somewhat phenolic finish.
There's no substitute for fresh hefeeissen in situ.
I'm on a mission to fnd this on tap.

A beautiful beer to look at with it's creamy hudge head and frosted golden color. Yeast and banana fill the nose and a filling creamy beer is experienced as it passes the toungue. Not a hoopy beer, the empahasis here is all malt and hefe. I prefer the Dunkel, but this is very good. Unfortunatly this is so rarely fresh when purchased here. Worth seeking out close to the date of production.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2006 (Bottled) Murky, dark golden-orange color. Pours a large and quite lasting, cloudy and lacy head. Yeasty and sweet banana-strawberry aroma - smells strongly like sahti when pouring, but fades quickly. Sweetish banana flavor with perfectly balanced, crisp acidity and a sourish finish. No bitterness at all. Very smooth and slicky-yeasty, medium to full-bodied, quite carbonated palate. Very refreshing and enjoyable, and one of the worlds very best hefeweizens!
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2004 Had this over the weekend on tap at a bar.  I was first happy they had a hefe-weizen, then REALLY happy when I tasted this beer.  So smooth and delicious.

whoaahhhhh baby.  this is some tasty, refreshing stuff.  sweet & spicy banana aroma, light banana, wheat, yeasty flavor.  this is the best hefe weizen i've had so far in my short beer-tasting career.  yes.  yes. yes.  this cuts through the heat and makes me feel so good.

Bottled.
Orange with a steady head. Aroma from yeast and citrus.
Dry, spicy and yeasty flavour.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2010 RE-rate. Had on tap at Snookers in Providence. Tall, blond and beautiful! Wonderfully refreshing and drinkable. Everything a weissbier should be!
Cloudy pale yellow, large white head. Yeasty banana aroma, nice German hefe.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2003 Bottle.  Pours cloudy orange-golden with a large white head that lingered nicely.  Aroma is fruity with yeast and wheat very apparent.  Flavor is sweet and delicious, banana, spice, a bit of breadiness and lingering bitter finish.  Nice mouthfeel, medium body with creamy carbonation.  Nice hefe all around.
