Oh yeah, this one made me wish I was back in a summertime Munich biergarten.

Cloudy yellow with a big white head that sticks around a while.  Aroma is citrus and yeasty and the head is very bitter.  The taste is musty/grassy with some significant citrus notes.  A very good hefe.

Pours a murky orangish color with a big fluffy white head.  Aroma is of inviting yeast and wheat.  Banana, apple, maybe pear and the perfect touch of wheat flavor.  Palette is incredibly smooth with a near perfect finish.  If you love hefe's and haven't had this yet... it's worth seeking out... fantastic
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2003 Excellent hefe.  Nice tart apple taste with a light spicy finish that tickles the tongue.

Fizzy white head.   Golden hazy appearance.  Yeasty aroma with tinge of clove and banana.  Lovely light and fruity palate with strong yeast and banana flavor which has a tinge of spice at the end.  A classic hefe--with a lot of appeal.

I'm going to ignore the last time I tried this, on tap at Cambrinus, Rotterdam, and instead talk about all the good times I've had with this beer from the bottle.  Wonderful, wonderful beer - big fruity, sweet flavour, with a superb bright orange colour and smooth, fluffy mouthfeel.  This is just about the best hefe weizen around.

Cloudy orange coloured body with a thin white head. Aroma of pepper, yeast and citrus. Medium to Heavy-bodied; Nice tastes of cloves, anise and yeast. Aftertaste of yeast, citrus and coriander seed. Overall, a good hefeweiss, definately worth trying! I had this pint on draught at R.F.D. in Washington on 28-November-2003.
It pours a deap cloudy amber color and has a decent sized head that shrinks rather quickly.  You can taste and smell the wheat along with citrus and banana tones.
Huge head. Some banana and spice in the aroma. Big wheaty flavour with a slight citrus sourness. Finish is moderately spicy.

A very good Hefe. Hazy, cloudy yellow color with a half inch white head. Banana springs from teh aroma, slong with some wheat. Great smooth taste with some fruit. A tiny bitter finish that leaves you wanting more. Very good Hefe.

Muddy yellow, cloudy beer with firm head.
Banana aroma with sourish twist and tones of vanilla.
Banana flavor with bitter end.
Probably one of the best Hefeweisen I have had for a while. Color is gold cloudy. It has a strong wheat aroma, a long-lasting head. A fruity flavor with a slightly bitter finish

Strong nutty wheat aroma with some yeast and earth hints.  Large initial head mostly deminishes, but there is good lacing with what remains.  Color is a cloudy amber.  Lightly bitter flavor and can definitely pick out the wheat.  Nice medium creamy palate.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2004 Cloudy orange. White, lacy head. Spicey, yeasty aroma. Very well-rounded Weizen, with the usual suspects in full effect: banana, yeast, citrus, sourness. Very refreshing and tasty. Along the lines of Franziskaner Hefeweizen. Very good. Re-rate: As I did with Franziskaner, I had to higher the standards by which I measure weizens, and I really couldn´t rate a beer lower than its average, when I absolutely love it.

Smells nutty with vanilla hints.  Fluffy white head.  Clear pale yellow bubbly color on bottom that fades to large dark yellow on top.  Tastes fiery and very wheaty with hints of peanuts and haystacks.
Cloudy pour nice head smokey apple aroma, apple banana taste, a little sourness and bread taste also detected. If your into weiss's this is the one.

This was one of those beers that I had heard a lot about, and one of which I have been using this yeast forever in my own wheat beers.  The Weizen was a nice fruity crisp beer, with a nice balance of the Banana/Clove flavor against a refreshingly wholesome yeastiness.  Definitely worth searching out and procuring while I was in Germany, and best of all, I can now get it at my local bottle shop.
Definitely one of the best weizens, cloudy gold appearance, huge bubbly white head that laced around the glass, lots of great banana & spiciness in the flavors, very smooth & very drinkable

Looks like a wonderful hefeweizen. Nice pale rubbed gold. Tall foamy white head. Smelled apples when I poured it. Bubble gum, banana, coriander, lemon. Tastes like banana, bubble gum. Tangy at first. Smooth no aftertaste. Good. Better than Hacker Pschorr.
A wonderfully full hefe, with a firm banana aroma and taste.  Sweet, but not overpoweringly so, it is one of my all-time favorite hefeweizen brews.

Pours a hazy medium golden/orange, huge creamy white head that mostly lasts, leaves good lacing.  Aroma is dominated with banana and clove, with a hint of hops in the back.  Flavor is sweet, loads of banana, some other fruits, a bit of spiciness in the end, and maybe a bit of smokiness somewhere in there as well.  Medium body, finishes dry as a bone.  A superb hefe.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2004 Resin colored with a haze. Big, creamy white head. Aroma is banana, orange, clove spice, touch of soap - wonderful, just like a hefe should be. Tastes like it smells with a mild malty character. Texture is nicely carbonated - tannic that drys and puckers the mouth lining a bit.

Pours a very hazy orange-amber with a giant off-white head that slowly recedes. It almost looks like shaving cream as it fades into a rocky layer atop the beer. It was so attractive I had to take a picture of it. A thick-veined lacing is left on the glass. The aroma is bready yeast and a touch of clove and/or coriander. Smells more like the latter. Also a touch of lemon zest in the nose. The taste is superb, with again a nice breadiness, topped with fruity flavors, banana being the strongest of those, with a touch of plum or grape sweetness in the background. A touch of butterscotch adds a nice contrast to the coriander spiciness and wheat crispness on the finish. The mouthfeel is buttery yet very refreshing. Carbonation levels are perfect, providing a nice liveliness on the tongue while not getting agressive and distracting.
Aroma of banan, cloves, wheat.  Perfect appearance, hazy gold with beautiful, lasting head.  Cloves dominate the taste, with a touch of banana.  Supremely balanced, very good beer.
Great appearance, earthy spicy aroma and slight banana flavour makes this my favourite of the weihenstephaner range.

Dark ylloe, cloudy, sparkling, thick creamy white head. Malty, yeasty and spicy nose with notes of banana and citrus. Medium body, pretty smooth and slightly sweet. Wheat-like, yeasty-like, slightly citrus, sour and moderately bitter. Sour, dry, bitter, pretty full and long finish.
A very good hefeweizen.  It has everything to be a great summer beer.  Light and crisp make it easy to drink.  The wheat and citrus fill this beer with flavor.

This was pretty good stuff I have to admit, one of the better hefes that I have had.  A very light summery essence to this one, slightly cloudy to overcast, very light taste and mouthfeel, but very crisp and acidic, but very easy to drink.  A definite choice that I will try again.

An excellent hefeweizen.  Cloudy almost orange color.  A nice lasting head on it.  Aroma was cloves and sweet fruit.  Taste was similar and quite refreshing.  This is a perfect example of what a hefeweizen should be.

This was a perfect German hefeweizen for me. Pours a clouded blond with a hint of brown in the mix. Tall whitish head with a nose full of malt, spice, yeast and maybe a hint of fruit - banana and citrus. The tongue is wonderful. More spice and yeast with some sweet notes. Very good and very refreshing! One of my more favorite hefeweizens.

Pours with a massive head like ice cream which stays to the bottom of the glass. Colour is a cloudy yellowy-brown (no real orange tinge). Aroma is amazing - spicy clove, sweet malt, orange, pineapple, alcohol. Given the amazing aroma the flavour is a bit of let-down. It's sweetish, with a touch of fruit (pineapple) and alcohol. Body is a bit thicker than I would like for a hefeweizen.
Pours a thick slow to drop foam and keeps on going.  The appearance is very cloudy and there is a hint of colliander that gets stronger the longer it sits.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2003 Golden color.  This is a great tasting hefe without the typical clove taste of the standard Deutsch Wheat, but plenty of banana and wheat flavors.  Great beer.

16.9 fl. oz. brown bottle. When you drink this beer, folks, you're drinking a little bit of history. Made at the world's oldest brewery virtually guarantees that much. It poured out a rich, golden yellow color, with a dense, rocky, white head. It slowly fades to a really decent lacing on top of the beer. Aromas are of banana, slight clove, and sweet grass. Fresh cut hay is along for the ride as well.
Champagne like effervescence make this a slightly gassy beer. Tastes good, with that classic yeast bite at the end. Makes a great summertime beer.

Every bit as good as Franziskaner, much to my delight.  I would be interested in testing the two side-by-side.  The cloudy, yellow-orange body is topped by a dense white head.  Aroma is wheat tang, cloves, and some banana.  Flavor is full and tasty, with banana and clove yeast notes sharing center stage with wheat tang.  Very smooth mouthfeel.  Lives up to its reputation.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2005 Hazy yellow, great head. Aroma from yeast, wheat and fruits. Citrus and raisins. Flavor brings banana, mango and citrus along with some yeasty notes.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2003 Dark orange.  Large, longlasting but thin white head.  Aroma of citrus and wheat.  Wheat, citrus, and some banana taste.  Aftertaste of sugar and fruit.  Refreshing.  Fuller bodied than many wheats.  A great beer.
7/25/03:  bottle.    thick, white full head (a bit rocky).  medium orange head.  lemon, wheat and citrus nose.  honey, wheat and yeast flavors with a lemon finish.

Cloudy, opaque yellow body with a creamy white head. Nice lacing.
Smells of wheat, yeast and citrus (mainly lemon). A bit of spice in the nose too.
Full bodied wheat. Nice yeast and lemon flavors too. Nice crisp wheat.
Clean and smooth palate.

Light murky yellow.  Big soapy nose full of lemon, banaba and pineapple.  Very carbonated, with some nice citrus and fruit flavors.  Finish is slightly abrasive due to carbonation, but overall it's quite light and is enjoyed very much in 100+ F summer temperatures here in Oklahoma.
Color is yellow with a nice white head. The taste is spicy and fruity. It has a nice but not to longlasting finish.
This smells like dickcheese. The flavour is yeasty, wheaty and sour. A terrible beer.
tap-maproom, Chicago, IL-Hands down, the best hefe I have ever had.  The aroma, body, appearance and palate are all right on par for excellence.  I must get more!!!

On tap: Map room - Chicago. This is what I think about when I want a hefe. Nice and cloudy, bright yellow with a crisp white diminishing head. Smooth mouthfeel. Spicy and yeasty. Very refreshing and traditional.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2007 Thick, spumous white head and cloudy honey-colored body with moderate carbonation. Pleasant aroma of banana esters, yeast, and fresh biscuits. Great depth of flavor with a pronounced fresh wheaty character, and notes of Mandarin orange, some mild nuttiness and a hint of phenolics. Continental hops make an appearance and lend some light but detectable flavor and bitterness. Mostly dry except for a touch of honey-like sweetness. Medium fullness on the tongue with some crisp and lively effervescence. This beer can slake a mean thirst but still has tons of character. One of my summer favorites.

I'm not very familiar with the Hefe-weiss style but I certainly enjoyed this particular beer.  Poured from the bottle into a glass, I was amazed at the initial carbonation and the very thick, "pocky" head.  Color was a cloudy gold with the gorgeous meringue-looking head, which took awhile to settle down.  The taste of cloves & bananas is noticeable but fairly subtle.  Very smooth mouthfeel.  I found myself wanting to grab another bottle of this once I finished the first--it's very good.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2005 (500 ml bottle). Cloudy golden colour (fairly dark for a Hefe), large head, not very strong aroma of cloves, good refreshing flavour, hints of bitterness (which often seems to be lacking in other Weissbiers).

The sample I had was at least 9 months old, having received it at Christmas as part of a gift pack.  Astonishingly, the head, color, aroma, etc. appeared to be intact, and was quite refreshing.  As others have said, it has the banana, clove, and other spice components without being overpowering.  Great for the summer!
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text: Poster child for the true Bavarian-style hefeweisen:  the appearance is unfiltered gold; the nose is true to the style; the taste is yeasty and develops the banana and spice attributes that one associates with a good hefe, but it does not overwhelm the senses.  Very smooth finish.  Most enjoyable.
Cloudy and fruity (banana) in nature. Some spicy hoppiness  is here. I would rather drink Ayinger.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2004 On tap. Hazy orange color. Big yeast, bubble gum and banana aroma. Full wheat flavor, more bubble gum, sweet but pleasant. Smooth, refreshing summer beer, especially when compared to some of the american wheats I've encountered lately. Rerate: Upped the score just a bit; lots of peppery spice in the aroma as well. This is a full bodied hefeweizen, lots of bubble gum, chewy. Dryish finish, soothing. Excellent.

When poured into my glass, there was a large white foamy head with small bubbles. The lacing was fair on the sides of my glass. It had an aroma of clove, banana and a light malty aroma as well. The body was yellow in hue. The flavor was smooth from start to finish. This was an enjoyable brew to drink on a warm summer day.

This brew pours a very large head of finely sized bubbles and a cloudy light yellow brown body.  It has a nice wheat beer aroma not stoo strong though.  Its flavor starts off with mild fruity banana lemon and yeast notes then mellows into a lingering soft mouthfeel.  It is on the thick side which adds to the smooth mouthfeel.  It is an easy brew to drink and is one that you could easily enjoy in a beer tent at the Oktoberfest!  Prosit!

Solid looking hefe, super cloudy, hazy, yeast filled golden straw color. One super large fluffy off-white head nearly three inches tall, fades and pops slowly to leave a fine thin head with some stringy sticking lace. Smell is a nice light and airy, fluffy lemon with a nice grainy wheat bread background and notes of banana and spice. Taste is one refreshing, rock solid hefe, with a perfect balance of lemon, not to tart, good breadish tone, wheaty, yeasty, but all very mellowing and smooth. Notes of banana linger and some spice of cloves. Feel is pretty full from sip to swallow, very mellow, has a textured feel in the middle, moderate tartness and a very clean finish. Which makes it incredibly drinkable, no doubt about it.

Out of the bottle. Asuper cloudy body with a beautiful pillowy head that rose a full inch above the glass. A nose of cloves and bananas along with a slight hint of citrus. Taste of pure liquid refreshment. As fine a Hefeweizen as I have ever had.

(o,5 ltr bottle) Many thanks to my loving wife for lugging this beer (among others) in her backpack while returning from Bonn. Beautiful, cloudy, orange-amber body and a huge, white, foamy head. Nice yeasty-banana, citrus nose. The taste is rare to find replicated in North American weissbier - light, smooth, fizzles on your tongue then tickles the epiglottis. Whimsical. Fun and refreshing. Delectable hints of bitterness in the finish. Lovingly German

Huge head and nice lacing. Good cloudy and orange/pale yellow appearance. Aroma is slight fruit/banana and light citrus and spice. Not as yeasty as the description would lead you to believe, but yeast in this one is good. Great hefeweiss for sure, but I may need to go on another wheat binge to see. This one had all the good flavors a german wheat should have, maybe a bit more watery than most.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2003 #300 Light yellow and hazy, aroma consists of fruits and flowers.Light and refreshing a Summer beer except that it has been extremely cool and wet here so far where I live, a great year for strawberries and maple seeds. Wheat and malty it is clear and crisp, This beer is recommended.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2013 the heaviest german white I´ve tasted. Sweet fruity aroma, huge everlasting head, very murky and cloudy. Taste was very sweet (reminded me a bit of belgian white) alot of fruits and a very complex taste

After tasting many copies, finally the original. Everything is here that was expected. Very lively beer, huge head. Aroma is slightly weaker than the flavor. But in the end it all comes together beautifully. Wish I could have kegs of this stuff.
An unclear dark yellow beer with an OK head. The aroma is slightly wheaty and slightly citrus. The flavor is wheaty, round and very nice.

One of the best German wheats. It is slightly similar to many of the 
Belgian styles because it is more fruity and fresh than most other German wheats, which I find nice.
Classic German wheat flavors, with lots of clove and peach.  Delicious.  Perhaps not as rich as Schneider.  Certainly one of the best Weizens available.

First off, if you can find this on tap, you MUST TRY IT! Pours to a huge fluffy white head with medium body. Banana, clove, wheat, malt, lemongrass, and ripe pear come through on the nose and palate. Dry, yeast finish that you can taste 10 minutes after the last swallow. Adding a lemon to this creates a totally different beer (which I will do sometimes), but straight up, one of finest Hefe Weiss on the market. A great summertime beer.
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2004 Massive banana nose to compliment the massive weissbier head.  Fantastic clove spice from this perfect example of hefe-bliss.
This is amazing stuff,  I was so lucky to get ahold of a bottle.  Someday I might even get more.
mild yeasty nose, pours with a cloudy yellow hue and a large white head, mild orange flavour, creamy texture, reasonable wheat beer

This beer poured a cloudy yellow color and had a medium amount of carbonation. It formed a hugh foamy white heat that left thick cobweb style of lace as it floated down the glass in float style of descent. The aroma was of malt, hops, banana and cloves. The flavor was of malt, hops and banana. The finish was light with a slight bread aspect to it. This is a fine hefe and very well priced. Holds up it's age well after all these centuries of existence.
Pours a huge rich head. Yeasty aroma that leads to a banana and clove palate. A refreshingly classic beer. Goes perfect with german potato salad. Prost!

I like this Weissbier because it has a uniqueness to it's yeast flavor. Pours nice, nice head and color. Nice malty wheaty mouthfeel. Good overall balance. Also pairs nicely with smoked ham and potato salad. (just thought I'd through that in)
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Goldenrod, only a tiny bit cloudy. Fizzy bubbles rise.  Spicy pepper, over-ripe banana, chicken soup stock nose (???).  Mostly clove on the tongue, but rich and thick.  Bubblegum, flour, hard banana bread taste.

Orange-tan color with cloudy body and large head of foam. Good yeasty-fruity aromas. Lots of layers to this. Amost a different taste with each sip- bubble gum,nutmeg,citrus, graham cracker, fresh wheat dough-along with the usual banana and clove. Deliciously sweet and creamy.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 Loved it. Close run thign between this and Schneiderweisse as my favourite. ) . Orange/cinammon

Overall a dcent hefeweisse. Great golden hues, particularly when served in a Weihen glass. Aroma was a bit funky, kind of like really old grain. The flavor was my least favorite aspect, lending way to stale bread and tin foil. Nice body for a hefe-weisse.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2009 Poured from bottle.  Well, it sure pours like a German beer - it took a while to get it all in the glass as a nice, whipped cream head forms.  A sweet wheat aroma.  Wheat and malt in the flavor, with a tiny bit of spice.  Seems more Belgian than German.  Good feel, a bit watery, but just the right bit of carbonation.  A good example of this type of beer.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Cloudy clove banana stuff going on. Has some tartness in the taste, only slight. Enough to make it stand out. I will drink one of these the first time I cut my lawn this year.
Cloudy, light gold.  Thinner, sweet malts.  I didn't get as much out of the taste that I expected from the appearance.  Some lemony banana, but overall a little bland.

Cloudy appereance, pale golden colour, huge and really persistent head. Spicy aroma with hints of banana. This wheat beer has the sweetest flavour I've ever found in this kind of beers, really malty, with some good banana and pear traces. Spicy aftertaste, with few bitterness. Very drinkable and pleasant, simply one of the best wheat beers on the market.
An excellent wheat. Hazy, pale yellow, with a full stark white head. Spicy nose. Good clove and banana flavor. Short finish.
A very good wheat... A very smooth, well-rounded flavor. Subtle, with a creamy head that just ads to the enjoyment.

Hazy whitish banana liquer body almost approaching witbier appearance with a cream-fluff head that was too thick.  Moderately yeasty aroma with the dominance of pear, which was the dominant flavor as well.  On the light bodied side with a dash of banana and a parching effect on the roof of the mouth.  Kind of flat, but a fair german wheat.

Pale orange color, with a thick creamy frothy white head that lasted for a long time.  This had the wheat taste that I look for in Hefes.  This beer also had some cloudiness to it but not much, very good.

Very nice color to this one, almost seemed orange to me. Good aroma as well.  As one non-beer drinking friend put it, "It tastes like the inside of a barn."  This was very true as the wheat taste came out wonderfully.
Extremely tasty classic wheat beer with huge aromatic foam, pleasant cloudiness, golden straw color and unbelievable taste of wheat. Interesting fruity notes.
As far as I'm concerned, this one sets the standard for a German Hefe Weissen...even better then Paulaner. Somewhat sweet, light body with a nice head. No lemon, please.

Cloves, bubblegum, and bananas in the aroma.  Substantial head, very cloudy.  Flavor balance is slightly sweet, but very close to even.  Light graininess/wheat.  Soem fruity/bubblegum esters.  Very high carbonation, light body.  A very good German wheat beer.
absolutely the best wheat that i've ever tasted! the banana and clove aromas are very appealing and the flavor leaves me craving for more. wonderfully refreshing in summer heat.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2003 Very similar to Paulaner with a slightly lighter wheat taste (which is still strong) and a beautiful finish. It provides an excellent example of how a wheat beer should taste in every respect.
Wonderful. Yeasty scent and taste. Seems strongeer than the typical heffeweisse.

Excellent wheat.  Nice, thick pour with an everpresent pure white head with heavy lacing.  Yeasty aroma of bananas and flowers. Detect bananas in the flavor as well with a bit of bubblegum in the aftertaste. Nice light orange cloudy appearance.  Very refreshing - could envision quaffing down several of these at the beach.  Probably on of the best Wheats I have had yet.
Hazey golden color, huge white head. Yeast aroma. Flavor is very sweet with yeast and wheat flavors.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2003 Up there with the very best. Add your lemon and enjoy, what a taste!. Oh yes a little darker then some weissbier it is very filling and satisfying

Overall this is a well balanced and decent example of the style. This version has the clove spice much more subtle than the Franziskaner that I found undrinkable. Still not a fan of the style because of the cloves, but at least with this one I could finish the glass.

Drinking these much heralded wheat beers in February might be the problem, but I ended up not thinking either this or Aventinus was the cat's meow.  This one is the better of the two, far less anoying esterily, with more complex and less aggressive counterpoints (lemonsmoke, clean malts, cloves).
I love this wheat beer. What can I say, cloudy yellow colour with hints of white, huge sudsy head with good retention. Spicey banana aroma and flavour. Smooth full body.

Nice hazy color with the typical huge head of foam.  Very well balanced although lacking bite.  More banana than clove I thought and not as spicy/citrusy as others I've tried.  But still a classic and very smooth and well done.

Thick creamy head greets you as you pour it into the glass, and it hangs around for a while.  I found the flavor to be a tad tarty but not in an IPA way-almost as if the hops were aged just a bit too long.  At least that's how my bottle tasted.  I think I prefer my hefe's out of a tap rather than a bottle.  Not to my liking but not a bad beer.  Doesn't mean the rest of the reviews are wrong-Just not for me.

An excellent wheat beer.  Pours with a substantial frothy head, with the beer being cloudy pale yellow golden color.  Aroma is all wheat, spice, and citrus.  I can inhale wheats aroma for several minutes before drinking, they have such a refreshing smell.  The taste has the typical banana yeast taste.  Added plus is this is very reasonably priced  for and import.

This must be one of the best bottled hefes ever. Banana nose and flavor, but not as sweet as some, very nicely done. Lower pepper, clove than others as well; exceptionally well balanced. Large poofy head, chill haze plus slightly unfiltered appearance makes it all very nice. Would love a side-by-side with Two Bros Ebel and Denison's Weizen (oh man on that last one...sniff)
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Excellent. What a good Hefeweizen is supposed to taste like. Smooth, rich and spicy not gritty and hoppy like some American versions of this beer. Anyone putting a lemon in this beer should be shot

Another very good example of an excellent Hefeweizen. Golden in color, cloudy. Beautiful foamy head, slightly citrusy in aroma. Thats a good thirst quencher for a hot summer day in the Munich Biergarten!
Pale amber colour with a beautiful head. The aroma is fresh, citrusy, grapefruit and banana. Lot of carbonation and slightly spicy. Grapefruity finish.

Strong, wheaty aroma...like a Belgian. Small, mostly lasting, creamy, frothy, white head. Nice, cloudy, orange body with decent lace. Very Belgian-like in flavor without the strong alcohol mouthfeel of say, a Maudite or Fin Du Monde. Very flavorful. Not my favorite style, but very good. Will be comparing it soon to the draught version in Germany soon.

Poured just like a german wheat should. Misty orange color with a fizzy background and ample head. Smells of slight skunk and citrus. Strong Hop aroma and a trace of wood. The beer was very carbonated and felt like alka-selzer in my mouth. The flavor was that of a mild wheat beer, nothing too complex, nothing too distiguishing. Overall, Ive had better german wheats, but still a tasty beer and worth trying.

I won this beer at Wawoods yuppy beer tasting.  Hef is a german bitch who gives good foamy head and wears lots of lace...she is really dirty.  her golden cloudy quality appearance distinquishes her.  she has a destinquishing taste that ends very smoothly. I like her yeast...so much so she may have an infection...which is a good thing. solid++

Bought for my brother as a gift (tall bottle), so I just had to sneak a few sips: I like the clingy head. Definite citrusy mouthfeel; decent graininess adds well roundedness. Easy drinkin here. I like this stuff - next time I will gift it to myself!

Bottled(500ml). -when I used to drink bad wheat beer I didnt like that stile at all, but now when Ive tried a few good ones I am bigining to like wheat beer... great yeast notes, malty, rich and fruty aroma, refreshing, great creamy head- personal best
UPDATED: JAN 23, 2005 In bottle: Nice head, refreshing pepper-banana like flavor; cloudy with dry aftertaste.  If it gives you a bad impression let it warm.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: Had this on tap. Came with a nice white head. Good wheat and banana flavors. Delicious and refreshing. Even better with a wedge of citrus.

Bottle. Tall, inconsistent, white head. Cloudy, mango colored body. Lemony
sweet punch-like taste. Dry aftertaste. Light, peppery, salty, not creamy. 
Due to its fullness and sweetness this is considered a superior, middle-priced wheatbeer 
(better than Erdinger & Franzikaner, etc). However, I find others sweeter. Abrasive in the 
mouth. A typical Wheat with a little too much high-end: Pow! without Pug!. 
Probably good with orange rather than lemon. Rolls down like any endowed wheatbeer.

Fresh on tap.  Typically, I have not had the best on tap until the other night.  Hazy dark straw color with a tall white head.  Mild clove and sweet malt aroma.  Light spice flavors of clove with only a touch of bananas, pears and raisins.  Finishes clean and quenching.

this was the reason i became the beer order writer at my job. i got this is a mix pack from a distributer..now its pretty expensive so i dont know if i would have taken a chance on it..but man..its damn good.
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2003 Excellent hefe-weizen and a very different taste on tap from the bottle.  This beer is a highly recommended hefe!

Winey, yeasty aroma, good spice and pepper. Peppery spice also comes through well on the palate with pear candy and banana, cloves, and a dry spice finish. Like Oakes says, a familiar flavor, but pretty impressive overall.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2007 Pour produces a frothy white head, color is a yeasty cloudy blond hue.  The aroma is typical of a first rate hefe, strong wheat characteristic, yeast and bananas.  Flavor is wheaty, then bananas then a hint of clove.  Finish is equally appealing.  The best hefe Ive ever had the pleasure of tasting.
Subdued aroma and (especially) flavor for a Weissbier. When in Freising, I prefer Huber instead.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2003 A truly pleasant wheat beer from the world's oldest brewery.  A beer to drink, but unlike Aventinus for example not a beer to study.  Works great with onion rings, for example ... Taste starts with wheat and with very light touch of banana, then finishes with soft bite of clove.  Can't do much better with a German Weissbier. // rerated 12 April 2003.  After a side by side comparison with Schneider Weisse I realize that some of the softness that i found so appealing in this beer seems more like flabbiness when compared with the clovey spiciness and the long bitter finish of the Schneider.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2004 This beer is my second favorite hefe-weisse beer. It should rank way up in the charts considering this stuff comes from the oldest brewery in the world. (since 1040) The Weihenstephaner that comes in a bottle tastes great, but tastes even better if you can find a good German restaurant that serves it on tap like one that I found. Anyone who rates this beer less than a '4' has either gotten a bad bottle, doesn't know a thing about weisse beers or simply has their head up their ass. One of the best beers in the world.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2006 Predominant cereal aroma and flavor. Doughy. Lots of bright lemony citrus. A bit of bitterish spice, like cloves. Banana notes are there but not dominant like in many wheat beers. This is more complicated than most weissbiers. Recommended.
Best rating for this beer ! --- Its the best Weizen ! --- Some Banana and cinnamon in the aftertaste, and I still ask myself how you can extract this taste out of cereals... Bravo Brewmaster !
Really smooth with the bite I like from a wheat brew. Brewing since 1040 they should know their stuff.
Not bad for a wheat, but there are som many other better ones out there.  Good, but nothing distinctive to me.

Cloudy copper bronze color. Huge head. Wheaty floral smell. Creamy pillowy head. Micro bubble lace work. Brown bread and graham cracker start turns mildly carmel/fruit flavored with malty tones. Clove or spicy finish.
lovely spicey/sweet aroma, creamy cloudy-to-clear pale golden color. all the banana/clove/citrusy essences that you want with this style of beer. very good.

I may have gotten a bad bottle because I didnt have anything like what most are describing. Mine was very sharp aand grainy in the mouth and made you want a glass of water when you were done. Will try again and re-rate.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2003 Re-Rate: What a hefe is supposed to be.cloudy golden coler with creamy white head. yeasty aroma is of banana and cloves. taste is complex with notes of banana, lemon, apples, coriander, clove. Excellent Hefe.

Most adherant to its style.  That could be because they invented it.  The quintessential German wheat beer with all the great characteristics: Banana and clove aroma, slightly cloudy amber body, and a citrusy finish.  Bavarians are bred on this stuff, and I therefore envy them.
A good German wheat beer.
Another tasty German wheat beer. Retains its head all the way down the glass. Crisp and refreshing.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2004  Sept, 2002:Tangy and refreshing with sparkles of tangerine, pineapple, melon, apple and a hint of banana, all balanced by a rubbery yeast that quickly erases one fruit to replace it with another. All this from the oldest brewery in the world (dates from 1040) with its attached brewing university! Easy available here in the UK from most supermarkets. [3.3]
Dec, 2004: Wheat beer. Agreeably pleasant while cold. More character, but less attractive when warming up. [2.9]
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2008 The oldest brewery in the world. Thats also gotta be worth something. Check it out. A great wheat beer.

Cloudy pale golden in color. Huge head that dissipates to about a finger width at half glass.  Citrusy with banana notes and of course cloves.  Not too sweet compared with some other hefes.  It does have just a touch of bitterness in the finish.  I really like German wheats, so this is a mid-pack hefe IMO.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2006 Bottled and Draught. Golden coloured. Unclear. Huge off white head. Aroma of yeast, banana some spices and citrus. Dense and aromatic. Flavour is equally delicious. Loads of banana and fruits, some spices and light yeast. Full bodied. Quite dry and acidic. Balanced. Ends on a dry fruity and citric note. Has light smoky notes. Hard to get a better german hefe in my book.
This is very typical for the style...cloudy yellow, clove, banana peel from nose to finish.  I like my hefes to be a little more crisp than this....full bodied for a wheat.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2011 I can be short about this: the best Hefeweizen i know. And also available everywhere! And now another sentence to meet the minimum amount of characters...

Truly wondrous-looking brew, with a delicious smoky-amber body topped by the longest-lasting weissbier head Ive seen.  Aroma very sweet, orangey-lemony, not as strong as it could be but nice.  Flavor super-duper malty, very sweet, very smooth.  Wheaty, banana-apricot with some caramel, truly decicious with a great finish; doesnt make as much impact as Paulaner, but very impressive and deserving of its accolades.
What everyone else said

Impressive head, doesnt last long though. Orange/brown, cloudy. Spicy yeasty banana aroma. Sweet-ish wheaty flavour, theres also some alcohol-bitterness in the back of the mouth. A good example of the style.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2004 yawn banana cloves etc. nicely malty, but simple and sweet in the finish. very smooth, drinkable but a bit predictable - bit more zing would be good. i think im reallly really getting bored with weizens actually.
Fizzy fermented and grainy aroma.  Moderately sour with back of the mouth taste.  Refreshing and sour in a pleasant way.

Just as the description reads "what makes this beer so special is the fullness and softness totally without the "edginess" sometimes found in Wheat Beers."  That is basically what I was going to write in my review!

After drinking a decent American try at a German wheat, this was a nice way to recalibrate just how distinctive this style can be.  Great cloudy beer with big head and big spicy nose.  Very complex interplay among the malts, hops and yeast to create a very spicy mix with plenty of sweetness to balance it out.  An excellent summer drink, and a good German wheat, although I still say the Pschorr-Brau is better.

The king of weissbiers, hazy orange gold colour, excellent rocky head with good condition and lace. Big banana/esters/phenolic nose, more sweet banana in the mouth with hints of clove and a sweet phenolic finish.
Nice sweet wheat aroma, slightly spicy, and wonderful balanced sweet wheat flavor.  Nice and light, good easy summertime drinking.

Re-rate: Orange color, good head.Finely differentiated banana and vanilla aroma and flavor. The mouthfeel is a bit like as if you get cream and liquid banana in your mouth. Still very palatable and no annoying aftertaste. Excellent weizen.
Very promonent yearst and grain taste. Good beer overall. A bit tart. Nicely carbonated. Aftertaste has yeasty, bread notes.
A magnificent wheat.  However, something odd in the flavor that I cant nail down mars this otherwise excellent wheat.
Hoppy, flowery aroma. Dry, herbal, hoppy, citric taste with a hopbitter finish. One of the best weizen beers Ive had so far.
I have to agree: a definite nose of cirtus, and that famous hefe aftertaste. Although I experienced no, zero head with this beer, and it went flat pretty fast.
Poured a nice cloudy gold with a big white head.Nose of citrus and spice with a little tartness. Great hefe!
Outstanding spicy aroma. Beautiful yellow color. Not very complex, but very good!
I agree that this may be the best wheat beer

I am making a political statement with my rating of this beer.  One, I think this is the best wheat beer on the market.  Two, I love reading the ratings on this site and I respect the beer knowledge of the reviewers; however, unless its a big, high alcohol beer nothing ever merits much more than a 4.5 ranking.  As king of wheat beers, I give this a 5.0.  The first one I have given.  And the perfect time of year ... check back in the autumn, I might have to rerate ... I think that I am lost in a moment right now.
had one in the keller for the token hefe beer while in the restaraunt

Big nose - spicy, yeasty, and bananas. Cloudy orange color. Lost a point because the head went down too quick. Fat wheaty taste with citrus tones (lemon) and banana. Chewy. Clean palette and a nice balance. Possible the standard against which all other German Wheats should be measured.
Wonderful: Banana and vanilla with hints of butter. Nice cloud, murky orange body. Fullmouth taste. An Excellent Wheat!

For some reason this summer Ive been more interested in exploring belgian wits than revisiting german hefes, as I didnt remember ever being wowed by a hefe before.  This beer changes my opinion.  It is so incredibly crisp and sharp in flavor.  Not nearly as much residual sweetness as many hefes.  More clovey than banana-y with restrained fruitiness.  This is a superstar hefe, and I will find a place for this in my refrigerator for the rest of the summer.
strong taste of banannas as is the norm for this type of beer.  Yellow and cloudy appearance.  Medium lacing and moderate carbonation.  Decent beer.

Very sweet. Almost like root beer. This very distinctive taste just might become a favorite of mine. I think I tasted cloves, but I think German law prohibits adding any spices to the beer. This is a great great beer!

Cloudy pale golden yellow color, a nice white head.  Classic fruity/yeasty German Hefe aroma.  Flavor profile is quite a bit less sharp and acidic than a lot of Hefes, as the description points out.  Very nice effervescent mouthfeel.  Pleasant lemony citrusiness and some smooth wheat flavors.  Finish is citric and refreshing.  Quite a well done beer.
An excellent german wheat, without a doubt, great banana and yes, wheaties taste, smooth and full, perfect wheat beer.
Bottle.  Traditional wheat look with a nice nose.  I enjoyed the spicy, coriander, vanila, and banana kick that often seems missing in wheat beers.  A quick dry finish with a little bite as expected.

Nice complex aroma, balanced flavour with banana but not too much.
Could do with less carbonation. Excellent Weissbier.
Nice German Wheat beer.
this is my first weisbier, and deffinatly not my last. pours a cloudy yellow with a good head. very good beer.
A milky, light brown weissbier. The aroma is sweetish but the aftertaste is dry and bitter. I was neither impressed nor dissapointed.

Huge white short lasting head over typical medium hazy yellow-orange colour. Lotsa corn syrup aromas and flavour. Full soft smooth body with sweetish palate I marked it down slightly for what seemed like a slightly artificial bitter aftertaste.
Pours with a huge rocky head.  Big banana aroma and taste.  Very clean, dry aftertaste.  A top notch hefe all the way.
Good example of the style, fruity - citrusy nose, pleasently cloudy. try it first without the lemon.
A very nice German wheat beer. Its aroma has some banana in it. It wasnt too crisp, but it was easy drinking. I found it to be very enjoyable, although I would have preferred a bit more crispness.
A tiny bit fruity.  A very light flavor, sweet aroma.
Sweet fruity (mostly pineapple) aroma, very thick head. Light bodied and sweet flavor. Im not normally a fan of the style but this actually wasnt too bad.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2003 A delightful german wheat beer. I am most proud of myself becuase i drank this at the recomended room temperature. It was everything i thought it could be and more.  I truly love enjoying a pint of german wheat with macgyver. Doesn't serve much else of a purpose beyond that though.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2004 Pours cloudy yellow, nice thick foamy head, leaves a clingy lace in the glass, aroma of wheat and bananas, banana-clove yeasty flavor. Light body, clean and crisp, very refreshing one of my favorites, always good.

Very hazy yellow. Fluffy head and moderate lace. Sweet nose of wheat,malt,vanilla and bananas. Soft,thin body, with most of the flavor residing in the middle to end. Flavors of banana,vanilla,wheat and yeast dominate. Completly non-offensive and easy to drink with tons of flavor. Quite the quaffer and a top 5 wheat in my book.
Not as tangy as some hefes, which in my opinion is a shame. In all other respects one of the good ones.
It has a nice foam with a pleasant colour. The aroma is quite fresh, slightly citrusy. It is well-balanced and generous.

Very full and thick head. Aroma was a little sweet with a hint of ginger. Wide on the palate which I like, medium-light bodied, probably more light. The ginger came through in the flavor also. Overall sweet. Finished very quickly with almost no aftertaste. One word... Refreshing.

Not as much ester flavor in the taste profile here as in a Schneider Weiss, but it does lurk under the wheaty-maltiness. Not much bitterness at all. I would drink this again as it isnt too expensive and its a pretty good hefe

Re-Rate 04/28/02: Chill hazed light amber, gold if your into that, enormous white head, lace in sheets that clings to the glass. Nose is yeasty, sweet, malt tones, citrus, Perfumy. Lightly sweet in the front, top light, finish is lightly carbonated, dry, fair hop presence, a Crystal Clean taste, slightly citrus. As much as I rant against lagers/pils, the beers from this brewery, are exquisite, and well worth the Hunt!

This is a GREAT brew!! It is a bit fizzy,but I like that, it tickles the tongue a bit on the way down...it has a fruity,but not too sweet flavor,and a great aftertaste.
Im Really starting to like German Wheat brews more and more!
Dark yellow and very hazy. Big ester and vanilla aroma. Very smooth, with wheat and banana flavour. One of my favourite summer thirst quenchers.
One of the best Weisse beers I have (in my somewhat limited) tried. Great color, and head.
Probably my favorite wheat beer yet.  Very elegant, fruity aroma, accompanied by a nice sweet taste.  Very refreshing especially on a hot, humid, Florida day.
this beer rocks

A pint bottle of this was my introduction to German Wheat.  This brew pours a hazy light
amber with a titanic off-white creamy head that is mostly lasting and has virtually no
lacing.  The fierce malty clean nose speaks of dark bread, toasted cereal, flowers, pine,
earth, cask-wood, ginger, pepper and a touch of alcohol.  The mostly balanced and
complex flavor is very malty and fruity with the hops contributing a slight bitterness on the
edges.  The finish is very sweet, but again the hops find a way to wrap around the
sweetness without coming to the forefront of the finish.  The creamy body is medium to
full  with a touch too much lively carbonation for my liking.  I do like this beer though.
Malty, light banana aroma. Amber color, cloudy, off-white creamy head. Could be more tastefull, sweet, light banana flavor. More sweetness and banana in the finish.
big lacy, foamy head, metallic spicy aroma, citrusy flavor.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 Bottle. Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy medium to dark yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Solid but not quite exciting...pretty much by-the-numbers.

A very enjoyable Weissbier.  Im sorry to say that I had poured it over a lemon wedge like I was taught to do 22 years ago at the German House  to do to all Weissbiers.  Guess I have to try it again with out the lemon.
an excellent wheat beer
A good fruity beer.  Reminds me of bananas for soem reason.  I usually have one of these at the end of the night.

apricot golden.  densely hazy, tho i carefully decanted leaving a gooey hunk of yeast attached to the inside of the bottle like a barnacle.  i was expecting explosive yeast dominance, but was appreciative of a more mixed effect, some cinnamon stick and applejack perhaps.   the uninitiated typically make sour faces at the first swig of german hefe-weissen, but this one is balanced and brisk and tangy, and still true to the type.  just dont put a damn lemon in it.
This is also one of the better hefe-weizen.
Wheaty! Goes good wuth food. I dont like ultra fizzy beers, although I accept that it goes with the style.
Smelled of bananas and vanilla and tasted of bananas, clove and vanilla. Nice cloudy yellow color. Tasty wheat beer but i think i like a few others better.
light, almost fruity.. very good.....  My mother approves ;-)
this is my favorite beer over here in bavaria.  it has a very sweet bite
A little musky. Good mouth. I dont think that they should judge weiss on appearance. :)Decent, though Im not a huge weiss fan.
This and Schneiders are the top 2 Weizens around, IMO. Just good stuff. Easily enjoyed even if your not a Hefe-Weizen fan.
about bloody time they got it right
A stunner with a liquid-golden smoothness Ive not encountered in a hefeweizen before. Plus the biggest and tastiest head imaginable. Dont miss this one.
Dark orange colour, big head, banana and spicy aroma, sweet and creamy, slightly smokey and nutty aftertaste - a big weizen !
Look at that presentation: Big rocky head. Smokey coriander, a bit of banana, and errr well a bit like the American breakfast cereal Wheaties. And thats a good thing.

Just as good as Paulaners Weissbier, but in a different way.  The taste is a little more complex and just a tad less sweet.  Malty and smooth, there is a bit more carbonation to this.  Fishmans right--practice makes perfect. Is there any beer prettier than this?
The oldest brewery in the world, I guess practice makes perfect.

My all-time favorite; 
Bottled flavor is quite impressive, but I actually found some hole in the wall in WI that serves it draught--sublime.
Great Heffe, not as good as Paulaner or Pinkus but very good.  Very wheaty taste, slight clove, banana taste.  great
Everthing has been said.  This is the best beer the brewery makes.
I put Weihenstephaner and Paulaner in the same league as great Hefeweizens.  Great on a hot summer day.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2003 As good as any hefe on the planet. Soft, subtle, and possessed of the perfect bannana-clove flavor, this brew is unimaginably refreshing on hot days.  Its good to see the progenitor of so many German beers finally get some notice in the States.
Fresh and crisp this is a beer for a hot summer day. Perhaps a little too yeasty but well done.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2010 Hazy, bubbly.  Dull tan.  Lots of fluffy head.  Fresh slightly fruity, kind of sticky body. The aroma is oriented towards fairly clean banana and some light spiciness.  The palate is clean, somewhat dry towards the finish.  This classic yeast is used all over, so the beer isnt particularly distinctive, but it is a very nice weizen.

This is a top-notch hefe, right up there with Paulaner.  It has a wonderful cloudy appearance, a nice yeasty aroma, and a fine, light taste reminiscent of bananas (but only just enough).  A most refreshing beer and an outstanding example of what a hefe should be.

Of all the readily-available
Weissbiers (Paulaner, Franziskaner, 
Aventinus, etc.) Weihenstephaner Hefe 
Weissbier is the best! Dont ruin it
with lemon.
Very good Hefe.  A little thicker than the paulener and seemed to have a little more taste to boot.
This is so close to Paulaner, I think I would need to have a head to head test to decide which was best. This is a really nice hefe.

This is the best hefeweizen Ive had thus far.  Edged out Paulaner by a nose (no pun intended).  This hefe defines the style in my opinion, cloudy appearance, lighter in color, moderate head, easy on the palate and smooth finish with tons of body and character.  A must try.

Is the listed brewer right?  Sweden?
Anyway - I just enjoyed this fresh on
tap with a plate of knackwurst, potatoes, 
and sauerkraut.  Very nice.  Both the aroma
and flavor were rich with hints of clove, lemon,
and maybe even a wee bit of licorice.
This was full-flavored and refreshing.
A great hefeweizen.
